column20: Oh me oh my. What an experience. If you're looking for good Texas BBQ, Terry Blacks is the way to go. This was by far the biggest, most savory piece of meat I have ever consumed. The prices may shock you, but trust me, it's worth it. For $28 a pound, I went with the beef rib. Yup just one beef rib. It's so big it acts as a whole cut on its own, and deserves a rack of 12 separate ribs. Wasn't expecting this kind of style of a dining experience, but it suits the restaurant the best. You may face a long line, but it moves fast and without many issues. The ordering process is simple and we were in and out within 8 minutes. Plenty of seating indoors and outdoors even on a packed day, so don't let the crowds fool you.I do wish the sides were a bit cheaper. Don't see why they have to price gauge a pint of mac and cheese and potato salad for $6.50 when any high end BBQ joint will charge you a normal amount of $2.50 for the same serving. You're already paying a lot as it is for the meat, so a side or two isn't going to break the bank anyway. Overall, I really enjoyed the meal here. A delicious slab of meat that'll put you in a food coma for hours. My recommendation is to hop on a bird scooter and enjoy the afterwards. That's what we did and it was the perfect remedy!

Absolutely delicious bbq. Hubby and I were driving through Austin on one of our road trips and we knew we had to get some Texas-style bbq. We were able to do an online preorder the previous day, and were lucky enough that they weren't super busy so that we were able to enjoy the bbq fresh on one of their picnic tables outside. Might be easier to do a bullet point for what we ordered and what we thought, so here goes!Meats:Beef ribs - These things are ginormous. You'll end up paying around $40.00 for one rib, but honestly this one rib is a full meal for one or can be shared by up to 3 people and will be enough meat for everyone to appreciate it. It was tender, super juicy, and just so satisfying. Pork ribs - Literally fell off the bone when I bit into it. The dry rub was fantastic. Honestly, you wouldn't need to add any bbq sauce because it's packed with flavor and juicy. Excellent choice. Cheese and jalapeño sausage - This is like a little treat. You can taste the spices used in the sausage, you get small chunks of gooey cheese, and the jalapeños added a nice subtle heat. Chopped brisket - Tasty, but my least favorite of the meat choices we ordered. It felt a little dry, and I wasn't sure if they doused it in their bbq like it was described on their menu. I ended up having to add more sauce. Maybe they used a leaner part of the brisket for this, so might be a good option if you're trying to watch your intake (but honestly if you're going to a bbq pit while on a strict diet, you're missing out - everything in moderation is ok!).Sliced brisket - Wow. The pièce de résistance of the entire meal. Best brisket ever. Tender, juicy, flavorful. The balance of lean meat and fat. I now wish I had ordered 5 pounds of this to take home, or even ordered one of their chilled whole briskets. This is the brisket of dreams. No joke, you have to try it. Sides:Cornbread - Great cornbread. It was moist, it had a nice nutty flavor to it. It's a nice sweet bite in between all the savory of the bbq. Coleslaw - I typically don't like coleslaw, but they do theirs well. Nice, chunky and crispy cabbage. The dressing wasn't too thick or too fatty. It's a nice refreshing bite to balance out all the fatty goodness from the bbq. We ordered a half pound of everything (that's the minimum allowed with their online ordering, not sure if you can order less in person), and one beef rib for two people. Definitely more than we could finish. What we ordered would be good for probably up to four adults and everybody would've been full. I can't wait to return to Austin so I can visit again!

We came here twice on our trip because the meat was awesome and they have a great selection of sides.We enjoyed the cornbread (wish they had honey for it), potato salad, and creamed corn. The green beans were better on our first trip than second, the Mac n cheese is rich and noodles slightly over cooked both time, but still a good flavor. Cole slaw was ok. We didn't care for the peach cobbler, but kids loved the banana pudding and the pecan pie was pretty good. Now on to the meat, really flavorful pork ribs and brisket, definitely ask for the moist burnt ends, to die for. Their BBQ sauce is good, not amazing, but it does the job since the meat is so flavorful. Loved sitting on the outside patio, nice cool spring days and was a great atmosphere for eating BBQ.

INCREDIBLE. It was my first time trying real Texas BBQ during my vacation here and I left completely satisfied. My group of 5 came around 6:30pm on Memorial Day and waited about 30-45 min in line. The line may look long from the outside, but the restaurant staff is extremely efficient so it goes by pretty fast.We ordered the following:2 lbs Beef Ribs1 lb Sliced Brisket1 pint Mac n Cheese1 pint Potato Salad1 pint Creamed Corn1 pint Banana Pudding1 pint Peach CobblerPecan PieComplimentary Pickles, Bread, and OnionsSweet teaUnsweetened tea Our favorite items were the Beef Ribs, Mac n Cheese, and Banana Pudding. I'd highly recommend those. The Beef Ribs were the crowd fav of our group and the main reason we'd all come back. It was extremely tender, smoky, and the meat fell off the bone easily. The Mac n Cheese was super cheesy and delicious. Banana Pudding was really flavorful and light. We liked it more than the Peach Cobbler since we felt that the peach cobbler was missing vanilla ice cream. They ran out of Pork Ribs and cornbread by the time we got to the front of the line which was a bit of a bummer. Come early and before peak dinner time so the popular items don't sell out. For drinks, we ordered two cups of unsweetened and sweet tea. They offered unlimited refills. Both teas were great, but I preferred mixing both to balance the sweetness level.The next time I'm in Austin or Dallas, I'll absolutely be back here. It was a perfect last supper meal to end my weekend trip. I'd recommend this to anyone who's looking to try delicious BBQ.

Lesson learned... don't pay for the bone. Or the sides for that matter. We ordered one ... one beef rib and it cost $51.57.  The bone and fat exceeded the weight of the meat. The side dishes were mediocre. Not a spectacular lunch for more than $100. The place is busy, but more marketing to tourists than food quality. Seems like plenty of other bbq to be tried to come back.

Worth the hype and the wait! We were in the area and was recommended to check this spot out. After seeing the line, I was wondering if it was "worth the wait". The line, despite long, actually moved relatively quick.The BBQ was absolutely PERFECT! I got brisket & ribs. The brisket was smoked perfectly, seasoned well & just melts in your mouth! The ribs were extra tender, slid right off the bone and seasoned to perfection. All of it was complemented perfectly by their BBQ sauce.The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the sides were lacking. The Mac & cheese was actually good but the potato salad was flavorless and truthfully, I was hoping they had some signature BBQ baked beans as a side but they instead had pinto beans which I didn't try but they didn't really look inviting. If they make their sides match their FIRE BBQ, instant 5 stars, no question. But I still recommend this spot for their BBQ!

So glad my friend recommended Terry Black's because it was bomb!! We came on a Thursday night around 6 pm and were lucky to only wait 5 min or so! We drove by a couple other times on the weekend and the line wrapped around the building! So go on a weeknight if you don't want to wait.It was cafeteria style, and you first pick out your sides. We basically tried everything: green beans, creamed corn, cornbread, potato salad, mac and cheese, and banana pudding. The pecan pie looked good too but that would've been even more over the top. My favorite sides were the creamed corn and potato salad. My boyfriends were the creamed corn and Mac and cheese. I thought the Mac and cheese sauce was a bit gluey, but I think that's because it was American cheese  we also got some sweet tea. The corn bread and green beans were decent though not rave worthy. Just glad I could get some green veggies in.For meat, we tried the beef rib, 1/2 brisket, and jalapeño sausage. I liked the beef and thought the sausage was decent, though it wasn't my fave. Beef was fall off the bone tender, perfectly seasoned IMO, and beautifully smokey. The beef rib was a bit expensive (around $30 I think) and our total for the evening came out to about $80. Probably could've done without the sausage and with just 1/4 lb of brisket (and probably could've finished our food that way too.) bu I would definitely come back in the future and recommend to others on a trip to Austin!It was also cool to talk to the guys working the pits at the side of the restaurant. I think they said it takes 48 hours from start to finish for the brisket. Lots of time put into it!

True authentic Texas BBQ at it's finest. Overpriced? Maybe but you're paying for the quality and reputation. This must be quite the tourist destination as well as local spot. We got there only 15 minutes after they opened and there was already a long line out the door. The line did move smoothly though and we ended up waiting around 20 minutes before we got to order. It's cafeteria style ordering so you order all the sides and meats, load them up on your tray, and then pay. As mentioned, the price is higher than what I'm used to in NC where I live. The sides were about 3 bucks a piece for the small sizes we got. We got sides of mac & cheese, green beans, potato salad, sweet corn, banana pudding, and cornbread. A half pound of sliced beef brisket which equates to only 2 slices costs 13 bucks. The piece of pork rib and the cheese jalepeno sausage each cost around 10 bucks. The total for our tray cost a total of 50 bucks. I would say an equivalent of this amount of stuff in NC would probably be around half the price. Oh well, when Texas you gotta try it out.The price may have not been ideal but the taste of the food was absolutely phenomenal. They ain't kidding around. The smokiness in the meats adds so much depth of flavor and can be tasted with each bite. The brisket was nice and fatty - just superb. The pork rib was fall off the bone and the cheese jalepeno sausage - best darn sausage I've ever had. The sides were just as good. Green beans were stir fried with some butter & garlic and rich with flavor. Mac & cheese was creamy. Sweet corn was not from your typical can and cooked with some kind of cream sauce - also the best sweet corn I've tasted. Potato salad had rosemary and other herbs - outstanding. Banana pudding was decadent and cornbread tasted good. All of the food just downright delivered and left us satisfied. They also allow customers to visit their smokehouse to understand the cooking process if interested and to answer any questions you have. We visited after our meal and it was very educational. Apparently, they're constantly cooking/smoking the meats 24 x 7. They have an overnight crew that continues to tend to the meats after the restaurant closes. So a lot of love and dedication goes to the food here. Overall, this place is one of the joints that pop up when you Google for good bbq in Austin and there's a good reason why. The taste of everything is truly awesome if you can get past the high prices. I'd recommend giving this place a visit at least once if you're visiting in town if you want some good Texas BBQ.

Wonderful BBQ to try if you're driving through Austin. Although I wasn't a huge fan of their brisket (it was a bit dry), their regular sausage was delicious. They offer different flavored BBQ sauce- my personal favorite was spicy BBQ. It paired well with the meats. Their Mac & cheese was pretty tasty but potato salad is mediocre. There was plenty of seating indoor and outdoor and parking isn't too bad. I wish we tried their beef rib but another time. It's cafeteria style but the line moves pretty quickly. Service was excellent.

All the raves and reviews can't be wrong, right? Yea, we didn't think so, so we made sure to stop here during our long roadtrip. When we arrived, the long line wrapped around the building, right in front of the smokers, and it was a 45 minute wait from there. Yes, it was true what others have mentioned, they are very friendly! Ordered brisket and a beef rib, then we got a bonus pork rib. The fact that it's all smoked for so many hours, means that it's all very flavorful! The flavor was delicious, but the salt was a bit overpowering- but to each their own, different pallets interpret salt differently. Nevertheless, just make sure to combine the meats with some of their sides and it will be perfect.The sweet cream corn is VERY sweet, almost feels like it should be a dessert! Added a bite of corn bread to a bit of creamy corn and it combined nicely- made my own dessert option. Good stop option to add to the list of "must-try" while in this bbq nation.

I wish I can still have those pictures for the times I have visited this place. My first experience was a to-go due our day trip to Austin, and drive back to San Antonio. We had the beef rib, brisket and the must-get jalapeño sausage~ sooooooo good. It is most definitely pricey, but really good. I feel that the sides are relatively lacking. Not the best I have had, but good. After all, the meats are the main course here. The second time of our visit, we tried the black margarita they had and it was amazing~We ordered the brisket and sausage this time around, a pint of Mac and cheese, coleslaw, corn and something else I do not recall on top of my head. I love everything except that I wish there was more bread for the amount of food we purchased. Which is why bringing it home is actually a good idea since you can always wrap it in tortillas to go with it. But the beef ribs just falls off the bone. Must get.

We hit the Jack pot with trying their food ! The best BBQ I've ever tried in my life !!! We tried brisket, ribs and sausage! Everything was great but sausage with cheese was by far my favorite. Even the sides were amazing! Creamy corn was also my favorite. I also tried black margarita which is a limited time option but very tasty! It is a must if you are in Austin!

This spot is amazing, only bad part is there's no reservations and you have to wait in line... BUT the line moves super quick! I loved everything that I tried, bricket was phenomenal, mac & cheese was great but heavy. If you don't like sweet corn don't get it. Green beans had the most amazing flavor and the closelaw was the freaking best (I would recommend ordering more). Definitely great for taking home leftovers too! Would recommend this for brunch, lunch & an early dinner as the food can be a little heavy. Best BBQ in Austin!!!

Ugh this place is so good. I mean every BBQ place I've been to in Texas has been amazing, but Terry Blacks is one of the more well known ones. Also, the wait wasn't as long as some other places! (*cough Franklins)We went later in the day, so a few of the meats were starting to run out. On our plate to share between three people was the brisket, sausage, sausage sandwich, sides of creamed corn, Mac and cheese, potato salad, green beans, complimentary pickles and onions and of course banana pudding!! Yeah that was a lot of food, but we finished it minus half a sandwich. Good thing I brought my backpack to carry that sandwich around while we bar hopped haha. My only recommendation is to get the fattier pieces of the brisket. Ugh those were SO GOOD. I only got half of the fattier pieces and half normal pieces, and the fattier pieces were literally melt in your mouth GoooooooOoDness. Sheesh. Also, sausage was meh in my opinion. I would've been happy with just fatty pieces of brisket all the way with ALL THE SIDES. Seeing the food photo I took makes me miss Terry Blacks already.

Came around 3pm and found parking right away. If you couldn't find parking at the restaurant, then I recommended to park your car across the street by the Park. This place is normally busy and has a 30-45 mins wait time. Your order at the counter and meats are charged by the lbs. I got 1 bone in beef rib, 4 pieces of brisket, coleslaws, 1 scoop of peach cobbler, and cucumber pickles. The total came out to be around. $65. I love the beef rib and highly rexommwdwd it. The brisket was too leaned and dried for my tasting. I would definitely come back.

I've NEVER been to Texas but have heard so many things about all their great BBQ joints. Terry Black's is on the list of places to eat really good BBQ. Every time we drove by there were lines snaking around the building. It's gotta be good right???We walked in, it's "cafeteria-style" which should have clued us in on what we were about to get. The first section served side dishes, each was served in a 5.5oz. tray. Take your pick they're all $2.95 ea. Then you go to the Meat section and select the meats. The meat server knew his stuff and seemed pretty bored. He turned on his spiel and cut the meat. They cut and weigh each based on what you ask for and how much you want. Want just one slice of brisket? ok, just one or two ribs? OK! A lot of one and none of the other? You got it!Here's what we got for $57.93...1) three slices of beef brisket-2) three pork ribs from the short end3) a serving of cornbread4) two 5.5oz. servings of peach cobbler5) a 5.5oz. serving of baked beans6) a 5.5oz. serving of mac & cheese7) a bottle of water8) a bottle of orange sodaSome background, we're not big eaters, and I don't mind paying for good food but, but this seems pretty spendy for what was on the tray. There were three sauces on the table- "Original" meh, it's nothing to write home about."Spicy"      Spicy? hardly, and I'm not one of those that eat habs as a hobby."Sweet"    Yes, it was sweet.None of their sauces were earth-shattering nor any better than Kraft's BBQ sauces. Let's review each of the items above:Beef Brisket: The brisket was cooked super tender, the meat by itself had a rub of salt, black pepper, sugar, and probably paprika and other spices which was most likely the same as that on the ribs. One can see the obvious smoke ring circling the brisket. The meat on the outermost areas of the brisket had good flavor and texture and just the right amount of give. As you get deeper towards the center of the brisket the meat becomes blander and the texture changes drastically to almost mushy and so soft you can hardly tell it's meat.Overall, the outside was good and the center was very unappetizing. I ate one whole piece and moved on...Pork Ribs:The rib meat was fall-off-the-bone-tender. It seemed like they use the same rub on the pork as the brisket. The flavor was similar but since it was pork, it had a little different profile. Other than the salty, peppery, sweet flavor there was little else unless you added the BBQ sauces. Cornbread:I've had better at KFC. Peach Cobbler:Seriously? It was more crust than cobbler and there wasn't much "peach" flavor or slices in the cobbler. it's a good thing it was only 5.5 oz. At $2.95, which was a couple of bucks more than it should have been.Baked Beans:OK, I know I'm in TX, and they do things their own way here, but these were SALTY! Just salt and beans. There was none of that sweet molasses flavor or the subtle taste of smoke and bits of ham or bacon or pork. I had two bites and was done. Mac & Cheese:Hmmmmmm, how does one make mediocre Mac & Cheese? Well, if you open a can this is what it tasted like. Institutional-style Mac & Cheese. Sorry guys, this was a fail. You didn't even doctor up the can of M&C with your own take on it, nope just open the can and dumped it into the steam tray.---------Overall the entire meal was just meh, not nearly what I expected after all the four and five-star reviews on Yelp. Based on this visit, I wouldn't come back, especially at that price. I get they aren't known for their sides, but at least give us good decent sides at a fair price, not overcharge for canned junk. If you actually DO have a human make that stuff in-house, they must have lost their taste buds. If you're known for your BBQed meats then dammit, give us the goods. The stuff I tasted made Dickey's BBQ seem like gourmet food. Is it because we came at about 3:30 pm, after the lunch rush, and before the dinner rush??? Was it old meat that had been sitting in the warming oven at too high a temp and just kept cooking??? If that's the case, it's pretty bad that they charge that much for second-rate food. Very, very disappointed :-(Save your money, go to a local joint who has people that give a rat's ass.

Their barbecue is a work of art. They take hours and hours to smoke these wonderful juicy and tender meats. The best part?? You don't have to wait in line for hours to taste it. My personal favorite when I go to barbecue places is to try their brisket. The brisket here is HELLA DELICIOUS. 1/2 lb + one side was enough for me to be full. I tried all of the 3 bbq sauces (original, sweet, and spicy). I suggest trying all 3 sauces because they are all amazing I was having a tough time deciding which sauce was my favorite. How this works is that you order cafeteria style. You first go through the "sides line". And then "bbq line". Then cashier $$. At the other end is where you fill your drinks/grab to go boxes.The sauces and napkins are at the sit down table. I highly suggest dining in to get the whole experience. I love the interior decors!! You can also sneak over to the side of the restaurant and see where the smoking magic happens. The staffs here are SO FRIENDLY. This would be a great place to showcase Austin food when you have people coming to visit! tip: you can ask the staff at the end when you're picking up your sides for the complimentary onions, bread, and pickle!

One of the best barbecue places in Austin! Austin has some many different BBQ joints, that competition really drives the food. This place is above par and one of the best places in the city. There's a lot of hype about this place, but it's so worth it. The wait can get a little long at times, but it's all worth it.Food is great, the sides are awesome, the atmosphere is very homey, and the staff is so nice!Make sure you get the cream corn and corn bread! Those are to die for.The meat here is the best part. Juicy and tender. Just melts in your mouth. I've been multiple times and have tried almost everything on the menu.Definitely worth the stop whether you're a local or just visiting. This place is a gem for sure!

Just phenomenal bbq. The beef rib was juicy and moist, brisket was even more moist if that's possible, and they even gave us a pork rib (loved the sweetness). Their sweet bbq sauce was to die for, awesome compliment and didn't overpower.The sides were solid, banana puddling A+, the corn was nice and sweet.Come hungry, leave happy.

When in Texas you must try some yummy BBQ. Finally had a chance to try Terrys when in Austin and it was great! Thankfully we got here around 12ish and even though there seemed to be a long line it went pretty fast. This place knows how to increase throughput time in a quick and efficient manner! Anyways once we got in we ended up ordering:*Mac and cheese: delicious, creamy and a must have. Would totally go back just for this*Coleslaw: fresh, yummy and once again creamy. This was refreshing with the meat we got*Cornbread: a little more crumbly than I wanted - but this was buttery goodness*Brisket: got a 1/2 lb of brisket which was two pieces and this was great. Tender and fatty the right amount and the pieces were huge. The guy in front threw us an extra piece which was so sweet - amazing customer service!*Ribs: these were tender and delicious. I enjoyed every bite here and this went well with the sweet BBQ sauce. I want these again!After eating which was great - we went to the back and the guy working there showed us all the brisket they were smoking for the next day. Super sweet and loved the experience! Recommend folks to give this place a shot!

This place had a long line right up until close to closing time. The brisket pretty much melted off the fork and you can't go wrong with sausage. The Mac and cheese was really good too. If I lived in Austin, this would be a place I frequent a lot!  I definitely think this is a must-try bbq place!

Oh my gosh wow!! Don't mess around. This is the bbq place in Austin, TX that you need to go to. The line was long and wrapped around the outside (30-45 minutes in line) but it was so so worth it. Not only were the BBQ options knock-your-hat off mouth watering and SO tasty but the sides offered were just as good!!! Go here!! Stop searching. This is THE bbq place.

Terry Black's was such a pleasant surprise for quality and quickness when I came by with some friends on a Tuesday around 11:45 AM for lunch. I was expecting super long lines and meat being sold out but the lines were actually fairly short. We tried both the brisket and beef rib and both were excellent! The brisket was super moist and seasoned deliciously. I also liked their traditional sauce! Overall great experience and they had plenty of seating both indoors and outdoors for groups of up to 6-8! Definitely will come back when I'm in Austin to skip some of the long lines I've waited at Franklin's or La Barbecue although both of those places food were great as well. Parking can be a little tough at Terry Black's but they do have a lot that we were able to find parking quickly mostly due to luck...

The BBQ game in Austin is hot fire!! And when in Austin, there's no way that you cannot miss a chance of trying some of the classic BBQ joints out there! After all, i's literally an attraction of its own. While I originally had other BBQ spots on my list, a local actually recommended Terry Black's instead so we pivoted and gave them a try.... which proved to be a great idea!The wait on a Saturday late afternoon was about 30-40 minutes to get in but once we hit the sides station, the food was put together very quickly. They have online orders even for the same day; however, there's an order minimum of $75 which may be good if you're buying for a family. But for a party of 2 we patiently waited and even collected some merch (BBQ sauces, rubs, hot sauce) to purchase at the counter. We ended up ordering...1/2 lb brisket (like 2 strips): Tender, smoky, and soooo amazinggggg! A must! 1/2 lb pork ribs (like 2 ribs): Fatty, but rendered beautifully. A must! Cornbread: Soft and muffin-like with a nice corn flavor - you gotta get it!Green Beans: Just okay.... as it was bland. Pickles (complimentary)Peach Cobbler: Sweet and yumz! This was just enough for 2 gals who weren't toooo hungry, though I easily could have gotten more to take on the road as the meats really hit the spot! I was very impressed and after eating my half of the meal on the patio, I almost wanted to get right back into line to wait for yet another 30 minutes, but alas, we had to hit the road! Next time in Austin, I'll be back to Terry Black's for sure, but until then, I'll have to attempt to make some ribs at home with all the Terry Black's BBQ sauces and rubs I stocked my car up with haha!

Yelped and YouTube what's a good BBQ to eat in Austin. Terry Black's came up a few times, and on my last day in Austin before my afternoon flight. I called after 10am and the employee said there was no line and I would be able to get my food and sit within 5 minutes!Heck yea, I'm having Terry Black's BBQ for breakfast on my last day in Austin. I didn't come all the way from Los Angeles for nothing. I actually ordered with my stomach and not with my eyes because if I did. I would have tried a lot more sides and had left overs. I'm glad my husband and I ordered just enough.  We ordered the moist brisket, which was been recommended on YouTube.  So good and moist! The creamed corn was so delicious different than the usual and of course the homemade corn bread, also so good My favorite part, the sauces is all there on the table and you can sauce up as much as you want. I hope I come back soon, and this time Terry Black's would be my 1st stop. BTW, great service, employees are so kind and quick!.

MainsPork rib: 5/5 flavor and moisture on point Beef rib: 4/5 a bit too saltyBeef brisket: 3/5 flavor not bad but kind of dry SidesCream corn: 5/5 creamy and flavorfulString beans: 4/5 just veggies nothing specialMac and cheese: 4/5 just mac and cheese nothing special Corn bread: 4/5 tastes homemadeBanana pudding: 4/5 lacking bananasPrice of meal: $82ish  I would come back if the Beef brisket is more moist.

Not living in a bbq state visiting Austin, I was so excited to get a real bbq experience and Terry Black's delivered!  We ordered a pound of brisket and divided it between a total of 3 people. The servers loaded up the brisket onto my tray and when i went to place pieces on my friends tray, the brisket was falling apart on its 2 inch journey from my tray to my friends... if that doesnt tell you how tender it is... idk what will! Apart from the brisket tenderness, the flavor was amazing and the meat melted in my mouth.The mac and cheese was awesome as well and will recommend as a must try side.The creamed corn was a lil too watery for me and suggesting skipping it for the cornbread instead

Guys... I died and went to BBQ heaven. The food. The smells. The people. It's everything I wanted and expected when I went looking for true Texas bbq!! I left so full of food and joy. We were driving through town and had been told we had to check it out. Boy am I glad we did!!

BBQ styled buffet, this was my first time experiencing such a dine in experience. You can order meats by the pound. The Mac and cheese is very good as well as their ribs. If you are looking for well seasoned bbq in Austin this place is a must

Wow! This place has really big portions and I love that they have a mini bar set up outside so you can purchase a beer while waiting in line. Their black margarita was really good too! I'm from out of town so being in a crowded place and the line being so packed with little to none mask wearing was a little bothersome. The staff themselves were wearing masks so that was good. Be warned, those drinks while you're in line will get you because you may be a little tipsy by the time you get there and over order. The portions are huge and the food was really good. I recommend their hot sauce that they leave for you to use. The brisket and the beef ribs were a bit dry but the pork ribs were juicy and perfectly smoked. The cheese sausage was not a hit for me, I'm not a fan of cheese and it was way too cheesy. The original sausages were amazing though, definitely would do this again.

My family drove here soon after landing in Austin to grab an early dinner. Thinking it would be quiet at 4pm on a weekday, we were surprised the parking lot was completely full and had to wait for a spot to open. There was a line out the door so it probably took another 20-25 minutes to order the food. But once you grab your drinks and order the sides (cafeteria style), you're just a few minutes from being served some excellent Texas BBQ.We ordered 3 lbs of meat (pork ribs, beef ribs, brisket), 3 sides (mac n cheese, Mexican rice, and creamed corn), few cornbreads, and a pint of peach cobbler for dessert. The meats were nicely prepared and had excellent flavor, although we found the beef ribs and the brisket overly salty. Our favorite was the pork ribs. The sides were all good but the real standout was the Mexican rice. I would normally not think to order a side of rice at a BBQ restaurant but so many Yelpers recommended it. They were right.The service was good and the ambiance was great. We felt like we were in a legit Texas BBQ joint.

The matter of reading this review is.. JUST GO AND TRY TERRY'S BLACK's BARBECUE! Everything we tried was amazing and the brisket is to DIE FOR I tell you. The term the best BBQ is in Texas is definitely a true statement (;

Food is amazing but be prepared to wait for a long long time. They sell drinks throughout the line in two different spots if you get thirsty. Ribs - they were so soft and juicy! So flavorful! Brisket - amazing! Must try these briskets and ribs! Red and orange sauces - they were both amazing!! Couldn't decide which one was my favorite so ate them both! Mac and cheese - Mac and cheese was so good and extra cheesy! Whatever size you think you might get, get a bigger one Mexican Rice - just okay, probably could do without getting Creamed corn - pretty good! Corn bread - amazing!! Add this to your order and dip in the Mac and cheesePeach cobbler - hits the peach cobbler craving but not the best

I don't care what this says about me, TBB's is good, solid barbecue.Bonuses are that you can drink in line (the $5 Black's marg is tasty), the line moves fast, the assembly line and tight menu make it easy to make decisions fast, and they hook you up with extra meat if it's your first time!Personal suggestions: load up on jalapenos, skip the corn bread and squares of cheese.

Going to Austin, one of the top things on my mind was getting good barbecue! I have heard a lot about Franklins but didn't have the free time to brave the lines. I've previously tried Coopers, Salt Lick, and Pecan Lodge in Dallas so I feel like I have a good bar to judge Texas bbq on. Salt Lick and Pecan Lodge are still my favorites. Terry Black's was great, but it did not quite live up to my expectations for TX bbq. I had a half pound of brisket and 2 pork ribs (1/3 lb). The ribs were super tender and came right off the bone. The brisket was a little more dry than I was hoping for. I had read other more positive reviews on here so I was thinking maybe my food wasn't as fresh since I came late in the day? I have had better BBQ in Phoenix (Little Miss). If I lived in Austin, I would probably come back here and give it a second chance. If and when I visit Austin again, I will probably try something else or make the drive to Salt Lick. As smoker legend Charles P. Thompson always says "With great barbecue comes great responsibility" or something like that.

OMGGGGG wow!!! Guys, the food here is DELICIOUS!!! OMG! Alright, the deets, this place is super popular so do expect a line wrapped around outside to get in lmao! I promise though, it is so worth it! The line is long there is even a little window halfway there for you to order water or and adult beverage lol. The prices here are affordable and reasonable. We weren't a fan of the black margarita but the color was cool lol. Ok, the meats, wow! Like we all know turkey is dry but it is flavorful and mouth watering here. Turkey for christ sake lol. The brisket was beyond my favorite here. It was so juicy and packed with flavor. Honestly, it felt like fine dining. The sides we got was the sweet corn, potato salad and Mac and cheese. I must say the potato salad was average but the sweet corn was out of this world. It was perfect. The Mac and cheese was very cheesy and delicious, as if the cheese was just made and pasteurized lol. Took my in laws here from Puerto Rico and they are VERY PICKY when it comes to food. They were amazed with the food here and actually ate the sweet corn. They tend to say some American side dishes are desserts (like sweet potato) but they loved the sweet corn and the other sides. This made me happy. We were a family of ten and paid about $250 for all that we ordered. I don't think it's too bad, costly yes, but for the experience and the overall quality of the meat, you can't go wrong honestly. I was a bit disappointed that the corn bread breaks off to easily so it was as if eating powdered corn bread lmao and I loved the pecan pies, absolutely delicious; it tasted home made. I loved the decor, organization and placement of table. In terms of our current safety measures, not met whatsoever. Face covering not required, absolutely no social distancing nor limited capacity. Parking was a bit challenging so go with anticipation. Can't wait to go back! I definitely recommend this place to those baiting Austin.

Terry Blacks's of the Black's BBQ family name fame has been downtown for a while now and offer up solid BBQ without a long wait in line or selling out. For these reasons they're an amazing option in town. There are certainly tastier spots in town but they all suffer the woes listed above. So for your time and money this is a better and more authentic get than a Rudy's or a County Line when it comes to picking a BBQ choice at 6pm. The brisket is solid and tasty. The moist more so than the dry for sure. Their sauce options are also very tasty and highly recommended. Parking can be a bit tight because of the location, but if you plan right you can luck out and be setup for success.

Wow! Some of the best brisket I think I have ever had! We ordered the small family size with 3 pounds of meat and 5 pints of sides and it was the perfect amount of food for 6. We ordered for pick up, and we are glad we did because the line looked long on a Saturday night to eat in. The sides were amazing too- the green beans had a nice green color and a good crisp. Oftentimes green beans are over cooked and mushy when they comes as a BBQ side but not here. The creamed corn was probably my favorite side but the mac & cheese was pretty solid too.

Being from out of town, I'm sure not the BBQ connoisseur but this was absolutely delicious to me. We tried a smorgasbord of a beef rib, some pork ribs, brisket sandwich, coleslaw, Mac and cheese corn bread, potato salad, and cobbler. Everything was excellent! I'd say the pork ribs were my favorite.From a Covid perspective, there wasn't any social distancing at the inside tables which was a little alarming - people sharing tables with different parties, etc.

The best meal we had in Austin by far. Amazing bbq, very efficient operation, and so cheap!Get ready to rub elbows with locals and tourists too as this place can get busy (go on a Monday!). Cafeteria style service allows you to get your food fast and fresh (right off the slab of meat!). They could improve their beverage selection but I understand that's not really their area of focus. I highly recommend trying Terry Black's for authentic Austin BBQ!

A must have if you're visiting Austin. We take every out of towner here and everyone is ALWAYS blown away by their brisket. Brisket is the best! Jalapeño sausage is a must. Beef ribs are also a must. Potato salad and creamed corn for sides! Always end it with a corn bread muffin :)

All I can say is YUM!! I visited Austin, TX for the first time with my boyfriend and my friend who is a local highly suggested Terry Black's. This is by far the best barbecue that I've ever tasted!! We ended up coming here twice during our trip because it was so good. We shared the brisket, jalapeño cheddar sausage, as well as a few sides: Mac n cheese, potato salad, coleslaw, and beans. We finished it off with the $5 black margaritas. I also purchased hot sauce to go as well as a T-shirt. I cannot wait till my next trip to Austin specifically to come back here.

I'm not really a BBQ connoisseur, but I will say having my plate of ribs, brisket, sausage, pickles, and mac n cheese with white bread made me feel like a man. One of the most epic meals I've ever had. I'm sure I lost about 2 years of my life, but I regret nothing.

Found this place from yelp and decided to try it out on my visit to Austin. Got the brisket and the pork ribs - super yum! The food was amazing, but the waitstaff weren't that friendly. Overall was great though!

This place was wonderful.  I have never had good BBQ brisket before.  The brisket was moist and tender and had just the right amount of fat.  The problem with me is that is kind of like a cafeteria.  I see it, I want it.  So, the okra was great, but the corn was outstanding.  Don't get a quart of corn if you in a hotel.  I had to eat corn for breakfast but it was really good corn.  My husband got BBQ beans but he wouldn't let me have a bite.  I am sure the banana pudding was great but I was never empty enough to enjoy it.  My favorite is the wine .  They have bottles of wine in the area you stand and you can just pick up a bottle for the table.  I had to drive, so I had the tea.  If I ever come back, it will be for the brisket.

Traveled to Austin to try out a couple of the well-known BBQ joints and Terry Blacks was one of the top of that list.  To be honest, I didn't have any big expectations going in but oh did this place Wow!   The place was pretty busy but everyone was pretty well socially distanced.  The surprising find was the Pork Ribs which had a tone of meat on the bone and had an flavorful seared glaze.  Peppery and sweet.  Best find of the day.  I might have given up my others meats to eat more ribs.  The brisket was tender and had a noticeable smoke ring.  We always ask for the burnt ends and they were some of the best we've had. The sides were also surprisingly good.  We ordered the creamed corn and the Mac & Cheese.   The Mac & cheese was unbelievably rich and dripping in cheese sauce.  The creamed corn could have been dessert with how much cream and sweet flavor you could taste.  Big fan!  One of our new favorite BBQ joints in Texas!!  Will be back in the near future!

I had heard so many great things about this place so I am hoping it was just an off night when I visited.  I got the pork rib, brisket and some sausage slices.  I thought the pork rib tasted really sweet.  Too sweet for my liking.  And the brisket was extremely salty and not the melt in your mouth type of brisket that I was hoping for.  The sausage ended up being the best thing of the 3 items but I feel like sausage should not be the star of the show.  Also, I don't know if this is a Texas thing, but there was no social distancing at all.  There were markers on the ground but no one paid attention to those and just stood right next to each other.  None of the tables were socially distanced either but I really don't know what the rules are in Austin for covid.

We had no idea about this place, but had driven by it several times as we spent a weekend touring around Austin and it was always packed. So, when we had a few hours to spare before going to the airport we decided "why not?" and just hopped right in to see what the fuss was about.  I now know we were extremely lucky; our timing was perfect and we were able to easily find a parking space and walk right into the line with no wait.Immediately, I felt like "this is TEXAS."  The decor, the smells, the abundance of plastic cups - it was just Texas BBQ in the way we had been wanting to experience.  Note that it is cafeteria style, tray and all, but that just added to charm I felt in that place, bustling with life and energy.I got the brisket and my friend got the ribs. When a friendly worker slammed down a perfectly charred HUNK of brisket in front of me, my mouth literally watered - the most carnivore reaction to anything I've ever had. My body knew what was coming; and it was right. The meat was delicious; it fell off the bone, the seasoning and even the FAT (Which I normally don't eat) was to die for. While the sides weren't anything to write home about (good, but not exciting, though the cornbread was warm and yummy), we were so glad we ended up here and relaxing in the park across the street was the best way to spend our last day in Texas.

Finally try the real good Texas bbq! Compared to the bbq we tried in Dallas, this restaurant did its best. The beef rib is delicious! Pork ribs are tender and juicy. Staffs are friendly. Like the casual dining area.

IF I COULD GIVE THIS MORE THAN 5 I WOULDFirst off, we're from the east coast and the atmosphere/people within the restaurant were so nice and welcoming. We went around 12:30 on a weekday and it was packed so we did take out. They packaged everything perfectly to prevent anything from spilling in the car and making sure the meat stayed hot&ready. The portion sizes are CRAZY amazing. Huge thanks to Stephen/Steven for giving us a little extra of the beef brisket since we were visiting from out of town! Hands down the best beef ribs ever- flavorful, smoky, fall off the bone tender. The flavor is strong enough that it's great on its own but pairs perfectly w/ the cornbread and mac&cheese. The mac&cheese was HEAVENLY. Thick and creamy but not to the point where it feels saturated/heavy- doesn't leave a gross sticky feeling in the back of your throat. The cornbread was prepared perfectly too! Moist, soft, and crumbly. I'm not a cornbread person but i am for Terry Blacks! The brisket was also great- slightly dry when you have to reheat it but still a top choice. People have compared terry blacks to salt lick and honestly it's no competition/comparison that Terry's is SUPERIOR. Will definitely be coming back to ATX just for this.

Having lived in TX most of my life then moving away, I really miss the BBQ. So when I return, I try to eat as much BBQ as I can. Pre-pandemic, I was turned away from Franklin's at 1:30 when they ran out of BBQ. So this time, I ordered ahead of time in line and inside dining was not available in late Apr 2021. The pickup process was smooth, follow the instructions on the parking spot and wait about 20 min while the confirm and cut the BBQ. So, is Franklin's the best BBQ I've had?An emphatic YES!.. it lives up to the hype!I shared some brisket w my daughter upon pick up. I picked up a few slices of the "point cut"/fatty portion by hand and it was warm and it literally started to fall apart between my fingers, it was that tender!, and the taste and flavor was amazing!As for the ribs, the meat almost started to fall off if you placed the rib bone on end!.. also amazingly tender and tasty. The sausage was good but not great.  Franklin's BBQ will be the standard for which I will judge all BBQ from here on out.

Been wanting to hit this spot for years.  We were in San Antonio for spring break and we planned a night in Austin.  I ordered ahead a few weeks ahead of time. Ordering online was a breeze and directions were super easy to follow as for as pickup goes.  No dine in.  Stay in your car and pop the trunk!The brisket! Oh my.  The best.  Ever.  We also go ribs and smoked turkey plus a few links. Snagged a key lime pie -- not a dessert guy but it was super good.  Pricey? Yes.  Worth it? Brisket yes...ribs were really good but only three ribs per pound.  Ouch.  Def will be back when we're in Austin again.

Let me explain how sad I was that I wasn't able to try the beef ribs and pork ribs. Due to the pandemic, they only do online orders. We have heard about the 5-hour wait so we were lucky we didn't need to go through that. We ordered a couple of days ahead of time but weren't able to order the beef ribs and pork ribs since they already sold out.We ordered 3 pounds of beef brisket, 1 pound of pulled pork and 1 sausage link and 1 bourbon banana tart. It came with a free load of wonder bread, a bit of pickles, and a bit of onions. The 3 sauces were not bad although we didn't really use them.The beef brisket were HEAVENLY, super duper juicy with its luscious fat that accompanied it. The meat basically came apart. It was a wonder how they made it so much juicier than the beef brisket we had at another competitor, Terry Black. After we took a bite, we felt like it was it. We only had to eat the beef brisket. Nothing else was up to par. The pulled pork was a bit dry but standard tasting. The sausage was also standard tasting. The bourbon banana tart was surprisingly good since Franklin Barbecue is not a dessert spot. It tasted like well blended bourbon and banana. The crust was also very soft and came with good crunch.

Why 5 stars?Yes, I gave a 5 star review!Welcome to the Mecca! The holy grail of BBQ!The best brisket I have ever tried, ribs galore with the perfect bite.I could go on with more but would sadly just make me want it again and again from 4 states away.

I been seeing this establishment on the tv show man vs. food and I definitely added it on my foodie bucket list collection. We ordered online, two weeks prior, yes, I said two weeks. You also have to complete/ pay when you book online. The restaurant is close due to Covid and has different time slots for you to pickup your order curb side and the staff place tour order in the trunk of your vehicle. This place is pretty pricey. I ordered a pound of ribs for $29.00 and pound of brisket for $29.00 which they estimates serves between 1-3 people.In addition I ordered the potato salad, pinto beans and a pull pork sandwich and four sausage links.The ribs were delicious so tender they fall off the bone. We also really enjoyed the sausage links. The potato salad had too much mustard for my liking however the pinto beans had a great taste. The also give you slices of white bread to go along with your order. My husband also enjoyed his pulled pork sandwich and the brisket!If your craving BBQ and in the Austin area, give this place a try you won't be disappointed!

I live in California and because of the pandemic travel is a problem and since I heard so many good things about the brisket I decided to order online via Goldbelly. It is very expensive and you need to order at least a month in advance and even before a month the options are limited. I only got the option to get the brisket with sausages, the package arrive after around a month perfectly packaged, cold and on the scheduled date. The instructions are very clear on how to prepare it and the brisket didn't disappoint and was delicious, it is the best one I have tried so far. The brisket is 5 stars but not the price and sausages. The sausages were a big disappointment, there was nothing special about them and were really expensive considering what you get. For a one time experience it was good to order online but it is so expensive that I would need to think it twice before ordering online again and always avoid the sausages if you can (at least for online order).

Finally had a chance to try the famous Franklins! I had heard that people wait like 6 hours for this bbq but because of Covid we were able to order earlier d try it out. Ended up ordering:*1 lb brisket - soft tender and probably my favorite out of everything we worsened*1 lb pulled pork - this was tasty but a little bit drier for my liking than I wanted *pork ribs- these were so tender and fall of the bone so lvoed it - did find the seasoning to be a little salty though so put some bbq sauce on it to sweeten it out*sausages - these were good but I've had better. I would get one and split if you really want to tryOverall I think the bbq was really tasty and definitely the best I've had in Austin in terms of brisket and ribs but wish it came more piping hot - and was slightly underwhelming from all the hype that surrounds it!

It was like an big event to get the bbq and to finally put into mouth.... too high expectation often falls into a bit short.  It is good but I won't camp for it though.  The most memorable food of Austin is Gus's World Famous Wings after all

***This is a review for Franklin's COVID curbside pickupI've always avoided coming here due to the infamous long lines, however, I thought I would give it a shot during COVID since they were doing curbside pickup. Thinking that I could avoid the lines altogether was a mistake, as this is Franklin's we're talking about.I arrived during my pickup window time and there was a long line that was already going down 11th street. All in all, it took me about 40-45 min to get my order after getting in line (this was on a weekend), which is definitely way better than their usual wait times. The line was organized and the staff was very attentive. The BBQ itself was delicious, but honestly fell a little short of my high expectations after hearing all the hype about this place. My group ordered ribs, sausage, and brisket - I think my favorite was the ribs - they were so flavorful~~

One of my pandemic indulgences has been mail-ordering some of the best BBQ in the country to my door.  For most of last year I was obsessed with a famous place in Lexington, but I recently discovered the claims that Franklin's brisket might be even better, so I sent away for some.  I had to wait many weeks, a sign of this place's popularity, and when I arrived, I got a truly beautiful piece of meat.I will admit, it took me a little bit to figure it out. The cut of brisket was so fatty that isn't so great if you just microwave it, as I've done with other briskets. You can warm it up slowly in the oven, but you can also cheat by slicing it and then sauteeing it in a frying pan to get some beautiful extra browning and crispiness. I'm sure it would get me in trouble if I ever cross state lines to Texas, but it is truly delicious.It might even be better than that famous place in Lexington.

My favorite pork ribs in Austin! The seasoning was incredible and not too dry. I would highly recommend ordering online in advance for pick up. There is a 3 pound minimum so we did 2 pounds of brisket and 2 pounds of pork ribs and a bunch of bread. The brisket was incredible, totally worth the hype. The pickup process is straightforward, an employee will designate a parking number for you to pull up in and then you text a number to let them know your spot number and check number. I would recommend having your check number handy.

Good stuff! Order online only, only blessing from rona, is that you can now have the chance to eat at franklins without waiting in line at 7am. However, big disappointment when they automatically make you give gratuity for online order. Food already very expensive since you have to order a minimum of 3 lbs of brisket . No option to give your own percentages, have to be 10% or more. Brisket was goood, very moist, even the lean ones was moist! No fighting over the fatty brisket. Ribs were biiiig, can be split between two people, i like it a lot. The sausage is average, taste like store bought. They only had 1 type here, no spicy or cheese. Just plain one, probably will skip next time. The coleslaw pretty good, not too wet and creamy. Potato salad was very salty tho, and sour. I don't recommend the potato salad.Banana tart is not too sweet, i like the layer of bananas on the bottom of the tart. The BBQ sauce is okay, but not my favorite. This place likes tangggggy. Too tangy for me but BBQ is good. I am not sure why they gave us a very small container of pickles and onions for our big order.... not even a serving of one... went to buy pickles and onions at HEB.
I hung tight in line for about 60 minutes. The brisket was well justified, despite all the trouble. Astounding!!
I hung tight in line for about 60 minutes. The brisket was well justified, despite all the trouble. Astounding!!
I hung tight in line for about 60 minutes. The brisket was well justified, despite all the trouble. Astounding!!
I hung tight in line for about 60 minutes. The brisket was well justified, despite all the trouble. Astounding!!
I hung tight in line for about 60 minutes. The brisket was well justified, despite all the trouble. Astounding!!
I hung tight in line for about 60 minutes. The brisket was well justified, despite all the trouble. Astounding!!

*Currently doing takeout orders only.  Order on their website online and then pickup the day of.  If you are ordering for a Saturday, make sure to order almost a week out.  I ordered on the Monday beforehand and there was no Pork Ribs left and I got the last two pounds of Brisket.  You wait in your car and they come put it in your trunk.  We arrived on time but it still took about 45 min. from when we got there to when we got our food.  Still a short time compared with what you'd have to wait previously.  Now, onto the food!  The brisket was top notch.  Not the absolute best brisket that I have ever eaten but one of my favorites.  Tender, Smoky, but not too fatty.  This is a brisket you could eat all day.  The Turkey was peppery and flavorful.   Sausage links were some of my favorite sausage I've had, it doesn't fall apart and the perfect amount of salty and fatty flavor.  Still need to come back to try the ribs!Enjoyed the BBQ a lot, people might have hyped it up too much before I went but it was still worth the trip to Austin and still is a first-class BBQ joint in Texas.

I didn't think I would be back in Austin and eating Franklin again especially in the middle of the pandemic but serendipity brought me back and the experience was much better than my first - mostly due to no wait! This time orders are taken all online at least a week ahead and you just go on your time slot to pick up the food! SOOO much better than waiting 4 hours to eat this! I have to admit, Franklin BBQ is still the best I've had despite having 7 years to trying other BBQ. However due to not being a BBQ fan, I wouldn't have waited 4 hours again! Luckily the pandemic actually made eating this easier!The brisket is still so tender but I enjoyed the turkey more this time! My daughter could not stop eating the turkey too! The beet ice cream at the end was awesome! Thank you Franklin for making delicious BBQ!
Thee best brisket EVER! Nuff Said wish I got to eat inside as due to covid had to get it to go. The brisket had so much flavor and was the most tender juiciest piece of meat.

Brisket sells out fast. That's all I have to say if you're wanting to place an order - make sure you get in your order early.Curbside pickup was a breeze. You place your order online, they email you your receipt with a check number and complete pickup instructions. They send you a reminder email the day before your chosen pickup day - wasn't forgetting, trust me, but appreciated nonetheless. Day of, you're directed into the parking lot, to a numbered parking spot, text the number on the sign and interact with their order texting bot, pop open your trunk and wait for your order to come right out. Might've been 10-15 minutes of waiting in the car but in the before times, I know this would be a several hour long wait so I ain't complaining in the least.Pork ribs - stellar. Loved the peppery rub and the smokiness. Pulled pork - a little leaner than I would have liked, I think. But with their sauces, I'm in heaven. Chopped beef - wouldn't miss it for the world. I believe it's mixed with a bit of their espresso barbecue sauce so just a hint of it comes through letting the taste of the beef shine - spectacular. Wish I had the foresight to have ordered two weeks ahead but oh well, I'll just have to hit up Franklin's some other time for their brisket and beef rib.Oh, sides! Potato salad was mustardy, which I liked as it gave a refreshing change of pace with all the meats. Same for the slaw though I personally preferred the potato salad.All in all, great spot, definitely lives up to the hype. Curbside pickup was a breeze and love that they're taking measures to keep customers and employees safe. That said, definitely going to have to get us some brisket next time!

We have always been huge Franklin's fans for their incredible food, however, they recently went above and beyond for us. We ordered a curbside order and one of our meats was accidentally forgotten. We called, and the GM personally drove the meat to our home nearly 15 minutes away. That is incredible service! We are also so thankful for all they are doing during the pandemic to keep everyone safe, while still allowing us to enjoy one of our favorite places!

We have always been huge Franklin's fans for their incredible food, however, they recently went above and beyond for us. We ordered a curbside order and one of our meats was accidentally forgotten. We called, and the GM personally drove the meat to our home nearly 15 minutes away. That is incredible service! We are also so thankful for all they are doing during the pandemic to keep everyone safe, while still allowing us to enjoy one of our favorite places!

We have always been huge Franklin's fans for their incredible food, however, they recently went above and beyond for us. We ordered a curbside order and one of our meats was accidentally forgotten. We called, and the GM personally drove the meat to our home nearly 15 minutes away. That is incredible service! We are also so thankful for all they are doing during the pandemic to keep everyone safe, while still allowing us to enjoy one of our favorite places!

We have always been huge Franklin's fans for their incredible food, however, they recently went above and beyond for us. We ordered a curbside order and one of our meats was accidentally forgotten. We called, and the GM personally drove the meat to our home nearly 15 minutes away. That is an incredible service! We are also so thankful for all they are doing during the pandemic to keep everyone safe, while still allowing us to enjoy one of our favorite places!

Awesome! We always get the pulled pork, brisket, and smoked turkey. Absolutely delicious! I recommend this place although you must make a reservation about a month in advance because the line would be impossibly long otherwise.

got it delivered by family as they were making a cross country move home. Knew of the famous Franklin and had to have em make a pit stop of legends. Ordered ahead. Went very smoothly. Brisket, pork ribs.. Utterly delicious and perfect brisket despite being 10+ hrs old.Place lived up to the legendary status.

Some of the best BBQ these Cajuns have ever had! Due to their COVID procedures we ordered the day before and pick up the next day..... HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! We had the chopped beef sandwich, quart of chopped brisket, Cole slaw and  it was perfect for this family of 6 to eat on a picnic lunch at Zilker Park just down the road.

I visited Austin in late February and I'm so glad I was able to eat Franklin's BBQ before the pandemic. I'm not a big meat eater, but my aunt swore by this place so I woke up early and got to Franklin at 8:15 to wait in the rain to try the goods. I have no regrets. The brisket was NEXT LEVEL and my favorite thing we ordered. It was incredibly tender and the flavor was robust. The pulled pork was also amazing and were the ribs. I can't say anything but sing praises to how delicious this meat was.They do everything right at Franklin. The sides nicely complemented the mains. I also tried a hand pie and it was a delicious way to end the meal.I don't know how COVID has changed things, but I still highly recommend this place!

My husband and I have been to Austin several times over the past few years and finally had the chance to try them out. It was a Sunday morning when we were heading back to Houston and decided to stop by on an impromptu moment. We are glad we did because without ant reservations we were able to take advantage of their curbside pickup service, order our food online, and have our food brought out to us in 15 min. This was an experience we were not expecting. The ladies helping us outside with the entire process were super helpful and informative. Unfortunately I can't say the same thing for other establishments nearby that had up to over a 90 min wait for curbside pickup. We had to make a minimum 3lb. Meat order which was ok with us and O.M.G. that meat was soooooo tender! We ordered 2 lbs. Of ribs and 1 lb. Of pulled pork. Our order also came with Wonder bread, pickles, onions, and 3 sauces. We had a great ride back to Htown eating barbecue for brunch!

My friend's researched and placed an order about a month or so before our first trip to Austin. I haven't had any brisket this tender before, *chef's kiss* for sure. They also included two different types of BBQ sauce that went amazing with all the items. Currently, they're just doing curbside pick-up and what they'll have you do is park in the next available stall and text the number with your info, they'll bring it out and place it in the trunk.

Been wanting to try Franklins, and I finally made the trip (COVID). At the time, there was only curbside pickup available, and the process went quite smoothly. I got to the restaurant about 10 minutes before my reservation and waited in my car in the curbside pickup section for 15 minutes. (Compared to the 5+ hours you have to wait for pre-covid, it is not a bad deal) I'd recommend you arrive a little earlier before your reservation because when I left, the line was down the street. Overall, I enjoyed my experience at Franklin's. The brisket (especially the moist) is to die for and is incredibly juicy. Critics argue that it is a little too greasy for their taste, but in my view, that's what you want with brisket. The ribs, sausage links, and BBQ sauce were good too, and I can't complain. As we are in the time of COVID, I felt that it was essential to address the leftover quality. I reheated the leftover bbq using the oven on low. The bbq held the flavor and juiciness extremely well. Bravo! If I were you, I would order the brisket and sausage with a bottle of sauce for the house (only 4$ for a bottle).
The BBQ here is top notch. The beef brisket is out of this world. Enjoyed the sides as well and their sauce is bomb. Definite 5 stars.

It is some of the best brisket on earth.  The old days you would wait in line for hours, but now you can preorder & pickup.  It makes it much easier.  I always order fatty but they can also cut you lean if you prefer.   G
Great place to see check out if you are in Austin. A true gem located in the heartland . You won't be disappointed as long as you are prepared for a bit of a wait

Heard this was THE place to go in all of the US for bbq so I was excited! Luckily a friend told me he tried to go the week before but couldn't cus they were sold out and warned me to order ahead. Good thing is, with covid, you can just place an order online and do curbside pickup which means no 3 hour wait! Bad news is, there's a 3lbs minimum and it was just two of us. Ordered 1lbs each of the ribs, brisket and pulled pork. Also ordered 1 sausage, 1 sandwich and 1 potato salad. I had such high hopes but I was underwhelmed. The brisket was good but so much oil it was sogging up all the wrapping paper. The food was overall overly salty. It tastes fine but nothing out of this world that would make me come back. Maybe a place I'd recommend trying once in your life but it's only one time for me. Curbside was fast and easy so nows a good time to try it. They don't include any utensils or napkins or wet naps so we had to go get done once we realized. For over $100, I expected to like it but it didn't meet my expectations. I've had much better bbq elsewhere like Phil's in San Diego.

I love this damn bbq place, I've waited in line numerous times but luckily and maybe the best thing that's happened since COVID is the order online, no more wait and can drive up and pick up the best ribs and brisket I've had. This place has inspired me to cook more and I now use a smoker.Would move to Austin just to eat this, don't know how much but I assume I would eat a lot of it.

Covid update:REALLY appreciate the social distancing and the ease of picking up my order! Dining room is currently closed, but they are open for pickup (read: no long waits!) If I was local, I'd def be stopping by more oftenWas driving from Florida to Cali and had to stop by Franklin! Ordering was easy, although there is a min. of 3lbs. When we pulled up, there was an attendant who directed us to park in a specific spot. You just text Howdy to the number and provide your order number, pop open your trunk and they bring out your food for you! Was in and out within 15min. Easy peasy.

So worth the waitI did come on a weekday though, so the wait wasn't too badArrived around 10 and the staff quoted us to eat around 12-12:30The wait wasn't bad at all. It actually went by pretty quickly, because you talk to the people in line around you and you can drink while you wait too ;) it's byob!The staff comes around to ask how much you're planning to order, so they know approximately how much food will be left for the other customersWhen we got close to the front of the line, they gave us samples of their brisketO m g . HEAVENLYJust that little sample made the wait feel worth it.. almostEnded up getting brisket, pork ribs, sausage, and turkey. A little bit of everything! Everything was good, but the brisket is what you're here for! So ridiculously moist and tender. The fattier, the better!Would love to try the beef ribs but I think they only have it on Saturdays

Lean Brisket (4/5) and Moist Brisket (5/5) [$29/pound]The brisket comes half moist and half lean. The lean brisket is well flavored and not too dry; can still be cut without a knife. That being said, the moist brisket is over the top amazing. Same flavor as the lean, but with much more marbling. Some of the pieces just fall apart when you pick it up: it is that soft. If only you could order all moist brisket. Comes with bread, pickles, pickled onions, two BBQ sauces: one vinegar based (my preference) and one smoke based. The ends of the brisket were a little salty, but that can be understood since more surface area. Brisket is what you came here for. Get the brisket.Pork Ribs (4/5) [$25/pound]Same great flavor with fall off the bone meat. Little on the salty side but  has a good ratio of fat to meat.Slaw (5/5) [$6.60/pint]The cole slaw here really complements the meats by adding crunch and sweetness to take the salty edge off. Goes well with the vinegar sauce and the brisket together on the bread!Pickup service (5/5)No contact service provided and orders are fulfilled quickly. All you do is order online, park, pop your trunk, and wait. Go early or on a weekday if you can for quicker service. Not their fault if you go on a weekend at prime time and they have too many orders.tl;dr Moist brisket is best I've ever had. Extremely soft and flavorful. The lean brisket and the pork ribs are good in their own rights, but cannot hold a candle next to the moist brisket. Slaw and service are great!

First time here staff was super helpful and friendly .  The brisket was incredible, totally worth the hype. Link were delicious. Wanted some pork ribs but sold out do come early and place your order online.

We did a curbside pickup today using the process that they established during covid. It took an hour from the time we got there until when we got our food, which was pretty ridiculous given that you sign up for a half hour time slot when you preorder.When we finally got our food, the brisket was fairly dry. Not so bad that you wouldn't eat it, but nothing that you couldn't get at half a dozen or more other places around Austin for less money and far less waiting. The ribs were great, but the sausage was also pretty mediocre.I've had Franklin before and been really impressed with the brisket, but after today I'm unlikely to go back.

Ok, I have arrived! I have always wanted to come here and flew in on a work trip and stopped by. Unfortunately, we are still under COVID lockdowns and I was not able to experience the full version of Franklin BUT, what I did taste was the best BBQ I have ever had!I have been a fan of Aaron Franklin for many years. I have his BBQ book and do BBQ in my back yard, but experiencing what he was able to do with the brisket was remarkable. I had to call in an order and you only could order a minimum of 3 lbs per order. Luckily, I trusted Aaron with that requirement and placed the order. Within 10-15 min we had our brisket and it was still wrapped in the butchers paper. The smell was adding weight to me it was that good. When I was finally able to taste it, I realized that no other place that I had ever been to, nor was there any BBQ that I had ever made that was like that. It was the most juicy, fall apart brisket I have ever had. The sauces were also incredible along with the seasoning on the brisket. I had finally found what the ultimate BBQ tastes like. The sad part is that everywhere else I go will be compared to this short abbreviated experience and it's not fair to the other places I have gone and will go, but hey, that is what makes Franklin that much more special. I do promise to come back when we can dine in and get more of what they have to offer and get a full experience. If you are within hours of Austin, just come here, you will thank me later.Beef Brisket

Yes, this is the best bbq I've ever had. The brisket is moist and and perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection. The turkey is good as well. I would recommend getting there early, they sell out quickly and lines are long. During covid, order a week in advance.Cannot be disappointed, it's worth the hype.

Thank you Franklin. BBQ is omg.  You have to get there early to be able to hold a spot to get an order. Bring a lawn chair! You will make friends with the people you are surrounded by because the wait to get in is pretty long! Enjoy the experience, Franklin's BBQ is worth it!!

Franklin Barbecue's reputation precedes them; I LOVE good BBQ, and I was craving my first meal from here in a big way :-)Tip: In-restaurant dining isn't currently available, but they're offering curb-side pickup instead. The online ordering process was a breeze - I used it to pre-order LOTS of brisket, pork, and sausage to enjoy at home.  We arrived at the pre-scheduled pickup time and there was hardly a any waiting at all before we were driving home; the car filled with the delicious smell of BBQ until I could hardly wait to try it.Back at home, with cold beer and a bottle of outstanding Zinfindel to keep it company, we dug in - Franklin's BBQ was nothing short of phenomenal!!  If anything, the hype doesn't set the bar quite high enough - highly recommended!!

This place is way over hyped based off of my experience. The food was good, but not life changing. Granted- we did take out and did not have the dining room experience. The food is immensely over priced. I truly do not believe that it is good enough to justify the cost and would advise people against spending this kind of money on it. Again, this is not to say that the food is bad because it is not. The food was fine and everything came just as described. Problem is that it wasn't life changing like these reviews imply. To charge as much as this place does the food should be otherworldly good. They're are many great bbq places in Austin that cost significantly less. I think if they adjusted their prices to be realistic this place would be higher ranking for me.
The brisket is . It's not my grandpas, but it's really good. (It's even better the next day)

My review probably won't matter in the thousands in this pool. But here's my 2 cents.The best thing about Covid is the curb side pick up. Yay to not waiting 4 hours but BOO! for no indoor dining.You will need to preorder 3lbs of meat. At most wait 30 minutes inside your car. The draw back is rushing home to go eat it. We ordered the brisket, ribs and pulled pork. All meats were very tender but not pipping hot and fresh. I'm sure the experience would have been great having it right after. You can't help but minus a point or two because of this.Do not get the sides. Don't do it. The slaw is nah and potato salad is kinda vinegary. Just focus on the meats.I wouldn't wait 4 hours for this, but I'm glad I tried it. I'd personally go to Terrys because it's not that much of a difference. PLUS Terrys sides are FTW.

La Barbecue is my only southern BBQ experience, but I thought it was delicious. Making things even better, this place apparently has FREE BEER... I had to ask twice to make sure it was legit, but the beer is totally free. Anyway, the food is delicious, with the ribs being a personal standout. I actually scheduled everything for pickup a couple of days earlier, then when we arrived we walked past the line and went through the door for preorders. I actually asked if we could eat on the patio instead and they said that was no problem, then they brought our food out to us on a big tray and gave me free beer. 10/10 experience.

Ordered a to-go for la BBQ because my aunt from the east coast was in town! Easy ordering online, but when we tried to place the order at 1pm, their brisket sold out!! We ended up ordering the chop brisket which was still good, with some ribs and a sausage. The chipotle sausage was very flavorful and tasted really good, probably my favorite bbq place to get the sausages. The pork ribs, oh myyyy, it fell right off the bone and the fats just melted in your mouth. It is a little more on the peppery side, so if you're not a fan of peppery ribs, it may not be for you, but the texture was oh so amazing. Sadly, this place doesn't provide free bread, but the bread that you pay for is not just white bread, it's potato bread, so I guess that's alright?? Pick up was really easy, and they packed everything well, so no spillage at all! Great food!

4.5 star experience.We ordered curbside today (Saturday). They had immediate availability and were only our of single red rocket hot dogs. Ordering on the website is fine, but if you want to change the time it warns you it will empty the cart (so I didn't do it). I was putting together an order for 7 so it took some time. My time slot was about 15 minutes out from the completion of the order and I arrived around 10 minutes late. There is very little parking and my wife got out to determine how to pick up the order. She had to wait around 10 for our order. The order was exactly right. We checked in the car before driving away.There are plenty of reviews of their food (it's good). We had brisket, sausage (jalepeno and regular), turkey, pork ribs, shells and cheese, potato salad, bread, pickles, and pickled red onions. I enjoyed all of it but I wouldn't order sausage again. The casing was tough more than snappy and the texture was a little soft although not a fine grind. It's a little expensive but in line with all other top tier BBQ restaurants. The ease of ordering, pickup, availability, and accuracy of the order will bring us back.

Was not able to try Franklins to compare but this place is amazing.We got the brisket and the beef ribs. The meat just fell off the bone for the beef ribs. Brisket was tender and flavorful. I highly recommend their bbq sauce to go along with it. I also absolutely loved their brisket chili - may be the best chili I've ever had. And their mac and shells was legitimate cheese and not artificial tasting. During the weekdays the wait wasn't bad. But even for a longer wait, I'd say the food here is worth it!
Delicious!Was visiting from New York Went midweek for lunch so no lines.Good set up with drinks in the ailsrs.
New favorite barbecue place in TX!! The hype is real Amazing brisket ... juicy, tasty, not fatty

Alas it is very difficult to get great Texas BBQ without having to wait in a line out the door. Unfortunately we got rained on as we were raining. Coming in the staff was friendly, even giving us a sample of their brisket! The copious amount of food is insane. It was very much a great experience despite the rain but of course they have no control over that. It was a bit salty but still super amazing. Special shout out to the Turkey. It was very flavorful and juicy!

Raise your hand if you want BBQ and are unwilling to wait in line for 4 hours for food? ME ME!Everyone I know that has been to Austin has recommended Franklin's. But not everyone has time or patience! I don't think I've ever waited four hours for ANYTHING, let alone BBQ. So what do you do?
