Try the other delicious spot in Austin that has less wait and is also known for their BBQ as well!La Barbecue served up some super tender beef ribs, pork ribs, greasy and saucy sausages, sandwiches and cold and refreshing sides, which are absolutely needed to help cut the fat and sauce. Everything we ordered was super rich and flavorful, definitely did not disappoint. Maybe next time in Austin, I can give Franklin's a try, but until then, la Barbeque is theeeee spot.

Best Barbecue in Austin and probably the world.A spiritual Food experience.The brisket and ribs are bliss.The rub and bark are perfection. I've tried so many over the last 8 years here and this spot consistently takes the number 1 spot over the rest of the stellar competition.
Best Barbecue in Austin and probably the world.A spiritual Food experience.The brisket and ribs are bliss.

My wife and I were in Austin for a long weekend and we had a 3 hour delay on our plane, so we were able to get to La Barbeque about 2 PM. I was famished. They have a cool grocery store with lots of beer and stuff, but you have to order your food from outside, which was my only thumbs down.I got the Frito pulled pork sandwich and a few IPAs from their great beer menu. The pork was delicious and juicy and the chips were a great texture add.The seating outside was plentiful and the people were super cool.Their are lots of restaurants on this drag if it is super busy, but I would give this place a try for sure!

This restaurant was our first stop in Austin. I had my eye on the brisket and my husband loved pulled pork. We ordered online and found a spot on the patio. At lunch time on Saturday, it was pretty busy. We found a spot at a picnic table and soon our name was called. The brisket was very good, moist, smoky, salty. Right up my alley. The pulled pork was tender, good flavor, but not the best ever by any means. After going to Valentina's Tex Mex BBQ we realized there are good BBQ places, and amazing places. La Barbecue is good. The pinto beans were a little disappointing. It's as if they weren't soaked long enough prior to cooking. They were dry and bland. The potato salad was unique because the potatoes were minced instead of prepared in chunks. They had a good, uniform flavor, but touch dry. The macaroni and cheese was good and creamy, had a little kick, but was almost too thick. That could be because we were so hot in the sun that it was hard to enjoy hot Mac and cheese. Maybe in another setting I would like it. Overall, it was a good stop, good for my gluten free husband, but as mentioned above, we found even more epic BBQ elsewhere. However the brisket here is still worth the trip. If I could pack it in my suitcase to bring home, I would.

Probably the best brisket I've had in my life and some of the best barbecue I've ever had. The brisket is so tender it just falls apart and cuts like butter. Just mouth watering thinking about it. The ribs were similarly juicy and delicious. I really enjoyed the potato salad. Tipping my hat to Texas BBQ as a North Carolina native.

Essentially my introduction to REAL Texas BBQ... did my research as my buddy drove us into Austin, came down to here  or Franklins, but La Barb  was close to our hotel so they get the win.It's no frills, a big outdoor area with benches...maybe they've updated, been a few years. Just amazingly delicious meats,: tender, succulent, awesome. Think, we shared brisket, pulled pork, and a chopped beef sandwich.They were totally outta side dishes (in the middle of the day) so it was an all meats affair aside from the few carbs derived from the pedestrian white bread served alongside. I later learned this is a customary "condiment" at most Texas BBQ places.Not complaining at all, really delicious... just would've preferred that it wasn't so hot and humid that week.

I can't believe I haven't written a review of La Barbecue yet. It's been my go-to joint for BBQ anytime I am in Austin. I have gone straight to this east-side smoked meat mecca from the airport after landing- suitcases and all!Upon this most recent visit I spotted someone waiting for his order with his luggage in-tow. I can relate to his eagerness.I was pleased to see an online order option. In the past there would be lines out the door and the idea of having my order ready ahead of time was much preferred. When I arrived, my order was freshly prepared and packaged.The brisket is probably the best Texas BBQ I've ever had. I will disclaim that I haven't had Franklins yet since I am not a fan of waiting in lines.The cut is moist like a fatty cut of brisket should be. What puts this brisket above others however is how well it's spiced as well as smoked. I've had my share of bland brisket, but there's nothing bland about la Barbecue.The pork ribs fall right off the bone, which I enjoyed since I'm more of a fork and knife eater. I was pleasantly surprised that there was a little heat in the seasoning of the ribs. The jalapeño sausage is big and beefy with a nice snap. Upon my first bite you can see the little bits of pepper inside. On the side I got some shells and cheese, while the consistency was nice and creamy- it wasn't anything to write home about. The sauces appear to be vinegar based, not my preferred choice but it was a suitable sidekick as I dunked my bites of meat with them.With so many great food options in Austin, it's possible to enjoy something great and different every visit. But if there's one place I'll always make sure I visit every time it would be la Barbecue.

I don't know what I expected but this place certainly surpassed it. I got there relatively late and the guy behind me got a sign taped to his back saying "last person served" so if you got there after him you didn't get served... Austin weird! But it's definitely worth it getting there early and trying the most succulent brisket I have ever tasted!

I came here straight from the airport and was my first Texas BBQ experience. I probably lost 2 years of my life eating as much as I did but I regret nothing. If you don't have the patience or time for Franklins I really don't see how you can get any better than this.
Went at 4pm on a Sunday, and waiting for 20 mins only. They were out of sausages though . I highly recommend pork ribs as well. Still drooling....
The reviews are great for a reason! Loved the brisket... it was a 10. I personally thought the ribs were too peppery. Loooove the pickles... they go great with meat.
Got a chopped brisket sandwich. Mostly lean but wow was super juicy. I especially liked the sweet bbq sauce they had.

All of the meats were delicious and tender.  No new photos needed as there's plenty of what's offered and everything looks beautiful when presented.  The sides, however, are less desirable.  The potato salad is extremely bitter loaded with mustard and dill- not sweet at all.  The shells and cheese didn't not present to be the most flavorful beyond the spicy heat from the pepper it's prepared in.  And the coleslaw was just plain HOT- again-  no sweetness whatsoever.  The pickles were tasty and complimented my pulled pork sandwich well.  Would return, but only for the meats

All of the meats were delicious and tender.  No new photos needed as there's plenty of what's offered and everything looks beautiful when presented.  The sides, however, are less desirable.  The potato salad is extremely bitter loaded with mustard and dill- not sweet at all.  The shells and cheese didn't not present to be the most flavorful beyond the spicy heat from the pepper it's prepared in.  And the coleslaw was just plain HOT- again-  no sweetness whatsoever.  The pickles were tasty and complimented my pulled pork sandwich well.  Would return, but only for the meats.

All of the meats were delicious and tender.  No new photos needed as there's plenty of what's offered and everything looks beautiful when presented.  The sides, however, are less desirable.  The potato salad is extremely bitter loaded with mustard and dill- not sweet at all.  The shells and cheese didn't not present to be the most flavorful beyond the spicy heat from the pepper it's prepared in.  And the coleslaw was just plain HOT- again-  no sweetness whatsoever.  The pickles were tasty and complimented my pulled pork sandwich well.  Would return, but only for the meats.

All of the meats were delicious and tender.  No new photos needed as there's plenty of what's offered and everything looks beautiful when presented.  The sides, however, are less desirable.  The potato salad is extremely bitter loaded with mustard and dill- not sweet at all.  The shells and cheese didn't not present to be the most flavorful beyond the spicy heat from the pepper it's prepared in.  And the coleslaw was just plain HOT- again-  no sweetness whatsoever.  The pickles were tasty and complimented my pulled pork sandwich well.  Would return, but only for the meats.

This little spot is a gem waiting to be discovered. The grill here is astounding and the bits are tremendous. You request at the counter and get your food...but I would say, these "nitty-gritty" places have the best grill.

This little spot is a gem waiting to be discovered. The grill here is astounding and the bits are tremendous. You request at the counter and get your food...but I would say, these "nitty-gritty" places have the best grill.

Do not ever wait in line here. I think they purposely take orders and prepare food incredibly slowly as either a hype generator (intentionally making the line look long) or as a form of rebellion by the staff to show that they will go at the pace they please. Don't fall for it. Food is ok...not worth any type of wait.

Located within a quickie pickie, a bodega with taps, lies an unassuming BBQ spot that produces nothing but mouth watering bites. Quick piece of advice, order the brisket early, because they occasionally run out and be sure to order ahead on their website; as that's the only option for ordering at the moment. Ordered the brisket, pulled pork, and the chipotle and jalapeno sausages. For our sides we got the kimchi and mac and cheese. Let me start off by saying that this mac and cheese is hands down the best mac and cheese you'll find at any BBQ joint in Austin because it has a flavor in it besides cheese. la barbeque dared to be great by adding some latin influence to their mac with some chipotle seasoning and jalapenos and thank goodness they did so, because the kraft mac n cheese they serve at other places was getting old. The kimchi was disappointing because there wasn't any cabbage. It was pickled cucumbers with a variety of chili and bell peppers. Although, the pickling solution they use is packed with flavor and adds a necessary acidity/freshness to any bite of greasy BBQ.The pulled pork was my least favorite since it came out a little dry and under seasoned. But the sausages and brisket were close to perfection. The brisket comes with a heavy pepper crust and it's so tender, it practically falls apart in your hands. The sausages had a snap to them, were packed with a savory, slightly sweet and spicy filling, and were some of the best sausages you can get in Austin. Overall, la barbeque does more than enough to distinguish itself from the plethora of options in Austin. And is somewhere I look forward to going back.

A solid 3.5 star experience for me. Two things were clearly established during my trip to Austin. Texans have huge portion sizes and definitely love their bbq salty. Overall the food at la bbq was good but I just can't stress enough how salty everything was and it nearly ruined how beautifully cooked the meat was.  We ordered brisket, pork ribs, house made sausage, potato salad and coleslaw. First the brisket had a perfect ring around the meat and it literally started falling apart as I grabbed it with my fork. It was juicy and tender and everything I had hoped for except it was way too peppery and salty for my taste. Pork ribs were just as tender and falling off the bones but yet again just too much salt and pepper, I had to peel off the bark around it.  With the meats being on the salty side, naturally I was craving sides that were on the sweeter side to balance but both potato salad and coleslaw were also salty and peppery it was just too overwhelming.  Portions were definitely huge and the quality is well worth the price. I just really wished that there's a good balance or salty and sweet to appease my tastebuds.

Online ordering only, we weren't aware of this but the food was ready five mins after ordering it so that went smoothly. They were out of most things by the time we got there, which was around 3:30PM.Favorite things were the brisket (of course) and the pinto beans! They have a kick to them and are probably the best beans I've had at any BBQ place. Potato salad was good but I wasn't super crazy about the amount of dill in it. Everything was packed right and tight so there were no spills on the ride home.

Waiting 1.3 hours, never git to the front of the line. And we're talking about moving only 20 feet from where we started. Very slow service. Also failed to announce that they moved to a new location, we had to walk after our uber ride

* Long Review Ahead*I'm giving them one star for many reasons, the first was because we arrived in an Uber to the original location only to find that they had moved locations.....7 blocks away AND La BBQ didn't bother changing the address. It was raining and we were unable to find an Uber so we had to walk there. When we arrived, there was a line out the door and around the corner, which is usually a good sign, but in this case it wasn't. The second reason is that we were waiting in line for about 15-20 minutes and only moved about 3 feet. We were curious as to why we were moving so slow , so one of our people got out of the line to check the front. They saw 5 empty tables OUTSIDE and all tables inside La Barbecue were empty with bbq sauces  so the tables obviously could have been open to customers. We spoke with some people' that we're ahead of us and they told us they had been waiting ALMOST 2 HOURS!It's unfortunate we didn't get to try this place, but I would not want to wait two hours for food and okay service. We ended up leaving after almost an hour and taking an Uber to another BBQ spot 10 minutes away.

I ate lunch here today based on Eater's recommendation. I was pleased with the brisket and the side shells & cheese - both very flavorful and the bbq sauces added an extra kick. The 4 stars is because the pricing is rather high for the portion sizes: 1/2 pound for $14.50 and the side of shells was small for $5. I would visit here again but order more food because I was still hungry afterwards.
Great BBQ! Yummy melt in your mouth beef brisket. Sauces were not your average BBQ sauces, tangy and full of flavor. Loved the spiced pickles, took a side home to snack on later.
Killer BBQ this place is no joke ! If you are looking for quality this is the spot ! Nice job I'll be backFor sure! Brisket was next level.

I think la Barbecue is a pretty solid barbecue option in Austin, especially if you are visiting from out of town and don't want to waste precious time waiting at a place with a ridiculous line.We placed an order ahead of time online, which was super convenient. We tried the brisket, Turkey, ribs, jalapeño and chipotle sausages, chipotle coleslaw, and the mac and cheese.The brisket was good. Not the best I've ever had, but very delicious. It has a very peppery crust, which I'm into. I saw a lot of the negative reviews complain about the amount of black pepper in some of their food, but that was no problem for me. The turkey was perfectly moist, and I loved the peppery crust (of course). My only wish is that the turkey and brisket were sliced a little thinner, but it's not a huge deal. I did not try the ribs, but I'm told that they were good, just a bit heavy on the sauce. The sausages were both good, but they are a looser sausage than average, if that's something you don't enjoy. I liked the flavor of the chipotle sausage a little better than the jalapeño. They gave us two sauces, and I kind of preferred the mustard based sauce, as the other one had a heavier cumin flavor. As for the sides, the coleslaw was a tad bland (might have just needed some salt), but I really enjoyed their version of mac and cheese. Super flavorful and creamy shells, with a twist on your typical cheese sauce. Overall, my top picks were definitely the turkey and mac and cheese.

Hi Yelpers. I miss you! I miss everything about playing in our fair city. This is my first write-up in the throws of the pandemic... so kicking this off on a happy note! It was my mom's 89th birthday and the one thing she was craving above all else was a bit of fabulous moist brisket with some sweet bark. Can do, mama.First things first. Consider not just showing up. Place your takeout order ahead of time. It's easy. la Barbacue is a stand-out at this time because:-  Franklin's BBQ has revised its pandemic takeout minimum from 6 lbs to 3 lbs, but good luck placing that order. I tried and tried and they were booked solid. la Barbacue sets only a one lb minimum. - You can place takeout orders for their righteous, in-the-top-three-bbq- places RIGHT NOW or schedule them for later today or any number of days ahead at a specific hour. - There's a parking lot on the premises and even though it was relatively full on a Sunday afternoon, I had no trouble finding a spot. - Walk around to the west side of the building to ask for your already-placed order. There was no line when I showed up. - The food was ready. It was hot. It was carefully packed. - If you'd like to do curbside, they'll pop your order in the trunk, though I'm not sure what the procedure is for that. Call them from the parking lot?You cannot get specific about what kind of brisket you want (aka lean vs moist, etc) with a takeout order, but no worry. Without any guidance from me, the cuts had just the right balance of fat and lean. My one tiny, itsy bitsy issue is that I had to reach over the counter on the west side of the building and accept the food handover directly from the server, mano a mano. I would have vastly preferred it if he had placed it on the counter and stepped back. I managed to get around this by bringing a grocery bag and having him put it in there, but physical proximity was still too high. I'm SURE he would have been happy to do a curbside so this is also my bad.   All this yammering and I'm finally getting to the quality of the food? My, how our priorities have changed. The brisket was instant happiness-inducing. And the #1 reason I keep going back to la Barbecue is the seasoning. It's so spot on that you don't need a drop of BBQ sauce.The ribs were a wee bit stringy but I'm hard to please so let that pass. Thank you, la Barbecue!!

A couple of people love me enough to bring me brisket, sausage and ribs from Franklin's. This makes me feel VERY loved. But sometimes I want good bbq at times when Franklin isn't open or my peeps haven't been lovin' on me. This was one of those times and the line looked manageable. I'll cut to the chase... each slice of brisket was both lean and moist. The pork ribs were so tender that the meat was falling off the bone... and the seasoning: Ooooooeeeeh! Smokey gravy and discernable (and very welcome) pepper. No bbq sauced needed.I took enough home to eat leftovers for two days, and they were delectable at any temperature.Observations:- As cute as the grocery store section is, I found the gentrified selection and pricing somewhat offensive. I don't mind paying the restaurant for their BBQ artistry (and at $20 a lb of brisket, la Barbecue ain't cheap) but overcharging me for bottled and canned things on the East side is rude. - Air conditioning must be heaven most days of the year. - Again, hours are appreciated.

Wow wow wow! SUPERB. Let me break it down for you travelers. Traveled here for our 15 year anniversary and made a deal that we would not be cooking at all, lol. We had every intention to go to Franklin's as everyone raves about their bbq and we love good bbq. Well after not being able to try Franklin's I did some extensive research and found out that La Barbecue gives Franklins a run for their money so some say. COVID & CLEANLINESSThe hubby and I are more than pleased and even had the leftovers for breakfast the next day. Let me break it down for you. We ordered curbside although the restaurant does provide outside eating and requires masks for COVID. The inside of the establishment is clean and so are the restrooms. They have a retail grocer side as well. Very cute inside and staff is nice. Meat is not cut until you arrive to pick up your order. We arrived an hour after we selected to arrive online but it didn't matter bc EVERYTHING WAS FRESH! Kuddos!FOOD BREAKDOWNThis was more than enough food for two. We ordered 1 lb of brisket, 1/2 lb pork ribs, 1 regular sausage link, 1 jalapeño sausage link, side of smoked Mac & cheese, side of beans, side of potato salad, 2 different sauces. Ask for bread, pickles and onions if you want some. We also requested more crust on our brisket as I saw some recommended to in their reviews bc it's just that good! Yum!RIBS - Hubby and I try not to eat too much pork so we knew our pork treat had to be great and boy was it! The meat fell right off the bone and melted in our mouths. Hopefully I can post the video of hubby's reaction to tasting them. I even tried a bite or two cold hours later bc I'm weird like that and it was still on point. Super tender and juicy even after reheating the next day. Not too salty either.Sausage (Jalapeño & Regular) - BEST sausage I've ever had hands down. Very good quality meat blend which is why it cost almost $6/ link. It's worth it. I loved them both but the jalapeño link was my favorite as it had the right amount of kick from the spice. Not too salty. Smoked just right!Brisket (Extra crust) - Hands down best brisket I've had. Sorry hubby... they've got you beat on the brisket. Flavorful all the way through and not too salty. Fat to meat ratio was spot on. Great quality meat and the crust just helped to seal the deal even more. Cooked to perfection. You definitely do not need sauce for any of their meat bc they obviously know what they're doing when they smoke meat for sure!Smoked Mac & Cheese - BEST I've ever had. I make a mean baked Mac and cheese but their smoked Mac is on another level. Great quality ingredients put together perfectly. Heated up well the next day. A must have!Beans - Ok I make a mean baked beans dish at home but they've got meat beat and hubby agrees. Seasoned well and not too salty. The meat was spot on in ratio to the beans. Heated up well the next day. A must try!Potato Salad - I usually don't try other peoples potato salad bc few get it right. It was good. Consistent flavor and not too bold or bland. Would I order next time...not likely bc the beans and Mac were so good. But, let me be clear that it was not bad. It tasted good; I'm just very particular about my potato salad and wanted to at least try it. You should try it too. Overall I will definitely go back and now I can't wait to also try Franklin's bc so far La Barbecue is my Austin fave! They're likely both very good in their own way! La Barbecue is a must try as they're very consistent with everything in quality and taste! Most places don't get the main dishes and sides right but way to go La Barbecue.

The Brisket is amazing, one of the best I've had. It's only online ordering so I suggest going to their website and order beforehand, but you can just scan the code and order right then and there. We ordered beforehand and waited less than 10 mins for our food. (Friday lunch time) we got a pound of pork rib and a pound of brisket. The brisket was amazing! It was juicy and flavorful, I didn't really need the sauce that it came with. The pork rib was good, it was also juicy but it already had "sauce" on it and that's not really how I prefer my bbq. But nonetheless it was still juicy, the flavor is ok. There's a mini grocery store inside you can buy alcohol and chips and stuff and eat it with your food there's only about 3 picnic table right out front and maybe 5 on the side. Parking is a small area but I think you can park around the neighborhood (please be courteous)

First time eating barbecue since my husband and I moved here (a little less than a month ago) and we were not disappointed! We ordered the 1lb.brisket and it was cooked so good and was tender. What we loved about it was that it wasn't salty at all. The only wish would be if this was cooked over charcoal and not over gas, but nonetheless good.I would recommend ordering the brisket with a side of red onions! We'll be coming back here again for sure.

I could've rated this restaurant higher, but I find the wait not worth it. We waited for more than an hour in line, come to find there is only one cashier and the tables were nowhere near to be filled in the restaurant. This place needs to consider adding in another cashier. If I was a local in Austin, I would not wait that long to eat their food.We ordered the Brisket and Sausage alongside with potato bread, beans, and mashed potatoes. The brisket was well cooked. Not too dry but not too oily either. The skin was not too burnt. I was not found of the pickles, but other sides were delicious.If it weren't for the long wait, I would suggest this place but I would not come here again when I visit Austin again.

Amazing BBQ!!! After trying a few different spots in Austin, this is our favorite.The #1 thing to try here is the brisket. It is tender, smokey, and irresistibly delicious. We usually order at least 1 lb. I recommend asking for extra bark (the outer "crust") - so much amazing flavor. I wish we lived closer so we could come here all the time!The sausage here is also great. We haven't tried the beef ribs yet but are looking forward to doing so in the future!

La Barbecue was definitely one of the more recommended Austin BBQ locations (especially as an alternative to the Franklin wait), and for very good reason.  And while, yes, you can pre-order, I opted to just show-up, mainly because I wanted some in-house recommendations in addition to grabbing one of their colossal sandwiches.The place itself has a pretty large in-door seating area, a to-go grocery store with the common essentials (plus a ton of beer and wine) as well as  some outdoor porch seating. And they boast a pretty impressive amount of craft beer on tap.They open up at 11AM, and I arrived at about 11:30AM on a Wednesday - the line was just outside of the door. The wait wasn't too too long, maybe 40 mins or so, though, I mean, there was just one person at register taking orders...so perhaps there's some room for added efficiency? That said, the staff is super friendly and helpful. As for the food - after ogling the menu for the duration of my wait, I was pretty dead-set on the El Sancho Loco sandwich, but clearly couldn't go with sampling some of their unadulterated meats. I opted for a pork rib and a slice of brisket, along with a side of their chipotle slaw. I mean...did you really do barbecue if you don't leave with the meat sweats?But, in honesty, I could have just had the El Sancho Loco and left a very very happy (and contently full) guy. Loaded with sausage, pulled pork, chopped beef, topped with pickled red onions on a Martin's potato bun. Goddamn freakin glorious. Now this is a sandwich. wow.Brisket - tender AF and just had a glorious smoke ring. Texan brisket at its finest.Pork Rib - fall off the bone with an amazing bark. Was I already way full? Yes. Did I still need this? Absofrigginlutely.Chipotle slaw - wow, unsung hero of the meal (if I could really say that) - so good, not overly creamy, had an amazing kick it, I would kill for the recipe.Two delicious craft brews and half my body weight in glorious smoked meat later...I waddled out of La Barbecue a very happy guy. Hope to do it again sometime!

So amazing!!!  Last time I was in Austin I just wanted to not stand in line for 3 hours at Franklin's, so opted for a reso BBQ restaurant.  Major fail.  This time still didn't make it a priority and Franklin's made it easy by closing at 3pm on a Saturday.  What kind of hours are those, yo?  Looked on Yelp for suggestions from Franklin's page and La was one of the most and highly rated spots.  Did not disappoint for sure:*no lines*30 mins before closing and most items sold by weight were sold out, still the brisket and pulled pork hit the spot, no sauce needed, pork edges out the former *do the slaw and skip the pickles *insane beer, Celis Brewery Belgian style wit, I have never easily finished ANY beer, separate register which accepts Amex and Apple Pay*they have fancy coffee machinery and all the frou-frou drinks to go along with it*semi natural groceries share the space *order ahead online is a nice option tooIt's been days and still dreaming about the beer and pork.  Keeps well on the flight also, so yes I took a bit into the Bay Area.
The best brisket I've had in my life. Nothing more to say. As good as bbq gets. Do not pass on this spot.

This place... is AWESOME!! In COVID times, Easy to order, online, pick up at window, you have leisure to enjoy outside or wherever. Their sauce is delicious I love their brisket and the rub they use on it. And their ribs, top two favorites. They were highly recommended by Texas Monthly for ribs and sausage. I've had both. Their sausage is homemade with spices and reminded of a similar chorizo-type. Still greasy and all the fun, I would definitely return to this place when I come back to Austin. For now I will reminisce on the beautiful deliciousness!!

Solid BBQ! The homemade Jalapeño sausage link was A1! So tasty had a nice smokey flavor, the skin was crunchy like a good flame grilled sausage should be. The sides are large enough for sharing, I repeat- do not buy one side for yourself. You will be overloaded. The portions are hearty and meats are hearty. You will be very fill when you leave. Interesting concept of a BBQ joint, there is a general store inside as well that carries lots of beer in cases and 6 packs as well as other kinds of drinks and knick-nacks. They do also have a bar with beer on tap. It's best to get here earlier in the day because they do sell out. We arrived around 4:30 and  most meats were sold out. There is a large front porch, side and back area with picnic style tables for eating. Great for friends, great for sharing.

I've been wanting to come here for awhile and finally tried them for lunch! I tried their brisket, pork rib, and turkey which I recommend as they were good! Their cole slaw is unique since it has a chipotle flavor - so that was nice. Waited almost an hour - so not too too bad. All in all - good experience. Would I come back? Maybe, but I'd try something more differentiating such as one of their sandwiches.

They require on line ordering because of the COVID scare, even if you are standing inside the building.  That made it hard to ask questions to figure out what I wanted to order.  I didn't like it.  On the food channel, they raved about the la Frito Loco, so that is what I ordered, along with a sausage, potato salad and chipotle slaw.The frito loco was good, the overwhelming flavor was pulled pork though and it was dry enough to require sauce.  The sauce was good, reminiscent of the Salt Lick sauce.  The sausage was spicy and excellent.  Slaw was different good and the potato salad was just ehh.  I would come back, because of the variety.

Excellent, excellent, excellent resturant to bring your friends and family for some Texas BBQ. This has to be one of the best BBQ I've ever had here in Austin. The customer service, food, and ease of ordering is what makes this place amazing for me! Let me walk you thru the reasons why this is a phenomenal BBQ joint:1. Great Customer Service: When you walk in, you are instantly greeted by the bartender asking if you'd like a drink while waiting in line. The bar is literally on your left side as you enter the restaurant. The staff taking your meat order at the pit walks you thru the meat selections and gives good recommendations on how much to order and what meats to try. You are pretty much welcomed to BBQ with a smile and weren't service. 2. BBQ: The BBQ here is amazing, full of flavor, delicious, not dry, and every bite you can taste the smokiness and savory flavors. What makes this place different from. Any other BBQ place I've tried is they douse the meat in their homemade sauce (of course they ask you first, but you are also able to get it on the side). It's like a vinegary, broth-like sauce that adds more flavor to the meats.3. Ease of Ordering: I always get stressed out trying to figure out what I want for sides and meats to get. I like this place because everything is laid out behind a clear glass that you can just point to. The lines starts at the meat selection, condiments, then sides. They have a variety of side to choose from. At the end of the sides, you pay and then there is another station that you can get your pickles/onions, beans, and bread. They've got this figured out and it shows.My overall experience here is def a 10/10. Great tasting food, plus amazing customer services makes for a great time! Will come here again!

Place is solid! It's not a life changer in terms of barbecue but it's good. First off, the space itself is very. Cool. Big community tables, a spacious bar, patio. The whole bit. Dark timber and brick it's legit. It's what you think an old pit barbecue place should feel like. I was here for lunch and had to work so the bar and drinks are not going to be part of the review.  Staff was great. Super friendly and ready to help you get your order in. These guys look like they are setup for volume. Ready to serve a lot of hungry meat eaters. The BBQ Sauce is vinegar based. It's not a sweet barbecue sauce so if that's a deal breaker for you, you should probably move on. Order your meat by the pond. They carve off what you want and while you grab your sides they slice and weigh and package for you. Pork ribs were good and the brisket was tasty. I liked the vinegar barbecue sauce but it's not my favorite. That's totally preference so don't read that as a knock on the place. Had extra sauce, pinto beans, onions, pickles out to grab. I might not search this place out again as I want to try other places when I am in town but I would not be mad if someone brought me here. As far as COVID, these guys are doing all the safety precautions but they are running their business and I am happy to support them and anyone else right now so they will be here when we are done with this craziness.

I was in Austin for less than 24 hours on a business trip (this was right before COVID) and I asked a few people where I could find the best BBQ. Most of them told me Cooper's, so that's where I ended up. They were not wrong! I couldn't decided what I wanted, so I essentially ordered it all. I ate until I was miserable and saved the rest for the plane. (imagine me chowing down on sausage while everyone else nibbled on peanuts) I still had some left over when I got home, so I had it for breakfast the next day. I can't wait until we can travel again! I'd go back to Austin just for Coopers.

I love the atmosphere of this place. The barbecue is a buffet kind of style. You go up to the counter to get your meat and sides, then pay and sit wherever.The barbecue is good here. Probably not the best in Austin compared to others but definitely good. And they had the best potato salad out of the places I've tried. I also appreciate that pickles and bread are free here.There is also a bar inside the restaurant and you can go up and order your beer to go with your food!

This place was not terrible, it just didn't stack up to the other bbq spots we check out in downtown. I feel like this is the spot where it's quick and food is OKAY. Gives off more bar food vibes than traditional pit vibes as suggested by the name. What we ordered: Beef ribJalapeño Macaroni and cheeseJalapeño cheddar sausageThe beef rib was more dry than expected.. it was more like yanked off the bone rather than slide off the bone. The sausage was on the tasty side, macaroni tasted like velveeta. Nothing special but good. The most disappointing item was the beef rib. If you're looking for a quick fix, this is the spot. If you want juicy tender meat I'd say keep looking.

DO NOT miss this spot! The food is so good! You go up to the counter and choose your "slab" of meat and then pick your sides! We went all in and had the pork ribs -excellent- the beef ribs - very good, the brisket- outstanding! and the turkey! Our sides were regular Mac and cheese and spicy Mac and cheese (yes spicy but I have a very low bar on the spice scale!) potato salad cole slaw and pickles! Lip smacking great! Great selection of beers too!

BEST BBQ in town! Delicious brisket and sausages.. they have two types of max n cheese A jalapeño bacon which is not that spicy and a regular mac & cheese. Same for the sausage there are two types cheddar and jalapeño and regular. They also have unlimited pinto beans, barbecue sauce which is their house sauce, pickles, onions, and bread (both white and wheat). For the amount of food you get I think it's a smokin' deal and every bit is just amazing. Staff is very friendly and there to help with any questions you have (:

After these great reviews I am disappointed in the beef brisket. The texture is tougher and drier than expected for the fatty cut and there is no smoke ring. The flavor of it was good, bold and slightly spicy to me, but I've had better brisket. The jalapeño and bacon mac and cheese was really nice, heat that sneaked up on me but nice flavor and a new flavor combo for me.They get an extra star for having dine in service but the first employee we encountered was pretty rude.We were first timers and unaware no plates or combos - everything is by the pound and a la carte. Gentleman that helped us with hot sides and checked us out pointed us towards the beverages and where everything else was. It made up for it. Glad we tried but probably would not return.Also the "plates" provided are wax paper sheets. It will do the job but we just weren't prepared for that either.

Maybe it was an off night.  First time in Austin, but not my first time having Texas BBQ and this was quite the disappointment.  We were looking for "authentic" and came here because of the reviews, but I think this place gets a lot of attention because of their location and frequented by a lot of tourists who don't know what really good Texas BBQ tastes like.  I read a lot of reviews and so many seem to be from people who were here visiting.It's located in the heart of downtown Austin and you can smell the BBQ aroma from a few blocks away.  We did arrive later in the evening and they did have a limited menu - this is common amongst a good BBQ restaurant.  They cook only so much per day so when it's gone... it's gone.  They only had Brisket and Sirloin so we got a pound of each.  As for sides, we got the potato salad and some of their pinto beans (they were out of everything else).The short of it, the sirloin might as well have been beef jerky.  It was so dried out and well done, we each ate a slice and left the rest.  Just a dried out piece of meat.  The brisket was definitely good but I've certainly had better.  The BBQ sauce... very disappointing.  It has a consistency just slightly thicker than water and it's quite plain.  No tanginess or spiciness to it.  It's really very bland.  The potato salad was okay but it's pretty had to serve bad potato salad.  Later they did have some mac-n-cheese which we had and it was quite good.  And lastly, we had Pecan cobbler and it was much like the sirloin.  Way too overcooked and no sweetness to it.  Again, had a couple of bites and left the rest.We are fully aware this was the first day open after the major storm that shut all businesses for days, however, if you are going to be open... the food should be just as good as any other day.  We did come late in the day, but that too is no excuse for poor quality.  Maybe the food is better earlier in the day, but I've been to other BBQ restaurants close to when they were about to run out but the food was still fantastic.  Cooper's is a nice place and I have no doubts caters to a mostly tourist business base.  If you have the opportunity, get out of downtown Austin and you'll find much better BBQ.

Coopers is pretty mediocre in the larger landscape of Austin Texas BBQ. Sausage had good snap and actually their sides are pretty great but there's much better BBQ out there. Convenient location though if you wanted to grab a bite then hit the bars; however, a meal here is pretty greasy so it all can sit a bit heavy after all is said and done.

We came here for some quick local BBQ and that it was. Cafeteria style and no frills. Meats smoked great - we had brisket and chick--and sides were solid--we tried the Mac and cheese, lite coleslaw and corn. The bbq sauce was just ok which is kind of disappointing. Vinegar based and super thin. But the peach cobbler? A different story. It was the shining star of the meal. Honestly I don't usually get excited about cobbler but this one is worth it. So cobble your pennies together--it's kinda pricey--and come for a meal. At least dessert. Yum.

Next on my list of spots for Austin barbecue was Cooper's, and while I really loved the atmosphere, I felt as though their offerings fell a bit short of what I had at Terry Black's or even Lambert's nearby. Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?I'm a sucker for open kitchen cafeteria style barbecue, and that's exactly what you'll find at Cooper's. Place your meat order, dish up your sides, and have a seat tucked away in Cooper's very quaint, comfortable, and rustic restaurant. Star. Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?With the exception of Franklin's the go-to barbecue spots in Austin are pricing their meats competitively these days with brisket hovering just north of $20/pp and Beef Rib just south of $20/pp. That's exactly what you find here at Cooper's, so fair play. Star. Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?Honestly? I just wasn't that big of a fan. I asked for my brisket on the leaner side, but what I ended up with was a bit of a mess of fat and gristle and a crust that didn't compete with the likes of say, Terry Black's. The Beef Rib was better, but there seemed to be way more bone in the mix (that was contributing to the price) than there was actual meat, which was another stark contrast to Terry Black's. Single Star. Star 5: Would you be excited to go back?Cooper's wasn't my favorite, and in a town as barbecue competitive as Austin you remember your favorites. No Star.
Don't get the chicken. It was bland and disappointing. The beef rib was really good. Great service.

The first thing I wanted when I landed in this city was BBQ and this place HIT THE SPOT. You walk up, tell the guy who is carving everything how much you want of whatever, and how much sauce you want with that. Then you choose your sides. They have a bar inside to where you can sit and watch TV (which I love) and then community tables on the other side. Brisket was 10/10. Beef ribs were 10/10, fell right off the bone and cooked perfectly. Sausage was good but not amazing like the other things. Mac and cheese was a must and they have complimentary butter bread near the utensils. All in all it was a great time and I would highly recommend

Awesome, colorful place with large variety of delicious meats, which are sold by weight, so no one would overeat unintentionally, haha. I tried all of their cuts -delicious. Cool and unpretentious atmosphere and friendly stuff.

Just visited Austin for the first time and the only requirement of the trip was that we get some BBQ on Memorial Day. Asking around, I heard that Coopers was one of the best. I will admit I am a BBQ snob so expectations were pretty low. Well.... I was absolutely not disappointed. The BBQ was fall off the bone tender and super flavorful. The jalapeño cheddar sausage was spectacular. It was classic Texas BBQ just like I grew up eating. I didn't get to eat the sides but my friend did and he loved them all. I did like the peach cobbler also. The only downside is that their traditional BBQ sauce was watery and just not for me or my friends. Will definitely visit again if I go back to Austin.

Great BBQ. The smoked sirloin is totally worth every penny. The pork ribs were good. Chopped beef was a bit disappointing. The beans are free but pecan pie and potato salad were great and worth it. Get there early because there can be a big line

My pork ribs and baked potato was good but I didn't care for the other items. The Mac and cheese was lack luster and I wasn't to thrilled about the brisket.  I love brisket so I was disappointed. The BBQ sauce was not good at all. It was watery and not thick like a sauce. I would come back for the pork ribs and baked potato. I spent almost $40 and only like 2 items smh. But you live and you learn lol.

Bruh. Stop scrolling for "Best BBQ in Austin" and park your little 250-lb-three-rep-max rear end down at Cooper's. This is where the Alpha dogs eat. Where titans and gods feast. Leave the piggy bank at home and bring the black Amex cuz it ain't cheap. But neither was freedom so pony up buttercup and swipe that plastic. And don't ask for the deal of the day cuz the only deals this place makes is with your taste buds. And your palate. And your stomach. After all three of them sing in harmonious symphony and Def Jam comes knockin' "yes hello we'd like to sign you to a record de-" BLAST OFF. NEXT STOP FLAVOR TOWN. ALL ABOARD THE COOPER'S EXPRESS. You just found the best BBQ in Austin, Brad. So next time you skip leg day skip Cooper's as well. Leave that i'll-just-keep-scrolling-on-yelp-to-vet-all-of-my-options attitude in California along with your Prius and Birkenstocks. And when you find what you lost come eat what you came here for.

Brisket and pork ribs were both absolutely phenomenal. For sides, the potato salad was really good, and the jalapeño bacon Mac n cheese was also an interesting variation on a classic. Lots of great Austin bbq spots, but Coopers is up there.

I want to say something upfront I am only going to say great things about this place! This was the first bbq I tried when I moved to Austin and I loved it! I moved here 4 years ago and I have continue to come back because their quality and flavor is always on point . I think so highly of this place that we used it as the venue for our wedding last year ( 2020). Yes! They have a really cool room on the second floor. Ok.. I will stick to the food , it is sooo good. You come in and the pit is open for you ti pick what you would like, then you can choose the sides , they weight your food and time to eat! Their sirloin is delicious ( my fav) and my husband really enjoys their peach cobbler. They offer free beans, bread , onions and pickles. I added some pictures of our last order that included all our favorites!

We had read these reviews saying this was the bbq in town, and I was a little disappointed! I will start off with the positives: the staff was friendly and nice, and the meat was cooked really well. I had pork ribs, and even though it was cooked well, there was little to no dry rub- just a salt and pepper, which wasn't great. Also, there was only one type of sauce, which wasn't the best either. Now the sides left a lot to be desired-the mac and cheese tasted very bland and the green beans tasted straight out of the can. I was expecting more from this bbq joint.

Very good food here. Prices are a little steep and the bbq sauce at the condiments counter was a little watery and vinegar tasting, but the brisket, jalapeño cheese sausage and beef ribs were cooked to a smoky perfection. The grilled corn was a nice touch, but the Apple cobbler was the it to finish off this meal. Would be back.

We walked passed Coopers during the day. Remembering where it was later, which was close to our hotel, we went back around lunch. We got the Jalapeńo Sausage and Brisket. For our side we had Cole Slaw and for dessert the star of the show, the Pecan Cobbler! Everything was Fantastic! Loved every bit!

This was one of my very first stop in Austin.  I had checked into my hotel and wanted to get some water and snacks.  While walking over to the store, I noticed Cooper's and decided to Yelp it to see what the reviews were.  After reading all the reviews, on my way back to the hotel, I decided to pick up some food.  I got to restaurant on a random weekday close to dinner time, so there was no wait.  I decided on some brisket and some ribs. The ordering was quick and easy.  I decided to take it back with me and eat in the hotel (I was having a suppper lazy moment after being on a long, early morning flight).  They packaged the food in a catering container.  In addition, which made it great for my to go experience, they had plenty of utensils to take away and containers for BBQ sauce.  After getting the food, I made my way back to the hotel and started to dig in.  The brisket and ribs were reallly good.  I actually enjoyed the ribs a little more (even if I am not a huge rib person).  I thought the meat on the ribs were a little more tender.  I thought that the food was really good, but wished the meat was a little more tender and juicy.  But, for my first Texas BBQ, this was a really good experience.  I also wanted to shout out the workers there who were super friendly and made my first Texas BBQ experience really awesome.

I was a little disappointed at this bar-b-que. All of the barbecue we tried were so salty. We tried the prime rib, brisket, pork and beef ribs. The sauce was so disappointing too. This is the first time that I've had a watery one. Not sure what the thought process was there.The best tasting meat they were the beef ribs. They were huge and juicy but again I couldn't enjoy it due to the saltiness. Hypertensive people beware here!
My favorite BBQ in Texas. The free beans are out of this world. Never had anything bad here!

I was pleasantly surprised by how tender the beef ribs were (5 stars). The fatty brisket was perfection (5++++++ stars). The corn was too salty and dry for me (2 stars). I don't typically like beans, but these were cooked to the right tenderness and had excellent flavor (4 stars).Despite the corn, I still have to give them a 5 because of the brisket!

I came in because of the amount of positive reviews this place had. We were ignored by the bartender, so we went to order some proteins. The process of ordering sides and everything seemed pretty rushed and forced. The brisket was chewy and the bbq sauce on it helped moisten it a little, however the bark tasted really strongly of chemicals. The sirloin seemed like the best cut that we had, better than the ribs as far as quality. The Mac and cheese wasn't spectacular either, but I enjoyed the pickles. Overall the sides seemed reheated/ mass produced and the meat felt overcooked and not fresh.

I came in here for dinner late last night and things didn't go well. The staff were rude and seemed upset when I asked for my meal to go versus dine in and the food wasn't very good. I've actually eaten here before, but the brisket was so salty I couldn't finish it and the sausage tasted like it had been sitting under a hot plate for hours.Really hoping this was a once off event..

I think we came in at a good time, only took us 10 minutes to order the line moved quickly. Only got the beef brisket and the Linc both were very good not covered in barbecue sauce, but still had a nice flavor. The one thing that is an absolute must try here is the baked potato, they put some yummy salt sprinkle on the skin and bake it and it is absolutely delicious. There is a big jar of pickle on every table, plenty of white bread. Bartenders were super attentive, my son accidentally dropped mostly empty beer glass and they cleaned it up and gave him a fresh one! Great location if you are staying downtown.

We were referred to a BBQ location a bit out of town, but choose Coopers as it was close to the hotel. We should have traveled. The meat looked ok, pork ribs, beef brisket, and sausage. However, the BBQ sauce was a watered down tasteless broth that did nothing to enhance the meat. The brisket and pork would have been good with a decent sauce that would stick to the meat. Sausage was decent not needing any sauce. Green beans, Mac n cheese were good. Unfortunately most of the meat went out the door in a doggie bag. Disappointing

This was AMAZING and such a great way to order, eat and enjoy dinner. Pick your meat, grab your sides and find a spot!! Had the brisket; make sure to have it dipped in their delicious sauce. Also had mac-n-cheese and corn on the cob.

With a bit of time to kill before more of our group got into town, my friends and I found ourselves in a bit of a conundrum - try to squeeze in a late dinner or head straight to Sixth Street to keep the party going.  We figured we didn't have time for a full on meal, but stopping at a random fast food-type joint wasn't all that appealing either.  Thankfully, though, the girl at the front desk gave us an awesome recommendation - Cooper's!  Open late and along the way from our hotel, it was the perfect place to make a pit stop.  Toss in the fact that we probably wouldn't be able to get BBQ during the rest of the trip and this was like a godsend!Having looked at their photos on Yelp during the walk across the river from South Cogress, the food looked fantastic.  However, I was also a little worried about coming here after seeing some rather long lines in their photos on Yelp.  Fortunately, there were only a couple of small groups ahead was, which, in the end, would've been the same as no one since we needed that time to figure out what to get anyways.  Their entire collection of meats sounded delicious (about 14 options to choose from), but they looked even better seeing them all laid out in their pit (I totally regret not taking a photo).Since we had been snacking/drinking quite a bit at our hotel bar before coming here, my stomach wasn't as quite empty as I wish it had been after seeing the food.  At the same time, I wasn't about to waste the opportunity to try as much as I could!  With so many options to pick from, I tried my best to balance getting a few different things to try while still getting enough to actually enjoy each one.  CHALLENGE ACCEPTED.-- BEEF BRISKET...$18.99/lb-- PORK RIB...$15.49/lb-- SAUSAGE...$12.99/lb(yelp.com/biz_photos/coop…)Of the three, the brisket was by far the best - slightly fatty, tender, and flavorful.  Yum.  As for the rib, it didn't have much of a smoke ring (it was barely pink), but the meat was moist and I liked the smokiness on the outside.  Sadly, the sausage was just okay - it had a nice bit of spice to it, but it wasn't very juicy.-- MAC & CHEESE(yelp.com/biz_photos/coop…)My actually friend ordered this one, but was generous enough to let me snipe a couple of bites.  All in all, this was great - the noodles were soft, the sauce was silky, and it had a fair amount of cheese (could've been cheesier).  The bit of spice and bacon made it all the better.Along with their selection of BBQ meats and sides, it was also pretty cool how you can help yourself to as much sliced white bread, onions, pickles, and baked beans as you can handle.  Since I wasn't super hungry, I passed for the most part, but I did make sure to try their beans.  The liquid they sat in was a little watery, but the taste of the beans was pretty decent.  As for Cooper's BBQ sauce (vinegar-based), it's a little runny for my liking, but the flavors weren't bad - it's not necessarily spicy, but it's got some spice to it.  One thing to note, though, is that their default is to dip your meats into the sauce when you order.  I asked for mine dry and added sauce later (I prefer less sauce), but my friends all got it dipped.Between all of their terrific BBQ offerings and how good the food actually tasted, Cooper's is pretty solid.  Sausage aside, which I don't hold against them as much as I would if the brisket was bad, everything was pretty darn good.  Both Franklin Barbecue and La Barbecue still have the edge, but I was definitely more than satisfied with what we had!
Dropped in with the family and loved it! Every time we visit, the better it gets.  Four of us devoured 2 pounds of brisket, macaroni and cheese, and coleslaw this time around.

First time visiting Cooper's Old Time Pit BBQ.  Was not disappointed!  The brisket was cooked perfectly and it's flavor was spot on- melts in your mouth good! The pork ribs, sausage and jalapeño Mac and cheese were all good.  Washed it down with a glass of craft brew.  Staff was friendly and ambiance was nostalgic and hip.

The staff here uses ample safety precautions. The bartender was so kind and thoughtful, he even remembered my sons name and reminded my little guy that he left his shoe! Thank goodness! The drinks were nice refreshments to have while waiting in the socially distant line. This was our first experience with Texas bbq and the warm welcome and friendly faces made it that much better. You get to choose from the meats first cafeteria style and they drench it in bbq sauce for you. We had the jalapeño cheddar sausage - amazing the cheese was gooey in each bite! Not too spicy. The brisket melted in our mouth like butter was the best brisket I've had even loved the fat! We also had some ribs and they were AH MAZ ING - we got come coleslaw and their toppings were all set up to be covid safe for the choosing we also had the bacon and French green beans which were bursting with flavor and not too soggy or over cooked at all - we also tried the Mac and cheese which was a big pleaser for my hubby! The pinto beans are on the house and they were spectacular! So we're the pickles my toddler especially loved the pickles and pinto beans - of course - they have it set up so you eat family style but also have everything you need if you'd like to grab it and go - they even gave us free stickers and JD a fun photo op on the way out the door. The staff even helped us capture this memorable moment with a photo and he was wearing gloves. They hve hand sanitizer available also - felt safe had an amazing meal and it was so good we barely had any leftovers! Cooper's is 5 stars in my book! It's right on Congress ave by all the attractions and in the heart of downtown Austin!

While in town for the day, we were in the mood for some BBQ and came across Cooper's. Parking downtown anywhere can be tricky so we parked in the garage, walked through the hotel and made our way. Nearing the building, we noticed a sign that advertised happy hour from 3p-6p and labeled themselves "Best Brisket In Town". Upon entrance you immediately smell the yumminess and bar to your L. The place was pretty packed but the lined moved fairly quick. As we ordered we watched the butcher cut and prepare our trays. My favorite was watching him dip our ribs in a jumbo pot full of BBQ sauce letting the flavors soak then watching the extra drippings before placing it on one tray. Whew! Alongside our ribs we also ordered brisket, sausage and sides of green beans, a baked potato and mac n cheese. The portions were generous and enough to share between the two of us. After getting your food, you pay then head to the condiment station to get your unlimited supply of pickles, onions, BBQ sauce, beans and bread. We opted to sit at the bar and indulge in the happy hour specials. I took a stab at their long island mixed with their sweet tea. It was a bit too sweet for my taste so the waitress was kind enough to change it to a regular margarita. I couldn't wait to dig in and this BBQ was hands down one of the best BBQ restaurants I've had in a while. My fav was the brisket but honestly every meat was delicious! The customer service was amazing and I made sure to let the manager know. I'd definitely return.
The meat was fine but very pricey. The sauce was a very vinegar based sauce, not much tomato, or sugar in it. I wasn't a fan of the sauce, I thought it was severely lacking.

Visiting from California, the brisket was good, the regular Mac n cheese was pretty good, the jalapeño bacon Mac n cheese had a lot of flavor not too spicy, the green beans were really good as well, the sausage was ok, the ribs were ok. The menu is completely by a la carte, they have a good BBQ sauce and the beans were pretty good also. The inside smelled like smoked meats lol but we sat outside is was nice.

I had zero experience, as they are supposed to be open until 10, yet closed at 9:10pm. I tried calling beforehand and someone answered and hung up. I assumed they were just busy but really I made an a** out of myself for thinking they would be busy when really closing down and hurrying home. It's a Thursday night and the place next to it is open. What a shame. I'll take my talents to a real bbq joint.

Omg love love love ! Go here fr cheap drinks instead of the expensive restaurant attached to the Marriott! Also amazing bbq perfectly seasoned by expert pitmasters . Knowledgeable bartender Aaron will make the Perfect strong cocktail fo you !

We've only eaten at Cooper's one time, which was for dinner last night. The downtown location is ideal for us and we had high hopes for delicious BBQ.We had the brisket (both moist/fatty and lean cuts) pork ribs, and  pork loin. Unfortunately, the seasoning for all of these was just dominated by salt; every other flavor including smoke was masked by salt.Atmosphere (4 stars): ideal for a BBQ place. It's a great downtown location with exposed brick and a lot of character downstairs and upstairs.Food (2 stars): SALT is about all we could taste. The first couple of bites were tolerable, but after that we both were just overwhelmed by the saltiness of everything we ordered.Given the convenience of this location and the atmosphere, we may give it another try.

This is one of the more popular places downtown and there's a reason why! There's plenty of options for meat and sides that will fill up some of the biggest eaters. Me being one of them! Thinking back to my meal here is making me hungry as we speak! My only complaint was the brisket was a little salty for my taste, but I still enjoyed it. The sausage link and potato salad was my favorite part of the meal. It's all laid out in front of you, so you pick what you want and how much. I love the set up. There's plenty of seating here with multiple benches throughout, as well as big bar set up. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful.

It was Monday and Franklin's was closed, reviews did not live up to the hype.  This tasted and had the texture of a crackpot pot roast. No way was this worth the money. The sides were good and brisket was just OK. Did not impress this california boy.

Delicious food!! Everything was very delicious, walking into this place and I started salivating! Great service and friendly staff! Visiting Austin and wanted to have some great BBQ and this place did it! Definitely will come here again when visiting Austin.

Sooooo, they are open 'till midnight, but when I got there a little after 9, they were out of all bbq except two items.  The ribs and sausage were good, real good, but not great.  The sides were in plastic!!!   WTF!  So. Not. Austin.  WTF?  Cole slaw pretty good, jalapeño mac n cheese tasted and felt like they made it a few days before.  Lots of character with the rustic facades.  Maybe too much, didn't feel clean.

This BBQ looks epic and I went off reviews on their ribs. I ordered a pound of Beef Ribs and a pound of Pork Ribs.I was beyond excited but the price was pretty high.The side sauce is Vinegar based but it's ok. It's just very soupy. I really wish they offered a thicker sauce. The ribs (both Beef and Pork) were a huge disappointment. They look amazing. But they do salty that it's unbearable. I rarely eat food that I don't like but this was really a bummer. I'm not sensitive to salt either...this was over the top. I'm bummed because this was expensive and it was not good at all.

The pork ribs are so tasty here. I had a great time. The blackberry cobbler was absolutely perfect. Not too sweet, just perfect.  The staff is friendly and works quick. Everything is clean and organized. I will definitely be back.

Cooper's Pit BBQ is a great stop for beef brisket (sold by the pound) if you're in town for a conference.  I was staying at the JW Marriott for a conference in mid-November and happened to walk by this place about a block from the hotel.  It wasn't too busy for an early dinner (5:30pm) on a weekday, but there was a long line on the previous night.  The beef brisket was outstanding & highly recommended (especially with a little cornbread). Sauces are not necessary, but they are available as condiments.  Also, you can pickup free pickles, jalapeños, and beans at the fixin' stands. It's casual dining which is great for small or large groups.  Seating is plentiful on the 1st floor but they also have tables upstairs on the 2nd floor if needed.
Driftwood, TX 78619

This is our absolute fave BBQ place! We have driven from Dallas to Driftwood just to eat and then drive straight back home. We love love love everything here. The beef ribs are to die for! The habenero chicken is great! As well as their sausage and brisket. Prior to COVID they had live music on the weekends Im not sure if they still have that or not. They also have a souvenir shop. Best of all they have a wine cellar there too!!! It's definitely worth your time to try this place out when in the area or when in the mood for awesome BBQ due like us, jump in Your car and drive over for a bite!

Finger licking delicious! Move over beef ribs, as the flavorful bison ribs are more preferred. Beef ribs tasted bland but still good. Everything else was enjoyable. Need to ask for the complimentary bread, onions, and pickles. A scoop of ice cream can be added for an extra cost. Alcohol is available, but in the next building over and can be enjoyed with your meal. Go early to avoid the crowds. We made it by 11am Saturday and was seated immediately and by the time we were done, a bit after 12noon, there was already a long line. There are 2 different lines. Togo and indoor seating. Outdoor seating is more picnic style where you can eat your "to-go".An experience that I would go back!
Nice outdoor seating.  Quick service.  Delicious BBQ.  Not sure how you can top this.  One of the best in the Austin area.

Ok. I need to get this right be ause my gf loves this place. Despite her love, I'm going to give you the real deal so you know what you can expect. The biggest advice I can give you, especially if you skipped the captions on my pics, ORDER AHEAD! Do not be that hapless chap who is like "this is a great lunch idea", then you get there and you're like "I didn't know there were this many hungry people out in the country... I'm never going to eat." When you get in the car, call and order. There... now we can get along like little doggies.The Nitty Gritty Ok... this place does BBW awfully good. The brisket is tender (mine was a little bit dry but with their BBQ sauce I was smiling), the pulled pork was nice. For you PP (pulled pork) enthusiasts, there were a few burnt pieces which were still tasty, but for an $18 dollar plate, it was really light on the pulled pork. I think I got the last of a batch. Look at the picture and judge for yourself. The sides were good, but the meat was the real show stopper. Oh... I had some of my gf's turkey and it was moist, tender and just awesome, especially with the BBQ sauce. If you can take the BBQ sauce home, do it.The space is amazing and the picnic area is beautiful. There is a monster amount of space for family, friends, pets, you name it. It's wonderful for a graduation celebration. Ok... you've read this far. So, when I think about reviews I imagine what I'd ask or say to the owner if I was sitting with them. One question I would ask is about updating their buildings and modernizing their business. Not being cash only is great. This place draws a crowd, and they crowd spends serious money. Why isn't there a proper restroom for the size and diversity of their patrons? They could do a lot. Rustic is a look. Just a thought.The food is great and you should absolutely check out this Texas Gem.

My husband and I were spending our anniversary in the area and stopped at Salt Lick for dinner on a Thursday evening. The wait was 45 minutes and order to take home was even longer. Thoughts...1) Need parking for expecting mothers 2) More waiting area seating would be helpful 3) Half chicken was delicious and totally worth ordering 4) Brisket was also very good 5) Either enforce the masks or stop trying to 6) Build real bathrooms for a more pleasant experienceOverall, the food is delicious! Totally, 100% worth the stop. Could use some better guest accommodations to make this a 5 star experience.

This place is carnivore heaven!! If you love meat, meat barbecued to perfection that is, you have to come visit this place. This is what I envisioned bbq in Texas to be. I'm in love with this place. We ordered the AYCE and got to choose 3 proteins, we got beef brisket, sausage, and ribs. I was kinda bummed they didn't have hot links but the perfectly cooked ribs and brisket made me forget all about them. I had a piece of the bread and it was tasty; nice and warm but I didn't want to fill up on this. I had a plan in mind and it was to have all the bbq meat I could handle. After watching a group of 10 people roll in one of those massive coolers with beer inside it, I realized being a first timer I was unprepared for this event and these people were obviously not new to this. This is a bring your own beer type of place and I waaaassssn'ttttt readyyyy!! Anyway, not to worry, right next to the restaurant and I mean right next to it like in the backyard, there's a little place that sells beer. The beer is pretty pricey, it's like 6.50 for I Shiner of 3 for 15; it doesn't matter!! I happily paid for my beer!! Next time I will be bringing my big ass iced cooler with Stella Artois though. Anyway back to my story.... the coleslaw goes the best with all this meat goodness, if you go, get yourself a few sides of slaw and a couple of those sides of fresh crunchy pickles; it's all part of your AYCE. One of the best parts of ordering AYCE, If you don't finish your food, you can pack it up and take it home! Ok, I lied, the best part of this experience is the berry cobbler, omg!! I had 2 of them all warm and gooey with vanilla ice cream and I'd totally do that again!!  I had the most amazing waitress. I waited too long to write this review and I lost my notes to give her a proper shoutout but I'll be back and I will make sure to get her name.

Absolutely amazing Texas BBQ. We were visiting from CA and DC and this place blown our mind. Food is delicious, tasty and flavorful. I like the brisket, bison ribs and coleslaw the most. Staff were very friendly but a bit slow. I love the atmosphere the most. Will definitely come back when traveling to Austin.

I am not a fan of BBQ, I don't generally like lots of meat all covered in sauce. It's just not my go to selection of food choices but The Salt Lick made me a believer!!!!!There food is soooo good! I visited the area and wanted to try "real BBQ". So I jumped the gun and went out of my comfort zone for this one and I'm so glad I did. I ordered a Ranch Water to start, it was typical and strong but perfect to compliment my entree. For my meal I ordered the Ribs and Turkey. We also ordered the Beef Ribs and Mac & Cheese to share. The Turkey was the best Turkey I have ever had, moist and well flavored it was amazing. The ribs were very good and tender whew! Of course I added the spicy barbecue sauce and OMG a party in my mouth. You can ask for bread, onions, and pickles. I loved the flavor of the Turkey and onions with the spicy barbecue sauce. Very goood. Nowwww I saw a couple next to us mixing the Mac & Cheese and the baked beans.... so we had to try it. Let me tell you it was amazing... almost like Chilli Mac. Literally the perfect side. I wasn't a fan on the potato salad (it was a darker potatoe maybe) and I don't eat coleslaw so I can't give you a review on that. Overall the food was amazing, I was glad I got to experience really good BBQ and you should too!!
Some of the best BBQ in Texas, hands down. The brisket, ribs, beans are fantastic! The best potato salad and coleslaw I've ever had. It is worth the 30-minute drive from Austin.

So it's tradition to stop in Austin to grab some bbq on our way home to Ft. Worth and we like to try different eateries each time. Most places were sold out by noon but we stumbled upon this awesome place and was happy the others were sold out. I placed an order on the internet which was very easy and convenient. Gave them about a two hour notice cuz we were still driving from Port Aransas. When we pulled up to the takeout allotted space, about 30 minutes later than our time slot, a young gentleman came out and greeted us then asked for our name to retrieve the order. Came back with two huge bags of greasy, yummy goodness. We ordered the family meal for 4-6 for $75 and let me tell ya, it fed us for 3 days. The brisket was soooooo juicy and perfectly smoked. The pork ribs were also amazing. The jalapeño sausage had a nice texture and was cheesy and gooey in its own delicious way. Pinto beans and Mac n cheese were also delectable!! Also came with fresh pickles/onions and white bread. The bbq sauce was tangy and a bit watery for my taste. Will def go back another time. I was delighted with everything!! Give their takeout a shot!!

Delicious!! Came here for a late lunch one Friday and got a one-meat plate with brisket, tomato/cucumber salad, and potato salad. The one-meat plate was a bit pricier than what I was used to at other bbq places, but the flavor was 10/10. The brisket basically falls apart and is not too fatty. The meat is also served with a tomato-based bbq sauce; it's not as thick as bbq sauces you might be used to, but omg does it work with the brisket. The service was 10/10: super efficient and very kind! Getting a meal for takeout was a breeze here. Parking situation: on-site

Deep in the heart of Austin on LAMAR Street is Stiles Switch BBQ & Brew. During the Isolation period, we found ourselves close by, so we decided to drop in. I heard they had a nice family meals at affordable prices. Like most restaurants with great food, always call and check availability. We arrived about 7:30pm and unfortunately they were out of Pork Ribs and Smoked Turkey. So we ordered brisket and pulled pork. The brisket was "Absolutely delicious". Tender and Juicy as you would expect. I can truly tell the prep that was involved in the making. I had the Pulled Pork and Man! I was looking forward to the ribs, but the pork was an excellent second choice. It was just as tender and juicy as the brisket. How do they do this? The Curb Side delivery is excellent. They come out to confirm your order when you drive up. Don't forget to tip generously to the Curb Staff. They can really use our help. Looking forward to my next trip. Michael Cummings Georgetown, Texas

Stiles is one of the BEST BBQ joints located in North Austin Texas!!! Been coming here for a long time now, and it never disappoints!!! At some point we were even going to use their location and food for our wedding reception, but ended up going a different route due to the amount of guests we would have. Anywho! Their service is top notch!!! They will all greet you with a big smile! Their brisket is SOOO GOOD(and we're picky), three great sausage options to chose from, and I could eat their CORN CASSEROLE allll day long! ANNND they just added brussel sprouts as a side in their menu and WOW soooo tasteful and has a spicy kick!! Yall really did it! Some real TEXAS BBQ. We also just found out they have brisket enchiladas on Tuesdays, so we've been saying for forever that we will come try them out! Honestly just follow them on social media for their daily specials!

Beware of the specials.  The Sausage sammy special was old and they were trying to get rid of a batch - I can only assume.  The skin was like leather and the knife had to be used as a saw.When I order brisket, I prefer the moist or fattier end, which I did.  Received a  slice with both cuts.  Separate!  Didn't touch the lean, dry pieces.The sides were the best part.

Really a 3.5 but the rude african american gentleman relaying order weights to the cashier rounded them down.The brisket was better than average but a little burnt, not the good kind.  The beef and pork ribs were actually very good while the sausage was very dry.Not bad but not the top of the mark for bbq joints in this town.  The prices are about average with other top-end bbq places if not a bit higher.

I just moved to the area. I know the Hill Country has some pretty good BBQ. I do have a rule of thumb that if you can smell it from the outside, go for it! Luckily this was the case so we went for it. It's sort of like Spring Creek where you walk up and order, and they make the food right in front of you.I had the brisket plate with a side of potato salad and macaroni. This brisket is probably in the top 3 that I've had anywhere else. However, the Mac and cheese really gave the dish some negativity. It was pretty bland tasting, and not enough of that "cheesy" taste. The potato salad was good, but it too could've been more flavorful. Other than that, I really loved the brisket.The staff was alright but not the best. One guy seemed like he had no personality when he was asking which sides I wanted. It is a pretty quick process to get the meals ready though. I enjoyed the iced tea they had; worked great for the warm Texas day. Not sure if I'll come back, but they do have other things I might dive for.

I was recommended this place by a staff at the hotel I was staying at. I tried the brisket, jalp chedder sausage, pork ribs, corn casserole and potato salad.The staff was friendly and the process was quick. I personally think the food was decent however the sauce was very watery too my liking. Everything else the flavoring and spices were good. However the ribs had too much spices for the kids and they werent able to eat it. My boyfriend however was disappointed. He didnt like anything.
THE BEST BBQ hands down!!! They actually season there meat well then smoke them to perfection. Even tho burnt ends are not on the menu, all you have to do is ask for them. I can't wait to get back.
THE BEST BBQ hands down!!! They actually season there meat well then smoke them to perfection. Even tho burnt ends are not on the menu, all you have to do is ask for them.

I'm from Houston and whenever I'm in Austin and I want some good Central Texas style BBQ, I always go to Stiles Switch on North Lamar!!! The Brisket is the best and I always get it both lean and moist. Just make sure you some Potato Salad, Mac N Cheese, and a Dr. Pepper to wash it off!!! :-D

This place is amazing, hands down, the best barbecue you can get in Austin, along with the AMAZING people that work there. So creative and delicious ALWAYS. It's hard to say what to recommend since they perfect everything they deliver! Also, I am a major fan of their mustard bbq sauce and cannot wait to purchase it when they start distributing it!!!
Just good BBQ and not overplayed.  Straight up Texas sit down and eat BBQ.  Ribs were very good!
