My bro and cousin decided that we wanted to go to find some BBQ and this place was recommended by a friend of mine. There was not a wait as we went when it was a little gloomy out. When we got there I ordered the 2 meat plate with the brisket and sausage with cream corn and beans. The brisket was really good with good bark and good smoke to it. The Sausage was good but it was a little dry. The cream corn was good as well but I think it needed a little bit more sweetness to it. The beans were delicious. It had some brisket in the beans so it created different taste as well as flavor and texture. We also ordered the pork ribs and they were really good. I would DEFINITELY come back and order the ribs. I would definitely recommend this place for some really good BBQ

Had a wonderful experience at Lambert's. Made a reservation even tho we ended up sitting at the bar and Nick took excellent care of us.  He knew the menu back to front and recommended each of our dishes, and his craft cocktail and whiskey knowledge was exquisite.  Never actually even got up from my seat! I hear they have a great live bar upstairs on the weekends and there's a patio out back, hopefully we'll be back in the summer when it's not freezing and raining!

Love the ambiance of the entire restaurant. Even though the back patio was open and it looked really cute and warm, we decided to dine inside. The upstairs was super cute with leather banquettes, a bar and a stage and while it is closed at this time due to Covid, I really do hope that it is back open next year.The mini cornbread for the table definitely gives you the impression that the food is going to be on point and we were not disappointed. For apps, we had the queso with burnt ends and it was delish as well as the homemade flour tortillas and homemade fried tortilla chips. The main courses consisted of the Texas prime brisket, grilled & broiled rainbow trout, prime niman ranch ribeye, roasted broccoli, yukon potatoes with sour cream & chives, collard greens, and fried apple pie. Every single dish was incredible! I do have to mention that when I first received the rainbow trout, the fish itself was cold, but as soon as I told our waiter about the issue, he immediately had a completely new dish prepared and the fish was perfect! I'm actually planning to go back this week to get some coconut pie and another apple pie to go!

Visited Lamberts in January 2020. I cannot exactly remember all of the things my group of 15 ate/drank but I can say without a doubt that it was delicious! Lamberts has both indoor and outdoor options and we opted for the heated/covered outdoor seating. We were able to order a mix of different sized plates that worked well for a shared plates dinner. There wasn't anything we didn't like.I'd definitely venture back the next time I find myself in the area!

Solid food, but my main takeaway each time I visit is the shocking pricing for what you get (an order of queso + 2 drinks was $45)The queso is listed on the menu as including burnt ends, but was served with one solitary morsel of meat Great spaceHot towels at the end are a nice touch Can have a pretentious attitudeNot McGuire's best option

BBQ and Blues...what else could you ask for. We came here on a night when there was a live show. We were sat pretty close to the stage, but even if we were further away it still would have been okay. Acoustics were great and the show was more of an imitate setting. We ordered the 3 meat plate to share between the two of us. Make sure you get some sides as well, since it doesn't come with any. Three meat sampler: A sampling of Prime Brisket (very tasty), Pork Ribs (too much fat) and Sausage (excellent! I wish we had more of this). The meats came with sauces to dip in. It was nice to have a variety of sauces to choose from.Baked mac n cheese: This side was okay. It was decent mac n cheese, but I wouldn't get it again.Mashed Yukon gold potatoes: My favorite of the meal. Nice and cheesy with a dollop of sour cream. Definitely when great with all the meats.Overall, good food, good drinks, and a really nice spot to start off our Austin trip!

Touchdown Austin. My objective? Hit as many BBQ spots over the course of three days as I possibly can (it turned out to be five of them) and see how they stack up. First up was Lamberts, and while this wasn't the rustic pit-centered setup that you might expect when you hear Texas barbecue, the goods delivered nonetheless. Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?Lambert's is actually a pretty swanky sit down spot following what I hear is a recent remodel, and they tether a comfortable environment with fantastic service that's lightning quick. Star. Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?Sitting down comes at a bit of a cost that's incremental even to the existing premium placed on Austin BBQ, and the result was $21.00 for what must have been about a half pound of brisket with some peppers and onions, two slices of bread, and a selection of housemade barbecue sauces. That's expensive, but not as much if you're expecting sit down prices and execution. Star. Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?I was told by Brian, my genuinely out of this world server, that Lambert's brisket can stand by itself, and I found that... almost to be true. Good flavor? Yes. Great consistency that balanced fat with lean? Yes, but the one place lacking here was the crust, which was thin and without much of a punch. Single Star. Star 5: Would you be excited to go back?Strictly for their brisket and nothing more maybe not, but Lambert's is very much serving a need in providing good barbecue in a sit down environment where you're not going to walk out of there smelling like smoke and meats. Star.

This spot has a really nice ambience. Dim lighting throughout and a nice vibe. The service here was excellent. The queso dip was super tasty. We tried the meat sampler and some barbecue and it was mediocre. The baked clams and the red snapper were absolutely amazing though in comparison. The food was overpriced but it was tasty. The ambience is what brings in the crowds. I would come back here for that red snapper, clams, and queso. Those were definitely taking me to flavor town. Overall it was a good experience. There was a lot to pick from on the menu so there was something for everybody.
Expensive and not worth the price. The brisket was very good, don't bother with the Wedge salad. Service was good, drinks overpriced big time!

Probably the best barbecue I had in this area. Everyone from the wonderful hostess that took down our name and called us when luckily someone else cancelled their reservations on busy memorial weekend; to our attentive server was great! The food was awesome. Fresh made chips and queso. Melt in your mouth brisket. I had a Tito's Moscow mule made with their rosemary syrup and it was so great I broke my one drink rule and ordered another. Absolutely delicious. Will definitely be back!

Came here here for a bachelorette and was very disappointed with the management. Our group of 8 tried to get ahold of the restaurant for weeks and barely received adequate communication. Our waiter Katherine was amazing and our busser was on point! I can't lie, I was disappointed because for some reason it took over 20 minutes to get dessert. I'm not sure if they forgot about us or if they were under staffed but overall I wouldn't recommend this place if you have a big group. They are not accommodating and non responsive so don't even waste your time trying to plan an event here. Unfortunately we will not be returning, including the locals that attended with us.

Thank you Yelp reviewers. Great gourmet bbq. Incredible atmosphere. Live music too?  The sampler was great, 1/2 chicken, and smoked clam appetizer . The best coleslaw I've ever had. Must get a side of their slaw!!

Had family win from out of town and my cousin picked this place.  The reviews looked good and the pictures of the food looked amazing.  Unfortunately that was not my experience here.  I ordered the " meat sampler" , what they brought out was sad to say the least.  Mind you it's a 30 dollar plate, what you get is 1 - Pork rib, 1 - sausage,  2 - slices of brisket, and one piece of white bread.  So you basically are paying $10.00 for each meat selection.  I wasn't expecting a feast or anything but I should walk away hungry after a 30 dollar plate of food.  The wife ordered the rib eye and all be it flavorful, really poor quality cut of meat.The reason this review went from what would have been a 3 star to a 1 star was as we were leaving I noted someone in the KITCHEN with their mask down and chatting with the other cooks!  Seriously, in to days day and age, blatantly out in the open with no cares.I will complement them on the staff all friendly and helpful, but WAY over priced and clearly needs some remedially training on health safety.

Cozy little restaurant so make sure to call ahead ahead for a reservation. Parties larger than 8 make sure to call way in advance, because of their size they need to be able to accommodate. The waiters and waitresses were prompt, friendly, and came back at the right times. The steak was cooked exactly how I asked. I'm not a huge ribs person, but these were actually really good and I would consider having them next time. The shrimp (ceviche) was actually surprisingly delicious. I'm biased of course and think that mine is the best, but they actually did a great job and I'd have it again. These dishes including the appetizers are fairly big so eating an appetizer as your main entree will be very filling. The drinks were normal nothing out of the ordinary.

These guys & gals are fresh open after a remodel and COVID partial shutdowns down. Limited menu- but let me tell you - best half baby back ribs anywhere!! Fresh cold draft beer.  Great attitudes.  I'm going to be back.  Good job!

Twice in one week we ate at Lamberts primarily for the crispy boar ribs. This restaurant was the first place on our schedule after a four-hour drive from Dallas. We've dearly missed the ribs since visiting last October. To make up, we ordered a second round with a delectable dish of clams in-between. Before leaving town, we came back again for the ribs and tried an order of queso which seem shy of the burnt ends this visit. Not to worry, we will come back and order more ribs on the next visit.

The skinny: Solid BBQ in downtown Austin without the typical insane all day wait times. Cool vibes from a simple restaurant to lively bar feel. Food: Had a variety of food at this downtown joint and was happy with everything we got. Ordered brisket, pulled pork, chicken fried oysters app, brussels and mac and cheese. Brisket was tasty and that nice melt in your mouth type of fat. Pulled pork was good but not as juicy as I would have liked. Fried oysters on texas toast was a nice treat - fried perfectly. Mac and cheese is very cheesy. Overall pretty solid dishes - BBQ sauce was great too! You also get complimentary corn bread to start and pickled items as a little side dish with your bbq.Atmosphere/service: Came here earlier on a Friday night and was quoted a 30 min wait but got in after 10 (they can put you on the waiting list and text you which is great). Theres a good amount of space here. Outdoor patio area, indoor restaurant style seating, and a bar both downstairs and upstairs. Upstairs had a live band as well. Service was fast and very friendly. Price/value: $$ Its bbq in texas - so pretty good portion sizes. We got 2 meat portions + 2 sides, and a small app to split between the 3 of us and had food to spare. Would I come back: If I was in the area yes, centrally located without the crazy texas bbq wait.

Came here with 3 buddies of mine after a day at the lake boating. We wanted a nice sit down restaurant downtown and I had never tried this place so we went with it. Although they said they charged for masks they ended up giving us some for free so that was pretty cool. The inside was pretty nice and I enjoyed the decor and lighting. There was no wait and we were seated right away. The menu was pretty short so making decisions was a bit easier. I went with the brisket, which unfortunately comes with no sides. The meal came out fast so that was great, but unfortunately very small. Bar B Q is generally looked at as big meals and comes with sides, but $22 only got me a small portion of brisket. The waiter was pretty cool and we did small amounts of corn bread so that helped. The food was pretty good and I did enjoy it, but I don't feel that I will ever come back. Portions were extremely small and i left the restaurant still very hungry. Friends agreed as well.

VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED. Don't go here! Not worth it and the price... Normally, we don't really write reviews. However, we were visiting out of town and definitely felt like we were ripped off. We want to make sure everyone is aware of this and doesn't have this happen to them. Clearly, we should have read previous reviews because this has already been called out. We ordered a 3 meat sampler with a side of mac and cheese. The mac and cheese looked good but tasted like rubber. The worse part of all was our sampler. We thought it would be enough for two people to share, after all it was $30 plus tax. It only had one hot link, two slices of brisket, and one pork rib. It is the saddest sampler I've ever seen in life. Let the picture be the proof.

Have to give this place a low star-NOT because of the food- but because of what happened after we left. So we went with my SO and another couple. Had an enjoyable meal. But a few days later I saw I received a FB friend request from our server. There was no way he would have known my name unless he purposely looked at my credit card receipt and stalked me on FB. We are not from here and I did not know the server prior to going there. This really creeped me out!!!!!! Mind you food was amazing and the hog ribs were so delicious. The whiskey list is impressive. I will say the Mac and cheese is kind of sweet which is off putting. But some of the best collards you can find around here (and that takes a lot for me to say). Nonetheless kind of creeped out to go back there...

I visited Lamberts Downtown Barbecue to meet up with some friends who were in town and suggested this place.  I'm glad they did because I wouldn't have known about it otherwise.  We had a fun time here! Lamberts is located in a historic building, so I really like that much of the character is still intact.  There are two levels to Lamberts and an outdoor patio area.  We met upstairs in the bar where there was live music!  This is where you want to sit for the full experience. Although the bar was crowded, staff let us stand around the bar area and order off the happy hour menu.  The happy hour menu is a great deal, offering half off all bar food items and two dollars of their signature cocktails.  The bar food menu included items beyond appetizers like barbecue plates.  It was a casual menu, but elevated.  I ordered the Frito Pie and a Prickly Pear Mule, which were both solid.  The Prickly Pear Mule was really nice, as it had a lot of the ginger flavor and was not at all sweet, which is how I like my cocktails.  The Frito Pie was very good, with brisket and goat cheese, a more sophisticated take on the traditional Frito Pie.  I would order it again.  But there is a lot to choose from here. Lamberts is definitely a great place to check out, especially with a killer happy hour food menu and live music!  Staff were super friendly and its downtown location makes it easy to find and get to.  Glad to have reconnected with some old friends here!

I came here during their happy hour (all day Monday and 5-7pm daily). This includes half off all bar food and $2 off cocktails. There are two floors and happy hour is at the bar areas of both floors.As I was doing research for this place I saw that the wild boar ribs ($8) were very popular so of course I had to order it especially since it was half off during happy hour. First of all, the plating was superb and the ribs are stacked high. The ribs themselves are a bit chewy but soft and the sauce is sweet and spicy. They were something I've never had before so I really have to give them props for that. They were really good and unique.My first drink was the rosumari sour ($10) which was frothy from the egg white and I loved the lemon. My second drink was the sandia daiquiri ($10) which was very refreshing from the large hints of cucumber.I had great service from my bartender Autumn and I really loved everything that I ordered here.

This is one of the few bbq places that takes reservation. It's a bit more upscale and expensive than the others. Overall, it was okay.For appetizers, we ordered the crispy wild boar ribs. This was my favorite dish and I definitely would recommend this. The flavors were delicious and I liked how cute and small the little ribs were. We also had the short rib and brisket. Out of all the bbq places I tried that weekend (Terry Black's & Franklin), the brisket here was the worst. It wasn't bad, but it was the least flavorful and most dry. The short rib was good but it was hard to get the meat off the bones at the very end. Overall, this place didn't leave a very strong impression with me. I liked how we could make reservations, but I thought the food was very standard.

I'm sure having a restaurant during Covid isn't easy. None the less one would still expect a expensive meal to be worth the patronage. 3 stars here for waiter and host. Food pretty sure wasn't fresh, maybe prepped prior in day, extremely salty and just plain not good. Great location, potentially neat environment however expense just wasn't justified. Thanks again for great staff.

This place has a wonderful ambience. Reminds me of a speakeasy-type atmosphere. We sat down at the bar for drinks and the bartender was very friendly, easily gave recommendations, and made some really tasty drinks. They're known for having quite a selection of whiskey. We didn't go for dinner, but I hope to return soon to try the food because it smelled delicious. It was the perfect place to go for date night.

Spoiler alert: loved it!From A-Z, this food and service was delicious.  Flavorful at every dish with just the right amount in each dish, Lambert's is always a crowd pleaser.We hit this restaurant before watching a show at the Bass Concert Hall. We grabbed a few apps ( the  fried green tomato and the shrimp campechano) and shared a steak. That steak though was the standout. Perfect in every way and enough for two to share. We were fortunate to have decent weather that night so we were able to sit outside on the patio. Lovely night with great company and exceptional food.

During our first trip to Texas we couldn't get reservations for Lamberts, but this time I made them ahead of time. Service was good so I would give them five stars for that. We had reservations at 9:00pm and they had a no show and immediately called me and told me they can accommodate me earlier since I had called to try and change my reservation. We ordered the fried green tomatoes which were good. They had greens and a crab salad which was tasty. For dinner I got the meat preview which brings brisket, ribs and sausage. My brisket was loaded with excess fat, room temperature and not savory. The ribs were not the type that fall of the bone and the sausage was ok. The Mac n cheese and mashed potatoes were my favorite things. My husband got the baby back ribs and he wasn't a fan, he said he could have passed on them and they were dry. The service was good so I do credit them for that, but I wouldn't be back for the food.

Wow, I can't say enough great things about this restaurant! I'm a native Texan and almost never eat barbecue as I'm more of a Tex-mex girl, but I was visiting with a friend who's never been down south, and I knew I had to treat her to some real BBQ! My brother decided on Lambert's, and we made our way over for brunch. Although it was brunch, they still had all BBQ options in addition to unique breakfast variations of their dishes. Our servers were all absolutely incredible, I can't say enough about the stellar service. The food itself was absolutely heavenly as well. I got the steak and eggs in a hole, and my friend and brother got variations of their famous brisket. We split everything in addition to several appetizers, and everything was phenomenal. Flavorful, great texture, amazing queso, what else could you ask for?It was everything I needed and more and I'm so grateful for my brother's great suggestion!

This would be a one star review if it wasn't for the one redeeming quality, our server was so nice and attentive. It was our wedding anniversary this weekend so we stayed downtown and Lambert's was recommended by several employees at our hotel. We decided to make it our spot for dinner and headed that way after making a reservation. The host made sure to let us know that they were very full and that we should probably sit at the bar. The restaurant was more than half empty. We politely declined and waited for a table. He didn't seem thrilled by this. Once we were seated we enjoyed the decor and ambiance upstairs. The booths were roomy and and the lighting was nice. The complimentary cornbread was actually very good. We decided to order the sausage platter, broccoli, and waffle fries. We were confused when our "platter" arrived and it was two sausage links for $25. The sausage was good but not $12.50/link good. The broccoli was so beyond meh. My husband couldn't do more than one bite. They had a strong chemical smell coming off of them. We had to have our server take the bowl away immediately. The waffle fries were on par with a famous fast food chicken joint that isn't open on Sundays. And at quadruple the price, not worth it. We left hungry, disappointed, and confused at all the recommendations for this place. I don't think anything could make us come back to Lambert's. If I want good sausage I'm heading to one of the many BBQ joints that Austin has. We ordered pizza to our hotel room right after this, happy anniversary to us. Highly recommend trying any other restaurant in the area.

This place is awesome! Luckily we made reservations because when we arrived there was a 2 hour wait (and people were waiting!). We had to wait a few minutes for our table and the staff couldn't have more apologetic. The moment we sat down they brought our free appetizers. Totally unexpected as we waited maybe 10 minutes? No big deal, but such a nice gesture!The food was delicious and portion sizes huge. My only real complaint was how slow the service was in general. I know they were busy but for just two of it took almost three hours to get through our meal which seems a bit excessive. They ended up giving us dessert on the house too due to the wait. While we truly appreciated the kind gestures, we would've appreciated slightly faster service more. But this certainly wouldn't stop be from returning as the food was really THAT good!

Fun downtown spot that offers upscale bbq food. The crispy boar ribs were presented beautifully and were fall off the bone delicious. The shrimp on the appetizer menu was ok. Seemed like a play on mexican ceviche but lacking in flavor. The cornbread they serve in the beginning is good, wish it were served warmer. Finally the steak that was on the special menu was great and cooked perfectly medium rare. The service was fantastic. Loved the cocktails especially the one with ginger beer in it.

Oh my, it happened!  I found my five star restaurant.  Food was scrumptious brisket, pulled pork and ribs.  Sides were fresh especially the collards which make my own take a side step.  The star of the day was the frito pie.  I will never forget them and nachos now also take a side step.  Saucy brisket with mounds of cheese atop crunchy fritos.  Top with a heavy hand of cojito cheese and you have reached the pinnacle of indulgence If u can sit upstairs for some eaay tunes

Oh my, it happened!  I found my five star restaurant.  Food was scrumptious,  brisket, pulled pork and ribs.  Sides were fresh, especially the collards which make my own take a side step.  The star of the day was the frito pie.  I will never forget it and nachos now also take a side step.  Saucy brisket with mounds of cheese atop cruncy fritos.  Top with a heavy hand of cojito cheese and you have reached the pinnacle of indulgence If u can, go upstairs for some easy tunes and enjoy.

Three of us wanted some bbq food. We went to Lambert for it. When you first walk in you can smell the bbq and it smells  good.  You can order one, two and three pieces of meat with two sides, or a wedge salad. I had the Achiote & lime rubbed natural chicken and fennel crusted coriander crusted pork ribs. First the chicken was my favourite. The flavour was mind blowing. I wanted to order more chicken again. The chicken was moist. Highly recommend it. The ribs were ok. I could not taste the flavouring on the ribs. The Mac cheese was and collard greens were on point my fiends said. Overall,  it was a good place for bbq. When we left we realized that our clothes smelt like we were still there. The atmosphere was fun and inviting with music.

I went back to Lamberts with Matt B. on a recent trip to Austin. We went for Sunday brunch, not realizing that it was buffet only, at a cost of $40 a person. This was an unpleasant surprise, but we'd made a reservation and it was already 1:30 when we got there, so we decided to roll with it.The restaurant was nice, as was the service--in addition to the buffet options, we could also get a variety of made-to-order dishes from the kitchen, which were included in the price of the brunch. We concentrated on the buffet, though, as we were there to eat barbecue. We got meat from the butcher block, then loaded up on sides from the buffet.The barbecue wasn't as good as I remembered, unfortunately. The brisket was excellent--brown sugar and coffee-rubbed natural brisket, very tender and flavorful--and I also enjoyed the housemade jalapeño hot link. The coriander and maple-crusted Berkshire pork ribs, though, were tough and dry, a huge disappointment, especially for someone like Matt, who goes to barbecue joints for the ribs.The sides were solid. I liked the new potato salad, the chilled sweet corn salad, and the heirloom carrots and avocado. I also loved the habanero honey pineapple, sweet and tart with a heat that really lingered.For dessert, we ordered the berries and yogurt and a housemade cinnamon roll off the kitchen menu. The berries and yogurt were good, though it didn't come with pecan granola as advertised. The cinnamon roll was sweet and sticky and satisfying, finished with a gooey cream cheese glaze.I enjoyed this visit to Lamberts, but not so much that I'd go back again on another trip to Austin. The food was good, just not quite as good as I remembered.

A couple weeks ago, I took a four day trip to Texas with my family.  We decided to eat some good Texas barbecue while we were there, and we started with dinner at Lamberts.  Lamberts is fancy barbecue, so if you're looking for a down-home Southern feel, I would look elsewhere.  We knew going in, though, that this place was an upscale, cosmopolitan restaurant.  We had a fantastic dinner.  The setting was casually elegant, and the barbecue was still very much comfort food, hearty and delicious.I liked the cool decor and relaxed atmosphere.  We got a roomy booth for our party of five, and we felt right at home.  The service was great.  Our waiter was helpful and patient, and the food came out at a good pace.  There was one unfortunate event during our meal - one of the exposed pipes rained on us at the end of our meal.  We were lucky that we were done eating at that point.  Management came over to apologize (and assure us it was not toilet water), and we got our desserts comped.  The water was unpleasant, but they did handle the situation admirably well.  Anyway, that little mishap was not the defining moment of the meal.  Everything else was truly excellent.I drank red wine and a cocktail with my dinner, and both were very good.  I loved the Killer Bee's Knees, a drink with mezcal, tequila, honey syrup, and fresh lemon.  It was smooth and smokey with a little bite and a little sugar, just the kind of cocktail I like to sip on, with or without food.We ate everything family style, and this was both easy to do and highly enjoyable.  We kicked off our meal with a plate of jalapeño cornbread muffins with butter.  They were delicious, lightly hot and sweet and loaded with butter.  We ordered spicy deviled eggs and crispy wild boar ribs as appetizers, and these were great starters.  The deviled eggs gave creaminess and a supple chew, with smoked paprika and a salty burst of American caviar on top.  The middle of the plate held a medley of olives, cornichons, caperberries, jalapeño, and pickled pearl onions to perk up each bite.  The boar ribs were delectable, smeared sticky with a glaze of honey and sambal.  They were tender and meaty with a lot of bold flavor.  The ribs came in a pile, served with blue cheese in a crumble and a sauce, with a celery and daikon slaw to lighten things up.  They were a definite highlight of the meal.But the real fun came in the straight barbecue portion of our dinner, when we got all the meats and sauces and a la carte sides.  We ordered the natural Black Angus brisket, the housemade jalapeño hot links, the half local chicken, and the Niman Ranch ribeye.  There were no duds in this spread.  The brisket was tender with a nice crust, rubbed in brown sugar and coffee.  The hot links had a great snap and a deep, gratifying smokiness.  I wasn't excited about the chicken, but it was moist and flavorful, with a pleasant achiote and lime rub.  The best dish of the night, though, was the mustard and brown sugar crusted ribeye, served with a whole roasted garlic bulb.  That was one of the best steaks I've had in recent memory, a perfect tender medium rare that spilled flavor with every easy chew.  The sweet and pungent cloves of soft garlic did nothing to hurt its case.We enjoyed our meats with Lamberts' trio of housemade sauces, a traditional barbecue, a mustard with ketchup and jalapeño, and a hot sauce made with habanero and red jalapeño.  I couldn't pick a favorite, so I used them all.  For our sides, we had the baked mac and three cheeses, the fried okra with spicy remoulade, and the sautéed lemon spinach.  The mac and cheese was particularly impressive.  Lamberts has a good recipe, one I wish they would share with restaurants closer to home.  The noodles were cooked firm, and the gooey cheese was full of flavor.  The okra and spinach were nice vegetable sides, but not really essential to the meal.For dessert, we had red plum fried pie, warm ricotta cheesecake, and fancy banana pudding.  Dessert was not the high point of the meal, but it was still very good.  The plum fried pie was warm and tart, with a heavy turnover crust dusted with powdered sugar.  It was served with candied corn kernels and fresh slices of plum, along with a summer corn ice cream, supposedly.  If there was ice cream on that plate, it was the melted sweet sauce on the side, and I don't mean that in a disparaging way - I just think the kitchen left out that component.  The pie was still good, but I missed the ice cream.  The cheesecake in a glass was a better dessert, with a honey pine nut crust and a topping of local peach preserves.  Not too sweet, with a great spoonable texture.  My favorite, though, was the banana pudding with Nilla wafers, caramelized Krispies, and cashew cream.  It was sweet and creamy and loaded with banana.I loved all the barbecue we ate in Austin, and though I'd recommend Lamberts behind Salt Lick and Franklin's, it was perfect for upscale barbecue.  I would love to eat here again.

Absolutely love love LOVE this place! The food is always amazing and HH menu is amazing too. 4 stars for today was due to the extremely loud music from upstairs that made it difficult to hear others. As well as our waiter (probably not intentional) seemed very disconnected/disengaged to our party. Other than that still amazing!

I was looking forward to top-notch Texas-style bbq, and was a bit let down by the food at Lambert's.  The first two brisket pieces were dried out, and were hard, with little smoked flavor.  Finally, on the third piece, we found one that was moist, tender, and had decent flavor, if not much smoked aroma.  The ribs were much better!The first serving of corn bread mini-muffins weren't warm, and seemed like they might have been made the day before.  We asked for seconds, and the next set of corn bread was hot out of the oven, with a great taste.  Overall, the restaurant had a cool, upscale vibe, but the inconsistent food quality left us feeling disappointed for the price, which is about double of the smaller places.

Lamberts Downtown BBQ is a great spot for good Texas BBQ in an environment that marries Texas with ATX. Here's what's to love:1) Food: They have all kinds of meats and sides and it all is good. You can pick one or two meats and get 2-3 sides. For sides, I recommend the baked mac and cheese or waffle fries. I ordered the beef sandwich with baked mac and cheese and it was very tasty. The BBQ on the table helps bring out the flavors too. My bill was just $20 after a generous tip for lunch.2) Environment: There's plenty of seating from tables to booths. It's a great spot for a work lunch or dinner too. They can accommodate groups.3) Service: It's friendly without being pushy and they are fast! If you go for lunch during the week, you can be in and out in less than 45 minutes total.If you like BBQ, stop by Lamberts. It's among the best in ATX!

This was not good. I'm from Memphis and I know the best BBQ. 1 rib bone for $17???? Seriously!?!?INSANE!!!ProsThe only thing good here was the fries. ConsThe BBQ sauce was 57 steak sauce.Tasteless tough meatNasty beansNo sweet teaWe were so disappointed and in shock. The waiter was nice but it took forever to get water, to even place our order and it took forever to get 1 rib bone and some brisket... Why...I've eaten BBQ all over the US, Memphis, Virginia, Seattle, Dallas, Houston, Maryland, NYC... you get at least 4 bones or half slab with fries and baking beans. 1 bone for $17???!!!! Needless to say I don't recommend this place and won't be back.

We just ate at Lamberts in downtown Austin, what a complete let down! I order 2 links which came on side plates that were so small you couldn't even cut the darn link & I had to ask for BBQ sauce for them. They have the absolute WORST BBQ sauce I have ever tasted, they didn't even try. My husband had the ribs, they were so burnt the sauce didn't make it & they didn't bring additional sauce to get the ribs down. We were hoping to have a great BBQ experience in Austin but it didn't happen. We also ordered a $60 bottle of Chardonnay that sucked! Save you time, money & taste buds! Go somewhere else!

Boar ribs are like the perfect lovechild of chicken wings, a rack of ribs, and riblets. They're absolutely, stickily delicious; get them!Not your traditional BBQ joint, it's a much different experience to Terry Blacks or Coopers or Franklin. It's a sit-down meal style BBQ, and their brisket is top-notch Texas awesomeness, and their cocktails rock too. No idea why it took us so long to try this place out.I haven't explored all the sides yet. We got the broccoli which was a total "meh", which is a shame because it promised roasted broccoli with garlic, and whilst it may have made its way to an oven, it felt more like steamed or boiled broccoli with the afterthought of garlic. But there's still 4 stars because the server, the meat, the super interesting flavors and very clean setting, cannot be overshadowed. Will definitely be back here.Oh yeh, the fried green tomatoes with a ton of crab on the top. NOM. Go for that and you won't be disappointed.

This place is great, located downtown and a cool bar club upstairs. We tried most of the menu (large group) there were no complaints, quite the opposite, food was stellar. Our server not only knew the menu to the smallest details, he had almost a writers description with such detail and compassion.Try it, you will love it. Ok

Arriving at 9:30 PM, there was zero wait but as a party of one, the hostess suggested that I would be better off at the bar. So I took the end seat of the bar and actually had a grand time. Much better than if I was just chilling at a table by myself!I got the spicy deviled eggs to start. This is a big portion with five halved eggs and a pile of rather spicy pickles to go with. Delicious.My main course arrived. I had the one meat platter. Brisket with collard greens and cole slaw. The brisket was absurd. It was almost too good. Perfect flavor, excellent texture, just the right tenderness that no knife was needed. And while the bartender did line up their three bottles of sauces (house, mustard and hot), none of them were at all needed for this tasty meat.The seat at the bar was great and they do have a special bar menu. My eggs and platter of brisket was $30. A real bargain.Five stars for Lamberts![Review 10180 overall, 1766 of 2018.]

THE service: impeccable. Brie is so friendly and attentive that I feel like she's my caring sister! Dining for one, she made me feel right at home. Her recommendations were spot on. She stopped by frequently to make sure I was happy. She's the best I've met in recent years.THE steak - Mustard and brown sugar crusted USDA prime ribeye with whole roasted garlic bulb: ORGASMIC! Brie said it's the one thing that shouldn't be skipped in this restaurant. And I totally agree with her. That crust, so so good, so well seasoned and flavorful. The garlic bulb was roasted to perfection that you can squeeze it out and spread it like butter. Yup, Brie said spread it all over the ribeye. This was the first time i finished the whole garlic bulb in one seating. It perfectly complimented the ribeye. Steak was awesome on it own, or with a dab of the hot and mustard sauce. I never had ribeye in the states this good. Salivating now!The brisket: Brie gave me a few complimentary  slices of brisket to try it out since it's my first time in town to have a taste of Texas BBQ. (Did I say I love Brie??? I love Brie!) Brie did recommended the pull pork over the brisket though. I should have listened to her. Brisket a little dry. And after I tasted the ribeye, nothing else really matters.The salad - Classic iceberg wedge: only me so I asked for half size. Came out in just right portion for me but looked so cute in a tiny plate, made me laugh. Not a lot of real estate to maneuver but the taste was spot on and very yummy. Bacon was so good and added a nice crunchy texture.Overall, my best meal in town. I think I'll be dreaming about the ribeye tonight.

Teetering between a 4 & 5. Fantastic dinner and superb service, with only a couple things that could've made it 100% perfect. PROS:Service was A+++ (we were 30 mins early and they still sat us, gave us the best seats in the house - upstairs corner booth) and the wait staff was extremely friendly and helpfulLive music on Sunday night was fantastic, soft jazz just the way we like itDRINKS - Some of the best cocktails we ever had (I could drink that Still Austin 75 all day every day, and I don't even like gin)Overall delicious foodOverall ambianceCheesecake came out for Dad's bday - it was fantastic. They didn't sing happy birthday which is a huge proCONS:**These are almost all really specific and relate to personal preference**As someone who isn't big on spicy foods, the menu variety was a letdown. Almost every item had an element of spice from medium to very hot, so I had to get a lot of things on the sideWhole Black Angus Short Rib was delicious, but at $47 it wasn't really worth it as more than half my bites were ALL fat, which just isn't my thing (but seasoning and char was fantastic)Mom's hanger steak was ordered medium and came out medium-well. She didn't mind so she didn't bother to tell the waitress.Mashed Potatoes was almost all cheese & sour cream. Though those are delicious, it's not what you want out of a bite of mashed potatoes.Baked Beans were overly sweet, which isn't my jam, but they were still really good.So even my cons are kind of pros... oh well.If you want a very full tummy and 1-2 good drinks, expect to spend about $70 pp - that's pricey for some folks, but it was downtown and IMO it was worth every penny. All 4 of us left extremely happy.

We stumbled upon this fancy bbq joint while we were in Austin on our way to the ACL music festival and I'm so glad we decided to give it a try.On our first visit, we sat at the bar downstairs where their bartender Nick whipped up some of the best cocktails I've ever tasted. He was polite, professional, and an expert at his craft. He even noticed I was eyeing up one of the amber ale beers on tap that I had never heard of before, Bells, and he was gracious enough to let me try a taste of it for free before ordering the whole glass myself. It's because of his great service that we decided to visit this location again on the final day of the ACL festival. Unfortunately, Nick wasn't working that day so we decided to sit at the bar upstairs instead where we still received wonderful prompt service as we enjoyed the live entertainment that was performing upstairs as well.Thank you Lambert's for having amazing staff who provide impeccable service to out of towners like myself. We truly appreciate it!!

My favorite meal on my trip to Austin was at Lambert's.  I went for brunch. Brunch started off with spicy deviled eggs, which were delicious.  For my meal i ordered the BBQ breakfast platter and asked the bartender for a rum based cocktail. She came back with a peach rum daiquiri that was perfect! My meal consisted of brisket, sunny side eggs, toast,  and home fries. Each item was cooked to perfection. The brisket was especially awesome. I cleaned my plate. Probably would have licked the bbq sauce off my plate if i could be sure nobody was watching. But you get more than a great meal and great service at Lambert's.  You get a live band too! So i got to listen to good music while i enjoyed my meal. What more can u ask for?Glad to have found a 5 star restaurant in Austin.

I have been meaning to make the pit stop at the famous Lambert's Downtown BBQ restaurant for years and I guess that time had finally come.Upon arrival on a late Thursday, the place was dead, which was odd as it was 6:30 at night, so I figured it would be a tad more busy for how popular the place is. Either way, I took a seat at the bar, which was nice, but not very spacious. Since this was more of a snack based on a full meal, I had only had the appetite to try a sample of a few dishes. Their menu is quite simple and laid out in a way where making a decision is not to difficult. I ended up with a sample of brisket, collard greens, waffle fries, and a glass of divine Cava. Again, touching on the fact that no one was really in the restaurant, my food took awhile to arrive, which was odd. When it did, it was very disappointing, especially for the price I had paid. The serving portions were small, and lackluster. The brisket was very dry and pretty tough to chew on, and when you are in brisket country and lack the ability to serve quality brisket, it is a true shame. The collard greens were alright, but a little bland and last but not least the waffle fries, which may of saved the meal. As for the Cava...I may of grabbed another glass as it was quite good and somehow got happy hour pricing on it, so two thumbs up there.While Lamberts is an institution in downtown Austin, I just did not understand the hype as my experience easily landed in a two star category. Maybe next time?

Food: I had the Cuban sandwich that was very good. It came out piping hot and the meats complimented each other well. The Mac and cheese that I ordered as a side was also really great.Staff: very polite and quick to give recommendations or answer questions. Will definitely be back.

While on vacation, my son and myself searched Yelp for the best bbq in Austin. There were a few strong contenders. The biggest qualifications we were looking for were: distance from our hotel and star rating. This led us to Lambert's Downtown. Prominently on a corner in the heart of the city, blues music from a local musician was blaring. It was loud in there, and my son was the only person under the age of 21 in the place. He didn't care. When we went to ask for a table, we were told it was an hour wait. But, at the bar it's first come - first serve, and a couple was just leaving. We jumped at their seats! My son ordered the half bird. It was cooked to perfection and the bartender suggested some of their house mustard which was a little bit spicy but perfect with the chicken my son ordered. My son agreed and gobbled up every bit he could. I had the pulled pork and I have never had anything so moist and tender in my life. It was soaked in their bbq sauce, but it was not overwhelmingly present. There IS a bit of spice to their sauce, much more than expected, but well worth it for the taste. For the sides, we had brussel sprouts covered in bacon. That was some darn good veggies. Also, the Mac and 3 cheese. It came out looking like a microwaved cheese bowl with burnt crust on top...but it was mouthwateringly delicious. Highly recommended. The atmosphere was great, a classic decor with a modern clientele. It was packed and I didn't venture upstairs to see the band playing, but great music was present throughout.
Austin, TX 78723

Wonderful restaurant and excellent customer service.  The woman who answered the phone was very polite and thoroughly went through the entire menu so I could make an informed decision.  I ended up ordering the smothered oxtail and was blown away.  The portion is very filling and a great value! I was also impressed with their COVID protocols - the place was spotless and everyone was wearing masks.  There is also plenty of parking.  Definitely worth driving by for a full and delicious plate of food!

First time at Fowler's. I work in the area and my husband and I were craving BBQ. Plenty of parking, the place was super clean. Sanitizer station, all staff wearing masks. There was a plastic tarp between the cashier & us. Tables were distanced. COVID wise they nailed it. The man & woman behind the counter were so sweet! We were staring at the menu and the man called us over and walked through it with us. Of course, my husband could not decide so went with the 3 meat plate (brisket, sausage, and ribs) with Mac n cheese and collared greens on the side. The cashier was super friendly, quick, and offered us the month's menu. They offer specials on specific days of the week (can't wait to go back for the meatloaf!).They had some football on while we ate. Everything was DELICIOUS! The sausage in particular got me, I had to fight over it with my husband. I always hold a place in high regard when they can get their Mac n cheese that good. While I would always say add more cheese, this Mac n cheese definitely had me going for more. Everyone was so sweet! Service was amazing! Highly recommend trying it out and going back again and again. (We ate it too fast to take a pic, sorry!)
Thank you both for giving us a try, we look forward to seeing you all again real soon!  Always remember, the first ingredient is LOVE!

This best BBQ... I've had in the last five plus years.I order a 3 meat plate with collard greens and potato salad and I informed my friend who pickup the food for me, on my next trip to Austin, I need a hotel close by .Thank you and God Bless .Stay safe.
Thank you for the great review!  The first ingredient is LOVE!

Well now. We just had our first of what is sure to be many meals from Fowler's. It was Fried Friday and we had the catfish.  From the first bite I knew that I'd found my new favorite. It was delicious! It was seasoned so perfectly that it didn't need any hot sauce, tarter sauce, or anything else. And the sides were just like home (okay, better - don't tell Mama!) The pound cake was delicious too. And the owners were friendly and treated us like family. Like they say - and it's clearly true - love is the main ingredient in everything they do. I don't have any photos because we ate every last bite. We'll be back soon! Thank you Kevin and Von - "Kevvon".
Hey Brian! You are now officially family! Thank you so much for your wonderful heartfelt expressions, we look forward to seeing you both soon! KevVon

Fowler's is built for families. Their dining space is no-nonsense, and when you bite into that first juicy & tender pork rib, you can taste the love that has gone into it.Their ordering process is nice and simple. We walked in on a Saturday to order a couple 2-Meat combos to-go, and were in and out within 10 minutes. The daily specials and sides are displayed on a chalkboard by the cafeteria counter, but they also post their specials on Instagram (I still need to try their smothered oxtail). The owners are extremely nice, and they are serious about their food! As I mentioned earlier, the pork ribs were perfect and we enjoyed every bite. But in a plot twist, it was the sausage that blew our minds. We order sausage at every BBQ place we visit, and somehow the sausage here is head and shoulders above the rest in melt-in-your-mouth tenderness. I don't know how they do that. Fowler's is definitely worth consideration in your regular restaurant rotation, especially if you live close by in the Mueller & East Austin areas.
Wow! Thank you Olivia for your wonderful review!  Our first ingredient in all our recipes is LOVE! Please come and see us again soon!
Austin, TX 78723

I'm going to be honest, I haven't even left the restaurant yet and I already have to tell someone about this place. The staff is all so sweet and always wants to make sure you're doing well and everything tastes great. The food, well it's up there with some of the best soul food I've ever had. The brisket is super juicy, the collard greens are the best I've ever had, Mac & cheese is absolutely perfect. The special of the day was smothered turkey wings over rice. 10/10 would definitely recommend you get that. Proud to be supporting such a fantastic black owned business today! We will definitely be back!
Thank you for such a wonderful review! It’s important to us as a family that our service is love-felt! Your support is greatly appreciated!

We ordered our Thanksgiving dinner from them since we were staying home for the holiday and didn't want to cook. We learned on the day we were supposed to pick everything up that they had had a hiccup in their production process and we wouldn't be able to pick it up that day. They were very apologetic and offered to drop it off to our house as soon as everything was ready. On top of delivering it, they also ended up giving us extra food. Everything was delicious and we were just really impressed with how they handled the situation. We will be ordering from them again. Thank you!

This place is legit! Family owned, clean, down home soul food. Everything we ordered was tasty and fresh. Hopefully next time we'll make it in time to try the peach cobbler. We will definitely be back!
Thank you Trevor! We appreciate your support and your wonderful review!  Hope yo see you soon!

I have passed this place so many times without even knowing it was there. It can be hard to miss but should be one of your go to places. The BBQ is incredible and more affordable than the others in town. I chowed down on a large plate of gumbo that literally blessed my soul. According to staff, the cook puts a whole chicken in the pot!! What bring some extra love into this place is the fact that it is family owned and run. You will see Yvonne up front and her family helping out also. This is the only place I know where Kool-aid is a beverage option and it was just what the body wanted. Sundays are apparently the best time to eat there as they their sides double and they have special menus. This might be my new favorite place!
Thank you Tope!!!! We pray you and your friends join us again soon!

Small family owned bbq, 2nd time here and wanted to give a shout out so they stay in business. Had the bbq last time (chicken and ribs) yummy!!!This time we came on a Friday and was able to get the fried fish and my girl got the pork chop. Owner was so sweet he handed out flowers for the ladies since it was valentine day.  Those reading stop on by and give them a try. The business sign is a little small so look for it carefully.

What an original place, in a different space than restaurants are usually in.  The sign was very colorful but hard to read from the street, so we passed it first.  Plenty of parking and lots of space inside.  Super friendly service.  We were greeted by the door and explained how everything works.  It was Sunday, so they had several extra side selctions.  We got two meat plate and two sides plus extra side.  Chicken was amazing, super smoked.  It's been a while since I ate such smoke flavor, it was awesome.  Brisket was also smoked and tasty, but a little but too much fat to suit my taste.  Mac and cheese was great flavor but bearly warm, and collard greens and potatoes salad were fine.  The atmosphere is very informal, plastic plates and plastic ware being used.  I will definitely return and that smoked chicken would be my go to dish.
Austin, TX 78723

I tried Fowler's for the first time today and it was delicious. I had driven past it many times as I live in the neighborhood, but had no idea it was a restaurant (I thought it was a catering company).I called in my order over the phone and came to pick it up. My first impression is that it's a very easy restaurant to access with ample parking. Walking through the doors, the smells are amazing and it's very clean. They've taken restrictions with covid with everyone social distancing and clear tarp around the food and checkout station. Everyone was wearing a mask. The BBQ: I got pork ribs and brisket. The pork ribs were tender and flavorful. The brisket was cooked well. The BBQ sauce tasted home-made. It was honestly the best sauce I've had. If it turns out to be store bought, I'll be shocked. The sides: I got the potato salad and Mac and Cheese. Both sides were a little bland in flavor. I'm not taking away any stars though because I put a bit of Cajun seasoning and they were SO good. It was probably personal preference to want them to have a little something extra. The potato salad is egg and mustard based I think and quite tangy. The service was really good. The guy behind the counter was really friendly and patient with me on the phone repeating items when I asked. They serve different specials on the weekends and have a mixture of bbq and fried foods. The prices were reasonable as well. For a two meat, two side dish it was $14.95 and enough food for two meals or two people.
Thank you Caroline for your wonderful review. We hope yo see you again soon!

After a nice sermon and feeling spiritually connected, with decided to try this place and get some real southern soul food-we were not disappointed the staff was very friendly (a cuz)and welcoming. We ordered two combo specials to meet I have the sausage and ribs and my dining companion had the sausage with brisket both were excellent,tender and very flavorful. They offered a selection of sides collard greens,black-eyed pea's ,cabbage and mac & cheese. The portions were great and the food was delicious. Will have to come back and try some of that more of this great food.
Thank you very much for giving us a try! Please come back soon!
You will not be disappointed. This restaurant is home-y and so is the food. The food reminds me of home! I will always return here.
Thank you so much Brittany, we look forward to your next visit!

If you're looking for some REAL FOOD FOR THE SOUL, you found it. Super delicious, satisfying and beautiful people serving it. This is a family owned business and you can tell it was made with love because it tasted like an amazing home cooked meal. We are visiting from Cali and wanted to support a black owned business and came across Fowler's.I'm so glad we did, because we had a great experience overall. The family was not only friendly but super attentive. Highly recommend this place
Thank you for your kind words!! It was great meeting you and we hope to see you again soon!
Best barbecue around.  Our brisket and smoked chicken were wonderful, but the collard greens were the best thing on the plate!;)
Austin, TX 78723

Fowler's Smokin Soul Food. Got the wing lunch and side of 6 shrimp with fries! DELICIOUSNESS all on the tongue. Great working lunch. I ask buddy at the register if they season their fries and he gave me the crazy eye and said of course we do (THE EXACT CORRECT RESPONSE I WAS LOOKING FOR FYI) Customer Service is second to none. Same guy called people by their name as the came in and ask about their babies and grand babies. I was checked on frequently but not annoyingly. Only complaint is that the shrimp stayed in the frier a little too long but the flavor made up for it. I overall enjoyed my entire meal with my cup of Kookaid of course Thank you Smokin Fowler's for a great experience.
Thank you for your wonderful review! Your concern about the shrimp will be shared!  We hope to see you soon to get that other star!!

If you haven't been to Fowler's Smokin Soul Food yet you're missing out on some amazing eats. Delicious food in a friendly, clean and spacious restaurant. Open Fri/Sat/Sunday. On 5811 Manor between Wheless and Rogge, plenty of parking in their lot.Today we both got the combo plates with tender and moist Brisket, meaty Ribs and juicy beef sausage. Menu varies slightly from Friday to Sunday and it's posted in advance on their website and their Facebook. Check out Fowler's Smokin Soul Food this weekend!
Thank you for dining with us!!! We hope you come back soon!
Delicious food, in the neighborhood, local spot - winning combo! Especially like the ribs, sausage and collard greens.
Thank you Cory for the great review! We hope you come back soon!

Really great owners and staff. Swung by the first time when they first opened to pick up Chicken and Dumplings, mac & cheese, yams, and bread pudding. Got home and dug in... so good! So pumped to have something so good in my neighborhood. Everyone there is super nice I pick food up at least once a week. I'm grateful to have a neighborhood restaurant that serves real homemade food.

I went here for a private event and the food was so good I returned! The ribs are excellent! I tried the sausage and the turkey leg also and they're good. I was also impressed with the sides: the green beans are wonderful! The only let down was the peach cobbler. It tasted like they used croissant dough... it's a no! But you owe it to yourself to try their smoked meats. I'll be back!
Thank you, hope to see you again!
Austin, TX 78723

This might be a place for you to try if you're looking for a change from the long lines and Austin BBQ frills. It's much more soul food oriented than your average Austin BBQ place. They were so nice and inviting. They even told me about weekly specials that they post on their Facebook page. The best part for me and what drew me in was the price! Their prices are about half that of any one of the recognizable touristy Austin BBQ joints. I will say that it can be a little harder to find than some of the others if you don't know that it's there. It took me around 7 months of driving by it to noice the building.
Thank you for your wonderful review! We are consciously working on better signage and hope to see you again soon!

Wonderful and hospitable staff/management/ownership. Chicken and dumplings and fried pork chop are to die for along with all the amazing sides. Still need to try the BBQ but I am just so blessed Austin has this place!

This is the real deal!!  Brisket, sausage, chicken wings, mac n' cheese...and the list goes on! All served hot and fresh! Portion size, lets say you get enough for two meals just on one plate. Come one, come all!!Get some Fowlers Smokin Soul Food!!
Thank you, we hope you come and dine with us again soon!

Fowler's is an all around great experience! Parking is easy, the building is very clean, and the staff is the friendliest in town. And of course the food is what keeps you coming back... I had the smothered pork chops with greens and Mac n cheese, everything was perfect. I can not recommend this place enough, you have to try it!
Thanks bunches Daniel for the awesome review!  Hope to see you soon!

Great service from a new local business!  Ribs are delicious, smoked chicken was ok and I got a healthy portion of the sausage....which made an awesome sandwich.  The BBQ SAUCE!!!!!  Unique and divine  They are only open Th-Sun. They didn't have souls food choices this Saturday because the entire place (which is huge) was being rented out for a birthday party.  But they post the soul food menu on their Facebook page days in advance (super smart!). I will be back!
Thank you so much!! Come back soon!

Stopped by on a Friday afternoon with no line!This food truck offers a small menu packed with flavor. Make sure to get the extra spicy sauce to get that extra kick. In addition, make sure to pick up handfuls of napkins for the mess you will create! * No minimum order required

Best BBQ in Texas. Yes, a bold statement, I realize. But it really is that good. I promise. They're open during this crazy COVID-19 and everything is socially distant friendly and packaged perfectly for to-go. I love eating their food most with a little buzz on at 2am after catching a show, but whatcha gonna do! They're still here and still the best.

We love this place..    The Brisket , pork Belly and sandwiches rule .    They have four different sauces . I like the ladybird best  Since we are  Covidian Age you can grab food to go  or sit  in the lot .  The coleslaw and smoked mac n Cheese are the bomb.   Definitely worth checking out this un assuming food truck . Today one of the employees let us try tHat pork belly  .   MEAT CANDY !

When ever is an Austin foodtruck ever bad when it has lasted beyond a few months? The people speak loud and Rollin Smoke is rollin some good flavor!Burnt Ends are my fave here and I get them every time they are available. I can't suggest anything in particular as it is a stalemate across the board!An East Austin foodtruck owning its spot! Thanks guys and I look forward to more!

I ordered one brisket taco and one pork belly taco. At $6 each they were some of the more expensive tacos I've had, and while they certainly weren't the best, they were both solid.The thin, single slice of brisket was moist, flavorful and had a nice buttery fat cap. That said, I feel like $6 should include either two thin slices or one thick slice of brisket. As it stands, I wouldn't order this one again.The pork belly was too saucy for my liking, but the meat itself was fantastic and my favorite of the two.I don't live close, so I probably won't make a special trip back, but Rollin' Smoke is absolutely worth trying if you're in the immediate area.

I'm of the strong opinion that every single barbecue pit or truck claiming to specialize in brisket in Texas, or anywhere for that matter, should have the option to put that brisket in tacos. We're here for this fusion if you can even call it that, and Rollin Smoke delivers on the concept. Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?Cool people in a cool little truck. I called in an order later in the day, and while Rollin Smoke was running a bit low on supplies, they were able to put together some brisket and pulled pork tacos for me. Star. Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?$5.00 for a brisket taco is perfect, especially if, as was the case here, they're filling the thing up with what seemed to be at least a quarter pound of brisket or pulled pork. Star. Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?These were good tacos both brisket and pulled pork. I'm a brisket purist at heart, and the flavor here was good in addition to the crust that delivered a particular satisfying crunch when dished up in taco form. My only gripe here if you can call it that is that the tortilla was on the weak side and I could have used with some sort of peripherals in the mix be that peppers or onions or something of the like just to make it something more than brisket and a bit of sauce wrapped in a tortilla. Single Star. Star 5: Would you be excited to go back?Definitely. Rollin Smoke delivers. Star.

We found this BBQ joint through Yelp and glad we went! We ordered the tacos (brisket, sausages and pulled pork). The meat was well seasoned and very flavorful. The guy even asked if it was our first time visiting and brought us a side of Mac and cheese and ends of the pork belly. The pork belly was fatty and sweet and savory.

Stalking these guys on IG is a hobby at this point...There Q is dam good, but they have a little something going down on Sundays....Little mini Barbacoa Crispy Tacos....We have been on a Birria Taco hunt for a few weeks, and truly these do fall into the same category for us....just missing the Consome...(Hint, Hint)....Tender Beef Check, Cheese, Cilantro and Onions...all fried up on the griddle to make them fire hot and crispy....Now one just cant hit Rollin Smoke with out getting some BBQ....Couple slices of Brisket, Sausage link and some killer Smoked Mac and Cheese and we were finished. Solid visit for sure!!
Thanks so much we have done lamb birria before but it is a little bit too much work on top of the load we’re carrying right now with just two of us. Maybe in the future! Definitely in the future.

I really thought I did this review, but evidently I didn't....and I feel bad for that...This place is Banging Good!!!....My draw to the Rollin Smoke was all the Amazing pictures of the Trays of food posted every where...Now they have there standard menu, and the trays aren't listed....Yet everything is available al cart....Just list off what you looking to get and they will custom build you a feast....Our tray included a sausage link, pulled pork, Pork Belly burnt ends, Brisket tamales, Brisket, Smoked Mac-n-Cheese and Spicy Slaw....There wasn't a single thing we didn't like...The pork belly was the best (only have tried a few) that I have eaten....very meaty....Both sauces were great....The whole visit was outstanding, even if they forgot our Banana Pudding...but thats all good....the site of that tray was very distracting....we cant wait to get back, as they were out of a few menu items...very, very good Craft BBQ.

This was the best BBQ food I've ever had! I'm from California and came to Austin to visit for a couple of days and a BBQ place that we were going to go originally required you to order a large amount of brisket. Since it was just me and another friend, we didn't need to order that much, so we just randomly looked up other close by BBQ places and this one popped up.  We had the brisket and pulled pork sandwich's. Banana pudding and Mac n cheese. All were amazing and literally melted in my mouth. I don't think I'll be able to enjoy BBQ food here in Cali after this. Can't wait until I go back to Austin one day just so I can enjoy this food again.
Sooooo good, I love their brisket!! Also they're listening to dope music every time I've been there (:

Food trucks in ATX are so pricey you'll GO BROKEBut all the progressives wanna live here cuz they're SO WOKEAnd the BBQ in Texas is so good, it's NO JOKEAnd if you want the best in Austin, go to ROLLIN SMOKE!They'll tell you that it's bad for you, well guess what, SO'S COKEAnd eating Subway's as healthy as Superman with NO CLOAKAnd no matter what you eat, you must watch out you DON'T CHOKESo f**k it, just try the best truck BBQ at ROLLIN SMOKE!WHATLet me start by saying I find the vast majority of food trucks to be overrated and the vast majority of BBQ to be overrated, so I was not expecting much, and it wildly surpassed any hopes I may ever have held. Bravo.We were extremely impressed by this wonderful BBQ truck. It's not cheap, but it has a lot going for it. For example, they are extremely friendly. Then there's the size of the sandwich, which is very generous.Then there's the smoky, amazing, juicy flavor, the perfect ingredients which don't taste remotely cheap (which is good, since the sandwich isn't), and the excellent BBQ sauce, none of which we were expecting, because it's food truck food, and honestly my experiences with food truck food in Austin aren't amazing, despite it being one of the food truck capitals of the world, along with maybe Portland Oregon and a few other places.So despite the mid-to-high prices - by Food Truck standards - the sandwich is well worth your money, and packed full of expertly-made, perfectly-seasoned, expensive/fancy-tasting, and more importantly, utterly delicious BBQ meat. I'm not even into meat that much anymore, but I make exceptions when something tastes this good.When you consider how good (and generous) the sandwich is, then the price is actually a steal. This is definitely one of the best five food trucks I've tried in Austin, and it almost makes all the bad ones I tried worthwhile just to have found this one. I'd say Boteco, Sonora Hot Dogs, Hi Tea (now closed), and I can't think of another one I really loved, so those are my fave 4 then.So for sure, we will most definitely be back here in future.Plus they're owned by Henry Rollins and Smokey Robinson (and a bandit), so that just makes them more awesome.It's good that they're always in the same place, which allows us to easily pin down their location at any given time. Which is known as a "Rollin Pin."
This place has an absolute delicious brisket Sammy. The Mac and cheese is solid. Good truck producing solid bbq in Austin. Glad we chose this place over Franklins.

I got my bbq here on a Sunday morning and I have to say it's probably the type of place I'd imagine to fit right in on sixth street after a long night. That said they're definitely among the best value out of all the BBQ places I've been to if you're into sandwiches. The Playboy sandwich has all their greatest hits on a bun and it's a hefty lunch that let's you sample everything you'd want from a BBQ joint. The brisket is on the smokier side compared to other places I've been to but it's perfectly tender and moist, although I feel it could use a tad more salt. The pulled pork is juicy and a blast of porcine flavor that pairs well with the BBQ sauce, though of the three meats that make up the sandwich, I think it's the most meh. The sausage has good snap and some serious kick that I was not expecting.Throw all of that on a soft squishy bun with some pickles and onions and extra sauce on the side and you're good to go...for a nap.
Awesome Food and friendly staff! Pulled pork tacos and banana pudding were great! Come early on Sunday because it's a popular place

My husband and I recently ate at Rolling Smoke BBQ and loved it! The brisket was tender, juicy and delicious! The coleslaw is made to order and very fresh without being heavy with mayo like some can be. The service was good and the guys were friendly and attentive. We'd go back again

Y'all steered me toward this particular get up, out of all the Q joints in Austin. I have to say, I was a bit surprised by appearances. I turned the corner, saw a couple of closed buildings, and parked in a parking lot to figure out where Rollin' Smoke was. Turns out I was in their parking lot. It's a tiny food truck next to a couple other food trucks, with a smoker in the back banging out the best brisket in town. When I showed up, they had no brisket up front, but they were about to take one out of the smoker. The cook went right out, grabbed the meat, and made me a fresh hot sandwich to go. Service: plus. Food: pluuuus. That is some damn good brisket. It has just the right amount of chew before it falls apart in your mouth. I got one piece of fat to juice up a sandwich that was otherwise made of meat (and pickles and onions). I got the bourbon sauce, and it blended in well - can't say I noticed any flavor other than deep and smoky, but hey, that's what I wanted with my sammy. The spicy slaw is really good. If I had more room in my stomach, I would have done the mac n cheese, which sounded amazing. But I mean, fresh made slaw with fresh jalapenos and cabbage... never had better. So, thanks, y'all, for the pointers. I agree with you. This is the place for BBQ in Austin.
Just landed in Austin not even 30 min ago. My buddy sends me a meet up location. Rollin smoke baby! Nice little joint of 6th strTry the playboy tell them I sent ya!

Seriously the best BBQ I've had in my mouth! The pork belly burnt ends are spectacular, like melt in your mouth make you feel like you're sitting in heaven. The barbacoa tacos are so flavorful and tender. The smoked mac 'n' cheese is slap your Mama delicious. The spicy slaw is my new addiction, it's so damn good I dream about it. Do not get me started on the smoked pimento cheese, holy hell, they serve it with these seasoned saltines that are super addictive. This year we bought a smoked turkey from them and took it to our family gathering, everyone at the table (including my very picky 6 year old) had seconds and thirds, very well seasoned and deliciously smoky on the outside and insanely juicy on the inside, it will definitely be a new family tradition to have a Rollin Smoke turkey for the holidays.The service is friendly and the all around vibe of the location is awesome. You are totally missing out if you don't drop by and try them out, truly an Austin gem.
Handy place to stop off and refuel on a night out. Delicious brisket in both taco and sandwich form. Pickles and onions round it out.

1 star for bad customer service. We ordered 2 tacos and a burrito. I got the tacos, but we were still waiting for the burrito. I ask the guy that got my order if the burrito was still coming, he said "the Barbacoa one? Yes..?" He sounded unsure. So I wait another 15 minutes. My wife asks him again about the burrito, and he says "the one earlier? I only charged you for the 2 tacos." So why didn't he just tell us that instead of making us waste time.
Sorry y’all he’s very new and made a mistake. There a real shortage of help in this industry right now and we are doing our best but appreciate everyone’s patience as we attempt to continue to train.

Absolutely amazing. I just got the brisket sandwich and a side of the Mac and cheese and wow oh wow. Best bbq I've had in a long time. I honestly want to go back right now it's so good. I should've gotten more. Gosh darn not getting more was a mistake. Update:the owner sent me a thank you for this review already which makes this places even better. 6/5 stars!

I'm a sides girl. A barbecue spot is only as good as its sides. I biked past Rollin Smoke after dinner last week and peeked at the menu to see if they have mac and cheese. Sure enough they did, so I made a mental note of it for when I had more of an appetite. Next I checked Yelp, and found good reviews for their smoked mac and cheese, and knew I had to come back. That's just what I did today for lunch! I ordered just the mac and cheese which was more than enough for one serving. Sometime when I'm starving I'll come by to try some meat too. I wasn't sure how smoked mac and cheese would taste, but in retrospect that's exactly what it tasted like. It had a real depth of flavor and tricked my mind into seeming like I'd had a meal with meat because it's so used to associating that smoke flavor with meat. The texture and balance of ingredients were just right, and if I didn't say it outright already, the flavor was amazing! I'll be back for more!

The meat was so over cooked.  It had the texture of greasy baby food.  Mushy,soggy and soft.  BBQ is not supposed to be this way.Smoked Mac and cheese is really broke Mac and cheese.  This was poorly made food. Mac tastes bitter, like burnt plastic and not Smokey at all. Really upset I wasted my outdoor time on this place.Five star reviews must be friends of the owner. It happens in Austin, sadly.

I wrote a message offering to refund your money and apologize but I’m gonna recind that now. I was wondering how someone, in the middle of a pandemic, could write and act such a way when people are literally risking their lives to make you food? You don’t like the food I get it. Just say something and you would get a full refund. You want to pick out pieces of barbecue and set them in a pile to add to your ever-growing list of one star reviews? Go Ahead. It is comical to me the list of fine local establishments you’ve bashed on here and I am proud to be included in that list. Don’t come back here we don’t want your business. I rate you less than one star. You don’t deserve to eat out. Go make your own barbecue if you know so much about it.

If you are looking for bbq in Austin I recommend this place! The quality to every item is perfect from the smoke Mac n cheese to the pork ribs, brisket and my go top beef sausage! Picked veggies on the side all on point! Also had the spicy slaw it's crispy fresh and spicy just perfect! Love me some Rollin

Yikers, I really haven't left a review for Rollin Smoke, yet? How is that possible? I basically picked the apartment I'd live in Austin based on its proximity to Rollin Smoke. It may not have the panache of a Franklin's or La Barbeque, but I'd say it's just as good and there's like no line! I keep coming back for the large brisket sandwich for $11, and I can never finish it. Should I be getting the regular for $8? Probably, but I just won't learn and I'm ok with that.I just learned they sell by the pound, too, but strangely I was told $11 for 1/2 pound of brisket, but that the sandwich has a 1/2 pound of briskey on it, so I might as well get the sandwich right?

One word.. Bomb!!!The brisket was pit of this word! The green chile was amazing. Two young men  that helped us last night andrew and joe were super nice friendly giving us great customer service!Will definitely come back!!

New review: amazing  The first time I went my experience was just ok but this time was really good, I had the pulled pork sandwich (7$) and the banana pudding (3$). The sandwich was really good & they hooked me up with a lot of meat so definitely worth the 7 ...The banana pudding is good just really small .

Banana pudding : 3$ - worth every penny Pulled pork taco: 4$ - good flavor ! Reasoning for three stars: the Mac n cheese is the worst. I couldn't finish it I wasted 10$ (bought for a friend & I )  The noodles were really chewy & greenish looking and the flavor was really confusing but the nasty taste lead me to try the banana pudding & pulled pork in order to gather a full analysis of the place. (That's what I get for going to a bbq place for Mac n cheese) The worker was really nice & full of energy, just sad she recommended the Mac n cheese.
If this place had a website it would be the bomb.com. so good, brisket was 22 a pound which is fair. Love it

Got the brisket taco from this spot and tbh I wasn't overly impressed. The price was okay at $5, but the brisket was kinda dry unfortunately, there wasn't enough sauce to cover for it, and the flour tortilla didn't really hit the spot. It wasn't necessarily bad per se just didn't meet my expectations. Maybe we came at a bad time, and it might be better the next time I visit
