BBQ pulled pork sand which was good and was large, it had a lot of meat on it. Prices were reasonable as well. The mac n cheese was a little hard on the top, but it was good. The pork taco was delicious as well.

Everyone knows that when the drunchies (drunk munchies) hit, they hit hard. But even with that this place was not good. The brisket was so dry that it was was practically cracking and the bbq sauce wasn't doing much to save it. Maybe it was because it was so late at night and we received whatever was leftover after a long day but I was pretty disappointed. Sometimes it happens and the bread is able to make up for it... however... these buns weren't even toasted! The buns that were taken straight out of the packaging from HEB (I would've said Walmart but I've learned a couple of things after living in Austin for a semester). I'm a bit conflicted because this place was rated so highly and maybe it just happened to be a bad night.

Stopped by on a Sunday night for a late dinner. Ordered the playboy sandwich without a bun, and a side of their home made cole slaw.The pulled pork and chicken were deliciously juicy and flavorful, and the sauce offered a great combo.I really appreciated the handmade cole slaw. It was outstanding, with a nice blend of spice, cabbage, and bite. The real magic came with the brisket. I was given a plastic fork, and my initial thought was to ask for a knife. But lo and behold, this brisket was so tender that I was able to cut it with a plastic fork! Lord almighty.Did I mention the sausage was fabulous? Just enough hot spice and a snappy bite. Awesome!
Thanks so much for stopping by! This pic is great and thanks for adding it!

Found this place by looking for inexpensive great bbq...  and I was surprised how tasty it was!  I tried the sandwich with jalapeno sausage, pulled pork, and brisket...  awesome!!!  I splurged for the mac and cheese... just tasty to the max!  Ride a scooter over here and have you some bbq!

If you're in the mood for a BBQ sandwich with TASTE!!! This is it right here! The meat is seasoned well, the bread isn't dry, the BBQ sauce is good. Brisket Sandwich  for me. Husband ordered the Playboy Sandwich!!! Which he already has plans to order on another cheat day!

Rollin' Smoke has built a solid reputation in a loaded Austin BBQ scene, and one taste of their succulent brisket is more than enough to understand how they have achieved quite a bit in a relatively short period of time.  And yet, I may have preferred the excellent jalapeno cheese sausage which is to tell you that Rollin' Smoke falls right in line with Kerlin, Valentina's and Micklethwait as one of Austin's best places that doesn't have a ridiculous line of folks out the door.   Sure, I understand the love for La BBQ and Franklin, but Rollin' Smoke provides a quality product as well.   Check the menu as they have plenty of daily specials.  Just the other day, they had some pork belly tacos and given their ability with that sausage, I'm just going to assume it was excellent.  They are a bit lacking in the sides overall, but if you are looking for excellent meats, you won't be disappointed with this East Austin food truck.

This place was amazing. Everything had great flavor. The Mac and cheese was bomb. The brisket could be brisket flavored ice cream as it just melted in your mouth. Sausage was just spicy enough. The 4 kids all asked if we could just eat here during our vacation. Highly recommended!

Rollin Smoke BBQ, is the real deal, no ifs ands or buts, as good or better than anything you'll find. It takes a backseat to no one even the famous guy in town. I had some what of a sampler platter, brisket, pulled pork, sausage, mac & cheese and slaw. Nothing on the platter was close to average it was all outstanding. At home I enjoy smoking in my backyard, I got to speak to the owner Kyle and he was more than generous with advice I could use at home.Great service great food, what more can you ask for, nothing. My advice when in Austin and you want barbecue don't wait for hours in line head to Rollin Smoke BBQ.
Thank Dave was great meating you! Super glad you enjoyed it!!

Listen here....I get everyone goes crazy over Franklin's, but there was no way I was waiting in that line.  But this little gem right here.  Man let me tell you, this was some of the best brisket I ever had.  It literally melts in your mouth.....Shot out to the gentleman that served me, not sure if he was the owner or not, because there was two gentlemen working.  Anyways I was hanging out waiting for them to open when this tall guy with glasses comes out back, I kindly asked, "You're getting ready to open right?" He says "sure am in a few" he then asked what I was looking to get, I told him I just wanted a brisket sandwich, mega please.  He goes right in the truck and makes it for me, and they weren't even supposed to be open yet....Now that's customer service.  If you're in Austin, you gotta check them out.  5 stars from me.

Rollin Smoke is one of my favorite bbq spots. The meats are fantastic, the portions are generous, and the service is good. But what bothers me are the precautionary measures taken by one of their servers during the current pandemic. He deals with customers without a face mask. He cuts the meats without gloves. He doesn't seem to be concerned about social distancing. That's a deal-breaker. I have every intention to return to Rollin Smoke, because it offers the best damn brisket tacos in Austin. But I'll wait until the current pandemic subsides.

If you are visiting Austin you come for two things... The best BBQ on earth and a riot of a good time. When it comes to quick, but delectable eats look no further! This is a place of genuine people who care about their customer experience and gift every passer by with their smoked meats. If you don't get a sandwich with a side (Mac & cheese) you are doing yourself a disservice. Rolling Smoke maintains a highly respectful and geographically accurate profile that provides each guest with a true taste of Texan BBQ. Austin is barely still the hidden gem of the US, but this remains a hidden gem within Austin.

If you're looking for some BBQ late at night, you found yourself a great option with Rollin Smoke BBQ. There is parking lot behind where the food truck is, but note it is $10 for 2-hour parking. My friend and I just simply for a pound of brisket for market price ($22), and it was definitely one of the best briskets I had ever had. It was combination of juicy, fatty, and all the wonderful things that are derived from brisket. It was served with onions, pickles, BBQ sauces, and green salsa. The green salsa was like those salsas from street taco trucks, and as weirdly as this sounds, dip the brisket with the salsa. I had to ask for more salsa to dip it with! Next time, I will come back to try the other meats, but I definitely will make sure to come back for some more brisket!

The brisket is quite solid here and pretty decently priced. The mega sandwich was enough for me and you can order a side of mac or some dessert to fill out the edges (the sides are to die for).We arrived on a Sunday afternoon and the food was out real quick and we spent about 10 - 15 each (not bad for barbeque). The brisket sandwich was a hit! Super juicy and and finger licking good! The sauce they use it quite sweet and not much tang (I like this style so it worked for me). The mac and cheese is some of the best I've had! They added a bit of spice which gave it an excellent kick. Probably not worth the $5 but its so so good! The banana pudding was also sublime.In essence, if you want a cheap bbq sandwich, swing by for some good eats! Not much seating since its only 3 tables, but worth it.

Thank you so much and we are glad you enjoyed it! Just to let everyone know we have 3 sauces now but they aren’t all on the menu yet since one is very new. For people that don’t want a sweet Sauce and need that twang we have added a central Texas style Sauce. We also have a Bulleit bourbon Sauce that’s good too if you’re into that sort of thing.  Again thank you so much and we hope to see you again!

I wasn't aware of Big Vinny's. Randomly looking for an UBER Eats BBQ delivery and Vinny's appeared reasonable and close. Wow. Truly surprising good. Showed up very fast ( less than 30 minutes) piping hot with tons of extras like 2 pints of sauce, bread, pickles, onions, utensils, napkins, etc. Quite a nice feast for 4 less than $30. Brisket was good, but baby back ribs and sausage was excellent. Definitely will be back.

Updated review below.  TL:DR - it was great.I originally had a poor delivery experience when I first ordered from Big Vinny's.Both the owner and head smoker reached out to discuss what happened and convinced me to stop by and try the food again.  I'm very glad I did.  When presented properly, the food was really good.  I loved the rub they used on the meat.  The sides were good, too.  The corn had a bit of spice and the bbq sauce was a thinner vinegary sauce that had a good tang to it.Both gentlemen I referenced above were friendly and inviting when I stopped by, even before they knew I had a challenging experience before.Happy to go back back again.  Thanks!(Frequent traveler trying out restaurants in his new home town)

76 minute delivery time. I tried calling and they picked up/hung up.When the food finally came, the bag was soaked on the inside with what I imagine was the bbq sauce.I'll adjust this to 2 stars if the food is any good, but I would not trust them for delivery.(Frequent traveler trying out restaurants in his new home town)

Let me tell you why I rate this place 1 star. We walked up to order mind you we drove all the way from San Antonio, TX. I'm not sure if is was the owner or just a worker. We were literally met with a blank stare we were never greeted. Worker them proceeded to look down at his phone and never acknowledged the 4 of us. I'm sorry but I refuse to give any business big or small our money especially when the customer service is completely horrible!! Never again!Update: If you mean us telling you to acknowledge customers when they are standing at your window as rude, maybe looking up from your phone from your online order and letting us know that wouldn't have gotten your company this review! Best of luck with your business. Keep Austin wierd not rude! Have a blessed day

Let me tell you why I rate this place 1 star. We walked up to order mind you we drove all the way from San Antonio, TX. I'm not sure if is was the owner or just a worker. We were literally met with a blank stare we were never greeted. Worker them proceeded to look down at his phone and never acknowledged the 4 of us. I'm sorry but I refuse to give any business big or small our money especially when the customer service is completely horrible!! Never again!

Been here a few times now and for whatever reason had no idea that they had been in this spot in front of Hudson's for three years (they use Hudson sausages!).Went through the menu and had some thoughts:* Brisket.  It's Texas - so you've got to try the brisket. I'd say the brisket was pretty good - smokey and not too dry.  It's not top tier - but it's solid.* Turkey.  On the last go the turkey was amazing - smokey, but so tender, soft and juicy.  Definitely ranked as some of the best turkey in town.  * St. Louis Ribs.  These ribs are probably my favorite of the things they do - sweet sauce glazed on this fall of the bone goodness.  * Baby Back Ribs.  These are two on my list - rubbed to perfection and not quite as sweet as the St. Louis.  They lack the meat cap and cartilage on the back, but are tender and tasty.* Potato Salad.  This was a thumbs up - great compliment to the BBQ* Street Corn.  These have a little kick but were a pleaser as well.All meat comes with some onion, pickles and bread too.  EDIT:  Forgot to mention - the BBQ sauce has a vinegar base to it so you're going to get a pretty sharp tang to it.  The acidity works well with fatty cuts of brisket.Service is quick and nice (cordial and appreciative).  Great local BBQ joint for S. Congress.
Thanks for your feedback, as well as taking the time to share your positive experience! We look forward to serving you again.

Stopped here on a biker tour for lunch. Great prices, great food and relaxed vibe. Awesome food truck with all sorts of delicious bbq. I had the brisket and sausage sandwich with 2 sides. The food was a big serving! Make sure you come hungry. Service was great and we sat right next to the truck. Only thing I'll say is that the tables and chairs weren't wiped down but the food was top notch as was the people watching. Definitely recommend!
It was a pleasure meeting and serving you all! Thank you and see you soon.

If not the worst brisket I've had, at least a tie. Dry as an overdone turkey breast, cut as if a child was given a knife and told to slice a brisket. Not much flavor. A throwaway after two or three bites.It's cheaper than other places, best thing I can say.

This place is amazing, went with 7 people and he took our orders quick and got the food out fast. Everything from the brisket down to the street corn was delicious. Brisket was tender and flavorful, and all sides had a little twist on the basics which is great. Whenever I go to Austin i will always know of a great place to go get some great TX BBQ

The chop beef didn't taste like chopped beef and looked recooked.  Also, I ordered a sausage and got a small cup of corn for $4.00.  Never, ever again.  The potato salad was so and so, but okay, I guess.  UGH!!

Hi Jane. We apologize about the unsatisfactory experience. We were cooking more beans, so I substituted corn. The driver took 2 orders that may have been mixed up. Either way, sorry that is on us. Thanks for giving us a try.
Took a chance on this place and it turned out to be a good gamble. Affordable, big servings, tasty bbq.
Thank you for the kind words! Glad you all enjoyed everything.

Just ask for "B. Miller"Big Vinny's was probably our biggest off-the radar discovery while visiting Austin. What is essentially a tiny shack on a street corner serves up some incredible barbecue. We took it down and sat next to friend's eating at Torchy's tacos and made them all jealous. The whole Big Vinny experience left me with two really outstanding takeaways. 1. They have some incredible, perfectly seasoned, melt-in-your-mouth brisket. 2. As good as the food is the side of friendly banter from V. Miller, the man serving things up behind the counter. He is related to Big Vinny (who also apparently manages gentlemen's clubs) and an all-around nice guy to chat with. I took away that they are very proud of their barbecue and that it's definitely a "family" thing.

Don't know what this is...but it isn't BBQ.  Stopped by for some moist brisket for a quick lunch.  After all, brisket is the true litmus test for legit Q.  There was absolutely no smoke ring or flavor on the meat and it tasted like it has been dried out and baked in an oven.  Will definitely not return.  You can do better guys!
Thank you for the feedback and we apologize for the bad experience! No excuses. Thank you for giving us a try.
Very nice and delicious! Vinny was super fun and generous with the portions and treating our birthday girl!

Don't know if they were having an off day, but I couldn't even finish the meal. Brisket was very dry and lacked flavor. Sausage could be okay, but was also very dry. Baby back ribs were cooked well, but tasted sour. I was not a fan of the sauce at all. I ate the pickles and onions just to rid my mouth of the other flavors.
Really great smoked meats. Really fair price and super friendly staff. Tried it today for dinner and was very happy.
Really appreciate your feedback. Very glad you enjoyed! Have a good one and hopefully see you soon!

When I woke up this morning, the first thing that came to my mind was BBQ. I was a mindless zombie with an intense meat craving combing through yelp on the comfort of my couch to find the next BBQ place that I can attack. While searching for a bit, the holy grail finally appeared to me in the form of Big Vinny's BBQ. It was at that moment that I grabbed my keys and headed off to the wonderland. But little did I know, Satan's asshole was leaking that day and the heat was pounding at me. But that did not stop my hungry soul while I drove to the wonderland in my car, butt scorching from the seat and hands avoiding anything that looked like metal.The service:The service is exactly what you would get at a food truck. You walk up to the window and then Big Vinny say in a jolly manner: "What can I get yah?" with a smile on his face. (This is how my brain interpreted it and may not reflect what actually happened) My only issue was that there was not a garbage can outside. Please put one out so I can do my citizens duty.The Food:FRITO PIE: As I opened up the to-go container, a bright light shined from it and what I saw was a reflection of my life. It was a meat galore with brisket, sausage, beans, fritos, and cheese. The brisket was great and the pieces I had seemed like it was a fattier cut. The sausage was also fantastic. As I bit into the sausage, the meat juice practically exploded from it. That's what I wanted to feel, a real Niagra Falls flowing in my mouth. My only wish with the Frito Pie was that I wish it was a bit more warmed up and the cheese slightly melted.POTATO SALAD: The potato salad is grainer than others. I prefer a smoother potato salad, but this one stands on its own two feet.PORK RIBS: THIS WAS nslfnsd2mp3dp23. That's how I felt when I bit into the rib. I actually might've malfunctioned in real life for a split second. The meat just came off the bone. It was both juicy and delicious.All in all, the food was great, however, It lacked the depth to make it 5 star worthy. It's almost there though. But it absolutely made the summers day out a whole lot better. Even though the heat tried to murder me that day.

Damn good brisket!!! Portions are HUGE! 2 meat plate with brisket and sausage are a solid choice. I can eat and this meal could've easily been shared and filled up 2 people. Give this place a shot and you won't regret it.
Thank you very much for the feedback it was a pleasure meeting and serving you.

Oh my goodness!! I'm going back to tip them more! I got a 2 meat plate for me and a 3 meat plate for my mom for todays Memorial Day. I assumed we were getting small portions for the price (Similar to some of the more lackluster spots pricing) but boy oh boy was I wrong! The brisket is oh so moist it falls apart at your touch and perfectly seasoned. The ribs , both baby back and pork fall off the bone. Now let's talk about the potato salad. I love you. Solid mustard potatoes salad that's well seasoned. We will have leftovers for days. I will definitely be back
Great BBQ, great proportions! Friendly staff will meat your needs. Very moist and well represented of Texas BBQ.

Stuck in the office and didn't bring lunch. Ordered this delicious bbq from Big Vinny's through Uber Eats and don't know why I've never noticed Big Vinny's on my commute home. By far the best Bbq I've had in a long time. Don't tell my husband! Lol... The meat was seasoned so well, tender and juicy. Absolutely love the coleslaw!
Thank you very much for the feedback! We are happy that you had such a great experience. Thank you for your business!

Hungry coming into town and impatient to eat wait in line for BBQ. Love this speedy, delicious, and collaboration with grub hub delivery and for 12 people coming in at different hours. Brisket, sausages, and racks of ribs that just fell off the bone, as their meat options. Potato salad and beans were delicious. They gave tons of bbq and onions, pickles, and of course with 2 loafs of bread...definitely worth the 2 Benjamin's I spent.

My boyfriend loves BBQ pork but I can't have pork... but they have TURKEY! Yesss, I can have that! Sorry for CAPS but WOW! THE BEST BBQ TURKEY sandwich I've ever had!! My boyfriend loved his sandwich too! I loved mines so much I forgot to take a picture of his food. Also that BBQ sauce is FIRE! I'm so happy we stopped by here and making it our last meal before we left Austin, Texas! THANK YOOOOOOOOU!
Thank you very much for swinging by! We are very glad to hear of your positive experience! See you soon hopefully.

Wow wow wow wow! Unassuming little food truck parked in front of Hudson Meat! The man working the truck (Brian) was great and so sweet, totally the Texas gentleman. Had a Big Vinnie sandwich and was soooo amazing! Great food, will definitely want to come back! So much flavor and the brisket was soooooo tender!
Thank you for taking the time of your experience at Big Vinny’s! We really appreciate it! See you next time!
So this is a food truck. Didn't see that on the app BUT the food was excellent. We had the briskets. Great bread-not just wonder bread. The barbecue sauce was tangy, and so good
Thanks for the feedback Laura! Dang, you know I usually have wonder bread! Ha!

Very generous.  WAY more than I was expecting for $15 but I'm from out of state so this may be normal for Texas.BBQ was good, not great, but solid.  Plenty of it.  Brisket was too lean for me but I didn't ask for the fat so it might well be available as well.  Next time.Cole slaw was good but too acid.  Needs to be balanced out with something to cut it.  Salt?  Sweet?Street corn was an A+.Overall, quite good.  I'll be back.
Thank you for the feedback! Really appreciate it!

Okay this is a must stop! The guy is awesome and the food is better.  I wish I could have tried everything. I wanted to smuggle the garlic sausage on the plane back to California with me. The street corn and beans are to die for. I cannot possibly say anything better about this place and the food speaks for itself. The prices are the best in the area also. What better place to buy food than from someone that cuts meat for a living.
Thanks for stopping by it was a pleasure meeting you! I’m very glad you enjoyed our food! Thank you for the feedback and we will see you next time you are in town.

A friend and I were at the meat place (the name escapes me) buying beef jerky and we were just about to call a lyft to take us to our Airbnb when we spotted Big Vinnys and our curiosity got the better of us. We had literally just come from a restaurant and were supposed to go home and get ready to go out to yet another one but we quickly yelped the place JUST IN CASE. When we saw that it had a solid five stars we knew that our duty was clear.We sampled the ribs and they were DELICIOUS. Smoky, moist and tender. My friend went so far as to say she liked them better than Terry Blacks, but I wouldn't get quite that carried away. Have you SEEN how shiny the ribs at Terry Blacks are? They glisten, friend. Nevertheless, Big Vinny knows how to do ribs and I'm glad we came across it!
Thank you very much for the review in for trying us out! I hope you have a great trip and we will see you next time.

Simply put: darn tasty. We had brisket...doesn't need any sauce. Baby backs..off the bone goodness. The beans, i believe incotporate yesterdays ribs and they are divine. I don't love cole slaw, but the spouse says it rocks. We bought wine next door at the market and sat outside. Don't know if that is legal, but briwn paper bag worked for us. ;)

The owner was super friendly. When I asked what I should try he suggested the ribs... Best ribs ever! Melt off the bone tender and amazing smokey savory flavor. Visiting from California and wanted to have classic Austin BBQ. Glad we stopped here.
Hey thank you for the kind words! It was a pleasure meeting you all. And I am super happy that you loved the ribs!

Big Vinny's was not only a delicious experience, it was a memorable one. My friends and I walked up, looking for delish BBQ. It's hot and we're babies so we whines and they invited us in to enjoy the AC while we waited. We made instant friends. Talk about southern hospitality! I'm floored. I loved everything about every minute we had at Big Vinny's, and we hadn't even tasted it yet. The food is absolutely incredible and clearly made with heart. Thank you Big Vinny's for showing us the best time we've had in Austin yet.
Food was quick, Delicious and no waiting in line!  I would certainly go back again, and again. Friendly staffer.
Thanks for stopping by!
Great BBQ, tucked in along South Congress.  We ordered a large takeout order; the service was great. My personal favorite are the ribs, but the brisket is really good too.
Thank you for the feedback! (I’ve been smoking ribs the longest! I used to only smoke briskets for competitions, until I decided to make my cooking a career)
Austin, TX 78746

Recently been doing the curbside and it is working well.  I thank them for their service.  It is via the phone and then they send you a text.  All the staff has been friendly.  They pack bread, sauce, pickles and onions plus whatever you order.  I am so grateful they are doing curbside.  We haven't been inside a restaurant or store since March 10, 2020.  The food is as good as it always has been.  Always fast and easy.

the service is always friendly and fast. Have never had a bad meal here. Some of my favorite is turkey and the ribs. On my way home so there is always take out as an option. Parking can be a bit tough at peak times.

I'm a big fan of Rudy's.  As a chain, they are consistently serving quality food, have a clean environment and meet or exceed expectations.  The BBQ is top tier and can compete with places much pricier and without the long wait of certain 'in' joints.  I heard they actually closed a franchise that wasn't living up to expectations (?).  Maybe its Rudy's lore, IDK.This particular Rudy's is great.  The service is friendly and awesome.  Just like other Rudy's you order by weight at the counter.  If you need any help at all the servers are glad to fill you in and adjust your order as you eyeball it on the scale.  COVID-wise the drink station is spotless.  The pickle/onion station has pre-packed containers now instead of being a DIY bar which is actually a big time saver.Some suggestions for food:  Order the 'moist' brisket (delicious), the ribs are dry rub and THE BEST.  And, a very overlooked protein, their TURKEY is so juicy and flavorful!  Give it a try you'll love it!  By the way, Rudy's is a gas station and convenience store, too (as it was in it's origin, I believe).  Oh, and don't be shy with the sauce -- it is peppery, savory deliciousness.

**COVID-19 takeout review** Rudy's BBQ is one of our favorites ever since we stumbled across this gem when we stopped by for gas.Yesterday, we placed an order for the picnic family pack which serves about 3-5 people. Order was ready within the 15 minute window for pickup. Their moist brisket is mouth watering as is their St. Louis Ribs. The family menu is reasonably priced - seriously a great value; bang for your buck, and the food is just too good.Overall experience at this location has been terrific - very pleased with quality of food and service - highly recommended!
Thank you for being a fan & for sharing your experience!

What can I say that hasn't already been said?!Brendan & I love trying bbq when we travel and I can say without a doubt that this is the best bbq we have ever had. First and foremost, the service is amazing. We got to taste everything before buying and that was so super helpful. My favorite meat? The TURKEY. It was so moist and flavorful- epic. The setting is perfect too- big picnic style tables with exposed handwashing stations- very handy, as bbq is messy! The bbq sauce is amazing and every side we tried was so good too. I can't wait until corona is GONE so I can come back!
Great little hidden spot. Some amazing fresh breakfast burritos.And you can get gas at the same time ;)

I was happy to make a trip to one of my favorite bbq spots. Due to COVID the store was practically empty. We went during lunch and usually the line would wind all around. We were able to go immediately to the counter.  After ordering brisket, sausage, beans and the creamed corn, it was easy to find a table that was socially distant from others. Pickles, onions, sauce are all in individual containers.  Sadly, the extra moist brisket was not very hot as the fat congealed which wasn't the most appealing. The food over all was still very good and I can only imagine the challenge of trying to determine how much to smoke when your business has been cut down due to government restrictions.The hand jacuzzi wasn't great before and after our lunch and I wish more retailers would get on the hand jacuzzi wagon.

We came in here in the morning for the breakfast tacos. The food was great the staff is friendly and the food is cheap... you could smell the brisket smoking for the lunch crowd. I need to comeBack for lunch, however this is a great quick place to go to grab some breakfast
Austin, TX 78746

I worked for them when I was 18,They are next level clean and thorough.They make great bbq and are obsessive compulsive about cleanliness. I love that. And can't complain about the food ever. Ken and Nolan have made a great place here that has always been a "go to" for holidays and party's with the group meal service they provide. Anyway, that's how I "put the sauce on"Rudy's is consistently on point for so long and I am sure they will continue.
It may not be the best bbq in Austin per their slogan  but it definitely hits the spot and is super convenient.

It was strange to see a Rudy's with a gas station attached but service was excellent as usual. I would have given 5 stars but the hamburger bun was extra and my local one doesn't charge. Tried the coleslaw for the first time today and it's excellent! Their potato salad is the ONLY potato salad I like from any place! The tea was fresh and strong.

Picked up a family pack for 5-7 people.  We had brisket, chicken and sausage and then I ordered an extra pound of brisket to make sure we had enough meat.  The brisket in the family pack was a little dry but the extra pound of brisket was really moist and delicious. Love their spicy beans!

Good old reliable Rudy's! When you are in the car headed somewhere and need a quick breakfast taco if you see a Rudy's you should stop and grab the brisket, egg and cheese taco. They are delicious. They are a bit greasy but in a good way. We had a taco emergency last weekend and we pulled in here, my husband went in and ordered a dozen brisket, egg and cheese tacos and in less than 10 minutes it seemed like he was back in the car and we were back on our way. I had forgotten for a minute how good those are. I also remember after I had my kid in the hospital that someone delivered some of the same tacos and it was memorable and much appreciated. You get it - stop here if you need some tacos. I don't think you will regret it.

Service was great. Brisket was slightly dry, ribs slightly dry, sausage link was tasty. Some worthy highlights include the individually wrapped jalapeños, coleslaw,potato salad, good ol bread. Worth trying for one of Austin's favorites.

Really long delivery times, BUT worth it. I was going to give a 1 star review but always give another try on the chance it was a one-off cluster of mistakes I experience and not a normal one. I'm glad I did. Rudy's you could say has the formula down for fast food BBQ. They're not about customer service, not to say its bad  just not there bc its all a la carte. You pick-up your sauce, pickles, onions yourself (they're free, no upsell like chik-fil-a for more sauce or the like). They give you a 3-4 slices of bread per 1/2 lb of meat ordered. 4 orders = whole loaf included. I ordered delivery through Uber Eats (not carried on Favor). Just a heads up to contact your Uber Eats driver ASAP to let them know to pick-up the already pre-packaged accroutrements of BBQ sauce, pickles, and onions over to the side of the ordering counter. Rudy's doesn't deal with on-line orders so the Uber Eats person is responsible for getting it themselves. I ordered 1/2 lb moist brisket, 1/2 lb pulled park, full rack St. Louis Ribs, bananna pudding, cream corn, and baked beans. Lets start with the brisket, its an easy one. The flavor is lightly seasoned, not salty, with a very distinct and bright pink/red smoke ring. The shell is sticky with carmelized to burnt at the thin parts. The seasoned taste is from the shell with a thin fat layer that keeps its crust wet and sticky and the meat very wet. Moist is not the best descriptor here, wet, is best. The meat is very very tender as such you will not need a knife. A fork or fingers will suffice just fine. There sauce is a spicy tang type so it pairs well with these dry rubbed brisket. Next lets talk pig, pulled pork. Was very thick, the chew was not easy but very tasty. I recommend this be spread thin on the bread with extra sauce. I tasted the rub, a bit salty, but thats expected seeing its been pulled and mixed and kept warm till serving. I imagine, not sure, that with the volume Rudy serves not everyone gets the pulled pork right after its been pulled and mixed. Some, I think like me, get it much much later after its been sitting and warmly slow cooking. It was okay, but not worth the price and not recommended to try. The St. Louis ribs were cut short, as a full rack is in my experience at least 8 falls I got 7 with a very burnt unedible charcoaled end. The 7th was tiny, no meat. So in truth 6-1/2 falls at 4in long by 1inch wide. Poor showing for a BBQ joint that charges a premium for slow cooked rubbed ribs. The half rack of the full slab that was sauced and juicy fell off the bone perfectly and gave a light push back to the bite as opposed to being mushed. The meat was very well smoked as being lightly rouge of pink shade. The caramelized sugar shell went well with a butter pickle chip and piece of white onion, I recommend the ribs but check them before you walk away from the counter, don't pay their premium prices for unedible meat. Next up, the cream corn, do it, try it its thick, not to sweet and crunches at each kernel, definitely recommended. The beans are a bit looser than typical (typical for me is like bushes baked beans, thick). It has a savory vinegar taste similar to the water in the slow cooked southern collard greens. There are small tastes of ham in the beans and slight kick of mustard flavor. These pair well with the pulled pork with the sweet and sour like tastes. The 4ounce cold bananna pudding is topped with a malty whipped cream and 4 vanilla wafers. Its very thick and neutralizes any spices in your mouth or overly onion and pickled stomach. Just a heads-up their sweet tea is very 'southern' sweet tea as to say super sweet. Add lemon and suggest 1/2 the cup be un-sweet tea to calm it down. The delivery takes an hour to hour 15min, don't be fooled by the 30-45min quote on uber eats. Never ever that quick with Rudys. Its expensive just looking at the food prices vs portions and quality of product. I will come again for lean brisket and try their baby back ribs next time. I recommend you try Rudys and email me your review would love to read your opinion.

Went in for take-out. Early dinner line moves quickly. Indoor and outdoor seating are also open for dine-in experience. Ordered (ranking by deliciousness)Best: Brisket wet2. Brisket dry3. Pork ribs4. Pulled pork. Good value. We skipped the sides. Staff are super friendly and move quickly. The cutters have this down to a science. Ambience is down to earth yet fun. Rudy's has some of the best sauce. Great for the pulled pork, which was quite sweet. Will be coming back.
When I went to Rudy's I can't say I was expecting much but I was pleasantly surprised when I ended up with an amazing BBQ lunch.  Ready for another visit.
Austin, TX 78746
Very solid bbq, great brisket, great potato salad and bbq sauce! Only meh thing is the coleslaw- I will skip this next time. Also, very reasonable prices compared to other spots in town.

I had some friends visiting from out of town and they wanted some BBQ. They were wandering downtown doing  touristy stuff so we decided to meet them at the 360 Rudy's. With Covid around, I haven't been to many restaurants so was unsure what it would be like but I knew that their seating areas were large so I was hoping it would be okay. We masked up and went inside. We each grabbed a drink from the iced buckets as we walked through the line. We ordered pretty much everything on the menu so that they could try it all. We ordered:Creamed cornJalapeño sausage Moist and regular brisket Pulled pork TurkeyThe sides fixing bar was closed obviously. Sauces, onions, pickles etc were all in little containers. We ate until we couldn't eat anymore!! We sat outside and were were the only ones there. It was hot but we appreciated the room. I miss getting breakfast tacos on the way to work in the mornings but I know things will get back to normal- hopefully sooner rather than later.
Thank you so much for being a fan and sharing us with your friends!

What can I say about Rudy's that you don't already know?? If you haven't been... here's the skinny. The breakfast tacos are fresh. The brisket, turkey, sausage, all of it really are to die for! I am always greeted with a "good-morning" or "how's your day" upon entering. The employees are always friendly and so are the customers. People hold the door open for you, smile, and make eye contact (whoa) ;) You always leave the building feeling happy and full. If you are getting food to go, your mouth is watering as you carry your bag full of goodies to your car, fingers crossed that the Austin traffic is light on your way to your destination. Rudy's is a top notch place- breakfast, lunch, or dinner!

This place was highly recommended so after along drive from Los Angeles, CA we had to go straight to Rudy's to have a good authentic Texas bbq. Rudy's is located inside inside a gas station but the restaurant is pretty big with spacious outdoor dining area. The brisket was delicious, sausages was to die for and the sides were so good especially the bbq beans. For dessert you have to try the banana cream and creamy corn they're are so good!
I'm a big Rudy's fan! Their staff are always kind and friendly and the food is delicious. I love the brisket, potato salad and pickles!!

Rudy's BBQ has always been delicious, affordable, and remarkable all at the same time and every time I come here.  This location is right off of Capital TX Highway which makes it very convenient to come to and order in or take out.  Hardly ever a line when the restaurant is open and always has a place for large parties when you come here with the fam. Recently we came here during quarantine and it was surprisingly super easy and convenient again to order out.  We ended up getting a great valued family meal deal with brisket, chopped beef, cream corn (oh this is my favorite here), beans, potato salad, a whole loaf of Mrs. Bairds white bread, and all the sides like extra bbq sauce, onions, and pickles. Everything was packaged up nicely and tight. We even ordered from their grocery items they have on their website right now that included flour, sugar, bread, tortillas(!), and even toilet paper!!! Saved us one trip to the grocery store for even the smallest things.  Picking up your order was super easy too!  We parked in the back, called the main line, and let them know what parking spot we were located in. Pop your trunk or roll down the back window and they will place the bag and your order in for you.  Super easy peasy!  It did make me sad that we couldn't enjoy eating our food out on their lawn/patio area like we used to when we came before quarantine. But we will definitely be back when things are back to normalcy and continue to eat their delicious bbq.
Thank you so much for sharing your experience and for the support!

My wife is on the Board of a Hotel Association here in Austin. They had some Gala slash fundraiser. I was directed to donate. So, I bought five gift cards. I better go and use them; lol.Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q is what I call Commercial BBQ. It is bbq for the masses. Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q seems to be all over. Great concept. Gas station and bbq. Awesome idea. It is good. Consistent. Tasty. While it is not in the same league as the famous bbq houses. It holds its own. You want ribs, brisket, etc. they have it and they satisfy the taste buds.What strikes me as the number once asset with Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q; is their staff. They make you feel welcome, special and appreciated. My jaw just dropped by service. You get all the things that make a customer come back. It is amazing to experience and watch.Been to this location now a few times. Brisket is solid. Good taste. Has smoke. Moist. BBQ ring. Very consistent taste. Ribs are also very good. Has all the consistent markings of taste, pull and bark. Some days the cue at Rudy's is awesome. Other days so so. Bottom line; if you want bbq because you crave cue. Rudy's is a solid bbq joint.CC friendly. Parking on-site. Plenty of room to sit. Beer options. Price point friendly. Clean. Family-friendly. Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q is a very good option for the tasty cue.
Austin, TX 78746

Bday dinner takeout for a family celebration! Apologies for no pics- being my bday, I was happier to give my family personal "love," and didn't think to take food pics.And, as "uncool" as it may seem for me to say I wanted a different place for my BBQ bday dinner, so too ALL needs to know that Rudy's was #2 on my list. My 1st choice wasn't open on a Tuesday. So yes, all smiles about Rudy's, and a big Texas YEEHAW for what they provided!For starters, what _I_ wanted vs what I saw on their website was different: Different options/prices on the website vs personal desires to "build" the best BBQ dinner in YOUR opinion... A Phone Call cleared up all questions and resulted in everything desired at a reasonable price for BBQ in general, let alone it being Rudy's legendary BBQ, but also including their awesome sides!FYI, for $88.xx, feeding 6: Our order:1.5 lbs of "moist" brisket1/2 lb of smoked turkey (turkey from Rudy's is a "must" IMO, regardless that I prefer pork/beef BBQ in general).1 rack of baby back ribs1 pint each of: beans, creamed corn, and cole slawCame with bread, onions, and pickles.Results?!?!? Everyone ate heartily and to their capacity... Except me: I ate BEYOND my capacity because it was THAT good! (Didn't save room for dessert, lol!). Happy to take a walk to not dishonor the person who made dessert... A small dessert portion requested; funnier that I cared more about knowing where any BBQ leftovers were put!Yes, I absolutely recommend Rudy's.Beans are awesome.Creamed corn is awesome.Cole slaw wins vs other placesRibs: Holy awesome, meat falling off the bones - SO glad I included a full rack!Brisket: moist & delicious (yes, I prefer "moist" over whatever else they offer)Turkey: Wish I ordered more!Everything was packaged well. To search for a "negative," I wish I asked for more of their awesome sauce. But any possible "lacking" ultimately saved me from eating more... And that's a really good thing, actually... Because I ate WAY too much!Enjoyed every bite of everything: thanks Rudy's!!! Thanks for making my bday dinner so awesome!

My husband is from TX so Rudy's is a must stop during each of our visits home. As he recommended I ordered the "moist end" brisket and wasn't disappointed. You don't need sides as the meat comes with white bread and plenty of sauce but there are sides to choose from in either single or family sizes. Although I enjoy dining in I would definitely recommend Rudy's for an easy family meal to-go. We ordered food for 3 (brisket, potato salad and slaw) and they sent home an entire loaf of white bread which actually created enough to feed 4-5.

We had both a fun and delicious dinner at Rudy's Country Store!   I discovered this on Yelp while our family was in Austin and wanted to get delicious BBQ w/out a wait at Terry Blacks.  Make sure and tell the server at the Counter that it's your first time there!   We were serenaded with a humorous "Welcome Rookie" song which was sung with gusto and was both surprising & hilarious!   We heard the 'extra moist' Brisket was great...and this review can confirm that it is all that and more!   Mouthwatering!   Also really impressed with Potato Salad and Cole Slaw - nothing revolutionary or exotic....just delicious!   The creamed corn was different and it took some adjustment....it was in a heavy gravy-like sauce.   At first, I didn't think I liked it, but then I discovered that I kept going back and eating more and more of it.Super casual with outdoor seating in the back in a park-like setting.  We can't wait to go back for more extra moist brisket and fixin's!

Talk all you want about Franklins (which agree is fantastic) but Rudy's serves the most Q in town for a good reason. Order the brisket, moist cut with bark, you want be disappointed. Add a pint of cream corn, the best in town. Curbside around the back. Call before you go and let them know when you are there and they will bring it out. No tipping. Easy
Thank you so much for being a fan and sharing your experience. We appreciate the support!

The best brisket in my humble opinion. I love their tangy, peppery bbq sauce was too! Whenever I come I must always get the brisket and make a sandwich with the pickles and onions, sublime. This place is awesome.
Awesome the best BBQ and super quick. If you are in town, hitting up Rudy's is a must! Hey the Extra moist Brisket and Cream Corn... you'll thank me later.

What isn't there to like about Rudy's?  The feel of the place is really homey and comfortable. I love the fact that you can order bbq for breakfast: All of the meats are full of flavor and are of great quality. I wish they would expand Rudy's into Louisiana.

Yum!!! I had no idea what to expect from this gas station stop, but I had a great experience! You walk in to the restaurant and get in line to order and receive your food at the front. There are ice coolers next to you the whole time in like to pick our your choice of bottled sodas or beer. They also have a fridge section that has dessert, coleslaw, pickles, and more! Ordering can be a little confusing because you order by the pound and they weigh the meat in front of you and charge you accordingly. We got baby back ribs, brisket, and prime rib. My absolute favorite was the brisket! It was seasoned to perfection and soooo tender. The ribs were falling off the bone and so delicious. The prime rib was outshined by the other two meats. I also picked up a cup of banana pudding for dessert and it was very creamy and not too sweet. I could eat that pudding with every meal. The dining room is set up family picnic style with long tables. Each area is equipt with seasonings and Rudy's barbecue sauce. The sauce is one of the best bbq sauces I've had. It is super peppery and tangy, just the way I like it! You can even purchase bottles of the sauce to use at home. Overall, I had a great time here. It is a laid back feel and you eat everything on a piece of wax paper. The food was high quality and shockingly tender. I will definitely be coming back...every week...! Check out Rudy's if you are in need of gas and some food.
Austin, TX 78746

Staff was great. Food was good. Menu was ok. Usual BBQ offering, but there were no plate options. I just wanted a couple small meat and side choices but had to buy in bulk. They wrapped everything up as if I was at a butcher. If that's what you want, cool, but we just wanted a simple meal to go.

You know when a place jokes about how they're the "worst Bar-B-Q in Texas," it really means they know they're the best. Rudy's is situated at a gas station, which truly brings a countryside character out of this place.On MLK morning, there was no line nor crowd here at all. I'm not sure if it's usually like this, but I sure appreciated not needing to wait. Plus, there is so much seating area with extra room and space for the customers. As a first timer, the cashier welcomed me and my friends with some samples. This was really neat, which allowed us to actually make an informed decision on which meat to order rather than being stuck with pounds of meat we might not like. We were able to sample the turkey, brisket, and extra moist brisket. The minute I tried the extra moist brisket, I knew that was what I was getting. Also, they offer tacos here which was nice because one of my friend was all BBQ'd out.My friend and I shared 0.5lbs of extra moist brisket ($9.29), half rack of baby back ribs ($9.99), cole slaw ($2.34), and creamed corn ($2.64). We weren't too hungry, so this was the perfect amount for the two of us. I absolutely loved the brisket here. It was so tender, juicy, and thinly sliced to make for an easier bite. As for the baby back ribs, they were rather okay to me and on the smaller side. Even though the meat was delicious, my favorite was their sides here. The cole slaw was light and refreshing, but the creamed corn was just heavenly. The corn is extra creamy and definitely on the thicker consistency, but so freaking delicious!All of their pickles, onions, sauces are self serve on the side counter, which is very convenient. Also, they have the coolest machine to wash your hands. You just stick your hands in the buckets and it cleans and soaps your hands. Afterwards, you can even get a sticker that says "I have clean hands." This was super cool --more places definitely need something like this.Overall, bomb BBQ (yes to the extra moist brisket and creamed corn) and great service. Bonus points with that hand wash machine too!

I've been here countless times whenever I come out to Austin for business but this is the first time that I have a chance to write about my experiences. What a concept to have an awesome BBQ restaurant at a gas station. Wish that we could have these in California. My favorite items here are the ribs, the brisket (both regular and moist), and the sausages. I have honestly never had a bad experience here. Their BBQ sauces are right on. You can get the regular or Sissy Sauce (mild). I would highly recommend the moist brisket and the ribs. In addition to the typical BBQ fare, they have lots of sides and plenty of different alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks to choose from in addition to the soda fountains.There are plenty of seats so unless the place is super crowded, it shouldn't be difficult to find a seat. This place is probably the closest to fast food BBQ that is super yummy. Wish I could get them to open up a location near my house in California. :-)

All Rudy's are great, but this one has to be my favorite. All of the staff who works here from meat cutters to bus boys are incredible and work with a smile on their face. Julian in particular was polite, kind, and a true example of great hospitality. Can't recommend this restaurant and staff enough, they are 11 out of 10! Thanks for a great experience Julian!

I went looking for my old review of Rudy's and for some reason I reviewed one of the Rudy's far far away from my home. Well, believe it or not, this non-meat eater still comes back to eat their delicious breakfast tacos. And thank the lord they have POTATO AND EGG!!! BECAUSE THEY'RE SO GOOD!I may not eat meat, but I still love their Rudy's BBQ sauce and their potato and egg breakfast tacos. It's a must for whenever I'm back in town. And for those of you who would like a little taste of my meat eating wild side, please follow the link below. yelp.co.uk/biz/rudys-cou…
1lb of brisket is wonderful and filling! It's enough to feed two people and is made just right.

Not even kidding... it's the best food I have ever tasted.  I literally would fly to Austin, Texas right now just for this food (of course if I had the money to... because college). You MUST go here if you're down south, because apparently this is a chain in the south if I've heard correctly.  Also, it's strange to have food in a gas station up north, so I was a little weirded out by that at first... but once I tasted it, it was a complete game changer.

I'm not even really a big fan of BBQ but this place takes the cake. The person taking my order was super patient with me and when he found out I was from out of town, he got the whole staff involved. Everyone greeted me loudly and he had the kitchen prepare me some samples so I could try some of their most popular foods. He even gave me a brief "tour" of the dining area, explaining where everything I might need could be found. The food is kind of prepared in bulk, so I recommend bringing your family and friends. If you want to try some decent Texas style BBQ, you would be remiss to not give Rudy's a try.

One was my favorite. Not sure what happened to the 360 location. Ordered 1 lb moist and 1/2 lb of regular. Lols like we got 1/2 lb of each and but was dry and mediocre at best. This is the second time in a row. Definitely not the same Rudy's. I hope they arrest this down hill slide. Time to find an alternative.
Austin, TX 78731

Extra star for the patio view. Beautiful lakeside, turtles swimming by the dock where you can leave your boat. Come by land or water!Happy hour drinks here + the view = worth coming here for.Not many vegetarian options and the food is average.Service is friendly and attentive.They also sell 2 day old bread which is a cute idea.
Great, favorite spot on the lake to have a drink and relax or have dinner with friends! The bartender took great care of me out on the patio! Yummy wings and sausage!  If you haven't ever been... go!

My husband surprised me by taking me on a surprise brunch at this lovely place.The view on the waterfront patio is breathtaking and makes me even more grateful to call myself an Austinite.The menu is pretty straight forward, everyone's favorites are listed : sausage, brisket (both lean and marbled), ribs (pork and beef), pulled pork, turkey breast.They have also a large selection of drinks and beverages, their happy hour is definitely something to consider as well (3pm-7pm everyday).We tried the beef ribs (moist and tender), the spicy sausage (amazing!), the marbled brisket (my favorite, I devoured it...) and the pork ribs (a little dry, the sauce is also too sweet for my taste, hence the minus 1 star).The coleslaw is surprisingly good and the bread pudding was definitely a winner!Make sure you sit outside to enjoy the beautiful view from their patio, if weather permits.

County Line BBQ. It's been in Austin as long as this native Austinite can remember. When I was growing up we would pass by the location on Bee Cave Rd. Now I live in North Austin and I get to the lake location when I can.The food is still the same as it has been for years. Tasty, filling and plentiful. On this trip I picked up food to go. They had a special for to go orders only. It's basically a little bit of everything for $13.99 per person. The staff took my order and they were super friendly. The food was great and I just wish I would have purchased a loaf of day old bread.Stop in, have a cold beer and eat.

Wow! Thank you for the great review Bill. We are so happy that we've still got it!We know there are lots of choices out there so we are grateful for your continued business and we hope to see you again soon!

The location is so beautiful!The view is unbelievable!The service was excellent.The brisket was fabulous!The potato salad was yummy.The bread!!!! Super yummy! Beef rib.... no. It was dry, didn't taste smoked and was tough.Beans had a weird slightly metallic taste to them.My salad was dry with stale croutons. (I think it was left in the refrigerator uncovered overnight.... but their Ranch Dressing is excellent! That said, I would definitely recommend the brisket and bread- ask for a fresh salad, I'm sure it'll be fine.And sit outside to enjoy the turtles and lovely view.

Made a reservation the day before 6:45pm. Wanted a seat outside, however was told reservations are for inside, when you come ask for outdoor and it's first come, first serve. Easy enough. We show up for our reservation, and ask if we can sit outside, they say it's an hour wait. We were hungry and just said seat us inside. They said we'd get a text for seating when readying.Considering I have a reservation for 6:45, I should get a text in like 5-10 mins. Get a drink at the bar.30 mins goes by and no text. Go to front desk to check on it.... maybe they thought I was waiting for outside. Nope, they know I want inside but another 30 mins????? What's a point of a reservation??? Also know there is half the tables empty!!! Maybe they are under staff??? So go to the bar for another drink while we wait..... 3 servers just chilling behind the bar for more than the 20 mins it takes me to get a drink from the bar.... go back to front desk.Why are the three hostess, 3 servers chilling behind a bar, half the restaurant empty and I'm waiting an hour for a reservation I had since yesterday..... I'm in a twilight zone. Like an SNL skit.... someone must be fucking with me.... anyways food was good. Waitress was nice, not expensive.... won't be back lol. Chow.

This place has a great location right on the lake. There's a lot of seating but it can get very busy. We ordered the a half loaf of the Famous Homemade White Bread, the Brisket Tacos, and the Bar-B-Q Sliders and split between 2 people. The bread and brisket tacos were great! The sliders were okay, but the buns were too thick. Our server basically disappeared after they brought out our food.

I absolutely love barbecue so naturally I found this place really good! The portions are huge so it's enough to eat and take some home for later! I wasn't a fan of the beans but the potato salad was very good! I highly recommend the peppered Turkey; it was so delicious and flavorful! The pomegranate drink wasn't anything out of the ordinary, but if you enjoy a simple drink it should be good.
Austin, TX 78731

The service was amazing. Jacob took such great care of our party and made our special night memorable. County Line offers great service, stunning view, and good food.The bread is really soft and has a lingering subtle sweetness. Put some of their famous honey butter on top and you got yourself a party in your mouth.Drinks were of high quality. We tried multiple cocktails but the Bloody Mary's were very delicious topped with some olives. (We requested extra spicy and got some jalapeños).While maybe due to covid or time of night, some of the meats were a little more dry hence the 4 stars. I will definitely come back and recommend to friends and family. My favorite thing to eat last night was the loaded baked potato with moist brisket on top and fully loaded with chives, bacon bits, cheese, and more! Def work coming just to eat that again.What more can you ask for. Affordable bbq with a great view and amazing service. Thanks Jacob again!

Well........The most decent food on my plate was the potato salad and I don't even like potato salad. Brisket was dry and flavorless. And ribs, well I'm the kinda girl that wouldn't mind getting messy with some juicy and saucy ones. Wth was that watery stuff given on the side. Barf! Real BBQ ribs SHOULD be messy that ya need bib. Needed some flavor to everything including that watered down Mojito. Wasted space of scenery for this place.

This spot has a decent ambiance and BBQ that is mediocre. I had gotten the 2 meat plate with brisket and pulled pork, needless to say the sides were better than the BBQ. The meat had little to no flavor & the BBQ sauce was not good enough to mask the flavorless meat. I'm overall disappointed in the Service and the food. There was a point in time where I would've given 5 stars, but unfortunately this place caters to those who have sensitive taste buds. I can see this being more of a hangout instead of a BBQ joint. 2.5/5

This is a special BBQ spot that should be considered when planning your next date night. Conveniently located off of 360 (Capital of TX HWY) it sits on a calmly on the water. Although you are next to a busy highway, you'd never know it. The outdoor atmosphere, authentic Texas charm, coupled with high quality BBQ, you won't find a better BBQ restaurant in Travis County. If it's your first time, I highly recommend the beef rib. It's big enough to feed a small village. Crispy on the outside, and juicy on the inside this entree lacks nothing in the way of flavor!NOTE: because of its unique location and outstanding Texas BBQ, this location is perfect for family reunions, wedding parties or events.

This is a special BBQ spot that should be considered when planning your next date night. Conveniently located off of 360 (Capital of TX HWY) it sits on a calmly on the water. Although you are next to a busy highway, you'd never know it. The outdoor atmosphere, authentic Texas charm, coupled with high quality BBQ, you won't find a better BBQ restaurant in Travis County. If it's your first time, I highly recommend the beef rib. It's big enough to feed a small village. Crispy on the outside, and juicy on the inside this entree lacks nothing in the way of flavor!NOTE: because of its unique location and outstanding Texas BBQ, this location is perfect for family reunions, wedding parties or events.
Glad that you can dine-in again! The food is always delicious and the staff is friendly. One of our favorite BBQ spots. Mmmm! Oh, and don't forget to go out back and feed the turtles, they love it.

Better than their sister County Line in Bee Cave: more care in takeout packaging, better quality chicken, more cheerful service, more choices, and a lagniappe: pickles, onions and jalapeños without even having to ask. How do I know? On Thanksgiving, my son invited me to lunch. He gave directions to The Lake; he intended Bee Cave. I ended up with two Chicken BBQ plates. Go figure!

I was super pumped and excited to try out this BBQ place mainly because of it's location but it was not what I expected. Location: Really gorgeous. The highlight of my trip here was feeding the fish some bread! I will say, this is a great activity to do while you're here! :) Food: I ordered the Beef Ribs, and honestly, I am the person to blame for my terrible experience. I should have returned the ribs the moment I saw them because they were beyond burnt. I didn't want to be 'that customer' that returns back a dish so I pushed through it; trying to eat around everything that was black and burnt. I was not satisfied with my meal, and the sides were nothing to die for. The beans were bland. The baked potatoe was surprisingly the highlight of the meal portion. Drinks: I ordered a strawberry lemonade, but it didn't have chunks of strawberries like I'm used to so I was a little sad. The drink was good. I also ordered a strawberry margarita, and that was yummy. I would recommend you come here for drinks, and try something other than their beef ribs.

We had a large group dinner here one evening. I got to try both the beef and pork ribs, brisket, beans, and potato salad.I found the pork ribs and brisket I was served - across the board were dry and overcooked. The Beef ribs were moister and the best thing I ate that night.The highlight of the evening was camping the Pecan Porter - that is one tasty beer.Service was good.#CountyLineOnTheLake
Austin, TX 78731

Everybody should already know about the BBQ and Texas Toast here, as County Line is an Austin fixture. I wanted to write about the Old Fashioned cocktail that I had last night.The bartender used a Texas Rye Whiskey -- I unfortunately forgot which one -- but the spiciness really worked with the deep, sweet, autumn flavor of the pecan orgeat and chocolate bitters. What really struck me, though, was how well the orange garnish was worked into the glass. The glass was redolent of fresh orange from the first sip to the last. Really well made.

YUMMY!  Was in Austin for a work event and a few co workers wanted to grab dinner after work and this place was suggested. So worth it!  They have a cute patio area you can sit on that overlooks the river; very peaceful. Beer was great, had the 512 IPA and then ordered the 3 meat dinner with Pulled Pork, Brisket, and Sausage - Yep... ate it all!  Meat was perfect. Oh, and the warm BBQ sauce on the side was the perfect finish to everything. Would highly recommend if you're in this area. Service was great as well!  5 stars!

Don't waste your time. They have all of 4 servers. They are unapologetic about being understaffed also. I was told "I don't know what to tell you." Only outdoor seating so it's at least 45 minute wait. They have 2 people sitting at tables of 6/8. Pathetic customer service. This is coming from a Bostonian coming to Texas and this joint as a staple.

Food and service was top-notch as always at County Line on the Lake. During a severe thunderstorm that forced the closure of the patio area (costing about 8 tables) and a temporary drainage issue in the entryway, you were able to see how well manager GW and his team handled everything that popped up with extreme professionalism and quick reaction. Reservations were delayed, as people weren't leaving due to the weather. Our reservation was delayed by about 20 mins, but as soon as someone got up to leave someone hopped on a table to turn it almost immediately. The queso was very good and in my opinion can rival some other restaurants more known for it. The marbled brisket was juicy, the shredded beef went well with the bbq sauce, and the jalapeno cheddar sausage had the perfect level of kick. Their famous homemade bread always is a great addition. When high service levels match the food, it's always a place to return.

Very disappointing experience today. We are longtime customers of County Line on the Lake and are very familiar with the food. The beef ribs we ordered at lunch were inedible. They were dry, tough, flavorless, and nearly devoid of meat. Our very kind server acknowledged this, agreed with us, and promptly brought out a replacement dish.The GM then came out with another beef rib and asked us what the problem was. He told us it looked like we almost ate the entire rib. When we said there was barely any meat and what little meat there was was inedible, he then effectively scolded us for not ordering the dinner portion beef ribs and said that the lunch portion ribs weren't as meaty and that beef ribs are tougher in general. There was no apology whatsoever except from our wonderful waiter.That was our first experience with the GM and likely our last. Every server has taken such great care of us over the years and then for the GM to rudely question our integrity and insult us was unacceptable. Mr. Hood, your 27 years of experience was not on display today. Questioning and lecturing the customer will never work and you've lost a longtime customer. I see from recent reviews that this isn't the first unpleasant experience customers have had with you or your beef ribs, so it might be time for you to revisit the way you treat customers and handle your kitchen operations. I would recommend observing your incredible serving staff for examples of how to treat customers.

My stepdad is obsessed with this place (and its special BBQ sauce), and every time we've ever been here the staff has been very friendly and very accommodating. For my stepdad's birthday, I mail ordered him 2 bottles of the BBQ sauce through AirRibs on their website. I was skeptical because of the slightly high shipping cost and everything going on with the pandemic, but it felt worth the risk and I'm glad to support a local place. Not only did the BBQ sauce arrive to him in Houston in only TWO DAYS but they also sent THREE bottles instead of just two! I am amazed by this service and now my stepdad is a very happy camper. Thank you, County Line!
Thank you Madeline. Can't wait 'til we can see y'all back at the restaurant, but in the meantime Air Ribs is the next best thing for sure!

I love the ambiance of this restaurant. As the name implies, it is located right on the lake. Sitting outdoors was lovely (late September weather has been nice). There are lots of turtles and fish to see in the lake. There is lots of space (looks like a great event venue) and so you can sit in a variety of places outdoors. I ordered a Texas Tea and my husband ordered a Whiskey Mule. We loved our drinks and enjoyed the food. I was slightly disappointed by the brisket. We tried both the regular brisket and the marble and both were dry. It may have just been an off day? We did love the pulled pork and the sausage! We would go back and order the sausage any day. Also, best cole slaw that I've had. All in all, despite the disappointing brisket, the ambiance and sausage has me giving this place 4 stars and I can't wait to go back with friends!

Reserved a table for three at 6:45.  Showed up at 6:40.  "Sorry sir, we're on a 90 min wait."  Explained I had a reservation.  "Oh, that just gets you in line.  That doesn't guarantee a table."  Explained that's actually exactly what a reservation does.  Hostess looks at me like I just asked her to explain differential calculus to my cat.  "Would you like to talk to a manager."  Replied yes if he's going to take me to my reserved table.  "Sorry sir.  We can't control walk-ins."  Asked why they take reservations.  Hostess looks absolutely baffled...again.  Really County Line?  That's the best you can do?
Austin, TX 78731
Our daughter just moved to Austin so we wanted to try some BBQ. We went for lunch and ate outside. Just a beautiful setting. Good food and a great margarita special. Can't wait to go back again.
Great location and atmosphere,  excellent food and great service. A must visit BBQ when in Austin!

If I could give them a MILLION STARs I would. We did a group order with Grub Hub for County Line for a professional celebration and for some random reason it kept changing our location to somewhere in east Austin, then stating that we needed to make different selections because they weren't on the menu, and it wouldn't let me pay. We are right off of Mopac near Camp Mabry by the way. There was no way to resolve this online so I had to call Grub Hub. I spoke to someone and told them what the issue was and she said that a specialist would call me back. After waiting over an hour for someone to call me back I called County Line myself and expressed my frustration and pleaded with them to be able to fulfil my very large order over the phone. Not only were they calm and took my order for more than 20 people with names, they had it ready in less than 30 min. We picked it up and it was DELICIOUS!!! That is the last time we will ever use Grub Hub and County Line will always get my business!!!Thank you for saving the day!!!!

JaMilla, Thank you so much for the great review. We can't tell you how much that makes our week!We know you have lots of choices when it comes to food "To-Go", so we can't Thank you enough for choosing us, and we can't wait to serve you again!

My husband and I went in for lunch and everything was fantastic...minus the straws. We are huge advocates of no straw so we just left them on the table but then they started blowing away so I had to contain them. Straws are generally not used and should be handed out upon request. There are literally hundreds of reasons that I could mention as to why but my biggest is the turtles! Don't pretend to be advocates with your signs if you truly are not.
This place makes me feel like I just got finished floating the river with my family. Amazing patio views and friendly staff

Walked in at 9:54pm and they were closing at 10pm. The staff was warm and welcoming even with us walking in so late. We sat at the bar and got food and drinks with five minutes to close and wow they delivered! Louis and team are rockstars. My hubby got the brisket and I got the turkey and the sides rocked. I'm genuinely impressed. We're from California and this would've never happened back home. Massive thank you to the entire County Line staff tonight.

Chathri, Thank You so much for choosing the County Line. Your comments made our day, week, month!We know that folks have lots of choices out there so we are always super happy when we get it right and deliver on the promise.
Incredible, magical, mystical, setting. Felt like we were floating lazily down the river, while more delicious food than we could have imagined was served!
Austin, TX 78731

I have been eating here for close to 20 years now. The barbecue is good - it won't be featured in Texas monthly but it will hit the spot - but what keeps me coming back is the setting. On a nice day, sitting outside on the deck and watching kids feed the turtles and fish, there's not many spots nicer in Austin. We have been doing curbside during COVID times (even though the dining room is open again, waiting until things are closer to normal to eat inside a restaurant again, even with a nice patio), and the food is still just as good. I can't wait to get back to that patio, though.

I think they have just become a tourist attraction, I've tried meals from here multiple times and I've been disappointed each time. I feel like you can get much better barbecue elsewhere in Austin. I've had their brisket, tacos, chicken, the sausage and pulled pork sandwich were actually pretty damn good, the fresh baked bread is amazing. I suggest going during happy hour and trying out a few things... I am pretty picky but many people like this place. Barbecue is a pretty difficult game to master here in Austin when there's so many options. Very pretty outside area and friendly staff!

The view here was great. We enjoy sitting and looking out the water. Our kids enjoy feeding the turtles. They have little coin machine for you to get the turtle food and feed it to them. The food were ok. Its more of the view here.
I come about once a month and on Tuesday Lauren our host was just fantastic! Just wanna say this place has a great rack of beef ribs which makes me keep coming back for more!!

I have always loved County Line off 2222 until this evening. I ordered a very simple meal and was so disturbed by my food that I actually lost my appetite. I called and spoke with GW, the manager. I was cut off during the conversation and right off the bat he placed blame on Favor delivery insinuating that favor tampered with the food. GW was not responsive in a professional or responsible manner. He immediately placed blame on others, was not apologetic, and sounded as if he had been drinking alcohol. He was slurring his words.

A great steakhouse to visit, but not the best bbq to eat. This was my first time in Texas, more specifically Austin and as someone who loves bbq, I did have high expectations hearing all about Texas bbq! Although I did end up having phenomenal bbq all around Texas, I would say this one was a letdown in terms of the food.Our waiter was friendly but I don't understand if you have a reservation, how they make you wait another 20-25 mins. Granted, I didn't mind the wait too much as I was there visiting family and friends and it was nice to go out back, see the turtles and take pictures! This is definitely a place you would have to check out at least once but not go too crazy with the food.The price points were not that great either. Maybe if the bbq was a bit better, the brisket was probably the best as we had ordered a pretty good sized spread of all the different types of bbq. The place seems to be pretty busy so my recommendation would probably be to come early because even with a reservation, you may be stuck waiting.
The BBQ here was really good and the portions were huge and I was completely satisfied with the food. The women who took my order over the phone was very polite and knowledgeable about their menu.

I want to say the food at the County Line was excellent, & I give the food 4-stars. However, due to the experience with the hostesses, I have to give an overall rating of 3-stars. My sister wanted to celebrate her birthday at the County Line so we made a reservation in advance. We received a text confirmation the day of and the time was incorrect. We called to fix it and were told it was taken care of. Despite being told it was fixed, we got another text confirmation of the wrong time. When we arrived to the restaurant, they had no record of our reservation and it took a while to get seated. It was disappointing but the manager was very kind and he took care of us. The waiter was very nice too, just wish the hostesses would have had a little more organization.

It's a beautiful place.  The drive on 2222 alone is worthwhile.  Kinda pisses me off at fellow native Texans eeading reviews.  We can all want BBQ done our way.  It's easy, do it at home.  You go out you save 12-24 hours and surrender to another way.  They do a really solid job although beef ribs just aren't a Texas thing.  That's tourist.  And for the tourists, no you can't get BBQ your way, e.g. I want ribs sauce on the side.  It's BBQ.  It cooks for hours not minutes.  Choose a dry rub place, Franklin's, Cooper's in Llano, (short drive from Austin).  They don't have a xouple Yankee racks just in case you come in.
Austin, TX 78729

For my first time here I can say the food is excellent. The ribs where fall of the bone and super tender . There wasn't a dry piece in the whole bunch . The smoke was perfect and didn't take away from the bbq as a whole . I'm a sucker for good bbq and like most native Texans I am picky as hell when it comes to proper BBQ .    I am sad I hadn't come here before now , I highly recommend trying it out if your in the area  . The staff was extremely friendly and the location is so close to my house I will definitely be coming back soon .  I'm sure everything else is just as tasty and can't wait to try it all .

Fantastic! I recently visited this place after walking out of another BBQ place (you can read my review). What a wonderful and pleasant surprise. First, it is a pleasure visiting a place and being greeted with a pleasant and genuine hello. That just sets the mood and after walking out of my previous place, it immediately let me know I was at a place that valued me as a customer. I ordered the sausage and brisket sandwich to get an idea of what the food was going to be like. I got home and noticed that the bun was perfectly toasted and super soft. I tried the sausage first, saving the brisket for "dessert." Delicious. I was genuinely surprised by how good it was and immediately popped a piece of brisket thinking both couldn't be that good. Again, I was surprised and this was even more impressive, because after tasting the sausage my expectations were much higher. My one mistake, not ordering two sandwiches. One filled me up, but BBQ this good is supposed to be eaten until you're stuffed. Don't judge me, that's Texas law.

When ordering BBQ from any BBQ location, I always ask for, "1 pound of brisket, lean, the leaner the better." I have had mixed results, but Bigg Belly was perfect; not dry, lean, and super tasty, and the service was great. I have visited twice and will be back. Hope the consistency continues.

Delicious!! Not too smoky. The sauce is perfectly tangy. The chopped brisket is so soft and moist. Even the bun it comes on is worth mentioning. We will def go back again soon! Some added chip options would be great.

Easily the best brisket EVER. We had the sandwich, quesadilla, and taco. I felt like I'd died and gone to heaven whilst drowning it in sauce. The meat itself is incredibly tender. I am, however, a saucy kinda gal. Luckily I was just visiting a friend, otherwise? I'd eat here every GD day

We happened upon this spot by chance.
