I also tried what was left of the pulled pork which tasted good, but they ran out of a full serving size right before I ordered! The food was good, so I'd recommend it if you're in the area and don't feel like waiting in line for more popular spots nearby, but if you're looking for the best, I'm not sure this is the right place for you.Also, they don't offer mac and cheese which is the biggest let down! What kinda BBQ spot doesn't have mac and cheese on the menu? Sadness.

Melanie, thanks for the love! I'm glad you were able to swing on through and get some good BBQ. It sounds like you enjoyed your BBQ meats, and I hope they keep you coming back. I apologize for not having the mac n cheese -- but we promise some of our other sides are the bee's knees. Try our corn! Hope to see you soon,Scotty - Owner

One thing to keep in mind is that this was an Uber Eats order and sometimes food just tastes better on site.   That being said, the stand outs were the creamed corn and the potato salad.  The corn tipped in the to go container and got into the potato salad and the bites that had the two mixed were freaking unbelievably delicious.The brisket had a nice texture, but lacked some flavor for me.I liked the sausage.  The pulled pork was tender but had little flavor. I didn't enjoy the sweet sauce on the brisket, but it was better w/ the pork - that made sense to me.Kind of a bummer, but not terrible.** Ok, had to come back to this as I did keep the leftovers and I'm eating them now . . . I like it better today, maybe we have the lasagna effect happening, I might be hungrier today - but I am enjoying this food more today than yesterday.
Harsh

I'm a Dallas girl, and we haven't got much good BBQ in Dallas (pecan lodge is the closest and it's pretty average). Got the brisket, and two sides- one potato salad and one creamed corn. It was pretty good. My brisket wasn't fatty, and had the right of smoke. It was satisfying. But the creamed corn- oh lordy, THIS is what earned this place four stars. It was flavorful and delicious. The amount paid is so good: a meat and two sides for 13! I haven't tried the super famous places like Franklins, or LA BBQ, but for a BBQ deprived Dallas girl, I'm happy.

Pretty good BBQ! Not the best I've had in Austin, but delicious all the same. While stranded at a hotel, I pulled up Bite Squad and low and behold, this place will deliver hot bbq straight to you! Why order a cold sandwich when you can have a meat feast?- Sliced Brisked: Pretty great taste and very tender. My preference is fatty, moist brisket and the version that was delivered was more on the lean side. Next time, I'll have to specifically ask for moist, as I see other have left rave reviews. - Cream Corn: I could have easily eaten 5 pints worth. So creamy and good.- Coleslaw: I'm a fan! I know coleslaw is a throwaway side, but I love this version. Perfectly seasoned, vinegar-based deliciousness.- Sauces: Sauce game is on point. I loved the spicy, while my husband was a fan of the sweet. Also enjoyed the Dr. Pepper version as well. No, good bbq doesn't need sauce, but it never hurts to add on while sopping up juice with some bread. Yum!

Emiley, thanks for the kind words! We're so glad you had a great time swinging through and eating some BBQ. Awesome choice with the brisket and the sides you had with it. Way to go with the Dr Pepper sauce, as well! Come back again soon, Scotty - Owner

Every time I drive by the long-ass line at La Barbeque, I laugh silently to myself, because I know that if those people got off their phones and walked half a mile east, they would be enjoying a delicious plate of Scotty's BBQ, without the super long wait. I agree with most everyone else on here that this isn't a revelatory, best barbeque of your life, semi- or quasi- or full-on religious experience, but you know what, most of the time I just want some good goddamn barbeque that I don't have to wait an hour for, and this place certainly scratches that itch. Also, it's in a food truck park with lots of other options (including my other all-time favorite Kurry Takos, as well as Thai, Puerto Rican, and healthy-ish Southern-ish food), so it's a great place to head for a date, or with friends, who might have non-barbeque cravings and/or dietary preferences.

Amazing what a food truck can do!   Ordered the Scotty's Platter with brisket and add ribs.  The Dr Pepper sauce was delicious.  The beans were tasty and I like their potato salad.  After you order you can sit at a picnic table and pick from several sauces to add to your order.   Good smoke flavor. The ribs were fallen on the bone.  I would have liked my brisket just a tad more tender.  Your order comes with pickles and pickled onions.   We shared and had plenty.

Don't waste your time. I asked for burnt ends and the guy kinda looked as if he didn't know what I was talking about.  So what I actually got was slices of dry brisket from the end.  I didn't see what they had sliced until I got home.  The brisket was more like jerky and it was sliced with the grain...SMH.  It was not well seasoned. All I could taste was black pepper and smoke. The ribs were okay.

Visiting from California, first day in Austin. This place was about 3 miles from our hotel. Hands down best BBQ I've had so far. I ordered Scotty's plate, which included 2 meats, 2 sides, bread, pickles, the works! I ordered the brisket and pulled pork. Very tender and flavorful! For sides, I ordered the creamed corn and beans.. The creamed corn was AMAZING. This guy knows what he's doing! Hope to visit this place again before we go back home!1/18/16: Here for the second time. Terrance is awesome and cool. I had the sausage this time and by far my favorite thing in their menu, other than the creamed corn. You guys rock!!!

Didn't have to wait an hr for food. Always helps. Finger licking good. Definitely get ribs and brisket. All the sides; creamed corn, potato salad, beans and cole slaw. 2 plates will get what's mentioned. ($13.50+/plate) Ask for in house Dr.Pepper sauce.Cheers,Frederick L. Robinson II

Didn't have to wait an hr for food. Always helps. Finger licking good. Definitely get ribs and brisket. All the sides; creamed corn, potato salad, beans and cole slaw. 2 plates will get what's mentioned. ($13.50+/plate) Ask for in house Dr.Pepper sauce.Cheers,Frederick L. Robinson II

If you come into Austin on a Monday know that most of the famous BBQ joints will be closed. To our dismay we thought all hope was lost! But then a shining light at the end of the tunnel! We happened upon Scotty's a food truck in a little old red bus. Clarence, who worked the front window where you order, was as sweet as can be and was excellent at recommending the best selections on the menu. We would definitely recommend the Turkey as the best menu item we tried and  the pulled pork was pretty tasty. They offer three options for BBQ sauce: spicy, sweet and Dr. pepper with you guessed, Dr. pepper soda as the special ingredient.Definitely would recommend this to folks coming through Austin! Bon Appetite!
column21: University Hills and Windsor Park, Austin, TX

column20: This is my go to spot for authentic and real Texas Bbq!!Their Dr Pepper sauce is THEBOMB.COM. Always Hot juicy and Flavorful.Ask about the Dino Ribs.I mean everything is bigger in Tx so wait until you see that piece of meat

Excellent BBQ with good prices and a nice spot to sit and eat. Their meat definitely does not need sauce, like any good bbq should require, but if you so desire the flavor of their sauces will amaze you. Will definitely be coming back!

I'm still impressed...a whole day later! I throughly enjoyed 2 slices of tender, full of flavor, moist brisket, and 2 full of flavor, dry rub-seasoned, smoky delicious ribs. I topped it all off with the party-in-your-mouth spicy sauce. Oh.My.God!!! I also had the creamed corn and beans. All of it was the bomb.com! I met the owner who was very service oriented, his brother, who stopped by for a plate and friendly chat. Whenever I come back... You know where I'm going?!?! To the little red bus with the baby doll on the front!!! As crazy sounding as it was delicious!!!
Austin, TX 78703

Awesome! Love the divey vibe! It's right in the neighborhood and an easy walk for me to get there. They have a few beers on draft which is cool, I usually stick to Tito's and soda though. Bartenders are prompt and friendly. I like how they have the dividers up for covid. Definitely a must check out if you're in the area!

My girlfriend and I were downtown and she was thirsty. I was navigating to a sonic when we passed this bar and almost didn't notice it with its rustic exterior and outdoor seating right next to a barbecue joint. My girlfriend flipped a U-turn so that we could get her a beer. I had a double shot of silver tequila.The bartender greeted us with warmth in her voice as she took our order. The tables were spaced and the outdoor seating was pleasant and the weather was perfect as we sat in the sunshine and enjoyed our drinks. Someone came out and buster table as we sat there, and offered to take additional orders for drinks. I think will be back

We had never been here before the pandemic. When they finally let us have a little freedom it was the first place we went. We met some really cool people that both work here and are patrons. We have been back many times since and always have a good time. There is parking in the garage behind the bar, which is awesome for this area.

I NEVER come through Austin, without spending an afternoon destroying a platter of bbq nachos and a great selection of whiskeys and beers, with a few friends, or just solo at the bar, there at the Cat. Such a wonderful "Old Austin" holdout. So thankful these folks are still doing it right.
SHE SAID GRAPEFRUIT NOT CRANBERRY JUICE. Thank you Max for being dopeI have to write more to post this, I love alcohol and fun people!

Today was my first experience to this restaurant and to say I'm highly disappointed is an understatement. The staff was incredibly rude and kicked myself and my friend out because I wasn't wearing a mask while sitting outside..with NO ONE AROUND, mind you. These people are on power trips and have zero regard for humanity and customer service. I'm utterly disgusted and appalled at the way they treated myself and my friend. You would think with the current state of our world, these people would be grateful for anyone willing to give them business, obviously not the case. I will never be back and I will tell everyone I know not to support this business.

This place is a Johnny Cash shrine-LOVE IT!The staff was nice and the decor was fun. We met some local people and enjoyed beers on patio where space heaters are available.   Pet friendly. I'd definitely go back. I went here for my 50th Bday last Friday 12/11/20.  This is a pet friendly bar.

This may be her best bar in Austin.  The people who work here are the best.  I consider all of them my friends.  The people who drink here are also very friendly. The vibe, the music and the whole god damn place is awesome.  Come get a drink and relax

Been in Austin for over 16 years. This used to be such a little gem for me and my friends. In fact I remember going to this bar and 2006, before being renovated. But unfortunately the staff is just incredibly rude now. You would think coming out of a pandemic they would be grateful and thankful for business and be kind. Instead they're all rude and on power trips. How far they have fallen from the charming local Austin bar.
Austin, TX 78703

Well I'm not sure why it's taken me so long to check this place out, but I'm glad I finally did!! A very cool bar with an original "Austin" feel. It's got a great atmosphere with plenty of seating and there's a patio too. Drinks were affordable and good, and they have Stubbs bbq too. Omg yum. Can't go wrong at the mean eyed cat!

This place was incredible. Very good service and very good food. I had the nachos with jalapeño sausage and they were incredible. Topped with beans, queso, etc. they also play Johnny cash music so the atmosphere is great. If you're in the Austin area, I would definitely recommend going here. Small menu but all the food is incredible

It's a Johnny Cash themed dive bar - I mean, how cool is that!This was our last stop on the bike bar crawl thing. And man, it was one of my favorite stops. Inside is a motley mix of Americana. It's like a fancy shack got a makeover - complete with lazy boy recliners and lots of photos and knickknacks on the wall. I only had one drinks while here - a bloody mary. Because let me tell you, when you're hungover and on that darn bike in 100* weather nothing in the world tastes better than a bloody mary. It's probably the salt, to be honest. While it wasn't the best bm - the staff was super kind and pleasant and the atmosphere was one of a kind. Indoor, Outdoor, and everything in between -  loads of places to sit and not feel like you're in the middle of a ton of people.
Favorite bar in Austin. Good vibes for whatever is going on. Whether it's post workout, pregame, after work HH, you'll probably see me at MEC!

Johnny Cash themed dive bar. If you are in the area, it's well worth the price of a drink to hangout and look around. It's clean (bathrooms too)-that's HUGE! The staff are friendly, & drinks are reasonably priced (and quite tasty).  Lots of IPA draft options + others for the non IPA but hops lovin' folks of the world. I appreciate it didn't smell like an ashtray. Folks were smoking out on the patio, but not inside. I hung out to have a drink while waiting on some friends. They played great music and the bartenders were cool. It's a bigger place than I expected-various pockets of seating. I didn't have any of the BBQ onsite, but it did smell good. I'd recommend visiting this spot if you're in this neck of the woods. It surprised me in all the good ways.July 2019

Well I haven't ever been here but I've been looking for a man who comes here by the name of Ghost. It's really important I find him so if anyone has seen Ghost aka Keith please message me. It's a family emergency
One of the few Austin originals still left in the city. Amazing vibe, great beer selection, and a great all around atmosphere.

The servers were pretty inviting for a laid back dive bar. They made a delish vodka martini and the other patrons were calm for a Monday night which we really appreciated. We will definitely come back...apparently they served bbq but we didn't find where. We will be back to try that out!

Still the best bar ever. Very patient staff, willing to discuss the origins of the Lemon Drop shot, super interesting. Also, don't yell at the staff, they hate that. Except Max, he has self esteem issues. Anywho, go there. Have fun. Tell Dario his mask sucks.
Austin, TX 78703
Had a few drinks on the patio, not too crowded, the wait staff was good, I did not know until got my check, but they have Lone Star on the Happy Hour.

I've lived at the adjacent apartment complex for nearly six years and having The Mean Eyed Cat so convenient is a true benefit of living next door. There is always a great mix of folks here and many opportunities to chat-up other patrons. There is a cool vibe about this place that seems to put people in a good and friendly mood. Friendly staff, on-site BBQ, and sports on TV...This is a good after work hangout but is also very lively during football season as many out-of-state college alumni groups will descend when their team plays on Saturdays. The same is true on Sundays as NFL fans come to watch their favorite team.This is one of my favorite bars in Austin.
Need to spread the tables out on the patio and get some social distancing. Way to close.  Besides the wait staff, zero customers wearing masks.  Took a good shower after my Happy Hour.

Fun interesting bar with a strong dedication to Johnny Cash.  Super tough to describe because there are so many different rooms and seating options.  The bar itself isn't large at all but the super friendly bartenders kick out the drinks quickly and have great memories.  Walls are plastered with a variety of Cash photos and other beer/alcohol signs.  Young crowd that's easy to mix or get along with.  Large beer menu and strong drinks.  Bonus, across the street from El Arroyo so you have the chance to read their ever entertaining sign.
column21: Corona Del Mar, Newport Beach, CA

column20: First impressions are everything and this place delivered. We'd never been here before and all the bartenders were extremely welcoming and pleasant. Demario (I'm probably butchering his name) recommended some great hot drinks since it was chilly last night. He gave us a history of the bar and was just a all around nice guy. All the other bartenders seemed to have the same nice Demeanor as well.The patio area was super cute and was not overly busy at all. Got a great seat under George(the old giant tree)   and enjoyed our Hot Toddys and spiked apple ciders. I can't comment on the food because we didn't eat-but I can say with confidence we will be back.
Awesome bar and restaurant. Make sure you head to the back and grab some brisket. Ask for Jamie. She's the best! You never know when Johnny Cash might show up.

Unique does not even begin to describe this bar. It is a nicer version of a "dive bar" that is a tribute to Johnny Cash. The place is huge. There is a really nice outdoor patio complete with big screen TV. There is plenty of different seating options inside with couches, tables, and chairs. The bartenders are super on point even when it is hopping. I was given a great recommendation of combining two of the beers on tap, so feel free to ask the knowledgeable bartenders for their suggestions. They have Stubbs BBQ, but we didnt try as we had already eaten. The decor is cool and the music is funky. Very casual atmosphere. Find free parking in the garage adjacent.

We found this place while searching somewhere near us. It had Johnny Cash memories everywhere. Their barbecue was so good! We had brisket tacos and chicken nachos. I will say, the nachos order was huge! If you are by yourself, definitely get a half order or share! Very friendly service and offered great advice on places to not miss while we are here.
It has gotten stale.Service is meh...food is horrific but decor is niceTime to move along
Austin, TX 78703

This was a pretty cool spot, very much an Austin bar.  I was surprised to see the Johnny Cash theme throughout the bar, it was pretty well done.  We came for late night drinks, so I can't speak to the food.  They weren't crowded at all for a Friday night.  We came in and there was plenty of space at the bar and out on the patio.  The weather was great so we opted for a picnic table on the patio.  It was cool out, so they had heat lamps running...always nice.  The patio also had a TV, built into a stone chimney, to keep us entertained.We ordered drinks at the bar inside, but more than one member of the waitstaff checked in on us constantly.  They also kept the table clear of empty glasses.  We hung out for a few hours, into the wee hours, and never felt pressured to leave.  Another bonus, there is free parking right next door in a parking garage!

Johnny cash bash smack dab in the middle of Austin! Place is neat and great chill spot. Prices are avg bar staff easy to talk to (its their job i know but some bartenders these days) Either way. It was exactly what I expect from a bar. No gimmicks just drink and chill
This place was not so pleasing. The barbeque meat wasn't hot. The pork ribs were a bit hard. Wouldn't recommend this place for Texas barbeque.

Awesome Johnny Cash inspired dive bar! Went over here with some friends and we really enjoyed the atmosphere. If you are inside and need to look at the menu for the drinks, just look up, it's in the ceiling as well I discovered it too late but they actually got a BBQ in the back! Check it out and sit inside or outside. One of my favorite bars so far.

It wasn't too busy at lunch time.  The key is to get there before noon.  I had the in-house sausage sandwich with potato salad and cole slaw.  The sammy was tasty with a little stubs bbq sauce.  The side pickles and potato salad were good as well. Seemed s little pricey at the time.  I was hungry so no pics thus time.  Also there are tables near the ordering station well as the bar. Enjoy.

Such a cool spot to hang out at. They staff was really friendly and service was good. We stop by this place during our pub crawl, wish we had more time to check out this place longer but we will definitely come by on our next visit. It cool in side with all the old school memorabilia of Johnny Cash. It's kinda out of the way but cool to place to chill at.

I came here before I started the Fall 2015 semester .. my fun memory this year! lolI loved loved loved this place. So eclectic and cool. had a few of the speciality drinks:1) spicy margarita - dont recall exact name but it had floating jalapenos in it and spiced rim. Absolutely delicious!2) some drink similar to an old-fashioned. yum but it was super strong. Let's just say I got my $$ worth on this one. and I had to order food afterward... which was great since they have Stubb's BBQ inside of this bar. Great times, good music, cool ambiance. and they love their regulars there... someday I hope to be one.
Super cool staff clean place, everything Johnny Cash, safe, fun, great barbecue place in the back and sushi place next-door perfect for an Austin fun time!!!
One of my favorite bars. Bartenders are friendly and they have a good beer selection. Johnny Cash themed!!
Austin, TX 78703

How can you not love this place?  It is full of character and a taste of Austin culture that I hope we never loose as newer developments come in.  My Seattle hometown unfortunately lost most of it's Mean Eyed Cat's, and became a land of look alike Starbucks. After visiting this establishment several times now, I am hopeful that Austin will be able to maintain hints of it's local color.  Mean Eyed Cat is all things Johnny Cash, and even if you are with a group of boring people, your eye will easily be diverted and entertained by the numerous diverse Johnny Cash memorabilia decorating the walls.  There is ample free parking outside, and unique comfortable sitting inside and out.  You go up to the bar to order, and they even have a small menu of Stubbs BBQ to order for eats.  They recently didn't have any cider on tap, but are currently updating their taps they said.  My friend enjoyed a white wine, while the rest had some beers.  Always a great time here.  It can get crowded at the peak times.  But I always seem to happen upon this place to start out an evening downtown, which is always early and slower.

A Johnny Cash tribute bar housed in a former chainsaw repair shop - it's covered in everything Johnny and June Carter Cash (ticket stubs, posters, paintings) and has a ton of rustic charm.  They have great cocktails and a lot of beers on tap!  Stubb's sells food here as well!  Vegetarians, they have some delicious sides and a salad! Cool outdoor seating under a 300+ year old Texas Live Oak and tons of indoor seating as well!  There's a ton of parking because of the shopping center just next to it (that houses a couple of restaurants and a nail salon).  This place is so Austin.  Full of charm and unique.  And yet it's not as popular as a lot of other places!  Definitely give it a shot!

Austin's finest! A Johnny Cash shrine doubling as an atmospheric bar. While it certainly helps,  you do not have to be a Johnny Cash fan to appreciate MEC.Right next to a former workplace, this was the go-to place for corporate happy hours or when we needed a break. Relax outside on the super cool patio under an old huge Live Oak tree! Grab some nachos from Stubbs BBQ inside & drink some good beers! Blood and Honey and Thirsty Goat on tap. Friendly bartenders, respectable selection of local beers, lovely atmosphere, bbq, & live music on the weekends, what's not to love? 5 Stars fo' sure!

I absolutely love it that The Mean Eyed Cat has so many lives, and has once again survived the opportunistic monolithic building takeover of downtown Austin. From tiny wooden church, to funky saw shop, to Johnny Cash shrine, to shuttered up. We were worried when it closed. But check it out: it's back, and it's even better after its latest makeover!A few inner walls are missing, along with the back porch screen enclosure and the wide stage, which has moved indoors. But all of the cool Johnny Cash kitsch, downtown Austin vibe remains, along with a friendly, efficient staff. And the new open layout is very Feng Shui, which only helps the vibe flow freely, both indoors and out back to the rows of picnic tables. I'm beyond thrilled that my wish for food in my previous review has been granted, by none other than Austin's own STUBB'S BBQ! That's right, the Cat isn't just for drinking and dancing anymore; there's BBQ too, in the form of Stubb's BBQ pulled pork nachos and BBQ sausage, both regular and Jalapeno cheddar, and sliders. You can even order BBQ by the pound. I've included some menu photos that might make you hitch up the wagon.This just might be Austin's finest dive bar.

For those who remember the quirky and much-loved Liberty Lunch downtown, this place might be its grandchild, at least in spirit.  This is a live music, open-patio venue that is a shrine to the late Johnny Cash, and is as quirky as Austin gets.As some other reviewers have noted, it's a re-purposed building that used to be a saw shop, and there are huge round blades hanging on the walls.  But if you look a little closer at the architecture and some of the furnishings, you'll see that the main building also used to be a church....one of those really cool tiny wooden churches with wooden framed records of attendance on the outside by the doors (they're still there; they now hold photos or announcements sheets) and hand-hewn windows.  Some of the deacons wrote their names and the year in the wet cement on the sidewalk that leads out the back to the patio where the bands perform.  Patrons and waitstaff tromp across them all night long.  The stage has three "pulpits" for the microphones with funky sayings on them and across the stage.  Someone has quite the sense of humor.  But the object of worship in this "church" is Johnny Cash.  His photos, sayings, lyrics, and other tributes permeate the place, and if you don't like the band that night, you can entertain yourself by scanning the walls, ceiling, and even floors to see what treasures are on display.  The inside fills up quickly and feels a little suffocating to me, but the live music happens outside anyway.  The patio is covered but is screened in on the sides for an open feel.  There's plenty of seating at large picnic bench type tables.The bands start pretty early on weeknights (830 or so) and there usually isn't a cover, which is kind of nice for folks with day jobs who just want to hang out for a few hours before heading home.  The house sound system is well balanced and plenty loud in such a small space. There's a nice selection of quality beers, not just the usual boring Lite or Bock fare you often find.  Prices are reasonable. The only improvement I would make is to have them serve food of some kind.  Just fries or even bags of nuts and chips.  But they don't, so you'll need to eat first or step out later for a bite at El Arroyo across the street or the sushi place up the block.Parking is a snap even though there's a tiny lot, because the garage behind them is open at night, and currently doesn't charge for parking.  The location right on 5th next to MoPac makes this place easy to find.

Hands-down the best hockey bar in all of Austin. Owned and operated by a hockey player and local wonderful employees, great Patrons, and always hockey on. I have only been twice but know that I will continue to frequent this location as I enjoy great food, supplied by their partnership with a wonderful barbecue supplier. Additionally a very attentive, thoughtful, and kind stuff. So much so that after a very brief conversation about having a newborn son we were greeted with a onesie for him! How wonderful is that? Additionally when asking for a specific game to view we were met with immediate results and smiles, Red Wings win in overtime!
Couldn't be any worse. Uber ride out there on a Saturday and doorman says they are closed?!?!  Private event. No notice on the website. How does someone run a place like that?

So glad we came across this gem in Austin! Great bartenders that pick awesome selections of drinks you may prefer especially if you're just passing through. Amazing barbecue from Stubbs as well which went fantastically with the beer Will be back most definitely!

Nice kitty kitty... The Mean Eyed Cat watering hole is a nice tucked away joint, not in the overall  mix of the 6th street gridlock of bars of Austin.... If your drinking here you gotta search it out before you belly up to the bar. This kinda reminds me of Uncle Bubba's place, because you feel at home instantly. The decor of THE MEAN EYES cat is something borrowed. I'd bet ya $20 that all this stuff was found on the side of the road or a yard sale.Kinda like drinking beer in the garage with a group of friends. That wonderful down home feeling helps ya all you toss a few brews back while you go into chill mode!
Austin, TX 78732

It's been a while since we've been in Texas as we got stuck out in California due to covid. 9 months to be exact. We missed Jim's BBQ more than any others i. The area by far, and we've tried them all. We just finished dinner and I've got to say, he out did himself yet again! The brisket was as always on point, and the ribs were fall off the bone perfection.  None of it had too over powering a Smokey or salty flavor. The balance was right on! The sides are always just as good and didn't disappoint. Glad to see he's still rocking it despite the tough times. We will be back for sure!

Decided to go here because of the amazing reviews on yelp. It did not disappoint!! Like others have said, it deserves more than 5 stars. Should've taken a pic but we dived right in. Ordered the daily special B-RAD Bomber Sandwich - Sausage, pulled pork, cheese, pico; the Brisket Sandwich, both tacos, with Mac & Cheese, Green Chile Corn, and Sriracha Coleslaw. The sandwiches were both incredible, and the Mac & cheese was the best we've had in a long time! I got the smallest sides, and they were plenty for 2! Also grabbed the banana creme pie - which was a large portion and so delicious. The covered sitting area had strong fans, TVs (they weren't on we didn't need them), corn hole, and ping pong. We were there early on a weeknight and with COVID it was perfect we were the only ones eating there. The staff were very kind. We live in Leander, but would happily make the trip to eat here again. It's a must try!
Dinosaur beef rib, Poblano Corn Chowder & Banana Cream Pie were all excellent. Outdoor seating area is nice, with fans and ping pong & corn hole! Clearly passionate owner, great quick bbq stop

Why Jim's Smokehouse has not been featured on the cover of the Austin Chronicle or Texas Monthly is a mystery to me.I am a 5th Generation Texan barbecue historian. There are 5 top places on my list within a 150 mile radius of Lake Travis, and Jim's Smokehouse is at the top in the #1 slot.The Black Angus brisket is outstanding. Talk about the place downtown with the 6 hour wait all you care to, Jim's Smokehouse beats them without question, without the 6 hour lines.Seriously, WA Brennan, it's about time you made a trip to the lake and tried Jim's Smokehouse.

My brother and I are 7th generation native Texans who cook and eat good barbecue about as often as we can. He lives near San Antonio, I live near Austin, and we often meet at one of our favorite spots to visit with each other and check up on a place in our Top Five List. One of my newest top fives is Jim's Smokehouse. I'm slow to run through the menu over several visits when I locate a good one, so I can only speak to what I've eaten so far. That said, it takes only a bite of their brisket to indicate the quality of the rest of the fare. If a place has brisket that's been treated right, everything else on the menu supports it. Sides are sides at most spots, and when I want the traditional potato salad, coleslaw, and beans, I know where to go. When I hit a place that vamps on that tradition, and does so with great success, I take note. The said, order the slaw...just do it. I was so taken with Jim's jicama slaw that I brought some home for my wife to try. That right there is sayin' something. The brisket tastes, looks, and otherwise behaves like Prime, but I haven't asked, and it's hard to tell with the Black Angus at Jim's Smokehouse. Some places advertise "We use Angus beef," but Black Angus is different; the marbling is distributed evenly, and a correctly done Black Angus brisket will tower head and shoulders over the best of other brisket breeds, as it does at Jim's.The sausage, made-to-spec in Llano, is a delight; meaty, just the right spice, Texas as all get out. Don't miss it. The sauces are main-course quality...complex, complementary.Jim's has done outdid theirselves with Key Lime Pie and Strawberry "gravy." Yes, pie! Grandmother's recipe, done respectfully by a CIA chef. Have a bite of pie, then supper...you will thank me.I should admit here that I have never waited in line to eat at that popular place just off 35 in Austin, though folks I trust tell me it's worth the wait, and I bet it's good and all, but I would have to drive right past Jim's Smokehouse to get there, and so far I just haven't found a reason to do that.

This food truck is outstanding. Tacos are gigantic. Mac and cheese is soo creamy (Mmmmm) . The BBQ sandwich with an egg is truly out of this world. Everything is fresh, made to order, and supremely delicious It would be a huge mistake driving by and not placing and order.  Huge.

5 words, Fantastic! (and repeat that five times). I had one each of the tacos, and I'm super impressed! Not only are they decently priced ($5 each), but they are humongous! Top off with some BBQ sauce and you have a killer lunch!

I'm visiting a friend here in Austin and my request while is town was for some " good BBQ". Well, Jim's smokehouse delivered. We literally ordered a little bit of everything!! My favorite was the Mac and cheese with pulled pork on top, as well as the brisket. But ALL OF IT WAS DELICIOUS!!!! You will not be disappointed.  When we pulled up, gun store and BBQ in same parking lot- I knew I had arrived in TEXAS!!

Honestly, it's the best smoked meat I've ever had in my life! So Delicious! Your MUST place to visit and eat when you're in the area! I'm sure one day I'll come back here and visit Jim's Smokehouse restaurant ;)
Austin, TX 78732

Unbelievable bbq so fresh and clean with not a lot of stuff on it. These guys were on the number one spot in the bbq business very soon. The brisket and ribs was incredible and the sides were some of the best I've ever had. I love it.

Wowzers. World class BBQ has finally come to Lakeway.I've passed this trailer for several months, and aside from the alluring smoke, there was consistently a line around lunch time. "I have to check that place out one of these days..."Well, that day came and now I'm kicking myself for not coming here sooner. The wife and I went hard and ordered half the menu. Just about every plate was an out-of-the-park-homerun.I'll start with the brisket. A few other reviews have grumbled about the brisket being dry and Jim's is definitely a tale of two briskets. If you order lean, it is on the dry side. If you order moist, it's sublime. Not quite good enough to dethrone Snow's, but then again you're not driving 2.5 hours to the middle of nowhere on a Saturday morning.The Jalapeno cheddar sausage however, did overtake my current top spot (Black's BBQ). It does away with the greasy, mealy texture at Black's and instead packs in an incredible smokey heat. These are legitimately spicy, but well worth it.I was blown away with the Sriracha coleslaw. No mayo in sight, just fresh, crisp flavors to refresh your palette in between bites. Brilliant.I'll echo all of the other Yelpers: Do yourself a favor and get the key lime pie. Wonderfully tart, not too sweet, absolutely killer.Not only was Brad friendly, but my wife was doubly impressed by his to-go order packing skills. Typically BBQ will leak through butcher paper, but Brad lined the bottom of our bag with aluminum foil...the devil is in the details.

Absolutely worth the hype! Finally stopped in today (11/21/20) after passing this place daily for what seems like forever. Jim's deserves all the stars! We tried the moist brisket, Dinosaur Beef Rib, jalapeño/cheddar sausage, turkey, Dan's Special Pulled Pork sandwich, and medium sized scalloped potatoes, and Mac n' Cheese.The brisket was spectacular! The beef rib was perfection!The sausage was super good!Turkey was moist and delicious!Pulled pork was awesome!Sides were both really good, though not great.But, still, good!We will be back for sure!For us, it was all about that brisket and ribs!!

I picked up a pound of everything for a family lunch yesterday. Not only was it on time, friendly service, everyone raved about the food. I'm a Native Austinite, and this is great BBQ! We also loved the sides, especially the jicama slaw.

Brisket is aplenty here in the capitol city so it's always harder on bbq places to get the coveted 5 star rating. Jim's proudly deserves this honor. First of all, the people there were incredibly friendly. I had questions and they had answers with a side of friendly. But more than that, the brisket was cooked perfectly, had a great smoke ring and wonderful flavor. We especially liked the pepper vinegar sauce. One of the dangers of this place is that we enjoy exploring new places, but when we have something like this it's easy to make it your go to place. Great experience overall and we look forward to being frequent patrons.
Absolutely the best Pulled Pork Sandwich I have ever had.their Brisket and sausage are great as well, but can't get past the Pulled Pork.fantastic

Absolutely fantastic Pulled Pork Sandwich: Key Lime Pie was good and Moist Brisket and Jalapeno Sausage was fantastic as Well.Five Stars and Thumbs Up: as everything is made to order, call ahead for faster service.

Absolutely the best flavors, temperature, service and outside environment. Incredible all around. We have had almost everything on the menu over the last year. Please make sure to order any deserts along side the BBQ - That is the icing on the cake! I love the key-lime pie the best - Enjoy!
The food is decent. Unfortunately they will rip you off by charging you for a pound of meat but only give you 1/2 lb. This has happened twice now. Very sketchy service
Austin, TX 78732
Fantastic brisket and dessert (and everything else, friendly service, fun story, this is our go-to spot on the way home from the lake.

Absolutely amazing BBQ and service. The brisket, ribs and bird were all on point. While we were waiting one of the guys inside came out and gave us some burnt ends, my son's response was priceless: "How do they get food to taste this good?!?!".Don't forget the key lime pie, was also delicious.

This little bbq truck had some promising reviews, so we thought we'd try it. We had the ribs and brisket tacos. The tacos were just decent, and while the meat really does fall off the bone  for the ribs...they were not very good.You could tell it was a cheap cut of meat - which anyone knows...no amount of smoking, grilling, etc. can fix that.If you're nearby, it's okay - but not worth a long drive.

This is a hot off the press review. Just had our meal from Jim's and OMG!!! So, so good! I had to give credit where credit is due. I'm not normally as passionate to leave a review unless my experience sucked. The BEST ribs I've ever had. I don't like ribs. They're ok. Not my thing. These were my thing. I couldn't stop saying oh my, oh my. We got the brisket, Mac n cheese, sriracha slaw, and Maui waui taco. The TACO y'all! The flavor was incredible. So glad we found this gem close to home. I hate wasting money on crap food. That's not happening here. Quality and taste can not be beat! And if you need a gun and gas while your waiting, you are in luck! Lol
So amazing!! We luv yal! Great food!! Great location!! Great people!!  Turned me from a vegan to meat eater again ----

Okay this place deserves 10 stars. From the extremely friendly staff to the insanely delicious food, you can bet I'll be coming back and telling people about this little spot! The brisket was melt in your mouth tender and the cheddar jalapeño sausage was the best I've ever had! Highly recommend getting the scalloped potatoes too. Everyone in my group kept eyeing mine!! And please do yourself a favor and save some room for some key lime pie (his grandmas recipe). IT WAS SO GOOD! My mouth is currently watering just thinking about it. Thank you for an awesome Texas bbq experience!!!!
Visiting here from Miami..and this is amazing place..The best ribs ever. must visit if you re on Vacation in Austin. 6 stars

OH MY GOD Jim's is amazing! I came with my family and everything was perfection. I had Dan's Special which was incredible, And for dessert I had the Banana Creme Pie which it literally the best pie I've ever had in my entire life!! If you're in Austin and are looking for a real good place, come to Jim's!!
Their chopped brisket sandwich was SO good! Definitely top 3 I've ever had! The portion they give you is quite generous!
Austin, TX 78732
Amazing BBQ and great, friendly service. A really cute roadside place with room for the kids to run around. The perfect stop on our trip to Lake Travis!
Amazing Dinosaur rib dish. Try the scalloped potatoes. Very generous portions. You can spit the dinosaur Rob :-)

A Must Stop and Try. Today we order both of their sandwhiches, ribs, mac n cheese, and cole slaw. All was amazing. If you want to try some Texas BBQ this is the place y'all. We've also had the Banana verme dessert. You have to get this.
Very good roadside bbq close to Mansfield Dam. Got two orders of the 2-meat sampler with sides. The corn is very spicy, which I like. Worth a visit! I will come back.
This place is great. Stop and get some awesome bbq and play games or take your food to a park down by the dam.
Jim's a great Food is excellent!  Love the de Leon taco.  I'll be by a few times a week.
I got the brisket, my wife the sausage, both were on point, and  we got the key lime pie for desert. The service was amazing, very polite and quick.
Best little hidden gem.... great BBQ... cooll owner!   Spicy sausage & the beans wweeeee da bomb!
De Leon Tacos are delight!  Perfectly soft!!!  Jim's Smokehouse is  quite friendly and easy-going.  They deserved FIVE-STARS!!!
Austin, TX 78732
Amazing service and food! Loved the outdoor seating with fun games to play.
Delicious ribs and sides. Save room for the key lime pie because it's on point!! Will definitely be back
Really delicious! The two gentlemen went out of their way to make us feel at home and make sure we were enjoying our food and offered samples. Fast service as well. Will definitely come back.

Sooooo good. I'm from south Texas so I'm extra picky with my bbq and Jim's was great! We ordered basically the whole menu between my family and everything was delicious. The chopped brisket mac&cheese was our favorite!
Best brisket and ribs I have had in quite a while.  Moist and juicy.  Full of flavor.Great sides too.  Will definitely be back.

Absolutely delicious BBQ with a great back story.  Jim is actually the namesake for this amazing place.  It was named after Jim for his great BBQ recipe and the love and respect of the owner... I think Brad was his name. [Sorry if I got the wrong].  Definitely worth checking out. We really liked the food and friendliness of the owner.  We had the turkey, ribs and brisket. The scallop potatoes were yummy.  All delicious!Please support this place.

Came here with my coworkers and had a good conversation with Brad who runs the joint. We ordered the brisket, pork ribs, and mac n cheese which ended up being absolutely amazing. Collectively, we agreed this was the best bbq experience we've had in Austin. Being out-of-towners, we make it a point to try the best food in town whenever we travel and so far , Jim's Smokehouse is in the lead. You're doing your grandpa Jim proud, Brad! Cheers!

BBQ food trailer by the dam - how good can it be?  Pretty dang good! - that's how good. We ordered all the different meats and went with the mac & cheese and jicama salad for the sides. Finished it off with the key lime pie for dessert. Everything was great. It's just a matter of time before word gets out about Jim's Smokehouse!
Best BBQ in the 620/Lake area, by far.  Baby Back Ribs were perfect, and the Pulled Pork Sandwich was overflowing with delicious smoked meat.
Austin, TX 78748

This was only my third time eating here. The first two times were underwhelming. But this time? Fantastic!! I think once you start eating your way through Austin, you can see the wide range of food and quality out there. The meat was super moist, everything was flavorful. Pandemic ordering (with about an hour wait as the earliest pickup time) online, and then contactless pickup from a table in front of the truck. Excited to go back!

I first tried Valentina's on an unseasonably cold evening, so opted for take out. It was excellent, so I knew I had to go back for the full experience. My boyfriend and I waited for the first sunny day, and we were off. Here's what we went for:-pulled chicken sandwich - 8/10: solid, noms-brisket taco - 11/10: omg loved this-steak fajita taco - 10/10: tad salty but delish-carnitas taco - 10/10: I don't even like pork-potato salad - 8/10: standard sideOk so technically I got the sandwich no bread.. so chicken pile with toppings, but low carb and yummy. I also think it's brilliant if you're wanting to try a bunch of meats, but don't want to commit to a full pound. Loophole!We had already sampled many of the meats as part of our takeout feast, but the brisket was a new add. I took at least 4 bites of my boyfriend's taco innards. SO GOOD.Based on my now cumulative experiences, I'd highly recommend the carnitas, brisket and chicken. Corn and caramelized onions were my toppings of choice. Made a little DIY taco bowl action at home.Outdoor space is cute and spacious - perfect for a sunny day.TL;DR wait for a warm day and order ahead online. All of the meats are epic, so I'd order a few by the pound and try others by opting for sandwiches sans bread. A bunch of outdoor bars down the road, so make a day of it!

First time checking out this place, had never even heard of it before and sorta stumbled on it. Right now they do take-out only & you have to pre-order online. My experience was just a single taco with brisket smothered with avocado on the inside. From the flour of the tortilla to the brisket quality, hands-down one of the best briskets I've ever had and not to mention the tortilla & avo were amazing but complimented the brisket nicely.Eager to come back here & order plenty more of the brisket!

I am fairly new to town and sooo many people rave about Valentina's and how great it is. Today I decided to give it a try. I was excited there wasn't a line and barely anyone sitting at the tables. I proceeded to the truck and tried to order. The staff member says, "all orders are online" in kind of a rude tone. I brushed it off and started ordering online. I paid and then I noticed my two tacos and pulled pork sandwich wouldn't be ready for an hour!!! So I said to myself this can't be right, I go to the same window to the same lady and asked is this the correct wait time? And with even more attitude she says, "I told you it tells you the wait time before you order" I don't know what I did to this lady for her to be an a-hole but I didn't notice the wait time sheesh. I waited and finally ate and I was honestly not really impressed and the horrible service left a really bad taste in my mouth. Even if this place had the best bbq in the universe I wouldn't spend a penny at an establishment with that kind of service. Definitely my first and last time.

The food here is pretty great.  Downside is the service.  You order ahead online, are told to wait and hour and a half for you food to pick up.  Then you arrive and realize you need to wait an additional 40 minutes.  It's kind of absurd really. Just get a better estimate of when people should show up as no one enjoys wasting their time waiting.Ridiculous.  Just an update, service here is still dogshit.Thanks

The food here is pretty great.  Downside is the service.  You order ahead online, are told to wait and hour and a half for you food to pick up.  Then you arrive and realize you need to wait an additional 40 minutes.  It's kind of absurd really. Just get a better estimate of when pekoe should show up as no one enjoys wasting their time waiting.Ridiculous.  Dropping it to two stars actually.  What a joke.  If you choose to come here plan on nothing being prepared when you're told.

Like in "A Chorus Line" - Food? 10; Service? 3. Even knowing the difference between time ordered and time delivered, I was not prepared for the 30 minute additional delay. My impatience was magnified because I skipped breakfast in anticipation. This was a Wednesday lunch, not a Friday, when everyone goes out to lunch. The best part of a wonderful meal was Algo Dulce ("something sweet"), arguably the best flan I've ever had.

Phenomenal, worth-the-wait BBQ. When you arrive, know that you must put your order in on-line. Check the wait ahead of time, because you can order before you get there, so you can time your food to be ready when it's convenient.  Our first visit was on a Sunday. It was an hour wait, we almost left, but the reviews made us stay. I hope I can encourage you to do the same! I ordered a pulled pork taco and brisket taco for myself. My husband had the brisket (moist) with corn tortillas. (Gluten free meal). We split the street corn. First, the brisket. Oh how amazing. It is so tender, it completely falls apart. Each little sliver of brisket packs so much flavor, and when they are combined into one bite, you'll realize it was worth the wait. Smoky, salty, flavor drenched brisket. It's the best I've ever had. The tacos are delicious, simple and flavorful. A good way to sample several meats of you don't want to commit to buying meat by the pound. The street corn was probably some of the best I've ever had, spicy, flavorful. We also got the chips and queso. The chips are phenomenal and the queso.... Yipes it was good. It was spicy, packed with several cheeses, the chips are made fresh. I would have been happy with the chips and queso alone, (except now I know how good their BBQ is). This visit inspired another a few days later on the way to the Austin airport. This time we got more brisket, spicy sausage, and ribs, as well as potato salad. The potato salad was good, fresh, with firm potatoes, refreshing on a hot day. The ribs fell off the bone. Usually I expect BBQ sauce on my ribs, and we had some on the side, but I didn't use it because these ribs were smoked with so much flavor, they held their own!The spicy sausage had a great flavor, texture, wonderful. But the star of the show, the leading lady, will always be the brisket. Standing ovation. Y'all get yourself down to Valentina's Tex Mex BBQ and enjoy the smoke show!

Located outside of Austin.  There are a lot of places to sit.  Went on a weekday and did not have any problem finding seating.  SERVICE: Staff was friendly and the food came out pretty fast.  FOOD: BBQ sandwich was decent but when samplinging the meat by itself, did not find that smokey rich flavor that I have come to expect with Texas BBQ, especially with all of the great BBQ joint in and around Austin.  Meat was tender but flavor is the biggest component of excellent BBQ.  The sausage was probably the best part of the meal but still not the best sausage around town.  Worth a try but did not meet my expectations of what Texas BBQ is all about.
Austin, TX 78748

This is seriously some awesome tex-mex. The food here is absolutely fantastic I give it a 10/10. I would return back here for the brisket any time. The carne and pulled pork were also really juicy and flavorful. The only issue was they forgot to give us the smoked corn. They brought it after we already finished eating. Other than that the service was friendly. All of the meat was high quality and tender. If you want a ride on the tex mex flavor town train be sure to check this place out when you're in Austin...

We were in Austin for the weekend and we found this gem on Yelp. We didn't know what to expect but when we saw many people picking up orders and the delicious smell we decided to order. Seems it's a local favorite. It was the best BBQ we have eaten in a long time. My husband was happy when he realized he would be back in Austin in a few weeks and could get some more.
Food is great. Service sucks. You need to order online and wait a hour and half. Definitely not coming back. Hello Terry Blacks.

I was excited to try this place out and wanted to like this place but I was very disappointed. I ordered a carnitas taco  and brisket. The taco was soaked in the meat juice and the brisket didn't have much flavor. Kind of pricey for what you get. Skimpy portions.

Taking one star off for the extremely annoying lady at the window mocking my order cuz I didn't know the "chico" size was "only two bites" (insert major eye roll here). And I tried to order a chicken dish, but not available until 11....umm, it's 1056 (insert another eye roll).

Bruh. Where do I start. The hubs and I are coming from San Antonio to Austin for a day trip. I'm looking up breakfast spots and someone wrote about Valentina's; the thing that got me was a pic of one of their breakfast tacos. So we put the directions on and soon we're kinda off the normal path (technically Manchaca, TX). Then we see billowing smoke that lets us know brisket is ahead. We ordered the Real Deal Holyfield, the Ultimate Bean & Chz w/ Brisket + scrambled egg and the Manchaca. The tacos came out quick and we inhaled them in 5 minutes. They were huge! The brisket was so juicy, I bit through it like soft butter (yes, The fried egg in the RDH was a delicious touch. The Serrano salsa was a perfect  compliment to all of the flavors. All snuggled in a righteous homemade flour tortilla. *Side note: we have been trying to go "meatless" a few days a week.* This was the first meat we've had this week and it seriously has me reconsidering the "meatless" venture.

Five stars for the flour tortillas alone! I got $45-$50 worth of meat and other things and everything was exceptional and stretched out to more meals throughout the week... From breakfast to lunch to dinner!If you don't order ahead, order online and then head to South Austin Beer Garden for a beer or two and then make your way back and your food should be ready.The queso and chips are not to be missed, either. I love that it's not in the city proper; makes it more of an adventure!
Brisket Taco was spectacular, perfect texture, moist. THE FOOD WAS AMAZING. Just know you have to order ahead of time online, sometimes it takes a while
NO ONE SHOULD WAIT 4 HOURS FOR TACOS. The wait is horrific. There are better service bbq places, same taste.
Austin, TX 78748

We tried Valentina's because of the high reviews on Yelp.  Upon arrival, at 11 am, they were transitioning from breakfast to lunch.  We had to wait around 20 min for this to take place.  We were in line like 45 minutes total.  There were like only 6 people in front of us in line. Our total was $80. It was another 25 minutes before our food arrived.The meats were moist and tender.  The only drawback was there was no smoke flavor which I would expect from BBQ.  For the cost of the food I would like my food to have more flavor.  The barbacoa taco also followed this trend, moist, tender but lacking much flavor.Overall the food got 2 out of three things right.  They were moist and tender but not much flavor.  I have had bbq with all three at cheaper prices back in Houston.  It's more of a tourist spot in my opinion.

Great very tasty brisket tacos Very long wait next time will call in orderNext timeNo bathrooms except for port ay potties Gross situation Will return when they have adequate sanitation bathroomsFood great

TexMex at its finest! I'm blown away by their flavors!Oaxaca sausage - great flavor and gooeyness Smoked pulled chicken taco with citrus guacamole-  you can taste the mesquite wood and the guacamole keeps it moist. Yumm!Smoked carnitas taco - Smokey and delicious Cerveza braised beef tacos - wow this is my fav taco now!

What a wonderful food truck! Currently during COVID they are primarily order online. Do so early or you risk missing out on anything that they run out of. Also found that order to ready time can be 2+ hours so plan in advance. I've had most things on the menu, I would say anything with a tortilla, there's something in those tortillas that make them amazing, although they forgot to put some in my last order of BBQ so make sure you check the bag. Other than tacos (my favorite is brisket), I liked the fatty brisket (moist), beef rib (huge). I was just ok on the pork ribs and sausage. Eat here! Will not regret it!

Quick trip to Austin the other day. We stopped by @valentinastexmexbbq and we were just amazed on how good this was . Its an interesting combination of Tex Mex BBQ that quickly drew our attention. The Holy field taco is what best represents this mix of flavor. Topped with fried egg, refried beans, potatoes, bacon and Brisket on a flour tortilla served with Serrano salsa was truly a unique experience.**What we had:Holy field tacoSliced Brisket sandwichSmoked carnita tacos.

DO NOT order online for pickup no matter what you do. The line moves faster and they prioritize people in line over the orders with a pickup time. Our order was over an hour and a half late and after standing next to the pickup table for almost 2 hours they gave my order to someone else. By the time it was finally addressed they had sold out of two of the items I had ordered.5 stars for food but all over 2 stars for severe neglect of your prepaid customers.

We'd had BBQ from Valentina's a couple of years ago. We'd picked it up with our family a little late and didn't get enough because when they sell out, they're done.This year we wanted something special for New Year's Eve so we placed a to-go order at 7:30 am, right when they open. I picked up brisket, ribs, sausage and sides of corn, Charro beans and slaw at about 8:30 in pouring rain. I was hungry when I got home and tempted to have some BBQ for breakfast. It smelled amazingly good. I stuck to my guns though and put it in the fridge for dinner. We warmed it up for dinner (meat in the oven, sides in the microwave) and it was well worth the wait. The brisket was incredible: tender and really tasty. The ribs were fall-off-the-bone cooked and just marvelous. The sausage had a nice taste and was just spicy enough. Their corn was really amazing. Grilled with Mexican style flavors it tasted terrific. The beans and slaw were very good too. As a transplanted New Yorker, I consider myself a bit more picky about BBQ than most Texans as I discovered it later in life. I consider this some of the very best I've ever eaten and highly recommend this place (but order it early or you might miss out).

We are on line to order our foods for a good 1hr. Standing We dont know we have to wait like another 30 minutes or so for our foods to be delivered on our table so time check we. Are here exactly at 2pm and now is 3:24 pm our food are not yet doneit is so frustrating they need to let the customers know that waiting is almost an hour   looks like this Restaurant is under staff they dont even give any complimentary drinks to the customers this is our first time we will never ever come back here

This place has incredible brisket tacos and pretty good sides. All-in-all the food is the bomb. The setup sucks, though, especially for a "restaurant" as acclaimed as this. I have to order online? Really? Even though you're standing right there? And you're still just doing picnic style? Also, the last time I went the flies were out of control in the outdoor (but covered) seating area. I hear they're shutting the ol' truck down and doing a brick-and-mortar in Buda. Hopefully, that will solve their serious deficiency in terms of comfort and convenience. If you're going to do it - and the food is definitely worth it - I'd reccomend just getting it as takeout.
Austin, TX 78748

I just paid $9.75 for 12 ounces of soggy canned corn. And my total bill for corn, beans, 3 tacos was $50 including tip -___- My  tacos were soggy and had so much grease. The green salsa came with a layer of water on top and came out in one scoop in solid form like it had been sitting in that cup for days. When we first got there the girl at the register asked her coworker if she should take our order. There was still 1hour left before they closed. The other worker said yes and we regretted that later. Lol I should have saved my $50 and eaten HEB bbq instead :(

You may not need it but you'll crave it in your sleep. That's right, it's the Real Deal Holyfield Taco $9Fried egg with refried beans, potatoes, bacon, sliced brisket,on a fresh flour tortilla & served with tomato serrano salsa. Filling, almost too much, but I can force it for this breakfast amazement. There's a pulled pork option too but this is Texas so I expect you'll order correctly. Queso? Did someone say melted cheese? You bet I did. It's well worth the $4.50You can order online and save yourself some time. But don't wait too long, the meats don't last forever and will run out. Sure there's more amazement on the menu but next weekend morning you're a little fuzzy from the night before, doing go to one of this chain taco shacks, hit up Valentina's for The Real Deal. You'll tank me. Make sure you get there before 11am to score the breakfast menu. Enjoy!
The bbq in town!!  My favorite!  The real deal holly field! Yummy:  the brisket is the best so moist.

Need to update my rating just based on business flow. Great bbq. Mediocre sides. Terrible wait times. I have been here many times and the wait times Alone have me going to other locations for bbq. Which is sad because their bbq is great. Even if you order online and have a specific pick up time, just expect it to not be on time. If you're willing to wait, then you'll get some good bbq.

This place is a lovely little gem and worth the visit. I'll make this quick. Superb BBQ. Seriously measures up to the greats like Franklins, and with less of a wait. You cannot go wrong with the brisket, pulled pork or ribs. I have now had multiple times. Their sides however, you would be better served bringing your own sides. Or pick up and have your own sides waiting at home. The sides are actually why i am not rating 5 stars. Why be great at food and not care about beans, slaw, mac and cheese or whatever. Simple items to be so dull here.

Been going here for years before all of the hype. Placed an online order to pick up before heading home to Round Rock. Got there and the order wasn't ready. They claimed the order wasn't received despite the fact I showed them my order confirmation. Was told to place another online order they no longer offer to go orders in person. The wait at that point was 110-115 minutes. Their website reads "ORDER ONLINE NOW FOR IMMEDIATE PICK UP". Wanted to pick up one last time before they moved to BFE. Regret all of the hundreds of dollars we've spent here in the past and all the times I recommended them.

My boyfriend turned me onto this place based on their incredible brisket breakfast tacos! I've been here a handful of times and I love how convenient the ordering process is. You just purchase everything through their website and it tells you exactly when your order will be ready, easy peasy. I will say that I'm giving them only 4/5  stars because of their pricing. For the Real Deal Holyfield Taco (refried beans, potatoes, bacon, eggs, and a huge slice of brisket in a tortilla) which is undeniably my favorite breakfast taco in all of Austin, $13+ is pretty outrageous of a price. While it's unmatched and definitely worth a try, the cost is hard to justify if you're going often. All in all though, the brisket is so freakin good (comparable to some of the best BBQ places in the city) and the tortillas are home made, what more could you ask for?

It's a crowded field for the title of second best tacos in Austin, because Valentina's on Manchaca has run so far away from the competition that only an act of God could dethrone them. I shit you not, this is magical, transcendent food. The first bite of brisket taco gave me goosebumps and I felt high. Who knew that one thick slice of perfectly smoked brisket, succulent with fat, topped with homemade guacamole and salsa and wrapped in a handmade flour tortilla could mimic the effects of psychoactive drugs? It was a 100% intoxicating experience. Officially known as Valentina's Tex-Mex BBQ, they do the traditional pit offerings as well as carnitas, and I look forward to working my way through all of it. I can't recommend this place enough. If you live in Austin, it'll become your go to taco joint. If you're visiting from out of town, it should absolutely be on your short list of places to eat while here.

Amazing is all I can say . Every dish every side was on point . The brisket was perfect . The thing that really really shines was the chicken . Totally different levels of bqq . I really would like some green sauce salsa . The tortillas were spectacular . Would def recommend it over any bbq place around here . Well we'll worth it . The owner was on deck  Exhausted but he was on it . Really really just shows the amount of work and dedication he has in this jewel of a business .
Austin, TX 78748

The food was amazing, but the experience and service was not that great. There's very limited seating so be prepared to possibly sit in your car. They are only offering online ordering and will leave it outside of their food truck in a brown bag. The online menu was not the easiest thing to navigate. They have a very limited menu which was very disappointing. The food was great but, the service could use some improvement!

Not even coronavirus can stop us from coming here.You can order online or drop by and place your order. They have several chairs set up while you wait, with plenty of space between them - just in case.  When your food is ready, they'll bring it out to a couple tables. They'll call your name, review your order and set it down for you to pick up -NO CONTACT.BBQ IS STILL DAMN GOOD, CORONAVIRUS OR NO CORONAVIRUS.

Yeah.  Just skip the reviews and do yourself a favor and:Try the brisket Their tortillasTheir beef ribTheir barbacoaI'm still on the fence about their corn.  It has a certain je ne sais quoi.  Maybe it's the lemony flavor.

No bbq is worth $30 per pound PLUS a two hour wait PLUS an extra 30 minutes BEYOND  the designated pick up time.   Wanted to try this place after seeing it in food network. Travelled ng from Alabama to Austin.  Did it once ...won't EVER DO IT AGAIN
Great food, but Shitty ass setup for ordering food and dealing with the pandemic. They need to just go back to how they used to do it and allow people to simply order in person

This is my third time at Valentina and all other times have been he great.  The ordering system they have the staff taking orders were totally off today.  Many of us were told our orders would take 25 mins, instead of notifying us that the system was back logged they had us wait.  When we asked they said we'd have to wait 45 mins longer but it was actually 2 hours wait.  I gave up eventually and asked them to cancel my order but I doubt they got that straight.Much better communication is needed.  I am not sure what happened today but that's just very bad service and makes me wonder how they're managing their food quality.
Hands down one of my favorite bbq spots in Austin.  The brisket just breaks apart in your hands and feels like eating butter.  It was an amazing experience.

Lines are not ridiculous like they used to be, even with (or because of?) people eating lots of take out.The Kuro Buta (black pig) was excellent. The brisquet was better than last time. Love bbq sausage, but this is not the best place to find it.2017-10-25 3 StarsRecently moved into their new Manchaca Rd location. The long lines have finally subsided and it is now you can order in a reasonable amount of time.Ordered a couple of pounds of briquet, ribs, and sausage.The sausage was very sub-par with a very tough casing. The ribs were mediocre. The briquet was good but nothing special. The BBQ sauce was runny and not the traditional Texas style (vinegar based?), but it was good for a change. I liked that they included tortillas (instead of bread) with the meat.I did not eat in the outdoor seating area that looked nice because it was HOT.I will come back some morning and try their breakfast tacos.Worth going back to, but I would not drive out of my way to come again.

Recently moved into their new Manchaca Rd location. The long lines have finally subsided and it is now you can order in a reasonable amount of time.Ordered a couple of pounds of brisquit, ribs, and sausage.The sausage was very sub-par with a very tough casing. The ribs were mediocre. The briquet was good but nothing special. The BBQ sauce was runny and not the traditional Texas style (vinegar based?), but it was good for a change. I liked that they included tortillas (instead of bread) with the meat.I did not eat in the outdoor seating area that looked nice because it was HOT.I will come back some morning and try their breakfast tacos.Worth going back to, but I would not drive out of my way to come again.
Great place for brunch. Easy use of tabbeddout app and the food comes really quick! Staff is super friendly and contributes to a great atmosphere. You'll have a great time!

EastSide Tavern was extremely safe with their contactless ordering! They have a QR code menu where you order online and "food runners" to bring you your food. We got the Brisket + Cheddar Tator Tots and the Brisket Egg & Cheese sandwich! Both were delicious but just note that the Brisket & Cheddar Tater Tots just have little bits of brisket in it so don't expect a huge amount of brisket in it :) Overall really delicious and would recommend for a Texas style brunch along with bottomless mimosas!

I just wanted to give a shout out to Chef KK.  She is fierce with a cooking style that warms your heart.  I had ordered a brisket and sausage plate with some adult drinks.  It was so tasty I had to ask the management team If I could tell her in person how great of a meal we had.  She came out to our table and sat with us just for a minute and it felt like i was at home eating Mom's home made cooking.  Just wanted her to know how under appreciated some Chefs are and that was an awesome dinner she made for us.  You are Legit gurl.  Keep up the great work.  We will be back again.
column21: Avery Ranch Far West, Austin, TX

column20: Second time at this eatery. Today is basically 3 days after Texas reopened post Covid. - I ordered the SOS because it looked amazing on their poster board. Although the picture displayed an egg stop l, mine came without. I was initially disappointed, but after my first bite it really didn't matter. This dish is scrumptious, brisket is melt in your mouth tender, not fatty, flavorful and proportional to the toast and gravy. Likely the best brisket I've ever had, Thank you.
Clean place and unique yummy food. I would definitely come back here to watch sports and chow down on their delicious smoked brisket.

Sam, Caitlin, and Moe were outstanding. Seriously. We came during  Saturday brunch, and all three were fantastic  and  upbeat the entire service. Based on the serving staff alone I would come back. Food was good and the drinks were great as well. Cant wait to come back and see them again soon!I dont usually leave review but between the 3 of them, I had to.

What a vibe here! Natural lighting, lots of seating options, and drinks kept on coming!There's a small parking lot where I was able to snag a spot so we are off to a good start! Music is good and service was nice and friendly.Got the smoked wings for an appetizer and bottomless mimosas to start. The wings were good and the homemade bbq sauce was sweet tangy and a hint of spice, *chef kiss. For brunch I got the breakfast taco plate, it was good as well! Great spot to checkout for bottomless drinks/brunch/bbq

If I could give this establishment no stars I would. Went here on a Saturday morning around 11. There was only 4 tables occupied when we went in. There was a large group of 11 of us split into 2 tables. When we arrived they informed us that they would not have servers, only food runners because of covid and that we needed to order on the app. Out of the 11 of us I was one of the first ones to order. Everyone was getting there food except for me. No big deal, I used to be a waitress and understand how it is working in a restaurant. But after everyone has already received their food and eaten I still had not got my food. I asked an employee to check on my meal which was a Cuban sandwich, street corn and a side of fries. She asked my name and then came back to asked what I had ordered then disappeared for another 30 min. When she finally came back to the table she had informed me that they had burned the sandwich and were making me a new one. At this point I had been waiting an hour for my food. About 15 minutes had passed when she brought out a burnt soggy sandwich and the corn, but still no fries. She let me know she had taken care of my bill and the kitchen was working on complimentary cinnamon rolls for me. Everyone was ready to leave as we had been there close to 2 hours so I waited to get a to go box, so I went to the bar myself where the bartenders were having a conversation and ignored me but handed me a to go box. As we were leaving the manger came by to ask if I wanted the cinnamon rolls to go only they still weren't done and I would have to wait.I would've liked my sides at least while I waited for my sandwich so I wasn't starving but that was not an option since the I was ignored the entire time.This establishment was an awful experience from start to finish. I would NEVER recommend this place.

The food was fantastic, some really great brisket in their breakfast bowl. Bottomless mimosas for $16 was a plus! I would give it 5 stars but the service was poor. I know Sunday's are busy but if we were even able to flag someone down they were impatient and rude. They do all orders through the TabbedOut app which has some kinks so that was a bummer too. All in all great time, great food, but they need better staff.
Adding to my existing reviews with a pro tip - ranch is the best dipping sauce to accompany their garlic parm fries.

Social distance what? They've never heard of it clearly. I know times are crazy but this felt very pre-covid with how many people were smushed into the restaurant. We came for brunch and the food was just okay. Nothing special. We got Brussel sprouts, nachos, and the breakfast bowls. We had mimosas but they were out of orange juice?(lol) they had cranberry and grapefruit juice instead. P.s. Parking lot is like maybe 8 spots so not exactly ideal.

First time at Eastside Tavern. I tried the BBQ nachos and the queso was not for me just too much of a smokey taste. But hey that's just my taste.  The burger made up for the nachos a burger may seem simple but I can appreciate how they seasoned their beef patties packed with a lot of flavors. The melted cheese just sets the flavors off even more. I will become back they have specials every day of the week! The rooftop is something to consider when Texas offers up a beautiful day like today. $7 Burger night Mondays and Wine down Wednesdays with 1/2 price bottles gotta come to check it out!

Worst customer service from the moment we walked in. We come here often on the weekend and this was the first time we visited on a weekday.Usually the rooftop is available for seating but as we walked to the rooftop an employee stoped us and rudely told us the rooftop was closed. She did not offer any other seating options and walked away. This seemed odd because we saw another couple kindly offered other seating options. No where was it stated that the rooftop was closed as it is a seat yourself establishment.We decided to stay and found other seats and ordered the bottomless mimosas. Because we come here often, we expected 2 glasses but the server only brought one. We asked for another glass, she aggressively stated that it's one per person. As someone in the service industry, i understand. My boyfriend only planned he would just have one and then ordered a single. The server then came to the table and scolded us and told us we needed to order 2 bottomless which seemed unreasonable for someone who wanted one mimosa. Then we we finally decided to leave and cancel our order, both her and the bartender argued with us that we had to pay even though the appetizer and drink never reached our table. Again, as a service industry worker, she could have reused the simple champagne and orange juice mixture because we never touched it and everyone in the establishment is drinking mimosas and it was most likely premixed. This was a long ordeal for a meal that was under $30. This was only resolved because the owner was there but we did not speak with them. I hate to leave local businesses bad reviews but they do not deserve your money when they treat their customers poorly. I will not be returning and before this was a top place I would recommend when friends or family visited but I will no longer support this business and how they treat their customers.

This is going to be a strange review since I didn't exactly get to eat anything but still loved the customer service that I received. We were waiting for our reservation for Bufalina across the street and a few in our party wanted to catch the football game and grab a beer. We made our way to the rooftop patio. They had big heaters that were set up but not all were operational. For some reason one of them kept going out. We asked for them to turn it back on and they were happy to do so.There is a small bar on the patio but the more comprehensive one is downstairs which you can also order from. A few of my friends ordered beers. I was pretty chilled so I asked if there were any hot beverages. The server let me know that they have a hot toddy which has alcohol in it. I braced myself for harsh judgments when I asked if there were any hot non-alcoholic drinks. Instead he was super apologetic because he thought he misinterpreted me and ran downstairs to ask if there was tea or coffee available. He came back up and reported that there wasn't but instead he could just fix me up a hot honey lemon drink as an alternative. He had to run back downstairs and up again with the drink. It was very thoughtful of him to make a non-drinking customer like myself feel welcome.
