The brisket SOS was really good and the service was good too, but I was concerned that after we were seated at the bar for breakfast they continued to seat people next to us and did not maintain social distance guidelines even after another couple asked the host to.  We ate quickly and left.

I've been waiting to eat here... I tried the Eastside Burger   special (no onions) ... I should've taken a peek before I brought  it home..well to my surprise..It was full of onions!!..when the ticket sd no onions!! Seems like everywhere I go we get onions when I specially say all the time  no onions!! Not only that it was really salty. My little girl didn't even want anymore.On top of that they do an extra charge  for credit cards. This is disappointing especially when they expect  a tip for giving me a wrong order...After  all I gave them a 25% tip.

I came here post covid with a friend for Sunday so I don't know if the service was normally this slow.  In short, the food was great but service, not so much.  When we walked through the door to the hostess stand, the hostess told us to go up stairs for seating.  We were rather confused cause we thought we need to be seated as oppose to just open seating.  Anyways we went upstairs and found the only two spot available in the hot sun.  The places was really crowded.  We looked at the menu on our phones and it took about 10 min before the bartender who's responsible for all of upstairs to come by and take our order.  After he took our order, It took about another 30 minutes before our food came out.  Overall, I may come back a few months from now to see if the service have improved but as of right now, I would give the food 4 stars and service 2 stars which equals to 3 stars.

If I could give 0 stars I would. The service was horrible. The servers were extremely rude and they would just be talking to each other while ignoring all the tables. 2 other tables next to us had issues with the service as well. We waited almost an hour to be seated and the food is overpriced just for the service to be very underwhelming. Extremely disappointing.

I'm a regular to Eastside Tavern and usually have a great experience. I went today and the service was not only ridiculously slow but they were rude. I ordered the tacos and they always can accommodate for vegetarians but for some reason today this woman rudely came up to me and said "there's no way we can sub the meat for anything it's just going to be lettuce ahahaha" like really I've had another server (in the past) accommodate a veggie taco. She still refused to accommodate and didn't give me any recommendations for anything else on the menu. If you're vegetarian or have any dietary restrictions I HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO NOT COME HERE...... I'm so disappointed... I have been a server myself for over a year so I understand how stressful it can been when it's busy but when a worker comes up to me with an attitude and judges me by my dietary restrictions it personally makes me very upset...

Great bar (Kyle is very attentive)!! Great Bar-B-Q!!  The order came out in only 5-6 minutes! The brisket is melt-in-your-mouth tender and delicious.  4 stars only because the coleslaw was not to my taste, very "artsy" coleslaw.  I suppose it's a big hit with some people.  It was dressed with a sweet vinegar and it was a bit bitter (radishes?)....  You know what, I take it back, 5 stars because they obviously made an excellent effort on the coleslaw, I just happen to not like it. The vibe was relaxed and helpful.  The music is a middle-of-the road mix of greatest hits from various eras.  (No live music today, just a playlist).  The door staff and busgirl are very gracious and helpful.An excellent Sunday lunch!

I tried the EastSide Tavern today for lunch!This place was amazing.Kyle was our service provider, he suggested I try the Smoked Turkey Club.This sandwich was the best thing I have eaten in a long while and the French fries are top notch.General manager, KK, Came over and talked with us. She is legit!Awesome setting on the inside.Give this place a try, it will not disappoint!

[2 Meat Plate: Moist Brisket with Beef Sausages and side of fries] The brisket had a nice burnt edge but it was not as moist as I had wanted. (Yes I did ask for very moist) The sausages reminded me of the chinese ones. The fries on the other hand were delightful and I finished those. You order through an app you have to download first and then you can also pay on that same app. The gentleman who helped us was very kind.
We were really impressed with this place. The server was fantastic, and chef came out to talk to us. The smoked wings, brisket patty melt, slaw, and specialty cheesecake were all out of this world.

Great brunch in Austin! We split the nachos with pulled pork on them. They had so much queso on them, and the pork was great. For my meal I had the brisket Benedict. It was Texas  toast with an egg in the hole, topped with a massive slice of brisket and hollandaise. The sweet toast with the tender brisket and the gooey egg and hollandaise was a great combo.Overall, a nice spot to grab brunch and soak up some of the alcohol still lingering from the night before!

I used to visit this place all the time on the weekends but went today and was given terrible customer service. They were rude as soon as we walked in and continued to belittle us. They argued and raised their voices at us. This was prior to the food coming out and I would not recommend this place to anyone.

You have to read this!!! I've been eating/ drinking here for well over 4 years. So I used to love this place... not so much anymoreIt's actually pretty nasty!They literally dunk their glasses in the first Sink and dip it in to 2 more sinks with "sanitary water."That's so nasty guys. Imagine the kitchen WATCH NEXT TIME: The bartenders put their fingers inside the glasses rim when grabbing 2 or more mimosa glasses. They put glass into glass and slam the whole stack up against their bare skin, It's disgusting and I never knew for like 3 years I just simply didn't pay attention Today I did, the glasses were filthy, the food looked delicious but imagine how the kitchen looks and is cleaned if this shit is right behind the barTo the staff, imagine if the county Cosme in to audit you guys. Step it up! The 2 stars are to the way the food tasted before we saw this shit. We paid and left ‍ I'm embarrassed for Eastside Tavern!

This is a happening spot on the weekends. My husband and I decided to drop in one Sunday afternoon. We had a short wait before a spot opened up at the bar. They serve brunch pretty late into the day, which was good to know for the future. I wanted to try their nachos. You can choose whichever type of BBQ meat on your nachos. I opted for pulled pork, and it was amazing. The portion size was good for me. I didn't feel like I couldn't put a dent in it; I definitely did. Next time, I'm gonna try the tater tots.

EastSide Tavern was a great spot to eat some bbq, grab a drink, and watch the game.  I had never been to EastSide Tavern and asked our server for recommendations.  He really took care of our table.  The Brisket and Cheddar Tater Tots are not like traditional tots with the stuff scooped on top but the tots were stuffed with brisket and cheddar.  They were really good.  My Eastside burger was also delicious!  I probably need to try the BBQ sandwich next time; there is so much to choose from.  Great meal, great company, I'll be back!

Let me just say, I truly think this place has a ton of potential! Great location, great patio (if you're in the shade), and delicious TX comfort food! The food is actually really delicious...heavy as hell...but very good! We had these items:1. Honey & habanero wings: 5/52. queso with brisket & jalapenos: so good! 5/53. Eastside sliders with slaw: 5/54. Eastside benedict: 5/5Overall, the food was absolutely delicious. Again, very heavy, but if that's what you're going for then check this place out! They also do bottomless mimosas for $14 which is super cheap. This is why I'm giving this place 2 stars:It's a toasty 90-degree day in ATX on a second-floor patio with 0 shade. I definitely think the table spots that are completely exposed needed misters. It was ungodly hot and people who are pale would be a lobster at the end of this brunch. Onto the main story!...We came here because the menu looked amazing and we wanted Texas comfort food, which is what we got from this place. However, the service was absolutely horrendous. I've never experienced anything like it. The manager, Brie, treated us really well during this experience. She went around to us and the surrounding tables to fix all of the screw-ups from the waitress. There was only 1 server for the whole upstairs patio and it was hot as hell, so I felt really bad for this waitress, in the beginning. Wearing a mask in 90-degree weather is horrible. We felt really bad for her in the beginning because it looked pretty miserable serving champagne and food to everyone in that weather.  It really did look like a challenging job. The waitress did warn us saying things were running slow, so be prepared. We thought how bad can it be....it was really bad! It turned into a 3-hour brunch. Our wings came out immediately, but our queso came out completely wrong without the brisket or jalapenos so we waited for the server to put that in. After the first screw up, she tells us to tell her manager what a great job she was doing....which was weird. After that, We waited almost two hours for our food and we finally asked where the hell our food was. She literally looks at us like we didn't even order food after we saw her write it down on paper. She couldn't remember what we ordered and didn't have anything on the paper.  She tells us she put it in the computer after we confronted her. We waited another 30 min and still no food. The manager finally comes and says, did you get your food? NO, we've been waiting 2 hours for TX toast, cheese, and bbq. It was insane! The manager finally brings our food, but the order was still wrong and at this point, we were over it and sunburnt. Meanwhile, at this point, I'm convinced the waitress was on drugs or drunk. She brings us our bill and nothing was fixed or comped. She charged us for items we didn't even get to eat. She just asked for our credit card and she's about to charge us. We finally speak up telling her we shouldn't have to pay for these items since we've been at brunch, not by choice. The manager comes by and says we shouldn't be paying for any of these items. She comped everything for us which was very sweet of her.  AFTER ALL OF THIS, the waitress comes over and says the manager fired me. Damn right she fired you, it was a terrible experience. AGAIN, if you want delicious food and bottomless mimosas then this is the place for you. I do think management did a great job fixing this issue, but they definitely need better servers.

Ask for nico. This guy gave great service and suggestions . When I say 5/5 I mean it. Honestly with 8 we all were happy. If you come get thing wings. Will return with my wife next time we come down. I know good bbq Bc we live Dallas. I'm so excited to come back .We asked for a manager to thank nico. See y'all at brunch !

Waited 40 minutes and never received food. The place was empty. They said the kitchen never printed out order. No one ever came to check in the table and see if we needed anything. Poor customer service even despite covid.

Went here on a Saturday morning for their brunch ($14 bottomless mimosa add-on), and the wait wasn't long at all! Their full menu is also available which I should've opted for, as brunch does not seem to be their strong suit.I went for the brisket eggs benedict, which for a brunch STAPLE they woefully missed the mark. Egg was runny, bread was fluffy, but "hollandaise" was runny and orange and the brisket was tough as leather. A good hollandaise can cover a multitude of sins, but in this case it was the main offender.However, the breakfast bowl seems to be the best brunch option as the potatoes are wonderfully crisped and salted. But when I go out for brunch I tend to opt for something with a little more flair, and not the exact same thing I could get at a local diner.Would recommend if you want to get sloshed with some crispy taters, but if you want a proper brunch, go elsewhere
Emma was our waiter and gave us so much advice for downtown since we haven't been here! She was SO NICE and helpful. Love this place, great vibes, great food, highly recommend!
Was seated immediately on a Saturday night, our waitress Sydney was great. Ordered the salad and added pulled pork. Wings for appetizer but did not like the sauce, blt sandwich for my friend.

We were starving upon arrival, and we ordered various appetizers to sample and share with our large group. The chips & queso were average but delicious when you're hungry. The brisket & cheddar tater tots were a weird size & shape but a nice appetizer to share. Though it wasn't what I was expecting upon ordering, it was surprisingly good. The corn dogs bites were great, but again nothing too much to rave about. I simply ordered brisket with mac and cheese that I later ate when the drunk munchies struck. The brisket was tender but lacked an intense flavor I was hoping to experience in TX. It was fattier than what I was expecting, but it was brisket. The mac and cheese was pretty good though! I just felt it was a little mediocre for the TX BBQ experience I was looking for. Nothing was bad, and the entrees were chowed down by everyone at the table. The environment is casual, but we had excellent service for our large group with particular guests. Our server was really on top of the questions and various requests, so I'm super happy about with service from being greeted, the food runners, and server. Despite this, I wasn't very wowed for a place that was recommended to us by our AirBnB, but it's a sufficient stop for food when you're hungry.

This place is awesome! Went during lunch on a whim and ordered 5 of their burgers ($7 on Monday's) for my coworkers and I. We loved the fries and burgers, and I enjoyed the lunch crowd as I waited. Great service, street and parking lot parking--it's a gem!

Soooo.... uuuuummmm....Mix it yourself mimosa???Uuuummmmm....The sandwich menu says you get a choice of meats but all the burgers include beef patties so they top the beef patties with your choice of meats.  Its a double meat sandwich. If you're looking to attempt cardiac arrest then thats what you get. I got a breakfast bowl. Just know it is literally a bowl (that should be a plate) of eggs, bacon, potatoes, those are the options I chose.  So the food was not a nice mix but instead just separated.My friend had to order her sandwich 3 different times due to ill verbage on the menu.  The menu does not state that any of the sandwiches come with beef patties. However, the menu gives the burger option as a CHOICE OF MEATS (not topped with meat a choice)   Aaaaallllll burgers are served with beef burger patties(thick looked good, but not what was ordered and she's allergic to beef (yes, beef)). So after we looked pissed they offered to remake the sandwich. Next she asked for a turkey blt.The sandwich that was presented came out and it was just bread, turkey and all the toppings (plated nicely on the side). Oh and an half dollop of bbq sauce on the bread. We ask for bacon to be added, then we ask for the manager. The manager comes out and says "in 3 years we've never had this problem". Not our fault that no one proofread the menu with the food. The manager never offered to comp her meal and never checked back on us ro se if we're were satisfied for our stay.

Food was really good and they have $12 bottomless mimosas! But the door guy and one of the manager with the short pink hair were some of the most rude people I've ever encountered in the service industry. Being a server myself, I was completely caught off guard when he told our party we couldn't sit together and when we were seated separately he told us we could not change tables even though we did not have a open tab and we were just sitting to finish our drinks. I then asked to speak to the manager and he told me I was not aloud to ask for the manager. I will NEVER eat here again, I'm appalled.
column21: South Oklahoma City, Oklahoma City, OK

column20: Cool spot! Was in line down the street at another place that happened to be out of the smoked turkey I was seeking. Since I don't eat beef/pork, I looked this place up and walked on down. So glad I went. It's bright and airy with a great corner location and seating in front outside. I believe for dinner the order setup is a little different but for lunch, you order at the counter and they bring it to your table. After chatting with the friendly bartender, I got the turkey wrap lunch special with an order of fries. There was so much lettuce, I thought I'd miss the flavor of the meat but I was wrong. It was soooo flavorful it was bursting through the other ingredients. The fries were yummy and stayed hot in their metal container. I got a glass of frosé which was ok but couldn't compete with the wrap! I should've gotten one to go!

I came here for happy hour and these were the things I tried (food review only):- frito pie ($6): chopped beef, salsa verde, queso, and pico on top of frito corn chips. Somehow they were able to make this dish way too spicy. We would have finished this off if they were more careful to tone down the spice.- fried pickles ($6): my brother and I were only barely able to nibble on these since it was way too salty unfortunately. the fried pickle spears from Austin's 24 Diner were juicier, and therefore better.- pickled deviled eggs ($6): sweet, tangy, but also had too much mayo. It stood out for being pink/purplish in color due to the pickled nature. Was it the best in Austin? I doubt it, not when I can say that there are deviled eggs in Temple, Texas that can outdo this one by a long shot (Megg's Cafe). While I did enjoy this dish, it was more of a helpful counterbalance to the surprisingly too-spicy frito pie. Additionally, I think I enjoyed more the tiny salad bed it was on (wished the salad was more plentiful!)- smoked chicken wings ($8): a tad little on the dry and tough side even with the wet marinade, but good flavor (we picked BBQ sauce over Buffalo, the only two options). Also came with the dipping sauce options of ranch or blue cheese dressing - but ranch dressing sometimes has blue cheese, so I thought it was weird that they only offered those two choices on the menu. Upon inquiring, they also have honey mustard which I thought was good (hope this tip is helpful for those who are not a fan of ranch or blue cheese).During happy hour, these were all offered at good prices. However, we weren't able to eat much because of the noted flops. The atmosphere was good, the waitress wasn't very accommodating for the deaf, the food presentation was lovely, but I think this is definitely much more of a beer garden (with wine and cocktail offerings) than a good place to eat as it would be tough for me to recommend others to come here at normal pricing until execution is improved (I'm still tempted to try the reasonable-sounding turkey avocado toast but it's only offered during weekend brunch - an unfortunate shame).

Was in town with some friends visiting and they recommended this place. There were 4 of us who had gotten there first and had others on the way. There wasn't a big enough table to seat all of us at the time so the older male host with a beard allowed us to sit at two close tables for the time being. We may had been there maybe 10-15 min. Ordered food and mimosas. Our apps and drinks had arrived and while there are two tables with two of us each sitting at a table, we decided to not speak across the tables so we wouldn't interrupt other guest. The older male hostess comes running over just yelling at us about how we cannot move tables. We didn't physically move any tables. We just thought for the time being, the 4 of us would sit together while our other friends parked instead of talking between tables. We understand covid rules and the idea to be safe but the male hostess was being irrational and claimed we were cut from the bar when we had just gotten there and hadn't even finished one drink. We explained to him our side and he wasn't havent it and berated us condescending things. We asked what we did wrong and what a solution could be to solve such a thing and wow, I've never met a more unreasonable person ever. We proceeded to go close out and he followed us to the bar. Not practicing social distancing at all being so close to us like we were criminals and would try and steal something. As I try to finish the 9/10th left of what I had to drink, he berated us again but this time over a mask. Not sure how I can drink a drink I paid for through my mask but alright sure. He was a dick. I truly understand these are tough and strange times especially for the restaurants industry but to handle a situation like this is absurd and sad. I do hope this issue is addressed with this individual because he will single handily drive out business away during these tough times. Complete power trip and every bartender just looked at us completely shocked as to what was going on as we closed out our tabs because they knew, we hadn't even had one finished drink...sad the other staff members have to suffer from one individual on a power trip and didn't even have the decency to give a solution to the problem he apparently had. In my professional opinion, I would recommend he get a prostate or colonoscopy exam because something is clogged up there for him

Just attended brunch at this restaurant. The service at reception was horrible...the guy seating guests had no idea what was going on but I gave him the benefit of the doubt that he might've been hungover or something - fine. After being seated, me and 3 others placed orders for drinks at the bar to get started and that service was fine. We then placed orders for food and 2/3 orders had barely been defrosted. My order, after an hour, was still nowhere to be found so I asked the bartender for an update on it where she cruised back to the kitchen and didn't come back to let me know what was going on. I shrugged it off. Another 10-15 minutes later, I approached the bartender to close my tab and cancel the food order and still got charged for a mediocre $11 old fashioned in a plastic cup....Needless to say, I will never come back to this rat trap of a place, and I highly advise everyone to hit McDonalds breakfast before coming here.

Solid brunch spot with a great rooftop. The roof has a lot of picnic tables and umbrellas. The bottomless mimosas are a great deal and the food is all basic brunch fare. We have been here quite a few times and it's always been a good, reliable spot and we bring can the dogs with us.

You CANNOT beat their $20 all-you-can-eat barbecue. It's such an amazing deal, and your belly will be full & happy after. The brisket was nice and tender, the pulled pork was very flavorful, and the sausage was nice and smoky. The only thing I didn't love were the ribs (but I'm also not a *huge* rib person.). Even the sides were tasty -- loved their vinegar based cole slaw,(I think it might have had shaved brussels sprouts in it?!) and their potato salad!
Great place to watch a game. Food wise, their cast iron skillet cookie is a must try. I've visited here a handful of times.

Was looking for a place for brunch and.. let me tell you guys. This is the spot. We went on a Friday, college footballs playing. Drinks were solid and so were our dishes. Service was super friendly and the atmosphere was very casual but in an freeing way if that makes sense. I got the brisket patty melt and bro, that was definitely the move. So bomb. Honestly what more can you ask for in Austin; bbq, brunch, football, and drinks.

Parts of Austin are getting real uppity due to gentrification. We were just trying to grab a bite to eat after a mud race and maybe a cocktail. A few places we entered gave us the most unwelcoming looks which landed us at EastSide Tavern. The ambiance is really cool and eclectic. We were minutes late for brunch but the menu looked AMAZING! The waitress was knowledgeable and friendly. Our food and drinks came out in a timely fashion and most importantly the food was actually HOT! I plan to return and try more of the cocktail menu. Definitely a great Sunday spot. I loved the pet friendly patio and shaded umbrellas.

Looks are deceiving. Staying in this area and saw this spot walking around - cool, relaxed atmosphere. They're doing great steps to protect and prevent covid. However, the food was very disappointing. Drinks didn't come out until the main course - we ordered an app. Also we ordered drinks but both we're out of stock - the app hadn't been updated so the waitress brought us different ones she thought would be similar (which was nice, thank you). Brisket patty melt had thick chunks, super low quality, not fresh. Smokehouse burger had this strange, less favorable taste to it. Mac & Cheese was runny in the skillet, not creamy and flavorful. Only things good: fried pickles and French fries. Disappointed we made this a spot during our trip. Just go to another BBQ joint.

The cocktails were solid. Nothing amazing but also not bad. Not a bad place to stop by for some quick cocktails.However, the food is a different story. I was surprised to find both the nachos with queso and grilled cheese to be super bland, tasted weird, or just had no flavor at all.With such subpar or mediocre food, I wouldn't recommend people coming here for their food. I also wouldn't plan to come back.

We came in twice during a weekend stay in Austin for drinks, largely due to convenience and them playing the NFL game we wanted to watch. Both times we sat at the bar and had a few cocktails and beers. We saw some folks ordering food, and a lot of brunch diners in the restaurant, too. Looks good, but we didn't eat either time. I'd recommend checking them out for the ambience and drinks, though. A little overpriced, in my opinion, but still a solid spot.

Everything we had was delicious. It was our first time at the restaurant so they let us sample a few items to help us order and it was very helpful! We got the extra moist brisket and turkey, which where amazing. For aides we got creamed corn (delish), coleslaw (hell yes, the creamy kind, but not too creamy), potato salad (very solidly good). Highly recommend this place if you want solid MEATS.They also had hand sanitizer, sinks, paper towels and cleaned the space thoroughly and frequently.
Thank you for sharing!

For a Texas "chain" BBQ spot, Rudy's can compete with all of the local smokers. Really good prices compared to most Austin BBQ spots. Tender brisket, great jalepeno sausage, a lot of tasty sides. This particular location is new and has a cool layout. Tons of outdoor seating, extremely clean. If you don't feel like waiting in line or paying the prices at Franklin's or Terry Black's, a solid option is Rudy's.

This BBQ joint was recommended by a family friend and we couldn't have been more pleased! The staff was friendly. The food was great. The atmosphere and decor is adorable. Little pricey but for the quality and how much food you got, it was well worth it. Husband had the steak and beans and loved it! I had a bunch of sides and loved it as well!

4.5 stars! Good kind service, clean, casual, lots of regulars for your typical Texas BBQ!Prices are really reasonable.Food is consistent and tasty. The turkey is nice and tender. I like the spicy jalapeños sausage the best. Brisket is good, the moist is fattier meats and that one is definitely a favorite here. Potato salad is good and I love the extra raw onions to help yourself (along with pickles and bbq sauce). Generous complimentary sliced bread. Just the typical white bread.They also have a really convenient handwashing station outside of the bathroom so you can wash your hands before you go in. They even have an automated handwashing station but I haven't used it before.

Classic Texas BBQ chain for a reason!Always such a treat to come here. You can't really go wrong with anything on the menu here - although I really recommend the brisket and creamed corn.The brisket is so soft and tender and packed with that unbeatable smokey flavor.The creamed corn on the side pairs perfectly, very rich and creamy. Personal favorite is the potato salad! This place is perfect for anyone visiting town who wants a taste of Texas BBQ. Don't forget to washing your hands :).

OMG I love this place. The wait was a little longer than usual. But there was a big party ahead of us. The food is always worth the wait. Brisket is juicy and perfect, I love the cole slaw here. And cream corn. Had a wonderful dinner, and the left overs will be great for lunch tomorrow.

Dropped off Mrs. Texas at the Red Stella Hair Salon and headed straight to Rudy's to throw down on some hard to beat Slap Yo Momma Good Texas BBQ. Now be warned, not every Rudy's is the same, but this location is a 5 Star location. Clean, comfortable, friendly staff, and Slap Yo Momma Good BBQ. Worthy of a bookmark and a try if you're passing through, or if you live, or work nearby.

I dropped Mrs Texas off just up the road to get her haircut at Red Stella Salon. I asked my 8 year old granddaughter if she wanted McDonald's, or Rudy's for lunch? She didn't hesitate and said, Rudy's. We enjoyed our meal. The dining area was clean, the staff was friendly, and the food was Slap Yo Momma Good !!! Rudy's serves excellent BBQ, but not every Rudy's location is the same. This location is worthy of a bookmark and a try.

I love Rudy's BBQ. Not their old burnt BBQ meat used several days ago. Horrible food for $18! Purchased 2 BBQ sandwiches and Pig in a Blanket. It looked and tasted like it was 10 day old burnt meat and buns were moist, wrinkly like it's seen it's days. Pig in blanket same way. Bun wrinkly and moist. Sausage was burnt and horrible. I'll never buy their pre-wrapped sandwiches again. Feed that to the animals; not your customers!!! See pictures but you might vomit. Rudy's BBQ is losing it's motto of serving fresh wholesome BBQ to now Recycled 10 Day Old BBQ for $18! Sad day in BBQ world.

Every time I come to Texas I've gotta make a stop at Rudy's! Man, I love this place. The service is always wonderful, and the food is always amazing. Today I went with the moist brisket and the St. Louis style ribs. . Note - if you get the moist ribs, be sure to consume some tasty fat. It's good for you, right? You MUST get the creamed corn, as well. My dad got the turkey - oh baby. Bottom line -- you can't go wrong with anything here. Will definitely be back!!

Another great Rudy's location! Delish BBQ at a great price means I can eat it more often! Stopped here 8:30pm on a Friday night and wasn't too busy. Had the brisket, ribs, sausage, corn, beans, and spicy chop!

The BBQ is probably a hair better at Franklins or a fancy artisanal spot, but Rudy's is consistently good, their staff are friendly and helpful and the prices are absolutely fair.  We make it a point to visit every time we're in Austin.
Visiting family and was referred to Rudy's by the car rental agent! Totally satisfied! Loved the creamed corn!

Went to Rudy's while visiting Austin on a recommendation and it was what I hoped in BBQ experience in the city. The place is spacious with plenty of seating (many picnic-style tables), and they've got a good system to get you the tremendous food.  It's the type of place where there's not a lot on the menu, but you still feel like you're missing out if you don't try many options because they all sound so good.At the register, they were incredibly friendly and helpful. They'll provide you with a few samples if it's your first time to Rudy's, which is a great feature and helps set the stage for your meal (they'll also give you a basic recommendation of how much meat makes for a good meal so you can make an educated decision).  I ordered the moist brisket and a peach cobbler for dessert.  BBQ sauce was readily available, but I only used enough to try because once I started eating the brisket, I wanted to savor the flavor of the meat without distraction.Writing this review makes me want to go back to Austin to eat at Rudy's - will certainly stop by if I'm ever in town again.
Good bbq here. We got brisket, pork ribs and sausage. Everything tasted great and the people were very friendly.

Plenty of parking, easy accessible walkways to get in, & nice line queue around the coolers of all the delicious beers and sodas and waters too!BBQ here and all their sides are always solid. I love their cream corn and I never share on that. Brisket is always a safe bet but I would recommend getting some ribs too if you are in the mood.  Service is always fast and prompt and friendly when ordering.  You can see your meats get cut up right behind the cashier who is helping you with your order. I used to frequent the original Rudy's location in Leon Springs so the decor in this location kind of makes me chuckle (the rusted tin roofs, sandy floors etc).  Plenty of space for large parties and love the different areas (inside and out) on where you can sit to eat your BBQ grub.

After not eating out for months, Rudy's was such a sweet treat! Spent the weekend in Austin and was put on to this gem. We had the Jalapeño sausage, spicy chopped, moist brisket, turkey, sweet corn, baked beans and potato salad! With varying level of spicy bbq, onion and pickles on the side and a sweet tea...I was in heaven!More than the food, the customer service was impeccable, the line was out the door and their social distancing policies were in full effect! Highly recommend if you're in the neighborhood!

Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity to delight you! We are so thankful for the support of our guests. We appreciate that you noticed the extra care we are taking to keep our guests and team members safe.
Absolutely Delicious!!!!It was my first attempt at bbq and Rudy's did a brilliant job !!
Good place to 'meat' friends! Baby back is my fav at this specific location, also tried baby back at Research blvd store but not as good as this one.

I'm a huge Rudy's fan. When other BBQ enthusiasts downplay Rudy's BBQ, I'm always quick to point out the solid, consistent BBQ, fun, lively atmosphere, and great value. For first-timers, it's a wonderful introduction to Texas BBQ experience. We always take our out of town guests here, and we love going here just the same!Food: Order the "extra moist" brisket, a half link of sausage, and wash it down with some sweet tea. Also, save room for the peach cobbler with Blue Bell ice-cream! If you're into sides, we love the cream corn and new potatoes, which is like buttery bite size pieces of potato. So tasty!The service here has been friendly and excellent as of late. A few months back, I did have bad experience that was not like the friendly Rudy's experience that my family has come to enjoy, but the management handled it with grace and professional tact. Honestly, that manager is the sole reason why I gave this location another shot. My experience today was stellar, and I can't wait to enjoy this Rudy's location for many years to come! We had such a wonderful time this evening!This Rudy's location also features a nice separate dining area that I'm assuming you can reserve or rent as well for group events. Also worth mentioning: The bus boy staff here is superb. Very attentive and kindly offered to help our family with the high chair. It didn't go unnoticed!

Last night was my first time at a Rudy's.  I am a newbie.  As a newbie - you get some special treatment.  David, our order taker, walked us through the offerings at Rudy and provided us with samples of the Cream Corn and three different types of meat.  My husband got the extra moist brisket.  The brisket melts in your mouth.   I had the half chicken.  Again, very good.  We also purchased the new potatoes and a little coleslaw.  The parking lot was bursting at the seams but it was pretty easy to get through the line.  There is family dining tables if you choose to eat at Rudy's or you can take it home.   Thanks for a great experience.

I came down to Austin for a wedding and my friend had her rehearsal dinner here. The food was delicious! We had brisket, turkey and sausage and it was all great. The brisket was amazing. Very tender and flavorful. The BBQ sauce was just right. A little spicy and a little sweet. Local friends said they also have a sissy sauce and a spicy sauce. For sides we had potato salad and beans. The potato salad was great, but I personally didn't care for the beans. I loved the ease of the meal and the large space. Great job Rudy's :)!

In Rudy's take-out, when you get the New Potatoes soaked in butter (and very tasty):1. They must be wrapped tightly with the cup turned Upside Down. 2. They must be packed in the bag with the cup turned Right Side Up. Otherwise it is disaster.  Basic Training at Rudy's I would suppose. My bad luck, errors on both today. Trainees?  An amazing mess, had to swab the car seat and carry my broken bags into the house in a bucket!  Rudy's would get a big zero from me in this review for this one, except that they normally do it just right.
Hey! We apologize for this to-go mess, seriously. Please email allysonyoung@wesellmeat.… so that we can make this right!

My mate and I stopped by Rudy's twice while we were in town at the behest of many, many locals (and Google) and we were not led astray. Okay so between the two stops, for meats, I ordered the regular brisket, the moist brisket, the turkey breast, and the pork loin. This was a lot because, in my day-to-day, I only eat poultry for meat. But it was so worth it, especially when paired with the house BBQ sauce and the pickles, onions, and bread provided for make-your-own sandwiches. The meat was the most flavor-filled meat I've ever had and was moist and melted in your mouth. All meat is priced by weight so you can really cater how much or how little you are willing to eat/pay. For sides, GET THE CREAM CORN! I cannot rave about this side enough and if I could I would eat it daily. The exterior looks a bit like a barn which is neat, and there's quite a bit of parking if you're driving. The interior is massive and there's community seating within so it really sort of feels like a picnic in a park. There are coolers with local and domestic beers, and a storefront within on another side. Service is wonderful and employees seemed really jazzed to be there, and it was cool because I mentioned it was my first time there, and they gave me so many free samples, I couldn't believe it. Truly a BBQ among BBQ, especially for non-locals.

I love Rudy's!  I'm there at least twice a week either buying brisket, chopped beef sandwiches or sides and tea by the gallon. Great Peach cobbler, too!  I do notice a disturbing trend at the N Lamar location, however, since  they reopened to public dining. At least half of the customers coming in are not wearing facial coverings and do not respect social distancing. The employees are doing their part, but the business is not requiring customers to follow accepted guidelines. I encourage you to support Rudy's for great BBQ, but be prepared to protect your own personal space and health when you go.

We got delivery last night. It was great, thanks for being available for delivery. I'm giving 3 stars but I will reorder. The banana pudding was perfect! The things that took you from 4 to 3 are: salty brisket and a shortage of bbq sauce. We ordered a total of 4 meet orders and got about 3 oz of sauce (lame). The lean brisket was not salty but the moist was very salty.
Thank you for sharing your experience! We hate to hear we did not get your order right. Could you please email allysonyoung@wesellmeat.… so the general manager can reach out directly?

Before every major metro area in Texas had a burgeoning BBQ scene, you had to drive out of town to find meat market style BBQ with ordering by weight and food served on butcher paper. Then, Rudy's emerged.So, keeping that nostalgia in mind, I went to this location for the first time.  And you know what?  What I had was good.  Very good in fact.  It's some of the best chopped beef in town.  And my St. Louis style ribs were bordering on perfection and easily competed with my previous favorites, which were a disappointment last time. (I'm looking at you, Miller's Smokehouse.)  The ribs were well done, had a great smoke ring, and a heavy crust of pepper.  And as always, Rudy's sauce is good, even if it's not as spicy as I remember it being initially.  Also, as always, Rudy's has great iced tea and soft drinks.It's actually relatively easy to serve good BBQ.  A bit of salt and pepper and the right amount of time in the pit or smoker will make you famous.  But Rudy's has a lot of the current trendy places beat for two reasons.  One.  Consistency.  It's going to taste the same almost every time you go to Rudy's.  No worrying about whether they're having an off day.  Two. The ability to manage a restaurant.  Rudy's gets service and taking care of customers.  You can't always say that of places that routinely sell out and leave customers in a line for hours.Rudy's succeeds and I like Rudy's for a simple reason.  They've got the complete package down.  They can both run a restaurant and sell good BBQ.

My first BBQ meal in Austin was at Rudy's and I had such a good time.  It had been recommended I try this place out when I got here and I'm glad I did. Fun and casual atmosphere.  While the menu isn't too complicated with choices, I wasn't sure what to get- everything sounded wonderful!  Luckily, when the cashier asked me if I'd ever been to Rudy's before, and I told her no, she happily got me samples of their brisket, moist brisket, roasted turkey and creamed corn.  All were so delicious!  I got the brisket and they gave me two slices of bread.  The sides were in a cooler next to the counter, and I grabbed potato salad.  They also had big coolers of ice with bottles of any drink you could think of, but you could also get a cup for a drink at the fountain.  My food was put on paper on a tray and there was plenty of seating to choose from.  The outdoor area was quiet and cool, with BBQ sauce available to add to your meal, if you needed it.  I did not need it.  This brisket was so good!  For a quarter pound of brisket, potato salad and a bottle of water I paid less than $10 and I was full.  So good!

I was told to get the moist brisket but when I got to taste the samples (as offered by very friendly counter/order taking staff) I actually enjoyed the turkey the most, so that's what I ordered, along with 3 ribs, and creamed corn and potato salad.  Ribs were just ok, but creamed corn was best I've ever had and the turkey sandwich was great.  I'd go back and I'll get the moist brisket next time.

Kudos to Rudy's for having so many locations that allowed them to bring in ICE to their downtown locations.  While we were in Austin, the city was under a boiled water advisory so fountain drinks were off limits but you could get (un)sweet tea or pair your bottled soft drinks with ice.The crew serving up the meat were friendly and efficient. Although most of the meat is priced at half a pound, you can get less.  Just tell them two or three slices and they are happy to oblige.I went with their sausage and pork loin. Was totally hooked on their sausage.  I like their creamed corn A LOT.  I also am a sucker for their puddings- banana or chocolate are equally as good.They could ease up on the bread but then again I could tell them that too. Plenty of seating and parking.  Restrooms are clean. This location is the closest one to UT Austin's campus.
Love the breakfast tacos and lean brisket. Pricey though. Best for groups. Sauce is a little spicy for me.
The best moist brisket I have had in a while service was quick the staff was Texas Friendly. The place was clean and no waiting but then again it was 11:00 A.MPlenty of parking.

I love this location because it's the most central (selfishly, to me). Right across the street from Central Market - it'll serve the medical/local business lunch crowd and everyone else for dinner. I like this one because there's parking and street parking and it's not attached to a gas station. Gasps. Shocker, I know. In and out for lunch (ordered and ate) in less than 30 minutes and got through the line in 5. This is a record for me. The quality is still as great as ever - though I love their outdoor seating area at this one more. The cream corn still touches my heart and their meats are great. Nothing new here.
Five stars simply because it's Rudy's BBQ! Delicious! Love this new location! We will definitely be visiting often. Great BBQ!

I was surprised by how fast this place was built; so, i thought it was shady to be done so soon. However, nothing can go wrong with rudy's, right? Cream corn is like the best thing on top of moist brisket and onions with bread.FOOD//Pricing seems to be higher than other places unless they raised it recently. EXTRA MOIST BRISKET 1/2lb was about $10. I thought my portion of brisket was super dry and fell apart super easily. Cream corn was still good, but the corn was too dry as well. IDK y, but overall, i was disappointed. ATMOSPHERE//It's new - for sure. I really like the interior of how there are so many space to sit (they have separate side for "more" seating area). I got super sad when they didn't have the hand washing area, but it was farther in, which was weird arrangement. However, i guess it's understandable since that's where bathroom is; so, don't think there isn't one b/c there is! "I HAVE CLEAN HANDS!"SERVICE//Super chillSURROUNDING//CENTRAL MARKET is right across and TEO is around the area; so, get yourself some sweet gelato/ice cream afterwards ;)

For my last night in Austin, I had to finish my trip with a classic barbecue stop. When we walked in, a little bit later in the evening, we were asked if it was our first time at Rudy's. We said yes, they did a little cheer, and proceeded to prepare samples for their whole menu.We went with a quarter pound of cutter's choice brisket, a quarter pound of fatty brisket, half rack of baby back ribs, and a side of coleslaw. The brisket was brilliant - cutter's choice had a great texture and nice blackening. The fatty brisket equally awesome. Having them side by side really helped me appreciate the diverse flavor profile of the briskets.Maybe it was due to being a later evening visit, but the baby back ribs were dry. They did peel off the bone - but even extra sauce could not redeem the dryness of the ribs.

I'm 65 years old and have been eating BBQ all over the state. Rudy's is the best in my opinion.  I like to order the Q moist cut with bark cut from the toe, excellent! The sides are good as well with the exception of the potatoes.  They should offer the hash browns that Bill Miller uses.
I came today & received the best service from Avery M. She is the best! I will definitely eat coming to this location more often!
Amazing BBQ and well priced! Everything is always fresh and delicious. This is our go-to bbq spot as it is so close to where we live. Their banana and chocolate puddings are divine!

Hey mates, this is a real American here! I know what good barbecue is, I do! take my word for this:you have just gotta try this plase it was smashing good great service and such but most of all tha foood I could eat 4ever you know that cream corn was just fabulous I must say but that sause was so yum in my tum that felt like a brickered Sunday morning in the north Atlantic sun with chips right just so classic and great just wish I could have more like can I get it for free plz it was thattt good onestlyHope that was helpful! have a good day!WOWOOOOWOOWOWOWOWOW1#yelpingsince4ever

This is an awesome way to have a chill BBQ dinner in Austin! I had brisket and pulled pork, which were both delicious, but the star for me was the creamed corn. I could eat that every day and still want more. Sweet, perfect consistency of creamy to corn ratio, perfection. The potato salad was also good. The attendant was very helpful while I navigated how much to order (you order by weight). The restaurant itself seemed super clean and spotless. Wonderful experience!

Great place!  We frequently stop in for an early dinner after work.  The food is great and served fast.  And it's a great fast breakfast place.  The breakfast tacos are ready to grab.  The brisket tacos are heavenly!
Thank you so much for the great review and for the support!

Went to Rudy's BBQ to pick up our catered Thanksgiving turkey and had the most pleasant experience the entire time through Thanksgiving leftovers. If you're looking to reduce time in the kitchen for the holidays Rudy's turkey was $49 and available to order online. We picked it up the day before and were met at our cars by a lovely worker who asked for our name on the order and brought out our turkey to the car. We didn't even have to turn the engine off! The turkey cake with a thermometer and easy instructions. When we finally made the turkey it was DELICIOUS flavored well and so moist. Best turkey I've ever tasted and the leftovers were just a good the next two days! We will definitely keep coming back for catered turkey.
Service was excellent. Guy gave me free loaf of bread. Food was pretty good. Spicy, flavorful and fell off the bone like a boy falls off the swing.
Not the size of the other Rudy's but the food is still the same and everything is new.Nice friendly staff and fast service..
Austin, TX 78750

First time here, self proclaimed bbq connoisseur... so, I want to get this right. Met some family visiting from out of town, their choice-lucky me.I'm sad I'd never been before. Brisket just melted off the fork. Pork belly glaze was on point pork itself was tender and just right. Loved having a bottled root beer. Took a brisket-avocado salsa-taco and tomato/zucchini salad with banana pudding to the hubby as an afternoon surprise treat at work- "where was THAT from, we're definitely going back". Perfect day for some outdoor bbq. (Outdoor seating) Staff/owners were VERY FRIENDLY, heard one of the gentlemen is from Corpus, WELCOME TO AUSTIN!!! Ps. I'm a stickler for cleanliness inside and out, it says a lot about the place and how it's kept-the bathrooms did not disappoint.

They just set up their website, theinterstellarbbq.com and you can place to-go orders, and even curbside during this COVID-19 pandemic. The to-go packaging was exceptional, and don't forget the free BBQ beans (so meaty!).Still the best ribs in the city too.

Second time here, first time on a Sunday where they had a collaboration with another pit master. Rolling Smoke was the guest this Sunday, and they brought some amazing bourbon pork belly burnt ends, watermelon juice glazed quail, smoked Mac and cheese with butter poached crawfish tails, and more. I also had some moist brisket this visit, last time it was sold out and they only had lean (which was great). The brisket melted in my mouth, and was perfect as is. No sauce needed. The ribs were perfectly cooked. Not too overdone and sliding off the bone...still a little tug off of the bone. Last time the pulled pork was sold out, and I'm so happy that it was there today. Tender shreds of juicy pork, bursting with flavor. Again, no sauce needed.You can't miss their sides either. The smoked scalloped potatoes are to die for!

The hype is real. These guys are serving up some righteous BBQ.We ordered via their online App for a noon pick up and had to wait an additional 20 minutes for our order, but it was well worth the wait.We ordered brisket and ribs. The brisket was tender as could be, not mushy and had an excellent bark that held the meat together perfectly.The pork ribs are large meaty and do not fall off the bone, which is good. A little tug will do ya to separate the perfectly smoked meat from the bone.They do provide a lite BBQ sauce that only adds to the goodness. You do not need to add BBQ sauce to their meat but a little dab will do ya. I like this sauce as it is not heavy and does not overpower the meat.They did forget to add beans to our order so dag nabbit we will have to return! I want to also mention that the folks that work here are super friendly and very appreciative of their customers. This little strip mall hard of 620 in the CP is turning into a cornucopia of dining options with Charm KFC right next door to Interstellar...Oh, and order early as they do run out!!!!!!!!

DELICIOUS BUT...I was in Austin a few days ago and I searched Yelp for bbq near my location. Interstellar had good reviews so I went by to give them a try. I went inside and started looking over the selections written in chalk on the boards on the wall behind the register. I was looking for a bake potatoes and meat plates. When I got to the register I asked if they had bake potatoes and was told no, they have never sold bake potatoes. Then, I asked if they had meat plates and was also told no. So, I first chose to order 1/2 lb ribs that were listed at $13.00 but when the person that was helping me sliced them and it was only two ribs I changed my mind. After looking at the menu again I asked if they only had beef sausage and was told yes outside of the jalapeño sausage listed. Though it was pricey as well, I then asked if I could get brisket with mostly fatty meat and was told yes...as I wanted to get something after driving over there...so I got 1/2 lb brisket which equated to 2 slices of brisket but he added a 3rd half end piece that took it a little over 1/2 lb. When I went to check out, I was offered complimentary bread, pickles and onions then beans. I don't remember what the brisket was per lb but my total came to $16.61. OUCH!!! Now, the only reason I am giving them 4 stars it because the brisket was as I asked and it was DARN GOOD!!! I gave the beans to my Mother and she said they were also good. Unfortunately, when in Austin again I won't be going back with the prices and minimum options. I will explore some other bbq spots recommended to me.

Food was fine, just fine. Don't engage in convo with pitmaster.... he'll talk your head off for 15 minutes while you just want food and trying to escape while he's answering questions you never asked. I asked a yes/no question of "can I order to eat a sammich now, or are you still on 24 hour pre ordering? (Per their sign)" and I lost all appetite trying to get the point to the pit master that I understood. Ffs!Then it took four employees (no exaggeration), with not a single other soul or customer present, to ring me up. It was most definitely the epitome of "how many people does it take to screw in a light bulb" Food was fine, experience is. 'wtf is going on here'

Staffs are very friendly and accommodating. I love everything we got. The smoked scalloped potato is definitely a must try. If you ho in a day that they have pastrami, it's worth getting as well. Their baked bean is delicious as well. And definitely get the peach glazed pork belly. I have not had that anywhere else. Definitely come back!

I've wanted to try this place for a while, but kept forgetting about it. Finally remembered, and holy jeez you guys, sampled everything, but the ribs and the turkey and it was all delicious. I mean so tasty that I had to leave the joint because it had the blood flowing to my lower region, which hasn't happened in years. Fantastic customer service and cleanliness, also.  Thanks for the food boner guys. I'll be back.
Amazing bbq! The Brisket and rib tips are so tasty!!! Definitely recommend stopping in for lunch.
Austin, TX 78750

Super tasty bbq, with the smoker right outside in the parking lot! They were out of pulled pork, so went with their recommendations: brisket and smoked turkey. Though the turkey was really quite good, I'd go back for that super tender melt in your mouth brisket. I've been to Franklin's and it was just too salty doe my tastes. This meat spoke for itself. The potato salad was awesome as well!
Great food, good customer service.I like their sides especially the scalloped potatoes. The beans where good. I will definitely go back. They could have more sauces to choose from.

I finally got to try this place after multiple failed attempts. What a great find in this area, I hope that it can continue to survive as most places in this area continue to come and go shortly after they open. I got the Brisket Sandwich, Banana Pudding Tart, Scalloped Potatoes and Mac and Cheese. The brisket was good and moist. I would definitely come back and get it again as well as try the other meat selections. The Mac and cheese and scalloped potatoes were on point! I really enjoyed the non-traditional sides that they had to offer. Both were delicious. They also offer free beans as well but I did not try it. The banana pudding tart was okay, but I'd venture to try other seasonal desserts they have next time. It was about $45 for two people to have lunch here, I did order a little more than normal dinner it was my first time trying it but it's a little on the pricey side but it was worth it. I'd definitely come back and try other options.

Ooooo, another good bbq place in Austin. No, still haven't gone to some of the big name places so I can't really compare it, but this place is kinda out of this world! The pork ribs were really tasty-really well cooked. The meat had a nice bite to it and wasn't falling off the bone but very tender and moist. Almost a perfect cook! I think I would have preferred a little more flavor in the rub or sauce but all in all, very good ribs. The brisket burger was also good even though I goofed on my reading comprehension and thought it was sliced brisket instead of a traditional ground burger patty. My bad! Still a darn good burger! I'd say you have to get the scalloped potatoes as that's just decadence in potato and cheese. Quite rich but not too heavy. Really delightful side dish that doesn't quite feel like a side dish. I really do want to come back and try the brisket and probably everything else on the menu.
The food was very well made. The brisket was juicy and savory, all the sides were so good. We'll come back!

How lucky am I to have this wonderful place just down the road from me? The food is crazy good. I have taken friends from out of town here several times as well, and they all agree, the food is insanely good.Wonderful service and hospitality. The free beans are really, really good. Every order gets their undivided attention. The food is coma inducing good. I will post more photos the next time I return.

Right now they are BYOB as of Dec 2019Been trying to come here for about a year - pretty much since they opened. Actually came here to eat 3 times before but the place was closed. 1 of the times I didn't pay attention to the early normal close hours of 5pm or so. The other 2 times, it was randomly closed. When we arrived, the line was to the door and moves pretty slowly unfortunately. Staff is friendly. Food itself is really good but expensive.  Jalapeño sausage is fantastic. The brisket is also really good. The 2 types bbq sauce they have are great. The mustard base one goes great with the sausage. Mac and cheese as a side is awesome. My wife had the salad. Again, prices for sides are also pricey. The one surprise that I didn't realize is that they have a big 'ol pot of beans/chili for you to eat for free. It's really good and pretty spicy. Food is great, staff friendly, a bit on the pricey side, and the line moves pretty slowly ... so if you are looking. For a quick lunch - this isn't the place.

Amazing, amazing, amazing food. Brisket is the best in Austin, the Saturday sausage specials are incredible, and the sandwiches are delicious.  We eat here a lot and it is always perfect - the food and the service!

We have been testing all the BBQ place close to our appartement.This place so far was our favorite for to go, even though I feel like the price was a little higher than some others.We tried the pork ribs, the brisket, the sausage : all tested great and were juicy and flavorful.The sides were the surprise : the Mac and cheese and the cole slaw are what you would expect plus a little unexpected change to the recipe making it interesting and delicious.
Austin, TX 78750

I don't know how long I've waited for the moment to come to Interstellar BBQ but it's cue that's out of this world for sure. They have a legendary Austin culinary heritage that has put this place on my radar ever since they opened (RIP Noble Pig). My friend and I after a friendly match of tennis decided to come here for our fatty lunch and to compensate for our calories burned and then some and boy was it worth the long drive.We decided to basically just try all the meats so here's what we got/liked in order of preference. Their house pickles are great and refreshing, and the both their sauces are good pending on what you like. I personally liked the red one more for the tomato base and less up front vinegary tang but if you like something more bracing and mustardy, go for the yellow. Anyways, on with the meat: 1. The sausage - I don't remember the name of the sausage we got (it was their special of the day), but oh boy was it flavorful. There's a little spice, some cheese and some other flavors in there that made it plenty nice. The texture was smooth and fatty without being overwhelming either. Best sausage I think I've had from any bbq joint.2. The ribs - The flavor on the rub is pretty insane - I guarantee you do not need sauce on these. It's sweet, peppery and despite relatively thin ribs, not overly salty. In other words, it tingles about every taste bud in your mouth just right. The only reason why it's not #1 on this list is the batch we got I think could have used a little more time on the smoker for slightly more tenderness.3. The brisket - moist brisket is the way to go and it's soaking the paper when it hits the plate. That said, it's surprisingly not too fatty when you start eating it. Again, mostly black pepper flavor with a lighter hand on the salt. I don't think their brisket needs sauce if you're a purist, but I would recommend a little because of the fat content so that the acid cuts the grease a bit.4. The chicken - red pepper chicken is definitely unique, so we decided to try it. They sell the chicken in quarters only and while the chicken is plenty juicy, I can say I've definitely had better flavor wise. I would pass on this unless you just want meat as a vehicle for their sauce.Yet in spite of all of the praise on the meat, it's arguable that the best things I ate at Interstellar were the sides. I don't know what ranches the owners have been on, but if I grew up on one of those ranches with a pot of beans like that, I would never have left the side of the pot. These ranch style beans are free on the house and by far the best beans I've had anywhere. And let's be frank: it's basically chili. It's thick and has lots of beans but there is a heaping helping of pulled/shredded meat in there that gives it that thick consistency. It's sweet, meaty, hearty, homeyness all in one bite. And honestly, if you wanted a cheap lunch, I would just buy a sausage and slather the chili on top of some white bread for arguably the best chili dog you'll have in your life. But that's JUST THE BEANS. Let's shine some love on that smoked scalloped potato too - well shingled, creamy potato casserole that's firm, yet delicate with just enough smokiness to evoke a fire roasted bake potato kinda taste. I wish this was at my thanksgiving spread every year...Lastly, the teas are really good too - peach tea is a summer dream but the brown sugar sweet tea is perfection in a glass as it's not too sweet but also has some more caramel like characteristics that take your taste buds on a ride that's way more complex than the usual one dimensional sweetness you get from other sweet teas. Don't get me wrong, regular sweet tea with the simple syrup is still sweet tea and awesome, but at my age where you have to worry about your sugar intake and have to weigh the pros and cons of intaking said amount of sugar, this would be one of my few exceptions worthy to drink.So in a nut shell, great meats, great sides, great service, great sauce - what's not to like? Interstellar BBQ may not be among the best known bbq joints in Austin [yet] but enjoy it while you can before the lines get brutal :).

Saw this place had great reviews. And with good reason. The staff was so friendly and the food was amazing. They came out to talk with us and thank us for coming in. Asked if we needed anything from inside. Try the pork belly. You won't regret it!!

I really want to give this place 4.5 stars but obviously I can't. We ordered the double brisket burger, pork ribs, and scalloped potatoes. The brisket burger surprised us. I thought it was going to be slices of brisket in a sandwich format. The meat itself lacked flavor and could've been better. The pork ribs were super good and flavorful. Probably one of the best. The scalloped potatoes were also really good. I want to come back and try just the brisket alone to truly know if this place is 4 or 5 stars. It's definitely up there. Brisket is the only way to gauge a bbq place and their quality like pad Thai for Thai food.

After a highly anticipated visit to Interstellar, me and our 7 guests from out of town left deeply disappointed.   The sausage was too dense and dry, the chopped brisket was so greasy, it was drowned out.     The turkey was the only reason this isn't a 1 star review, but even then...meh.I wouldn't go back here ever again, it was embarrassing to even recommend the place.   Our dog wouldn't even eat it. I'd look elsewhere if you are looking for Texas BBQ, we've only been here a few months and had way better in other places.

The food is truly amazing, Valerie at the front of this fun spunky personality that really makes the place even better.The food is on point. All of it. Oh, plenty of parking. Hopefully I can go back tomorrow and double up.

Did a curbside order today. Ordered online and showed up outside at the expected time. Called the number. Someone in mask brought out the food. No delay or long wait. I appreciate the extra trouble these businesses are taking to ensure their customers safety and satisfaction. Exceptional brisket. Perfect level of tenderness and fattiness. The sides were also really good.

When I heard that Noble Pig was was closing it's doors for a BBQ place, my initial reaction was mehhhh... Don't get me wrong, I love BBQ, but Noble Pig was one of the best sandwich places in town so I was definitely sad to hear that it was no longer going to be a thing.Today, I finally had the opportunity to check out it's successor - Interstellar BBQ, and wow... I forgot about Noble Pig reeeeal quick.This is not just a regular BBQ place. I've had the chance to try out all the well known BBQ places in the city, and Interstellar gives them all a run for their money, with the convenience of being up north and away from all the crazy lines.I ordered the beef cheeks and the moist brisket and I'm in meat heaven. The beef cheeks melt in your mouth and the brisket is up there with the very best in the city.I probably won't be able to eat here very frequently because my doctor will kill me, but the next time I get the craving for some smoked cows, I know exactly where to go.
column21: North Buttercup Creek, Cedar Park, TX

column20: This is the best barbecue I've ever had. Pre-COVID, I would take my little girl there for lunch every Saturday after dance class. As a bonus, everyone here is really kind. They were always so gracious when my daughter asked to see "the smoker where they make the bristet" as she says. I'm grateful we have a place like this just around the corner from my home.

Good stuff!Ordered curbside from the website, so I can't speak to anything indoors, but the ordering process was pretty smooth. They have very limited curbside spots, so I ended up in just another space in the parking lot, but was fortunate enough to be both under a tree and next to the pit, so it wasn't an unpleasant wait with my windows rolled down. I called when I arrived and described my car, and it was no problem - they delivered everything directly to my trunk. They were running about 15 minutes behind, but I wasn't in any kind of hurry, so I didn't mind.The food was excellent. Pork ribs literally fell of the bone, they were so tender. The brisket wasn't my favorite style - the flavor was good, but a very fatty cut, and no real crust. (There was no online option for ordering a less fatty cut; I don't know if the in-person ordering is any different.) Sausage was good - links are enormous, but also fatty. We ordered bottles of all three of their sauces. The mustard was our favorite, but I think the habanero would be excellent sprinkled on beans.The only side we ordered was the potato salad, and it was excellent. House-made.Pickles seem to be house made, also. Onions are red onions.We will likely be ordering from them again.
Austin, TX 78750

ALMOST RUINED MY WEDDING DAYFUTURE BRIDES AND GROOMS BEWARE!I have held off posting about this hoping that John and Noble/Interstellar BBQ would correct this situation, but I can't hold back anymore.STAY AWAY FROM Interstellar BBQ AT ALL COSTS. I will start the story from the beginning, so that you can all be fairly informed.We hired John and Noble Catering fairly early into our wedding planning. We got married in December of 2020 and we hired them in January of 2020.We sent them our deposit that secured over 220 plates of food. Fast forward to November of 2020. I sent an email on the 18th to ask questions and get clarification on a few details for vendor meals so that we could submit our final guest count in time for an adjusted final payment ahead of the date due on our contract, which was November 28th. On November 20th, John answered the questions that I had and we submitted out final guest count on November 23rd, five days before the requested date. My now husband called multiple times that week to make our final payment, including November 25th, 27th and 28th. On the 27th, My husband was informed by someone at Interstellar BBQ that John would call back by the end of the business day. We never received a phone call. NEVER.We followed up with an email on December 2nd, asking if they had received our email or our multiple messages left with employees because we were less than 10 days from our wedding at this point!!!!! We were, honestly, very worried about not having food at our wedding. We reached out to our venue and our wedding planner to see if there was any way that they could help us contact him, because no matter what we did, we could not seem to get ahold of him or anyone at Noble Catering.After reaching out to our venue and wedding planner for help in this matter, he FINALLY responded with an email on December 4th stating that he was sorry for the slow response, but the restaurant was on a holiday break and he had been out of the office, but that he would get us an updated total for the new guest count by that evening or first thing in the morning. On December 5th, ONE WEEK before our wedding, by 2pm that Saturday, we still had not received an updated cost or made final payment for our catering. We sent our termination of services email that day stating that we would no longer be needing his services and that we would be requesting a full refund.John emailed back almost immediately, stating that it was unfortunate, but that he would be checking the contract to see if he would be sending us a refund or not.Fast forward to December 11th, he sent us email asking where he could send a refund check to and we gave him our home address.As of January 6th, we still had not received a refund check, so we followed up asking when we might be receiving it, not wanting over $2200 to come up missing. He responded on the 7th, stating that he was going to be dropping it in the mail that day.It is now February 12, 2021 and I still don't have a refund check that was supposed to be mailed over a month ago!Thank the lord above for Pecan Springs Ranch owner Judy Smith, who was able to secure us a caterer last minute. The food was delicious and was raved about all night. Thanks to PEJ Events who was able to throw a whole menu together in 6 days. Save your time, energy and money and go with another caterer. Literally anyone else. Wedding planning is far too stressful to be dealing with the nonsense that we had to one week before ours and I want to save another couple from having to deal with it too.

I live in the neighborhood but have only picked up food from there a few times.  Being on Keto, BBQ is my normal go to type of restaurant.  Unfortunately the only thing I can eat here is the meat.   None of their sides are keto friendly.  Its totally passable BBQ and I like that they put adventurous twists on their food but if I have to make another stop to pick up vegetable sides, I might as well just go somewhere else.  Its also weird that despite what others reviewers have said, I don't get a friendly vibe when I go.

We did curbside takeout a few days ago for lunch. Like most other area restaurants I've visited during the pandemic, the curbside experience was pretty poor. There weren't enough curbside spots, and the order was almost an entire hour later than I was quoted, so I was left sitting in the parking lot wondering, along with many others.The food certainly made up for it though! The BBQ meats were all very good, but the sides are surprisingly what stood out to me about this place. The beans and potatoes alone would have been a great meal. Seriously, try all the sides! Get big containers of them! The brisket, turkey, pulled pork and sausage were all very delicious. I miss Noble Pig, but at least they replaced it with something as good or better.

One of the most beautiful trays of barbecue I've ever witnessed and eaten. John has a pedigree of making everything in house and it was showcased with all of these well executed proteins and sides. The sausage and scalloped potatoes were notable highlights!Thank you John & crew for all you have done & continue to do.

Just moved here from Dallas and have always been a bbq  fan. I was happy to find this place. After a few visits I can say that it's currently the best bbq north of 45. Moist Brisket was excellent. Sausage was good, sauce was decent with a few options.

This restaurant made my list since it was voted one of the best BBQ places by the Austin Monthly magazine. It was delicious BBQ! However it didn't blow my socks off and it was on the more expensive side. I would go back here if someone else is buying :)!

The brisket taco could be $10 with the generous cut of prime. Best value on the menu. Always get the beans. Jalapeño sausage is committed to its meat:cheese ratio.Get it to go. Flies outside both times I sat there during COVID. No ding now, but after COVID they need to clean the outside seating area more frequently. It reflects poorly on the product quality everywhere else.

Phenomenal food! If it is your first time, order a bit if everything but make sur to order the brisket tacos, they are sublime.  The peach tea glaze pork belly tender and delicious.  Scallops potatoes, I'm just going to say order them you won't be disappointed.  Great experience.

(8/29/18).  Promised myself to try Interstellar BBQ after discovering it next door to Charm Korean BBQ which makes amazing and flavorful fried chicken.  Their wood fired smoker is in the parking lot. Always smells wonderful. I told the cutter it was my first timer and he introduced himself as John.  He made a couple of suggestions. I ordered the whole burnt end of the brisket that was sitting there and 2 of the ribs he had just unwrapped.  Another employee suggested the smoked scalloped potatoes.    Meal was served on butcher paper on an aluminum try which to me is a good sign of true Texas BBQ.  The meal included house made pickles and pickled onions.  They also serve 3 flavors of tea and bbq beans. The brown sugar tea is excellent and unique.  Different flavor from traditional sweet tea.  The beans were good but had a little too much chili power in them for my taste.  But it didn't prevent me from eating 3 boats of them.  They were good after all.  Loved the pickles and onions.  Not over powering and different from others I have had in the area.  The smoked scalloped potatoes had an amazing flavor. It's a must order.I sampled both sauces on the table.  Neither one was to my personal taste.  Everyone around me seem to really enjoy them though.  To me, good BBQ doesn't need sauce.  Well, I was not disappointed.  The burnt ends were some of the best I have ever tasted.  They still retained a layer of fat that just melted in my mouth.  The meat was so tender it almost fell apart with a little urging from a plastic fork.  As tender as a nicely cooked roast should be.  Amazing.  The ribs were nice with lots of meat and a familiar flavor I couldn't identify at that time.  I'm going to ask about the rub on my next visit.Overall, Interstellar BBQ is a top notch example of Texas BBQ.  If you want a true taste of what barbecue is supposed to taste like, you must try them out.  Interstellar BBQ is definitely in the top 5 of my "Keepers List".
Austin, TX 78750

We came to Austin for a little family vacation on the way back home we looked up BBQ places near us and thankfully we landed at this place! Let me start by saying the Staff is super friendly and helpful with anything. The BBQ is made perfectly The CAB brisket is a must!!! They have complementary beans which were too delicious to be free! I mean honestly everything was great!! The sweet tea was just right not too sweet not too bland. Just perfect little place! Thank you!

I've been meaning to try this place ever since it was Noble Pig.  But I picked the wrong time being in the midst of Covid and right after the winter storm.  Dining is still limited to outdoor only, and the menu was limited due to supply issues after the winter storm.  So I opted for the chopped beef sandwich with beans and potato salad.  The chopped beef was quite good, and the bun was buttered and toasted.  It came with pickles, slaw and onions to add on top.  The slaw has a vinegar tang, but made a nice topping.  The beans tasted a lot like Ranch Style Beans, but thickened up.  The potato salad was chunky and a little bland.  I thought the sandwich was a bit pricey at $10.  You can get the same amount at Rudy's for $7, but with plain bread.  I wouldn't mind coming back in the future when they have a full menu and indoor seating.

Went for the first time on a Sunday just before noon. Line out the door, which is typically a good sign. I think the line might be a little by design to help manage the tables as well - if it went much faster there wouldn't be enough seating during busy times. But the food was worth the wait. We tried to sample a lot of different meats - moist brisket, pork spare ribs, turkey, and two different sausages (the jalapeño popper sausage and a hatch green chili and cheese one that is not always on the menu). All were good - the standout was the brisket - it's up there with Stiles Switch and La Barbecue, maybe not quite as good as Franklin or John Mueller (when he's cooking he's top of the class in my opinion), but that's very good company. The pork spareribs were very large - two of them were over half a pound.
