The turkey and sausage was all good as well - my wife gave the nod to the jalapeño popper sausage over the hatch green chili sausage, so I'm glad that will be on the menu next time we stop in. We had some sides too, and while you don't go to a barbecue restaurant for the sides, the jalapeño slaw was a standout here. There are two sauces on the tables - both my wife and I preferred the oranger of the two (it reminded me of the sauce from City Market in Luling), and the pickles and pickled onions served with the meats were both very tasty and refreshing either on a sandwich or in between bites. All in all, it's in the upper echelon of Austin barbecue joints, and given the state of Austin barbecue in 2019, that's saying a lot.

In a far away distance there is a gem.  I am a barbecue fan and truly love to smoke some meat.  I make a mean pastrami,  but this spot has got some skills.  If you ever get a chance, I would suggest you swing by and give it a try.  You won't be disappointed. We tried the brisket, pastrami,  pork ribs, and a jalapeno Cole slaw that was on point.  The flavor really was on point.

The moist end brisket literally melted, lots of flavor, some nice bark and superbly tender....i'm calling this my new favorite.  The pulled pork was very tender and good, the beef sausage link was almost as good as the brisket.  They pride themselves on their sides and after tasting the jalapeno cole slaw which was made while were standing in line, and the mac and cheese shells....my wife and I concurred...all we can say is yum!  We came in thinking we would order a standard 3 meat plate but they do it a little different here.....they ask how much you want....free samples can be had for the asking, if you try it you'll probably get some....yep we sure did!  We got too much but that just means we'll have a great supper tonight.  The iced tea was great too.  I got the vibe that these people love what they do and they do it very well.  We enjoyed talking to the young man manning the pit.

I love supporting local businesses so we've tried Interstellar BBQ twice to give it a fair chance. I'm a BBQ guy and love quality work. We really wanted to like this place which is why we gave it a second chance before writing a review. We ordered brisket, pork ribs, chicken and got their scallop potatoes, beans and mac n cheese for sides. Everyone felt the food ranked a 5 out of 10 scale. It was mediocre at best. Brisket rated at 6. Ribs rated at 5 and the chicken a 4. The free "beans" is a nice touch but they should really be called "chili beans" because of the heavy chili powder spice. A bit unexpected but not too bad. The mac n cheese was the best out of everything which is not a good sign for a BBQ restaurant. Again, we really wanted to like this place but it just wasn't up to a top tier BBQ standard.
Take-out - Chopped BBQ sandwich near perfect. Staff very friendly. For now, the definitive North Austin/Cedar Park location for BBQ (Stiles Switch opening soon in Cedar Park).

This place has the BEST brisket. It had everything you want in brisket. Some bark, some smoke, the right seasoned rub and most importantly it was very moist. Melt in your mouth moist. Yummy. We also had the chicken and jalapeño popper sausage. The chicken was great also. It had a great run and some smoke. The sausage was delicious. Some of the best sausage I've had out. This place does there own pickles and onions. They were hood. Not your run of the mill whit onion and pickles. We tried the scalloped potatoes and jalapeño coleslaw. Both were very very good. Highly recommend. They give you free bean which were also yummy. This place is great. We will be back for the brisket. Yummy!

Tried Interstellar today.  Overall, it's solid entry into the BBQ canon.  Here's my ratings:Brisket: excellent burnt ends/bark, moist, this is high quality BBQ, on par with Blacks.  (A+)Cole slaw: too dry for me, only big miss. (B)Potato salad: good stuff, big portion. (A)Side of home made pickles and pickled onions nice touch.  Sauce was a little too vinegar for me, but otherwise ok.  Ranch beans were sort of tasteless.  Wish it was more self-serve style with pickles, onions, bread, etc.Prices were high - it's about $20 a person for 2 meat plate, but that's going rate, I suppose.  Inflation.
Austin, TX 78745

Don't zip by too fast or else you will miss some of the best and underrated smoked meats & barbecue in South Austin. Seriously! Slow down and look for Moreno Barbecue's white trailer and the shaded/covered picnic tables at the corner of Stassney Lane & Menchaca Rd (I am getting used to the name change too). So many great things to try here but I am highly advising you to try the smoked delicious barbacoa that Moreno Barbecue nails on Sunday mornings. Order the night before (Saturday) for a pickup time convenient for you on their website. I recommend starting with 1lb per 2 people but spoil yourself and get a 2lb'er. You won't regret it! The barbacoa is not fatty, delicious, has a gentle smoked flavor, and comes with the required sides for barbacoa tacos such as homemade flour tortillas, chopped white onions, fresh cilantro, and wedges of lime. Also we got a nice red salsa too to top everthing off. You will appreciate the no-waiting-in-any-kind-of-line-on-a-Sunday kind of Sunday because you thought ahead and ordered the night before. Of course you can always walk up too if you prefer but I would hate for you to miss out on a Barbacoa Sunday IMO.¡Cuidado! (watch out), though! They usually sell out before they are set to close for the day.  They are open Thursday - Sunday's only but I would recommend watching their Facebook page as they update on all specials and food availability daily.

I tried to write a review months ago but the restaurant wasn't yet posted. This place is the best unknown bbq place in Austin. It makes Rudy's taste like thin gruel and it's a competitor with the big boys: Franklins, Valentina's, Salt Lick. We've tried everything and visited five times. Service is great, plenty of parking, tv while you wait, open through COVID. Hidden gem.

This is for the hood. Don't tell non-locals, please! Call ahead to make sure the brisket is well stocked sells out early, due to COVID making his cuts less available, love this guy and his family! Coming here since day 1 and being treated like that is what southern BBQ is about!

This was my first time ordering, I placed an order online and when I arrived I waited like 2 mins for my order.I love frito pies and was excited to try theirs. I've had my fair share and this is such a great size! It can definitely be shared for 2 people if you want a small taste. I love the amount of jalapeños I got, when I order other places a side will give me 3 slices and they gave me enough.The frito pie has such good flavor and enough of everything! I will be going back to try a brisket sandwich soon.

Problem with the brisket taco is it's literally just a piece of meat stuck in a tortilla.  No one should do that.The pork sandwich is delightful with the slaw but the turkey sandwich is a reason to come back.  Perhaps other things will pop.

In a BBQ state, is it possible to find good BBQ that sticks out? Spoiler alert, yes! The brisket was fantastic. So juicy, tender and flavorful.  I will go back and eat every brisket item on the menu. Kudos to them for getting a brick and mortar location soon (progress pictured).  A true Austin story (from food truck to brick and mortar), and I am happy to be in the same neighborhood, so I can literally walk over when I want.
Moreno BBQ will be the new if not already the best BBQ in town. Consistent and delicious. My only complaint is you cannot order everything at once. Or can you...

Figures a couple of good reviews and their customer service goes down the tubes. I'm standing outside your trailer in the rain - nobody else in line or nearby and you refuse to take my order because I'm not wearing a mask? When there's no one else around? Brilliant customer service plan folks. I mean you guys have got to be kidding me- I'm standing outside and you refused to take my order because I forgot my mask? I AM STANDING OUTSIDE and there is no one else in line? Most establishments would provide a cheap disposable mask if they have a policy they're enforcing. Your stuff ain't that good there's plenty of places for bbq in Austin

I was at a loss for words to adequately describe Morenos bbq. Let me preface with; I've been in the restaurant business my entire life -Born in Boston, grew up in VT; 20 years in SF where I was an Executive Chef and then Seattle, as Pit Master for a bbq concept based on an old local standby. And now? WOW! I'm new to Austin and stumbled upon this place earlier this week. I was craving a couple ribs for a snack, and new to the neighborhood so thought I'd give it a try. To say the customer service is great is an understatement. They're genuine and welcoming, it's like seeing old friends- however, to my disappointment-sold out of ribs. So I walked with 1/2 lb moist brisket, she was sure to add bread, pickles, onion and side of sauce. This is where words start to fail me...um it was delightful, lovely, heavenly, wonderfully the most delicious smoked brisket I've ever had. I've had my fair share- trust me, it's that good. I liked the sauce, a lite sweetness with a little heat- It was so good, I went back the following afternoon, in the pouring rain, needing to try more. The same ridiculously good service, got my rib fix in and another half pound brisket (that stuff could prove addicting) and a half chicken. Sides were beans, slaw and potato salad- which were all really good. You can feel the love thru the attention to seasoning and prep of the sides. Ribs- nice rub - smoked perfectly almost falling off the bone but still a little bite. Brisket- unbelievable you have to try it to understand it. Chicken, nicely done with a light rub and smooth smoke.  I got home and I found a container of sausage that I hadn't ordered. They were busy and I'm sure it was mistake (I'll pay you guys for it next time.) I'm not really a fan of sausage particularly hot links you find at a lot of bbq places. I'm not sure what kind of sausage they were but , they were truly mouthwateringly amazing. Great service, great bbq right here in my neighborhood. That's a fine welcome to Texas in my book. And with the current Covid19 cloud hanging over us...this place is a shining star.
Austin, TX 78745

Went by on a Wednesday for their burger day as I have already sampled the excellent bbq. Met a couple of buds for their first time there. I was bit apprehensive for them as we usually eat at a couple of places that have been cranking out cheeseburgers for over 50 yrs. They loved them! As a native Austinite I've had all the good cheeseburgers this great city produces and Moreno's ranks very high on the list!

Fantastic south Austin bbqI tried Moreno last spring and I thought that it was pretty good brisket and pulled pork, but not quite on the level of some of my favorites from around town. Not the case this time. ABSOLUTELY on par with the best BBQ in Austin. Thoroughly impressed. and full. Nice work!!!

Absolutely amazing bbq. Have not been dissatisfied once. Today I ordered a couple of different meats, i left without one of the meats in the bag, came back a few mins later & for the trouble they added some goodies in the bag. I thought it was extremely sweet of them & shows how much they care about their customer service! So glad I live near by, I always go to Moreno's for my barbecue fix.  Gouda mac, brisket & Banana pudding.... all time faves. Eat here. Wont regret it.

Went with the 3 meat ate, which is a deal at $17.  Good quality brisket and perfectly cooked pork ribs with a tasty dry rub.  Pulled pork was good; bock beans had a nice kick. Potato salad was average...The sauce was on the sweet side and tasty. The Moreno's couldn't have been nicer.Lots of options besides the meat plate but those will need to wait till another time.

Love this BBQ spot! It also doesn't hurt that it's walking distance from my house! Great customer service and they are very covid-conscious. This has become a weekly go-to for my friends and I. Don't sleep on the turkey sandwich or brisket mac-n-cheese!

Was shocked at how DELICIOUS this BBQ truck was in comparison to some of the places I've visited so far here in Austin. Absolute gem thats a must try if you're looking to try out some new cue in town.

Great new Bbq truck in South Austin. The ribs are awesome, very good dry rub seasoning. I didn't even think of trying the bbq sauce until I was halfway through the rack.  Creamed corn and Gouda Mac are on point as well. Try the specials! The Brisket Burger was full of flavor and a creative use of a Texas staple.
Amazing food, especially the brisket Gouda Mac and cheese! We were just in Austin for the day, and I'm glad we chose to eat here for lunch!
Definitely a go to BBQ it is delicious and the bbq sauce has a great taste the potatoes salad taste like something good check it out , if you like bbq this is the place .
Austin, TX 78745

I went here a few weeks ago...waited to post the review until after I had the chance to compare their brisket to some of my other favorites (Valentina's and Rudy's). I'll have to say, this is hands down some of the best brisket I've ever tried! My grandparents have lived in Fair Oaks out by the original Rudy's since it has been open...so their moist brisket has a soft spot in my heart...seems to be a pretty good barometer for brisket IMO. This is on par, if not better. I'm not the biggest fan of the sauce, but any BBQ lover is going to be stocked up several different types, so no biggie. I think that's definitely more of a personal preference. Also expect great customer service! I called around 20 min before close to see if it was too late or not- they encouraged me to come in and give it a try! I wanted to make it worth their while if I was going in before close...I got around $50 of food and ate on it throughout the week. The chicken quarters were amazing, turkey was moist and the sides and dessert were to die for. I got the potato salad and the gouda mac n cheese. Absolutely incredible sides..some of my favorite Mac I've had at a BBQ joint. From another review, I saw that they offer brisket nachos wIth the gouda sauce - that will be next on the bucket list! I also got the banana pudding, which was very good. I hope this little joint continues to grow!

Just had the brisket burger. Wow, you better have an appetite when you order this burger. It is huge, juicy and very very good. It is served on a tasty fresh bun. Can't wait to try the other items they offer.

I recently purchased carry out from Moreno's BBQ - brisket w/gouda mac 'n cheese, sausage, cole slaw and chocolate chip shortbread cookies.Lunch with my friend was motoring along swimmingly until we got to the cookies.  I had ordered a dozen, however, when I opened the box only two cookies were intact.  Most were broken into numerous pieces many to the stage of being nothing more than crumbles.The cookies were very tender and tasty, however, I would suggest either (a) be more careful when filling the box and/or (b) find an alternate means of packing the cookies other than a syrofoam container.We ended up putting the crumbling cookies on top of ice cream even though I would have much preferred to have eaten an intact cookie.The brisket mac 'n cheese was very good, I have to say but Moreno's needs to seriously work on the packaging of their cookies.

Outstanding!!! Chicken was smoked to perfection. Great smoke flavor..The skin was crispy but not burnt. You can tell it was smoked over 4 hrs slow and low. Great customer service and lots of shade trees are a extra bonus.

I stopped in because well why not? I have heard good things about the food and it is close to my house. I wanted the brisket nachos but they were out. Instead I ordered one pulled pork taco and one brisket taco and couldn't walk away without the banana pudding. OMGIt was all amazing! Mouth watering !  The meat was perfectly tender and delicious. The banana pudding just like mine. This is my new go to place. Dont drive through South Austin without stopping here.

Ya, this place is ridiculous. It's a must try. And do it now before they get super popular and you have to stand in line for an hour. We had the brisket grilled cheese, a chopped brisket sandwich and the Mac. All were off the charts good. Highly recommend. Will definitely be back.

This is My bbq spot here in south Austin! Great bbq great sides and great deserts! Bo knows what he is doing per at Moreno! Always great specials too my go too is the loaded turkey sandwich $6 or special or regular $8 can't beat it! The potato salad is my go too side and the banana pudding is killer! Go support you won't regret it!!

All the food I have had is delicious.  Breakfast tacos with a generous portion of meat.  Pulled pork tender and delicious.  Chicken juicy and great smoked flavor.  Sandwiches are excellent.  Service is excellent, everyone is very friendly.  Looking forward to trying the brisket burger!

It was my first time eating from here. I would pass by and wonder if the BBQ was any good. I finally placed an order and I it was really good. I tried the brisket tacos, brisket sandwich, chicken, turkey sandwich, pulled pork and potato salad. It was all more than I expected. I recommend, will be back.
Austin, TX 78745

This was some amazing tasting BBQ! We got the brisket grilled cheese and pulled pork sandwich loaded. A side of bbq sauce because who doesn't  like extra Sauce. We even got to try the sliced turkey that was super juicy and flavorful that needed no bbq sauce to make it taste great, but we added some anyways because their sauce was so good. Definitely will be back here while in Texas.

Good BBQ in my neighborhood which is good and bad - did I really need to know there was such smoky fatty goodness this close?  The pork belly is sublime!  Tender, juicy and  nicely smoked - my favorite thing I tried so far.  The brisket I received was tasty but was all on the lean side while I prefer mine moist.  It wasn't dry though like a lot of the more lean brisket and I like the peppery rub a lot.  My only (slight) disappointment was the pork ribs.  Again, the rub was nice and they were nicely smoked and flavorful but they were a little too al dente - I like my ribs a little less chewy, but overall this is REALLY good BBQ.  Nice to know I don't have to wait in line at Franklins or drive all way up to Stiles Switch to get some great smoked meat.

AMAZING! I go at least once a week to this bbq spot. They have daily specials, you get a lot of food for what you get, and have the best salsa in Atx! Literally anything you get will be great and the people working there are so nice but make sure you try the brisket guisada!
L.E.G.I.T. this is my new bbq joint. I really don't know what more I can say except get over there and give them all your money! Seriously, it's worth every penny!

Morenos is the best BBQ I've ever had, and I'm from Texas and have eaten my fair share. Brisket had great  texture and flavor. Spare ribs fell off the bone. The beans were so good and I don't even like beans. Gouda Mac and cheese was also a favorite.

This was my 1st stop into Moreno BBQ, and I will be back!  Very friendly at the window and brought my food out to me.  I had the pulled pork sandwich (which was huge)!  Sides of slaw and creamy gouda Mac and cheese.  Glad to have some good bbq in the neighborhood!

This BBQ was soooo bomb! The ribs were really juice and the meat fell off the bone. We also tried the Pulled Pork Nachos, mac and cheese and banana pudding nothing disappointed! The prices are good and service was great

My husband had the frito pie a couple of weeks ago and on this cold and rainy night he was craving it. I had the turkey sandwich and mac and cheese. The turkey is so good, super moist. The bun was soft, definitely seemed better then some store bought after thought. The GOUDA mac and cheese is amazing! Super fan already of this place!
If you are looking for some serious BBQ. I HIGHLY recommend Morenos BBQ. Started out as a one time visit to a weekly visit. This place us definitely up there with some of the top bbq spots in Austin.

I took up eating barbecue as a hobby last summer and this place is my favorite place I have ever found hands down. It's a hole in the wall with odd hours and the most delicious barbecue you could ever have. Service is prompt and friendly, very clean place with seating indoors and outdoors.Great place!

House Park BBQ serves up some of the best barbecue in Austin. Great brisket, chicken, pork loin, ribs, and sausage.  The brisket is tender and smoked to perfection. They are serving brisket tacos on Fridays now, and they outstanding, especially with the smoked tomatillo salsa. Really recommend trying some Q from the oldest pu in Austin.

Great BBQ . Try it all. Monday is  the only day they do chicken . It's amazing just like everything else and my favorite . No teeth or very few needed. I just had 4 pulled at dentist and saw their sign while on a bike ride near by. The owner Matt is a great guy and same goes for his team. Trying to talk him into making a Tex Mex BBQ taco that I can take to go. Support this local business and keep one of the oldest pits in Texas smoking for many years to come. Any place that is only open for a few hours per day has got to be great. Put this place on your bucket list!

Texas AF! From the moment you set eyes on the building you can tell they're smoking something good inside. Family owned and operated so you know they do everything with love. I got a mix plate this time around but I've had pretty much everything on their menu, everything has been amazing! My personal favorites are the brisket, chicken and I love the baked beans. Definitely worth a visit! "Need no teef to eat my beef"
Amazing bbq, friendly staff and a really homey feeling place. We had ribs, sausage and brisket and I almost screamed of joy when I saw our plate. Probably the best bbq in Austin.
Super nice dudes. Will be back simply based on how great the guys behind the counter are. The food was solid, old school bbq with no frills. Cheap prices and outdoor seating. What's not to like?

Considering it has been a whole eight years since my previous review, I thought I'd make an update!First off as a direct update to my previous review, they are no longer cash only and accept cards, so that's cool.Also, the BBQ is still good, no-frills- just like I love it.  This place is a little bit off the map for most folks, but I'm glad to have a place where I can get some good, old-fashioned Texas BBQ and don't have to line up for hours to get.  The food is made with soul & history and the effort shines bright.But the real reason for my update is that they started serving breakfast tacos a couple days a week (as of this review, Tuesdays & Fridays).  They are filling a serious gap in my quest for finding a non-pretentious taco in the morning at a decent price.  If you see that breakfast taco sign out in the morning, be sure to stop and get you (and your coworkers, you office hero, you) one of the classics like a bacon, egg, & cheese or something different like brisket & eggs.They're still an awesome bet for lunch, too.  I love meeting friends here or taking out-of-towners here to show them what BBQ is supposed to be.Love this place!

Great no frills BBQ in a location very close to the office.  I've visited this place quite a few times when I'm wanting some BBQ.  Typically, I get the Beef Brisket Sandwhich with a bag of chips.  One time I got a plate, but I'm not too crazy about their sides (beans are the only one of the three sides offered I like anyway). The brisket is very moist/fatty and sometimes is hit or miss as far as whether or not you really need teef.  The sauce pairs nicely with the meat, regardless.  The typical portions are fairly large and satisfying for the price.This place is cash only.  The guys behind the counter are very quick and make you feel welcome.If you sit inside, you'll see all the interesting things hanging on the walls, but be warned you'll smell like BBQ when you leave and everyone can tell where you've been.  On nicer days, I like to sit at the picnic tables on the outside.Sometimes it stinks they're only open for lunch on weekdays.  I'd like to bring my friends who work across town here- but that couldn't happen mid-week.

Found this place by accident when trying to go see the hope murals... they only open during week and close at 230. We stopped in at 2 and was welcomed to stay eat and don't rush! The place has a unique feel, Nothing fancy but amazing taste of BBQ! And great price!  The owner was really nice showed us the oldest smoke house in Austin. I loved that while we were there 3 other customers came in and the owner knew everyone's name and they were all chatting. This hidden treasure is a must try!

Some of the Juiciest sausage sandwiches and the staff are really friendly! Came because I heard about a Fourth of July promotion going on and unfortunately didn't get a mimosa but so glad it gave me the opportunity to try the food!!

Is jury duty ever a good thing?  Well obviously not but when Travis County gives you lemons throw them in the trash and go get some BBQ.  See House Park BBQ has been around for 60+ years but they are only open 11-3 M-F so once forced downtown for jury duty I thought it would be the perfect opportunity to knock another Austin BBQ spot off the list.  First just order BBQ.  The sides were not worth your money.  Potato Salad and Slaw were meh at best.  The beans were ok but not anything special.  The brisket was very tender but a bit on the fatty side.  Nothing really jumped out flavor wise.  Just a nice simple brisket.  Not the best in town and not the worst in town, pretty much middle of the road.  Good enough to eat once but not sure I would go back.

If you are looking for high end bbq experience this is  ! This place is everything you want Texas  barbecue to be. It's good. It's authentic. It's cheap. And it's definitely no-frills. Me and my crew came here from Chicago to visit Texas for a conference. There is an abundance of Texas barbecue places all around Texas in and around. Austin. This was one of the ones we chose to spend time at and we're glad did. The sausage was good I like the bite that it gave. The ribs were fall off the bone good. The brisket was very good.  The only downside is that you have to request fatty brisket. This place is a godsend gem for  tourist because everybody will be looking for the high end circus experience that comes with some of the other more established barbecue places. If you are in the Austin area and you just want some good barbecue definitely stop in. You can leave your teeth because you won't need to eat their tender beef. Also it is byob.
Friendly and fast with great sausage and sauce, and the building is delightfully dilapidated.

I was in Austin recently and checked out a few BBQ places. This was by far my favorite. Few options, but they do what they do extremely well. The people behind the counter are awesome. Can't wait to go back the next time I'm in town.

Lousy hours. Just an ordinary barbecue sandwich. Not worth going out of your way. Prices are average. Friendly counter service. Short wait and no crowds. Went during lunch around Noon. No frills. Has that look of an old barbecue place, which it is. No TV here. Takes credit cards.

After a lifetime of living in Austin, a lifetime of driving past House Park Bar-B-Q, I finally had the occasion of dropping in for lunch. I visited with two friends, one of whom had recently moved to Austin from the East Coast and not yet had the privilege of enjoying real deal TX BBQ. I sorely regret that this was my companion's introduction to TX BBQ, because this place is a real bummer all around. First off, atmosphere can best be described as corny, dirty, and (to quote our unfortunate commander-in-chief...) SAD. I get that it's got a kind of rustic vibe that may be interpreted by many as "authentic", but frankly to me it's kind of embarrassing. Like, if people think a grimy run down shack with sticky tables, flies buzzin' around, and no AC in the middle of summer (the audacity!) represents an authentic Texan experience then I'm not surprised so many out-of-state visitors are scared to leave the city limits of Austin. After the patron drops an inappropriately large sum of cash on their meal, they get to chose between sitting inside the hot, cramped, windowless shack or dining outside on the make shift patio in the blazing hot sun with scenic Lamar traffic whizzing by just feet away. Talk about southern hospitality!Ok, now the food. Sides were unappetizing, the pulled beef sandwich is a glorified sloppy joe, and the sausage sandwich was a greasy seething mess of nauseating pork fat. I will say that the sandwich was absolutely heaping with meat, but the sheer quantity did not distract from the fact that the sausage was of particularly low quality, sort of soggy, and tasted like an extra salty hot dog. I'm pretty well convinced that this place is only surviving as a sort of tourist trap, or perhaps business traveler trap, or maybe a hungover UT fratboy shame trough. A word of warning: if you are an innocent looking for palatable BBQ in a charming atmosphere, save yourself and avoid House Park Bar-B-Q.

Oldest smoker in Austin. One of the few "Austin" institutions left. Brisket is tender, rib meat falls off the effin bone and sausage is spicy. Menu is short and sweet, nothing fancy here. My fav bbq in the 512.

Good food for the money. Unpretentious and relaxed with good outdoor eating on Pick nick tables. Places definitely has a rustic feel and looks basic too, however the food is anything but. Pulled pork is awesome. The kind of food your mom wishes she could make :)

This place was recommended to me by someone whom I met on a flight. The recommendation turned out to be solid. I had Kansas style BBQ ribs, brisket, and sausage. The ribs were very good, moist, smoked flavor. The brisket was fall apart on your fork moist. Excellent. The sausage was delicious, a burst of complex flavors, dense consistency. Again, excellent. The owner and his staff were very friendly. His dad started the business; he took it over. Check out the 75-year old pit in back. Recommended.

How can a BBQ place stay in business this long with so below average BBQ? Very dirty, dingy building and very few customers even around lunchtime. Place just had a weird (not in a good way) vibe to it.Brisket was low quality beef and kind of tough. Seemed to have been cooked too hot or too fast. Chicken was OK and sides were all right but very small portions.
Got a restaurant.com coupon for this place. The guy behind the counter was friendly and part of the family. This place has quite a history. Good bbq. The brisket was pretty lean.

First off, how is it possible that only 6 folks have reviewed this place before me?!?  It's been here since 1943 people.  And that's probably what I like about it best.  The atmosphere is very old Austin, and there is a layer of smoke and grit inside the place that cannot be faked (think Smitty's in Lockhart, the original half).  So 4 stars for authenticity and atmosphere.  For the food itself, a solid 3 stars.  I had the brisket sandwich plate which comes with 2 sides, I chose the housemade beans and cole slaw.  The brisket was good with a proper smoke ring and bark.  Not the greatest I've ever had, but totally respectable.  The beans and cole slaw were both above average.  I liked that the slaw was not mayo based, which is a big turn off for me.  This place is BYOB, and there are tables inside and picnic tables outside.  They have a lunch special each day at $1 off the regular price.  The staff was really friendly and the customers all seemed to be happy there.  I am happy to have found this little hole in the wall of an authentic bbq joint so close to my office.  I'll be back to try their ribs and sausage next.

Went yesterday for the first time and had the mixed sandwich sausage/brisket.  Amazing best bbq sandwich I've had in a long time.  Juicy and full of flavor and only about $6 a piece.  I'll be back regularly now.

House Park BBQ has been around forever and after a hard morning riding bikes at 9th Street during college, we'd roll over to House Park for a chopped beef.  Now that I'm working downtown and fairly close to House Park, I've been wanting to go back.Time has not been kind.  I had the two meat sandwich this time, brisket and sausage.  The brisket was acceptable.  The sausage was mediocre.  I had beans and slaw, both of which were yawn inspiring.  Maybe I should have stuck with the chopped beef.In a city rife with BBQ choices, it's sad this old mainstay isn't making my list of go-to places.
Awesome local Bbq spot that I had never know about despite having grown up in Austin. Super friendly staff and great brisket sandwich for a very reasonable price. I will be coming back often.

I've been a customer for over 17 years working in the west side of downtown. The barbecue is nothing to write home about, but this 1 star review is for the breakfast tacos. They really need to drop the Mexican sub-catergory they're using on Yelp because it's an insult to that country and not even accurate because they don't eat tacos for breakfast in Mexico. If you're starving at lunch, it's worth a shot coming by for a chopped beef sandwich, but do not waste your time with their tacos in the morning. The brisket and egg had no brisket. For $3 that is almost criminal. I incorrectly assumed the sausage & egg from a barbecue restaurant would be cut up from a sausage link and not just Jimmy Dean pan sausage. At $3 that is a total rip off. I warned them that I am from South Texas and they told me that they would be worth every penny. You can't be charging Rudy's prices if it isn't the same quality. If you really want an awesome brisket taco for less than $3, go to Bill Miller...add some cheese and get a side of sour cream and you'll think you're eating a fajita taco for breakfast. That's the move!

10/10 BBQWhere to begin? House Park and the crew there are my favorite lunch spot. Its so nice to be able to walk in and get a legit meal with no bullshit. Their chopped beef sandwich is my standard, but the special is always tempting. The prices are on point as well as the portions. Here's the real kicker: they just catered my wedding and it was amazing. As my wife and I were making the rounds we started freaking out b/c everyone's plates coming out of the buffet line were HEAPING! I was doing the math for how much pizza to order once the food ran out- but it never did. We took home extras even! I can't believe our 120+ didn't finish it off. I even saw folks going for their 3rd plate! To Matt and his crew- thanks for being a part of our big day, and we'll see you soon!10/10 BBQ

Came here with a group of six guys and everyone liked what they ordered so that says enough right there. The soon-to-be-groom walked out with a t-shirt because the guys working this place are just that cool.Great food with no pretense. It's all about the meat, just the way it should be. Super friendly staff, cool old vibe, 71 year old smoker...the place just does things right.
Great food with no pretense. It's all about the meat, just the way it should be. Super friendly staff, cool old vibe, 71 year old smoker...the place just does things right.

An old friend recommended House Park and raved about the BBQ. Well, he has not been to House Park in more than 15 years and I believe his tune would change about House Park. The BBQ was ok but not great. I am accustomed to slow smoked BBQ. The ribs did not have a smoke ring and the meat did not fall off of the bone. The gristle was not chewable as I like. The sausage was good but the casing lacked the snap. The brisket had the texture of like it was cooked in a crock pot. I would recommend House Park to friends that prefer their BBQ not too smoky but I absolutely wouldn't join them.

This place is real good. Great brisket, ribs were god damn delicious. Why spend your day getting BBQ from an overhyped place when you can get BBQ as good or better here without pretentious noodles harping about.
To paraphrase Dean Wormer, "Cold, dry, and flavorless is no way to go through life, son."Cheap, and it tastes like it. Even the sauce is just 50/50 water and low grade ketchup.

I had absolutely no intention of going here. In fact we were walking to the art wall down the block. With my head down focused on the ground ahead of me, I got a scent of an amazing smoke smell. I thought it was just some barbecue place down the block. By now I've had my fair share of barbecue in Austin. My companions began laughing and saying need no teef to eat my beef. I looked up confused and saw the sign from heaven. I almost walked right past this place because I wasn't looking up. So of course we decided to go in. Unfortunately we were a bit early in the place wasn't open yet. He man in his 70s came out and said that they would open in 20 minutes. An hour later we decided to come back. With our own beer. Oh yeah this place is BYOB. We walked in and was greeted by the owner. He explained the menu which was pretty simple. Get the sampler. Add some ribs.Like all places don't even worry about the sides that you're going to get. Not good. However I wasn't there for the beans. I was there for the beef. The one I can eat without my teef. The 75-year-old smoker did all the work. The owner insisted he does absolutely nothing and just throws the meat in. The smoker does everything else. We ate outside and sat in a food coma for a while. The beef was truly tender. The ribs had just the right amount of pull. The only reason I would not give this five stars is because blacks bbq On Guadalupe spoiled me. That and there was no shirt with their famous slogan. Well we ate outside and we were entertained by the pitmaster who had been working there since the 80s. He began to tell us his senile stories of what it was like back in the day. And he also was wondering what he should wear to his church presentation that day. I hope he wore his red pants and a flannel shirt. I am digressing. Long story short. This is a hidden gem amongst the big name fellas there. Please go there before/after the art walk on Byron.

We recently visited Austin and tried several BBQ places while there.   The ribs at House Park were by far the best ribs I've ever tasted!  The rub was incredible and you could taste just the right amount of smoke in every bite.  The crew working there was incredibly friendly and we really enjoyed our visit!   Thank you House Park BBQ!!

This place is Mecca. I really don't know what else I need to tell you. 73 years old with a grandfathered pit that's even older. If you want real Texas bbq in a place that isn't inundated with the hustle and bustle of downtown this is it. Matt is the man and will absolutely help you navigate the myriad options. I can't recommend anything as I've tried it all. I truly cannot choose. It's all fantastic. If you put a gun to my head I would say the brisket is where it's at. Their motto of don't need teeth to eat the beef is totally and completely true. It's phenomenal.

There's a photo among the dozens that llive on the walls here that pretty much sums this place up for me, and oddly enough, it doesn't directly reference the food within. It's what appears to be some sort of parade photo featuring a seventies-era Burt Reynolds and Dolly Parton, and it is, in a word, Awesome. There's much of the innards of House Park that feels like someone turned the smoker on in here and let it permeate the wall adornments for the better part of twenty years, and no one's complaining: vintage shots of SRV, hot rod event posters long since outdated, news clippings all point to a longstanding Austin tradition. And I can't comment on the appropriate number of 'teef' necessary to down the beef, other than to say there was a ton of same (beef, not someone's teeth, that would be weird -) at the ready when I went chomping away. The sauce held up fine, and I rounded matters out with a side of beans with a little meat a ready part of the sauce. As has been oft-noted, the hours are short and sweet here so you'll wanna come for lunch, but no doubt, just like the fare within, they'll pack a flavorful wallop. Just like life, if you let it.

I've been coming here for bbq since I was little, rib plate with slaw and potato salad extra bbq sauce, white bread, and tons of pickles! The ribs have always been perfect for me, lots of meet and the dry rub is spicy! The sides are kinda meh, but throw some bbq sauce on them and they're perfect. I've had their chicken too, which is surprisingly moist and delicious as well.The guys who run it are super nice and always chat with me, plus it takes about 2 minutes tops for them to get it all ready. I wish they were open more hours because I get the bbq cravings quite often. The location is really perfect too, and I love the inside because it has all these old poster and news paper clippings. If I don't walk away smelling like heavenly bbq for the rest of the day I'm not satisfied. And now I've made myself hungry thinking about it..

NEED NO TEEF TO EAT MY BEEFHouse Park barbecue is only open for lunch, Monday - Friday.I work 15 miles from 12th and Lamar.I have called in sick so I could eat lunch there.Chopped beef sandwich, pork loin sandwich, oh man.But the best part is the inside. There's not much separation between the smoke pit and the dining area, and the hundreds of newspaper clippings tacked up against the ancient wood walls have turned deep brown from the smoke. The coup de' gras is the giant framed photograph of Burt Reynolds and Dolly Parton riding in convertible chauffeured by the House Park pit-master. There are few things in this world that can make me as happy as that.

The hole-in-the-wall places always seem to have some of the best BBQ around and House Park continues that trend.  The brisket could have been a little more tender, but that's a minor complaint.  The servings are generous and the standard potato salad, cole slaw and beans for sides are pretty good.  If you want no-frills BBQ, bring cash and an empty stomach and House Park will take care of you.

There's all kinds of BBQ in Austin, but one thing the more well known places haven't mastered is being RELIABLE.  That means having your trailer OPEN or being there on MONDAY.The guys at House Park have been doing this 11 am - 2 pm ever since, well, who knows?  But it's the same, good reasonably priced, smokey, flavorful, and tender meat every time I go there.  We're talking a little, laid-back BBQ joint that knows you by name and works to make YOUR plate the way YOU want it.  No California hipsters here, just real people wanting real lunch.Need a pan of BBQ for an office party?  They do that too.   BTW, it IS LUNCH ONLY.  LUNCH ONLY.  LUNCH ONLY.  11-2.Hint:  order the sliced beef sandwich with chips, a jalapeno and a Big Red.  Eight bucks can't buy anything better between 45th Street and the river.Oops....I probably shouldn't have said anything.

This place is small but the has good food. The brisket is moist and tender, the sausage was tasty and juicy. The sides were okay but I can skip it next time. I will go back to try the rest of the meats. The prices are reasonable and the daily special is a good deal.

I live in Nashville tn and this is some of the best bbq I have ever had. The helping of beef we got was enough to feed a very hungry big guy. As a bonus we got to see the oldest pit in Austin. I'm not a huge baked beans guy and the smokey flavour they achieved blew me away.

Classic to the bone, the original Need no Teef. Matt & Co. run the store like an old cue house should be run. Super reasonable for the quality price wise, always consistent in character and flavor alike. The smoke stains on the walls speak volumes. We love you House Park!

I have been going to this place since the 70's.At one time or another I have had everything on the menu and never been dIsappointed.It bothers me that some folks put it down. My guess is they don't know what bbq is supposed to be. Keep it up my friends.

House Park Bar-B-Que is one of the hardest places to get barbecue from for me. They are open only for lunch Monday through Friday. I have only been here once just because of that reason. Their sign on the outside reads "No need teef to eat my beef." This slogan is similar to another Austin barbecue institution. House Park is located in a shopping center and is within a stone's throw of an Austin classic, The Tavern. When I got there at 11 AM, there were a few people eating inside.I ordered a two-meat plate with moist brisket and pork ribs with a half link of sausage. The plate also came with bean, potato salad, and coleslaw. The brisket had two stories. So the long piece on the bottom of a typical brisket is the flat (lean). The top piece that covers half of it is the point (moist). The flat was chewy, and the point was super fatty. They must have cooked it too high and fast. It had a smoke ring, but without, I would have guessed the brisket was done in an oven. There were no flavors, and it was bland. The ribs were slightly better. They were dry, but the rub had a nice spice. You had to work a little to get the meat off of the bone. The sausage is made by the Texas Sausage Company which is the same people who make the sausage for Franklin Barbecue. It is sad if that was the best thing I ate. The sausage was a beef and pork house blend. The peppercorn gave it good kick. The sides were boring but did look homemade. More seasoning please?Bland was the story here. I am not sure how House Park House Park Bar-B-Que is in business with the limited hours. Sure, some places in town are only open for lunch, but their line snakes around the building. A lot of the places I eat at, the smoked meats are cut in front of you. Sometimes when you watch them cut the meat, you know it is not going to be a good experience. This was one of them.
SO GOOD! You don't even need teef to eat their beef! I bring my grandma here ;)

I have been twice to House Park Bar-B-Q. I had the brisket once and the sandwich one, both absolutely outstanding. Not only did i love the food, I loved the old-school Austin feel. Nothing fancy, but quality food is what it's all about The coleslaw and beans were on point and complemented the barbecue perfectly. Great to know there is still a few classic barbecue places around! Definitely my favorite barbecue in Austin! And, the staff is extremely kind and personable. A true neighborhood gem.
Pretty decent food, casual, cheap. Good place to hang out with some friends but parking is a hassle. Sadly they are only open for a very short amount of time.

I would venture to say that Central Texas has the finest BBQ in the world, and when we've got the likes of Mueller's and Franklin and the gods of Elgin and Llano only a day trip away, serving mediocre BBQ just doesn't cut it. House Park BBQ has been around since 1943, but their years of experience don't translate to the kind of quality BBQ that you need to compete in this town. The beans were underspiced and had a pinto-y off-taste that suggested they could have used more slow cooking. The potato salad was of cafeteria quality; bland, uninspired and lacking in flavor. The brisket had a decent rub, but that didn't save the dry, minimum-smoke-time taste that's so characteristic of pedestrian BBQ. There was nothing intriguing enough about the sausage; it was passable. They've got a decent sauce, though it was a bit on the vinegary side and was too watery to adhere to the BBQ to compensate for the lack of taste. The chopped beef sandwich is the way to go at House Park because it showcases the two decent things they have to offer: the brisket rub and the sauce. Again though, being in Austin you could just drive down to Ruby's and have the best chopped beef sandwich of your life.It's a shame that House Park looks and feels like it should have remarkable 'Q and delivers uninspired BBQ that you would find at Bill Miller. If they just brought some new talent into that place, they have the location, cult following and craze surrounding BBQ to absolutely soar.
Great BBQ for a great price. Very well served too. Two very nice men behind the counter went out of their way to please us.

This place is a hidden gem!! It's kind of tucked away in a corner with some other food trucks but I didn't have much trouble finding it. There's outdoor seating with a big TV for entertainment as well(:I got the brisket sandwich and it was SO GOOD. granted, it only came with the bread and brisket and pickles and onions, but honestly, that's all you need. Maybe it was the sauce or the quality of the brisket, but I couldn't stop eating it! It was only $7.50 or something like that so VALUE!!My friend got the ribs plate and that was pretty good too, but the taste kind of gets old after a while... So I would definitely recommend the sandwich.The lady at the register was so nice and patient while we were being indecisive! She answered all of our questions so if you have any, feel free to ask her haha.

Everything is drowned in sauce whether you ask for it or not....not mentioned anywhere on their menu. The beans were bland ass can be. The potato salad was ok. The brisket was chewy. Seems as though they didn't let it cook lower slow enough to let it break down. I chewed on a piece of it for about a minute and a half and just spit it out because I just could not break it down. Moreover, the dude that served up my plate, I'm pretty sure dripped in ounce or two oh sweat as he hovered over the box. I gave him the benefit of the doubt but once I got what I got, it was a lost cause.

Eh this truck is just alright. I had their popular entree set which is a 2-meat special. I had brisket which was a bit dry, their potato salad was a bit too mustardy for me, but their sausage was decent. It ran me about $11 for the whole thing but the portions were pretty big which is a plus. Their bbq sauce was too tangy for me and too gelatinous. It was as if they used a bottle and poured it on top. I guess if you're hungry after partying and have the munchies like we did, then this place will do the work but overall, the bbq is just eh. It's one of the only bbq food trucks open late night so give a shot!

Coming from the Midwest I was excited to try BBQ in the south. Unfortunately, I tried this place. I got the coma plate which pretty much includes everything BBQ on their menu. The brisket was almost all fat. The chicken was dry. Pulled pork was almost a liquid. Ribs are ok if you're coming off a week or not eating. Beans were flavorless without any of the BBQ sauce in them. Potato salad was present - didn't say much but it was present. I really wish I could speak higher of the food but I didn't even want to save the leftovers.With all of this being said, the sausage was actually quite enjoyable. It's the only thing I'd actually buy again

I had the pleasure of meeting the owner of this place when he was in LA and was able to enjoy some authentic bbq Texas style. He had a bbq with his family and cooked all of his original dishes. The brisket was so soft and the ribs were so juicy. The bbq sauce he made was just so amazing, I wanted to take some home. I don't know if I will ever get the chance to visit Texas but if I do, I'm definitively paying this restaurant a visit. And if you're in Texas you should too!
Super legit BBQ and really friendly service! Glenn really cares about  the costumers too. Love the pulled pork and chicken!

Friendly service... Even scared the bees away for me!  Food...YUMMY. We shared a four meat plate. Chicken, brisket, ribs and sausage.  All tasty.  Bbq sauce spot on.  Chicken was my favorite.  Potato salad is the bomb!  First meal and Austin, we are off to a good start!

I needed a quick bite and took a chance on this food truck tucked behind a few others.There were many tasty choices but I went with the Beef Brisket Sandwich.  It was a reasonable $8 (be a good person and leave a tip) and a ended up being a perfect bite with soft, lucious brisket and sweet, crunchy onions.  There wasn't too much BBQ sauce and I was able to eat it on the go without too much trouble.  Add a few pickles and I couldn't have asked for anything better.  I'll definitely come back again on this trip if I need a quick bite at a good price.

Less than the average 4 stars because of disappointment in location and no prior impression that it was a food truck. Several people came up to our outdoor "mega spool" table begging for money, which is always a turn off. I've had better pulled pork for sure - this was pretty runny and not super tasty. My family who ate with me liked it though, so obviously a preference thing - my sister is even from NC! The sausage was excellent. The brisket was good Texas standard - better than other states, but there is probably a place nearby that will rock your taste buds a little more. They don't have a liquor license, so we had to go around the corner to buy a couple beers from Lone Star ...so that was a little inconvenient. Restrooms in adjoining building were said to be awful as well.

Whatever you do stay away from the catfish. I should have known better because it is a BBQ place but I was hoping they could do it right. To start, they didn't even really fillet the fish. It was in one massive chunk like an inch and a half thick (who does that?!) on top of that it was some of the muddiest, dirtiest tasting catfish I have had in my whole life. The fries were soggy and very undercooked, the roll seemed like it had been sitting out for a few days very stale and no fluff at all to it. All around a bad experience. To top it off my very bad meal came to $16 after the ridiculous 1 dollar fee for paying with a card..... I highly do not recommend this place.

I was expecting more from famous Texas BBQ. I'd give the ribs 4 stars and the brisket 2 stars. The brisket was tough and chewy. I've had better back home. The included sides, potato salad and beans, were average.

Officially on my list of eats when I found out they sell Turkey legs. Might come back and try their plates and sandwiches, but at the moment I ain't passing on their turkey legs. Stubbs has some competition when I'm in the area.

Let me clarify the A-OK rating! If you find yourself  wandering around on a coldish night in the vicinity of drunk avenue aka 6th street, and are craving something meaty with prices that are not an instant buzz kill, then this is the place!  Friendly folks and not the best bbq ever, but it is quite a satisfying chew, even if you are not drunk.On many a occasion the brisket is weirdly underseasoned and dry, but on other occasions, it is a smokey meaty bite.  Pulled pork has always been nice and pork with the burnt bits adding a complex caramelly smokiness to the eat.  Ribs at times need the sauce to make them sing, but are always serviceable.  No this is not fancy award bbq, but it is definitely solidly middle class bbq at its best!
The best flavor in a food truck, visiting from LA and I was so in love with their BBQ sauce, it's not the prettiest of pictures but man does it have a kitchen. Thank you to the woman at the window.

Thumbs Up Here!Ok - Bar-B-Q Heaven is a food truck on Red River right near Barbarella within e-z reach of the Mohawk and Sixth Street. It is open till 4 am.If you are coming off of a fantastic night of dancing, music or drinking ... all food quality automatically goes up six stars. Three 7 & 7's and a night of dancing to Icona Pop or Joan Jett and the world is generally perfect anyway. You can eat roofing shingle and it is the greatest thing you have ever had in your life.That said Bar-B-Q Heaven is a genuinely good food truck.The Pulled Pork is my personal favorite. It is saucier and spicier than other versions elsewhere ... but I don't care. Bring on the sauce.Brisket is totally respectable - fatty enough to have decent taste - lean enough not to have your cardiologist order up immediate heart tests and with a good smoke to it.Sausage is not to my taste - but it will be to many Texans. Some people love their sausage coarsely ground and with black pepper to spare. If this is you ... BBQ Heaven has your sausage.Sides are standard and if you told me the beans came out of a can and the potato salad came from HEB I would not disbelieve you.But with a plate full of totally respectable meat - who really cares? Bring on the potato salad and the beans.(They probably got the pickles out of a jar too - rather than making their own. And I don't think they lose a lot of sleep over that fact.)This ain't a trip to Lockhart and it ain't Louie Mueller's but it is damm fine damm respectable Texas Bar-B-Q.And it is right on Red River right when you need it at 2 in the morning and the clubs are closing.BBQ when you need it, where you need it , and perfectly fine.
Solid bbq, fast SXSW service and they let me sub extra meat for the carb sides. They actually gave me extra meat instead of sides!Thanks for great SXSW service.
Solid bbq, fast SXSW service and they let me sub extra meat for the carb sides. They actually gave me extra meat!

The 2 meat plate (ribs and sausage) was delicious.  Now I personally didn't care for the potato salad,  it was a tad to sweet and wet for my taste but still a decent side. Excellent customer service and great food

Bbq truck located right on sixth street, good for a quick and cheap meal but quality is alright, we shared the ribs and brisket combo and I think it was drenched in too much sauce, the ribs were fall off the bone and tender but the brisket was a bit chewy, there is patio seating in front of the food truck but no free parking, this place opens til 4am so I guess it's a good option if your looking for a late nite snack after drinking
Had a turkey leg from here and it was smoked perfectly!! I've looked around Austin to find one and this is the spot. I for sure will be going back!

I came to Austin looking for good Texas barbecue and this did not disappoint!!! I got the three meat plate with brisket, pulled pork, and sausage. It also came with potato salad, beans, and two slices of bread. The food was SPECTACULAR! The woman who ran the food truck was really sweet and we talked for a little bit and just had that genuine southern hospitality which made me so happy. The food came out really quick and even though it was 11 pm it still tasted fresh and delicious!

$13.50 for a very poor quality 2 meat plate that came with the worst potato salad and beans I have ever had. Brisket was full of fat and pulled pork was too much sweet. I have had BBQ all around the town and this was by far the worst.

I'm not a Texas barbecue expert--I'm sorry, but it took a lot work to unlearn the Kansas City style--but I have at least tried Franklin's (believe me La and Micklethwait are on my to-do list) and understand what 5-star barbecue means. I went to Bar-B-Q Heaven with no expectations (and unlike some reviews, sober) just hoping to kill some time before a movie and Christ on a cracker it blew me away. Super tender meat, just the right amount of fat on the brisket and crazy delicious. The only reason I'm giving it four stars is because I had it sauced and didn't try the ribs. I look forward to going back again and giving it that fifth star.

I had already tried out Stubbs nearby, and Franklins wasn't open for dinner - so I thought I'd try out this food truck. Definitely worth it. The staff was super cool, there's seating outside, and the portions were really good for the price. If you don't mind eating outdoors, I'd recommend this over Stubbs.

The brisket was amazingly moist and delicious. If this is average BBQ in Austin, you guys are very lucky.Full disclosure: I was born in New York and live in California so I may not know anything about BBQ.

I was craving fatty brisket and I had been looking at several central Austin places to satisfy my desire. I had planned on a trip to Iron Works or Stubb's, but I knew neither would satisfy my need for burnt ends and fatty brisket. Bar-B-Q Heaven was not even on my radar.I've passed this place a number of times and I've found the staff to be a little confrontational to the Twin Liquors patrons parking in the same lot. This turned me off but the Bar-B-Q always smelled good. I finally had a free hour to eat Bar-B-Q and they were open, so I gave this joint a chance and ordered a one-meat plate of fatty brisket (with burnt ends) and a Big Red. My total was $7.54 with tax and it was SO worth the price!This brisket was delicious and the sauce was surprisingly decent. I was actually on my way to Stubb's because of their Serrano Cheese Spinach side dish (which is outstanding) but I am so glad that I got this brisket instead. Beans, potato salad, onions, pickles, fatty brisket, BBQ sauce, and bread was only $6 - what a deal! It was awesome and full of flavor. A two meat plate would only have been $8 and I think these prices are more than fair for the quality and quantity of meat they serve. I brought  home enough food to have a hearty sandwich and most of the side dishes, so it was at least two complete meals for that price, which is fantastic. I would rather go to Lockhart for my BBQ, and if I had a car - that might work. But for now my preferred location for Brisket in Austin is Bar-B-Q Heaven. Give them a chance! I plan on going back soon and often. The staff was very polite to me and as long as you are not trying to park in their spaces, they will probably be nice to you too.
So bar the best BBQ around.  This is our second time here and we will definitely be back.  The staff here is also super nice and the food is always amazing!

"And as I say every time I serve a good night platter. Nighty night... 'cuz you're goin' to sleep!" That may be true, as I'm still digesting, but I figured a good Yelp review was in order first.I fell onto this place out of pure luck. It was late on a Saturday night, and I was strolling down Sixth Street after finally getting downtown from the airport. I was hungry and thirsty, and I wanted take-out. I kept walking and walking, then all of a sudden i saw a line of food trucks. It looked like I was in heaven.I I could smell this place for blocks. The smoker out back was running in full force. I had no idea whether or not this place would be good, but the smells set my expectations pretty high. I went for the good night platter... 4 meats: Brisket, Chicken, Pork Chop, and Ribs.Amazing. Absolutely incredible.The brisket was phenomenal. A THICK smoke ring like proper BBQ should have. The chicken was out of this world. I honestly wanted to march back to that truck and get more. The ribs were falling off the bone, but not overcooked and gummy, like ribs can be. The flavor was amazing.The pork chop was dry, but still had good flavor. Not the best thing on the menu, but still pretty tasty.I'm full and happy. I'm so glad I was able to experience that.

I eat meat sparingly, once a month, and I was saving myself for my visit to Austin.  First stop, Bar-B-Q Heaven.Step up, order up, they serve it up.  You get friendly service from the guys there, a taste of Austin culture as you sit down to eat, and the barbecue is especially flavorful with the ribs falling easily off the bone, as it should.If you want quality BBQ, go here.  If you're in a pinch and restaurant kitchens are closed, go here.
Great amount of food for the price! Really good food truck! Ordered the two meat plate with brisket and sausage, and it also came with potato salad and beans. Great deal!

We were ordering food next door at Naan Sense.  And one of my friends who came to Austin a couple weeks before us told me that bbq was pretty good here.  So I stopped by and ordered a pull pork sandwich.  The sandwich was pretty good but nothing was special about it.  I am not sure if its because the bbq flavor was hidden by the bbq sauce.  But to me the bbq was just okay.  The service is friendly though.

At Stubbs the other week for a inside show, and went upstairs to get some grub only to find out the kitchen was closed. Then I remembered they took away the counter to make it a sit down place, raised prices, and stopped caring about the quality of the food. I also remembered this bbq trailer two blocks away, so I left stubbs and ventured off. Now I can't remember everything on the menu, but I can tell you that everything was affordable compare to Stubbs (or other downtown bbq), the $4 slice pizza place right by, the $5 hotdog place across the street, or the $10 screwed and chopped cd's always getting pushed on me by i35.Speaking of chopped, I ordered a chopped brisket sandwich which was only $3, and my wife ordered a Chop bbq chicken sandwich also only 3 bucks. For the price this place is hands down the best bbq value in austin. As far as quality goes, one of the best chopped brisket sandwiches i have ever eaten, beat stubbs w a tko in 3 seconds. The staff was very friendly and fast. I will be back often.

My girlfriend and I ordered multiple meats and received barely edible brisket, dry sausage, rancid chopped meat, and spoiled potato salad. Oh and some nachos that smelled horrible and tasted worse. Not doing that again.

Arrived late and was looking for BBQ. What a surprise to find a bbq place open until 4am! I tried the 3 meat platter with brisket, ribs, and sausage. This came with 2 sides for $11. So the most memorable part was the ribs and sausage. There was a bit too much sauce on the brisket.What stuck with me was how friendly the proprietors were. My sister had her dog with her and they brought out a little plate of scraps. The seating is interesting. Cheap plastic chairs and some old cable spools, which meant the table was way too high for the chairs. Also this is a food ail, so all the seating is under a canopy outside.Bottom line is that the atmosphere and people were great. The food was very good. It was past 11pm when were there and it was close to 90 degrees. I can't imagine eating in the daytime there. It'd be wicked hot outside.

Here is the thing: we were on a mission for La Barbecue and arrived too late (1.5 hours after they opened, at noon, they were sold out...very serious business). Anywho, I Yelped for the next best thing and this came up. I feel like ambience should be mentioned, as I didn't see anything about it when looking. It was in an area off 6th street that was a little...scary. Very...interesting...people in the area, right around the corner from the homeless shelter and the food truck itself had bars on the window? Also, it was not very late, maybe 7:30ish-8? I think a standard eating time...there was no one dining there at the few outdoor tables in the dirty dining area besides 2...interesting...looking characters.Anywho...the bbq was o.k. I like texas style bbq more than carolina or kansas style because the smoke is more important than sauce and you can typically find sauce ON THE SIDE as a dip. This bbq was smothered in sauce (see pictures), or maybe even drowning. And the sauce was just okay. I ordered the brisket and the chicken and found them just to be okay, the sauce was overpowering and tangy. The brisket, despite the bath it was taking, I found to be kind of dry. As we were finishing up, a group of bachelor party goers, very clearly drunk, rolled in and raved about how much they loved the brisket. My friend decided maybe everyone who wrote a yelp review was drunk and that's why they thought the food was good? it was a fair assessment, since we were next to a group of drunken bros and it's open until 4 am.I was saddened that this was so highly rated on Yelp and we made this our back up to La Barbecue. Better luck next time, i heard the Salt Lick was good too.

Excellent late night barbecue! I ordered the two meat plate and was more than happy with it. The brisket was served exactly how I requested and love and the sausage was flavorful and cooked to perfection. The smoke flavor was perfect and every bite was full of barbecuey goodness. This little trailer is definitely a gem and the lady at the window is super sweet. I'll definitely be back when another barbecue craving strikes past midnight.
Order the one meat chicken plate. The meat was dry with little flavor, potato salad was runny. Beans were blah. I wouldn't recommend this place at all.

Its real BBQ, which automatically makes it better than any food masquerading as BBQ. However, on a Texas BBQ (aka real BBQ) scale, it was mediocre. Pulled pork was good, but that is easy with all the sauce. Ribs, brisket, and chicken were good, but if you are a BBQ guy like me, there's nothing to see here, especially considering Franklin is just around the corner. Ultimately, it will do if you are craving BBQ, and you are on a budget.
Fast, friendly service and great food! I don't really know much about BBQ so I can't comment on "authenticity", but everything tasted great!

I have eaten a LOT of BBQ in and around the Austin area. I have been to Franklin's and it was amazing. This place has always consistently made the top notch BBQ that I crave. The quality is consistently superb and the service is incomparable from any other food truck. The owner has been a pit master for over 30+ years, and he knows his stuff! If you love REAL, authentic Texas BBQ, go eat here!! I'll keep coming back as long as I'm alive!!

Time out. Whoa.I ate a lot while visiting Austin (tons!) and the BEST meal I had was here.  The food was perfectly seasoned and cooked.  Hands-down the best BBQ I have ever eaten.  Oh, and the guys who grabbed my order and served my huge platter were so nice.  We sooooooo need a BBQ truck in Providence!

Great, fast, easy food! Loved the BBQ ribs and brisket. Potato salad and beans were tasty too! Could have done without the white sandwich bread.... Why does every restaurant in Austin serve white sandwich bread?!

It's just a food truck! But it's pretty awesome. We were hungry and ordered a variety of meats. Price was good, food was great. Ready quickly. Wish we could've sat down at something nicer than a community picnic table but we will sacrifice for inexpensive great BBQ!

Just finished a BBQ tour of the city with a brisket sandwich worth every penny.   The value of this food truck destination under covered picnic tables is simply the best.   Large portion size was main reason I am ranking them so high.   Flavor and tenderness of the meat is great.

Pretty good - 3.5 stars. Just not up to the level of Franklin or JMueller. The guy who took our order was super nice and friendly. The pulled pork was just okay, the ribs and the brisket were good. Nothing blew our socks off. The price was outstanding for how much food we got though. I would definitely come back here again and the fact that they are open late at night is huge. And for a trailer, I was pretty impressed.

If you want great bbq, without the fuss, this is your place.  The owners are the nicest people in Austin and always have a smile.  The brisket sandwich is absolutely the best in Austin.  No frills, just fantastic food.  I'm a local and have never been disappointed either early evening or late night.  Do yourself a favor and stop by.
Attach dogs teied to run me off before i could order. Dont carry a back pack

There is nothing that says "I don't take this seriously" like having a huge turkey drumstick in your hand. Take any situation, add a drumstick, and suddenly you're the laissez faire guy who couldn't care less. I can't tell you how many meetings I'm in where I wish to god I had a huge gnarly hunk of turkey leg which I could occasionally glance up from and say, "I'm sorry, what? ".Bar-B-Q Heaven has $5 smoked turkey drumsticks the size of a football. They are very smoky and tender, not greasy AT ALL, the turkey just falls right off the bone. It was a little salty (they must brine them before smoking), but at that point I had a turkey drumstick so I couldn't be bothered to care. The guy was really nice and helpful (he double wrapped it because it was so hot). That evening approximately 75 people asked me where I got that drumstick. In response I would glance up from the shredded leg and say, "I'm sorry, what? ".

Just the folks ALONE that run this joint deserve the 5 stars!  The woman that was working reminded me of kin folk back home and made me laugh with how familiar we were with one another right off.  She was making fun of me because I was making Mark M. drive around the block while I ordered and waited for my food.  She was telling me, after Mark had circled twice, "Honey!  He can come park in here!  My man ain't THAT mean!"  She then told Mark that I had to give him all my bbq since he had to drive around the block so many times.  Listening to Marvin Gaye through a small boombox while I waited for my food was a super plus.Now, on to the food...I got the brisket plate.  The brisket was melt in my mouth so freakin yummy I could drive back there and kiss those folks!  My mouth is watering just writing about it!The potato salad and beans were good, too, but Mark and I decided that next time we'd get a meat only plate... no need to waste stomach space on anything but meat!I will make the drive from Buda to downtown Austin to get this BBQ ANY day!  If you haven't tried it, you must!!!

I asked the man, "Can I get a pulled pork sandwich?"He replied, "Yes, now can I get a hell yeah?"I love food with personality served by personality.Pulled Pork. Tangy sauce, dripping. Plenty of napkins, folks.Onions, Pickles. I don't even like pickles! But these meshed with the flavor oh so well.Fantastic sandwich served up by some personable people. Great cue right downtown. 4 dollars, cash only. Wanted to try a plate, but was on the go. Was so good, I didn't realize I had dripped sauce all over my shirt.All in all, Bar-B-Q Heaven delivers the goods to the downtown regulars.Now can I get another hell yeah?
Austin, TX 78746

I have been coming here since college days in the 80s.  Every, yes every, dining experience has been great.  Their BBQ is top notch--especially the ribs.  And sides a bit more creative than usual at a BBQ place.  A nice change of pace.  Location on the hill is wonderful with view and overall atmosphere (been to the lake location and while food is as great, the view can't match the hill).  Staff always friendly.  Recently we planned a family private dinner but had to cancel because of the pandemic.  They completely understood, refunded deposit, and were courteous.  We will return for dinner and eventually reschedule our family party.  It's so nice that this place has 'aged' well while retaining excellent food, atmosphere, and staff.

Legendary BBQ, family friendly, great view, fantastic staff! You go in and feel like family.Large space with social distancing inside, outside or in their private event rooms.Best happy hour prices in town!Try the wings, you won't be disappointed

The patio on lake austin is one of the most legendary spots in Austin. I'd recommend taking out of towners and tourist here to get an old austin vibe. The beef ribs are "100 emoji" honestly just get a ton of beef ribs and don't waste stomach space with other food.
Totally love this place and the staff!The food was good and the view was wonderful!The waitress was exceptional! The restaurant was clean and charming.My husband and I will definitely return.

Man, I've got to be honest with this review. This is some of the absolute worst BBQ I have ever had in my entire life. Does anyone taste the food before adding it to the menu? The mac and cheese, no flavor whatsoever. N-O-N-E! How does that even happen? Coleslaw, chunky pieces of slaw that were way too big and also completely tasteless. The sausage, not that great. Just meh.The pulled pork, something was seriously off with it. It tasted a little sour and rancid. You know how pork gets when it's going off? It has that way too porkish kind of taste? Yep, I'll pay for that later in my review. We also tried the Mexican deviled eggs and they were super thick and flavorless as well. Queso was decent. I liked the atmosphere and our server was absolutely wonderful. That's the only positive I have about my experience. We weren't even completely out of the parking lot when my stomach started to turn. Couldn't even make it home without a bathroom emergency stop.  Some people must like it because there were a lot of people there during lunch time. I can see this place being for elderly folks as my grandfather would have loved it. Edit: it is now 3:38am and this is the second time I have been pulled out of my sleep to do the deed. I know that's a whole lot of information, but people need to know. I wouldn't wish this on my worst enemy.

I came back here for another event, and the queso was not grainy, but still a little too spicy for me. This time we could order off the appetizer menu, and the deviled eggs were a popular order, with nearly each table opting to split at least one serving of them.
Thanks for coming out to see us again and the kind words. We are always tweaking things so it's great to get your feedback so that we can constantly improve. We hope you can join us again soon!

Last night I attended a private event hosted at The County Line. We had a room and patio space reserved, and were served from a buffet of "heavy appetizers." The food included chicken wings, deviled eggs, chips & queso, and sausage & mushroom skewers. The food was good but not amazing - enough that I filled one party-sized plate, and went back for seconds, but no more. The wings seemed to be seasoned with a dry rub and had crispy skin and no breading. I love deviled eggs but theirs were a little plain. The queso was ok but a little too spicy and a little grainy... but who expects queso to be a bbq place's strong suit? The sausage on the skewers was a little too spicy for me too, but I'm a wimp. My favorite part of the meal was when I discovered I could use my drink ticket for a milkshake. I ordered the strawberry shake, which had flecks of real strawberry in it! Staff was friendly and attentive. A restaurant and venue that can accommodate a lot of people, has a good view, reasonable prices, and decent food is a lot of bases to cover, and The County Line does it pretty well!
This is a good local spot with a great view, friendly servers and very good food. I like the brisket and pork ribs. Nothing fancy but comfortable and relaxing. Among the places I love about Austin.
Austin, TX 78746
The food was mediocre at best. No smoke line on the brisket. tasted of liquid smoke. My two combo all on one plate hot and cold together not acceptable!

Always a favorite of our family. Last night we had my mother in-law 90th birthday party there and they went above and beyond to accommodate our large family. The food and service were exceptional and not one thing was wrong on our order. They stored the cake and brought it out at the end. It made a truly wonderful evening for our family.

I liked the bread, the potato salad, the coleslaw, and the service. Meat wasn't very good, would prefer almost any other BBQ place. To be honest just go to Rudy'sLet's start with the positives! The bread is very unique and seems to be made in house. It's sliced very thick and had a nice chew and subtle sweetness. It goes really well with their honey spread - make sure to eat it warm. The potato salad has a lot of celery in it - not for everyone but I was into it. Coleslaw was also good.
