The vegetables are chopped rather than shredded, and the taste was solid.We ordered beef ribs, pork ribs, sausage, and lean brisket. It came all piled up on a single large plate (as you can see in my picture), which made it hard to get at the stuff underneath. Would've been nice to serve it on 2 plates. Both types of ribs weren't very seasoned or flavorful, just a general meat and oil taste. Also, the meat wasn't tender and required a lot of effort to eat, and the beef especially had a lot of cartilage and fat. The sausage was pretty standard, nothing bad but nothing special. Lastly, the lean brisket was quite dry and tough. It was cut thinly and didn't have much taste. I'd like to maybe try the moist brisket, but in light of everything else I had I don't have high hopes.

Went there for an event and got french fries, veggie skewers and a glass of wine which were fine but we discovered later that they have the Beyond Burger! The waitress did not mention it when we asked for vegan options, unfortunately. Would have loved to try it...another time, I guess.

People kept saying this wasn't the best BBQ in Austin but you could've fooled me. My friends & I needed stretchers when we left! The 2 kinds are brisket are ! Better order the banana pudding too! And those views!! Didn't know there were hills in TX, lol.

This is a great option if you want BBQ, but want table service and even a cloth napkin.  A friend coming in from out of town wanted a nice dinner, but also mentioned ribs.  After thinking for a bit, The County Line came to mind.  (As a reminder, The County Line on the Lake has a smaller menu than this location.)The key here is the service.  It's excellent.  The staff is friendly and efficient and the orders come out quickly.  Depending on where you're seated, there's also an incredible view of the hills west of Austin. And because the restaurant can occasionally draw a crowd, you can make reservations online.Food?  Above average.  But in Austin's competitive BBQ field these days, above average no longer suffices. Both of us really liked the pork ribs, which were perfectly cooked and had a good flavor.  I wasn't as much of a fan of the shredded beef which most would call chopped beef.  It might have been my odd tastes, but I could've sworn I tasted a hint of pickle to the beef.  The fries were good -- as in hot and crispy.  The mac and cheese, which was an upcharge, was pretty standard food service stuff and not worth the money.  Their homemade bread is worth every penny, especially with the honey butter at the table.  They brought out two different sauces, one for the beef and one for the pork.  Truthfully, I was unable to discern much difference and didn't find either particularly inspiring.Long story short -- if you're in the situation that I was in -- wanting ribs and a sit down dinner, this is a great option.  Otherwise, it's just another place to satisfy a BBQ craving in a city full of stellar BBQ options.

Wes,Thank you for Visiting us and letting us know how we did. I would like to apologize we did not fully meet your BBQ standards. Please send me a message at my email orlandos@countyline.com. I can send you something to get you to come back and give me a chance to meet you as well. thanks for commenting on your service/view and liking some of our BBQ.Sincerely,Orlando Sosa

After my good experience with County Line earlier this week, I called to make reservations to take my parents out to dinner.  The lady who answered the phone said they don't do reservations.  No problem.  Then she told us about "call ahead seating."  She then told us there was already a 30-40 minute wait and that anyone who came into the restaurant before us would get seated because call-ahead isn't guaranteed.In other words, they don't need the business tonight.  The attitude and the hassle isn't worth it.

The truth is, there's better BBQ in Austin.  But that's not why you necessarily go here.   However tonight was a perfect situation that only the County Line could fulfill. I had out of town guests who wanted BBQ.  I needed a sit-down restaurant with a bar where we could catch up and have a good dinner. Great view of the area?  Check, well aside from the bad weather.   Good food?  Check.  All of us had the rib king plate and liked both the beef ribs and the baby back pork ribs.  Their new hot and spicy sauce was also excellent.  Serving warm sauce in the soup cups with a large spoon made for a very easy way to enjoy the sauce.  If I had any one gripe on the meal, it would be that the beef ribs had a lot less beef than some of the other BBQ purveyors in town.  The complimentary brown bread was also, as always, a great way to snack before the meal.Our waiter, Paul P., was excellent.  He kept drinks refilled and was pleasant and knowledgeable about the menu without being overbearing.One final note, with the increased costs of BBQ these days, the County Line provides a remarkably good value -- good BBQ served with sides and at a sit down restaurant. And I wouldn't be surprised if we left there paying not much more than some of the newer places that sell BBQ by the pound.I think I'm going to have to start going back more often.
Austin, TX 78746

I love this place. The food is great and the service was wonderful. The patio seating is a great choice but make sure you come during the day to see the beautiful view. Unfortunately we went after the sunset so we couldn't see it but the night view wasn't that bad.

What a fun atmosphere! Great view of the valley. Extremely friendly wait staff, and clean restrooms. We enjoyed the homemade sourdough loaf prior to our meal. The size of the iced teas are huge! Enjoy the two items to meat plate with lean brisket and sausage along with fried okra and potato salad.  I wish the potato salad was a little of a more mustard flavor but, overall I have a empty plate as I go home very full and satisfied.My husband had a three item plate with the lean brisket,  sausage and chicken.  He had a piece of dark chicken and said it was "fall off the bone" delicious. My friend had the peppered turkey and lean brisket with macaroni and cheese, potato salad and a side of the "vegetable of the day," which was corn on the cob. She enjoyed everything, especially the peppered turkey, the corn is boiled and she wasn't a fan.Our waitress was super friendly and helpful.  We can't wait to come back!

This is a great place. We've had several family gatherings here.  I am from out of state and just had to plan a dinner for after a family memorial. Taylor was so great and accommodating. We always enjoy the food and had a wonderful young man as our waiter. They had no problem with separate checks. They made it so easy for me to get this planned from out of state. Thank you Taylor and staff.

As soon as you walk in, you can smell the BBQ. One of the best BBQ places ever. And they have beef ribs! The half a rack was very big...very flavor...and extremely delicious. The service was good and the place was very clean. GREAT scenery and the Mac and cheese was awesome. Pepper turkey and 2 nd cut brisket was also really good. The turkey just melted in my mouth.

I absolutely love love love eating here especially during sunset time. They have a killer happy hour I definitely recommend the wings and pulled pork queso fries with the frozen margarita. On the regular menu all appetizers are good such as the deviled eggs, fried pickles and their newest addition chips and queso. The homemade bread is definitely "worth the extra dough". Great atmosphere and customer service if your looking for a moist brisket then I recommend the 2nd cut if your looking for no marbilization and more Smokey then the leans your type of brisket. Both ribs are juice the pork are more fall off the bone but the beef ribs are killer, absolutely love them. The pork sauce is my favorite it goes well with everything even the potato salad. To finish off your meal if your looking for a great desert try the homemade banana pudding and for a delicious heartier one my all time fave to share is the bread pudding, talk about delicious! What more could one want.

The most Amazing views, breathtaking sunset, and hospitality big as Texas Hill Country and beyond! Orlando, the GM, went above and beyond to accommodate us. Jules, our server, was wonderful. Thank you, thank you for a great dinning experience. Look forward to coming back soon!

Compared to other BBQ places in Austin, this place seemed very expensive, with small portions and lower quality food. Brisket portions were tinyyyy; and beef rib was cooked way to fast (dry, hard to get off the bone). Mac and cheese tasted like Kraft. Potato salad was OK. Their bread was very good, worth a star just for that. Wish it had been a better experience. Excellent views of the hill country, very pretty.

BBQ done right! We used to have one of these in Oklahoma City and it was my favorite BBQ joint. Recently I was in Austin and I had to stop by for some of my favorite BBQ. This place did not disappoint! The ribs are thick and juicy, the Cole slaw is wonderful and creamy and the fries were cooked to perfection! What makes this place extra special is their homemade hot bread with honey butter!! Oh man!!! So so good! This place has an amazing view of the city of Austin as well with a wonderful patio. I highly recommend this place for any occasion! I'll definitely be back here time and time again!
Wow - Thanks for the kind words!  We are always thrilled to hear about a great experience at the County Line.Hope you make it back soon!
Austin, TX 78746

Fourth of July special were red white and blue margaritas for four dollars. Had the two meat special turkey and lean brisket with green beans and fried okra and a homemade wheat bread. It was all excellent and a very good value. Will definitely go again.

Let's start by saying... I do not like bbq. I never have.But, I got out numbered and ended up at the county line. I got the 2 combo meal with chicken and pork ribs (upcharge for the pork ribs). My sides with Mac n cheese and beans. The meats were amazing!!! I devoured the meats. They were perfectly seasoned and not dry at all. The sides on the other hand were disgusting. The Mac and cheese was awful. It tasted like school cafeteria food. The beans were not creamy. They were legit hard and dry but were in a watery bean juice...... trash. As a bbq restaurant why would you not serve delicious baked beans! I wouldn't come back on my initiative but if I got invited I'd come back. I basically just ate chicken and ribs.

Absolutely loved this placeWent there on a Saturday evening with my wife.  I have eaten at their location on the lake before but this is the first time I've been to the one on the hill.  I am a big fan of pulled pork which is not as easy to find in Texas as the beef brisket or the barbecue sausage.The pulled pork was lean and tender with just the right amount of wood smoked flavor.   I had it as a sandwich on a nice thick homemade sandwich roll, lettuce (which I've never had on a barbecue sandwich before). tomato, pickle and onion.  It came with a portion of cole slaw in case you wanted to add it to the sandwich,  a heap of fires - the thin skinny kind, and a bowl of pintos.  It was both delicious and filling.  The fries were mediocre, but the sandwich and pinto beans more than made up for it.  There were ample portions and I couldn't have eaten another bite.My wife got the two meat plate, turkey and brisket.  She said they were very good, moist and tender as well.  Hers came with two sides.  The server was ver attentive and checked on us 3 or 4 times during our meal (we were there at 5:30 pm and not many guests had arrived yet).  My phone indicated they had guest wi-fi, but you needed a password to long on and I didn't ask because it wasn't an issue for me. Mine was $14 and hers was $15.  They also sell homemade loaves of bread if you're interested but they come with complimentary bread as well.

Gets fairly busy for weekday lunch times. The view is great and they have lots of tables that are good for groups, they also have ample lot parking. BBQ is decent but sides are disappointing; the service is very slow and some of our orders came out wrong. There's too many barbecue places in Austin to put this spot high on the list unless you're going for the location and short wait times.

Better have plenty of time for lunch if you decide on County Line. This was the slowest service I can remember, and the place was nowhere near busy for a Saturday lunch. We came in for my in-laws 50th anniversary, and we waited for everything so long I was afraid I would hit my own 50th anniversary. I really don't blame the server, who was friendly, just slow and seemingly poorly trained. I blame the management for not making sure wait staff knows what they are doing, and more importantly for (apparently) not being on the floor to check on their customers. Our server took forever and forgot multiple items. Tables around us were also sitting and waiting. If you're wondering about the food, it's below average barbecue and sides. Unimpressive brisket and sausage, with forgettable cole slaw and ok beans. In a town with great barbecue I don't know why you'd come to County Line, except to maybe take in a great view. If you don't pay extra for the homemade bread (worth it! says the menu) then you get bread that would never be served by another restaurant. I took a photo of the sign by the drive. "Always hiring" it said. Maybe high turnover accounts for untrained wait staff, but there's no excuse for the super slow service to go with meh barbecue.

This was my first ever going to County Line Bbq. I was referred there by a friend who had her birthday dinner there. I went on Saturday, the weather was excellent for barbecue. Our server Catelynn(I hope I'm spelling her name right), was very attentive and had good helpful for our order. The food was amazing and came to our table at  a decent time. I would definitely recommend going to County Line Bbq any day of the week. I will definitely be back in the coming days!

I really hate to leave a bad review but my friends and I were shocked at bland lack of flavor and smoke to our food. We had 2nd cut and lean brisket with ribs, corn, fried okra...none of it tasted good. The okra was so small it was just fried breading, the corn on the cob was mushy and overcooked, the brisket was dry and bland, and the ribs were sticky and sweet but no heat to balance. The bbq sauce was good but as we all know, you shouldn't need it! The view was nice, but not worth going back.

Tried to substitute sides and not my driver or anywhere on app says you 'get what you get' or not allowed to sub sides when at the restaurant your order comes with your choice of sides... that being said I will never use grub hub or yelp again. So stupid.

Well we drove three hours to come to this highly recommended barbecue place in Austin Texas. What a disappointment! It's a shame that the homemade bread was the best thing going?This is a big place. Plenty of room for a large group. They do offer family size portions. We started out with the homemade bread well worth the price and well worth buying to have. Hands-down the best part of our meal was the bread. I had two choice meat combo with St. Louis ribs and sausage, With the up charge of macaroni  and green beans. The ribs were good and tender, the sausage taste store-bought, mac & cheese taste like a six-year-old made it out of the microwave and the green beans were good because they added bacon to it.This place came highly recommended by a lot of people and it was a big let down. Get somebody new in the kitchen that knows how to make great sides take time to hire somebody to make homemade sausage.Hate to beat  this place up, but for the price and hype wasn't worth it.
Austin, TX 78746

The food here was AMAZING!!! The service was prompt and friendly.  Prices are very reasonable as well.  The 3 of us ate for less than $60.00.  The best advice I can give is...ask for the fresh homemade bread!!

Good barbecue. Better views. Came here for a corporate dinner and ordered the family style platters. Beef ribs were excellent as was the brisket. I never made it to the turkey but the chicken was smoked well. Is there better in Austin, sure. However, don't overlook one of the originals and that View...!

Better than it used to be so I'm going back in the future. The service was fast and the server knew his stuff. I had the moist BBQ Brisket which was quite good. Others had the stuffed baked potato, BBQ chicken and the ribs. If you can plan your evening at the right time of year, the patio is great and has an amazing view but be aware of the direction of the sun as it sets opposite the patio causing blinding conditions for about an hour. Keep up the good work!

Nice to hear you enjoyed everything Brian, thanks for your comments. Great BBQ, service, awesome sun sets and a cool patio view. Sitting by the window has a price, glare when the Sun is setting but we have spent some $ on new window screens that we are waiting on, come back soon and thanks again for your GREAT input.Orlando Sosa General Manager

Some friends and I came here on a Saturday afternoon and had a really great meal. We were taken aback by the view from patio and very pleased with the food we had. I really wanted to try some of their bread, which looked amazing, and I could smell the loaf on the table next to me(it was heavenly) alas i could not(no carbs). I did however order the rib king ( a massive plate of pork and beef ribs, with cole slaw and green beans) and loved it. The beef ribs were bigger than my head and there were pork ribs underneath them. The pork ribs really stole the show as they were truly incredible; they were juicy, tender, and delicious. The green beans were outstanding, slow roasted and smoky. I wish i had enough room to try the dessert, however i was full and took the beef ribs home. I will be back for that bread and dessert though, no doubt.

Wow, Sean you just made our day...We love to hear about a great experience like yours. We know there are lots of choices out there so we know how important it is to be firing on all pistons! Hope you can make it back soon! We'll keep the pits turnin'.
Our food took an hour and was really gross and cold. I have no idea why this is an Austin staple. Any other BBQ is better.

Historic busy restaurant known for their bbq, but on this day we were hankering for a burger. Run, don't walk to a belt busting sized delicious fresh grilled burger with a melt in your mouth fresh sweet bun. This is no yankee burger, this is the kind that your favorite Texas cousin spends all his spare time perfecting and gosh dern, cuz got it right. Who cares what's on the side, the freaking patty is the beauty queen! This judge happily crowns you 1st place trophy, no competition even comes close! My pics don't even give the glory with the lights all dim at sunset. I'm feeling Texas proud with all the cowboy lingo being piped into the can. He jests the word for man is "fellar", come over here, "c'mere," it had me laughing. Two locations to hitch your horse to at this Austin legacy that I have frequented since I was just a buckaroo.

Yummmm with a great view. The brisket tacos were great - good portion without being over the top and lots of flavors. Others had the brisket, turkey, sausage and all the trimmings and was tasty as well. Great bbq with a great view.
Austin, TX 78735

It was my first time having SLAB so I wanted to try the trio to get a taste of the most popular sandwiches. Let's just say that it did not disappoint!The portion sizes are HUGE, which is always a plus for me. The trio comes with the Texas O.G., Notorious P.I.G., and the Chicken W.A. All of the sliders were amazing, but my favorite has to go to the Chicken W.A.! Their dank white sauce is addicting!!! For COVID-19, they are currently doing curbside takeout and limited dine in and patio service

Slab is a fantastic bbq spot with sides just as good as the meats. My wife ordered it for us last week as we have been focusing on both supporting local business during Covid-19 and also supporting black owned businesses in austin. Slab is both. Beyond that the food quality is insane. Their chicken is so tender. Their sausage is amazing, and their baked beans melt in your mouth. If I could eat here 8 days a week I would for sure do it. It's a must. I'm going to update my top 10 bbq places to include slab because it's that good! Do it ! 10 of 10! Delivery and app services available.
Best BBQ in Austin. Fantastic sandwiches, chicken, and nachos!Quick curbside service in Pandemic

Back again to our favorite BBQ place. This time I gorged myself on brisket nachos with no onions or jalapeños.  Man oh man. The crispy chips. The tender, flavorful melt in your mouth, slap yo daddy and kick your cat good brisket. Tasty sweet BBQ sauce. Classic queso and what makes the whole plate a hit...chopped up pickles. A little burst of crisp vinegar to cut the richness of the cheese is a bite of what I hope clouds would taste like. We drive from San Antonio to eat here and you should too. Call up your boo and tell them it's time to get weird and head to Austin. What are you waiting on? Go on. Austin is calling.

Alright...we drove from San Antonio to Austin to eat here. We had the McDowell Sammich, the Tony Montana Sammich and the Texas Tornado.  Then we saw someone walk by with a tray of nachos and we HAD to try them.  Grabbed some banana pudding for good measure. Yall. This is the best mf'n bbq. Go. Seriously. Best damn food.

This was among the worst barbecue we've tried in the region. Two sandwich combos plus tip was $50. We had a brisket+sausage sandwich and a pulled pork+mustard slaw sandwich, mac and cheese, and potato casserole.Every dish was cold to lukewarm. Brisket and pork were both cold (some lukewarm bits), extremely dry, without flavor of their own, and severely under sauced. It helped when we asked for more sauce, but the meats were so dry that they soaked up moisture, and there was little flavor imparted. The smoked gouda mac and cheese was lukewarm, pure mush, and tasted like artificial smoke more than cheese. The twice baked potato casserole was just dry, grainy mashed potatoes. The mustard slaw had spice-heat but no flavor.I couldn't finish my cold meal so I boxed it up and took it home, while my friend forced herself enough to be full and toss the rest. Once home I reheated it in a skillet and added more of the red sauce I'd requested, and then everything just tasted like sugar. Disappointing.
Got there early and thankful we did. Fills up even on Memorial Day. Brisket pork and chicken all cooked perfectly. We forgot to add any extra sauce as soon as we started eating

We were looking for a BBQ lunch spot and SLAB delivers! The meats are smoked to perfection and because we couldn't decide on what to try we got two of the best sampler options on the menu - the slider trio (chicken, pork, brisket) and the epic DONK sammich (all the meats - chicken, pork, brisket, sausage and all the sauces). We also tried two of their sides because YOLO - Gouda Mac and the twice baked potato casserole. Legit, UNBELIEVABLY good. My favorite out of the slider trio was the chicken - sauces were on point, chicken was tender and juicy. The Mac and cheese was EPIC - it's a wet Mac which I love. Super creamy, smoked Gouda is just divine. Twice baked tots were also good (but my heart belongs to the Mac). If you're here for epic then go with the DONK. Singleportion was HUGE but it delivers on flavor! Stacked high with meats it's also smothered in delicious sauces, crunchy onions and jalapeños. Honestly, will come back for that! Beer selection is fantastic. Get you some SLAB!

We had the slab BBQ truck at work last week which was a real treat!  I had the brisket sandwich with a little side of potato salad and coleslaw.  The huge sandwich was delicious! Definitely will try them out in Oak Hill!
Austin, TX 78735

Don't waist your time.. I'm visiting Austin for business and i wanted to taste some good BBQ. When we pulled up i should have said I'm not going in. (Hint hint) if it's attached to a mall don't do it.. But since i was with a group i went with the crowd. The meat had no hickory or season taste. The sauces were bland and just not good. It was grocery store barbecue at best.

I loved my burger! My husband didn't love his Cuban sandwich. But we will be back again to try more! They don't have fries which doesn't seem right. They had different sauces to try and all were delicious!

So good sooo good soo good! And on top of that, this location has awesome and friendly staff, clean restrooms and tables (always important!) and just all around great. We love it here. Oh! They also have cool merch

Omg so yum! We got brisket nachos, the slider trio and we had to try the potato casserole. Definitely appreciate the queso coming on the side for to go orders. The nachos were big. Between the two of us, we had 1 slider each and about 1/4 of the nachos each. I didn't even have enough room to try the casserole... tomorrow's lunch for sure. We'll definitely order from SLAB again!

First time visit to SLAB (about two weeks ago) and we were impressed by the quality of the food, portion and reasonable price. Service was prompt and friendly. We opted to dine outdoors and food was served right away. The sandwiches and sides were delicious. I had the Notorious PIG (perfect size for me) while hubby enjoyed the Texas Two Step with a side of potato salad.I do recommend - can't wait to come back soon.

Looked forward to great BBQ with the high ratings and ended up being really disappointed with the food, maybe I came on a bad day. The brisket and buns were dry. The sauce made it better. Mac and cheese had a strong smoke flavor and that's about it. The potato casserole were more like bland mashed potatoes and tasted waterlogged. Banana pudding was an average vanilla pudding. The chicken and pork sandwich were okay.  At least the food presentation was nice.

Staff was so friendly and the service was fantastic! We ended up coming in a little late not realizing they were closing soon and they did their best to accommodate and served us a great meal. Thanks again! We'll be back again soon!

I guess I set my expectations too high for the slab. I expected so much more but everything was just... mediocre. I gained interest in the slab after watching an episode of Triple D on the food network. I opted in for a sammich and went with the el jefe. The brisket wasn't bad at all but just average, nothing special. I ordered  the green bean casserole and twice baked potatoes both wasnt that great and if I was to return I wouldn't order either. I decided to try their banana pudding and that I must say was the best of them all. Although I was pretty disappointed I understand we all have our off days but I am willing to give them another shot.
I had the chopped brisket with a small Mac n Cheese. The brisket could have been more tender and it was a little on the dry side.
Austin, TX 78735
Been to this restaurant a few times. Never disappointed. My son still loves the nachos!!!
This is a new restaurant in the area. They provided Excellent. I had the Brown Chicken and Brown Cow Sandwich and my son had the BBQ Nachos. The Nachos was a huge serving.
Bad service, bad BBQ. Much better places whose claim to fame isn't being "black owned."
Love the BBQ. Hate the tunes.The music being played is obviously for the working crew. I love the brisket Two Step on the jalapeño cheddar bun.

I guess I expected more after a few word of mouth suggestions. I got a bunch to go; the 3-piece sliders; some brisket, sausages and Mac/cheese & beans. At the end of the day only the sausages 8/10 and chicken were reasonably good 7/10. Brisket was middle of the road to dry (4/10), pork (5/10) not good not bad. Beans are way to sweet for me 2/10, mac n cheese sucked 0/10. Had 3 sauces; bbq sauce sucks - too sweet and overpowering 0/10. Hot sauce is very tasty 7/10 and the white sauce was my fav 8/10. I probably won't go back based on this and cannot recommend to a friend.

Wow really disappointed with curbside.  When you pull up, you can't text, no one answered the phone, and the scan code on the curbside sign didn't work!  When I finally received my order, There were no utensils, NO barbecue sauce for the brisket, no napkins, and the salad had the smallest amount of items on it I've ever seen. I didn't know onions could be chopped so fine, and there was only about a teaspoon of them. The salad dressing was really skimpy too. Get a clue people-you have strong competition. I'd really like some barbecue sauce and napkins!  Eating dry brisket with my hands

Great BBQ spot in the SW Austin neighborhood in the shopping center  at the Y (290 and hey  71).  Love the hip hop themed menu and decor.  The bar area seems pretty popular too.  Portions are large and you really can't go wrong with any thing on this menu!!!

Good food!  It's not what I would consider "Texas BBQ" but it's cooked well, really tender, and a fun atmosphere. You walk in, order at the counter, and seat yourself.  While you wait, you are entertained by the throwback music and sports on the TVs. My daughter loves ribs, and liked the McDowell (which is an awesome name and nod to "Coming to America").  My son got the Texas Tornado, but it wasn't his favorite. However, it was HUGE!  He loved loved loved the pickles. I got the OG, and it was perfect. The red sauce is a tad sweet, while the mustard based sauce is a nod to the Carolina mustard sauces.  The potato salad was amazing, the twice baked casserole was a tad dry, and the baked beans were great.  We didn't get to try the Gouda Mac-n-cheese because they were out.  :(All in all, it's a good meal and fun atmosphere for all family members.

Creative sandwiches, better than most fast food and  lunch options for a quick bite, but really, really substandard bbq, heavily reliant on sauces. NOT EVEN Smoked?. BBQ version of like Potbellies or something, but with bad bbq. Sorry. And maybe COVID has had to alter their methods?
Austin, TX 78735

Ordered the chopped brisket sandwich with baked beans, twiced baked potatoes and banana pudding. Sandwich was great. Beans had a good taste but the texture was mushy. Baked potatoes needed a little more seasoning. Banana pudding is 5 stars! And BIG cookie is a great bonus. Will be back :)

Everything was awesome here. The McDowell rib meat blew our minds. All the other sandwiches we order were good too. They're consistent and friendly, which makes it a good pick for out of towners when it comes to bbq.

Delicious sides and tasty bbq! I will preface by saying that I had the food here for the first time when I was 9 months pregnant so everything tasted really good. However, I remember thinking that the sides were Better than the meat, but who knows?! Mac n cheese was awesome, and I really enjoyed the decor in the place. Definitely worth trying out at least once or more and enjoy the bar too.

We moved to south Austin and received some coupons for free small nachos in our welcome to the neighborhood package so we decided to give it a try. We went to the Highway 71 location. The first time we went in a young man helped us and was great. He explained the menu, asked us if we had any questions and made sure we were taken care of. Awesome job. We had seen him 3 other times since then and he always gave us exceptional service and even remembered who we were. Wish I got his name because he was awesome. That brings us to our last visit. I received another free small nacho coupon for my birthday which I thought was awesome since they were so good the last time we had them. We went to this location on Thursday, March 5, 2020. When we walked in there were 3 employees working, the cashier and the cooks and about 4 other patrons. We were greeted by a female cashier. She asked for our order, we told her we were going to be getting the small nachos and presented the coupon. Due to food allergies we asked for the cheese and brisket only. The cashier looked visibly annoyed, proceeded to tell us we would be getting a kids nacho instead because it only comes with cheese and meat and would be too much for her to have to remove the items we did not want if she placed the order as a normal adult meal. My wife told her we would be sharing them and were not told before we would have to get a kid's nacho due to what we were ordering. She didn't tell us anything and put the kid's order in. My wife then noticed they were putting the cheese on the chips and asked if they could put the cheese on the side since it was a to-go order and she tells us they already made it. We told her that the last couple of times we have ordered that the young man that helped us, on more than one occasion, said the cheese is always put on the side for to go orders. She again was visibly annoyed, yelled to her cooks that "they want the cheese on the side" and "I'm not going to eat that" when they asked if she wanted them since they were not able to sell them. We sat and waited for our order. She bags it and throws it at our table causing the bag to almost fall and she has to catch it before it does. We got home and opened our food to see chips, about a tablespoon of cheese and a dollop of brisket. Not happy at all. Needless to say, any time that lady is working, we will be sure to go somewhere else.
Nice people and a good place to grab a quick bite if you need a bbq fix. Probably not my favorite spot but that's just a matter of taste. I suggest anyone give it a try.
Oh my! What a hidden gem.  We love to go in for lunch never crowded , don't know why, but this stuff is great. Pork, beef, ribs all on sandwich if you like!And don't skip the green been casserole.

Thank you, Slab BBQ! Not only do you have amazing food, you also have compostable to-go packaging. This is really important as I hate contributing to the world's trash but sometimes don't feel like making dinner.

Nope. The type of barbecue that might excite Food Network celechefs looking for empty calorie TV content but ...  Slab just doesn't cut the mustard-based Carolina sauce. Barbecue variety isn't a sin in the holy land of Central Texas 'cue but bad execution is.

Let's start with ANY restaurant that has white sauce on their menu and it's legit, gets my vote! We devoured all of our Pork Sandwiches and ribs before any pictures could be taken. The bbq beans were a bit tangy and sweet. I'd order them again. The twiced baked potato casserole had a lot of garlic flavor in them. This Alabama girl felt like she was back home. Keep doing what you're doing!
Austin, TX 78735

Food was great but when picking up our order curb side, when I called the guy hung up the phone on me and when he walked out to delivery our food there was no thank you, no hi or nothing, he handed us our food and walked off...  extremely rude and when Austin has so many great BBQ spots, good service wins.

Food was great but when picking up our order curb side, when I called the guy hung up the phone on me and when he walked out to delivery our food there was no thank you, no hi or nothing, he handed us our food and walked off...  extremely rude and when Austin has so many great BBQ spots, good service wins.

I forgot to review this place, I tried it a while back with ny family when nothing ekse was open (Stile Switch is our go-to). Although not traditional as far as a BBQ olace goes, it only had sandwiches and that type of thing, it was very tasty and we really enjoyed it. The service was excellent as well. I will try it again soon to see if it is still as good as I remember.

The BBQ nachos hit the spot. I have never thought to put BBQ toppings on nachos, but it was super satisfying. The chips were topped with jalapenios, bbq meat, onions, cheesy sauce, and bbq sauce.I also had the bbq sandwiches, which were good but not life-changing. The bread was very soggy, even immediately after it was delivered to the table.I did like that there were bottles of extra sauce to mix and match.

A great bbq spot, the bread for the buns is really good! They have an order line and you sit with a number for your food to be brought to you. They have a little outdoor pavilion that you can sit in too and it's just for the slab bbq clients. They have a bar inside on the opposite side of where you order as well! It is a bit pricey, but bbq usually is. Would like to try more from here, but wouldn't drive my way out of for.

Came here one night after a wedding and we were craving BBQ, found this little gem on yelp and headed that direction.We got there almost 30 minutes before closing and everyone that was working was super chill about having us come in last minute (I really do hate going last minute but wife wanted BBQ).Go there ordered some turkey, brisket, and a sandwich can't remember which one but it was delicious!Brisket and turkey was solid but I got to say the gem was the sandwich. The bread was soft and fluffy, the turkey in it was moist and flavorful, the sauce was the perfect tanginess it was delicious. I scarfed that sandwich down so quickly! It definitely hit the spot. Apparently the nachos are the thing to get based on the pictures so I might have to give that whirl next time I come by. Worth your time to come get some BBQ.Side note found that there is one up north off 183 so might have to go there!

AWESOME! ate the Gonk and it was just as big as the picture on the menu. Thing was HUGE. The sauces are great, and the dank white is the best. Brenden had great customer service and was great at helping us choose what was best to eat. He even gave us a bowl of their green bean casserole to sample. Great food and excellent service. My wife had the trio sampler and it was legit. The Gonk is everything it was advertised and more. I had originally questioned why they didn't serve french fries with their meals but after eating the Gonk I was glad that they didn't because I was completely full after finishing the sammich. There is no need for any fries. I highly recommend eating at Slabs and trying all of their sauces.

Great BBQ, friendly staff, clean restaurant. The nachos are amazing. Brisket is very good. Ribs are good. The banana pudding is fluffy and very yummy. The sodas are made with pure cane sugar. Ample parking. Although I have never been there specifically for the bar, they do have a bar available for drinks. There is a separate room available for parties. There is also a deck outside to enjoy Austin's beautiful weather.
First timer here! We had the pork sandwich, brisket sandwich, and their Mac and cheese and twice baked mashed potatoes.  Everything was delish!!We will be back!

Delicious BBQ for a fair price!We ordered a Brisket Sandwich (Texas Crutch), Brisket & Ribs Plate, and one soda which totaled to $23.Meats: Both the ribs and brisket were tender, juicy, and deliciously done. BBQ sauce was also great - not spicy but tasteful.Potato salad: Good but had a bit more bacon than potato for our taste.Coleslaw, onions, pickles: Excellent.The restaurant itself was a good experience - colorful and inviting, fairly clean, ample parking, and had fun Latin/salsa music in the background.

It's been a couple years since I've been on the Texas bbq food scene.. but this place seems to be holding its own. This is a food truck.. but there is indoor seating available.. shared with the taco shop on the property. I like that this place is still relatively new so I came at 3pm in a weekday and didn't have to worry about anything being sold out (contrary to franklins). I had the brisket (1/2 pound for $9.25).. I ordered it to go and the sauce conveniently came on the side. It was definitely melt in your mouth good.. fatty.. but that's to be expected. I ordered a side of potato salad which was oddly tangy almost like a citrus flavor which I wasn't too fond of and I. Couldn't finish it. My brisket and 1 side came to $14+. It's good bbq.. but I'm still convinced I need to try more around Austin.
Food was excellent. Brisket a little fatty for my taste, but still good. Nice smoke rings. Good portion sizes and prices reasonable. Would have given 5 stars if music wasn't so loud.

Perfect smoke!   Alonzo is a meat specialist.   Never been here before.   We talked about the menu,  he set me up with a great plate with very well paired sides. I think it's great that he talked with me about what I wanted and how I liked it after I finished.   For someone to accept feed back is awesome.  He is  very knowledgeable about what he does with his smoker and meat.   Thank you for a very good meal.P.s.  the ribs literally fell apart.

Thank you Austin and Yelp for helping me navigate my way to some of the best BBQ I've ever had!! This is a food truck located outside of a taco restaurant, but you can eat on the patio or bring your food in. They've only been open for 4 months, but have been cooking BBQ for 12+ years. We did a make your own combo plate with ribs, brisket, cheddar and jalapeño and original sausage. The meat was incredible. The best brisket I've ever had. Everything was so tender and full of flavor. We also had a few sides- Mac n cheese, potato salad, and collard greens. Marco brought us out a few slices of turkey to try as well. Alonzo makes all of the sides in house and Marco smokes all of the meat. You can tell everyone who works there takes pride in what they are creating. Marco came around to check on us. Do yourself a favor, come check this truck out. Soon to be one of the most popular BBQ trucks in Austin!

Texas Ranch has been on my pending list for a long time.  I see good reviews and figure it's got to be pretty good.  Not sure if they used to only be a truck in the lot and now share the indoor space with Papalote or how that combo happened.  I ordered the brisket and rib plate and started looking for a place to sit.  One side of the room had high tables and the other side had low tables.  I went over to the low tables to make a 4 top for us, but by the time I pulled the tables together and sat down, the stench from the bathroom overwhelmed me.  There's no way I could eat and be assaulted by that odor.They brought our food out fairly promptly.  There was a constant flow of customers, so I figured this was going to be acceptable.  The rib was kind of the only thing that was pleasant.  The brisket was not much of a serving and was very blah.  You have to come with better game than that in Austin these days.  The sides were uninspiring as well.  Potato salad was almost mashed potatoes.  The pickles and onions were awful.  How do you mess up onions?  They were bread and butter-ish pickled and they were gross.It'll be a while before I give this a try again.
Stopped in for a late lunch. The ribs were some of the best I've ever had. Friendly staff. Clean dining area inside. Just a pleasant place. Give them a shot!

First time here so I will just break it down.This place is owned by the same people that own Papalotes so you know going in it won't be bad. The two share the site which allows for indoor seating. Parking limited but it does exist. Nice trailer good smoke flavor:Brisket - lean meat so if you like moist you might be disappointed. It also could have been that I didn't arrive until after 1 and the bulk of brisket could have been sold.  Not dry or stiff just needed more sauce (B+)Beans - good flavor but not overly spicy. I prefer the beans this way with maybe a little more smoke but overall (A)Slaw - again, crisp with good flavor. Lite wet mix so you aren't insinuated by mayo or other spices.  Authentic (A)Pickles/Jalapeños - pickles were standard and may be a little sweet for some (B) but OMG get all the jalapeño mix they will give you. It's like they infuse the smoke into their concoction.  They could sell this in mass quantities and it would be ingested like a fat kid love cake (A++)Overall I liked the food and will be back to explore more. Yummy and not overpriced ($15)

What a great find. Really exceptional brisket, ribs and sausage. The sides were excellent too. The brisket was that perfect balance of lean but juicy that's so hard to find. The ribs were smoked to perfection so that the meat fell off the bone with the slightest of motion. The sausage was the best we've had in Austin and that includes the big names. The pit master, Alonzo, is a perfectionist and comes across in the product. The ambiance is basic, so if you're seeking romance for anything but meat, this is not the place. But if you want to bond with some of the best bbq in Austin, this is the ticket.

Mmm. Mmm. GOOD! Here's my order, 1/4 lb of brisket and two spare ribs with pinto beans. Brisket had a nice smoke ring around the slice, part fatty and part lean, which gave it a subtle taste of the post oak. Spice rub was a good combo of salt, pepper. Ribs looked and tasted beautifully but had a sweet taste to the spice rub. The brisket as well as the spare ribs are kept warm wrapped in cellophane. Beans, were a little bland for my taste. So what makes this a place standout in the crowd? Easy, friendly customer service, a good tasting product, homemade pickled onions and pickles with a kickass BBQ sauce. Out of all the joints in central Texas, only two places standout to me for their sauce; City Market in Luling and The Salt Lick. I know the sauce is not the boss with purist of traditional BBQ, but when it is combined with meats, onions and pickles on a slice of white bread, it is something to point out. I never tasted before a near perfect combination of lean brisket, homemade pickled onions, a homemade pickle, and bbq sauce wrapped up on a slice of white bread as I did at Texas Star. Major props to the owner of Papalote for a tasty creation. Believe me, the meats do not need the sauce. I was given two portions but only used one. I'm not going to bother trying to figure out the combustion of flavors, just go there and try it. This place got it right!

My boss and I came here one day for lunch! I am glad we did because I was getting tired if the usual places we go to. The good smoked smell of BBQ is want caught my tapeworm's appetite.First when you get order your meal, I must say you think you're being cheated but truthfully you're not. The serving is just right for the price! I even told the owner I was impressed because I really thought I was being cheated. To me I like that part of this place. There was no waste as I ate my entire meal and I was completely satisfied!There is seating outside in front of the trailer and I believe you can sit inside the parnter restaurant. But the day I came here it was nice beautiful day outside.Private parking is limited, but you can park in the street designted areas. I definitely will come back another day. The staff is friendly and I enjoyed their customer service.

Having tried a decent bit of BBQ all around Austin, I think I can safely say that this place has the best for which you don't need to WAIT forever!This may be a silly distinction to make, but talking with friends and coworkers about places like Franklin's, La BBQ, and Salt Lick when you're already hungry is pretty frustrating since we agree they are very good but they require at least a small amount of planning ahead or willingness to wait a long while! That being said, really liked the ribs and brisket here since they were very moist and flavorful. The brisket seemed to come sliced such that it had a fatty side and a lean side, which worked out well, and the bbq sauce had a slight spiciness to it as well which makes it a bit more unique than the standard sweet-only BBQ sauce.Overall solid place

Hidden gem!!! My husband and I went to this establishment prepared to order tacos. When we saw the BBQ menu we gave our initial plan a second thought and said, "let's go for it!" I ordered a brisket sandwich with sauce on the side and Mac and cheese. I'm very picky about my bbq sauce but this stuff is heaven! It has a very unique flavor, not too sweet or vinegary. The owner said it's made with Modelo Especial. I absolutely loved the sandwich and sauce!! Mmmhhh!!! The Mac and cheese was amazing too, very mild and creamy. You can tell everything is homemade here, the owner even said so himself. He was such a nice man who takes pride in what he cooks! Our new favorite lunch spot for sure, we now have the option of fantastic tacos or bbq all in one place!! Can't wait to go back! Support small businesses!!

I came to Austin hoping to have some good barbecue. After learning how long the wait usually was at the most famous local barbecue place I decided to see what the alternatives were. Texas Ranch got pretty good reviews so I decided to give it a shot. The brisket that I got here was top notch. It was tender and flavorful and definitely best enjoyed without any sauce on top. The mac and cheese and pickled vegetables were both very good sides. I came here with a couple of other people who tried the ribs and sausage, and they thought those were excellent as well. The staff here was also very friendly so it was the kind of business I liked supporting. One thing to note, this place used to be called Twelve Bones but apparently they have to change their name because of a trademark issue. They also share a building with a taco restaurant, which may lead to some confusion when you get here.

My husband and I were just passin' through and stumbled upon this spot for lunch but I think there are some name discrepancies because the truck is covered in the name "12 Bones." My husband ordered a 1/2 lb. of spare ribs and I ordered a 1/2 lb. of baby back ribs. We also ordered sides: potato salad, greens and ecabeche (spicy pickled veggies).  Both ribs were just about the best ribs we've ever known!!!! The sides were all homemade and fresh. On top of that, they were incredibly kind and friendly!!!

It may have been overblown expectations, given all the 5 star reviews, but color me unimpressed. Average brisket (ordered a lb), average smoked turkey (1/2 lb) and tasteless coleslaw. The pickled cauliflower rocked but those two pieces didn't make up for $30 worth of very average smoked proteins. The staff were very nice, although one thing that did make me smile was overhearing "just a couple of slices" after requesting some bread to go with the order.

Just finished eating here with my family , customer service was HORRIBLE , dark hair was in my beans, and the Jamaica & tamarindo they gave us was old and had a really weird taste to it. When we asked the lady worker to replace the drinks due to the low quality of it she simply poured a little out and tasted it, said it was fine and handed us back the same drinks. The brisket and ribs were great, but her inability to fix the problem and rude customer service turned me off. I'm not sure who's running the place but they really ought to see what's going on with there employees maybe that way the place would be busier

Why on earth is this place a 4.5 star?!? It should be a 2 at best.This was by far the worst meal of our entire trip in Austin. My fiancé and I are only in Austin for the weekend and we were really looking forward to having BBQ before we left. We are SO DISAPPOINTED. It is VERY over priced and it looked like someone who doesn't know how to cook tried to throw some items on a piece of paper and call it BBQ. The portions are tiny, the sauce was not good.... It was just awful.Choose anywhere else.

This truck is off the hook. I've been eyeing the twelve bones truck for months since I live nearby, and then I finally saw the lit up open sign! I walked over with the fam today and did my first round of ordering since I usually try everything on the menu at least 3x before making a call on the place. We got the burnt end sandwich with cream corn (done properly- like meat cotton candy exploding with intense flavor that melts in your mouth, crisp corn was sweet cream goodness); brisket (seriously some sexy smokey supple meat); and jalepeno cheddar sausage (crispy casing and juicy innards- love the snap when you bite into it). Marco is super cool, and clearly know his craft. A big difference from Leroy & Lewis a block away that we don't eat at anymore because of a holier than thou attitude and brisket that you need a knife to eat . Twelve Bones also has plenty of seating both outdoor and indoor (will soon be another location for Papalote Taco house  that both customers can eat in). We got take out, and like the subtle touch of the black take out containers - elevates the experience, lol. Walking back over now to try the smoked pecan pie, and definitely coming back for breakfast tacos .Welcome to the hood Twelve Bones- pls don't ever leave!

Me and my friend ordered the moist brisket and we both got completely different types of meat. One was kind of moist and nicely cut and the other one was small chunks of fat. This was my first impression of Texas bbq and I was utterly disappointed. Only thing that was okay was the Cole slaw, not recommended!
Awesome!Ate here for the first time and I have to say that I'm very impressed. Homemade sides are collared greens, pinto beans, mac n cheese.

Oh wow! I have lived across the street for over a year and had the Papalote breakfast tacos often (share seating space, those are really good, too!), but never BBQ.. until today. I had a craving and am so glad I did!I got the chopped brisket sandwich with the sauce mixed in, and it's the best I've had. I am totally guilty of getting BBQ To-go and then loading it up with Sweet Baby Ray's sauce at home, but not this time. The meat was perfect, sauce so flavorful, and the pickled onions-yum! I'm a big mac-n-cheese fan so I got a side of that too. It's a white cheddar mac, which is interesting for bbq, but is good. Tastes like Annie's white cheddar mac if you've had it. Definitely recommend!

Some friends and I went here for lunch today. I hate to say it, but the BBQ was mediocre. The brisket was dry. I did like the pork rib. They were out of sausage even though it was still on the menu. The potato salad needed more flavor. The cole slaw was OK. Not sure what was wrong with the tea, it was probably left over from the day before. Oh, the smell... they had some kind of sewer issue. Sit under a vent if you don't want to smell the foulness. Very dissatisfied.

Wow is all I can say. The food and service was amazing. This is probably one of the best bbq meals I have ever had. I tried the brisket, spare ribs, and baby back ribs. The meat was so tender and flavorful. The rib pretty much fell right off the bone. I also tried the many sides that were offered. I had the collars greens, potato salad, and mac n cheese. The greens and mac were amazing. The platter also came with a housemade bbq sauce which was sweet and chipotle like.Overall, the food was so good and I would definitely eat here again.

Tasty, Tasty BBQ. Stopped in for the first time for Father's Day. The owner of the food truck offered us samples of the meats and we were impressed. The most moist turkey and sausage we have ever had. Flavor is on point. The meal came with bread, pickles and pickles onion and some sauce (not spiced, a little sweet and a tad vinegar. Great! Owner was extremely friendly, helpful and followed up with us after our meal. We ate brisket, sausage and the super yummy turkey and brought it inside to enjoy in the AC. My youngest also bought some homemade quack and chips from Papalote and it was also delicious, made fresh and full of flavor. Highly recommend. Affordable. Yummy. Great service - all around 5 stars

Basic BBQ! I bought a half pound of spare ribs, half pound of sausage, and a little over a half pound of brisket (even though I asked for a half pound) which came up to 28 bucks.  Very basic for all three meats they don't offer any type of 3 meat special with sides, so unfortunately I wasn't able to try any sides, especially considering I already spent 28 dollars.  The sauce is pretty good though.  Overall I say it's an ok spot nothing too special, I may try it again in the future.

Marco has moved on and Alonso has taken the helm and still cranking out some great BBQ.  Smoking it a little longer on lower heat to make the brisket and turkey oh so tender.  Collard greens are awesome too . . . and as usual the escabeche mmm.

Now open on Sundays! Get some to snack on while you watch football.Been back a few times now and I have to say that the Turkey has been amazing - it's the most moist, juicy and flavorful turkey in town (and I generally am not a smoked BBQ turkey fan).  Spares are also still a favorite.  Also note - breakfast tacos are now sold through Papalote - the brisket tacos are great and filling (plus they go FAST if you order a bunch for work).  Marco and Ashley are super nice and always make you feel welcome.

BBQ trailer on S. Congress where the old LuluB's (and soon to be Papalote) was located.  Marco helms the pit and crafts some mean meats.  Ashley was on the register and both of them with bright smiles and warm friendly personalities really makes this place special.On the tally this day:1.  Brisket - wow, so soft melty with each cut having a little top and bottom brisket.  Nice seasoning as well.  A little salty, but that imparts great flavor.2.  Turkey - this stuff was moist and tender (not always a given with smoked turkey) and had a nice seasoning on it as well. You can eat this without any sauce and it just tastes good.3.  Spare ribs - a beautiful St. Louis cut rib was evenly distributed seasoning all over. Perfectly cooked and juicy.4.  Baby backs - hello tenderness.  Falling off the bone and fully seasoned throughout.  I'd say both of the ribs give you great succulent flavor without the feeling of just eating a lot of pork (like when lesser seasoned ribs give you that big mouthful of pork taste).5.  Sausage - opted for the jalapeno and cheese.  Not greasy at all with a nice crisp casing.  Yum.  Incidentally - this and the bread are the only two things not prepared by them.6.  Mac & Cheese - helloooo nurse.  That's some tasty stuff.  It's not orange colored but white ( is that white chedder - what is that deliciousness?)7.  Potato Salad - wait that's not mayo - wait this tastes like baked potato!!  I think there's meat in this . . . oh yeah I think vegetarians would be disappointed.8.  Sauce - got the spicy stuff - smells great, nice flavor with a little kick.9.  Escabeche - oh yeah - homemade pickles, onions, cauliflower, jalapenos and carrots (oh garlic too).  The bright acidity on this stuff cuts the oiliness of BBQ and is a fantastic compliment.  So glad to have this in the hood. Will be back for sure.

We drove almost two hours to try some Austin BBQ and stoped here because it seemed to be "up and coming," we were 100% right! The food was absolutely delicious and the service was amazing and we really enjoyed the customer service. It's decently priced and well worth it.If you're not interested in standing in hour long lines for BBQ, yet this could potentially be one of those long lined places soon, stop here!The meat is priced per 1/2 pound and there are scrumptious sides (The mac & cheese was to dieeee for!). We tried the Turkey, Brisket and Spare Ribs and couldn't pick a favorite from the trio. It was served with a chipotle tasting BBQ sauce that I wish I could buy in stores (although it wouldn't taste near as good on my cooking). The parking lot is private and as others have already stated, a bit small, but it's there and I would've even parked down the street and walked for it! We sat outside on very clean patio tables despite the angry looking sky; there is inside seating, however.

Having Twelve Bones BBQ so close to my house in the Dawson/St. Ed's neighborhood will be dangerous for my cholesterol level, but having top-tier brisket and other goodies in the 'hood is a long time coming. Pitmaster Marco Oglesby is a friendly face, genuinely happy to meet new customers (he'll remember you if you go more than once), and loves to chat about his craft.I am a bit envious of the East Austin BBQ scene, and frankly,78704 can stand to use a few top tier places of its own.  It was disappointing when La Barbecue couldn't make it work in the proposals to take over what is now June's...but Twelve Bones certainly eases the pain.  I'm hesitant to write a review since I kind of don't want anyone else to know!The pluses:1.  Happy and friendly staff, easy parking (for now), and the upcoming air conditioned building will make for a very accessible location for Central Texas smoked meat - more so than fighting for parking in East Austin, driving out to Lockhart, etc.  Come fall during football season, this place will be on my short list of to-go for takeout. 2.  As fall comes the pleasant patio and brand new deck will be a lot of fun - whoever they contracted with to do the layout did an excellent job.3.  Just about everything is homemade down to the pickles and sides.  The variety of sides is excellent.  The red pickled onions are something we don't see everywhere and really a nice bit to offset the fatty brisket.  Collard greens and potato salad are excellent.  I've got to try the smoked pecan pie but when you're lugging about 2 pounds of meat home...well...4.  Having breakfast tacos in the morning with Twelve Bones brisket...yes please.  5. The sausage is a finer grind, not coarse, but amazingly juicy without making it feel like a oily bomb.  I wimped out and went for the regular but it still has a nice kick.  I think another reviewer had a similar comment.  Both times I've gone I've loved the brisket and sausage and so haven't felt the need to challenge the lines at La Barbecue, Franklin, etc.6.  Finally - the brisket.  Fatty and lean and all are excellent with the expected spicy bark.  Like most fans I've had my share of Franklin, La Barbecue, Micklethwait's, and Browns (over on SoLa) and have also regularly been to Freedmans and Terry Blacks.  Since discovering Twelve bones I haven't gone back to the more established places.  Next on my list will be the burnt ends (a Kansas City thing, and I've only had the Jack Stack version, which was not really that memorable).  The minuses:1.  So new, still some minor kinks.  Forgot the sauce in my takeout (which wasn't a big deal to me since the meats were so gosh darn good.  No Big Red the second morning I visited it (you almost HAVE to have it in any BBQ place.  2.  The pickles might use a little more vinegar, but maybe I'm just used to the bottled variety.  These pickles are fully home-made.In all, I really hope Twelve Bones makes it.  That location had some good places but nothing could ever stick around - Lulus was a great trailer but didn't seem to generate traffic as a brick and mortar.

First time here and paid for a Dr.Pepper and the waitress tried to give me someone's food order. Still haven't gotten my Dr.Pepper. I finally learned that the drinks are located in a cooler behind the cashier. I ordered the brisket and rib plate and was given the brisket and sausage plate. I suggest you find another BBQ place and don't waste your time or money here.
Excellent brisket!  Don't judge this book by it's cover.  Plenty of inside and outside seating.  We definitely plan to return for a second helping.

This is a business inside of a business which threw me a little.  So, Mexican food and BBQ.  I was looking for that really good Texas bbq I hear so much about.  This wasnt it.  I had the combo with brisket and ribs, well rib.  The brisket was super tender but really didn't have a crust, the rib (singular) was good but didn't really impress with flavor.  The side were okay, nothing special.  The bbq sauce was okay, but not great.  The price did not justify the meal.  Sorry, but I wont be going back here, unless it is for tacos.
Stopped on a whim and thoroughly enjoyed our meal. The pulled pork sandwich was delicious. We also enjoyed an order of freshly made guacamole. Will definitely be back to try more!

This was my second time here and just like the first time the food was great. I actually live right across the street and was craving some bbq so why not visit my friendly local neighborhood bbq joint. Ordered a 1/2 pound of brisket, pinto beans and collard greens. The brisket was moist with a great crust and the collard greens were some of the best I've ever had. Won't lie the pinto beans left something wanting; maybe some spices to add a bit of flavor. That being said last time I got the mac and cheese it it was killer, so don't let that stop you. All in all a great spot to hit up and with so many bbq joints close by it takes having some good food to stay alive here and they have some good food.
Holy smokes. Those spare ribs and burnt ends brisket are phenomenal. The best I've had of both, hands down!!

Hands down the best BBQ trailer in austin !! We pick this up a couple times a month and get about a 1/2 pound of brisket and a pound of turkey and it never disappoints!  We like to pick up this BBQ when headed down to the beach so we can snack all day !The turkey is perfectly seasoned and the flavor is deep down in the meat! The brisket is tender and juicy and just melts in your mouth !  Recently tried the ribs and man are they good!!  This is making me hungry ! Do yourself a favor and pick some up right now !!  This place is the bomb!!   Friendly service and decent price point , but more importantly they know what they are doing when it comes to BBQ and meat!!!

I moved to Austin over six years ago, and my love for BBQ was a big part of the reason why. I make it a point to visit as many BBQ as I can as often as I can. With so many choices here in this amazing town, it's tough to pick favorites, but Twelve Bones is a stand-out to me.I now visit this truck on a weekly basis, even though I work near the Arboretum and have to brave Mopac to get there.Pitmaster Marco Oglesby is a master at his craft. He's a genuine and warm person with an intense love for what he does, which translates into amazing barbecue.Too often, pitmasters will over-season the food, dishonoring the meat. Marco never does this. His rubs accentuate the natural flavors without overpowering them. This matters.The baby back ribs are the best in town. The spare ribs are never tough or chewy, because they aren't rushed through the smoking process.I don't like turkey. Even on Thanksgiving, I barely eat any. Yet, I order turkey every time I visit Twelve Bones, because it is incredibly delicious. I can't believe I'm even typing this right now, because turkey is awful, but I love it here.The burnt ends are also amazing and again, not over-seasoned. There are plenty of places in town you can go to to find salty, over-peppered meat, but Twelve Bones is not one of them.I should also mention the sides. The coleslaw is great, more flavorful than I had expected. The team is always experimenting with new sides, keeping things fresh.So if you're interested in BBQ that is made with great care, full of flavor, and never rushed, Twelve Bones is the place to go. And Twelve Bones is still new enough that the lines aren't too long, so go now before this place gets too famous.

I had brisket and pork spareribs. Everything was cooked very well, but there was enough other stuff (not-salt-and-pepper) in the rub to turn me off the flavor. I'm fairly sure this comes from Marco's time at Schmidt Family in Bee Cave, since they adulterate their meat with allspice or some other perversion far past the point of being edible. Also, for some reason they store the meat wrapped directly in plastic, which seals in more water moisture than is probably good. Put that pink paper to work, man!My rating is entirely based on the seasoning, as I am very impressed with the texture and internal flavor of the meat. The escabeche was delightful, and the mac & cheese was lovely. Still, you don't go to a BBQ joint in Austin for the sides, and the flavor was off. I'll very happily bump up my rating in the event that whatever the stomach-roiling spice is (Allspice? Mace? I don't know either flavor well enough) goes away.

I had the baby back ribs and the brisket. Both were cooked perfectly. The sauce was delicious too but to be honest the meat was so good on its own you don't need it. We met Alonzo the owner and he talked to us for a bit and welcomed us to the city. Amazing service.

One word....SPECTACULAR!Headed to Austin with 5 friends and we hit 17 places in 4 days. Yes, you read that correctly, all in and around Austin.I had read an article about Twelve Bones being a hot new BBQ place and decided to add it to our list of stops and hit it the last day of our trip.There is certainly no shortage of top notch BBQ food trucks in Austin, but across the board, we all agreed, this one is one of the best!Marco and his staff were warm, friendly and extremely helpful at making recommendations.The turkey was the best we had on our trip...burnt ends and brisket, also amazing!These guys are turning out amazing BBQ...they killed it! One of the best meals we had on the trip! YOU GUYS ROCK!

Glad to see this spot finally opened as I've been driving by it for a few weeks. The brisket was perfectly trimmed with just enough fat to render out, and tender, juicy and a great rub on it. The baby backs also had another rub that kicked the heat level up in a good way. The slaw was all very good and refreshing.Two kinds of sauce-regular (vinegar kick) and spicy. There is inside seating with good AC too! Pitmaster Marco has spent time at Opie's and Schmidt Family, and I will definitely be back. A great addition to the South Austin BBQ scene.

I had the turkey, coleslaw, homemade pickled onions, whole jalapeño, and pickles. The turkey was moist and tender, the coleslaw was unbelievably fresh, tasty and creamy. All the pickled items were FABULOUS. The turkey was moist and tender and not overly salty. My friends had the brisket, which they all agreed was some of the best they've had..super moist and tasty!  They all agreed the sausage was underwhelming, and I thought the bbq sauce was too tomatoey...too much like marinara sauce. I prefer a more smoky, tangy, spicier sauce.The best part about this food trailer is that they have outside as well as inside, airconditioned seating...so nice when there's triple-digit temps.  Nicely done!

Came here really not expecting too much--BBQ is a hit or miss in the state of Texas, after all. Ordered probably way too much but so glad I did because I had leftovers for dinner (winning!). The staff was great. It was super hot out, which is my main complaint, and they immediately told me of their indoor seating. I'm obsessed with their Mac n cheese. I know, I know... not the thing to brag about at a BBQ place, but I couldn't find a spoon that night and found myself eating without (don't judge, we've all done it).The ribs are another favorite. They heated up really well for the leftovers, which is also a hit or miss. If you can't tell, I'm all about the leftovers. It worked out to my advantage. I live far from them but I'll be making the trip out very soon for another round!
Arby's would have been better. One rib and two slices of dry brisket. Pinto beans were not fully cooked. Any fast food would have been a better choice. Shameful to sell bbq of this caliber in Texas.

Just opened a couple weeks ago and stumbled upon it out of the blue. Fantastic service to begin with. Very welcoming and eager to answer any questions. Everything homemade except the bread and the sausage (which was still pretty dang good). Brisket was up there with the best of them. Great texture, wasn't overcooked and held it's shape well but was still extremely tender. Great smoke flavor and smoke ring. Baby back ribs had a great smoke flavor and were tender with a great bark. Home pickled veggies had the perfect flavor, not too salty as tends to happen. Creamed corn was rich and buttery without being overly so. Definitely would recommend. No line or waiting, but I'm sure that won't lay for long as good as this was.
The salty bark on the brisket reminds me of Kreuz Market. The turkey has a nice spicy flavor to it but not as smokey as I prefer. Good spot. Plus there was not a line at noon.
Best in South Austin, by far. Brisket, ribs, and turkey were off the charts. Great Mac and cheese also.

After reviewing their online menu I drove 5.6 miles for brisket tacos, potato salad and corn. They don't have tacos or corn. An online menu update is needed so don't go with expectations. I ordered a sliced brisket sandwich and potato salad with pickles and onions. I received two slices of cheap white bread and not even enough brisket to cover an entire slice of bread. I could make a fold-over half sandwich with it. I showed the girl at the counter so she asked the carver to provide enough for a whole sandwich. Finally there was enough meat to cover a slice of bread but it was thin. When I order a $5 sandwich I expect a nice sandwich bun, not cheap white bread. The BBQ sauce has an unusual spice that does not fit for BBQ. The pickles and onions are not pickled, just drenched in vinegar. I disliked it. A disappointment I won't return for.

The absolute best BBQ AND kolaches!! The people who run it are so sweet. Once, someone didn't pick up their order, and the woman at the food truck decided to share the order with all of us at the trailer park. If you want to get there before they run out, calling ahead might be the best option.

Great barbecue ! I had the ribs, ate a whole rack, I'm a fat bastard, but I'm a happy and fed fat bastard.  Shared a bit with my homeless buds around town.  The lovely and talented and hottie woman that took care of me was crazy hospitable!  And, she's got homemade pickle, she's got great sauce, she's got blue cheese coleslaw, she was out of that "cream corn"  but like I said, I'm a fat bastard ..so I could do without the cream corn.  Absolutely one of the greatest barbecue trucks in all of Austin and that I've ever been too.  Get ya some B B Q!

Did I just wait 3 hours IN THE RAIN for BBQ? Yes, yes I did and I think that officially makes me a Texan!Not sure how long Kerlin had been out of operation for, but their comeback was no joke. They were giving away free ribs (and beer, though, sadly no beer because of the rain), so clearly that was part of the appeal for most. For me, I wasn't really sure what I was in store for, but once I had waited an hour, I had passed the threshold of turning back.When we finally did get up to the truck, you can see it's a true family affair. Mom, dad, and kids were put to work!I got the sliced brisket sandwich and the blue cheese coleslaw. And, of course, the ribs were thrown in the bag, as well. The ribs were like buttaaaahhhh. But, butttaaaahhh lathered with the most amazing spice rub. I don't even really know if one should be describing ribs that way, but that's what is coming out of my typing fingers, so that is what we'll go with.The brisket sandwich was a mouthful...in a good way. I added the pickles, drizzled a little BBQ sauce on it, and... plopped some blue cheese coleslaw on there! Purists will chastise me, I'm sure, but it was rich as its own bite - creamy and perfect on the bun mixed with the meat and pickles, though! You have to reaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaally like blue cheese to be able to even make a dent in the side as a side.Three hours is a bit excessive, of course, but if you are with company you enjoy, and maybe slyly BYOB, the time is of no concern when the end result is so rewarding!

Franklins bbq was sold out and we heard a lot of great things about this place so decided to preorder. We ordered brisket, sausage, beef n cheddar kola, ranch style beans and potato salad. The brisket was pretty amazing. However beef sausage was the show stealer. The kolaches were pretty darn good as well. The ranch style beans were delicious and had a Mexican style chicken tortilla flavor soup kick to it.The potatoe salad had a jalapeño kick to it and was good as well.Order in advance, they run out of meat as well.

Overall good bbq, but everything was a little drier and less greasy than I prefer. I almost felt healthy after finishing my meal here, which is good but not something I set out for when I'm in want of overwhelming, juicy, clog-your-artery type Texas bbq. Kerlin is known for their brisket kolache, and it definitely didn't disappoint. I was impressed by the dough, which they apparently prepare from scratch daily. Filling was good with generous brisket, but I wish it were a little more cheesy and juicy.I also tried their moist brisket, ribs, and banana custard. The moist parts of their moist brisket were very good, but a fair portion of the brisket was unfortunately quite dry (picture attached). Overall, the brisket was better than Rudy's on their average days but worse than Rudy's on their really good days. I wasn't impressed by the ribs- it was dry, and parts were almost jerky-like. Flavor was great though. Banana custard was alright, nothing remarkable but enough to satisfy your sweet tooth.Parking- the truck is in a food truck park with space for about 6 cars. Didn't have trouble finding a spot Saturday at lunch time.

Kolache! Kolache! Kolache!We certainly love BBQ however we also love Kolache's. Years ago there was a Kolache factory in MN. Ever since they closed, we have been looking for a place that serves these delicious treats.Enter Kerlin BBQ. (Can you hear the angles singing?) Kerlin became a must stop on our list of places to visit during our Austin trip. The Kolache's did not disappoint. We sampled the brisket and sausage. Loved them both. The brisket was smoky and juicy then wrapped in that warm slightly sweet Kolache. Wow! The sausage was fantastic! Top quality sausage with a good snap, great flavor. It was like eating a bagel dog times ten! So good! We made a few trips over to get some Kolaches. The only thing we didn't like is we didn't try any of there other items. Those Kolaches were just too good! Very friendly service and fantastic Kolaches from this little food truck in east Austin. They do sell out of these early so when you go, go early and get some Kolaches!

While exploring East Austin I wanted to find and try Kerlin BBQ where it was highlighted as one of the top BBQ places in the city. Located off of East Cesar Chavez St I pulled into the gravel parking lot to find it tiny with huge potholes feeling like I was driving on the moon. There were no spots and noticed a sign saying no parking in front of the piñata store next to it. Kerlin also shares the same spot with Veracruz Tacos food truck making this location a very popular destination. I ended up parking on an adjacent street and walked to Kerlin. I ignored the few homeless people but felt fine leaving my vehicle.I made my way to the Kerlin BBQ food truck passing a run down gas station and piñata store. The setup was nice where you order/pickup food at the truck and find a place to sit at under a cover awning.I ordered beef brisket, pork ribs, macaroni & cheese, and jalapeño potato salad. The order was ready pretty quickly and one plate had two big slices of brisket and the other pork ribs.  Both meats were very soft and juicy where no knife was needed.  It was unbelievably delicious where I see why listed among the best. Both meats had a nice smoky flavor and the sides were good too especially the jalapeño potato salad.It's a no thrills place in the outdoor Austin culinary culture where it is all about the meat and cleanup after yourself when you are done.
