We came here on a food truck tour and returned again on our ownThe good:- The kolaches!  This is the only we tried here and omg, they were so delicious!  I wish I would have brought some on the plane.-Their BBQ sauce: I am not really a sauce person but I really liked this sauce (you will love it if you like vinegar).The so-so:- The kolaches sold out really fast (each customer can purchase up to 6).-This place opens at 11am and there is a line before it even opens- The seating is outdoors so not sure what happens if it rains (or does it not rain in Austin?)The bad: None!Final Verdict: This would probably be one of the first stops I make if I were to return to Austin.

My favorite bbq place! I love everything on the menu even the pulled pork which I normally don't enjoy. Cross your fingers you get there in time for a kolache on Sunday. All the sides are great. The portions are perfect and price is on point. The owners are so kind! Super fast too.

*TIP* Come here if you don't want to wait at La Barbecue! We actually split our party in half; half of us waited at La while half of us walked to Kerlin. No wait, we grabbed takeout and walked back to La, ate our food and were still waiting in line at La. Since we were already indulging at La - we were only able to try:Brisket - tender, fatty, juicyRibs - good and flavorful Blue cheese cole slaw - I love the flavors because I love blue cheese but others in my group didn't really like how thick it was. I added the complimentary onions to mellow out the thickness and strong taste.  Kolache - pastry wrapped meat with cheese. Like a pigs in a blanket/ hotdog bun if ordered with sausage either way, delicious!!!! I could eat this all day. We were all very impressed with Kerlin and how there was no wait !!! It's not hyped up as other BBQ joints but def. just as good if not better. We thought the brisket was 10x better then La's.

We came to Kerlin through a food tour and we are already planning when we will be back. Their pork ribs and the kolachi are quite literally to die for. Oh and the blue cheese coleslaw and dill potato salad. You are speaking my language. It's exactly what is sounds like. Gas station food truck. Don't expect a gourmet experience or a restroom or place to wash your hands. There are a few food trucks in the lot. Their hours are until they run out of food. Picnic benches and they have a roof for those hot summer days. Do yourself a favor and 100% get the kolachi. It has brisket in it. And it's more of a roll. Not sure where it falls on the actually being considered a kolachi spectrum but it has heavenly. Can't wait to return!

No lines! However parking lot needs some repaving, watch out for the pot holes if you have a low car. We ordered the chopped beef sandwich, a hot link, creamed corn and Ranch style beans (no drink) and it came out to about $20. The food came out quick and was hot. The corn was heavenly, it reminded me of cajun style grits! It was really flavorful and my new favorite cream corn! Really everything was flavorful and we had no complaints. We had just recently eaten at a rave bbq joint in Luling which was thoroughly disappointing but this place did not disappoint at all!We wanted to try the kolaches and so did quite a bit of other people, but they were sold out by the time we got there. So if you want a Kolache, then get there early!We definitely will be back for more BBQ!

This review is only for the kolaches but WOWZERS.Slightly sweet, chewy dough filled with brisket (my #1 fave), pulled pork, or sausage, all with some type of cheese. The dough straight up melts in your mouth, and the same can almost be said for the meat. The pulled pork has more a delicate flavor but the brisket has a sweet smokiness to it. Just wow.

This place was only 2 blocks away from La Barbeque. We were waiting in line for La Barbeque and our friends went to Kerlin to get some food. No wait at this food truck! We only got to try the sausage and cheese bread, brisket, blue cheese coleslaw, and pork ribs. The pork ribs were a bit dry. The brisket was fatty and tender. No wait for bbq? I like it. I would suggest have someone get some food here to-go while you wait in line for La Barbeque.

I've tried most of the well known Bbq places in Austin multiple times. Kerlin might be the best value for the "wait" (very brief).Excellent brisket, pork ribs that stack up well against any of them, good sausage, and the pork belly burnt ends they make are delicious. Friendly people too! If you love Barbecue and haven't tried Kerlin yet, you must go.

After 8 years in Austin I can comfortably say Kerlin is in the top 4 bbq places here.It shocks me there is never a line. Part of me wants to keep it under the radar so I can waltz up and get brisket and pork ribs without a wait, but they deserve more recognition for their awesome flavors!The moist brisket and pork ribs are always solid and exactly what you want from BBQ. Kerlins will give you all the flavor you could ask for.If you're visiting give Kerlins a go! I doubt it will be under the radar for much longer with the new location by capital city bakery.

Had the brisket sandwich, ribs and sausage. Brisket sandwich was good. It was moist and juicy. The seasoning on the brisket was different but goodRibs were very tender but lacked in flavor Sausage was ok not greatWould have gave it a higher review but a little too pricey for me
Best brisket and cheddar kolache omggggg I could eat one of these every day they're soooo dang good!!!

Decided to give Kerlin a try since we had to have some BBQ before leaving Austin. Kerlin was highly rated and did not have the lines of another well known BBQ joint. Since me and lines don't get along Kerlin was the obvious choice.Parking was a bit of an issue. They have a small lot but it was full by people going to the taco truck right next to Kerlin. So we had to find some street parking a block or two away.The place itself is just a food truck with some outside seating. Luckily it wasn't raining and wasn't too hot the day we came.The lady at the counter was very friendly and we placed our order for some brisket and ribs. We also got a side of coleslaw.The brisket was very good and so were the ribs. The blue cheese coleslaw.... I dunno. It was growing on me, but I'll still take my regular coleslaw over it.Not cheap, cost us around $60 and the only left overs was 1 strip of brisket and 1 rib.

Austin, the home of smoked meats and BBQ. Stopped by LA Barbeque first but the line was way too long. I heard Kerlin had some good BBQ nearby and ventured off here. Turns out the BBQ is pretty good. I ordered a sliced brisket sandwich, 1/2lb pork ribs, 1/2lb pork shoulder, coleslaw, corned cheese, and corn on the cob. Placed the order around 12:30pm and the brisket was already gone!BBQ was decent. It's not the best BBQ I had during my stay in Austin but it was really good. The sliced brisket sandwich came with lean brisket so it wasn't super juicy and moist but it had a lot of flavor. Pork ribs were smoked and rendered tender.Pork shoulder was my favorite out of the three items I got. Service was seamless and fast. This is the perfect place to get a fast & decent meal and not wait for 2+ hours.Check out my review of La Barbeque/ Terry's Black

I'm amazed how delicious their beef brisket and ribs are for a truck food! It taste like from a 5 star restaurant! I'm serious!I already recommended this place to my friends and family! Definitely a 5 star flavor and taste. I loved it! 100% recommend! Next time I come back to Texas, I'm gonna drop by here again! Service was good, not bad. Like can be long but it didn't took too long anyway. Price is affordable and worth every penny. Thanks!!

Disclaimer: I only came to Kerlin for their banana pudding (famous in ATX) and it's the best I've had in the city. It's only a few dollars for a bowl of it. Unlike other spots in the area, the vanilla wafers aren't too heavy in the pudding. The pudding itself is extra creamy melting in your mouth.

So I'm giving this place 5 stars because of their kolaches. Their brisket and sausage are great btw (maybe not the best in Austin but definitely still worth a try), but the kolaches will knock your socks off! Soft, slightly sweet, fresh-made bread houses tender brisket and cheese or sausage and cheese. These are the best kolaches in central Texas!!! Wednesday to Sunday, 11am til sold out.I've never had to wait in a long line here. Plus the staff is always super nice, especially Amelis!

Austin is a BBQ town and you have to work hard to stand out. People will stand in line of hours to get brisket at nationally known locations and then you come across the local favorite.Kerlin's is a food truck that is now parking in the same location day after day. There are tables under a canopy. We tried all their meats and then went back for more. (Brisket and ribs were favorites) But there's more, the side dishes are outstanding. Everyone does beans, corn, coleslaw and potato salad, but Kerlin does it better. Add blue cheese or make it savory, your lunch went from good to gourmet.Everyone should try Kerlin

This was my first stop on my self-guided tour of Austin brisket. At the time, I didn't have anything to compare it to, so I thought it was pretty good, just a little overpriced - as good as most of the brisket I'd had elsewhere, anyway. But now that I've had brisket several other places in Austin, and know what really good brisket is... even if you exclude Franklin (because duh, obviously it's not anywhere near as good as Franklin, plenty of amazing bbq places still aren't, Franklin is in a class of its own), I have to say, it's... ok. The brisket I had here was decently flavorful, but a bit dry, and not *that* flavorful. And their pickles are waaay too salty. It wasn't bad brisket, but I've had way better, for about the same price - if your brisket is 21 dollars a pound, it should definitely be better than the brisket I tried here. Maybe some of their other meats are better, or maybe they had an off day, but based on what I tried, if you're in Austin looking for brisket, I can't really recommend Kerlin. I might think differently if they had been giving out free beer, but I didn't see any such thing (I guess it's only on the weekend?)

You know when you go to a business and you can just tell the person working really cares about what they do and the people they meet while doing it? That's this place. The woman working while we stopped here was SO kind. All the food was great. We came for the blue cheese coleslaw but the Mac and cheese and jalapeño dill potato salad were the best in show. (Not that the coleslaw was bad- everything we had here was great).

My best barbecue in Austin so far (3rd try).  The brisket has a thick smoke ring, tender, juice, and strong smoke flavor.  The pork ribs were done just right, with a slight pull the deep rosy meat cleaned  the bone.  Love the thick blacks pepper barks!  The potato salad and mac n cheese are tasty.  Although the noodles a bit too soft but the flavor was right .  Coleslaw has blue cheese in them.  First time meet this flavor combination and LOVED it.  Only critique is that the ribs and slaws are too salty for my taste.  It would be perfect if they used only half of the salt on the ribs, and half of the blue cheese in the coleslaw.  Al

A hidden gem! Brisket was amazing! If you don't want to wait in line at Franklin, this food truck is a great second without even feeling like it. Arrived at around 11:30 and waited a total of 30 min in the line and ago receive the food. Will definitely be going back. They don't have a beef rib but they make up for it with the brisket and yummy bbq sauce!

Had my first time at Kerlin BBQ today for lunch. Ordered the brisket, hot sausage, and a pulled pork frito pie. The brisket was good, wish it had more of a punch with the rub, but had both point & flat and were very tender and tasty. Sausage was really good and had a nice kick. Frito pie was really good as well, the pork was nice and peppery topped with cheese and pico, very tasty very good. The sides were different, but in a good way, blue cheese cole slaw was dang good, just enough blue cheese flavor to give it that "different" taste from everyone else, other good thing was the slaw was still crisp.Merlin's I'm still salty about you guys beating us out at the cookoff in Wimberley a few years back.

Brisket kolache (5 stars): tender chopped smoky brisket, just enough cheese to keep it moist, and lovely soft bun with just a touch of sweetness. The outside of the bun was just a little crispy, and we were very impressed with the high filling to dough ratio. I was afraid it would be way too much dough but it was just thin enough to hold it all together. Add on their tangy hot sauce and I'm already dreaming about getting another oneService is super nice. Waited about 30 min at 11am Saturday, but there was a food tour group there as well so not sure if this is a normal wait time. Lots of outdoor seating

I'm working in Austin this weekend. But I'm going to enjoy some "Damn Good BBQ" too. Texas makes you salivate for good smoked meats. In my search and asking locals a couple recommendations keep repeating. "You got to try Kerlin BBQ". You won't wait an hour and a half and you get some of the best damn BBQ in Austin. Tucked behind the Shell Gas station on E Cesar Chavez St (East of the 35), is a trailer, picnic tables and the smell of BBQ smoke.Kerlin quickly established itself as a serious player 6 yrs ago and have the accolades to prove it. Arizona transplants, Bill and Amelis Kerlin, started as backyard enthusiasts before hitting the competition scene and taking home a grand prize on there first outing. They embrace Central TX tradition with a standard post-oak wood smoke and then amp it up with quality Prime Angus beef. They also have some great Pork Belly Burnt Ends with really great flavor. I decided to build myself my own platter to sample some of the tasty things on the menu. One of those is a kolache, typically a Czech / Hungarian pastry. In Texas this is a staple in some barbecue joints. I've never had it before, but being part Czech I wasn't about to skip the opportunity. Basically a bread pocket filled with meat and plenty of flavor. I chose the sausage, cheddar cheese and jalapenos. All I can say is I can't wait to try the other meats. I hear the brisket kolache is the bomb! My platter;Smoked Prime Angus BrisketPork Belly Burnt EndsBeef Hot LinkSmoked Mexican corn on the cobSausage, Pickled jalapeños and cheese kolachePickles and onions@kerlinbbq #bbq #barbeque #smoked #brisket #beef #macncheese #kolaches #pork #burntends #Austin

We visited Kerlin's as part of the Austin Eats food tour. Best bbq ever. Ribs were amazing, slide off the bone. Little cheese and meat sandwiches (I forgot the name) melted in the mouth. Short to no wait, and like other bbq in Austin, they close when they sell out for the day.

Fantastic spot. Ribs possibly the best of the five joints sampled over 3 days.Brisket comes in after Franklin and ties with Lockhart Smokehouse.Ribs have Super crisp bark lacquered with a sweet sauce mellowing out the chuncks of pepper flakes and salt.Tables arranged under a tent on a cement slab with paper towels and BBQ sauce along with white bread and extra plates if necessary. Walk up to the trailer and place an order - credit cards thankfully accepted - leave a tip add some side and pickles and onions, grad a seat. When your name is called, it's time to grab your meat, have a seat and mow some of the finest smoked meat in Central Texas.

This is true hidden gem. Food truck with a permanent location and some benches. Parking is tricky. Skip the line at la bbq across the street and come here instead. This is the real deal. Also, the kolaches are probably the best in Austin- but sell out fast.

I tried Kerlin on saturday morning just by chance. I went to Vercruz for tacos and didnt even realize Kerlin was right next door. I had heard good things about it and figured i had to sample their bbq. To be fair i didnt get much food but what i did have was solid. The brisket was well done, rendered beautifully and well seasoned. it was a well rounded piece of smoked meat. (A-) the sausage was a bit disappointing. the menu said they were hot links which makes me think they would be fatty and coarsely ground and snappy exterior, but none of these were true. (B-) We also tried all 3 kolaches with the pulled pork and the brisket kolache really stealing show the hear. It was very well proportioned, not too bready and not overly stuffed. i loved these options for lunch/breakfast (A) I didnt try anything else but the pulled pork and ribs looked solid as well. There was no line at all when they opened which is always a huge plus when dealing with this type of high end bbq. Id happily swing by again for more(A-,B+)

I was very impressed!  It was Mother's Day amd my wife had a craving for a BBQ sandwich.  We were near downtown do tried to go to La BBQ.  There was a 1.5 hour wait at 11:30 am on Sunday.  No thanks. It cannot be that good (or that much better than other good places).  So we Yelped around for a close good place and found Kerlin.  We were very glad we did.  It is run out of trailer with separate smoker room.  It has covered outdoor seating as well as a store nearby where you can buy beer to go with ur BBQ (or they have Mexican Coke and other drinks).We all ordered variations on the sliced brisket sandwich.  I had coleslaw on mine.  Brisket was excellent!  Tender, smokey and flavorful (extra moist).  Also sauce was good, a bit of sweet, spice and vinegar.  Side dishes were awesome and creative.  One proprietor is Mexican or Latin American and she brings el sabor.  Like Mexican street corn on cob, cream corn with bacon, a creative potato salad and more!  They also have BBQ Frito Pie, ribs, turkey, sausage, etc.Definitely check them out. Don't you dare wait 1.5 hrs for any meal (life is too short), especially BBQ.  They were friendly, no waiting (though they had many customers).  Viva BBQ! Viva Kerlin!!

My friend, Carter, is a brisket snob, just like me, but he takes it up a notch to nerd level. I'm not kidding. He has a brisket spreadsheet. We fairly routinely meet for lunch and try new barbecue joints. The other day, I was wanting some good brisket and Carter suggested trying Kerlin's. I didn't really want to risk bad barbecue, but gave it a shot anyway. I was very pleasantly surprised. I had the sausage, beef rib and brisket. That beef rib was on point!  Nice crust, good smokey flavor and just the right amount of salt, and tender...so, so tender. The sausage was also really good. Firm texture with a mild spicy, peppery flavor. The brisket, the measure by which Texas barbecue is judged, was near perfect. Good bark, nice balance of smoke, seasoned well and tender. It was moist, but not quite as moist as Franklin's (my gold standard).  That didn't take away from the experience. I still thoroughly enjoyed it and Carter gave it a thumbs up, too.

The burnt ends are some of the best I've ever had. Literally amazing, When I used to smoke my own bbq, my goal was to make it just like theirs. Sadly I never accomplished that feat. But luckily for me, Kerlin's was right down the street (along with Scotties, Micklethwait, Franklin's, La BBQ). If I had to rank them, I'd go with La BBQ, Franklins, Kerlin, Micklethwait, and Scotties.  Although this list could change any day depending on my mood, if just ordering the burnt ends, I would rank Kerlin above Franklins, but when factoring in everything, Franklins would beat out Kerlins.

I'm a long time customer of this great barbecue.  I was having dinner for 14 last night and Amelie, one of the owners, suggested I order about 1/2 pound per person.  Amelie had a full brisket ready and suggested she not cut it since it would not be served for a few hours.  She said the brisket, delivered wrapped in butcher paper and foil, would keep best at low heat in the oven with a small pan of water at the bottom.I followed Amelie's instructions and followed her thoughts on the proper slicing to the letter.  Everyone gathered round this gorgeous brisket to watch the process.  I presumed I would be cutting away some fat, but there was no waste, not one crumb.  The mix of moist and lean was perfect.  Almost everyone requested some of each.      The guests are still contacting me today to tell me that was the best dinner they had had this season and by far the best bbq.  The slice at home brisket route was a really fun way to feed a group.  Can't wait for the next event.

It was good, but I guess the reviews made me expect much more. We tried almost everything. Brisket was delicious, ribs were alright, kerlache was ok and sides were small. Pulled pork sandwich was good, too.

This place is good. It's a food truck with the ability to sit in a shaded area. Just stopped by to get some brisket and sausage. The brisket was nice and juicy, sausage was on point I really enjoyed it and so did the kids. I would come back

We stopped by late morning on a weekend and there were no lines - yeah!   The food was very good.    The Brisket, Cheddar Kolach was memorable - I am still thinking about it.    We also had the Brisket and the Ribs which were also good.   There was something different in the BBQ sauce (mustard seed?).  Whatever it was it was delicious.   (Sauce is served on the side).  The trailer is parked in a lot.  Outdoor seating only (picnic tables), with shade.

Great food and service! Not sure what we liked best as it was all good! We had planned to go to another bbq place but the line was so long that we went with our Plan B which will now be our Plan A whenever we are in Austin!

The best BBQ I had the 3 days I was in Austin! To be honest, Kerlin was bookmarked but was not the first choice that day because la Barbecue's line was crazy long and slow. So happy we made the decision to walk over. Kerlin was celebrating their 3 year anniversary that day. Lucky us, because there was free cold beer, live music and most importantly the food was amazing. I was super excited for the ribs but the person ahead of me ordered for like 6 people. Ran out of everything!! "NO RIBS"!! Waiting in the storm and having the person in-front of me crossed out 4 things on the board I wanted, broke my heart. But that wasn't going to stop me from ordering. Brisket: Perfectly cooked and seasoned. Extremely tender and moist with peppery bark. Pork Shoulder Sandwich: Meaty, smokey, tasty and full of flavor. It just melts in your mouth. The best I ever had. Sausages Kolache: So yummy. With melted cheese inside a toasted closed bun. Jalapeno Dill Potato Salad: Light but very flavorful. A hit of spice but not spicy. Very refreshing. BBQ Sauce: It's free on the tables. SO YUMMY! I wish I could have brought some to go. So much flavor!Nothing to complain about and the people are super friendly. They also pass out watermelon cups that day. They are great!!

We tried to go to another BBQ food truck (Micklethwait Craft Meats) at 1pm but we waited in line for 30 minutes and watched them put "sold out" for half the meats. We instead decided to come here because previous reviews had said "no wait." It was the BEST decision! We walked right up to no line and got the chopped brisket sandwich and pork belly burnt ends (a MUST get). There's also quite a good number of tables that had a shaded awning over them and there was a live band as well. There's limited parking so we parked about five minutes away in the neighborhood.
Amazing Kolaches! Beef and cheddar is the best! The straight up brisket is also one of the best in town!

I am a 72 year old Austin Native; born in East  Austin and Raised inSouth Austin. I've enjoyed fabulous Barbeque in Austin, Elgin, Driftwood ,Lockhart ,Llano .... The premium brisket plate I was served today at Kerlins was as delicious as any I have ever eaten!  Wow, really Fabulous!  So says Old Bill Pool

This is my favorite place.Amalis makes it feel like family. We had to take a deep breath at the old location to find the new location-a great spot. We didn't get our usual frito pie but the brisket sandwich and took kolaches home for breakfast. All this food is always amazing- sides have Amalis's creative twist and like I said the truck feels like family in and outside the truck.

We went here because La Barbecue had a 4-6 hour wait. I wouldn't call myself a BBQ connoisseur, so maybe La BBQ really is THAT good, but in my opinion, just go to Kerlin. It was so good. Ribs were juicy and tender, brisket was delicious, corn was fantastic... everything about our meal was perfect. I was so glad we went here instead of waiting for la BBQ.

Came from Southern California on a food tour. We have also tried Coopers, La BBQ, Terry Blacks, Salt Lick and one other bbq food truck. We tried the sandwich thing idk what it's  called, brisket and ribs. Hands down this was the best out of all the other Austin Bbq places we went to!
Taylor, TX 76574

A relative of mine visits periodically from the east coast. Prior to each trip to the South Texas area he researches smokehouses for Dino beef ribs. Many beef ribs have been devoured over the years and with great pleasure. He has yet to find any smokehouse that tops Louie Mueller's beef ribs

Visited Friday with several family members for a later lunch and were there just in time, we were wanting to sit outside but they closed the patio as we were waiting in line due to almost sold out of meat..by the time we ordered, they had 3 lbs of brisket which we bought a pound of and we did get the last 3 pork ribs which was delicious..our sides were outstanding..coleslaw had a lot of pepper which gave it extra zing as did the Mac and cheese. Potato salad was some of the better I've had. They sold out while we were eating and so they had to unlock doors for those of us still inside. Delicious as usual and will definitely be returning..

Louie Mueller is a historic and classic BBQ stop that we had to visit while we were in Texas. We arrived early on a Saturday morning and were one of the first people in line. Louie Mueller is located in a building right in town. We actually drove past it. I just love that you can visit these town in Texas and have world class BBQ. When they opened it was extra special treat to see Wayne Mueller himself. We were a bit starstruck. The smoke stained walls just add to the experience as you walk in. With so many options we had to limit our order. So we selected a beef rib and some ribs. Thankfully when we placed our order we were given a sample of their brisket which was very good. We have learned to love the beef ribs and the beef rib here was fantastic. One of the best that we had in Texas. Great bark, smoky flavor and velvety smooth. You could cut it with a plastic fork. Just outstanding! The pork ribs were good. Not great but good. Maybe eating that beef rib first ruined us as I would eat that beef rib 8 days a week. We really enjoyed Louie Mueller BBQ and would definitely come back to try some other items or maybe just order more beef ribs!

While on our way to central Texas we passed through the town of Taylor. It had been quite a few years since I've been here, but you can't come through Taylor without stopping for some good Texas BBQ at Louie Mueller's!!! It's been here for years and is now in the capable hands of his son Wayne Mueller. We stopped in and apparently they had only been open for a couple of days after being closed like so many other places due the Covid situation that continues to haunt us all. We were met at the counter by a very nice assistant and she took our order. We started off asking for one pound of moist and lean brisket. I also got one of their huge beef ribs! We asked for half a rack of pork ribs because that's what my wife is all about, but they were out!!! She them asked about some sliced turkey and they were out of that too!! The counter assistant then offered up some pulled pork which my wife loves too which they had, so we got that and some smoked sausage. We got our drinks and sat down at table where there were windows in the section over from the kitchen. They got our order ready and I picked it up from the counter. The brisket was way better than I remember the last time!!! The beef rib was really good and tender and pulled off the bone!! My wife had new try some of the pulled pork. I was REALLY impressed with their pulled pork!!! It had to be some of the best I've ever tried here in Texas! The sausage was really good too. I loved the ambience and the friendliness of the staff. They did take time to explain that they were not really back up to speed yet do to just re-opening and just not having a lot of customers yet! I can accept that. The place has been there a long time and had a lot of old antique stuff on display that had been used there at one time or another. An old cash register and an old sausage press being a couple of the items. It was a really good experience even without the pork ribs and Turkey and well be back!!! On a sad note, the Taylor Cafe, another Taylor BBQ place just around the corner run by the legendary Vencil Mares was closed. Mr. Vencil Mares a World War 2 veteran who had owned and ran the place since around 1947 or 1948 recently passed away and his business didn't look to be open anymore.

Is it worth the drive to a tiny town? To wait in line? Go for the beef rib. Pack up your crew, commit to pay the $40-50 per rib, decide to share with a friend, and order the rib... You'll just need one, you'll just need that.The sides are terrible. The sauce is average. The brisket is fine. The turkey is good. The beef rib is what makes this place legendary--and for good reason. It is spectacular. You WILL have the meat sweats when you leave. You probably won't care.I'll be honest, I'm unabashedly a lover of the sauce and sides at a BBQ joint (I know it should be all about the meat... but it just isn't for me; hate all you want), but this is a place for one thing--beef rib.

We visited this location in hopes that we would get some great barbecue.  We ordered the brisket, ribs, and sausage.  The brisket was dry and we had to cut it with a knife to eat it.  The ribs were chewy and bland.  The sausage was the only thing that saved this trip.Wherever they get their meat from, must be the same supplier as Blacks in Lockhart.  Very poor quality of meat.I agree with other reviewers on how slow the service was.  It took us 30 minutes to order with only 20 people in front us when we arrived.  This is not a place I will visit again.

The food is always amazing at Louie Mueller Barbecue.  Are you going to wait in line? Yes you are. So what, spend the time talking to your family or friends that you came with. Heck take a deep breath to calm your nerves and get to know the people in line in front or back of you. We always meet new people and have great conversations. I love the line specifically for this reason! In a time where everyone is in a hurry, Mueller's line reminds us to slow down and  pay attention to those around us. Get out of your comfort zone and meet someone new. It's fun and it could change your life!Now let's talk food. The brisket and beef ribs are amazingly and consistently moist and delicious and are my faves.  The sausage is perfectly seasoned and the smoked turkey is the perfect option if you want a lean meat with excellent flavor.  Don't forget dessert, the cobbler is to die for!Next, let's discuss  the "feel" of the restaurant.  I love the historic building and even the heat in the summer.  It reminds me of times past. The smoky smell and echo of voices bring a strange sense of familiarity back from my childhood. Creaky wooden floors,soda in a bottle, and a  screen door take you back to a simpler time.  After you order and get your food you can step into the cool dining room and enjoy your barbecue or stay in the main dining room and simply enjoy your delicious meal. Bottom line:If you hate the line and want to complain, then just go somewhere else, this place isn't for your kind.  If you enjoy people, great food, and traditional small town ambiance get yourself over to Taylor and enjoy some great food and fun! You won't be disappointed.

Be prepared as with most BBQ in Texas you will be in line for a long time. I don't mind as long a you are moving along a a good pace. This was not the case here. Each customer takes 10-15 minutes here. Only Wayne Mueller (glaring and frowning the whole time) himself cut each piece of meat. Three hours to get food is too much. Maybe work on improving the assembly line piece so the line is moving at least a little bit at a time. The beef rib was the best I have had, the sausage and pickles very good! Brisket was ok. However, the coleslaw and beans needed some work on the flavor. Too bland. We drove 2.5 hours to try here, don't know that we would again.
One of the many legendary BBQ joints in Texas. The ribs and pulled pork were spot on. However, the sides were very bland - costing the joint a star.
Taylor, TX 76574

Louie mueller BBQ, Taylor Texas often referred to as the "citadel of smoke"The brisket that started Aaron Franklins, la barbecue (grand daughter) and many more. The pulled pork was nice. The sausage had a good peppery bite bit did not care for the casing. The beans were nice and Smokey and the peach cobbler is the best I've ever eaten!However, sadly, the star of the show (BRISKET) was only good. It was flavorful and tender. BUT nowhere near as juice as Franklins, Kreuz Market or my queen of the Brisket la barbecue! I expected more.

Came on a scorching hot Saturday afternoon around 130 and was pleasantly surprised to find the line was not out the door. It took us about an hour to be served and just narrowly missed the last beer rib. They were getting pretty close to running out of brisket by the time we ordered. Overall it was one of the best bbq meals I've had in Texas, well worth the 40m drive out of Austin. The brisket had phenomenal flavor and probably the biggest smoke ring I've ever seen. The moist brisket was melt in your mouth soft and the lean maintained a fantastic smokiness. The pulled pork was so good it almost made us forget we missed out on the beef ribs. The sweet peppery sauce was incredible and I liked that it had some nice big chunks of meat as opposed to the usual thinner texture. The sausage was more jalapeño forward than other spicy sausages I've had in Texas in a very good way, but was a distant third behind the brisket and pork. The sides were both solid but nothing to write home about. The 2$ home made ice cream also made a perfect ending to the meal on a hot summer day. If you're looking for a short bbq road trip out of Austin I'd highly recommend making the drive

Ehh...ok bbq.Had the brisket and turkey.  Turkey was pretty good, the brisket was a little dry and tough.  Not great.  Had slaw, potato salad, and beans.  All of the sides good, but nothing special. The service was terrible slow.  I honestly don't know how they could be any slower.  Complete disregard, almost contempt, for their patrons time.  Note the two photos from the line....taken 20 minutes apart.  Needless to say I will not be going back

Louie has a different flavor than Austin BBQ. The brisket is slightly lighter in flavor (more St Louis style in terms of method of cooking), but extremely tender and pairs well with the sides. Sides have slightly stronger flavor, like the Mac n cheese having green hatch Chiles or jalapeños in it (it was also creamy, imagine an over easy egg in comparison to over medium for consistency) Some places have very thick Mac n cheese and not as much actual flavor besides cheese because it pairs well with the stronger meat. It's a different approach and enjoyable experience. It is in the top 10 bbq places for me in Central Texas and possibly top 5. You can go home without feeling like going into a food coma. Great experience. Go on a Wednesday afternoon.

This place is absolutely delicious and awesome. The beef ribs are a freakin' must try!!! So dang good.   Beef brisket was excellent as well.   The sides were only okay, nothing special.   The beef ribs are the best I have eaten.  I recommend the trip to this place.  Lines can get a little long but not too bad.   About 1 hour or so.    Definitely recommend this place and will return!! Come get some BBQ!!!!

Drove from Houston to eat here yesterday. Gotta say, VERY disappointed. We arrived at 12pm, and the line barely wrapped around the corner of the building. We figured that we would wait an hour or an hour and a half, but no. We waited for two and a half hours to order and get our food.Once inside, we saw the operations of the restaurant were just poorly organized. Staff were standing around chatting away, while people stood in line and hardly moved over 30 minute intervals. The main reason why? The owner, who makes the BBQ, is the ONLY person cutting the meat. A line that should take roughly 20-30 minutes to order and receive your food took AN HOUR!!Our food was fair. It wasn't anything special, and it was by no means worth the wait or the price tag. We'd caution all to avoid this establishment until ownership can get its act together in terms of streamlining its workflow and hiring the appropriate staff for a smooth experience. This place is an example of what happens when someone can cook, but doesn't know how to operate a business.Stay. Away. We won't be back.

We stopped here just before 2pm for lunch on a Friday. Central Texas BBQ is world-renowned, and this establishment is always mentioned in the upper echelons. Curious to give it a try.The beef brisket & pork ribs are rather hard for me to describe, imagine the most buttery pot roast you have ever eaten but smoked. Dang, right sinful! I had my heart on the sausage link & pulled pork sandwich but unfortunately after waiting in line for 20 minutes they were all sold out...it was a busy morning for them.  So we both settled on what they had left. When you order a staff member asks how many in your party, then the meat cutter walks up with many little chunks of brisket/meat for you to sample and then takes your order. We ordered 1/2 lb of beef brisket, 1/2 lb of pork ribs and beef brisket sandwich. There's not a whole lot of sides to choose from. Potato salad, cole slaw and pinto beans. I didn't love their beans or their potato salad... fairly basic and not a lot of flavour. Final rating... A-Ok!We are newly Austin transplants and still pretty much  learning all kinds of Texas BBQ. Here's what I've learned about Louie Mueller BBQ in Taylor; their motto is 9 parts pepper and 1 part salt, so it has a bite. Moist, tender, and good smokey flavour... it wasn't heavy nor overwhelming. They use oak wood for smoke to achieved that.Forewarned, if you don't like pepper rub chances are you won't like this. Good smoked BBQ comes with a price tag as well, so keep that in mind folks.Everyone was nice and helpful. Parking is plentiful around the establishment, and they have a large sized indoor main dining room with an attached sunroom type eating area with a covered patio. I loved the atmosphere. I had my heart set at visiting Franklin's BBQ in downtown Austin but there's always a multi-hour wait, and since I heard Aaron Franklin learned to cook from Louie Mueller, why not just visit the best.  A plus...only had to wait about 20 minutes.  "Barbecue is not a matter of chance; but a matter of choice."--unknown

Always wanted to go to this well known James Beard award winning Texas bbq restaurant for their renowned brisket. As my wife and I have smoked a number of briskets ourselves in Hawaii and her family in and from Texas have smoked meats for years, I wanted to see what this place had to offer.Unfortunately, we were both very disappointed by the taste, which was just ok but also that it was served at room temperature and basically not hot which is how I like my food served.We ordered 1/2 lbs of brisket, 2 sausage links, one spare rib just to try, one serving each of coke slaw and potato salad, and two drinks, ice tea and a bottle is soda. It came with a small dish of Some sort of broth. Cost $37.The brisket as I said was basically served cold as was the sausage links. Brisket tasted just ok and the sausage was over cooked and dry as well as cold. The spare rib was warmer as it was taken out of the smoke box, but not hot. Ok flavor. Worst were the sides.  Both were both awful. Cole slaw tastes like pepper & mayo and unpalatable. Potato salad was heavy mustard & pepper and no better. Think we ate 1/3 of it just kept trying to see if it got better. It didn't.  Didn't know what the side broth was or what it was for. Never got an explanation or instruction. Assumed it was a dipping sauce. It didn't help the meat as there was little flavor in it and wasn't hot.Their bbq sauces were decent. Wife liked the Jalapeño one and I liked sweet one. Only saving grace.  That and the ambiance was very unique.In the end, We didn't finish the meats and tossed most of the side dishes we didn't finish. We will not be coming back here ever again. Too many good bbq joints I've experienced that are good and when I come all the way to Texas for Authentic bbq, I expect a whole lot more. Sad to say I've made better brisket then I had here.  Honestly.

Went on a Wednesday afternoon.  Small crowd.  Lunch order took too long to fill.  Apparently it was training day.  Moist brisket and the jalapeno sausage gives this place high marks.  Frito pie and the sides take points away.  Not to mention the fact there are beer signs everywhere but they do not serve beer!!  Also, I shouldn't have to pay $53 dollars for lunch.  Just think 28 dollars a pound for brisket is a bit high.
Taylor, TX 76574

Driving in from Austin to try all the award winning bbq places in the area. Like most good bbq places there will be a line. What sets Mueller apart is how unconsciously and ridiculously and artificially slow the line goes. Like 5 minutes for every order. If you are the first in line no problems, if you are 40th in line do the math. We ordered the lean brisket, sausage link, pork ribs, cole slaw, Mac and cheese and peach cobbler. First off, this is a pepper dominated place. Nearly everything had pepper, and a LOT of pepper. First the 1lb of "lean brisket" that was ordered.  Easily half of the weight (as seen in the picture) was a fat cap that was not removed or had not been rendered.  15$ for fat that would not be eaten.  The pork ribs the pepper dominated and covered the flavor of the pork.  The sausage, only major flavor, pepper. Cole slaw was not memorable at all, a menu afterthought.  The meat, hatch pepper Mac and cheese was good, but again, pepper. Peach cobbler was good and luckily was absent of pepper.  If you don't like pepper, avoid. If you don't like stupid slow lines, avoid. If you don't like having half of your paid price for brisket being fat, avoid.  As for the historical aspect of the squeaking floors and old Texas feel to the building, ok. As for the bbq, better places to be found.

All, the bbq is good BUT be warned if you go on Saturday it is SLOW AS HELL!!!!!!!!! We are standing in line for 90 min and we got here when it opened. They are very inefficient in the way they take orders and it is no where near optimized. Bring a cot! It will take a while

Don't know what happened here but this place has gone downhill. I used to consider it one of the top ten BBQ joints in Texas. Not anymore. I had the pork ribs which used to be exceptional. This time they were undercooked. Even worse was what has become of the rub. Previously one of the best, it's now a straight blast of cumin and not much else. Very, very disappointing and sad to see how far Louie's has fallen.

This place has my favorite Brisket of all time. Great seasoning and meat to fat ratio. Super juicy and tender that will have you forgetting about other briskets you've had in your life.Beef Ribs here are huge! No wonder they are also known as "Dino Ribs". It has a solid rub a tad on the saltier side. Very tender beef with great smoked flavor. Although many people claim that the beef ribs here are one of the best, I would have to disagree. They are not far behind #1 for me, but check out my other reviews to find out where has the best Beef Ribs. As for sides, I only had the potatoe salad and it was good, but nothing to rave about.Come for the brisket, leave with smile.

Truly don't know why this is a highly ranked place!  Their brisket doesn't pass the Pull Test.  Their cole slaw had just mayo in it.  Cole slaw has zero flavor.  Mac & cheese was runny and reminded me of a school cafeteria.  The sauce that comes with the meat is nothing but oily and tasteless.  Gross!  Not worth the drive here!!  Bill Millers BBQ is way better!  Also, they have the most inefficient method of getting customers through the food and order line.  We won't be back!

GET THE SAUSAGE!!!! Best bbq sausage I've ever had. Totally worth the drive from Dallas for. I would rate this higher but there was some low points. The side of consume they give you is pretty worthless. I would just stop serving it with the food as it cheapens the food. The beeb ribs, which they have all week, were really good! Well seasoned, juicy and smoked to perfection. I would not recommend the pork ribs. They were dry, and kind of flavorless. Next time i go, I'm getting a plate full of sausage and nothing else!
Old-school authentic Texas BBQ brisket and sides. The brisket , beef rib and sides are the stand-outs, just be prepared to mortgage the house, as really good doesn't cone cheap.

In town for work and had to try my taste buds for this place. Located in a lively oLd downtown, you are welcomed by what looks like the buildings original screen doors. The aroma gets your taste buds watering. I ordered brisket, sausage link and a rib. Having to travel throughout Texas, this trio was hands down in my top 5 bbq. If you are ever near this place, please do your taste buds and stomach a favor. Enjoy......

Prepare to wait in a long line, but I promise the wait is worth it. This is my favorite BBQ spot in central Texas. The brisket is the best I have had. Visiting this place is like stepping back in time.
Taylor, TX 76574

Definitely a Mecca of Meat. If you want to try some of the best BBQ meat in Texas, this is your spot. It is written up consistently because this is as good as it gets and they have been doing it for a long time.The brisket is worth trying so you know what an upper echelon BBQ joint produces. The bark is thick on this, so it will be a kick in the head of sodium and pepper. The BBQ sauce isn't worth writing home about (even in the cheap world of e-mail). So, pass on that.I also had one Beef Rib. This makes you feel like Fred Flintstone. It is LARGE. Again, it is thick on the rub so don't eat this if you are taking heart medications. If you aren't, this is some awesome meat. In fact, bring a cooler as you are going to have some left over. Really, you should think about sharing this with someone before arriving.The challenge is that this place has been so good for so long that the service kind of suffers. I felt like I was in the Soup episode of Seinfeld. They will bite on your head if you do anything out of order or act in any way like a rube. Just stay there in line and don't do anything until told. The service is definitely the type you get from a place that is world class and doesn't really give a rip if you never return. In fact I won't.Also, the sides are to pass on. I had the coleslaw and it was terrible! Well, you might like it but I was a pass. The onions were nice and sweat but the potato salad was a pass at best. In fact, stop at an HEB on your way in and just do a picnic with their meat.

I was in Taylor and after reading so much about Louie Mueller's, stopped in for lunch today.  The BBQ was pretty good, but it wasn't the best I've had in Texas!On top of that were the prices.  $25.00 per pound for beef ribs and $21.00 per pound for brisket seems a bit strong.  This was cut at the counter and served immediately, unfortunately the dining room ventilation consisted of a large fan - no air conditioning.  I get that this is an old building, but it's gotten hot in Texas in July for a long time as well!All in all, maybe I just expected too much.

This is a transcendent experience. It's one of the holy grails of Texas BBQ. Brisket fatty is some of the best in texas, and their beef rib is next level. I was also pleasantly surprised by the turkey.

My husband and I were in Taylor running an errand and were craving barbecue, and I had heard of Louie Mueller's, so we stopped by! It was Monday at lunch time and the line wasn't too long. For those complaining about having to wait, that is simply part of the experience at these types of establishments. You order and get your food at the counter without waiting AND you get to let your mouth water while you watch them cut your meat. If you are in a hurry, then come by another time. We got 1/2 lb of mixed brisket, 2 sausage links, 1/2 pint of beans, baked potato with turkey and 2 drinks for $42 with tax. My husband is a barbecue snob and he loved everything. The ladies taking orders were super friendly and hooked it up! Will be back soon and recommend!
Omg so good. Always friendly. So glad y'all are open again. The place has the best brisket I've ever had. The Frito pies are delicious. Must stop and try.

Came here Labor Day weekend. We were so excited to try this place. When we arrived the line didn't look too long but it took a while to get our food. The main dining  room was stifling hot like you were in a sauna. The room to the side was a little cooler with fans but no AC to be had here. My 8 year old daughter complained the entire time and I don't blame her. You can't enjoy your meal in the heat. As for the food, it's just meh. Not really bad but not great either. The baby back ribs tasted a little odd. Perhaps it was the chili powder? I don't know, but it didn't taste like bbq. The brisket had little to no Smokey flavor. There wasn't even a smoke ring on it. The sausage was just sausage ....nothing exciting. The biggest disappointment was the beef ribs. It was dried out from being over cooked. The meet was so stringy. We Ordered 2 ribs and could only stomach one rib between 3 adults.  We all left disappointed with no desire to ever come back.
I rate my bbq joints on the beef rib. AMAZING. No sauce is needed. Great pepper. Delicious.  The moist brisket is great, too.

Outstanding all around.  I had the beef rib. A bit pricey but damn was it great.  Sides were some of the best ever. Hatch chili Mac cheese.  Tater salad. And desserts were off the chain.  Banana pudding had nothing artificial at all and peach cobbler was solid as hell.
Very good bbq food Brisket was juicy and tender The ribs are really good too Great overall restaurant Friendly staff
Taylor, TX 76574

Very long wait time. Not impressed with the barbecue! My husband was eager for us to drive 2 hours to come here, and said it was comparable to another Texas favorite of ours "Truth bbq". It was nothing like it. They do not have wine in the ice bucket. Truth has wine. It was very hot inside too. Not worth the wait.My husband had the beef rib, coleslaw, and beans. I had the turkey breast. The sides I tasted were all very ordinary, the turkey was pretty good but nothing to write home about(I wouldn't make the drive for it again)! My husband says the beef rib was "fantastic"!If you do happen to go to this establishment and fall in love, they have nationwide shipping! Enjoy!

This is exactly what we were expecting to see, feel and smell when seeking out an authentic barbecue joint in Texas. The tiny town of Taylor, TX is home to Louie Mueller Barbecue. They hold a James Beard Award so you know everything about this place has to be good, right!?!? Right! All of the meat is smoked inside which gives a beautiful haze of smoke in the restaurant and delicious smell. While looking over the menu on the wall, one of the pit masters gives you samples of the brisket while you order. You can choose fatty or lean brisket. In my opinion, get both. The brisket was smoked to perfection, crusty on the outside, juicy on the inside and had just enough fat. We also ordered a beef rib which was huge. It was also very tender and delicious but I don't think I'd order it again unless I'm sharing it with multiple people. The smoked sausage was really good as well but the skin was a little bit tough, which is expected when smoking it for so long. My husband loved the coleslaw but there was a flavor that made it not my favorite, but it was still good. The beans were also very good. It did come with pickles and onions and soft white bread. They also give you cups of sauce as well as sauces on the table to use. We ordered peach cobbler for dessert which also didn't disappoint. The staff was very friendly! The bathrooms and building are very clean and rustic. I really loved this place and will be back the next time we go to Texas.

Been wanting to try this place and it was the only one around the area that is open on mondays. Made a pit stop for lunch on the way to corpus christi. The brisket and ribs was good. Got a beef rib as well. Yum. Sausage was just ok.

Absolutely the best smoked brisket I've had yet in Texas!! I've been to Franklin in Austin and Snow's in Lexington, but Louie Mueller tops them both. The moist brisket melts in your mouth. The jalapeño sausage is phenomenal. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The line moves quickly. This is the definition of a central Texas smokehouse.

My wife and I decided to take a drive out to Taylor Texas, and eat a take out order of brisket sandwich, ribs, beans, and potato salad. We were very delighted on the service, food quailty, and prices. Hope to return again, and invite family and friends

Maybe I'm a little bit of a plain Jane when it comes to BBQ. I mean I like flavor but I like sweet. So being a basic Bea, I was not a fan. I ordered the ribs, chicken, sausage, and potato salad for us to try. I did like the sausage but wasn't a fan of the other meats. I think it was the dry rub. Everything taste like pepper. That's it. It was tender but it was just a tender pepper rib. Once you enter, you can smell the BBQ smoke and it does smell so good. Oh their sweet tea is pretty darn good. That I give a 5star on that tea. More pricey than other BBQ spots also. I'm trying my options being out here in Texas. People suggests so many places and there's only so much bbq I can eat. But I'm glad I gave this place a try.

Garbage BBQ !!! As a bred, born, and raised, Texan, I know my bbq. I am a self-proclaimed professional BBQ Judge, and this was horrible !!! Brought my son in law here who was visiting from California, as he wanted some "Real Texas BBQ", not a chain. We stood in line for 1.5 hours, ordered 4 slices of brisket (garbage), two links of sausage (delicious), and a beef rib (alright). We also ordered two sides, and two drinks, for a grand total of $75 dollars !!! Not worth it. I asked for bbq sauce as the brisket needed some help, they brought me a container of basting sauce (very watery). We were so disappointed, especially after being in the Top Five of the Top Fifty for the Texas Monthly Magazine. We will NEVER return. A few days later I took my son in law to the Rudy's in Round Rock (all Rudy's are not the same), and he was blown away with their "Real Texas BBQ". Why 2 Stars ?? Delicious sausage links. That's all I've got to say about that.
Always great bbq in a classic location. Well worth the drive from Austin. We had brisket, pork ribs,, and sausage and are were up in top bbq placed in Central Texas

So this week I had the privilege of visiting the cathedral of smoke.  As a BBQ aficionado this visit should have come sooner.  The setting is fantastic, part saloon part the Notre Dame of smoke.  Behind the counter are these beautiful, brick built in  pieces of bbq history.  This is where our current BBQ world started, a pillar of influence to the BBQ world.   The staff were lovely, with smiles on their faces welcomed my order.   All the items (brisket, ribs, link, potato salad) were fantastic. You just can't go wrong.  Make the trip and relish being in this historic establishment.
The bbq was so good! I haven't had bbq this good in so long! I wish I had a picture but I ate it to fast

This is my boyfriend's favorite barbecue in Austin, he is obsessed with their frito pie! I was more into their chicken and brisket and cheese sandwich plus the beans made with brisket were super good. I wasn't too big of a fan of the sausage, but that's probably just me. Love supporting local businesses! They were also super nice and oh yeah they have big red yessss a bbq must!

Really good BBQ!  My husband had the dry rub ribs and I had the Maverick sandwich-  brisket and  pulled chicken with red sauce, onions, cheddar cheese and jalapeños- along with a side of their peppery cabbage.  This truck is located in the Rosewood area in a food park.  The couple at the bench across from us raved on the potato salad.  We wanted to try their Buji lemonade but they serve items until they run out- and it was out.  More reasons to go back Food total about $29 before tip.

This is the best barbecue I've had in Austin, period.  That INCLUDES Franklin's.  I tried this place for the first time last weekend, and I am *so* glad that I tried it.  It's two blocks from Franklin's-a little black trailer surrounded by some tables and one or two other food trucks.We had two sandwiches just to try the BBQ.  I had "The Texan", which included baby back rib meat, brisket and potato chips on a bun.  My boyfriend had the pulled pork sandwich.  Both were EXCELLENT, but we both liked the Texan better.  You HAVE to try this place.  Best thing?  NO LINE.  Also-it's black-owned, which is one reason why we decided to try it. However, I don't care if it is purple Martian owned.  I'd eat here again, and again.

OH MY GOD. I think this is my favorite BBQ in Austin. It's a food truck on 11th, and it's 2 blocks down from Franklin's BBQ. However, I have to say-I like this better than Franklin's, and their prices are better!!  This is a black owned business.  Now on to the food..  We ordered the Texan sandwich and a pulled pork sandwich.  We both agreed we liked the Texan better, but we would be happy with the pulled pork too.  We unfortunately did not get dessert (they didn't have them at the time)  or sides, but I definitely plan to try them next time.  Service was very good.  Seating is typical outdoor seating with wood picnic tables under a tent.  I  didn't even eat HALF my sandwich. Leftovers await!! Thank you, J Leonardi's.  Austinites-go!

Delicious! What a surprise find! Came here on July 4th with a last minute brisket craving and   For reference, la Barbeque and Franklins are my favs and this place now ranks up there. They were already sold out of all sides so I didn't get to try them this time.

The hardest part about leaving this review is deciding which was my favorite item! A++ customer service,  amazing gentleman provided some delicious samples. We order some to eat there and another order to go.  Everything was packaged separately and in quality containers, honestly I was just blown away by the attention to detail.The barbecue was delicious!!  Plus the portions are huge!  I kept saying I was full but I kept taking another bite :) The bonus to our experience, we were the last customers of the day so they threw in a few extra items for us.  I live in South Austin and I will gladly drive to this location the next time I'm craving bbq. You guys keep up the good work!!Your #1 fan on the Southside

We ended up coming here in search of BBQ while looking for an alternative after being turned down from Franklin's. I don't know how amazing Franklin's is, but I ended up happy and full, and waited a whole lot less time to fill my hungry belly. And they offered free beer to top it off!Cute little father-son business with excellent customer service. Tender meat with good sauce. Jalapeño corn was just the side we needed. Definitely recommend.
The bread is so fresh, and the brisket melts in your mouth - the sauce is amazing, too. Will come again, the chicken looked really good too.

My husband and I were looking for a place to eat with ribs, beef brisket,  sausage, and side dishes. We tried J Leonardi's. It's a food truck parked on a corner of 11th street in Austin.  Actually we were very apprehensive to eat anything from a food truck. They did not disappoint on any of there food. We had there brisket, ribs, sausage, potato salad and beans. My husband went back and ordered a to go of same for later. If I could give these young beginner entrepreneurs a +10 I would without hesitation.  If you are in the area this is a must try. Food and service was better then some restaurants we've eaten at. We are IN snow birds and for sure when we come back we will be eating and checking in with them. Truly a great place to eat and great owners/staff. Thank you for a great meal and talk.
Do not order online! I'm not sure this place is even open any more. I placed an order online, got charged, drove down and it was boarded up. Called, got no response.

Goodness gracious this was some good BBQ and I know good and well that my chances of finding BBQ like this in Philly is slim to none. I knew it was real when I seen the smoke pit behind the food truck.So it was a steaming hot day in texas and we had just got off the plane and was starving. We searched around this one nearby BBQ spot and they were sold out at like 4:00 in the afternoon so they told us to walk about 5 blocks to the food trucks. At first, I was skeptical about a BBQ food truck. I didn't realize that Austin is known for its food trucks but boy I was in for a treat.Simply delicious I ordered the two meet combo which was brisket, ribs, jalapeno corn and smoked cabbage. SMH it was heaven! The food had a good smoke, it was flavorful and tender. I would've had pictures if I wasn't so greedy. Overall it was 15.00 dollars and it lasted for two days. The owner is also pleasant and she teaches country line dancing!

I leave reviews across multiple platforms because I use multiple ones when checking.I hesitated to leave this review, but I'd be remiss not to share our experience. We're visiting ATX, and we heard positively wonderful things about this establishment. It came highly recommended, so we thought we would patronize black owned businesses during our stay in Austin. We perused the menu, decided to sample a few things like the Brisket Frito Pie and a few other things to get a taste, and we placed an online order. Nothing indicated the business wasn't open on July 15, 2020. The order went through perfectly fine, and we were even given a pickup location. We left our rental home and headed to the address given on the order. When we arrived, J. Leonardi was closed. We didn't see anyone around. Nothing was listed on the Facebook page or website indicating an early closure.  In fact, their website, Google, and even Facebook all said they would be open until 6 PM but online orders had to be received by 3:00 PM. We sent  in our order before the time. When we called the phone number while parked in front of a closed business, we were met with a prerecorded message stating they were at another location nearby. The message said 1149 1/2 Airport something which was different from the address given on the website. We went to that address, and there was another business there but not this one. When we drove back to the original location, we were told J. Leonardi was closed by another gentleman/business owner sitting down. I don't know if there was a failure to communicate, or if something unexpected happen, but we were less than impressed. We were left quite bemused because we were able to place an order, and no one called to say, "We're closed or not accepting orders." I guess our money was just going to be tied up or eventually refunded if they had ever realized it. Maybe not.I reached out via Facebook Messenger at 4:39 the same day, and it's now just past 48 hours. I haven't received a response. One thing I look for and actively seek is quality, A1 customer service and clear, concise communication. As a precautionary measure, the card used was canceled. My mom wasn't sure what was going on, but she felt like it was some funny business, and considering we didn't get an order but the transaction tried to clear yesterday or today like everything went through, I certainly understand how and why she feels that way.I really didn't want to leave a review like this because it's never my intent to leave bad reviews or hurt anyone's livelihood, but with the lack of response and no explanation regarding the other day or even an attempt to make amends, it was simply a must. I hope that this will help you improve and communicate with paying customers the next go round. I can honestly say I won't even try to place another order with your establishment because this experience has soured me and completely put me off.

It's my lucky day. Hungry at the front end of some errands and happened up on this truck on E. 11th Street. Sliced brisket sandwich (add pickles, onions, sauce) and potato salad.  So tasty. My wife had sides of smoked cabbage and pinto beans/brisket. Also totally yum. These guys are friendly and seem really committed to the quality product. Dig it. The rest of the menu is calling my name. We'll be back. Highly recommended

It wasn't a good day for barbecue today. There was no line even though several people had said there would be. The brisket and ribs were really dry.  Maybe it was leftover from the day before? Who knows? The meat had an over the top smokey flavor. Possibly artificial. The sauce tasted good, but reminded me of Sweet Baby Rays that you can purchase at your local super market. The jalapeño cream corn was OK, I wouldn't call it creamy (like Rudys BBQ). The best part of the meal was the smoked cabbage. I could have more of that. I guess that they didn't like my post on Instagram since they blocked me. LOL!If you want really good barbeque, my top favorites are Franklins, Mickletheaits, La Barbecue and Kerlins. SLAB BBQ has some really good sandwiches. Terry Blacks is pretty good too. Vic's BBQ can surprise you at times.  Enjoy!

Drove to the East Side the other day to try this place out because of the few good reviews hoping to find a new Austin BBQ gem. Man were we wrong. Have to start with the meat and it was just flat out bad. Over smoked, dried out, and generally flavorless--except! for an overwhelming flavor of liquid smoke? Definitely some kind of artificial smoke flavor. We ended up eating somewhere else and cutting this all up to mix in our dog's food. The sides sounded interesting so we tried them all. The creamed corn was the most edible but pretty one dimensional. The potato salad was straight from a Hill Country Fair tub at HEB. The sauce is clearly bottled, and they charge $0.25 for each little thimble. Lol, why?The most disappointing part is that we weren't even going to write this review--we just mentioned on our personal Instagram that we were sad this place was disappointing. Instead of reaching out and asking for some feedback, they just promptly blocked my account. Poor food + Poor service = Won't be back If you want a real Austin BBQ there's of course Franklin, La BBQ, and Valentina's, but Kerlin and Mum Foods are our best kept secrets.

Not being savvy to a famous barbecue places "we have to order three days prior" requirement, we (my wife and I) Took a short bike ride up the street  on 11th and Lydia) to J. Leonardi's barbecue. What a delight! Great service, great food truck atmosphere and amazing food! I'm not sure if this is a Austen statement, but it should be. I'm sure that other place is great too but you'll be messing up your trip if you don't come by J. Leonardi's barbecue first!

This guy knows bar-b-que and has a great options of side done right! Former UT student turned entrepreneur makes Austin proud. I had been enjoying his fare since J was located on Oak Springs when I could walk from my house--I sure do miss those days of convenience but understand that spot at the time was a bit obscure. Please def check out the menu and share a full on variety of sides with a friend. Plus J is super patient, courteous, and dang handsome--I would wait in line anytime

Ribs here are fall-off-the bone! They are so tender and flavorful! The air is scented with the smoking of meats in the nearby pits. The brisket and ribs truly sing! They are made with great care and it shows!

This place is fantastic! Service was quick and friendly. We ordered the Rocket and the Grizzly. Both sandwiches came with so much meat. Do not leave this place without trying their sausage, as well. He sells it by the link, in case you want to try other items too. For sides, I highly recommend the corn and beans with brisket.
Franklin BBQs line was over 3 hrs long, came here instead...no regrets! Sweet guys, delish BBQ. This place is legit!!!!!!

Great place and great food! If the line is too long at Franklin's or you just want to get some good bbq, then come here. Great customer service! Brisket sandwich is amazing and potato salad was delicious!! Sauce was also amazing!
Every head must bow.Every tounge must confess.Nobody smokes better ribs than The Man, Mr."J.Ribs" of J. Leonardi's Barbeque.BEST DAMN RIBS IN TEXAS!

This was great barbecue - with all trimmings and meats available even after 2pm for us late risers.  IMO just as good as some of the "well known" names on the street where I have also sampled.  The proprietors are very interested in customer satisfaction and care about their craft.
Incredible brisket! The sides are not the best but their proteins are from another world. Highly recommended

Yummy! Chopped chicken, brisket, and rib sandwiches and potato salad were all very good. Outdoor covered picnic table seating. Good for the family. No alcohol served. Wait was short and folks friendly! Extra bbq sauce would be great. It's a bummer that they still use styrofoam. Would definitely recommend, tho.

Stopped here after we were going to Franklins Bar-B-Q but they were sold out.This place was closing but kept the place open for us. We had the pulled pork, juicy brisket and ribs with sides of potato salad and their beans.Everything was super tender and delicious with just the right amount of bark and perfect smoke rings.This is a local permanent style food truck but with a lot of available seating.My only complaint would be the small plastic container of good barbecue sauce that they give you with the meal.We did talk to a few local customers who said they liked this spot better than Franklins

One of the moistest 'lean' brisket pieces I've ever had and the sausage and ribs were great too.  Just two blocks from Franklins, so if you don't want to wait, this is the place.  The sausage is an original recipe, made for, but not by them.  Great stuff!

I used to really enjoy J Leonardi's but I feel like the quality has decreased over the past year. They used to have some of the best brisket in town but the last two times I went the fat in my moist brisket had not fully rendered so it was a little tough. It's not a bad place to just grab a sandwich and there's never a line but the food is better at the other trucks in the area.

Enjoyed a solid BBQ sandwich lunch here today (see photos)! First up, the J Ribb ($8.50) - deboned rib sandwich. Delicious meat, good outer flavor layer and excellent topped with onion, pickle & a bit of BBQ sauce. Also had The Grizzly ($9) - what a might fine beast it is. Mix of chopped brisket and pulled pork - full of flavor, generous portion, and just plane tasty! Both sandwiches were good sized and came with sides of onion, pickle, jalapeño and BBQ sauce. The pickles were better than you typical jarred salty dill bombs. Overall solid BBQ and didn't have to wait in line at 1:30 pm. In the mood for good BBQ without the line hype, I highly recommend this place.

If you're looking to eat only a BBQ sandwich, then J Leonardi's is the place to go. Situated among other food trailers, you can find JL by following the sweet smell of burning wood. The menu is simple, order a sandwich, sit down on one of their picnic tables and enjoy the food. Of course, it was already pushing 100 degrees so ordered my food to go. Gotta tell ya, the meat in the grizzly (brisket, pulled pork) was nicely smoked and tender. It was a messy sandwich but JL provided a fork to scoop up the mess. My co-worker order the Viking. It's a 1/2 sausage link in a hotdog bun, onions, pickles, chopped brisket and cheese. But get this, you get 2 of those in the order!! I like these sandwich options and JL gets creative with his menu options that include brisket, sausage, pork, and chicken. There's one for everyone!

I decided to try this place because it was listed as a black owned business in a news article, and I wanted to patronize such because of the recent social unrest.  Thank goodness I tried it.  I probably wouldn't have even known about the place, otherwise.  I ordered MEAT (which was delivered at no charge if spending over $25.00, which was easy to do.).  I ordered pulled pork and moist brisket.  I'm here to tell you, the brisket is AWESOME!  Moist, tender and the rub is DELICIOUS!  I haven't tried the pulled pork yet.  I hope the rub is the same.  I have eaten so much BBQ where the rub is too sweet, but this was perfect.  GREAT JOB!!!  I will definitely order again.  Update:  I ate some of the pulled pork today and it is delicious, also!
Best ribs in Austin. You know it's good when they sell out by 1pm. I've came late so many times but I've learned my lesson now lol Keep on smoking the best meats in ATX
Best BBQ I've had in Texas. Being from Kansas I love the sweet BBQ sauce! YAY for having pulled pork too, it was so Juicy and moist! So happy to have found a BBQ place that reminds me of home
I haven't had a bad experience at an Austin food truck yet, no exception here. Great customer service, clean truck, excellent food. Austin is doing it right!

I only had the chopped brisket sandwich since I needed a little snack to get me through the lunch hour. It was absolutely fantastic! I can't speak for the sauce, because I didn't use any. The flavor was superb- saltier than most briskets, but I liked it. Very moist and tender served on a fresh bun. I will be back again for a larger taste of their menu- but for now, it's a hit!

Great food at great prices. I got the three meat plate and barely finished. Ordered brisket, sausage and turkey with potato salad and the beans. The sausage was definitely my favorite of all. Delicious smokey flavor. I wish the brisket was cut a little thicker, but the little bits of brisket in the beans were awesome. The little trailer is just down the road from Franklin, and a great alternative if you don't have the time to wait in line..
Great food, great service! Recommend greatly. Been in Austin all my life and will definitely be back

I teetered between a four or five star review. The possibility of rating a 4.5 would have had my fingers typing sooner. Since that's not an option, flashbacks to elementary math had me round up to five. Additionally, I had told my cousin that if I lived in the Austin area, I'd be hesitant to write a review for fear of a lengthy line the next time I wanted some BBQ.We found a different barbecue spot with great ratings, thanks to Yelpers. We stood in line with the masses although there was no guarantee we'd be served. As an out-of-towner, I was quite intrigued by the whole process. As a person who doesn't enjoy waiting in a line that's not moving much and with no guarantee that I'll get what I'm waiting for, the curiosity waned and I went back to reliable Yelp for nearby alternatives. Up pops J. Leonardi stationed a couple blocks away! I quietly shared the info with my cousin and we left the line with dozens of customers behind us smiling at our departure. This food trailer presented as clean, organized, and with a nice variety to choose from. There was a very short line, woo-hoo, and once our two-meat meals were ordered, he began preparing the assembly line of tickets placed above his head. The gentleman who was taking orders now worked efficiently, with disposable gloves on, to reduce the number of tickets overhead. I observed that he swapped gloves several times as we waited for our order to be filled. I don't know if that's a requirement for Austin food trailers, but high five for that! Order filled, we headed back to our vehicle with carry out bag in hand. Driving past our initial destination, the line was considerably shorter, just outside of the door, but we had no regrets about leaving and being able to get exactly what we wanted. I had the baby back ribs and brisket with jalapeno cream corn and smoked cabbage. My cousin had grilled chicken and brisket with potato salad and smoked cabbage. All was melt in your mouth delicious! The rub used on the meats is incomparable. The seasoning for the sides had just the right amount of whatever to be flavorful without overpowering. I considered a four-star rating because the majority of my brisket slices were half fat and half meat. I've had brisket at restaurants and was served lean cuts. The pics on Yelp show no fat on the brisket. Not sure what happened with my order. However, with a small pile of fat building, I continued to eat and was a very happy girl! When in Austin, I will gladly return to J. Leonardi's Barbeque to satisfy my BBQ fix with a polite request that they trim the fat on my brisket. High five!!
I can not believe how amazing this place is!! We were on a hunt for good BBQ and we need to search no further. Thank you.

What a find!  Family stopped by for lunch today and we all agreed this was fantastic. Brisket was juicy, tender and flavorful with great bark. Sausage was great. Pulled pork was classic smoky Central Tx style. Then there were the sides. Classic potato salad. Jalapeño corn was amazing.  Smoked cabbage was the delicious sleeper. Will definitely be back.

I was in Austin with my youngest son we looked on yelp for bbq places .this establishment was 2 blocks from overcrowded franklins bbq ,I tried Grizzly sandwich which had brisket and pulled pork , the brisket and pork were so tender,They have jalapeño cream corn and smoked cabbage that was so good. They make some of the best brisket I ever ate. My son let me try his boneless rib sandwich , it was very moist tender and flavorful. They take credit cards .
This is an awesome spot! The ribs are amazing! The customer service is top notch, great people work here!! Thank you for making my trip to Austin so memorable!

Solid BBQ spot. Good prices. Great customer service- above and beyond friendly staff. Brisket smoked right. Smoked sausage sandwich was massive. Liquor store conveniently located across the street for BYOB.

My first time at a food truck and what an experience! The food was beyond delicious. We ordered a rib sandwich, a brisket and pulled pork sandwich, two orders of brisket plates and a chicken plate. The plates come with two sides, the sandwiches don't, but we ordered - corn, potato salad, cabbage and beans with brisket. All were winners. The man running the truck remained calm and efficient, even though he ran the whole operation himself. I haven't been to many bbqs in my time, but this is an experience no one should miss.
