De-freakin-lish!!!!! Always Very hospitable and clean. We showed up today and I realized I hadn't posted a review. Showed up today and ordered the most delicious sammich(yes, I said sammich). I had brisket on white bread with smoked cabbage, pickles, onion and bbq sauce and a side of the pinto beans with brisket in it. I'm in a good coma.Didn't know the sammich would be that big. The portion beans was a good size as well.Please see the pictures, they do not lie

The BBQ ribs and brisket were amazing to say the least! The jalapeno corn and cold potato salads were also delish. It is a lunch truck where you see many locals coming by to eat or just pick up their food.

So glad I tried your BBQ!!! Brisket was moist and flavorful, turkey had the right amount of smoke applied to it, beans were out of this world good, and the jalapeño cream corn was phenomenal.I highly recommend, Keep up the good work!!
Great bbq! Try the longhorn!!!!! Came here because la Barbeque was a 2 hour wait and we are happy we did!
There bbq is great!! Definitely try the Jalapeño corn. They also have great service. All time favorite bbq in Austin!

Nice little neighborhood BBQ joint!Meeting some friends last night and ended up here. Had the baked potato and opted for the smoked turkey instead of the chopped beef and WOW!  The turkey was amazing!  I tend to be the person who goes to a bbq place and gets the turkey, so while I can't attest to anything else, the turkey was On Point.Staff was friendly and they have a wonderful covered patio in the back.

So glad you found us, Stacey! I'm happy to hear you and your friends enjoyed a meal with us the other night and that you were such a fan of our turkey. I appreciate you taking the time to leave a review and hope to welcome you back again soon!Sincerely,Orlando, Owner
they are selling breakfast tacos now open at 7:00 am before the Hipsters get up and about
first time here since ownership change; glad they decided to keep this place from being ravaged and replaced by a hipster coffee shop. stuffed potato has pinto beans in it and costs $9.00

If consistency is the key to success in the food business then the people who work here are the key masters!! continually making great BBQ!!    here's a tip....mix some chop beef into the mac and cheese!!

The best little barbecue joint in North Austin, Very folksy and laid back!! $6 gets you a chop beef sandwich, drink and a bag of chips!!! Say what!!???. Back of restaurant has covered porch with picnic tables, TV and mist fans for comfort!!! Liking what the new management has done with this iconic Austin BBQ joint!!

Pretty darn good bbq and the service is great! The employees are engaging and funny. They have daily lunch specials that can save you a little off the regular prices. No prices on the website which irritates me when restaurants do that. But I am posting pictures with prices as of 6/4/2020.

Thanks for coming our way, Russell! I'm happy to hear you enjoyed your BBQ and our amazing team took good care of you. We appreciate your photos and feedback and hope to have you back again soon! Sincerely, Orlando, Owner

It's not great bbq. Picked up moist brisket, sausage, and ribs plus a side of potato salad. Ribs had the most smoke flavor but still weren't great. Brisket and sausage was edible but no more. Sauce was bland and had consistency of runny baked bean juice and potato salad lacked any flavor. I've been eyeing this place for some time but won't be back. Sad. Staff was great.

I’m sorry to hear that, Andrew. We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review. We take our guests feedback very seriously and we want to continue the conversation to try and make things right for you. Please reach out at your convenience at contact@bigospitbbq.com.

This place is really a hidden gem.  My husband and I *finally* found an amazing BBQ spot!  The staff is really friendly and they have great food.  I would highly recommend the moist brisket, as it's one of the best that I have ever had.  Also, the prices are extremely reasonable, as compared to some other BBQ places we have been to.  If you want real, delicious BBQ, I would 100% recommend this place.

We really appreciate the kind words, Tess! I'm happy you found us and were so pleased with the brisket. I can't wait to start seeing you and your husband back regularly. See you again soon! Sincerely, Orlando Arriaga, GM

Ever since the Taco Shack folks bought The Pit the level of service has declined a bit. Staff behind the counter come off as scatter brained and routinely forget desert and or have to be told twice what sides I want. However today they redeemed themselves with excellent service!  The meat and jalapeño sausage is still tops. As a matter of fact I think the brisket here is some of the very best in Austin!  Way to go guys!!!

Ever since the Taco Shack folks bought The Pit the level of service has declined a bit. Staff behind the counter come off as scatter brained and routinely forget desert and or have to be told twice what sides I want. The meat and jalapeño sausage is still good but service has knocked them down a few stars.
Small time BBQ operation.  Excellent meat choices, especially the the most. The naner pudding is great.
We're so glad to hear that you loved the BBQ, Jason, and we hope you'll come back to see us again soon!Sincerely,Orlando Arriaga, GM

Real good home style BBQ without the trendy hipster wait. Found this little hole in the wall looking for a lunch spot for me and the boys to escape the work day. From the moment we walked in we were greeted with a big ole Texas howdy and some great southern hospitality. Since it was lunch rush i drove straight for the brown bag special (chop beef, side, drink for 6 bucks) and got two pork ribs on the side. Food was pretty darn good and I'll definitely be coming back again. They have really good rotating lunch specials if you're looking for a smoking deal (pun intended).  Give it a try y'all, just might like it.

Benjamin, we're glad you all decided to stop in for lunch! It's awesome to hear that you received some classic Texas BBQ with a big helping of southern hospitality, and we look forward to seeing you visit again soon.Sincerely,Orlando Arriaga, GM

I went here for the first time this afternoon and had SUCH a great experience! Jalapeño sausage was incredible, and my friend got the frito pie and said it was delicious! If you can believe it, the service was even better! I cannot remember the names of the man and woman that helped me today, but they made me feel so welcomed! Will definitely be back to try more!!

Shelby,Thanks so much for stopping by to give us a try! I'm thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your lunch and that our team took excellent care of you. We look forward to welcoming you back in soon!Sincerely,Orlando, GM
New ownership has done wonders for the pit. Slow roasted brisket is perfect and the sides are good too
We're so glad you love the brisket, Matthew! Come back and visit anytime.Sincerely,Orlando Arriaga, GM
Such good bbq sauce!!!!! My favorite in town. Plus the sausage is awesome and the price is right. Also they are local, been here forever and know what they are doing.
Thanks so much, Faye! I'm happy to hear you're such a fan of our barbeque sauce. Looking forward to welcoming you back for more of your favorite barbeque sometime soon! Sincerely,Orlando Arriaga, GM

Theres a reason this place has 3 stars and its not cause you get booted for parking there. I had the unfortunate experience of eating here last week, (11-2-17) While the atmosphere seemed pleasant, the cashier was pretty abrupt with me and seemed like I was bothering them. I ordered Brisket and sausage. While the sausage had a semi decent flavor, it was obvious it had been sitting for quit a while as it had the texture of a slim jim. Brisket had a small smoke ring but was super dry. So I had to sop it all up with bbq sauce. Fortunately that had a good enough flavor to cover up the sadness i was consuming. And if the culinary experience wasn't trough enough, instead of smelling the loveliness of smokey meats, all I could smell was some kind of cleaner that my nose told me was the same scent of a urinal cake. Not my favorite scent.All in all, I guess for a quick and cheap bite, its acceptable but unfortunatley this place is as drab as most of the reviews I've read.3-10-18Thanks jeff for your mediocre response. It perfectly reflects the product you serve in that outhouse you try to sell off as a restaurant, which makes sense because your sausage does look like turds.

Ben, I'm disappointed to hear you were underwhelmed by your experience. As you mentioned, we don't get this type of feedback very often. We appreciate the feedback, nonetheless. If you do choose to stop by again, we'll work hard to make your next visit a great one.Take care,Jeff Duff, Owner

When we moved in off of Burnet Road more than 10 years ago, the Pit was our neighborhood barbecue joint - family-owned and unchanged since 1971. We'd pick up chopped beef sandwiches and take them down to Town Lake at a time you could still drive there in 12 minutes instead of 30+. The Pit also became part of our holiday tradition - we'd take our own turkey and have the Duff family smoke it and slice it - so delicious, we vowed never to cook our own again. After 40 years in the business, the Duff's son wanted to retire and the Pit changed management. Fortunately the new manager is an Austinite - in fact, in the 70s he would ride his bike to the Pit to buy (you guessed it) chopped beef sandwiches. I taste change - the meat seems a bit blander, as does the potato salad. But the sauce and cole slaw are still great. These are easy fixes which I hope Orlando will make. That's why I give this review a 3 instead of a 2. I'm thankful he's trying to save an Austin institution too often overlooked by people who can't see past the new restaurants to those who have fed locals for a long, long time. The Pit can be a 4/5 again - I look forward to supporting it as it gets there. (And it would help significantly if you all would also bring back the smoke-your-own-meat option!)Thanks for caring about 'old' Austin - all best.

Aimee,We appreciate your love and support over the years. We're doing our best to constantly work towards improving the restaurant in all areas, and we appreciate your patience with us as we get there. Just to let you know, we do still offer our custom cook service, including an upcoming turkey promotion for Thanksgiving. Please visit our website for more information: thepitbarbeque.comWe will be sure to discuss this with our team and we look forward to welcoming you back in soon!Sincerely,Orlando Arriaga, GM

As soon as we walked through the doors we were greeted with the most amazing hospitality! Walked through the menu (we were new to the place) and served quickly right after. We met Rudy Rivera (the cook) who immediately made us feel welcome! They also treated us to to some homemade peach cobbler. Definitely will be going back & recommending this place to family & friends!! Also the brisket was amazing and I found the bbq sauce to my liking!

Thanks for stopping by, Jesse! I'm thrilled to hear that Rudy and the team took great care of you and showed you an excellent first visit. We'll be sure to pass along the compliments to our team and look forward to seeing you back in soon!Sincerely, Orlando Arriaga, GM

The Wednesday Special Turkey plate for under $8 with coleslaw & potato salad hit the spot as the joint serves nice quick lunch. For you health food types, you can request whole wheat bread slices like I did for my meal. If you pay attention you might see one of the family owners working the Grandfather's pit that has cooked lots of BBQ meat. When you walk into this place, it will transport you back to the 70's of old Austin as the rustic appeal with no frills is unique and most of the folks that eat there are working folks from around the area.
James, the Wednesday Special Turkey Plate is always an awesome choice! I'm really happy to hear that you enjoyed your experience with us. We'll see you next time.Take care,Jeff Duff, Owner
Thank you for our Thanksgiving Turkey it was amazing! Absolutely love this place. This has become my go to barbecue restaurant.
Danielle,We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed your pit-smoked turkey! We look forward to welcoming you back in again soon.Sincerely,Orlando Arriaga, GM

Awful food coupled with horrible service.  I brought my family from MN here to experience Austin BBQ, and they were quite disappointed, as well.  Never coming back.In addition:  This unethical company makes it's money by putting boots on cars who inadvertently park in their parking lot, and then extorting 150 dollars to get the boot taken off.  I work hard for my money, only to have it taken by these crooks.  I understand the value of parking for restaurants, especially if a parking spot is the difference between getting a customer or not, but 150?!?!  That is robbery.  The owner should be ashamed.  (I'm sure the owner is busy copying and pasting his standard rebuttal where he shifts the blame to somebody else right now.  Have fun with that.  How hard could it be to put up a sign that warns of the $150 extortion?)

Hey, Jon. After reading your review, I'm a bit confused. While we don't employ the parking enforcement company, they wouldn't be booting vehicles of those who are parking in our lot to dine with us. That being said, there are also signs up in our small lot warning of the parking policy, so we're sorry you didn't see them this visit.  We've taken great pride in bringing quality BBQ to Austin since 1971, and we hope to get a shot at showing you what our BBQ is all about some time.Best, Jeff Duff, Owner

There have been some pretty serious changes at The Pit.  There's a new crew behind the counter with an excellent attitude.  The complaints about towing have apparently been the cause of a parking lot that's now much better marked. And the entire place has a new look.  The food is still exactly the same, and that' s fine with me.As for the parking, well, if you park where you shouldn't now, you either are doing it on purpose or can't read the English language.There are new items on the menu, things you wouldn't normally find at a BBQ joint.  I'm kind of a traditionalist, but I think The Pit is finally coming into the 20-teens.  As for me, i'll be back.
Thanks for the kind words, Mike! We're thrilled to hear that you are enjoying the changes and are excited to have you back as we continue to work to improve. Until then!Orlando Arriaga, Manager

So I came to eat with my friends and we decided to have beer on the brewery next door, 8 minutes later they had my car getting the yellow lock on my wheel and charged me 150$ I went and talked to the owner and he was like yea still pay the ticket and eat here, he was very rude to me and said I don't think you would eat here. So disappointed

Mohamed, I already mentioned this on Google+, but I'd like to reiterate: I'm sorry you were booted. I understand how frustrated you must feel. The property owner has a strict rule about Pinthouse's customers using our parking lot and unfortunately, we have no say in the matter. We don't enforce the policy, a private parking company does. That said, I'm sorry you had a bad experience​ in our lot. Best,Jeff Duff, Owner

Great lunch BBQ spot. Solid brisket or turkey plates for under $10? Great deal. They got a new smoker at this place and it's made all the difference. This is my new go-to lunch BBQ place in the neighborhood. Brisket had great flavor and marbling, sides were good too. Clean and comfortable inside.
Mediocre barbecue spot. The brisket was pretty dry but the sides were decent. The atmosphere was definitely not my cup of tea, pretty dreary.

Blair, thanks for coming to check us out! We've been cooking up our BBQ here for 45 years, so we're glad to have you in. It's disappointing to hear your brisket came out a bit drier than you would have liked, but I can assure you we take great pride in the flavor and preparation of our food, so we hope to get another shot at showing you what we're all about in the future. Just curious -- was this your first time coming to check us out? Hope to talk soon, Jeff Duff, Owner

Pit BBQ has new ownership and the outcome is not good.  Everything that made this place special and historic has been "improved."  The comforting dark interior, that's the stuff of dreams now, buried under whitewash with floodlights in all the booths.  I was willing to accept the makeover.  But what I am not able to accept are the so called improvements to the food.  On four visits now, brisket is consistently undercooked, tasteless, rubbery and a pale grey color--no smoke ring and you can forget about any charred outer bark where all the flavor was.  I was told the owner is siphoning off the briskets for his chain of taco outlets.  Sometimes they're completely out by mid afternoon as a result.  Not going to discuss the sides, I think the previous reviewer of June 18 covered that subject well.   As a lifelong Austinite it breaks my heart.   The Pit as I knew it is truly gone.  From now on I'm going over to Sams on the east side.

Not really sure what is happening at "The Pit" these days.  My husband & I loved this place.  The food was always delicious, and worth the price.  The last 3 times we have gotten food from here, something was bad- either the lean meat we ordered was full of fat, or the beans were overcooked, etc....  This last order-everything was just bad. The meat, beans, coleslaw, and potato salad had no flavor & the beans were overcooked.      For almost 33 years this was the only place we would go to get barbeque.  I can tell you that we're never going back.    One time maybe someone messed up, twice could be an off day, but three times - we're out.

The service was very friendly but the servings were small especially the brisket.  The special plate of the day was brisket and I got that.  The serving amount was small and 2 of the 3 pieces were tough.  The beans and potato salad were good.

Gillespie,We appreciate your feedback. As we transition to new management, we are continuing to improve every aspect of the restaurant. We will discuss your comments regarding portion size with our team, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again very soon.Sincerely,Orlando Arriaga, Manager

Recently I returned to The Pit after a bad experience and a lengthy absence. The new manager, Orlando Arriaga, reached out to me after he read my negative review on Yelp! and invited me to return to The Pit and give them another try. I did. The new staff was friendly and welcoming, unlike the previous rude staff. I sampled all the meats except the chopped beef. The ribs were fall of the bone, succulent and delicious. The sausage was juicy and flavorful, as was the chicken. The brisket and turkey, while smokey and flavorful, were really quite dry. They need some work. But overall, The Pit, under Mr. Arriaga's leadership has come a long way from where it was.

Jeff Duff - Well, I never heard back from you about trying to make things right with me or to invite me back so..... By the way, I am glad your website no longer lists prices - much better chance of not ticking off customers that way. I hope my review may have had something to do with that. Oh... your online menu shows an offering of DESERTS - you might want to change that to DESSERTS unless you are serving up portions of the Sahara or Mojave. Just saying. Who maintains your website? Sheesh!

Your review of The Pit Barbeque2.0 star rating 11/2/2015Rip off! I had not been to The Pit in a long time, so I decided to go get some chopped barbecue sandwiches. Once I got there, everything smelled so good that instead I ordered 3/4 lb of brisket, 3/4 lb of ribs and 1/2 lb of the chopped beef. Based on the prices I saw on the website this morning, I thought it would be about 25.00 with tax. They were busy so I didn't stop to question it when what was charged on my card was $32.66 - Later I called and the guy who answered said their prices increased on the ribs and brisket some time ago from $12.49 to $15.49/lb. That is quite a hike! I told him about the website prices and he said, "yeah that is old". I told him they needed to update the website - that is false advertising and under the law you have to sell at advertised prices. He said it wasn't his problem. WON'T BE BACK.Jeff D.'s comment on your review:Douglas, I'm terribly sorry to hear you are upset about this. While the prices on the website are out of date, all prices in the restaurant are current -- I apologize if this caused some confusion. Web sites can be difficult and expensive to maintain, especially for small family businesses such as ours -- I hope you can understand that. Still, I'd like to learn a bit more about your visit -- which day did you stop in? Hope to hear back, Jeff Duff, Owner One week agoMy visit was on Monday, November 2nd at approx. 11:45 AM. I understand that websites are expensive to maintain, especially for a small business, but if you are not going to keep it current, better to get rid of it. Advertising one price on the website and not honoring it at your place of business is misleading and brings customers into your restaurant under false pretenses. This is illegal. Advertised prices must be honored. That the person I spoke with took no interest in the validity of my complaint is not satisfactory. I would like to know what you think is a fair resolution to this issue.One hour agoDouglas, I appreciate you taking the time to get back to me and again apologize for any confusion caused by the website and for the handling of the situation on site. Again, thank you for the feedback.BestJeff Duff, OwnerOne hour agoMr. Duff - I am glad that you are appreciative, but that is not enough to make me want to return. You are sorry. Okay. And? This is where a business owner interested in retaining a customer and ensuring he doesn't lose even more customers because this customer is dissatisfied, says - "We will get the information on the website corrected immediately", "We will take down the website since it is misleading and is too expensive to update" or "I would like to make this right with you". So - nothing?Delete Conversation
Austin, TX 78759

Rudy's is some of the best BBQ I've ever had and my only regret is I didn't come back for more during my trip in Austin. I went to visit family and we decided to carry out dinner one night. We ordered the moist brisket, creamed corn, potato salad and Cole slaw. I was in heaven eating the brisket. Wow, talk about good BBQ. The sides were just as delicious and satisfying, including the slaw which I also seem to despise but not from Rudy's!The staff is also very friendly which is a bonus to this already amazing food. Rudy's is a must if you're in Texas!

I really have zero complaints about this BBQ restaurant. The food is always hot and now they serve peach cobbler! The only issue I had previously (and it was probably my fault) was ordering the extra moist brisket. It was just too fatty for my personal taste.  The corn is outstanding and really you can't go wrong with all the sides.  The sausage and turkey are probably my favorites.The restaurant maintains cleanliness and at least in these times, everyone is wearing a mask and seems content.  It's a bit loud, so with a mask you kind of have to speak up for the cashier to hear you adequately.  But that's just a sign of the times.I've eaten here a few times in the last two months and each time the experience has been great.  I'd never hesitate to recommend this to anyone visiting Austin.

Ordered through Uber eats *disclaimer: review is my husband's opinion (I do not eat meat)Traveling through, was craving Texas bbqThey were one of the only spots open for delivery after 7:30Ordered the 1/2 pound of ribs Ordered the 1/2 pound of moist brisket The food was DELICIOUS the ribs were truly falling off the bone, you don't need teeth to eat them. You can eat them with your gumsSo upset that I only got a 1/2 pound when I should have gotten moreThe brisket is out of this world, other worldly stupendous. It makes love to your taste buds.
Best barbecue in Texas. That's it, if you are carnivorous you need to check this place out!      Try it you'll like it!

Rudy's is great bbq despite the sign stating worst bbq in Texas !! LOL !! I'm sure some non Texans have made that comment, but Rudy's is hard to beat. Now I will tell you that not every Rudy's is the same. I have eaten at a dozen different locations and I've only found two that were not that great and I will not return to those two locations. Some offer free jalapeños and some charge for jalapeños which is a Texas sin !!! Since they are individually owned franchises they set their own rules. Worthy of a bookmark and a try if you're passing through or if you live or work near-by. Tell em Mr. Texas recommended them. They also give veteran discounts.

Rudy's has always been a good place to go for BBQ. They seem to be every where. Which is great when in the mood for BBQ. From breakfast tacos to meats and sides. Never been disappointed. The staff very friendly. Prices are reasonable.

The people and the food, OMG!  How have I not come here in the last two years?  THIS is my new favorite BBQ place.  The quality is  amazing and prices are fair. We tried the ribs and the Prime Rib steak.  Both were soooo good.  When something is as tasty as this, my husband is probably embarrassed because of my yum noises.  ribs were tender and juicy and the prime rib was as tasty as any I've had at fancy restaurants.  I feel like if I go to heaven, this will be what it's like. For sides, we tried the coleslaw and it was good as expected.  The creamed corn was fresh tasting and good but a little too thick and sweet for me. That said, if it showed up on the table, I would still have a few bites.   They have the pickles and onions sides available as well as the famous Rudy's sauce. We ordered the peach cobbler for dessert and that was warm, peachy and tasty.  A scoop of vanilla ice cream would knock it outta the park for me. They show you each item you've  ordered as they place it on your tray for your approval. That's when my mouth started watering and it didn't stop as I began to taste all the food.  All of the staff is so polite and hospitable.  Jill, who helped us with our order was so patient as we asked questions and figured out what we wanted. Terrific customer service skills. We will most definitely be coming back here again and again.  Can't wait to bring our friends here.

I was very disappointed today that Rudy's has let many employees at the registers and behind them preparing the food -- including the manager -- handle and prepare food without wearing masks.     I counted 4 employees behind the counter hovering over and handling food that were not masked.     We picked a register where the employee was wearing a mask then went outside to eat in the restaurant for the first time in over a year.   It was about 11:30 am and guess what we found -- the tables had not even been wiped down and dried off since the rain.Rudy's and especially K & N has always had very high standards for quality, hygiene, health, and  food safety.   This laxness on the mask and on cleaning the tables goes against everything they've come to be known for, and makes me concerned about what else might be going on that we cannot see.Come on guys.   You're the flagship location with headquarters right there next door.     Let's be the example for everyone else.   Don't get lazy.  Set a high bar.   Keep it safe.

Hi Joe, we are very sorry to hear that the table you had chosen to sit at had not yet been wiped down and we will pass this along to our team. In regards to the masks, we are following all guidance that the CDC has released and will continue to do so.
Austin, TX 78759

Rudy's has always been a family favorite. Anything you get there is packed with flavor and their store operations during COVID-19 are very safe and they take precautions very seriously. All sides are prepackaged including the onions, pickles, and breads. Our family eats a lot, and they were generous to give us a whole new loaf! For meats I recommend the MOIST brisket over the lean. It's so tender, juicy, and flavorful. Lean is also good but not as flavor packed, definitely need to use some extra bbq sauce for that. The sausage is so tasty and a personal favorite. For a family of 4 I recommend choosing 3 meats off the menu, with some extra sides. Half a pound isn't as much as you think! My favorite sides are the cream corn and beans! The corn is super sweet and creamy, and beans are packed with flavor. I thought the potato salad was just like any others you could find at your local grocery store, so you might want to take a pass on that. For dessert, the banana pudding was delicious, but a bit on the pricier end for a small cup. I liked the taste except the vanilla wafers were slightly old. However, I'm a big fan of banana pudding and could not pass up the chance. It's served with a generous amount of whipped cream.  Never had a bad meal at Rudy's, and I fully recommend any Texan looking for bbq to stop by! Plenty of bbq joints in Austin but for the price, consistency, and variety I think Rudy's deserves the 5 stars!
Thank you for being a loyal fan and for your confidence in us. We appreciate you and for sharing your experience!

A family favorite of ours for the past 15 years. At this point, I've had most of the things on the menu and highly recommend their moist brisket, chicken, jalepeno sausage, and spicy chopped for meats and potato salad and cream corn for sides. All of their meats are filled with barbeque flavor, juicy, and tender and the sides pair well to give you that Texas bbq experience. With COVID, they now prepackage their bbq sauces, onions, and pickles, making it very easy and safe. They are also very generous and will give you an entire loaf of bread if you ask for it!
Great fast BBQ, great breakfast tacos, super-fast service. What's not to love? Also: free pickles.

BEST BBQ IN TX, HANDS DOWN. Do yourself a favor and order the EXTRA MOIST BRISKET - I'm salivating just thinking about it! Not to forget the complimentary Rudy's pickles and bbq sauce; if even the condiments are delicious, the entrées' quality is unquestionable. My husband and I have been to Rudy's multiple times and have never once been disappointed. Anytime you're craving bbq, GO TO RUDY'S!! 10/10 A+

I ordered through Door Dash to get some breakfast tacos delivered to me. I have tried Rudy's tacos once at work office and thought it was solid and decided to try it again. I ordered a few brisket breakfast tacos and some basic bacon egg cheese tacos. My second impression was that the tacos was meh. Not too satisfying for my liking in terms of taste. Don't get me wrong it was edible but nothing stood out. Their sauces were pretty watered down and had no flavor. Tip- save your money and spend it during lunch/dinner on barbecue.
The food is always tasty and the service is on point.  My personal favorite are the St. Louis ribs, the moist brisket and the cream corn.  They are absolutely inanely delicious.  Totally recommend

Now that Rudy's has switched to a 100% "To-Go" status, it hasn't stopped their success. Rudy's still offers fresh tasty BBQ purchase by the pound. They have some of the tastiest brisket in Austin. Sure there is a lot of BBQ competition out here, but in my book here is why I give them 5 Stars. 1. Presentation - Store is always stocked with drinks sides and refreshments you can grab as you go through the line. 2. Friendliness- Rudy's staff is Super Friendly. Big Super Welcome if you're a First Timer and they Offer you samples of their cuts. 3. Rudy's offers discounts to Military Vets and First Responders. 4. Rudy's offers several Meat selections. Pork Ribs, Brisket (Regular, Moist and Lean), Chicken, Smoked Turkey and Sausages. The cuts are always fresh, always full of flavor. For me the Saint Louis Pork Ribs and the brisket sometimes have a bit too much rub, making them a little salty. 5. Cleanliness - Now BBQ is a"Hands On" meal. Knife and a Fork, won't get you too far. You got to grab it with yo hands, place yo elbows on the table and dig in. Rudy's has an automatic hand washing machine for your convenience. The staff is always clearing tables, wiping them down and restocking items. Paper towels and BBQ sare in the table and some stores. Fresh condiments everywhere, pickles, onions and all you can eat BBQ sauce. So if you're sitting at home getting that urge for some fresh que, you know where to go. Michael Cummings Georgetown, TX.
Thank you so much for sharing your experience and for being a fan!
Austin, TX 78759

Stopped here for dine-in for the first time since March.  Have gotten take out since then, but this was the first time eating in.  The line looks a little long since people are spaced farther apart than before, but it moves fast.  The people working here are just a fun as ever.  I decided to get an extra 1/2 lb of lean brisket to take home.  They packaged it up nicely and it was still warm when I got it home 2 hours later.  The bar for pickles, onions, sauces and stuff, is now a station with everything prepackaged in little containers.  So nothing is out like before.  But all good and nothing to slow down the lines!

Update to earlier review: very pleased that Manager followed-up to get details and to apologize. Poor service can't always be prevented, but the Manager demonstrated that they will try harder and even hand-wrote me a thank you card. I will now revisit Rudy's again.

Underhanded trick they did by filling half of my 3 lb St Louis Rib order with old, dried out discolored ribs.....by placing them on the bottom covered by fresher thicker ribs. Unacceptable way to present your company, and to treat a customer who paid over $50.

Our most recent visit, the husband and I shared a plate of food and dined in.  We had:Brisket - we always enjoy the brisket here. I have had better in some places but it is also better than most places I have tried that is BBQ.  I like that it is not over the top peppery but it is also NOT lacking in flavor.  We order this usually and am never disappointed.Jalapeno Sausage - packed full of flavor yet even though the name implies there would be spiciness to it, it's really not spicy - the flavors are very well balanced.  This is another protein we generally order from here.Potato Salad - Potatoes have a good texture, this is not an overly sweet type of potato salad which is good because I do not like the sweet ones. It is not salty either and overall is well balanced. I would get this again.Cream Corn - this is my favorite place to get cream corn. Creamy, nice texture, delicious! Highly recommended.BBQ sauce - not my favorite but I am generally not a fan of BBQ sauce. I figure if the meat is good enough well then there is no need to cover the flavor of the meat with BBQ sauce.All in all, we know what we like and we stick to it.  We come here not only for dinner or lunch but for their grab and go breakfast tacos as well which we always enjoy. We will always have Rudys as one of our regular spots for meals weather dine in or take out.  For the quality of food, you cannot beat the prices and customer service is ALWAYS spectacular - no matter what location we visit.
Always consistent and tasty! Can never go wrong with anything on the menu. Dont forget the dessert....mmmmm.....banana pudding.

Rudy's is always friendly, always clean, always consistent, always delicious! This was the first barbecue restaurant we went to when moving to Texas eight years ago. We have been to many others, but Rudy's remains my favorite! The entire experience is perfect from start to end every time!

It's really easy to choose when it comes to making choices for BBQ joints in ATX, it's hard to go wrong, when you choose Rudy's!The complete family BBQ dining experience with the super juicy meats and the perfect sides to accompany that. This experience is unparalleled to any other outside is Texas and they keep wowing you with every bite of BBQ you bite into.Tons of choices and the most inviting and interesting food experience, where the plates are wax paper and the trays are bottle crates.But, the place is not gimmicky, it does have everything on it's menu to back up the fun experience you crave for at a 5 star Texas BBQ joint, so pay them a visit and you shall not be disappointed.
column21: University of Texas at Austin, Austin, TX

column20: Best bbq ever! The creamed corn is a dream! There isn't anything I wouldn't recommend from this place!

Perfect service perfect food perfect service every time.  We had just moved here 5 years ago and stumbled upon Rudy's.  They asked if we had been there before.  When we said no, they cheered and celebrated us and welcomed us and had us taste a bunch of different meats.  While the hoopla is gone, we are every bit as excited to get their food now as we were then.  Maybe more so because we know just how delicious it is.  The sausages and cole slaw are my favorite.  My kid prefers the prime rib (most expensive option naturally) hubby loves the brisket.  We all leave fat and happy.  Oh, and breakfast tacos are the best around.  LOVE RUDY'S!
Austin, TX 78759
Good! Portions are weighed not the tastiest I've Had. But it is Available.Other times it tasted a lot better. The sauce is great and the barbecue is not.

Make sure you get the extra moist brisket and the ribs. So amazingly tender and juicy! Ribs were fatty and falling off the bone. The sausage was alright, a bit dry and casing felt tough. Knocking off some points for the sides. Potato salad was good, coleslaw was decent, cream corn was too sweet in my opinion. There was only one type of bbq sauce that they gave us, it was quite sweet and didn't have a lot of depth. Overall, I would come back for the meat which is the most important part so I'm glad they got that right! The guys behind the counter were also very friendly and made the experience fun. Loved watching them cut the meat in front of you.
Thank you for sharing your experience!

Nice roadhouse type place. Huge outdoor covered seating area. Very good brisket. I had a breakfast taco which was simply a flour tortilla with a good amount of brisket inside. Nothing else. This is for the purists. I loved the flavor, taste and smells. I ate in the outdoor area on a picnic table. Every other table is closed off for social distancing. A properly masked employee came by frequently to clean the tables. All inside employees were practicing safety in regards to the pandemic. This location has a small general store with the usual convenience store items including tea, coffee and pop. Popular place as a lot of traffic came and went while I was there. I bought a T-Shirt to take home with me along with a container of their rub. I wish they had places like this in the Puget Sound area. Definitely worth trying.

Greatly service. Everyone was sooo friendly. The food is great as always. They immediately offered a high chair and did a a wipe down every table right away as well as the high chair which is a huge plus. Brisket moist is amazing it's fattier and worthwhile. My sausage was a bit cold but I don't know if it's their fault or mine so I won't take off a star. I was afterall feeding an infant while eating so who knows. The beans were piping hot and I mean temperature wise and spice level they were amazing. I wish I had gotten 2. Creamed corn too die for. Potato salad was good just a little heavy on the mayo this time around. Overall I thoroughly enjoyed the food and the customer service. Kudos.
Mission accomplished! Thank you for sharing your experience.

I actually think Rudy's is the most underrated BBQ in Texas. I always get a solid, delicious meal here, and I honestly can't say the same for all of the supposedly high end options around Austin. I do wish the sides here were a bit better/fresher, but overall I really love Rudy's!

Rudy's has been awesome! I visit for double brisket tacos at the 620/4Points location and I can get gallon jugs of tea with no lines ! I visit around 1-2 times a week! A coworker loves them too( I bring breakfast) .

I was once offered to split some Franklin's for a party. My response was, "why don't we order Rudy's instead?"The other person balked at me and told me Rudy's was trash. I was enlivened with rage and In utter shock! I do have some law education, and in that instant, I took it upon myself to defend Rudy's for dear life!The thing in, Rudy's is a whole lifestyle. The BBQ is cheap and mouthwatering good. As a native Texan and Austinite, I am often a pariah at parties when I say I've never been to Franklin's. "Why would I when I have Rudy's?"And that's the truth. Once you have Rudy's BBQ, you won't want to eat anything else.Also, I live across from a Rudy's, which has proven dangerous more times than I can count.
Austin, TX 78759

Okay... I like Rudys for in-a-pinch-what-to-eat spots. It's fast - in and out quickly - and fresh. But, it's pricey for roadside brisket. I find the bark too peppery so frequently I cut off this otherwise delicacy. Sides are meh. Always get moist. Haven't tried sausage but it seems to be a favorite. Last order they forgot sauce, but I rarely use it anyway. The meat is the treat!
For breakfast tacos and a barbecue place, the quality is consistently good.  Definitely a place where I often get breakfast from.
Very good customer service. Helps the front desk girl was cute and upsold me on merchandise. Foods always great. Sending a box back home so I can taste it in California.

Love the food, love the service. While it's a chain, Rudy's is a great place to grab some quick Texas BBQ. Lines can get long at lunch and at dinner but it moves quick.  The parking lot is very large, so I didn't have a problem finding a space. Got their Brisket Moist, Hottie (jalapeno sausage link), Turkey Breast; and as side, I got their Cream Corn, Coleslaw, and Potato Salad. The brisket was great. I decided to take some back home because I know I would be craving some more the next day. Overall, while there are other BBQ joints in the area, and some may be better, Rudy's has a good balance of convenience, taste, and price.
I think their prime rib is excellent. It is a great way to get prime rib on a moderate wallet. They have discontinued it during COVID. Hope it comes back. I love all their side dishes.

Useless person delivering the pickup orders tonight. She tells my wife she gave our order to someone else but it was correct now. We were concerned about the food being in someone else's car and she said no we made it all new. Well OK... if they did it was ALL wrong. 3/4ths of the $60 order was missing. Couldn't tell because it was in a huge bag. Now we are home, can't go back up there. kids are settled.

Hi Michael, we are very sorry to hear about the customer service you received and that your order was missing items. Our Area Director would like an opportunity to reach out to you directly. Do you mind emailing us at reviews@rudys.com?

As much as I give other BBQ spots a try now and then, our go-to BBQ spot is Rudy's! It's hard to beat! Consistency of their brisket is unparalleled, their sides are all delicious, and their BBQ sauce is my favorite in town. Service is always on point as well. Not fancy, unpretentious, consistently good and easy peasy.

We love Rudy's Bbq! We just moved to the area and wanted to check out this location.We went on a Saturday and they were pretty busy! This location is special because they have one of the biggest outdoor spaces I have seen that's enclosed! We prefer to sit outside because our toddler is Autistic in case he has meltdowns its better not to disrupt anyone else.They were super helpful in offering suggestions and explaining things.Im from California so sometimes I feel overwhelmed with texas bbq lol.But I have to say Rudy's is pretty amazing! We ordered 2 lbs of moist brisket which was so good it has a lot of pepper and salt so make sure you love salt and pepper!also we ordered the half chicken and sausage.Everything was really good.And also I love their sauce it's peppery with a kick to it.My husband wants to drink the sauce all the time.
Pflugerville, TX 78660

Yes, the BBQ at Brotherton's is great, and if you are in the area, by all means come here to get your smoked brisket, sausage, and rib fix. Prices are a bit spendy, but the quality of the meats and the friendly service are in line with any other independent 'cue joint in Central Texas. Plus, they are good neighbors and are always contributing to help others in Pville, such as feeding hundreds of seniors for free when Covid lockdowns began.The reason I'll be back again and again are the excellent sides, sandwiches, and other dishes that aren't available elsewhere, most with a bonus spicy TexMex, Cajun, or Asian influence. Take the South Texas Barbacoa Boudin, made with spicy beef cheeks and Spanish rice - so delicious and unexpected for this Cajun Country-raised girl.The collard greens are hands down the best I've ever had outside of my own childhood home. My mama always cooked them low and slow with ham hock or pork neck bones, then served with spicy pepper vinegar. Brotherton's taste just like hers but with the spicy-sour component already cooked in. If you can't stand hot/spicy, these aren't for you, but I absolutely love them.Creamy Green Chile Hominy? Get outta here! Sooooo good. The only dish outside of traditional stewed pozole that would make me want to eat this weird cooked corn nut.Homemade fresh dill pickle slices - perfection.I haven't yet tried the shredded brisket nachos or any of the myriad of distinctive burgers & sandwiches, but the hundreds of love letters you can read in other reviews speak to their quality.Follow on social channels to see the daily specials and latest Covid-19 impact on service. Note, they often sellout by 3pm, so get your order in early.
Always have great food here! Love the burgers and green chili mac the best! Love the adjustments they've made to keep serving during COVID.

John Brotherton makes some awesome barbecue. I've eaten there so many times and each time it's absolutely delicious. He generally has different things in the menu from time to time and just keeps it exciting. His brisket, ribs, sausage it's all on point. He makes his own pickles.Another really cool thing about the owner is he totally supports all local businesses even other barbecue places he's totally about the community!!! A rising tide lifts all boats and that's exactly the effect that John Brotherton has on the community.If you want a nice place to go on a date night check out his other restaurant called Liberty BBQ in Round Rock.
Brotherton's. What can I say that hasn't already been said. They will turn a vegetarian into a lover of smoked meats.This is my go-to for BBQ

The only thing better than the BBQ and service at this place, is how amazing the owner is with giving back to the community.  If you are reading this, and you order the last bites of the newest side (cornbread casserole), we will have issues.  :) LOVE this place!
Sold out of food at 3:00. Closes at 8. I just call that piss poor planning. If you can't gauge it better than that just stop.
It's fine. A little pricey, under-seasoned, adequate. But with so much great bbq  around, not really worth a trip.
Never even knew this place existed and I work right up the road. The food was phenomenal! I'll definitely be back now that I have a favorite new bbq spot in Austin!!

This is a solid BBQ spot. The meat is spot on and the sides are interesting and delicious. Have the corn casserole. You'll be transported back to Sunday dinners after church and remember your first crush.Also, the graphic design of this place is top notch.
column21: North Austin Civic Association, Austin, TX

column20: Pflugerville, TX 78660

I saw an episode of Day Tripper and they raved about the scratch made Reuben so i had to have one.  Sure glad i did 'cause it surpassed my expectations, the bar is always set high at Brotherton's and they did not disappoint.  Wifey had a link of stellar sausage with two sides, hatch mac n cheese and tater salad.  I being the glutton i am had to try a piece of punkin sheet cake...yum!  My Reuben was the brightest star among many and the best part was we had plenty of leftovers for a second tasty meal.

Wifey and i showed up at 11:30 am on a Saturday and there were still plenty of seats available, during the week you need to get here early 'cause they fill up fast.!  My wife found out you can order any sammy without the bread if you wanna low carb it, she did, not me because I wanted the full sensory experience....it was worth it.  I had the Pflugerville Pfilly and after giving my baby a taste sans bread...I had to fight her for the rest.  She loved her grilled cheese n brisket sammy.... minus the sammy part.....but she coveted mine more.

This was our first but not last visit...since they expanded...lots more seats inside and out...same awesome food.  My wife and only remaining boss enjoyed and shared one our regulars...the Cuban Sammy, I enjoyed a Texas take on the Vietnamese Bahn Mi...an amazing brisket Bahn Mi, I topped  it off with the last piece of green chilli apple pie...me likey a lot!   Love all their Brotherton branded BBQ sauces...made by Mkey V's in G'town.  I posted lots of pics...there will be a test later.....

I would deduct points for smallness of their location...but the foods too good.  My wife and I met some nice ladies while cohabiting a table and we shared foodie stories.  My wife enjoyed a huge Pville Philly cheesesteak Sammy and I enjoyed and disassembled a brisket sammich that you could tell had been touched by some Brotherton magic.  I need to try some of the mango slaw on my next visit.

One of the bestest Cuban Sammys we've ever eaten, very tasty bread and the meats were full of flavor and oh so tender.  I also enjoyed a hot cup of Ruta Maya roasted coffee.  Thanks to my fellow Yelpers for info on this place and Christian and Alex from Quinoa Grill...they highly recommended this place.  Any place that has an assortment of sauces that include Mikey V's Habanero sauce has got to be good.

Brisket was moist with a good flavor as well as the jalepeno sausage.  1/2 pound meat plate with 2 sides was $18.00.  Add a drink and it's about $20.00 for a meal.   Liked the Austin vibe as music posters and '80's rock tunes piped through the dining areas.  Took one star off secondary to staff attitude.  Not very friendly or welcoming.  If I were to guess, it appeared  they all had a fight before they opened.

The owner contacted me a while back and rather than apologize for the bad quality of his food and the jacked up pricing of his bbq, he chose to insult me and said I "don't know what good bbq" is and that I "get what I pay for." No sir! That attitude will NOT do. I wouldn't go back to Brotherton's if it was the only bbq place in the area. That place is ratchet in a rundown strip mall in a forgotten corner of Pflugerville. Bill Miller BBQ tastes waaay better, they never run out of food like Brotherton's, are inexpensive and you get huge portions, and they also treat you better.

Waaaay overpriced for location and menu offerings. So I went in hungry for bbq, thinking it would be inexpensive since it is located in a rundown strip mall. I gazed at the menu, and chose a bbq brisket sandwich. I saw that it was $10.99 and I assumed it came with a drink and some french fries. Was dismayed when a smallish sandwich with more bread than meat was brought to the counter. I asked where were the sides and was told that they are extra, as well as a drink would be extra too. I was flabbergasted that I had paid almost $12 (incl tax) for a small ok tasting brisket sandwich. I opted never to go back. I would rather go the Bill Miller's on I-35 and Wells Branch. Their bbq, sides, and drinks are tastier AND less expensive!

I went here in search of a new place to get my bbq fix, and, I was craving some smoked chicken.  Unfortunately, these guys don't have chicken!!  That's right. It's a bbq joint that doesn't have CHICKEN.  I was so disappointed.  Instead of chicken I got the two meat plate with ribs and brisket.  It came with two sides and I got the mac-n-cheese and asian cucumber salad.I enjoyed the asian salad and pickled onions much more than the mac-n-cheese.  The mac-n-cheese was very thick and didn't have much flavor going on.  You definitely need water to swallow that stuff.  My brisket was just ok as it was a bit on the dry side.  The ribs definitely saved the day here.  I was pleased with the ribs for sure, and, would definitely go back just to have them again.Can I say that I am a fan?  Not yet.  I will go back and try them again for sure.  Not having chicken is a real show stopper for me though.  Sad face. :(  Maybe they will bring it back.  A resurrection of the cock?  Come on guys it's good protein. Especially after a good workout.
Pflugerville, TX 78660

Gotta admit - a bit disappointedRead the reviews and thought this place was gonna rock it, but I wasn't overly impressed. First let me say the staff is super friendly and genuinely seemed happy that we were there. I had the brisket nachos. The staff said they were amazing and they are really good, but way too many chips. I think literally 1/2 the chips had nothing on them. Not even a drip of cheese or meat. The ones that had something were awesome. My wife had brisket and it's good. Imo average or a bit higher.  Beats many of the Austin chain places. If I'm in the area, I will be back because I want to try other items.
I love the boudin and the brisket cheese sandwich is awesome...

Oh my goodness.. the Brisket here is pretty great. We were blessed with the brisket ends and it took me to flavor town as soon as I took a bite of it. It had a good amount of fat and seasoning.I also had the Banh Mi here and I have to say it's pretty great. Unfortunately, they ran out of baguette so they made it with a bread roll. Make sure they have baguettes when you grab a Banh Mi! The sandwich tasted great, but it would have absolutely tasted better if it came on the baguette.Don't make the mistake of skipping on the green chili Mac n cheese. Very cheesy with a nice kick to it. What's not to like?!

This food here is very good.  The people who work there are always giving me the shady feeling though but I can't recommend the food high enough.   The brisket grilled cheese, omg so good!   I'd say this is the best brisket I have had here in Texas so far.  Just go

Awesome BBQ and sides. The brisket, Mac n cheese, and cream corn were all excellent. This is a great option for Texas BBQ without having to drive too far out of town. Truly delicious, feel-good food. I'll definitely be back.

I'm new to the area; I finally dined in! My other attempts, they were "sold out" or closed. The atmosphere was nicer than imagined then my true experience in the food. I ordered a chopped brisket sandwich; it was a generous size & so delicious. The barbecue sauce was excellent, and of course I tried their popular banana pudding, unlike any other yet mouth watering- get ready for a treat! I'll be returning.

I'm new to the area and finally dined in today. On my first attempt, by 4:00 p.m., they were "closed" due to a sign posted on the door "sold out"! My visit today was worth returning to find a friendly staff, a very comfortable setting, the food was above my expectations. I loved their barbecue sauce, it was one of the best I've tasted. My husband & I were both pleased with their brisket, be sure you order the banana pudding. It's unlike what I've had before however it was most delicious! I'll definitely return.

Brotherton's Black Iron Barbecue was our third stop for the day on our barbecue safari, and it was good. We ordered pork ribs (they do a St. Louis cut), brisket, sausage, and a Nashville hot chicken sandwich. The ribs were some of the best we had on our trip. The brisket was moist and tasty. The sausage had a smaller grind than many of the other barbecue joints, and tasted more like a kielbasa. Only the chicken sandwich was disappointing. It was horrible--soggy coating, no flavor.Stick with the barbecue basics at Brotherton's and you won't be disappointed.
Best BBQ around! Brisket grill cheese should be illegal it's so good. The spicy sausage hits the spot. I go way too often!
Pflugerville, TX 78660

Ribs, brisket, green chili mac n cheese, banana pudding!Not cheap but good bbq- (includes 2 sides)3 meat (3/4 lb) $19.002 meat (1/2 lb) $15.00*PORK RIBS- not necessarily fall off the bone, but they were tender and flavorful. Good amount of meat on the bones and not fatty. Hub's favorite over the jalapeno sausage and brisket. Got 2 ribs*BRISKET- kind of lean with a fatty edge (seemed leaner than Rudy's moist brisket). SIL's favorite meat over the sausageJALAPENO SAUSAGE- pretty good sausage w/ firm casing. A tad spicy.BRISKET GRILLED CHEESE $10- this was pretty good but not mind-blowing. I added bbq sauce. Still recommend.BRISKET AND KIMCHI BANH MI $10- tried some of my bro's. It was tasty and spicy, good bread.*GREEN CHILI MAC N CHEESE- definitely enjoyed this!WASABI COLESLAW- very pronounced wasabi flavor, just a tad of a nasal burn but not really that strongMASHED POTATOES- tried my mom's, white gravy was goodCREAMED CORN- not as sweet as I like, but comparable to Rudy's, I think. Usually we make our own creamed corn for the holidays and add more sugar*NANNER PUDDING (banana pudding) $4- i thoroughly enjoyed this which was full of wafers and bananas. Not too sweet actually. Hubs and SIL thought the pudding was very banana-like, but I thought it was vanilla pudding w/ a lot of bananas (i dislike artificial tasting banana flavored pudding/candy/etc)STRAWBERRY PIE $4- i expected a fruit pie, however this is like a whipped cream strawberry flavored mousse pie w/ marshmallows and maybe graham crackers or something mixed in. Definitely sweet, it was good.

This place is a hidden gem! It's inconspicuously located in a small strip plaza, kind of hard to spot until you notice all of the smoking pits and trailers on the side of the building. They smoke some seriously delicious meat here, but it doesn't stop there. Then they incorporate that high quality smoked meat into unique and glorious works of sandwich art! I hadthe brisket and Kimchi banh mi with smoked brisket, house made kimchi, mango serrano sauce, kimchi aioli, sliced cucumber and cilantro on locally made baguette - it was super delicious, but kind of hard to eat. I think if the switch the hard baguette for the more typical French-Vietnamese bread that crispy on the outside but airy and fluffy on the inside it would work a lot better. But overall super tasty!My sister had the B.O.B - brisket on brioche, she loved the flavor of the meat and the tenderness. For sides we got the green chili Mac and cheese and the Asian cucumber salad, both had great portion sizes and incredibly unexpected tasty side options.So many more sandwiches to try so few meals in the day!
Great Texas bbq. Ribs and brisket are the best and they take care of gluten-free needs exceedingly well.

Always on point! Very unique flavors with everything I've had here. The first time I came I could hardly wrap my head around the wonderful flavor  profiles that we're going on. I even told my wife that the flavors were dancing  all over my taste buds. The Reuben is the bomb.The wasabi coleslaw is epic. I can't say too many good things about  Brotherton's. When I moved to Pflugerville it was the first place I checked out. They set the standard insanely  high for anywhere else we went after them. I'm so happy to support this local spot!

Another trip to the coast, another stop in Central Texas for some great BBQ. This time, it is Brotherton's Black Iron BBQ. Eschewing my normal ritual of sampling all the main meats (forgive me, oh BBQ gods), I decided to try their famous sandwiches instead. Of all the great options, we went with the Brisket Banh Mi and Turkey Pesto. Both sandwiches come in a hefty serving, not skimping on either meat or bread. The meats in both were also delicious and smoked to perfection. Despite my love for brisket, I felt the smoked turkey Brotherton's has here is probably some of the best I've ever hard, and slightly outdid the Brisket Banh Mi. Both were enough to fill The Wife and I up and it is refreshing to see a BBQ place step out on a ledge and try something new.  So, we will definitely be back to Brotherton's, to either try more of their unique sandwich creations or just a sampling from the Holy Trinity.

High quality BBQ. Artisan BBQ.  Craft BBQ.  Whatever you want to call it, the Austin area has been getting more and more places for better BBQ.  And now, Pflugerville has Brotherton's for an upscale BBQ option.  I'd been meaning to try them and when a friend suggested lunch, I jumped at the opportunity to give them a try. First of all, I appreciated the spacious restaurant area.  Even with the lunch rush, there was plenty of room to find a table.  And the line moved efficiently. (I think the idea of serving the meat plates from the line and taking sandwich orders to be brought out is a stroke of genius.)Let's talk about the food. My brisket was slightly above average.  There was a beautiful bark, the fat was rendered, and a nice smoke ring.  Unfortunately, there wasn't a strong hint of smoke or seasoning, especially in comparison to the appearance. The ribs were the meat highlight for sure.  The ribs were cooked to the right temperature and the seasoning was a welcome combination of sweetness with a hint of spice. The green chili mac and cheese tasted exactly like macaroni noodles served with queso.  The sauce was also a welcome accompaniment to the meats.  However, the spicy bbq sauce available at the condiment table was a real disappointment. Both my friend and I are native Texans and very used to spicy food.  However, this spicy sauce was overwhelmingly hot to the point of harshness which took away from any other flavor.  Brotherton's is pretty good BBQ if you're looking for a bite in Pflugerville.  But there are even better options around the Austin area.
Great spot to drop by if you're in the Pflugerville area. Love the bread and moist brisket on their sandwich. Solid 6/10

OMG we loved everything about this place!!! The employees:Extremely accommodating and friendly. Lots of places lose their touch because of this reason right here. Great customer service just makes the food taste better! Thank you guys for your amazing hospitality from the moment we walked in until we left!The food:In short, we're going home and take a nap because the food coma is coming! Everything was amazing! I got the philly....and DAMN! We had loaded fries which were amazing sand my husband got the brisket grilled cheese. All amazing and we'd get them all again! The atmosphere:Very clean and neat (minus the parents who let their kids make a huge mess while eating and didn't clean it). There are TVs to watch the games and music in the background. You order on one side and seat yourself wherever on the other side.I'd recommend it! The way we determine a place is good or not is if we agree to go again. Needless to say, we'll be back! LOVED IT!

First time here and was really impressed.  Ordered the four meat plate (brisket, turkey, boudin, and pork ribs) which comes with two sides.  My mate and I split the plate with mac n cheese & slaw as our sides.  Saw a bunch of pics on Yelp with shrimp etouffee boudin, but it wasn't on the menu. I asked about it but staff said they didn't have it.  So maybe a seasonal thing? They sell beer too, but don't expect an extensive menu.   They have an open condiment bar- pickles, pickled jalapeno, pickled red onion, bread, sauce, etc.  I really loved that!  Often times places will charge you for that, so having it for free is a big plus.  10/10 will go again.
Pflugerville, TX 78660
This place has the best BBQ in the area. My Dad came to visit and fell in love with their Brisket. Made him wanna be a better grill master himself, lol

I had the grilled cheese brisket and the cheese steak sandwich here. They were both delicious. The grilled cheese brisket sandwich was very scrumptious and the brisket inside of it was quite delectable. This is a very good grilled cheese sandwich. The Pfluggerville cheesesteak was also delicious. I highly recommend both of these sandwiches. I'm looking forward to returning to try some of the other menu items.

Best Texas BBQ! We got the four meat plate-tender brisket, pulled pork, jalapeño cheddar sausage, and smoked turkey breast..amazing Mac and cheese and potato salad for our sides. Sweet tea was so good! I only wish I lived closer so I could frequent this place. You'll be so glad you checked it out!

All the brisket!!! All day long!! I am not a bbq person, but I really enjoy the food here. The brisket is super flavorful and moist. I highly recommend the brisket grilled cheese. All the desserts have been delicious. I really enjoyed their lemon blueberry cobbler. It's sweet and has just enough tartness.

Place had been on my to do for years, just kinda off the beaten path and never had the chance to make it out this way. The opportunity finally arose and several of us stopped in on our way to see a game in Austin.About noon on a Saturday, no line, but the inside was at least half full of customers already eating. Scoped the menu out quickly, didn't realize they had so much "off BBQ" type items. I decided, even though first time in, I would grab the Smoked Pastrami Reuben just because it sounded so good. I also got a few ribs, and some of the green chili mac n cheese. Most of the other got meat plates.While waiting for my sandwich I started on the ribs. Really tender, moist, great taste, just a little sweet, and good bark taste. Really good ribs. The reuben was really good also. Seemed like the right amount of sauce, along with house made kraut, swiss on some good Rye bread. It was really good, and a nice size sandwich, I could only finish half after I'd eaten the ribs. The green chili mac n cheese was the best I've had that I can remember.The others in the group commented about how good the cream corn, beans and wasabi cole slaw was. We all agreed some of the best sides around. Most everyone else got brisket and ribs, and everyone agreed this was all around some really good bbq.Prices were right. They offer bbq plate combos with sides, or meat by the pound. They have some interesting sandwiches they sell. I might not make it out here very often, maybe never again. But I would come back in a heartbeat if the opportunity arises in the future.

I love everything about this place...brisket is amazing, Reuben is the best I've ever had. And that brisket grilled cheese is the bomb! But my absolute favorite? The wasabi cole slaw, y'all! I sneeze my way through it but it's 100% worth it!

Better then Franklins..........Need I say more?In a non-assuming strip mall location sits Brotherton's Black Iron BBQ. When you exit your car you will be hit by the scent or dare I say perfume of smoked meat.  Let it be known if you go to any smoked meat shop and you don't smell this scent..... get back in your car and leave.I hurried to the front of the line and quickly ordered the two meat plate. I waked a away with a plate full of brisket and pork ribs. The ribs were perfectly smoked, moist, tender, dry rubbed with a hint is sweetness.The slices of brisket were firm enough to hold its shape yet very very tender. The brisket had just the right amount of moistness and smoked flavor. I found the house bbq sauce to be delightfully sweet without being over bearing.

The brisket grilled cheese is awesome! I personally am not a fan of brisket but it's definitely on point. The turkey is too dry for me but you don't go to a bbq place for turkey. The sandwich choices are really good! The brisket nachos are also good. The sides options are okay. The Mac and cheese was good but heavy. The mashed potatoes I like and the coke slaw are good but nothing to write home about.

On our list to try for quit some time and we are glad we visited.Short line that moved quickly...Staff was super nice!!...Wife went with a 2 meat plate with Brisket and Sausage...Mine was the same expect I added some ribs as well. Brisket had great tasting Bark...What fat there was melted away...yet not much smoke and/or flavor. Sausage was good...Ribs were the highlight for us..meaty, great smoke...definitely could have eaten a few dozen of those. Sides were outstanding...Green Chile Mac-n-Cheese and Cream Corn were delish! Mine were just plain exciting...Something unique and off the wall..A cold BBQ style pasta salad and a Wasabi Slaw. Both were awesome!!..I couldnt get enough of that slaw!...What really got our attention is the table next to us had ordered sandwiches...The were stacked!!...and this is what will bring us back. Hope to visit soon!

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Austin, TX 78719

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Wow! If only all airport food was given this kind of love and craftsmanship. My husband ordered the brisket platter and I was worth every penny. Brisket was Smokey and perfectly cooked. The bbq sauce was unique and complimented the meat well. The coleslaw was delicious and the baked beans were great. There is a good tap and wine selection as well.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Very kind attendant9$ leaky beer - 1/3 lost to leak from cupAnd $4 tiniest Side of somewhat uncooked potato salad as a meal - that took 10 min to bring outThank you for ensuring this customer will always go elsewhere

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Great airport food.The service was super nice and the brisket sandwich was wonderful. Unfortunately, we ate the sandwich so quickly, the picture is of an empty container.Or one can appreciate that it was so good that we ate it before the camera was thought of!

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: This review only reflects the Austin airport terminal Salt Lick. When I've been to the Driftwood or Round Rock/Plugerville Salt Lick locations they don't automatically drown the brisket with sauce, you get an option to add it on at table or you can have them add it in the line. The airport location has flimsy plastic utensils that do a horrible job on sliced brisket, which is usually one of Salt Lick's stellar choices. This brisket was not tender like the usual Salt Lick brisket, the weak utensils, and customer service just herding people through and automatically covering everything sloppily made today's experience at Austin Airport Salt Lick a bad one. You can do better. Hopefully next time I'm here things will have improved and I'll reflect it in a new review.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: All good things must come to an end...1) They removed the little stand that was by the stage. It's now Earl Campbell's...2) Salt Lick is further down in its own area. They still sell breakfast tacos which are now pathetic3) they have SIGNIFICANTLY increased the prices. Cold tortillas...no longer spicy salsa...brisket tacos are an extra $2 on top of the $8.50 charge for 2. All good things must come to an end :(

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Anytime I have a layover in Austin, I head STRAIGHT to the taco stand. Forget the bathroom.Forget the water bottle refill.Egg & Brisket Tacos OR!Just any tacos....with extra salsa.Plenty of seating, reasonable prices (airport food is always more expensive), and great portions.I've been here when service is fast. I've been here when service is slow. It's not consistent, but the taste is every time.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: 100th review wohoo!!! Plane and simple... I will miss my flight to eat here. Definitely worth the line! Breakfast tacos and burritos are delicious.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Alright so here we go..... arrived at the airport at 7pm after all the restaurants were closed down because my flight was delayed. Walked the entire airport looking for dinner. Came across this restaurant because they were cleaning up but stated they still had food to sell. So they tell me they only have plates and sandwiches. My son was starving and we opted to get a plate because it had potato salad and beans of which I decided to eat since I do not eat meat. We get the platter and there's no potato salad because they forgot to mention that they were out of it and also provided us with some cold used ass beans. There was about three pieces of brisket cut in half. My son did say the flavor was good but there's no way on earth I would purchase again. Wouldn't pay $22 for this mess.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: The brisket was very good. The sausage had potential of being good but it was so cold we couldn't taste the flavor. Everything else on the platter was not good. The potato salad was gross with a weird texture, the beans were under seasoned and the coleslaw was okay. There was no toast or butter on the bread. It was just a piece of cold Texas toast. Another thing that was disappointing was, the food was cold and sloppily put together. There was hardly any bbq sauce on the meat. To think, one brisket platter, adding sausage and two waters were $37. Yikes! Never again!We would not frequent this place on our trip back to Austin.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Austin, TX 78719

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: About 20 miles outside Austin you'll find one of the best barbecue restaurants in the state. Room for well over 200 cars the restaurant probably holds three or 400 people. The service was great and the food was fast and outstanding. It'll definitely be one of the places I go to when I go back to Austin. Scot Abplanalp

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: BEST Brisket Burger I've ever had!! It was quality meat, Smokey, perfectly salted, cheesy, and quite filling.  It's definitely not like other traditional burgers. Incredibly the burger was a great size and made to order. You don't find that often from airport food. And their bbq sauce was phenomenal! So phenomenal I bought some to take home. I hope they never change the recipe. Even the tater salad was one of the better ones we tried out of many bbq places we visited in Austin. I was sad that this airport restaurant didn't carry macaroni and cheese. It made me kick myself for not going to the main Salt Lick outside Austin city. We knew this place was gonna be tasty when we saw all the pilots grab lunch here. I'm so ecstatic that we made time to stop and eat before the flight.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Not sure if this is a famous chain, or local joint. However, saw the place open, was good. I love bbq. And was a bit thrown off by the dry pork, Had to get extra bbq sauce. Ordered a brisket sandwich and i got a pull porn sandwich... it happens, flavor was good, just a bit dry, even the side of potato saldad was on the dryer side. Did notice a airport worker ask if the potato salad was hard today? Then explained that sometimes it on the dryer side... so that made me feel a bit better knowing that in was not being extra picky. I repeat, food was good. Would go back. BBQ Brisket

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: $19 for sliced brisket. Beware what you ask for. I got pure fat and charred firm meat. I asked if they have fatty brisket and they said they did so I ordered the combo with potato salad, baked beans and the sliced brisket to go as I had a flight to catch. The first serving I got was all the lean part of the brisket. I told the server, "this is all the flat part of the brisket. " He took it back and returned with new pieces. I peeked inside and saw what appeared to be the point part of the brisket so went on to my flight. Brisket: 1 star. Unfortunately, the top piece was the only point fatty brisket and it was very charred and firm on the other side (felt misled). The other 3 pieces under were pieces of flat that had 2 inches of pure untrimmed fat on top and barely any meat. Inedible. Potato salad 1 star: The potato salad was undercooked (I like the potatoes in salad firm but not almost crunchy as this was). Baked beans 3 stars. The baked beans were normal baked beans. Service 1 star. Although the service wasn't unfriendly, I was misled and dismissed. This brisket was made in Texas, albeit in an airport. But If you don't have good fatty point brisket, please inform the customer. I would have rather stuck with the flat.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Had the big Tx breakfast Burritos, was delicious and left me wanting another, perfect meal for the upcoming 5hr flt, if you are in the airport and want a but of BBQ don't hesitate to try THIS!!!!!!!!

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: It could be better! My girlfriend and I went here out of curiosity since we ran out of time to try the original Salt and Lick Bbq location in Austin. The terminal wouldn't do justice, however we did it anyway. Of course, the ambiance will be sort of a fast food scene since it is inside the airport. Although, the best part of this location is when you're in a hurry to give a souvenir to your love ones. Might as well buy them a frozen brisket for to go! The customer service is great and efficient. It is not bad for a terminal food :)Their brisket was ok, but was kind of dry without their sauce. Granted, it could be just how they heat it up in here compared to their original location. It might have affect the tenderness and texture of their meats. Speaking of that sauce... it was amazingly delicious and it amped their meat 1 star higher. They have different unique sauce flavors to try from Orginal spice to Sweet Pecan. We ordered their sides, but it was disappointing and have no further comment for that. Overall, it is a good spot to buy frozen bbq on the go for your fam and friends :)

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Good, solid barbecue. The brisket was a bit dryer than I was expecting, and the rub didn't seem to have penetrated most of the way through. The sausage was unexpected superb. Service was I love that they have a 'low-carb' option where it's basically just a bunch of slaw and meat. Mmmmmm!Good location near the middle of the terminal. Bathrooms: None. Regular airport bathrooms.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: This is a great location in the Austin airport. The food is fantastic! I loved the smoked brisket (chopped) and the pulled pork. The sausage wasn't very spicy, but they have to make it so it appeals to everyone. Would love to have a hot link option. The sauce is kind of sweet and interesting. Again, it would be nice if they offered their spicy option at the serving line. It's available in bottles, but I didn't see that it was available for customers dining in. The staff was very nice, efficient and friendly. They really looked like they were having fun working and taking care of people. This is a great spot to get a little taste of Austin before you leave (or when you arrive, I suppose). Keep up the good work, Salt Lick!

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: The BBQ isn't bad, just isn't great. The service also isn't bad, but we felt mislead.
