You can't get 2 sides of brisket so we were told that we could do one order and then order brisket on the side but then we were charged $50 for 2 full meals. For the price, it just didn't feel worth it to me. Not much is open at the airport right now (which makes sense) but I still don't recommend ordering a ton of food here because of the value and cost.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Austin, TX 78719

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: It's pretty cool that there's a BBQ spot in the Austin airport, making it the prime spot to get your last-minute Texan meal before heading home.  Many of the locals told me that Salt Lick BBQ was a solid BBQ joint outside of the Austin area, and all of them mentioned that they've never had it in the airport.  But I figured it's worth a try. There was a line that went by quickly.  While in line you can watch one of the employees cut the slices of brisket while two others take your order.  There is a seating area, but expect it to be packed and messy.  Brisket ran out soon after I visited on a Thursday evening.I ordered the two-meat combination plate, which came with potato salad, baked beans and bread.  For my two meats I chose the brisket and sausage.  Ribs are not an option for the combination plates.  Food was meh.  Brisket was tender enough, but it tasted dry and bland.  Sausage was also A-OK.  The meats didn't really impress me.  Potato salad was good with the mustard.  Baked beans were average.  And my piece of bread looked like a hot dog bun without the opening.  I know it's food at the airport and all, but I wouldn't pay 20 bucks for this meal again.  Once you've had the best BBQ, it's hard to compromise, especially at the airport. I'd say if you were in Austin and didn't at all eat BBQ then you can get your fill at this Salt Lick BBQ before flying out.  But did you really visit Austin without having BBQ?  (What's wrong with you?)  Expect airport quality.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Incredible brisket taco.  Jammed packed with egg and brisket.  Very flavorful and filling.  Worth every penny if you are in the airport.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Ordered sausage and egg breakfast taco.  It was $5, but absolutely worth it!  The sausage was delicious!  Complex flavors that danced in the mouth and cooked to perfection.  A huge mound of eggs.  The salsa was sweet, tangy, and complimented the taco.  The taco was so packed it was falling out of the tortilla.  One taco is enough.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Airport BBQ at its best! If you have been to the original location, you know this place knows how to make Texas BBQ. This is definitely a great addition to the Austin airport. Breakfast Tacos!! Texas is known for amazing breakfast tacos, this restaurant doesn't disappoint. Lunch/Dinner... you are in Texas, Brisket is the way to go! Sausage or ribs are number two on that list! Don't forget the potato salad and beans!

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: I had three separate BBQ visits in Austin but it was airport food at the departure hall that tasted the best to me. I mean the other places were all good but a bit salty for my taste, so ironically, Salt Lick BBQ was my favorite. I don't believe there is a "best" bbq in Austin. The best is what a particular person enjoys. I've read so many reviews and opinions that I've decided there is no best, maybe 'favorite' would be a better choice of words. The brisket I had was moist and tender, with the flavor really coming through those thin slices. Their sausage was good too and made the whole "platter" really satisfying. I was tempted to pack home a whole brisket and glad I didn't because of a 3 hour flight delay. Hoping to get to one of their pit locations on another visit.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: The BBQ is good no doubt but the confusing menu sucks. Go ahead and try to order a double brisket with a chopped beef for a 3 meat plate. Even though that is a  like a $21 plate that's going to be asking way to much. Like really $21 bucks can't make that happen? How lame is that ? Your asking for way to much beef and not enough filler! Come on man (Joe Biden accent) really? Jeese Louis, $21 bucks for a plate and that's asking too much? It's good but not that good! Wish y'all the best...

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Only reason I gave 3 stars, is because the meat was great. The baked beans were horrible, the prices were outrageous. I guess that's understandable because it's an airport, but there's should be a limit to how much you can charge with so little food. I give props to the cooks for the meat, but the baked beans taste like just pinto beans in a non flavor sauce.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: This was pretty bad BBQ. I know its in the airport and I should have known better, but the Salt Lick had a reputation for quality, and I was in Austin so for one last meal, I thought I should give them a try.   For $19 the paper thin sliced BBQ brisket was smothered in their sauce.  When a BBQ place puts the sauce on for you, they are generally trying to cover up something and that was the case here.  I was not allowed to choose whether I wanted the lean or the point (more flavorful) part.   The beans, potato salad and the slaw tasted like they came out of a can - nothing freshly prepared here. The servers are automatons, no smiles, just taking orders and filling them as quickly as they can. Salt Lick - I am sure you can do better with a little more attention to detail.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Tl;dr: Great bbq in an airport?! You better believe it.Salt Lick BBQ in the Austin airport hands-down beat out my in-restaurant experience at Black's BBQ (near UT Austin). +FOOD+---Pork ribs (5 STARS): The meat was tender and that bbq sauce was heavenly. These ribs hit the right combination of fat, meat, and smoke. Just wow.---Beef brisket (4 stars): The brisket was so, so tender!! How?! The flavor of the brisket was not as meaty or memorable as the pork ribs, but still some great meat.---Sides (3.5 stars): The potato salad is slightly above average good, and the beans are solid. The bread was a little disappointing-- I would have preferred a plain piece of soft white bread instead of the roll. The coleslaw was average... not creamy with more of a vinegar taste.+EXPERIENCE+Food took maybe 10-15 minutes to come out? Just fyi in case you're trying to make a tight connection! I hope I get to fly through the Austin airport again sometime soon, so I can have Salt Lick bbq!Date visited: 8/25/19

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Austin, TX 78719

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Bacon not cooked all the way. You'd think for a $5 breakfast taco I'd get cooked bacon. You can get anywhere in Austin and get a fully loaded and cooked breakfast taco for under $3. I was charged  $5 for a bottle of water. 3 stars is for the nice employee who gave me a cooked piece. It says they aren't open, but they do serve breakfast.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Arrived at 1 pm on a sunday 4/28/19. Had a 4 hour layover so I decided to eat here at 3:30 so I can take my time eating just before  boarding at 4:30. Line was really long and I heard of these guys before so I was looking forward to what they have to offer.So I ended up getting the 3 Meat Platter($18.99) so I can sample as many meats as I can. Comes with potato salad, coleslaw, and beans. Your choices of meat are brisket, sausage, pulled pork, chopped beef, and turkey. I was disappointed that the ribs werent one of the choices. I even asked if i could at least order one rib on the side so I can try it but the cashier said you cant do that unless your order both as plates. So what I got was pulled pork, chopped brisket, and sliced brisket. They put a couple drops of bbq sauce on there so I had to go get some more. They have them ready to go in little cups. Another disappointment is that the only choice you have is their original bbq sauce. From what I noticed you can purchase bottles of their bbq sauce in either original or spicy. So why not have both available? Btw, their sauce is vinegar based so if you are not into that then be fore warned. It's alright with me but not my first choice.As for the taste it was decent. You can taste the smokiness in every bite. I gotta admit though, the pulled pork tasted just like the brisket. A little bit of dryness was evident too. So I poured several cups of bbq sauce to get some flavor on there. The sides were just ok as well. Nothing really stood out. The Texas toast they give you is just your basic plain toast. I guess I got spoiled by Raising Canes because the Texas toast they give you is buttered AND toasted.Service was ok. You order at the counter, they give you your receipt with your number that they call for you to pick up. I waited about 10 minutes. Not too bad because the line was pretty long to begin with.In closing, im assuming that the brick and mortar establishments are probably much better. Was thinking I was gonna have leftovers but the meats were just right to fill me up. So if you are really hungry, the two meat platter will not be enough for you. I would also like to mention that the tables you can sit at has electrical outlets so that you can charge your electronic devices. Next time I need to go to one of their restaurant locations.Yelp 2019 Review #23764 overall

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: How can you label this place as having vegan options? There's literally animal in everything!

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Oh this was SO much better as a smaller limited item spot next to the stage. Now that they have a mini restaurant a few gates away the quality has completely gotten away from them.Had the most expensive two meat BBQ platter I've tasted in Texas and was hugely disappointed. The brisket had the texture of jerky. They are NOT cooking this as thoroughly as they once did. The sausage was good but almost commercial in quality.For sides, the beans rocked but everything else was a complete let down. This is definitely a long term Austin staple that has "sold itself out."Pro-tip: SaltLick STILL has the best BBQ sauce around. Just buy a bottle and take it home. You'll be much happier.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: This was the best airport meal that I have EVER had. I missed a few meals during all the flights, but I don't think the hunger did it. It was served by a very Austin friendly worker behind the counter, had a wonderful brisket flavor and a unique combination all for about the price of a bag of chips & water at one of those rip off stands.I had the Baja Brisket taco. It was the most awesome smoked brisket on a flour tortilla with a nice kicking poblano sauce and crunchy slaw. It absolutely made my day. Pretty good sized (bigger than some of the nearby burgers) and less than $5 bucks. This is going to be my go to spot every time I'm around when they are open.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: I'm sure this place is much better at one of its separate sit down establishment away from the airport.Was hungry before my flight and got a chopped brisket taco and a pulled pork one.The chopped brisket was promising but the set up at the airport was ughThe pulled pork was just a mess.Service can be better, pretty confusing on what you can get and what you can't w/o paying extra.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: After arriving at the Austin airport (AUS) for ACL in October 2019, we were hungry and heard really good reviews for Salt Lick. We were surprised to see there was a location at the airport, so we decided to eat here before picking up our luggage. Their menu made everything look so good, we had trouble deciding what to get! The line was short and we didn't wait long to get our food. We didn't expect much for food at the airport, but we were pleasantly surprised! It was all good. There was limited seating but we luckily found a small spot to stand and to put our food to eat :) And because we decided to eat before getting our luggage, by the time we went to the carousel, they were ready - we didn't have to wait, and just grabbed our luggage and went to get our uber :)

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: A great option for your visit. They make their own sauces for BBQ that are amazing! The lines remind me of Shake shack lines in the NY area. I found a great bar seat and got my plate very quickly. Try the two or three meat so you can experience the variety.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: I wanted to love this place. I've been to some tasty airport foodie outposts and had hopes for Salt Lick BBQ (SLB). I wanted to give it a fair shot. As President Andrew Jackson said, "Any man worth his salt will stick up for what he believes right, but it takes a slightly better man to acknowledge instantly and without reservation that he is in error." I was in error. This wasn't great BBQ. The brisket was dry and over cooked. The sides were "meh." There wasn't much pride behind the counter. I'd skip SLB next time.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Austin, TX 78719

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: A friend recommended Salt Lick as a dining option while a friend of mine and I killed some time at the airport. The food was pretty good, especially for airport food. The price was an airport price, and the service was really disjointed. Hence three stars, right down the middle. Here's the good and the bad.So the food was pretty good. For some reason I was not feeling brisket or other traditional barbecue, so I was pleased to see that a smoked turkey sandwich was an option. The sandwich was huge with thick slabs of turkey on a giant brioche bun. I ate only half of it. But it was good. The potato salad that came with it was also good but a bit on the spicy side for me. My friend got the brisket and seemed to enjoy it.The ordering process here is really the thing that drew most of my negative energy. It's very confusing. It's not very well explained. You have to kind of walk down the side of the counter to where there are two registers with people taking orders. Then when you order you have to make like 9,000 choices. I ordered a turkey sandwich man. I had to then choose sauce or no sauce, drink or no drink, which side, for here or to go, etc etc. It became really clear to me why the line does not move quickly here. Then after I ordered my soda, the guy who took my order left his station, ran behind the counter, served my soda and handed it to me. So inefficient! So once you order, someone else fills your order. They call your number and you go get your food. This was not efficient, you couldn't hear. I don't know, it was just totally disorganized.So decent food, horrible process, $23 for a turkey sandwich, a scoop of potato salad and a soda? Yeah.... I am sorry they got rid of the Schlotzsky's at this airport.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Their other location so was awesome that I got lucky there was a location in the airport. They didn't have ribs until 10AM and I was there early. I got a brisket burrito. Kind of pricy but I won't ever get it again so oh well. It's was a great choice. I was so full I could not finish it

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Way too expensive for all of their items.  Nachos were cheapest at $14 dollars so I got them with brisket.  Barely any brisket even on them.  Good bbq but terribly expensive for what you get.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Surprising to get some good BBQ in the middle of the airport. When I was there the bar was always full and always a line for the grab and go counter. The two meat platter comes with potato salad, slaw AND beans! The sauce on the sausage was a bit spicy but was tolerable . Service at the bar was great.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: In terms of airport food, this place gets 5 stars! It's a meaty, comforting send-off from Austin. And THAT SAUCE. So unique & flavorful... I was tempted to take some of the little containers home with me!The 2 of us shared a 3-meat platter of sliced brisket, pulled pork, and sausage. All of the meat was served in the plate's large compartment, dowsed in their famous sauce. And you can take as many of the little plastic containers as well. Trust me -- you'll want to. The plate also comes with a slice of soft sesame seed-covered bread (perfect to soak up dat sauce), baked beans (which are also bathing in delish sauce), cole slaw, and potato salad.This plate was enough to fill us both up, and sharing made it pretty affordable at around $20. Just be warned: eating at The Salt Lick before your flight may make it even harder to leave Texas!

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Ordered loaded potato and a soda. A few minutes later after I paid they told me they do not have loaded potato. It took quite a while until they canceled and they refunded the potato, but the tip, so I paid well over 5 USD for a soda and zero service.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: It was ok. They were friendly, the sausage and sliced brisket was pretty good, the mustard flavored bbq sauce was yummy... the employees were alright....The parts I didn't like were that everything was ridiculously expensive, like over $20 for a 3 meat bbq plate. I guess that's to be expected?? I don't know. The turkey was extremely dry. I'd always heard such great things about the salt lick I was excited to try it... but it was nothing to write home about.  Honestly I've had much better bbq... at lots of different places.  If I came to the airport again I'd probably get something else, or possibly try their chopped brisket.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Austin has amazing BBQ and folks rave about the original Salt Lick location outside the city. Let is be known that the airport location is not the same. At all. It has such potential. It smells great. It's readily available while you're waiting for your flight. But it does not live up to the hype at all. Rumor has it that they send the food from the original Salt Lick and this location simply keeps it warm all day. If so, that definitely explains the mediocre taste. The brisket is incredibly tough, the turkey has zero flavor, and the potato salad is just bad. It doesn't matter if it's included in the combo, don't get the potato salad. Do yourself a favor and go to a real BBQ place when you're in Austin and skip BBQ at the airport. You owe it to yourself.

column1: The Salt Lick BBQ - Austin Airport
column20: Oh the joy of airport food in the morning, what is better than that?Queue my first and last visit sadly to The Salt Lick BBQ chain. They serve what one would expect from a airport BBQ restaurant in the whee hours (Eggs, biscuit, sausage, et cetera). Most of the food seemed to be cooked from the night before outside of the obvious eggs and biscuits, but they had a huge vat of cold sausages they were warming up. With that seen, I had expected not the finest dining experience, but to be honest, this was a quick eat and go, so I was fine with it. The price point was great, $8.99 for a platter which could fill anyone up quite honestly. When it comes to the flavor, lets just say the food never made it to "flavor town", most items were quite bland, but the sausage had a decent taste to it. As for the restaurant itself, its a pretty decent size depending on which one you visit, the one I had visited had many booths to occupy with a decent bar. On a side note about the bar, it looks like they have plenty of local wine and beer to choose from, which is a plus for those looking for alcohol prior to boarding. Would I bad mouth The Salt Lick BBQ, heck no as I understand their official location outside of Austin lives up to the hype of true Austin BBQ. I think the airport location just does not have all the tools to match the experience of their home base at least in a breakfast scene.
Bastrop, TX 78602

The BBQ here is delicious! However, we did have some difficulty finding this place. It's off of Highway 71, but it no longer looks like the pictures from the previous yelp reviews. If you drive up to the address located on yelp, it will look like a deserted lot with not much going on, but Fitties is indeed OPEN! It's now located in an inconspicuous grey trailer within this lot and it's only open for drive through and with a limited menu. There is no signage or anything, so it might look a little sketch, but don't be alarmed. The owner of the joint was very friendly and let us know that they actually just reopened for business a few days ago, which is probably why there's no sign or anything. Like I said earlier the food is great as well. We'll definitely be coming back next time we stop by Bastrop!
Living in Texas I've had my fair share of BBQ but boy these ribs and brisket are gooooood af

Omg. Finally found a BBQ spot out here. I've tried four other spots in the area and this dominates ! How it beats the others :1 not overly smoked2 served hot3 tender 4 good sauce5 fast service6 NOT DRYAll the other spots had a combo of that list but always seemed to lack somewhere. Not here.

Delicious!! We are on the road to Galveston and drove thru for some chopped beef sandwiches potato salad and beans. Fast and so tasty. I'm a food snob and the potato salad was seasoned very well. Just like I like it. So tasty!!

This review breaks my heart to leave .Owners seem super sweet; but I pride myself in leaving REAL honest reviews. With that being said, this is by far theeeee worse bbq I have ever tasted. First, I absolutely hate bbq sauce on my bbq. Give me mine to the side so I can dip as needed. The first red flag that I ignored was when I got out of my car, I didn't get hit with the smell of smoke‍ Then contrary to the previous reviews of cheap prices I shelled out $18 for a plate of pure disappointment. Y'all! This shit was so gross. The brisket was obviously some precooked/sliced crap that they microwaved. The sausage had absolutely no evidence of ever touching a grill. The rice was sad, those beans were flavorless.... chillllle. The ribs... same sadness. I've worked in the food industry so I understand precooking or reheating leftovers but this was NOT that. Nothing ever hit a grill, it didn't look or taste like it. Bucees has better bbq for the same price. -Very Disappointed
Best bbq - make you feel comfy and welcome AMAZING FLAVOR. Can't wait to come back again

Great cheap food. The food was 4 stars for all the breakfast burritos but they left out part of our order. The prices have gone up but still good for the amount of food. Great grab and run place, just make sure all items from your order are in the bag.

Let me start my review with a disclaimer.I was looking for breakfast and on the menu they list breakfast tacos, breakfast sandwiches, breakfast platters, etc. I went today (2/15/2020 Saturday at 12noon). Excited to try out a couple breakfast tacos and breakfast sandwich, and was informed they stop serving breakfast at 11am.What a huge disappointment. This may have marginally biased my review but I stand by it. But they should definitely serve breakfast all day or at least until late afternoon on weekends.Since I was there, thought I would try their lunch. I ordered a double cheeseburger, fries and a drink ($10 + change). The portion size was good - met my expectations.As for the taste buds, the meal was rather...basic. Not bad, but nothing special either. It satisfied my hunger but missed an opportunity to be amazing. It kinda reminded me of decent cafeteria type food. That's the best way for me to describe it.Pros:- variety of food options for a walk up counter- friendly staff/owners- fast service (about 5 mins)- portion size is goodCons:- doesn't serve breakfast later on weekends- doesn't visibly state breakfast ends at 11am- lacking flavor (not bad, just not memorable)That being said, you should definitely try it for yourself and come up with our own opinion. I will likely try it again for breakfast (served only till 11am) and also BBQ.
This place is sooo good I wish they would partner with DOORDASH already! Come on!!!!!
Bastrop, TX 78602

I was staying at the Happy Horse Hotel (great little place in Bastrop for a charming getaway on a farm!) and the owners recommended I come here for breakfast tacos. Breakfast burrito more like! The taco was huge, with a fresh fired tortilla, brimming with eggs and fillings of my choosing. It felt a little lacking in panache - that is, salt, pepper and anything to take it really over the top. I think some fresh salsa would have helped, but the taco fell apart when I tried to open it (so stuffed) and it was piping hot too. This place has a call ahead option and lots of benches for eating outside, if you'd like. Overall, the food was fine, the ambiance was nill, the portions were huge and the prices were randomly listed and kind of confusing.

Texas bbq is an art form and Fitties has mastered the art. You can taste the slow smoked love in the bbq chicken. And if you don't order the cobbler you are missing out on peach perfection. Great food. Great people. We make the drive from Austin. It's that good.

Not sure how I have missed this place all these years...Being thats it kinda on the outskirts of Down Town Bastrop....Open at 5am Im sure they get a lot of highway traffic.  There is a $15 minimum for Credit card orders...So having to order an extra taco wasnt a problem..Service was prompt and friendly...We went with the Marty, Bacon, Egg and Cheese 2X and a Brisket, Egg and Cheese...The salsa on the side was a nice touch, and very good...Tacos were pipping hot and the eggs has a great fried, griddle taste. This is on our map of place to stop when headed to Bastrop...Lunch will be our next adventure.

Just left fifties and it was ok. They stop serving breakfast tacos at 11am so we got whatever was left over. Which was the jailhouse tacos. That they definitely were...they were ok if you enjoy a lot of stuff in a taco. Not my preference. The salsa wasn't bad. Again not my fav with tomatoes but it was good salsa. We also ordered the brisket and rib with dirty rice and baked beans. The meat itself was delicious. I would prefer the sauce on side. The beans were bland and the rice was alright. So overall it was ok. Try for yourself.
One of the only times in my life brisket has made me go "oh $h!t" damn this is good bbq!!!

It takes some tricky driving from my home over to Fittie's but I would rather move than miss going there. People, I want to tell you this man serves REAL fries. So far, I have eaten a few of their hamburgers and cheeseburgers but today I had the Lucy Special Sandwich. It is the leanest, most tender sliced brisket with onions, pickles and sauce or leave off whichever. I don't really care for peach cobbler BUT I will be getting more helpings from there! Fittie's is closed Sunday afternoons and Mondays and I haven't gotten up early enough to enjoy their breakfast treats. But, at least once a week, I'm there picking up their sandwich combo. Hope to see you there!

Home of the best breakfast taco ever. Folks, I'm referring to none other than the Marty. If you haven't had one yet, I suggest you get over to Fitties ASAP and order yourself one (or two or three). You might only be able to eat one since they're so large, but there's nothing wrong with hoarding more for later.My affinity for the Marty started 5 years ago, when my husband brought home one that a coworker had gifted him. I'm pretty sure that my inner fat kid died and went to heaven when I took my first bite. Now every time I go near Bastrop, I stop at Fitties. This past Wednesday, I stopped around lunch time, only to find out that they stopped making breakfast tacos at 11:00am. I didn't realize it until then, but all of my past trips have been in the morning, so it never even crossed my mind that they'd stop serving tacos! I gave Gary (the owner) so much grief, but he took it like a champ. I ended up ordering the Lucy, which is a lean brisket sandwich with a side (I chose potato salad) and drink. All for under $7 - what?!? So reasonably priced. Pro tip: they require a minimum of $15 for credit card charges, so remember to bring some cash. Gary threw in peach cobbler because he felt so bad, which was super nice of him. Everything was delicious! The meat was tender, the potato salad was fresh, and the cobbler was warm. I also love their BBQ sauce, which is more savory than sweet. And of course, the customer service is spectacular - Gary is a hoot!Bottom line: Fitties ain't fancy but they sure do dish out some darn good food!
This place is THE BEST! The Marty breakfast taco is amazing. The people are as friendly as they come.

Recommended as one of the best BBQ places in the Bastrop area. I had to give it a try. I wasn't disappointed!! The meat falls apart as you try to pick it up because it was so tender. Don't be scared off by the location or the looks, because the food is great.
Bastrop, TX 78602
I have enjoyed Fitties since my college years. Even bought a full brisket to freeze until I missed Texas. The Marty breakfast taco is my fav

Didn't serve breakfast tacos at 11:30, but no worries! The food was delicious, Brisket, Burgers, fries, cobbler, etc! All were super tasty, and for the price, very worth it! Would definitely recommend!

I stop at Fitties every time I go through Bastrop.  The barbeque sauce is addictive.  I buy extra to use at home.  But the barbeque is so good.  The owner will tell you exactly how he makes it and how the brisket is supposed to look.  He is so nice!  I also love their potato salad, ribs, chicken, and brisket.  So far, nothing has disappointed.  Thank you, Fitties, for being great at what you do!

I tried the chicken wangz;  good smoked flavor, savory sauce...very tasty! Reminds me of my years of growing up in La. and the old saying "JO put his foot in it"! Can't wait to try the Dirty Rice and other savory sides!

This is a small local shack by the side of 71. Great service, quantity, and quality but I felt the burger lacked some flavor. I expected the Smokeyhouse to have a "smokey" flavor but I was disappointed. Will definitely come back to try the brisket!Tip: Hold the ketchup in the burger as it was too overpowering.
One of my favorite places to eat lunch in Bastrop, Texas. Be sure to get the Special of the Day.

Due to many reasons, my friends and I didn't have high expectations for this place, which seemed very humble and the menu is very short. BUT, we had a great meal here. 1, everything was inexpensive, all four of us only spent $37 in total with desert. That usually equals an ok meal in a fancy restaurant. 2, the staff is a NICE couple. They are patient and genuine. 3, the weather was so nice and eating outdoor was fantastic. The environment is nicely set up and maintained. 4, the bathrooms are very neat and clean. We all highly recommend this place. It's difficult to find when you are on the highway. But it's like a hidden treasure. You get more than you pay for.
One of the best bbq Ive tasted! Perfect stopover for long drive. You can dine in alfresco while smelling their freshly grilled bbq. Their ribs are so moist!

The bad thing about this place is that 'The Marty' breakfast taco is just so darn good that I have yet to try anything else there! I've brought a few friends out for a Marty and they all love it. The BEST breakfast taco around, and worth the drive from Austin! I just wish I could manage two...
Bastrop, TX 78602

Extremely delicious and hearty portions. Easily taste smokiness in the brisket and ribs. Very accessible location, welcoming and friendly staff. Picnic like outdoor eating area. No complaints here. Fully satisfied.

I came here today with 2 other adults and 6 children. 9 of us in total and Not a single complaint. The kids ate up their burgers and fries and enjoyed every bite. The service was incredible and the owner so kind. They even served us some peach cobbler to taste and the crust tasted like candied deliciousness. I really wish I lived in Austin but nope LA is home and pretty far away. Stop by folks, it's worth your time and money. I know I will if I come back to Austin.

Brisket was great with a good Smokey flavor and sweet BBQ sauce. The potato salad was above average but the dirty rice wasn't hitting on much with me, but I could see others liking the flavor of it. The weather was perfect to sit outside and eat at the provided seating.

I ate here 3 days straight for bbq and bf taco while in Austin, this is the best bbq I have ever had in Texas and great price, taco portion was so generous thought would need 2 to get full but 1 was sufficient, I personally think the bbq it tastes so much better than some other big name brands. On the day back to NYC, ordered 3 pounds of everything to take on the plane. It was worthy waiting 20 mins in 110 degree to get the food, Bbq took a while to be ready, lady said call next time in advance for pickup.
Best spot ya digg. Friendly faces, good tacos. Spent the 20 ball quick with the tip to help the good folk. All love digg. Also, took some for the road.

I just order here 10mins ago and it was my first time.  We ordered 5 Marty's and holy shit they were amazing.  So much flavor in this taco and they DO NOT DISAPPOINT in portion.  I can't believe I've lived here almost a year and today was my first visit. Hands down best food in the Cedar Creek,  Bastrop area.  HANDS DOWN.........

I thought this place was just ok.The ribs were not really tender at all, kinda chewy and didn't rip of the bone like they should after a long cook. Flavor wasn't really there either. Hardly any smoke flavor as well.The brisket was tough and sorta dry. Plus the fat wasn't really rendered down. You can't tell cause the fat is not melty, it's hard and yellow still. Can barely taste the rub and not much smoke flavor. Needed salt.Maybe I went on a bad Sunday, who knows.The actual place is cool, outdoor seating, trees around. Worker was nice. It's a neat spot. Just the BBQ wasn't that good.
This. Delicious. Don't let the exterior fool you. Smoke pit was going out back....smoking away. Staff was extremely personable and friendly. A MUST stop when going to Bastrop or Austin.

Stopped here yesterday for the first time .. let me start by saying it was amazing ! Chorizo and egg tacos not greasy !! They have tons of fillings and taste top notch! The service is so friendly ! So had to stop today too ! They serve BBQ and hamburgers as well .. I'm sure will be back to try those too
Bastrop, TX 78602
Best breakfast Taco (Marty)!!! Awesome  Everyone that I have referred here has said the same thing...

Best BBQ stop on the way to Houston from Austin! The people were warm, friendly, and inviting. We enjoyed the brisket plate with dirty rice and green beans. The BBQ sauce was delicious along with the entire meal. So good we ordered more food to take home. The benches were comfortable and spacious. It was a pleasurable experience all around. Really enjoyed our time there. It is off of 71, don't miss out, it is legit! Can't beat the price of the combo meal.
Oh my goodness!!! What delicious flavorful bbq!! The sausage was my favorite!! But you can not leave without trying their cobbler. Your taste buds will thank you.

Don't know why such rave reviews. The place was barely adequate and nothing special. Beef brisket was very tough. It did have a good smoke in the meat, and the bark was pretty good. But the toughness was not desirable. We tried both the lean cut and the regular cut. I'm  a "keep that fat on the meat" person, but some of these slices had almost a 1" wide piece of fat (that was also a bit tough). That's too much. The sauce was adequate. But spicesSides:Cole Slaw - they need to call it shaved cabbage and carrots. That's all it was. No mayo, no vinegar, no salt & pepper. Just cabbage with a few carrot shavings. That is not Cole Slaw. Dirty Rice: now this was excellent. Fries: good, but very small side size. Potato Salad: very tasty. Don't know if it was homemade or from a tub. Overall value based on quality and quantity for price is low. Won't stop again, will try a different place in the area.

Every time I go to Bastrop to fish, I stop here for breakfast and then again on the way home for BBQ for dinner. It is a little shack and lacks any kind of atmosphere. You can sit at a picnic table after you get your food at the window. There is a cat there that will finish whatever you can't eat, or "accidentally" drop on the ground. Food is tasty and potions are large. Prices are great. I live in Georgetown and wish Fitties was closer!

Delicious.  The breakfast tacos are very filling. I had one taco and it lasted me until dinner time. The bacon is the best bacon in Texas ! I'm not exaggerating it was so good. The food was made fresh to order. There is picnic tables available to sit down and eat as this is a grab and go kind of set up.

The most friendly people I have ever meet and the food is  amazing with a very reasonable price definitely recommend this place and the food , totally coming back ! The burgers are huge and the ribs are so good , we got a plate and it's a good amount of bbq !
This gem in Bastrop is lights out for breakfast tacos...do yourself a favor and order the brisket, egg, and cheese!!!

Delicious BBQ and wonderful people! Stopped on my way to Austin and had the Lucy special...lean brisket without an ounce of fat and the most amazingly tasty sauce. Owner J.O. is the host extraordinaire!
Elgin, TX 78621

Visited this BBQ joint as part of the Texas BBQ trail.  The restaurant has a drive through which makes is easy to get your BBQ fix during Covid times.Ordered the brisket and the lamb ribs.  The brisket was one of our favorites on the Texas BBQ trail, we visited two other BBQ joints during this day.   The brisket is super rich so we could only eat a limited about but there was so much flavor packed into a little portion of the meat.  The lamb ribs were pretty good, a nice complement to the brisket.  Has more of a gamey flavor but very tasty and glad we bought some. One of the top stops we made to get BBQ, highly recommend stopping and trying some of this good Texas BBQ!

It's been quite a while since we ate at SSM so we decided to stop in and have a late lunch on the way back from Austin.  Everyone was masked up and social distancing.We tried a little of everything thinking whatever we didn't eat we'd snack on later in the evening.We ordered brisket moist - 3 to 3.5 starsPork ribs - perfect!Lamb ribs - so tender and not over seasoned so you can really enjoy the meat flavor.  And sucking the marrow out of the bones was a nice bonus.  Beef sausage - course ground, juicy and perfectly smoked.  This is one of our favorites places for sausage; we bought 10lbs frozen from the shop to go.Everything above was so "juicy" we ended up with about a quarter inch of grease in our butcher paper, but that wasn't a problem.  We just stopped it up with the white bread for a dessert.Also had the Slammer - sausage, jalapeño, cheese.  It was good but could have used more jalapeño.Forgot how good everything was here.  We'll definitely make it a point not to stay away so long again.

Great place to check out if your wanting some good BBQ. Ordered takeout on their user friendly website. The 1/2 lb lamb ribs were the highlight of my meal, along side of the sliced brisket and coleslaw. The lamb was tender and rubbed to perfection. The brisket was great with the original bbq sauce, I found that it was a bit peppered without it. Next time im in town Ill be back for a full pound of lamb!

Average bbq.  I tried the chicken, baby back ribs and brisket.  All were dry.  Especially disappointed in the brisket.  The slaw and potato salad were both very average.  Tried both the regular and spicy sauce.  Both were below average. On top of everything, the ordering process/line is very inefficient and slow. Wouldn't recommend.
Best fresh cut steaks in Texas!!!I highly recommend the New York strip!!!This place has never disappointed me in any way

I enjoyed my large salad after a long day on the shooting range.  I did take half of my salad home and I will enjoy it tomorrow.  Thank you for such a healthy selection with the same experience of great BBQ...
Stopped in here for lunch. Pretty solid bbq. The restaurant made it easy to order, get food and find some socially distanced tables. Parking was easy as well. I'd go back.

Very good. Less expensive than I expected and everything was as good as expected. Staff was great and line moved fairly quickly considering it was lunch time and the place was full of blue collar workers on their lunch break.
The brisket was tastless and so fatty there was no eating it. To go order was wrong. Not going to recommend this to anyone
Elgin, TX 78621

Complacency. If there is one word to describe my visit to this venerable Elgin (and Texas) institution it would be complacency. It shouldn't take an extra trip to the counter to get edible brisket. Also, on most days good BBQ places produce brisket that is fork tender...not here and not today. Disappointing but I'll be back because while I'm disappointed today there have been many other visits here in the past that were great. I can hope that complacency isn't contagious or this business might be on a downward path. That would be sad to see.

I ordered a 2 meat plate for $13 and my husband ordered the "Ranch Hand" for $9.50. My brisket was dry and my chicken(leg quarter)  tasted bland. The Mac and cheese was good and the potato salad was decent. My husband enjoyed his bowl of beans, brisket and cheese(hence the 3 stars). Mainly beans in that bowl! The bbq sauce was runny and lacked more flavor. This restaurant is overpriced so we won't be back but glad we gave it a try. We did appreciate the fast line and good customer service though!

Not sure why everyone likes this place. I went there on a recommendation.  I ordered the brisket and it was dry and the amount I got on the plate was very insignificant.  My friend wanted beef ribs. $25 bucks a pound but they said their ribs average 2lbs. no smaller than that. Hmm. He ordered regardless. What he got was a mess. it was a greasy fatty mess.  It was a $46 Rib!  he trimmed the fat and took out the bone.  The Bone was 7oz and the fat and gristle was 5oz (we weighed it because we wanted to see!). So he paid $18 bucks for the inedible stuff.  The meat itself was greasy.  Never again!  McRib is better than that stuff.

I was disappointed recently with my drive thru order from Southside bbq. My husband picked up some bbq and they left out the bbq sauce. And he even asked for extra! Needless to say, we didn't enjoy the bbq. So I called and asked to speak with a manager on Tuesday. No return call. Then I called again today. I spoke with Chris. He said there was nothing he could do to make up forthe mishap because it's a free item. Then after a little prodding he offered a free dessert that I declined. So after saying he couldn't do anything... somehow he came up with an option for dessert? Which to me means he could have offered something else. I asked for a credit of some kind to use so I could enjoy the bbq next time. What good is bbq without bbq sauce??? #disappointedcustomer

Drive through order for all bulk meat was $74. I asked for bread and BBQ sauce. Handed me a large heavy bag so I assumed all good and drove on to Austin. Family ready to dive in then going only 4 slices bread and 3 small containers BBQ sauce. Meat was good but experience was disappointing. Feeling ripped off.

First let me say the customer service is AWESOME! I came through the drive thru and explained that it was my first time and the guy was extremely helpful. I personally like the fatty part of BBQ (don't judge me lol) and he suggested the lamb ribs. He told me they had "an acquired taste" but it was juicer than the spare ribs......LAMB RIBS TASTE LIKE ROTTING MEAT! I love lamb in Mediterranean dishes so, iono what's going on. The brisket was "okay" and so were the sides; I was just disappointed in the portions. For $16 I was expecting to get full  (-minus the danky ribs) I don't think I'd return; I prefer the mom and pop bbq joints where they give you more for your buck and taste more like LOVE‍ but again, the people are great there!

Ashley - Thank you for your candid feedback. We're sorry to hear were not completely satisfied with the order you received. We'll be sharing your feedback with our leadership team as we are always looking for ways to improve the guest experience. We also want to thank you for the awesome praise for our team. Our folks work hard and it's a pleasure to share real world comments like yours with them!

Y'all should be ashamed of yourselves. While people are being generous and helping each other during this pandemic, you are ripping people off with your tiny portions for $13 a plate. That's just wrong. People are trying to stretch a dollar and you crap on them a couple dry strips of brisket and a single pork rib that's mostly fat. 1 pork rib?! Get out of here! Haven't you heard that everything is bigger in Texas? Don't go to Southside!Go to salt lick, go to la BBQ, go to Smokey Moe's, go to Valentina's... I could go on all day. Southside doesn't even make the list.

This BBQ restaurant is legit!! The staff was so friendly and helpful, and the space is so clean and wide open. There's a perfect hand washing sink before the dining area that apparently was even there pre pandemic. The meat was so tender and flavorful, I got a chicken salad and some turkey that I've literally been eating the past three days. My cat loves their turkey too haha. Thanks Southside!! Hope to see y'all expanding more in the future!
Elgin, TX 78621

Been driving past this place over several years. We travel a lot between Austin and Houston. Decided to do the drive thru. We ordered at the speaker, the woman we spoke with was very helpful and courteous. She repeated the order twice to confirm order was correct. Got up to window and confirmed again the order. Get home both orders were wrong. We ordered two plates for $38.00. At least if the food was good, I wouldn't be reviewing this. The brisket we received should have been used for the chopped sandwiches. It was all pieces. The ribs were ok, nothing special. I really wanted the sausage, but did not receive it.The sides were bland. Especially the beans. Sorry just wasn't worth the money. Maybe it was just an off day. Either way think I will try your competitor down the street next time.

Came all the way, from Austin, through rain, to get my a lot of my favorite BBQ tonight to take back for weekend event. They decided to not serve me, even via the drive thru, even though it was not 8pm, closing time.  As I drove by the window, the employees just looked and continued to ignore me. Time to find a new favorite. No more wasting time coming here. Disappointing.
column21: Central Business District, New Orleans, LA

column20: Everything was perfect! The Mac and cheese was really really good, the brisket was excellent and the peach cobbler with ice cream? The peach cobbler was just heavenly!!! I even got mad at my husband for not turning back and getting me a second order for that amazing cobbler!!!! He used to be sweet when we were dating!  Ugh!!

Ordered four BBQ packs to ship to four different locations for Christmas gifts. A mistake on my part caused to order to close and process before I entered the gift notes for each of the gifts. I sent an email to the online store and Rusty responded to me in less than an hour! He graciously volunteered to add each of the individual notes to the packages. The four families received their packages, two of them a day earlier than expected, the tracking information and follow up emails from Southside were amazing! Everyone loved the packages and all of gift notes were included in the correct packages! The other thing I loved, is that the website allows you to place a large order to be sent to multiple addresses. That saved a lot of time! I will definitely order again!
Like the sausage but rest are ok. Brisket are dry all the time. Order to-go twice and both didn't get the BBQ sauce. Called and they said I had to ask for it?!?!? Aren't you a BBQ pit?
A good barbecue to go to. The sausages are really good but the ribs aren't as good. Everything else is decent. I would be down to come again! Let's just say it HITS!
A good barbecue to go to. The sausages are really good but the ribs aren't as good. Everything else is decent. I would be down to come again!

Bland and no flavor. They removed the bark and discarded it into the trash ( BBQ no no....) Brisket was dry. Sausage was mush. As a self proclaimed Texas BBQ connoisseur, This ain't what the defenders of the Alamo fought and died for.

Oldest doesn't mean best...or really even good. When you reach for the bbq sauce, you know you're not eating good bbq. I so wanted it to be delicious, but it just wasn't. The sausage was pretty mushy in texture and didn't have much flavor. The brisket wasn't moist, but had a smoke ring...maybe it's overcooked or left over from days prior?  The seasoning on the bark tasted good, but there just isn't much. My overwhelming feeling is overcooked (left over?) brisket and undercooked sausage. So disappointed. I was surprised they weren't on Texas Monthly's annual Top 50 list, but I understand why.  I know amazing BBQ and this just isn't it. The staff was amazing though, and I'll come back for the cobbler. Just not anything else. Sorry.
Elgin, TX 78621

DE LISHH US Oh my my, Southside you 'dirty' pit mastering scoundrels done done it again! Ever-RY single time the food is AMAZING! The Salad, I usually get turkey on mine, is yum yum! The Brisket, ribs, SAUSAGE, boooy MMMM! Seriously tho folks. This here is some good BBQ. And a Texas tradition. Swing by and get some grub! You can also order online, which is cool. Restaurant is clean, service is swift, people are genuinely Texas friendly. I eat here a lot, so they had plenty of opportunity to lack, and it's great every time.

My friends took me here for lunch on the way to Austin. I loved how there was a drive thru and how large this restaurant was. No worries about having bigger groups of people or coming during meal times when it's packed bc there's room for everyone. They had a to go line inside and then two lines for dine in. Super efficient! I got the 2 meat platter that came with 3 sides for less than $15 which is great. I got sausage, brisket, and double Mac and cheese. I gotta say the sausage was peppery and delicious, my brisket was sadly very dry so I drenched it in their BBQ sauce (comes regular or hot), and the Mac and cheese was one of the best I've ever had. Overall I enjoyed my experience!

Kacy - Thanks for the stellar review! We appreciate you sharing the great word-of-mouth. We're disappointed to hear that the brisket was on the dry side and we will be researching this further with our team. We hope to host you again soon!

Extremely juicy fatty brisket, well seasoned potato salad, and a self serve pickle/jalapeño/onion/hot sauce bar. Dino beef rib (25$/lb) was the special of the day- massive and slid right off the bone. Really mastered the burnt ends flavour while retaining moisture. Mary was a dream come true. Love you Mary

Rob - Thank you so much for the glowing review! We appreciate you taking the time to share your comments, and especially the shout out for Mary. We'll make sure she sees your support. We're looking forward to hosting you again next time!
Something changed!!  The prices are higher, the brisket is tougher and the ribs are undercooked and fatty.  This is not the Southside I remember.  Stay away!  I won't be back.
I never leave bad reviews but This place has sloppy rude drive thru employees. Go to meyers far superior bbq and great staff

Drive out to Elgin and enjoy some original Texas style BBQ.  I went with my usual duo of sausage and burnt ends.  Good deep smoke flavor to both.  Beans were not bad but I like a bit more spice to mine.  Potato salad was good for a mayo based item.  I have more of a mustard based taste.  Overall, good quality and flavorful BBQ.

Dane - Thanks for making the drive! We appreciate your support and we're glad to hear you enjoyed your meal. We'll be opening a new North Austin location before the end of the year which should be even closer to you. Hope we see you there!
Elgin, TX 78621

Southside is one of the those old time Texas BBQ stables that is coasting by on the fact it's been around for so long -- before BBQ was made into hipster cool.  They've also been pretty good as marketing their sausage links via HEB.  And this location is huge, like the size of a barn, it can handle hundreds of customers.So, then, how is the BBQ?  Uh, ordinary, nothing special, really.  I got the brisket burnt ends and it toasted OK -- it had a faint aroma of propane or charcoal and/or wood smoke - I couldn't tell the difference.  I sure hope it wasn't propane!The sausage/jalapeno cheese stick thing was kind of dry and bland tasting. Overall, I wasn't impressed it nor with Southside.  Service was slow.  BBQ sauce was runny and watery.  On positive front, this location was clean.Sorry, but this place is coasting by on longevity rather than serving up amazing BBQ that stands the test of time.  Thumbs down!
Monte - Thank you for your feedback.

This review is only for their online ordering system. Don't bother, seriously. I have used it no less than 10 times over the last 6 months. They never check for the orders so it has never, not once, been ready (or even started) at the promised time. I tried and tried to give them the benefit of the doubt. I've spoken to a manager three times in the hopes that they would change their process. But sadly, I am still having the same issues. It is frustrating and I highly recommend against using it.

We went the second night they were open in Hutto and by 6:30 pm they were out of everything but sausage and baby back ribs. We waited in the drive thru for an hour, but they did have someone walking the line of cars updating us on what ran out of. I can't speak to how the sides are, since they were unavailable...but they seemed limited.  I'll try them again in a month or so when they have time to work out the kinks.

It was my first time in this place after driving by for decades! I don't know why I never stopped in before, but it will definitely be my go-to when I'm on the road and passing thru.  Great smoke ring on the brisket. A little fat but not much, I asked them to take it off.  Turkey was good - sausage good - bbq sauce good, was peppery and medium consistency.  Someone else said it was watery but I did not think so.  I guess customers have to ask for the sauce to be included in to-go orders because I didn't get any in my order, which was 1/2 lb each sausage and turkey, and 1 lb brisket. I ordered a brisket sandwich to tide me over til I got home, and sauce was included in that, so I don't know what the deal is. Just be sure to ask. All food had such great flavor, tender brisket,  smokey flavored turkey, yummy juicy sausage. Their cole slaw is the creamy kind, fyi, so I passed on that.  I did not have any sides. The meat is sold by the HALF POUND so be aware! I loved this bbq and will definitely be back.

Theresa - Thank you so much!! We're very glad you decided to stop and we'll be saving a seat for you from now on. Thanks, too, for the constructive feedback about the sauce. We'll check in with our team to make sure sauce is consistently included/offered, with every order. We're looking forward to hosting you again and until then, safe travels and happy eating!

As the sausage capital of Texas we have a few different options to choose from in Elgin when it comes to good barbecue. Southside is a great option for sure. Lots to choose from on the menu but my favorites are the smoked chicken salad and of course the sausage. This is definitely a great place to stop when passing through Elgin if you're looking for local flavor.
Kacey - Thanks for the great review and general shout out to our hometown, Elgin! We're always happy to host you!

After long drive some TEXAS original BBQ was on point!!! The amount of flavor in food was awesome! I got good meal for sure, you get plenty of calories to burn for the rest of the day ! Awesome on Sundays they got dinosaur ribs too I should of got it but maybe next time for sure !!!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Austin, TX 78759

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Place was nice and clean and staff was friendly. I was kind of shocked that I was the only dining inside customer, however I say several take out orders and curb service while there. The bbq was good I had turkey and sausage. Both were a tad dry. The bbq sauce was not to my liking. I did like the coleslaw it was a bit peppery though not sure peppery is a word.  The beans were not what I expected,  I like a sweet baked style beans these were more of a pinto or ranch style. I actually liked them even though they were a bit plain, not by flavor, they just let the beans go the talking.  Overall I think this place is probably better when their busy.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Great bbq. Ordered brisket, sausage and baby back ribs and they were all amazing as always. I do love the Elgin location tho. Didnt want to make drive to Elgin. It was still great food. Curbside service was excellent and easy to use. Was sad I was unable to order peach cobbler as it was not available on online ordering, hence the 4 star rating.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Amazing BBQ but the staff needs a lot of training. Half my order was missing. It was curbside so glad I didn't drive away. Had to go inside and they made me wait in line.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Decent BBQ. Ribs were big and juicy. Cheddar sausage wasn't bad, but not as good as the ribs. Brisket was also good. Mac and cheese and potato salad both had good flavor.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: This staple is flavortown. We ordered the 3 meat plate with sausage, brisket, Turkey with potato salad and beans and added a sausage slammer. Everything was cooked to perfection, seasoned and tender, very flavorful. We will be back!!!!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: WowwwwwwwwThis place was absolutely delicious!! I'm so happy I didn't have to drive super far to have some great quality barbecue I was so impressed!!! My brisket was fatty and delicious and my jalapeño sausage was absolutely incredible. The pork rib was bit fatty but super delicious. The Mac and cheese was good so was the Cole slaw. Washed it down with an ice cold big red. ILL BE BACK

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Ok, so Southside is a legit old school Texas BBQ joint, for better or worse.  I got the brisket baked potato - it was filling, large portion of brisket, etc.  It was good brisket but not great - the brisket was a bit way on the smoky and dry side for my taste.  The BBQ sauce was lacking and thin - as is typical with the authentic old school Texas BBQ joints which don't like to serve any sauce, which is unfortunate. If they had better sauce, I would give it four star review.I just wished some of the old school Texas BBQ joints would up their game with better BBQ sauce and better gourmet sides - doing it the old fashioned way is, well, getting a bit old.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Arguably the worst brisket in the entire state of Texas!  My son wanted to impress me for Christmas so ordered me a mail order brisket from this place,which he was misled to believe was one of the best.   What I got was the fattiest untrimmed brisket I had ever seen. For me, brisket is sll about the bark, but the bark had 3/4 inch of fat attached because they were too damned lazy to trim it and charge, apparently, by the pound. When I complained, they did not even care enough to reply to my email, let alone try to apologize and redeem themselves by sending me a better product.  Bad food, worse customer service!  With places like Le Barbecue and Franklins in town, who would waste their time here?

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: First time visit to this location. It was quiet Saturday afternoon and it was clean and neat. We ordered Brisket, Pork Ribs, Baby-back ribs, Lamb ribs, and Sausage slammers. Sausage is a new item to try which I would say pretty solid with cheese and Jalapeño stuffed inside. Lamb ribs are tender and juicy. Overall, everything looks fine. The only one thing was we didn't like Pork ribs as much due to chewy and little tough meat. We didn't try any of sides this time.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Austin, TX 78759

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Stop.  Do not eat here.  I have had some great barbecue in Austin and around  the great state of Texas but, this is definitely NOT the place to go out for barbecue.  This restaurant seems to be surviving off the reputation of another location with the same name.  Do not be fooled the brisket is poor.  Whomever the pit  master is shouldn't simply be fired,  they need to be stopped from ever cooking barbecue again within the borders of Texas.  On the plus side the restrooms were clean and their is a friendly atmosphere. I do not enjoy posting negative reviews however, I went shopping for clothing immediately following my lunch and two clerks who work within a few hundred feet of this restaurant verified without prompting that Southside Market and Barbecue is the worst place to eat around there.  It's not just me - this place is bad.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Greg - Thank you for stopping by. We're sorry to hear it was not to your liking.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Great selection of bbq and sides, for a good price. I enjoyed eating lunch here with my husband. The mac and cheese and banana pudding were the best that I have had anywhere. The only downside I saw was the brisket was a bit dry.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Southside Market & BBQ out of Elgin (that's "ELL-gun" with a hard "g" sound, emphasis on the first syllable, located about 30 miles east of Austin on Highway 290), est. 1882, has recently opened up in the Shops at the Arbor Walk center across the way from Spec's and JoAnn's just east of Mopac and Capital of Texas. It's a surprisingly large space for a strip mall, with barred, zig-zag line control at the BBQ counter, 2 self-serve drink & garnish stations, tons of tables, a gift & to-go meat market shop up front, and parking & entrances on both the south and east sides. We gave them a try for walk-up take-out the other night and really enjoyed our meal, even with a couple of hiccups on the service. We dropped in on a whim at dinner time, realizing Southside was now open, having just been across the lot at the Skecher store picking up the ever more gigantic shoes my now 13 year-old son apparently requires every 4 months. :-/I wanted a savory assortment to test, so we stepped up to the counter and began rattling off about 7 things. As a native Texan, I've been trained from an early age to have my order ready when reaching my turn with the meat cutter, so as to not inconvenience the large line behind me or annoy the knife-wielding professional before me. Well, this particular gentleman seemed new to the task, as he asked me to slow down and repeat myself so he could write up the ticket on a pad of order paper, and he needed some assistance from the other team member next to him to find the menu items I'd requested. He also missed that this was a to-go order, so some repackaging was needed at the end. No biggie - I'm sure this will get better with time as the new team finds their groove.We ordered the following items, plus fountain drinks:1 Sausage Slammer ($4), a sausage enrobed, cheddar-stuffed jalapeño, wrapped in bacon & smoked to perfection.This was an easy-to-split appetizer for 2, providing about 3 bites for each person. I love jalapeño poppers, bacon, and sausage, so this one was a no-brainer. Tasty if a little dry overall, but that's preferable to flabby bacon. 1 lb Original Beef Sausage ($14)Not bad, not bad. We've always preferred Meyer's sausage to Southside's when we are stopping for BBQ in Elgin over the years, but this long, snappy link with a natural pork casing and a bit of black pepper bite was a-okay. I just finished off the last of the leftovers on that one and I enjoyed every bite even after a few days in the fridge and a microwave reheat.1/2 lb USDA Prime Brisket ($10.5), no menu option of distinction for moist, lean, or house-choice.When I made my order, I'd asked for "Moist Brisket" and there was no correction back to me to let me know that they don't do that (apparently). It was a bummer to unwrap this meat at home 20 minutes later & see the total absence of juice or fat - this was definitely a too-lean-for-me cut. I wouldn't order this brisket again.1 Chopped Brisket Baked Potato ($10), entrée-size with chopped brisket and all the fixins.OMG, I am a sucker for every possible preparation of the humble spud, and I've been known to order hundreds of Chopped Bakers (with smoked chicken) over the years from Smokey Mo's. The Southside version is huge, like one of those Jason's Deli full-sized baked Russets, only covered in lightly sauced chopped brisket like you'd get on a sandwich, plus cheese, butter, green onion tops, and sour cream. Yes, this may hasten my death date, but - worth it!1 Ranch Hand ($9), layered bowl of cut-to-order brisket, beans, cheese, & diced white onions served w/ Fritos on the side.Imagine the most decadent Frito pie you ever had. The onion level was a bit much for us, but they were easy to push to the side. Delicious!I was disappointed to find that no bread was included in our bag (not sure if we needed to request it or what), so we had to make do with our hippie 8 grain wheat bread at home to make our sausage wraps and next-day brisket sandwiches. I was also bummed that pickle offerings are limited to ridged sour hamburger dill slices - Pokejo's has spoiled me with their superior fermented offerings.The pluses at Southside - Arbor Walk that will likely keep me coming back:- easy online pre-ordering for pick-up- excellent bowls for $10 that could make 2 meals for me (dinner tonight, lunch tomorrow)- close to the Domain area where I live & workCheck out the menu & daily specials online:Menu southsidemarket.com/arbo…Online Order: toasttab.com/southside-m…Specials: southsidemarket.com/aust…Holiday meals (including smoked turkey, ham, or pork loin, with sausage dressing as a side option): southsidemarket.com/holi…Protip: Save 10% on the first online (shipped) order by subscribing to their email list. This could be a nice way to send a batch of oak smoked beef jerky to a homesick Texan on your Xmas list.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Shannon - Thank you for putting in the time to share your complete experience. We appreciate you excusing some missteps due to newness; however, we regret that you should have to bear any inconvenience while our greenest teammates complete training. Along those lines, it is standard practice for our folks to ask our guests "Lean, Moist, or Cutter's Choice?" when fulfilling a brisket order. There's no price difference, we just want to make sure you receive exactly what you prefer. We apologize that this, most-important of steps, was missed during your visit. We are working hard every day to get better at checking all the boxes and crossing all the t's of top-notch quality and excellent service. We hope you'll join us again in the future!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Ok this reviewis not for the company as an whole it's strictly regarding this visit here at Arbor Walk..I have always made South Side BBQ an traditional stop in Elgin when I'm going to watch my Fighting Texas Aggies in College Station on fall Saturdays..The meat has always been on point but todaythat was not the case.. I ordered 2 ribs and a sausage wrap. The wrap tasted as they always do but the ribs were not good..The flavor and texture taste new and not like they usually do.. I had a friend who got the brisket and she said that it was pretty dry and not good..I know that I paid 18 bucks for 2 ribs and an wrap..Seemed to be a little pricey but I never really paid attention to the price in Elgin..I will still frequent this new location, maybe it was just an one time issue but I do feel as if I wasted some money.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: LaRon - Thank you for your candid feedback and we certainly appreciate your years of past loyalty to our Elgin location. We take your comments seriously and our leadership team is actively working with our new pit crew to make sure all meats (and other foods) are meeting the high standards our guests have come to expect. We appreciate your willingness to return. Should you ever feel that your meal is less than satisfying, at any of our locations, please alert a manager right away. They would be glad to replace or refund your order on the spot. Again, we appreciate your business and want to keep you in the Southside family!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: We tried the Austin location off MoPac on their opening day, close to opening time at 11am. Food: Southside Plate is sausage and brisket for $14, and comes with two sides. The sausage is definitely the star here. Flavor is amazing, and the sausage meat is almost tender as you chew through the skin, which has a nice snap without it being too chewy. Brisket was alright, tender and slightly smoky. Pork ribs are pretty good. Hard pass on the baby back - the two on our plate was overly dry, and lacking flavor other than the smoke it was cooked in. Mac and cheese is as you'd expect - creamy and cheesy. Potato salad is good, as are the coleslaw and beans. Service: As most BBQ locations, you walk up and line up. We've not been to the Bastrop location, so we can't compare the two, but we wonder if the ordering system is similar. There's loads of people behind the counter, but it's not cohesive. There's an order taker, who may or may not be cutting up and prepping the meat on your plate. They shout out your sides to the folks at the back, and they bring forward the sides to add to the plate. Which makes its way down to the register, where they seem a bit confused as to what you order. Perhaps this is a new location and they need to work out the kinks. Cost: The one and two meat plates are both $14, and both come with two sides. The three meat costs $18. It's not super pricey, but you'll see that you don't get a lot portion wise either. When we went back a second time and got a three meat plate, that was literally 2 slices of brisket, 2 baby back ribs, and 1 pork rib. Overall: Parking is plenty in the shared lot outside. Space is open and clean, but you will come out smoky, as with most BBQ places. Best thing is the sausage, and we'll come back for that if nothing else. Takes cards.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Shirley - Thanks for joining us opening day and for taking the time to leave this in-depth review. We value your first impressions. While opening day jitters may have come with some kinks, we've continued to raise the bar daily both on our food quality and smoothness of processes (like the ordering line). We appreciate the grace you extended us on 11/24 and we hope you'll choose to join us again in the future. We'd love the opportunity to exceed your expectations next time!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Austin, TX 78759

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: I've been waiting to visit this spot for the first time since it opened, and finally got the chance. I was disappointed :(Maybe the folks at the front were having a bad day, but they were not friendly to me at all. I asked for ribs, and they said they were out. I asked for brisket and they said they were out. They basically just made me keep guessing and seemed pretty annoyed that I didn't magically know what they had available. They just made me feel pretty uncomfortable, especially on my first visit. I asked for a small side of beans, they ended up charging me for a pint. Bummer.I ordered a baked potato without brisket, and they still charged me for the full price. Lame. At least let customers know if you have to charge full price and put it on the side? The bbq sauce was not very good by itself. If you are going to make a bbq sauce in the first place, it should at least have a good flavor on its own.The food in general wasn't terrible, but I'm definitely going anywhere else when the topic of BBQ comes up in the area, due to the terrible customer service alone.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Worst experience I've had to date. Ordered online Sunday, got home to eat and the food smelled off.  After trying to eat it, it was horrible. The brisket and sausage didn't taste right, had no flavor and was nauseating. I've eaten here several times before, and have never had this bad of an experience. Was really disappointed in the quality of the food.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: My wife helped me snarf up a 3 meat plate with 2 sides, there was nothing left but a few rib bones.  The ribs were very good, the brisket was slightly chewy....4 stars, the sausage was the bomb.  The cole slaw was very good...not too sweet, the salad was good too.  After we finished our meal we bought some garlic sausage, a small punkin pie and some semidry sausage, we would have bought more of the last item but we snagged the one remaining package, the gentleman behind the counter gave us some ice for our goodies.  We've been to the mother ship in Elgin and this location compares well to mom.  We'll be back for more, we need to try the Hutto location when it's up and running.  Great meats and service.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Tim - Thanks for trying a little bit of everything! Thrilled to hear you and the Mrs. enjoyed your visit. We look forward to hosting you again!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Wasn't sure about going here after seeing some negative reviews, but it turned out great.Meat was probably the leanest I've had, it wasn't overly fat which I hate (I have only been to one other BBQ joint in the area and it was super fatty that I couldn't even eat).Brisket was good, lamb was good, the  pork steak was super dry but edible.All the sides were pretty good. Macaroni and cheese, cole slaw and potatoes salad. But I didn't love the beans, they were whatever..The service was great, they were very sweet and helpful.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Alina - Thanks for joining us and sharing your constructive feedback. We appreciate the things you enjoyed and have made note of the areas you feel could have gone better. We'll be sharing it all with our leadership team today and we hope to host you again in the near future!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Terrible bbq, Probably the worst I have ever had. The only thing good there was the mac and cheese. The employee that took the order was very rude and the brisket was bland, the bbq sauce was disgusting and the ribs had no flavor. I do not usually write reviews but this place was disgusting. I honestly think I would have enjoyed a meal at mcdonalds more.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: There is better BBQ available, but none better inside the Austin city limits proper. Southside has been in business since the 1800s and this is their first location inside Austin after the original in Elgin and the second location in Bastrop.Why does Southside excel?  Simple. They've got the BBQ business model down.  Great BBQ (which I'll discuss in depth) and a well run business.  The lines move quickly; the staff is friendly; the place is clean; and most importantly, they rarely run out of meat.BBQ?  On point.  I tried the three meat plate.  The moist brisket was sliced well and had a nice bark and smoke ring.  The pork steak was well done and is one of the better pork BBQ dishes out there.  The baby back ribs are also on point with being well done and having a good seasoning to them. My dining companion liked her jalapeno cheddar sausage's kick as well as the visible pieces of jalapeno and cheddar, but said it could've used a bit more time in the pit.  She said the turkey might be the best she's had and that she's planning to come back to pick up turkey to bring home for sandwiches. Pro tip:  If you're a sauce fan, their Texas Bold sauce is among the best options out there.  It's a great complement to their meat and adds just enough flavor and heat to complement anything you try there.They've got a good variety of baked desserts and an ice cream counter serving Blue Bell, but neither of us had room.Definitely adding to my regular dining rotation. Being able to get great BBQ during regular business hours is something that a lot of the new places around Austin could learn from.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Whoop Whoop - Thanks for the awesome support! We're very excited to be in your neck of the woods and look forward to hosting you again!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Austin, TX 78759

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: After doing some shopping at Arbor Walk-I checked they many options and decided to try this new BBQ place. It was an off time so hardly anyone was there(I like that -Covid ). I ordered a large sliced brisket sandwich w/potato salad and a serving of banana pudding-incredible juicy sandwich -I wish I had asked for much more onions and pickles-the Potato salad was mayo based-ok-not much flavor-their banana pudding is to die for-Best $3 dessert in Austin-so food-I had to have another! Great experience-BuBye Rudy's

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Most plain and blandest bbq I've had. Service was good but food was not good at all, sausage wasn't cooked all the way through. Brisket was dry. Cant even get a Smokey taste. Very disappointed. Not worth the money.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: First timer and very disappointed. Mac and cheese wasn't good at all. BBQ sauce was too watery and no flavor. The brisket and sausage was ok.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: They get an A for friendly and generous customer service from start to finish.
