They were welcoming, helpful, checked up on us, and even gave us free drinks for needing to wait a few minutes on one part of our order. The restaurant experience itself is good. However, the meat is a C at best. The brisket was dry and had literally no flavor. Ribs were similarly tough and bland. Maybe it was an off day, but I would expect any barbecue market of this type to do much better. But, thanks for treating us well!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: My wife ordered a Smoked Turkey from them for Thanksgiving for $50, advertised as 12-14 lbs. When we got it home it only weighed 9.86 lbs.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Southside gets four stars mainly due to their stellar customer service, cleanliness, and very fun atmosphere to bring friends and family out to.  All of the staff were extremely attentive and hospitable.  They also have a lot of employees to help make ordering and serving food very prompt.  As far as the food goes, I'd say it's about Rudy's quality.  The meat that stands out the most would definitely be the Jalapeño Cheddar Sausage.  It's really, really good.  The regular sausage is good too.  Aside from that, everything else is pretty average.  I got the Pulled Pork sandwich which was decent, but was expecting a lot more flavor.  All of the sides we ordered which included the coleslaw and Mac and cheese were also mediocre.  The biggest let down would have to be the brisket.  It was very dry, and the flavors just weren't there.  Overall, Southside is worth a visit.  Hopefully, we came on an off day.  I really wanted this place to blow me away.  All of the pros about this place will have me come back and give them another try in the near future.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Christian - Thanks for the standup review. We appreciate your constructive criticism and will be evaluating the areas you suggested we could improve. We're glad to hear that you were well cared for and brought along your friends and family. We really want to WOW you on the food and we'll work to make that happen should we see you again in the future!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: What an experience. I really did not know what to expect. We had chicken, sausage, brisket, and lamb. All delicious. Potato salad was great. Peach cobbler was good. The atmosphere was really nice. You will continue to flourish in this location. I believe I have found a new spot.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Wow! Thank you so much for this amazing review. We're so happy to hear you had a chance to enjoy an assortment of items. Welcome to the Southside family!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Austin, TX 78759

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Ate here for the first time. We hoping that this might be a regular stop for me.Atmosphere is good. Usual line, order and eat at long tables. Service was great.I ordered a sausage sandwich Very bland. Very little flavor. Same for the potato salad.I tried their original sauce. Honestly I couldn't taste any flavor. It was like I was tasting nothing. The spiced one had some taste.There is too much good barbecue round Austin to make this a stop for me.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Chris - Thanks for giving us a try. We're sorry to hear that you were disappointed with our offerings. Our senior leadership team will be reviewing your concerns with our Austin team today.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Newly opened location of Southside Market. Very similar interior to other Central Texas BBQ places. Famous Southside sausage somehow tastes better when cooked on their BBQ pit compared to the supermarket version. Offering both moist and lean brisket like other places. We always get moist when available. Some other places execute their moist brisket better. The moist brisket we got at Southside was very greasy and had a thick line of rubbery fat in it which could have been rendered better. Good flavor.Lamb rib was good but salty. Haven't seen that on a BBQ menu before, nice to see a new/unique meat. Sausage slammer was a very good bite. In any other city in the world Southside Market would be a 10/10, but they have very tough competition in Austin so I'd rate them 8/10 (or 4/5 on Yelp). Solid effort.
column21: Naval Station Pearl Harbor, Honolulu, HI

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Karen - Thanks for coming by on opening day and sharing your candid feedback. We appreciate your thorough review and hope to host you again!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Since arriving in Texas from Hawaii most of my meals have been the typical fast food spots so I finally decided to try local food and boy am I pleased. Brisket was mouth watering good, mac and cheese and beans was delicious along with the sausage. I will return soon for another meal. Highly recommend this establishment. Greats customer service.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Fantastic!!!   Just as good as their location in Elgin.    Everything was delicious.   We will definitely be back here again.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: Jeremy - You made our day! Thanks for the support in Elgin and now in Austin. We really really really appreciate it!

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: SSM has good meats, their beef sausage and pulled pork are very good. They offer selections not found at most BBQ places in ATX, lamb ribs, pork steaks, sausage slammers to name a few. Sides can be much better and desserts too. Owner is not open to new recipes and ideas to improve things, unfortunately. SSM tosses meats and sides into the trash at days end, even during the covid-19 crisis, it's really sad. I asked if they could please consider allowing employees to have this or groups needing it and was blocked from commenting on their Facebook site.

column1: Southside Market & Barbeque - Austin at Arbor Walk
column20: We went on the opening day  and it was packed on opening day  the Staff was very nice and they seemed already know how do do and ring everything up as it was the first day We both ordered the Southside Combo  - Brisket & Sausage The Brisket  we got it moist  which we should have gotten regular as the moist was fatty The Sausage - it was very good just the right amount of spice The Beans - was to pasty and not enough flavor  we liked the Potato Salad and the Sausage the Best They have a varied menu which is good  I hope they make it as Arbor Walk needs a good BBQ place and I think Southside  is a good bbq restaurant   and they have Plates unlike Rudys so that is a plus for Southside
Spicewood, TX 78669

It's All Good is my favorite bbq spot. The brisket is delicious and juicy, and all the sides are amazing. The Mac and cheese is amazingly cheesy. There is a really nice outdoor seating area under the trees. This place also has drive through pick up making it an easy to have any time.

If the gun is smoking they are open! This place has a drive thru!!! The food has always been great...I will admit I have only gotten the brisket and the tator tot casserole so maybe I need to branch out.....but if it ain't broken why fix it?! The staff here are always super friendly as well.
We love All Good BBQ. It's right on the way home and they have a convenient drive thru.
Stuck in traffic on a Friday afternoon and hungry I pulled over. Little did I know that I'd be getting top tier bbq

For BBQ, 3 stars means I'd stop again if it's on my route but I'm not going out of my way for it...It's all good. It's not all great. Brisket: nice smoke ring, nice pull, moist, flavorful. A little bit of a gas aftertaste. Turkey: a little dry but pretty tasty. Sausage: a little greasy, casing was tough. Ribs: fall off the bone but a little bland. Everything needed a little sauce, which was a little too sweet for me. Sides: multiple versions of bland slaw, bland potatoes, bland Mac & chz, etc.

Here in Texas for a few days and came by based on their decent reviews. They had outdoor dining and drive through order and a line for already placed orders which was us. I called in and ordered 2 chicken plates for my hubby and I. His sides was potato salad and Mac & cheese and I got the green beans and Mac & cheese. For $15 a plate, it was a good amount of food. It was half a chicken so you got the breast, thigh, wing and drumstick. I was expecting full on Smokey BBQ flavor but unfortunately that was lacking. I needed to dip the chicken in the bbq sauce to get flavor which is not good!Sides were ok. The Mac & cheese a little too much cheese and not much Mac in mine. Their menu on their website clearly states:Chicken PlateOne Half pit-roasted chicken, two hand-picked sides, pickles, onions, jalapenos & bread.We did not get pickles, onions, jalapeños or the bread. They totally forgot!! They also forgot utensils!! Wonderful. But, the smoking gun outside was nice to look at while waiting for our food in the car.

Their sides are really good. The Spicewood bbq beans were my favorite side. The greens beans were flavorful and the greenest I've ever seen at a bbq restaurant. Also, they were perfectly cooked not mushy, falling apart.The mac n cheese was creamy. A bit on the thick side for my taste but others might prefer it that way. The vinegary coleslaw (they have a cream based one which I didn't try) looked fresh and tasted pretty good. I've been to many places where cabbage is partially wilting and has a soggy texture, but not the case here at all. I'm not sure if they make their own bbq sauce but if they do, I need to go back and buy some to take home. I liked that it wasn't too peppery nor all sugared up - it was well balanced. Lastly, as far as sides go, tater tot casserole was yummy! Must try it if you like the potato flavor of french fries and light creaminess of mac n cheese with bits of crispy, fried tater tater tot edges. I also had their moist brisket, smoked turkey breast and chicken. As far as the brisket and chicken goes, I prefer Rudy's (not going to compare with the more well known bbq joints). One last thing I'd like to add was the service went well. I really like that they have drive thru service (they even have a separate line for call-ahead orders).

Stopped in for some food after a day of hiking at Pace Bend. I don't know if I caught them on a bad day, but the food was very mediocre. We ordered a brisket plate with mac and tater tot casserole, a brisket plate with green beans and tater tot casserole, a chopped beef sandwich, apple cobbler, and blackberry cobbler. The brisket on its own has little to no flavor and definitely needed the sauce. It was also immensely greasy and my stomach didn't feel great afterward. The mac and cheese was basically more cheese than mac -- skimpy on the noodles. The tater tot casserole was decent, but I felt like I got tired of the taste and consistency after a couple of bites. My boyfriend was neutral on his sandwich -- described it as "okay". I was really praying for the cobblers to be good since I wasn't thrilled with everything else, but alas, they were not. They were very mushy and the biscuit part of it was super bland.

Recently visited All Good BBQ again and this time the brisket was spot on, the ribs falling off the bone and the sausage delicious. The tater tot casserole was great and their more vinigery BBQ sauce was tasty. Very much an upgrade from last time. Keep it up!
Spicewood, TX 78669
My favorite place for a barbecue in Spicewood. Get it while you can I think they sell out every day. In my opinion a lot better than the other big place in Spicewood Texas.

I ordered a chopped beef sandwich,   I should have known better. The sandwich I got is what I call a yankee bbq I hate ground up brisket with sauce mixed in. Next time I'll order a sliced brisket sandwich Taste was ok but.

Stopped in for the first time and ordered a half rack of baby back ribs. So delectable! I don't drive out this way too often, but this will be my spot from now on. The husband ordered the brisket, which was plenty moist and every bit as good as the ribs. Just depends on what you're in the mood for, I suppose. We saw two types of bbq sauce--one more smoky and savory and the other more sweet and tangy. You won't really need sauce for the baby back ribs, but it really adds a little something to the brisket. My ribs didn't come with sides, but I took a couple bites of my husband's mac n cheese and tater tot casserole. Yum. The restaurant itself is tight quarters with long tables for communal seating. There's also a drive-thru if you want your food to go. It's rustic inside with a mounted deer head, portraits of John Wayne, and neon beer signs, plus two flatscreens for watching sports. Would definitely come back.
Amazing bbq and great sides. Excellent stop from Enchanted Rock back to Houston. Closed Monday and Tuesday but definitely worth a visit!

Super delicious BBQ, but the new chinese virus pricing of $17.50 for a single plate of brisket is simply too much. I'll stop back by when the pricing come back to earth. I understand the reasoning, but no bbq is worth paying that much.

The best thing is they have a drive through which is uncommon with bbq places, but is nice during CovidThe sausage was dry although it had a good flavor.  I asked for moist brisket and they gave us lean which I didn't realize until I got home, and that was dry.  The pork ribs were fine.  I asked what was in one of the sides and the response I got was "I don't really know."  I was excited to try it because of recommendations from friends although I wouldn't go back.
Excellent BBQ.  We get the meal deal...sliced with sides....live the tater tot casserole and creamed corn.  Yum

This place is amazing!  The moist brisket is to die for, as are the stuffed jalapeños.  No frills kind of place but also quaint and comfortable.  Lots of side options for those doing lower carb diets as well.

Solid ass bbq. Green beans were so well stewed and peppery. Mac n cheese was awesome. Brisket is fatty and turkey juicy. Sausage was a nice, salty and crisp bite. Serve yourself bread, onions, pickles and jalapenos/carrots en escabeche. Hit the spot and reasonable prices given the texas sized portions. Stopped after a wine tasting and did not regret it. They also sell farm fresh local eggs for $3 for the dozen. Delicious af.
Spicewood, TX 78669
They serve the best brisket I've ever had! Great Mac and cheese also! Blazing fast service and you don't have to order at the counter.

Very good brisket, sausage, and ribs. We also enjoyed the German potato salad!  Be careful ordering brisket, if you want some fat on it make sure they understand you don't want lean. I will certainly be back in the near future.

It was tasty.  I have had better...I have had worse.  Perhaps a notch up from "meh."  They sell out all the time, so get there early if you are going.  I'm a BBQ snob...so 4 is pretty good when it comes to a rating for certain.  Nice little place.  Brisket was good and tender.  Sides were pretty good.  Sauce was only ok.If you are there, it's a great place to stop at.

All wasn't all good on Friday afternoon when I went through the drive through to pick up an order. The guy preparing the food, hovered over the meat to chop it and spoon out sides had NO mask on. The teenager who handed me back my credit card DID have a mask on and I asked him about the guy behind him not having a mask on. He too seemed annoyed and confirmed, yep, he's not wearing a mask. I've reached out to management several times to ask about this and they've not responded. I had called back in April, before we braved eating out during COVID, if they were following safe practices (masks, gloves, different person handling money than food, etc.) and reassured they were on top of it. I'm SO disappointed because this had been our favorite local BBQ spot. Bad safety practices during a pandemic with soaring new COVID cases coupled with bad customer service means we sadly, won't be eating here again. Angels Icehouse just across the way had to shut down just last week due to employees testing positive. Not good. :-(

We placed a to go order. It was a group order, each person calling in & one person picking it up. Everyone got a what they wanted.Personal, we compared this food to Opie's. We prefer Its all good. Big portions that you can share or have for lunch the next day. I had turkey at both places. Here it was more juicy. My husband had the Brisket at both places, he preferred It's All Good.Go to It's all Good over Opie's if in the area

DONT WASTE YOUR TIME!  I stopped by ( again ) Wednesday around 7:30 ish?  The guy at the window said, "they were out of everything" and refused to sale sides, i.e. beans, potatoes etc.  Not only was he rude, but he could of cared less if I ever returned!Everytime I go inside their employees are so rude and seem LOST?  Last time the pork ribs were like jerky...never will I waste my time!  I plan on driving the extra distance.
We LOVE it's all good bbq! Everything is delicious l, I especially love their chicken salad and stuffed jalapeños. And it's so convenient that they have a drive thru!

We have been here twice in the past few months and my kids absolutely love it. I am not a huge fan. The service has always been friendly and they have a lovely small seating area outside, which is nice. I do not like the interior. It is dark and you have to walk through tables to get to the counter to order.I'm a huge fan of brisket and always order it when I get BBQ. I do not care much for their brisket. It's just not that great. I'll eat it, but it's just not the best I've ever had or even something I would recommend, it's just ok. My kids love the ribs and we all think they have the best mac n cheese ever. Nobody cared for the tater tot casserole. It had an odd flavor, and I'm not sure what they do, but the taters are not in tot form.

Some of the best ribs tasted.  I am originally from Fort Worth and good amount of BBQ around.  However, south Texas has them beat!!  I had the ribs and sausage delicious.  Cream corn was good, but could have been slightly more flavorful.  Potato salad was also good, but could have been more flavorful as well.  Friendly staff and clean establishment.  Would definitely eat here again and recommend to friend
Spicewood, TX 78669

The barbecue is awesome. It's one of my top places in the Austin area. Brisket, turkey, sausage, ribs they're all great. Real friendly staff. It's not much to look at it but with the barbecue as good as it is, you just won't care.

Two minutes away, but we won't return after several really lousy meals.We ordered two different dessert cobblers--both were awful.Almost every time we've tried it, their barbecue is gristly, tough, doesn't taste fresh, too expensive for its mediocre quality. We won't return there, even though we're right down the street.

Nice little place for some good BBQ on hwy 71. My favorite meats, on this visit, in order from good to okay. Chicken, sausage, pork ribs, and brisket. Yep you heard me brisket last. The chicken had good flavor, meat came off the bone pretty easily. The sweet BBQ sauce really kicked it up in the flavor department. The sausage was really beefy with little fat and/or filler. It could used a bit more seasoning. The pork ribs really needed more flavor and bark. Lastly, the brisket was really disappointing. I'd ask the cutter for bark, he gave me the end of a brisket that was saturated with grease. The bark ends was so soggy, I just couldn't eat it. Like the meats before, the brisket could use some more seasoning. Their sides are wonderful. Especially the mac n cheese.

We had a catered event last weekend, and we could not be more pleased with the service this restaurant and team provided for our evening. Not only did they take the time early to set up nicely, but they kept the serving area clean throughout the entire period. That is a plus!! They didn't rush our serving time, and the food was delicious! We had guests in town who ate barbecue elsewhere the night before, but this meal was by far their favorite. We wouldn't hesitate to use them again!!
Great bbq. Highly recommend. I had some brisket and pork ribs and both were excellent. Good flavor and no need for sauce. Give them a try!
It's ALL GOOD! Truly it is, you cannot go wrong, my favs, the brisket, green beans, and the tater tot casserole!

My brother, his fiancé, and I were craving BBQ after our time at Hamilton Pool and of course you awesome Yelpers did not disappoint when rating this place!!  I had the chopped beef sandwich, the peach cobbler, tater tot casserole, cheesecake, and Mac n cheese.  My brother and his fiancé had the same in addition to ribs and the cream corn. The pork ribs were crunchy on the outside, juicy on the inside.  A little too much fat for his taste.  We both enjoyed the chopped beef sandwich with their bbq sweet sauce.  I personally didn't care for the tater tot casserole nor the cream corn.  The cheesecake was frozen solid The Mac n cheese is a must!  The peach cobbler is tha bomb!! Def leaving with a food coma!
Excellent food. Some of the best bbq I've had. I highly recommend trying this place if you're on that side of town.

Been here many times and it has ALWAYS been fantastic!  The sides are second to none among the many great BBQ joints in Central Texas.  The pork ribs and brisket are very, very good.  I'm not a good judge of sausage and never had the chicken here.  The sauces are really good too.  A bit of a hidden gem.
Spicewood, TX 78669

This is no lie! A smallFamily owned BBQ place that will knock your socks off! The beef ribs ( only available on Fri-Sun) are life changing. All the sides are delicious especially the cobbler . Eat there or take out. Come early as they close when they sell out...and they do sell out! Yummy!

It's not all good at its all good! I ordered brisket and sausage.  The only way to describe the brisket is that it looked like a piece of roast or meatloaf.  No bark, no smoke ring and no flavor.  The  sausage was better but not by much.  I will not be back.  Thanks,Wally

It's not all good at its all good! I ordered brisket and sausage.  The only way to describe the brisket is that it looked like a piece of roast or meatloaf.  No bark, no smoke ring and no flavor.  The  sausage was better but not by much.  I will not be back.  Thanks,Wally Kelm

We are from San Diego area and we met someone who suggested we come and try this Bbq out.  We both had the tri tip I had the lean cut and my husband had the moist cut.  They both were delicious.  We had to try the tater tot casserole and beans along with a stuffed Bacon Jalapeño,  couldn't say a bad thing about anything we tried.  When I come to the Hill country I will stop by again.  Yummy to the tummy.  Simple down home Bbq.

The best BBQ for me!Maybe I'm biased since I live down the road but I keep coming here after passing other bbq on the way so that still says a lot! The ribs are my favorite, brisket is perfect for me, vinegar slaw makes me feel healthy, Mac and cheese is a kid's favorite, and bbq sauce is tangy and vinegary which is a perfect change from the norm for me.

Being from Kansas City I'm always frustrated when somebody brings up Texas bbq but the moment I visited this joint, it was all good.  It was nice having quality bbq in a drive through window. I'm not going to lie... us Kansas citians we're impressed. PS. Keep those jalapeño poppers coming, they are fire.

Delicious brisket, ribs and chicken. Sausage is very good too and nice and lean, really good. It's all good as the name says. Love the squash and if you get there early enough, the stuffed smoked jalapeños are awesome. Highly recommend!

Holy cow this is good BBQ if you are in Austin or Marble Falls. Probably what Salt Lick used to be. It's been in it's location a long while which speaks volumes as if your BBQ in Texas isn't great-it will probably turn into a taco-shop. When you come in there is the ice wells to grab sodas or beer and you order by going through the line. The servers will cut your meat to order in front of you. We got it to go so I can't speak what the inside experience is like. I did notice a station to grab condiments, peppers etc. We ordered a huge selection of brisket, sausage and ribs. ALL were amazing. My faves are the brisket and sausage. The brisket and ribs had that wonderful smoke ring and were tender. Order the "wet" if you love moist falling apart meat. The ribs were nearly fall of the bone. Sausage had that nice "snap" as your teeth broke the casing. You'll also note many cook-off awards around the place, I can see why. But do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else-It will leave more for ME!

Great Bar-b-q place! So delicious brisket and sausage. I really liked all the sides. Pecan pie is that good to die for!!! Place is clean and stuff is very nice. It's definitely the place to come! It's so worth a drive!!!
Round Rock, TX 78665

If you are a barbecue aficionado, and you haven't tried Salt Lick BBQ, you need to add it to your places to visit.  Do it soon you won't be disappointed. The Salt Lick location in Round Rock is where it all started. As a foodie, I was intrigued that their sauce is not tomato based, yet it still has a rich sweet taste (sugar in their sauce helps get that signature caramelization). I tried four of their meats and four sides as part of a take-out order for a fundraiser they were supporting for William's Community School.  The Brisket was my favorite.  They baste all their meats four times during the cooking process.  The bark on the Brisket had a ton of flavor and was perfectly moist inside. I tried the pork ribs second. The meat easily tore off the bone and was tender, however I thought my other choices the sausage and smoked turkey were better.  The sausage is made up of a beef/pork mix.  They smoke it for almost four hours.  I suggest using their spicy BBQ sauce with it.  The flavor really pops.  Finally, the smoked turkey was probably second to the Brisket.  I think some places overcook or over smoke it and the meat becomes dry.  Not at Salt Lick, moist as their other meats and great with the sweeter sauce. Sides, well they take up room where you could just eat more meat.  But if you're asking, go with the Slaw, Mac N Cheese and Potato Salad. My wife would add their sweet potato fries. Didn't eat in so no view on the ambiance or service.  Prices were fair and what you would expect for good BBQ.

This is really great Texas smoked BBQ.  There's sauce on the table both sweet and hot if you want to add it, but it's not sauced when it's smoked.  The brisket is usually very tender but this last visit my wife said it was about the same as Rudy's and more expensive. I prefer the pulled pork and it is nice and moist.  The ribs are fall off the bone delicious. I'm not a fan of sausage or turkey, so I can't speak to those.  They also offer BBQ sandwiches as well.  But BEWARE if you are with several people, they do NOT offer separate checks!    AND if there are more than 20 in your party, at least 20 of them must each purchase the family style dining for $27/person.  Like all Texas BBQ places, plates and by the pound orders are served with loaf bread, pickles and onions.  It's higher priced many other BBQ places, but the service has always been good when we ate there and there is ample indoor seating at long picnic tables in a rustic style setting plus outdoor dining as well when the weather (i.e. Texas heat) cooperates...mostly in the fall and winter months.  They have homemade pies and the pecan was highly rated but I was not a fan.  I make my own homemade pecan pie on special occasions and mine is much better than theirs.
Loved the BBQ. Outdoor seating was great. Service was friendly! Had fun! Thanks Salt Lick!

Edit: this is an edit to my original review of 2 starsThe manager or owner not sure reached out to me shortly after I posted the review. First that alone got 2 more stars, the manner in which he did was great! And what customer service should be all about. It shows he really cares about the customer and I'm pretty sure he was sincere. I will give this restaurant another try next time we will eat there and hopefully things will be better. Thanks Ben for reaching out! I've tried Salt Lick at the airport and I thought let me go to the Round rock location and get some dinner. Well do I regret it! Got the family pack for $49 and change so more than $50 for... 2 ribs, 5 pieces of brisket, and the rest mainly sausage:((((... then you can't substitute anything. So I got 2 pints of their potato salad that btw it is not a good potato salad , beans that were just OK! And stale hard bread are you kidding me!!Edit: informed their tip is not automatically, there is a chance to say no or give what you want. Person should mention it you.Then they do tip automatically without giving you a chance to say yes or no? Why am I paying tip when you are just packing  my food up and that is it!I paid $80 for food that was mediocre and I will NEVER EAT THERE AGAIN!!

We had a great experience at the Round Rock Salt Lick. Part of that is we drove to Snows Barbecue in Lexington and got there at 8:30 and they already had a 4 hour line so we peace out and went to Round Rock. We were glad we did. The Brisket was good and not sure if they put butter on it cause it was moist but seemed like more of a lean cute. It had amazing bark almost like burnt ends, was much better than I remembered. The burnt ends were almost like sliced pieces of fatty portion so moist and well seasoned. Mac and cheese was really good definitely worth getting again. Ribs were good but we're on the large side for pork. Sausage was pretty good. Turkey was good, moist but don't know if we would order it again since the brisket was so good and we aren't turkey people but would make a great sandwich. Pulled pork was just alright. Potato salad was good, it was almost a German style. They do have a full bar with microbrews on tap and cocktails. Credit cards are accepted.

I loved this place!  The brisket melted in my mouth, the sausage perfectly seasoned; the ribs delicious, perfect waffle fries, Cole slaw and potato salad.  The best though without any doubt was the pecan pie, they have chocolate chip and plain...wow is all I have to say to that.  Really enjoyed it and looking forward to next time.

Best in class by far. While I can't say we had every BBQ that exists in Austin, I can say of the 1/2 dozen we did eat, this was head of the pack. The Buffalo ribs was my favorite but there was nothing wrong with the brisket! The potato salad was particularly good and different from others, The potato salad was a non-mayo German style. DO NOT MISS THE COBBLER!

Salt Lick is my favorite BBQ!!  The meats are delicious & tender-- but I LOVE the fact that their coleslaw & potato salad are unique & not loaded up with Mayo!   They really elevate the entire meal .   Their drive up to-go is fast & organized.   It is expensive,  but good barbecue is usually not cheap!! :)

Great food, great atmosphere and great location for us here north of Austin!  We have been going to the original in Driftwood but it's a long drive.  Happy that they have a location in Round Rock where we will be going to more frequently with friends and family.
Round Rock, TX 78665
Man oh man Moist brisket 1/2 turkey One giant pork ribSausage Beans Potato saladSlaw Bread pickles on onions Margarita and a drink for Molly (dirty snowman)What a meal    I'm stuffed!!

Their brisket is so tender and amazing. I also like the sausage and turkey. We typically get a variety of meat and share family style which is the best so you get to try a variety. I love their blackberry as well as their peach cobbler for dessert but the peach would be my favorite. It can get pricey pretty quick but worth it for the amazing BBQ. Would love to see creamed corn added to the menu.They also have a play place out front where we can take the kids when they get antsy. Happy we have salt lick in Round Rock!

It's been some time since I have been here. Stopped in for lunch and ordered the beef and bison rib plate and the pork rib, sausage and moist brisket plate:Beef Rib - 1/5 - not a lot of meat on hereBison Rib - 4/5 - very beefy flavor - delicious!Pork Rib - 1/5 - kind of dryMoist Brisket - 2/5 - smoke flavor did not penetrateSausage - 1/5 - kielbasa type sausage Potato Salad - 2/5 - not your typical mayo/mustard concoction; I'd say it's their hallmark dish Beans - 1/5 - had a weird aftertaste Coleslaw- 2/5 - no Mayo, just vinegar and sesame seeds They provide spear pickles and onions on request. Jalapeños are an extra 25 cents. If you don't want your meats drenched in sauce, be sure to let them know otherwise their default is to sauce your plate.I'm reminded today why we never come out here. Extremely mediocre barbecue. I'll stick to The County Line for sit down barbecue.

Times are different, but one thing is for sure the bbq here is good! Ordered right up front and parked while the food was getting prepared and was brought right to our window.BBQ did not disappoint, get the fatty pieces! I thoroughly enjoyed the option of fatty or lean. Everything here was delicious. Sausage, brisket, and turkey all were so good!

It's super family friendly with a playground for the kiddos & plenty of patio seating! If it weren't for that though, I wouldn't return here. The food is mediocre and bbq in general tends to be a bit pricey, and Salt Lick is no exception. Of the brisket, sausage and pork ribs I tried, the pork ribs were my favorite. They only had lean brisket the last time I went, and don't even bother with it. It's not tender and lacks flavor. The sides are ok but nothing outstanding. The potato salad & coleslaw are not drowning in sauce, which I appreciate, and the baked beans are buttery but the sauce it's in is pretty boring.

Have been in TX 2 years now (Dallas), and we thought we knew good BBQ. Salt lick just elevated our expectations, their pulled pork, sausage and ribs were exceptional. Now add in the hands down best sides- cole slaw, potato salad and beans with each platter- it's straight up BBQ heaven. Also their original BBQ sauce is out of this world!!!

Family of four ate here last week and the portions are Texas sized, for sure. We had a salad with chopped brisket on top, pork ribs, mini corn dogs, and burnt ends among other things. The burnt ends were the least favorite and (being very honest) the most disappointing part of the meal. They were too burnt - is that a thing? Hardly any substance to them other than char, as if they'd been drying out all day after being trimmed off the brisket.The server was incredibly nice and good at her job and the rest of the meal was great.The outdoor playground and seating area was great for us as we were on a long road trip and this was our only stop between DFW and San Antonio.

Texas BBQ at it's finest.Great balance between authentic smokehouse in a really nice setting. Great location and plenty of parking.Wonderful smoky wood smell from the second you leave your car in the parking lot.Beef Brisket Nirvana!.I realized I never really tasted excellent brisket until now. Got the Brisket and Pork Rib combo.It comes with smoked beans, coleslaw, potato salad, bread, homemade pickles and extra bbq sauce.Staff was courteous and spaced everyone safety.I ordered a mix of both lean and juicy brisket, both were amazing. Extremely tender and really balanced natural Smokey flavor. Nice bark edges. This did not need any bbq sauce, perfect flavor and not too salty. Pork ribswere fall off the bone tender, juicy and flavorful. Bbq sauce is well balanced, not too sweet with a subtle seasoning.Potato salad was excellent, tender with slight vinegar German like. Slaw also excellent and not sweet or drenched in Mayo. Pickles were crispy.Sweet potato fries were also good. Portions and value are excellent. All in all a great BBQ venue. I highly recommend. Excellent for families and I would love to come back in the evening. Full bar and beer offerings

These folks are amazingly friendly and happy to serve! We were greeted when we looked a little confused turning into the parking lot and welcomed to their back parking lot where there was outdoor seating. A comfortable atmosphere of picnic benches among large, shaded oak trees and strung lights for evening ambiance. Even a playground to keep rambunctious kids happy. Bathrooms were available to customers (even during COVID-19 precautions).The menu had many options of BBQ meats, but not many options for smaller meals. As a small guy, I don't need a huge amount of food, and the only small plates were available to children under ten or seniors over 65. I ended up with waaay too much food-- normally I like taking home leftovers, but since my hotel room doesn't have a microwave, it's not as convenient. My chicken and Mac n cheese was very tasty, and the server offered me another root beer refill to-go!Their billing is completely automated on their tablets, which was pretty handy! No waiting or trying to get the server's attention.
Round Rock, TX 78665

How do YOU eat your BBQ? We built this beautiful brisket sandwich from the all you can eat feast at #saltlickbbq. We certainly found a bit of foodtopia today.  #findingfoodtopiaShout out to our AMAZING server Shannon! He was the best!

The service is always good. The sauce, cole slaw, and potato salad are unique and good but I can't get over how lackluster the meats are. I've always thought, "maybe it's an off day, it's been around forever, it must just be my plate." And other such mental excuses but the meat consistently disappoints me. We ordered moist brisket. It was not moist and I couldn't pull it apart with my hand or even a fork. I had to use a knife. I really disliked it. The pork ribs were fine but not much flavor and the sausage (I am not a sausage fan in general) was the best meat we had. I ate 2 pieces of sausage, some sauce and a lot of cole slaw. My family enjoyed the beans and potato salad as well as the blackberry cobbler but this is a BBQ establishment and their BBQ was a big miss for me.

Per my review below, Crystal from Salt Lick has reached out to me and offered us a replacement meal on them. We haven't gone yet but her concern and gesture speak volumes to their commitment to their food and customers. Thank you for making things better, Crystal.

Worst brisket and beef rib I've ever had. We've eaten at the salt lick no less than 25 times and this was inedible. I was shocked that they would serve something that "off". We had family visiting from out of town and we told them all about the delicious the BBQ at Salt Lick. Everyone ordered brisket (some with other meats too) and we ordered beef ribs for the table. The sides were spot on. The turkey was great (unfortunately I was the only one who got it). The brisket and ribs were dry, chewy, and almost dehydrated/shredded. It was so sad that we brought out of towners here to eat and it was this bad. Very very disappointed. A sheer waste of over $100. I didn't say anything anything because we were needing to get home to get the kids to bed and because we were paying and didn't want to make a scene or be embarrassed in front of our guests. The server, Danielle, was very nice. Still in disbelief of what the cutters had the nerve to pass off as brisket and beef ribs to us.

We got the family style option that comes with all you can eat brisket, pork ribs, sausage and sides. We also got beef ribs and sweet potato fries.1- the service was spectacular, our waiter came by when we were in need of drink and food refills and was very nice2- the ribs and sausage were *chef's kiss* the brisket was a little dry for me3 - the beers on tap options were really good.4 - the pickled jalapeños are to die for. I wish I had gotten more to go. So delicious and perfect pairing to the brisket and ribsThe brisket was better once you added their BBQ sauce but I wish they offered a regular BBQ sauce along with their own made and I wish the brisket weren't so dry.Would definitely come back and I recommend this spot

We have been going to salt lick for years.  In the last two years they have either run out of some standard stuff or decided it will not be on the menu for two months. We tried to call the last couple of times going and the phone rings off the hook.  The past time. We called and called with no answer and drove the 30 minutes only to find out they did not have a full menu.  Decided to go to south side where they seem to never run out.  We would love to come back. At this time we are very disappointed on the service and the lack of online support. Sorry.

This place was solid! Good family bbq joint that had a kids jungle gym and cornhole. As a group we ordered brisket, sausage links, chicken, potato salad, criss cut fries, mac & cheese and the kids meals were chicken tenders and mini corn dogs. All the food was yummy.  Only thing that was a little different was the potato salad, was not a mayo base but was still tasty.  For our little mans birthday he got peach cobbler with ice cream and that was quite tasty.  I also enjoyed the spicy BBQ sauce.  Cool atmosphere and good food. YAY!

I decided to pick up a family for four dinner and they serve quickly let me say it's a hit and miss.  The huge portions they give you are ok like potato's ehh not my thing, coleslaw ehhh not great , the one portion I did like was the beans.  The beans were to die for tasted liked made from scratch I even had some the next day with eggs. Let's get to the meat very good portions and allot of everything my fav was def the brisket.  The price is def worth fit when it comes to meat not so much for the sides.  I also ordered the Mac n cheese on the side which was very creamy really deliciousLol I forgot to mention the pickles and side of sauce that was good but don't need it with the meat.  Actually you could save the sauce for wings just a taught lazy cooking days.  The pickles were def delicious and I ain't no pickle girl so am surprised very good food this was my first time trying so I think I'll order something else to try

Service was fast.  The brisket comes in lean and fatty or you can get a combo.  I love fatty and it had great seasoning.  The ribs were also good.  The area is very large for indoor dining.  Definitely a good local Austin stop when passing through.
Round Rock, TX 78665

There is a reason neighbors recommended Salt Lick over other nearby BBQ. The moist brisket might be the best beef we've had anywhere. It falls apart as you try to plate it (Family Order). The outside is caramelized perfectly. Slightly pink, marbled brisket slices. We also had the turkey. It has a mellow smoke taste. The sauces are wonderful. A slightly vinegary edge to them. The spicy sauce is not too hot too enjoy. It's flavorful, not overpowering. The sweet potato fries were cool by the time we reached home, but the meets were still extremely hot in their foil wraps. The take-out issue isn't really their fault. (We will dine-in after the pandemic fades.)The sides were good, but it's all about the brisket. Next time, that's the only meet we'll choose. We were impressed. Definitely returning.

Salt lick is An Austin staple! Whenever I have company I bring them here for a taste of Austin barbecue. They have two different locations plus one In the AUS airport. This is the definition of Reliable and consistent bbq in central Texas. I usually order the Thurman platter bc you get a variety of items.!!! Try them all

Really really angry at making it so difficult to eat safely with a 3 year old. They wouldn't serve us in the outdoor seating, which is ok. They wouldn't let us order to go at the restaurant, which is not ok. We had to get back in the car, drive around the building, get the to go and then come back to the outdoor seating to eat. I talked to the manager. I used to pick up here a few times a month. I won't be back. Ever

This is one of the best places to get Barbecue. Everything has great flavor and it doesn't give me heartburn. The give you lots of things to go with your meal and they are generous with their portions. It's definitely worth the price. The atmosphere is down to earth and service is great too.

I came here for a business lunch after a long first half of the day, we were both starving, I'm visiting from San Diego and she's local. She recommended the Salt Lick for some amazing bbq. Once we pulled up you could smell the bbq in the air. During Covid time you can dine outside under the tree with no masks at the table, inside the ac once you get to the table you can take off mask, or order to pick up. I loved the play area for the kids. It's very family friendly. Saw a baseball team chowing down. Lots of visitors from other towns or cities or out of state travelers. In fact I met a mom in line who lived in the city next to me in my hometown small world. Everyone's so nice here. Our hostess and server were hard workers. My agent got the all you can eat portion for $26.95. She said don't waste your appetite on the coleslaw beans or potato salad go for the beef brisket and pork ribs it also comes with sausage but she didn't order that. You are allowed to bring it home with you if you don't finish it. I ordered the Pulled Pork Sandwich and waffle fries to make it a plate. It arrived and oh man was this sandwich huge the bun, pulled pork, and sauce was the best I've ever had! It was served with a pickle and onion on side. My basket of waffle fries was gigantic I'm like who's all this for wow they do not skimp here. Best waffle fries ever. We both had the sweet tea (I had lemon on the side). Here's the funny part, our server kept dropping off new cups of sweet tea refills I was nursing my first one I never knew that was going to be a thing I'm so used to one cup and that's it. Nope not here it keeps coming without being asked. The more the merrier and everything is bigger in Texas-love it. Another plate of pickles and onions arrived too. I was stuffed to the brim I didn't even cut my sandwich in half she took a pic of me stuffing my face. Now the bar area and the smoker with sausage was all blocked off for covid time so I had to take photos thru the plexiglass. The pies looked like granny just baked them-they looked perfect all lined up-what a treat. You can enjoy the half cobbler or half berry pie if you can't decide. Overall, this is a nice casual option if you're in the mood for some best tasting local style Texas BBQ. The menu is not elaborate it's plain and simple with all the best food items to chose from. The seating is spaced out inside and outside. The customer service is marvelous and I would come back here in a heart beat.

First time to Salt Lick but had heard good things and wanted to give it a try.  Waitress recommended Thurmond's platter as I would get a good sample of the Q.  I asked what came with it...bread, onion, pickles, cole slaw, and potato salad.  I asked to not have the potato salad and I ordered a side of the mac n cheese to replace it.  My plate came out with potato salad on it...it covered my cole slaw and over my rib.  I scrapped it off as best I could.  I ordered the amber Austin beer...the beer had chunks of crap floating in it and at bottom of the mug...I guess they don't clean their beer lines.  The sausage was great, the brisket had a mustard taste to it, not a fan.  Service was quick but the fact they did not listen or try to make it right was a big turn-off.  Several great BBQ places in the area, this was not one of them...very disappointed as they did not live up to the hype

It has been 12 years since i have been to a salt lick. I wanted to treat my son to something special. I remeber the brisket being awesome.  I ordered the brisket plate with beans , potato salad , and slaw. This reminds me of cafeteria bbq. It was cold. The beans were cold. The brisket was cold. What a horrible experienece for 56 dollars for two plates. I guess i should have brought him to driftwoood the original location. I can only hope they care about what they are bringing to the table. I have had hospital food better than this. They should be ashamed to serve this ..no less charge the most i have ever paid for a brisket plate. Avoid this place at all costs. .. They depend upon desperate people in the middle of no food choices to make thier money.
Really really good ! Tried a few bbq spots in Texas (Houston and Austin) and this was our favorite. Authentic bbq, well priced, nothing fancy.

First time visiting! We were sat right away and service was quick and great. I had the brisket, pork ribs and sausage. Brisket was too dry but man those ribs were amazing! The sausage was equally as delicious. Mac and cheese was good too.
Round Rock, TX 78665

I love coming here. Always great service, and great food. It's a good spot to go with the family or just a couple. Your food comes quick. Always on point. Never had any issues. Highly recommend. I've pretty much tried everything on the menu.
Always GREAT BBQ.  A must go to.   Great people working there, fun place to eat with family

I enjoyed using their drive through service as it was really fast and efficient. The folks that took my order were following all cdc guidelines as recommended during this covid 19 pandemic. Onto the food. I opted to get both lean and fatty cuts of brisket. Lesson learned. Always always get the fatty brisket when ordering bbq. Forget the lean cut. Forget being health conscious. The fatty cuts are definitely worth a moment of your time. The lean ones are just ok.

Jamie is the best!!! We came here for our Bach party and he was SO amazing and accommodating. I am so glad we had our first meal here- it was the best way to start our trip!!! We love Jamie!!!! The food is good too lol

Huge open space. Bench like tables and I didn't feel like I was too close to anyone during this pandemic. I was visiting from California and wanted Texas BBQ. Amazing spot and your food arrives so fast!

Cold slaw here was the star of the show. It's not your typical Cole slaw you would find anywhere else.Beef Ribs here were my favorite followed by the sausages, brisket, then baby back ribs. Disclaimer: Beef Ribs are usually my favorite.For sides, I wouldn't order the potato salad again. It wasn't bad, but I'd rather try something else. The Mac n Cheese was pretty traditional and worth a reorder. I already told you about the Cole slaw. You should give it a try!Overall, a good Texas BBQ joint that has great outdoor space with benches as seating. Great for big parties. Staff was nice and friendly.

This was my first experience of legit texas bbq in texas! And it was so bomb. We got a pound of brisket (mixed lean and fatty with burnt ends), a pound of pork ribs, and a pound of pulled pork. The brisket was tender and melted in your mouth. The pork ribs slid right off the bone. The pulled pork was flavorful and oh so juicy! On top of the food the ordering was super convenient and service was incredibly quick (we got a take home order). It was a great first experience and I'm already looking forward to coming back!

I went to Salt Lake round rock location I order the brisket and rib platter and received a pathetic plate of barbecue the fatty brisket was cold the  bison rib was very beefy and it came with two sides the barbecue beans had a strange aftertaste and the potato salad was made with al dente potatoes. Traditionally barbecue joints provide free pickles and onions and jalapeños I was charged $.25 per jalapeño I ordered the wait staff was standing around texting on their phones the waitress was wearing her mask below her nose area and the beer had particles floating inside it looks like they don't clean the beer lines!!! I strongly suggest not to eat at this location especially if you're a seventh generation Texan like I am!!

From start to finish our experience was great! Our hostess was super pleasant and so nice. Mike T was our waiter and he was wonderful!! My husband and myself ordered the brisket plate and I could have had two! The brisket was so flavorful, moist(and not fatty) and the bark on the brisket was hands down delicious!!! The sauce took it up several notches- heavenly! I wish I had the recipe. The potato salad that came with the meal was savory and had a slight sweetness to it and the coleslaw complemented that nicely. I recommend this place. Again, what made it extra special was our waiter- great service!
Austin, TX 78727

Went for a quick and easy BBQ dinner with the hubby!Let's talk FEWDS! Feel- Very Covid friendly set up and all fixings prepackaged and ready to go for you. Nice local feel to it. Great for a quick bite or for to go orders. EATS- I got the Friday special which is the half chickenplate comes with two sides. I really liked the chicken it was very moist and tender *tigger words sorry*. I got the peach habanero bbq sauce to go with it and it was tasty! For sides i tried to keep it healthy side salad and their broccoli salad. Broccoli salad was actually really good! Was dressed in their Italian style dressing. Probs will get a double portion next time. My husband got the two meat plate (brisket and pork ribs) we love their pork ribs flavor and the brisket is pretty tender too. He got it topped with spicy bbq sauce. For his sides, he got the cornbread casserole and potato salad. I really liked the potato salad a lot! Has a bit of mustard flavor to it which i like ! Cornbread casserole was okay but fell flat for me. Take it or leave it. Worth- I'd say it's good size portions And decent quality food. However after tip i spend about $40 on two meals. Kinda feels a bit much for me. Drinks- self serve soft drinks, water, tea sweet and unsweet! Service - greeted quickly upon walking in and a bunch friendly guys working there! I'd say their customer service is top notch. Quick to recommend things but always make you feel like you made the best choice no matter what you get! We definitely like coming here for a quick bbq fix and recommend our neighbors give it a try too! Also they do catering, which we almost highly contemplated for our wedding before Covid hit!

I ordered takeout online and it was pretty easy to do. I ordered the plate with brisket and for sides I ordered Mac and cheese, potato salad, and potato casserole. It took less than 5 minutes to place the order and I opted for curbside pickup. Once the order was placed I received an eta of 15 minutes of when the order would be ready. Once I arrived there, it was really quick and easy. The server who brought out my food was super nice and friendly. Food was hot and delicious and I plan on coming back here very soon!

Wedding Catering We were so pleased with the service and quality we received with Pok-e-jos catering.We used their services for our wedding on June 23.  We ordered some appetizers for the happy hour before the dinner service and a 3 meat BBQ package for the dinner service.  All of the food was delicious.  We received several compliments from our guests.The staff was extremely kind and professional.  They were also accommodating.  I needed a few plates to be packaged for some guests that could only stay for the ceremony and not stay for the dinner service.  I wanted those guests to be able to leave with some food from our wedding.  The staff was able to box up a few plates for these guests.  It was a small thing, but we really appreciated this extra effort that the staff went through. One other thing I need to mention is that we felt very safe with the service they provided.  The staff all wore masks and gloves and they plated the food in a way that made us feel comfortable given today's conditions.  We worked with Anna to set up catering.  She helped to walk us through the process of selecting the meal options and the contract.  She was extremely helpful and a pleasure to work with.And in the end, one of the main reasons we loved working with Pok-E-Jos is that they were almost invisible.  They were so professional and did all of the setup and tear down of the services that they provided that we hardly even noticed them there.  They provided us with a great meal and we had no complaints.Thank you Pok-e-Jos for helping to make our wedding extra special.

If you are looking for a casual, straight forward BBQ joint this is your spot. Their menu is not overwhelming and has just the right amount of meaty classics you'd be expecting to have in any Austin BBQ restaurant.  With a clear view of everything on display, you can see they try to keep every dish nice and fresh for their patrons. (Today I went for the Mac n' cheese and it did not disappoint!)  The Pok-E-To-Plate is the perfect option for someone looking to be full but not overloaded.The few times I've been here I have not had an issue getting a table during peak lunch hours and service going down the line is quick and easy.

This is difficult because there are parts of the meal that were fantastic and some there were just not there. So I'm gonna break down our feedback the best we can.Meat & Sauce:Sauce - 1.5 out of 5 - It's just odd, not sure what they are going for... vinegar and tomato? It's like North Carolina and Texas had an alien baby. Needs some re-thinking... Try making 3 originals for everyone.Brisket - 3 out of 5 - without sauce, it's just dry. The smoke is there... but just Clark Griswold choke on a bone dry. (also you know how I feel about the sauce already)Pork - 3.5 out of 5 - Good flavor, but still dry... needs a different sauce than that odd Vinegar hybrid. I recommend a thick red sauce or mustard-based bbq sauce like South Carolina. If you don't like mustard base check out Meat Churches sauces. I'm sure they can recommend something fantastic.Not Edible:Cole Slaw - 0 out of 5 - reminds me of elementary school. Plain horrible.Greenbean Casserole - 0 out of 5 - reminds me of BBQs with a drunk friend that brought that 1 dish they destroyed from a family member... Plain horrible.FANTASTIC!!:Potato Salad - 5 out of 5 - hands down some of the best potato salad I've ever had!! This stuff is on point! Grab a tub or bucket of this stuff because it's fantastic!!!Fries & Okra - 3.5 out of 5 - I mean how can you mess up fried Okra and French fries... but they did need more salt.Summary:This place is decent for a craving but it's just commercial BBQ. However, if they fix some of these things it could be a great place. Hope the owners tweak some of the minor items and then they have something.

Oooh baby!  You like your bbq spot?  Do ya?  That's real cute but come on down to Poke Joe's and try the real thing now.  This place is hot to trot.  We were hesitant to try this location because we are so use to ours but it blew us away!  Everyone was on top of things, helpful, offered free larger drinks to the boys, and before I could ask for anything extra- already had it for me.  The place is clean, the pickle bar is fresh, bbq sauce hot, and they have the best sweet tea.  We love the brisket, fried okra, mashed potatoes, and more!
You get exactly what your order, and oooooowwwweeeeee is it good!!! I always grab some lean brisket and tasty sides. Never disappoints!
Not great food but great service. Meat had no flavor and Texas fries are puny, not giant (I thought it was all bigger in Texas) Too bad the food is not worth it, cause the employees were so nice
column21: Central Oklahoma City, Oklahoma City, OK

column20: This was my first visit, the dining atmosphere was very good, clean & cozy. The staff were friendly. The food was beyond my expectations; my smoked chicken was excellent and I loved their potato salad! I look forward to returning.
Austin, TX 78727

Great experience today. The staff was on top of it, friendly, and very fast despite it being a slow Monday. The food was perfect, brisket melted in my mouth and sausage is my favorite around. Their cornbread is delicious and I can't think of anything to say other than a perfect lunch stop. I've been coming here 20 years and it's been amazing the whole time, and continues to be. Thanks guys
Ordered takeout. They claimed they gave my order to someone else. I've been a customer for 20+ years. This is the worst. Never going back.

It's back this year!Their brisket chili is to die for. I love their smoked turkey also, but once a year during the month of February, they make a really awesome chili. Some chili I have eaten recently seemed to have too much chili powder. The Poke-e-Jo's chili was milder and the smokey taste of the brisket was not overwhelmed with heat or spice. You can buy their chili several different ways but the way I like it is on top of a bed of Fritos covered with melted cheddar cheese and chopped onions. Poke-e-Jo's is reliable and has good customer service. I have become a big fan of smoked turkey lately and they have moist tasty smoked turkey here.

I moved into this neighborhood about 6 months ago and have eaten at Pok-e-Jo's at least a 1/2 dozen times.Their best meat, in my opinion, is their smoked turkey. You have to ask for it, but they always have it. Today I tried one of their seasonal specials, brisket chili. It was awesome. Fortunately, they do not put beans in their chili. It seems like it's made with high-quality pieces of smoked brisket, and the usual seasonings you would find in a high-quality chili. They serve it on a small bed of Frito corn chips and offer it with grated cheese and raw onions on top. You can add beans if you want to be like a Yankee.They offer their chili through the end of January and if you haven't tried it it is worth they stop by to try. The bowl is just right for an entrée. I had a side of coleslaw with my chili.Their chili is not too hot, but it does have the correct Texas amount of chili powder.With eight days left in the month, I am thinking I may go back to get a quart or two for my freezer.

Great all around BBQ place. First it's not Blacks, but it's good - not great. I've been to multiple locations and it's always consistent.  The meat itself is always good. The bbq is pretty tasty.  What sets itself apart from the other chain places is the sides.  Broccoli salad - check. Mac and cheese - check (great with kids).  Green bean casserole - checkFried orca - checkBanana pudding - checkAbout 15 other fantastic sides - check. I'll be honest - I come here for the sides with good BBQ. Prices are getting a tad pricy. I think it's ~$12 for a poquito plate with a drink. Poquito is 1/4 lb of meat and 2 -1/2 sides and Texas toast of you so choose. Plenty for me. It's my go to whenever I have guests. Again, it's not black or other "elite" place, but it's always consistent and you don't have to wait 1-2 hours or drive 2 hours for good bbq with great sides.

We're new to Austin (and Texas BBQ). I happen to be around the corner getting my toddlers hair cut when we stopped in for a quick bite to eat. I was a little overwhelmed by the menu choices but the staff was so nice and patient answering my questions. They even turned the train on for my son's entertainment. I got the chopped brisket sandwich with a side of beans and coleslaw and my son got the smoked turkey with a side of Mac and cheese. We also split the banana pudding. My almost 2 year old ate every morsel of his lunch and about 1/2 of mine plus his weight in pickles. Pickles might be his fav part about Texas BBQ. While we were eating, the manager (perhaps owner?) stopped by our table to welcome us to Austin and asked where we were from. We shared that we just moved from Hawaii and he spent a few minutes telling us about all the awesome events happening in the area. Thanks for making us feel so welcome! We'll be back again for sure!

We had a delivery from your Parmer Road location today, and I just wanted to let you know how pleased we were. But then, we knew we would be; we've been Pok-e-Jo's customers for YEARS! Only BBQ we buy. It was SO good to see that your quality hasn't changed in spite of this damn pandemic. The meat, the sides, and all the extras were perfect. Thanks Pok-e-Jo's, for being there when we want great BBQ.

The meat cutter guy was nice and welcoming and pretty quick with the service.. When it comes to BBQ in the Austin area my top selections are as followed  #1 Salt Lick #2 SouthSide Market #3 Rudy's...The brisket here didn't seem to have that deep down smoked taste to it, so it was lacking that stand out flavor. I think when it comes to BBQ in Texas there has to be a separation and I didn't find it here..The 4 stars were for the friendly and fast service.
Quick and easy service. Was my first time here since I am from philly and was not disappointed. Brisket and pulled pork were amazing.
Austin, TX 78727

The staff was friendly when I placed my order. I ordered the 2 meat plate with brisket and turkey.  They have a wide variety of sides, but since this is my first time here I decided to stick to the basics ( potato salad & pinto beans) The one thing I liked about this place was the portion sizes of the sides! The meat portion size was okay and I guess within normal range of most BBQ restaurants. The restaurant itself was nice, spacious with tables & booths and a couple of TVs! Unfortunately the food was awfully bland! The turkey and brisket had no flavor to it and the same can be said of the  potato salad and pinto beans! I was excited to try this place out, but was let down by the taste of the food. It's almost like it was not seasoned at all. Maybe I went on a day where the prep cook forgot to season the food! Also the bar with the pickles and onions had nets flying around it which was interesting as the place was pretty clean. The AC was running and the fans were on which probably attributed to my food getting cold fast, I placed a picture of the food so you can see how good it looks; looks can be deceiving! As far as the price I paid the meal was almost $17 for for the 2 meat plate and a drink which sounds about right for what I got. To sum it up, nice venue, decent portion sizes, but bland food!

I mean... Peach Cobbler...Cake? I have NEVER seen or heard of such a thing. That is something I just can't get through my head, and I am not from the South. I am used to the best part of the Cobbler is the Crust.. but I digress. I will also preface with saying I do not eat the pork or beef so I am not a good judge for those but, the Turkey and Chicken are ok. I would say the Turkey is the better of the two. Their Mac N Cheese tastes like a knock off Velveeta. Without Much Velveeta. The Green Bean Casserole is disgusting. I just don't find this to be a great BBQ Place. Go To Smokey Mo'sEnd of Story.

Great BBQ and sides but this review is about the incredible customer service from the woman who cuts the meat, to the guy piling on the sides, to the waitress that checks if you need anything additional, to the busboy that offered to refill our drinks, to a manager (Zach - that I talked to at the end) who noticed that a gentleman hadn't touched one of his sides so he got him something else.  Everyone was so incredibly pleasant. I'll definitely be back. Thanks,  Pok-e-jo team!!

I ordered a quarter chicken, white meat, which included a breast and wing.  You can order it either white meat or dark meat, and the price is very reasonable at $3.99 before taxes.  They offer lots of different sides, but I went with just the chicken.  It tasted good, and the barbecue sauce is also really good.  They also include buttered toast with your meal, and you can request whole wheat bread toast.The staff is very friendly and bend over backwards and  work really hard to please their customers.  All of the employees seem to enjoy their jobs, which was displayed by their very positive attitudes.They also have a condiment bar with barbecue sauce (original and spicy) pickles, jalapenos, onions, lemons, crackers, salsa, salad dressing and a few more things - it is quite extensive.  They also have a soda and tea refill station where you can get your own refills. I will definitely return to Pok-e-Jo's and highly recommend them.

Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review Chris! We really appreciate you giving us a shot, and I will definitely be sharing your comments with the staff--they will love to hear it. Hope to see you again soon!Regards,John, manager

Central Texas easy. Great Sausage, sides, Brisket - always a Texas experience. I like moist brisket with little fat - they do it up right. Lunch is well served and easy in and out. It feels like a place your Uncle goes regularly. The new TVs show sports and News(CNN).Tip, get the sauce on the side! For sure take the Texas toast it's good in the sauce :-)
Thanks for leaving us a review Andrew! We really appreciate, and we look forward to welcoming you back again some time soon.Regards,John, manager

They've got good brisket and pork ribs! I love their fried okra as well.They've got various daily specials like stuffed BBQ baked potato, 2 meat plate, BBQ salads, etc. I always call in for pick up with no problems or mess up orders.
Thanks so much for the review Pesh! We really appreciate your business, and hope to see you again soon.Regards,John, manager
Austin, TX 78727

Not very satisfied at all with this place. It was way over priced. The brisket was super dry, the sausage was over cooked. The potato salad was very bland. Even the coleslaw was very bland and no flavor. Also our tea had no ice. For the price of the food I expected way higher quality.

We tried Pok-e-jo's a few days ago because we were craving BBQ and it was the nearest spot, we were not disappointed! It's a fast casual style BBQ place with a delicious selection of entrees and sides all for a decent price! My boyfriend had brisket and I had pulled pork, he had coleslaw and fries and I had mac and cheese and potato salad, and the plates came with a piece of Texas toast.Everything was absolutely delicious, we devoured it all! And the service was very good, they brought out fresh fries to the table for my boyfriend, and they swung around to ask us how everything was which was nice too! the location is convenient for us so I'm sure we'll be back!
Thanks for the review Marissa, and for the awesome pictures! We hope to see you and your boyfriend back in the store some time soon.Regards,John, manager
Ribs were so dry they were like wood.  Inedible threw them out. Meat in general  was over cooked.

This place has been here since I was in high school, and before that I think almost 30 years not positive on that but it's close. Brisket, sausage, pork ribs were all fabulous, their sauce goes perfect with all. Many years of some good BBQ here.

I can see why this place gets such great reviews for food. The food is excellent. But they use plastic cups for every dine in customer and throw them away without even recycling.  Really? I'll go back in a year and update the review to 1 star if the same or 5 stars if they recycle or switch to reusable glasses.
Pretty good and well priced. The meat was a little cool for some reason. It was still a good portion and wasn't cold so I was fine especially since I had been in the lake all day and was starving.

Okay. Hands down the best BBQ in Austin. When you walk into the restaurant, its smells like you walked into a backyard BBQ party. Nice  decor too. Great place to eat lunch. Service is fast and friendly. The mac-n-cheese tastes like the South. The brisket was cook to perfection and moist. I give this place an A+
Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review! We would love to welcome you back to our backyard BBQ party any time :)Regards,John, manager
Austin, TX 78727

What a wonderful place! Great food, yes, but the service is outstanding. The people are incredibly nice, very attentive. Old fashioned true customer service. Whoever is training the folks there, keep doing what you are doing. I'll be back for the delicious BBQ ribs and perfectly smoked brisket.

Why have you hired a handful of people who are incapable of customer service?! The night crew on Wed needs to be replaced. If you're wondering why your sells are low on the night shift it's because the night crew is lacking integrity. And online it says that they close at 10pm but it is 9:22pm  and the people on the inside have the doors locked because they don't want to serve black people.
Good tasting brisket and great tasting buns.  Carry out did not include pickles and onions in the bag.
I've been here 2x now...meh. I'd rather go to Slab or stumble into a new BBQ joint, this place isn't great..it's ok.

BBQ is not something I usually crave, but something I'll enjoy once I have it. Stopped by Pok-e-Jo's as its not a far drive from my friend's place, and ordered a 2-meat plate, which includes two sides and a Texas toast. The person taking my order was really nice, I think he could tell it was my first time here. I chose brisket and chicken for my meats, and had pinto beans and Texas fries for my sides.The food was great - the meats were moist and the BBQ sauce delicious. The only complaint I had was that my fries tasted a little bit soggy even though they had just brought it out to us (hence taking away a star, but really you should read this as a 4.5 star review). After we finished eating, as this was my first time here, and we saw trash cans near by, we decided to go throw our trash away and was met by one of the employees saying "STOP!!," which startled me a bit, only to find out that he would take care of our finished plates. The service was exceptional, and I would definitely come back again.

Hi Elaine,So glad to hear you enjoyed everything on your first time in! We will definitely take your comments and try to improve our fries and not scaring people with our service :) We love seeing first timers in, and hope to see you back in again soon for another round of BBQ!Regards,John, manager

This place is in our list of go-to places for lunch at work. It's cheap, fairly decent, and very quick. A 3 meat plate comes out to around $15 with 2 sides and a drink. There's hardly ever a line and there's always somewhere to sit.The food is nothing spectacular though, but it hits the spot for the most part - moist brisket, tender ribs, etc. What they're lacking here is the strong smoky flavor Texas barbecue is known for. At this price point, it's gonna be hard to get something wood smoked so I don't blame them.

Hi Daniel, Thanks for taking the time to leave a review, we really appreciate it! We do actually smoke all of our meats at each of our locations twice a day. We will definitely take your comments about the smoky flavor and work to get more of that in the meat. We appreciate you eating with us, and hope to see you back in again soon.Regards,John, manager

I am fairly new to Texas, but since arriving I have tried a few different BBQ places and I keep going back here! Other places for me may have great sides, but their meat falls flat or their meat isn't that great and the sides are gross. Pok-e-Jo's however has delicious meat and great sides! The jalapeno sausage is amazing and definitely has a bite to it. I really enjoy the turkey and the brisket! I always get the mac n cheese. I wouldn't say it's the best I've ever had but it is very tasty and I love it. They have two choices on sauce, original or spicy. I suggest getting the spicy, it does add a kick to your food. The puddings are very delicious.. the banana one is very dangerous! Once you have one bite you want more! My boyfriend loves the Jalapeno Corn Bread Casserole. I had family visiting and we picked up food from here and they both loved it as well! They were sold.I always end satisfied and stuffed. I will definitely come here again
Spicewood, TX 78669

Stopped on the recommendation of a neighbor and glad that we did. The meat is in a warming container right when you walk in. You just tell them  how much you want, they weigh it and you are  good to go. You then order the sides, with wonderful butter beans, onions, pickles and bread at the end of the line. Make sure you order the tater tot casserole. It is out of this world. We had the peach cobbler for dessert and thatt was very good also. Be aware that they  sometimes run out of meat if you go too late.

This place was great. I was driving looking for a place to eat while in the area. They were open during quarantine, and when calling they could do takeout. They were kind of enough to call me when it was ready so I could quickly walk in and pick up since I had my dog with me.  The food was great, staff was friendly. I'll definitely be back if I'm in the area again.

We decided to expand "shelter at home" by sheltering in our car on a bluebonnet viewing drive down Hwy 71.  Opie's is open and doing curbside, so we treated ourselves, and what a treat it was!  We think their bbq is the best around and felt like kings eating their brisket and ribs.  The service was quick and cheery, and the servings really generous.  A terrific way to break the tedium of being shut in during this surreal time!

We got a pound of brisket, jalapeño cheese sausage and ribs. Brisket melts in your mouth good, sausage was the right amount of spice loaded with flavor and the ribs were tender off the bone good. I highly recommend it. We plan to continue going to Opie's anytime we're in the spice wood area.

This is a no frills, bare bones operation. The staff is quite low key and friendly. Drinks are serve yourself. We did not try the butter beans, but they seem to be a local favorite. We got a mix of dry and moist. It has a good flavor, but not a place worth going out of your way for. The tater tot casserole was a good compliment to the meat and the green beans are also fine. They have a large selection of t-shirts with the restaurant's name on them. The walls are adorned with old tools and farming implements. There's nothing wrong with the restaurant, it's just not a stand out. They have a setup for live music. Maybe with beer and music it is better.

This is a no frills, bare bones operation. The staff is quite low key and friendly. Drinks are serve yourself. We did not try the butter beans, but they seem to be a local favorite. We got a mix of dry and moist. It has a good flavor, but not a place worth going out of your way for. The tater tot casserole was a good compliment to the meat and the green beans are also fine. They have a large selection of t-shirts with the restaurant's name on them. The walls are adorned with old tools and farming implements. There's nothing wrong with the restaurant, it's just not a stand out. They have a setup for live music. Maybe with beer and music it is better.
Delicious Texas bbq! Staff are very friendly. If you want beef rib get there when they open!

Opie's is always a treat when headed to Krause Springs! It's right at the turn that takes you there, so we always stop there on the way in. This last visit was probably my least favorite, but every other time has been great. This time, it was a little jarring, coming from the city, that zero people were wearing a mask upon entry. Even the girl cutting the meat was not masked. No employee or patron had a mask at all. We are vaccinated, but lots of old folks there eating that I was concerned for, but I guess it's their choice. Either way, it was definitely a contrast from what I know.The girl cutting meats was only cutting huge slabs of meat and didn't seem to want to comply with my request for a smaller piece of meat.
