The brisket was over cooked and dry, despite the load of fat that was on my slabs. The turkey was pretty perfect though. The butter beans tasted terrible and the green beans were just okay. The tot cass though, was sooooo good! I will definitely be back next visit to the springs even though it wasn't a perfect visit this time. It usually is.

Great BBQ - nice and spicy!  Their ribs are outstanding!  My only complaint is they often run out of meat.  I was in there on Saturday at 5:00 p.m. and bought the last rack of ribs and the last of the sausage.  All they had left was 2 smoked turkey  feasts - at 5:00 pm on SATURDAY!  I guess they wanted to close early...
Spicewood, TX 78669
I've always liked Opie's and they have some of the best sides and deserts around but the robes and chicken were disappointing the last couple times there, just not a lot of flavor for Texas bbq.
The BBQ is tasty.  My only gripe is the price.  I had a sampler of 3 meats.  Total came to $42!  One small rib was $5.40!!  See picture!
Great BBQ and sides - the ribs and brisket were amazing, and the craisin slaw was perfect. Inside dining was nice and staff was masked up.
Passing through town checking Yelp and saw bbq with almost 5 stars and almost 500 reviews.  Did not disappoint.   Great job. Thanks.

Just amazing brisket. And the smoked turkey is not to be missed. Love that Opie's is just 10 minutes from my home. If you're in the Spicewood area, take the time to stop at Opie's. You will not regret it!!

Tender doesn't even begin to describe the brisket.  It is so tender you almost don't even need to chew.  And very juicy too.  Great smoke flavor.  Some of the best brisket I have had in quite a while.  Also had the spicy corn.  Packs a little heat but very good, would order again.  Cost isn't cheap but definitely worth it.

I'm giving this two stars because the meat was decent enough for a barbecue place. The turkey was pretty good and usually turkey is dry. However... It was extremely overpriced. I paid two dollars for four bites of sausage. I'm not even joking it was for little rounds for two dollars!!I I ordered that tiny amount of sausage and not much brisket and turkey. It was just about one plate full and I paid $16 for that and one side!!! The brisket was moist but it taste a bit like rubbing alcohol. The tater tot casserole was kind of gross. The positive is that they have a big bar with barbecue sauce and pickles etc. and you also get free beans but they don't let you know that until after you've ordered a bunch of sides.  Sidenote... None of the employees were wearing masks. You won't hate it but I definitely won't go back.

Unfortunately, I was not at all pleased with this BBQ place. You order your meat right when you walk in. It's very awkward especially if you have never been there. We stepped back to look at the menu and let others go ahead of us. We ended up ordering 1/2lb of brisket and a half rack of "sweet & spicy" baby back ribs. We took our meats to get weighted and ended up paying for nearly 1/4lb more of brisket than we ordered. After picking our sides and paying, we headed to our seat when I noticed an area with free beans, bread, pickles. I could not find plates anywhere! I noticed people looked like they were eating off of paper, which I eventually found back at the register. I ordered the fatty brisket because I was told by the employee it would be more moist and the other drier. It was not very moist at all and I would hate to find out what the dry version was like. I'm a huge brisket fan, but I really didn't find this brisket exciting. My son said the "sweet and spicy" ribs were just SPICY and didn't care to eat them. My husband said they were good. The sides-ugh! The Mac and cheese was watery and flavorless with burnt pieces in it. The tater casserole tasted like tuna casserole with potato instead of noodles. It was disgusting and not at all what I expected.

Is it unusual to daydream about what you want to munch on for lunch during breakfast days prior? Well, I'm that guy. I literally 'pre-plan' my visits to Opie's because I've been told by my nurse significant other and my doctor to not eat so much dang red meat, boooo! Sooo *sigh*, I make my once a month visit worth it!My usual orders are as follows:Extra Moist BrisketRegular SausageTater Tot CasseroleGreen BeansAll of the above menu choices are downright delicious and addicting. I'm sure all of the other items on their menu are just as tasty but I as I mentioned I pre-plan my visits so my mind is already set on what I want before I even head over. I guess I'm just dedicated that way, LOL!The restaurant is located on the corner of an intersection. You can't miss it. If you do, get your prescription glasses checked, LOL. There aren't parking stalls because they don't have a paved lot. Just park and mosey on up to the front door.You start the gauntlet off by choosing the amount of meat(s) you desire then you choose your sides as you make your way up to the cashier. Later in the day they may run out of certain food items. That's a good indicator of which items they sell most. The staff members have always been friendly and the restaurant has always been kept tidy. When you're done stuffing your face, kindly collect the remnants of your meal and leave it for them to bus, that's how they want it.I love this place. If you haven't been here, you should give'm a try!
Spicewood, TX 78669
Just want to let you know that we desperately need you in southern california. there's nothing like your bbq in this area and it's making me emotional.i hate it here

I drive by this place when going to Austin.  There are always long lines to get in but I never feel like I have time to stop.  I was driving home and decided to stop. We love brisket so I ordered 2 pounds of the moist meat.  When I got home my husband, sister and I opened it up and WOW was it tender and tasty.  I am going to make this a regular stop. Can't wait to try the baby back bibs and butter beans.  The best butter beans we ever had was at Willie Mae's Scotch House in New Orleans.  We will see how they compare.
Love the foood!  However, what happened to your COVID-19 protocols!!  No masks on employees, no masks on customers, no distancing. Seriously?? We won't be back.
This place is DELICIOUS! Their spicy corn is my all time favorite! So yummy I can't get enough:)

Came for an early lunch. Didn't plan on eating early, but when you're close to a great BBQ spot, you have to eat when you're there. Driving by, we made a quick turn and had a second hobbit breakfast.The place was pretty new for a BBQ joint and looked very open and nice. Very heavy rustic/modern furniture well spaced apart. There were only a few tables taken, but it could hold an army.They don't have any two meat specials so I just ordered by the weight which is the way they roll. I got a 1/4 pound of lean brisket and pork tenderloin and the cutter hit it spot on. That's impressive.The brisket had a perfect rind of smoke and a great looking bark. The brisket meat was very flavorful and spot on. I'd easily rate it at 4+. It tasted awesome. The pork tenderloin was nice and juicy, but wasn't even warm. All the meats were served from a warming pit, but this must not have been in it long from the cooler. Tasted good, but wanted it a bit warm. For sides I started off with their craisin-almond cole slaw. Their smallest container was enough for three. Really wished that it started smaller than that. But, it was divine! Lots of sweet cranberries & raisins with sliced almonds in the slaw. Could have been a dessert!I also ordered the creamed corn. For some odd reason, it came in an individual size. Liked that! The server warned me that it came with a bite. He wasn't kidding. I really liked it. Creamy corn, not too sweet with a lingering kick.In the middle of the restaurant are some fixings. If you eat in, you can put some into individual containers:- Very sweet BBQ sauce that was watered down. It was in a huge hot pot so I get that it likely flows like water.- Pintos were well cooked. Warm, temperature wise. At first no flavor until I realized the creamed corn cooked out all my taste buds! Once they returned it had a wonderful, warming ham welcome.- Butter beans were a nice surprise. Hadn't had them in a while and these were perfect! I'm usually not a fan, but wish I had more room for more of them.- Onions were very fresh. However they were strong yellow onion-like so be ware.- Noticeably absent was any bread slices. Usually BBQ spots have them. Didn't really miss them much.This is definitely a great place to eat. If you drive by and see a full parking lot, don't worry. The place is ginormous inside and most of the parking can be found in the back.

Best BBQ in hill country that I've yet to have in hill country. Everything from their brisket to their turkey is top notch. They even serve butter beans do guests dinning in. They have amazing sides including cranberry coleslaw and a tater tot casserole that I would kill for.  The staff is friendly, helpful, and it's one of the only places that let you see the meat before you order it. You can't go wrong with this place!!!!

Amazing BBQ. We're from Kansas City and wanted to try some Texas BBQ and it pains me to admit but this may be the best we've ever had. We had the brisket sandwich, several sides and the peach cobbler a la mode, they also threw in a sample of their signature tater tot casserole for free. We'll be telling our friends back home about Opie's.
This a good tex restaurant and would return.  Enchiladas were excellent.  Tacos were good.

This was amazing bbq food! Me and 3 of my other friends got all the different types of beat and it was incredible. The ribs were absolutely amazing (my favorite) and the sausage with the jalapeño cheese was a close second! The chicken was the only meat I regret getting. The brisket was so soft and tender and amazing also. All the side were amazing
Spicewood, TX 78669

The best barbecue in the Austin area, bar none. We've eaten there many times, and never have less than a great meal.This is an authentic Texas BBQ joint--you eat your barbecue in the butcher paper in which it's wrapped. In fact, the only thing they have to wash are the utensils--everything else is recyclable.When you enter, you get to choose your meat selections from a huge steel pit, in which you'll see all the barbecue that is available. If you get there too late, you may miss out, so always plan to arrive early. Service is excellent; they'll cut your meat for you if you want, wrap it to go or to eat in the restaurant; fixings are provided free--pinto beans, butterbeans on weekends, onions, jalapeños, pickles, barbecue sauce.We love the baby-back ribs, the smoked turkey breast, the jalapeño sausage, and especially their spicy corn, blackberry cobbler, and peach cobbler. We're headed there for lunch today!

The random stop and the closest place for food. The place was OK and looks like a big converted warehouse. Deco was not bad but ecstatically, I would give it a 3/10 as stocking printer paper with tape on the door/walls is a bit tacky.Food, it's not bad but would I spend $30 on a lbs of ribs, 1/2 sausage link, small slice of meat and two small sides.The blackberry cobbler was great.Would I drive to that place. Nope but I would eat there if I was hungry and driving by as there are way too many great bbq in hill country

Best BBQ in the world. Every time I visit family in Texas, we make the drive to Opie's in Spicewood. This summer, we were there with my 11 year old. He remembered this restaurant from the year earlier. I offered to take him swimming but he told me he wanted to go to Opie's! He actually remembered how good the food was from a year ago. It was interesting to see such a young child sit down to a meal and sink his teeth into the brisket and ribs. You would have thought he was eating homemade ice cream for the first time.

Get here before the line starts! We met some friends here that swear by this place... you walk in and order your meat at the pit. I'm a fan of fatty burnt ends... so that's how I judge a pit. We ordered that, brisket, sausage and jalapeño sausage. The sides looked good so we tried the spicy corn (very good) and the tater tot casserole (which was carb heaven)!   It's all worth trying. The actual brisket meat was moot and flavorful! Very good. The burnt ends were ok. And little soggy for my liking. I like the crispy but melt in your mouth burnt ends. The sausage was good. The sides were great! Try the free butter beans as well. The place was nice, rustic with a live guitarist playing at noon on a Saturday. The organization is good but they could make the line situation a little better so you don't have to wait outside in the blistering sun.  Everyone was friendly. One of the out guys came out when it was slow to ask how our food was. We were stuffed and complimented his work! Definitely a worthwhile drive to try some good BBQ.

Best BBQ period.  My first stop when I travel in Texas is Opies. The brisket is so amazing that as I write my mouth is watering. But don't take my word for it, go there and you will become a believer.

Old, Andy Griffith type feel. First time visiting felt pretty comfortable being the only minority in the room. The employees are nice and welcoming. They even had a live one-man band, probably a local fav. He was really great!Now on to the food...  Arriving around noon from Austin only found myself #7 in line. Liked that the menu is quite large right at the entrance. However I DID NOT like that the bbq (meats) is literally at the door, open for everyone to breath over. I immediately felt repulsed when a senior bent over and almost touched the ribs. Purchased a little of everything.  Pork ribs, brisket, sausage, pinto and butter beans, tatertot casserole, green beans and sampled all cobblers (pecan, peach and blackberry). The meats were ok. Favs we're the sausage and tatertot casserole. Omg that was GREAT. While the peach cobbler was pretty good (crusty and fresh Peaches) the Pecan cobbler will have you LITERALLY RUNNING TO THE DENTIST. MERCY ITS SWEET!  If you ask, they'll even give you ice cream from the back. Also loved that both beans were complimentary for those that sit in. Both huge pots stewing made me think back to my grandmother, in terms of appearance and flavor. 2nd best thing offered! Don't know if I'll be back all the way from Austin (45 min drive) but definitely an experience stepping back in time.

This is definitely not the best bbq place in Texas, I would say, somewhere below average. All meat is kinda plain and flavorless. Turkey seamed just like a boiled meet, the same was with pork loin. Brisket had lots of fat on it, even though we ask for a lean piece and they promised to give us a lean one. But probably brisket was the best of all three meats that we tried, even though half of it was fat. To be honest I didn't even think that bbq can be bad. The salads are fine and they have whole wheat bread option. If you're in the area better go to "All Good BBQ" it's in 71 towards Austin. So me and my husband where really disappointed with the place. It's not cheap, neither good.

We went on Saturday around lunch time. The wait was about 20min but the food was good! We had the jalapeño sausage, turkey and brisket. The potato salad was good but wasn't great.  We didn't try the deserts but next time it's on the list!

Oh My Gosh! Where do I start. You have to get here before everyone else does. When it's gone it's gone they say. You order your meat right out of the pit. Lots of selection. Then make your way to the mouth watering sides. Tote casserole hands down is the best I've ever had. Every. Single. Side. is amazing. Don't miss the desserts as well. I have tried almost everything here and you cant chose wrong. You can take the pinto beans to go but not the butter beans, so I made it a point to stay and try the beans. We normally get to go for the lake. I did not realize they had spicy ribs so watch out for that!  If you chose to dine in, I love the "Home" feel of this place and everyone is super friendly so you feel like you are eating at home.
Spicewood, TX 78669

I am not a fan of BBQ but being in Texas and with the family loving this spot I was so glad we went. By far the best BBQ I've ever had.  I had ribs and potato salad, the meat was falling off the bone and there was plenty of meat.. the potato salad was excellent! Everyone loved their food, from brisket to ribs, sausage (regular and spicy), turkey, potato salad and tater tot casserole (also delish) The staff are beyond friendly and the atmosphere is fun!If you are in Texas and near Opie's you should check this out!

We got a tip from a local Uber driver about Opie's, we were in the area after spending the morning exploring wedding venues. The place is really cool, as soon as you go inside, you see the pit with fresh smoked meats arranged. That day they had fresh white bean soup for free and it was delicious. The brisket was great, not amazing but great, the ribs were really good as well. The mac & cheese is a must try for sure.

This place seems to pretend that COVID-19 doesn't exist.  No masks on staff, no social distancing necessary for customers, condiments bar fully open.  They really ought to take this virus seriously. If I get sick, I'm going to tell the hospital about Opies and I'm afraid they will have to shut down.

We live about 10 - 15 minutes from Opie's. We've lived here about 3 years. We don't often go farther west than where we live, so it took quite some time before we ever actually ate there.We love barbecue. If you've read any of my other barbecue reviews, you know my stance. Barbecue should be able to stand on it's own. You shouldn't want, let alone need to put barbecue sauce on it. The flavors from the rub should be done well enough that you taste it in the meat and the smoke flavor from being smoked should be strong. A few places get this right, but not many. Opie's gets it very right! We have now had their food probably half a dozen times. And it's great. I sent friends there once recently and they were disappointed. I was shocked but when they explained what happened, I understood.When they went They had no brisket because apparently something had gone wrong with the smoker the night before. Then they had the pork ribs and they weren't that great. On top of that, they are gluten free so can't eat most of sides. Which means they don't get the best sides!So yesterday I had the chance to get Opie's back on their plates. We ordered a bunch of food from there for a get together at our house. We had to wait for a couple people. So by the time we got to eat, everything was cold and had been sitting a while.Well, everyone loved it! My friends who had the bad experience were raving and finally understood why I'd sent them there. (Keep in mind I talk about Opie's and a couple other amazing places all the time.) and all the new people were the same way. They all ate the food and loved it!Now a little about the food. The barbecue, all of it, is smokey. The rub they use is super tasty. There's gobs of flavor! And no need to use barbecue sauce unless you choose to.The sides are really good! The tatter tot casserole doesn't get any better than that. And their potato salad, cream corn and slaw are great too! I didn't try the beans yesterday so I don't remember how they are.All in all, fantastic barbecue! Great food! I'd eat here everyday if I could!
Great little spot for a quick bite or a coma inducing meal.  Love their chopped beef options.  Ribs pack a bunch of flavor.  Brisket on point as well.
I am giving 5 stars because this place is really that good. Top 3 barbecue on the planet.

The BEST BBQ I have found in the Austin area!  We typically go on the weekends when they have a wider selection of meats AND the butter beans...Mmmm...butter beans...I usually bring people from out of town over going to the Salt Lick as I think this place offers more variety and honestly just tastes better.  The stand out for me is always their smoked pork belly.  I've never had anything else like it at another BBQ spot so it's a must every time I come here.  The tater tot casserole and spicy corn are also delicious and unique.  Definitely worth the drive!  The cost is pretty consistent with other BBQ places (especially for the quality), but it definitely does add up if you're not careful.  Go slow and order more if you need it if you're trying to pinch pennies.

Called ahead to see if they have a pet friendly patio due to traveling with our small dog. Was told they have picnic tables out back. When we arrived found out the tables are located under trees but unfortunately the smell of the dumpsters nearby was nasty. We ordered our food to go and drove to the nearest vineyard. I ordered some lean and moist brisket and both tasted like they were smoked with love! Spicy corn was awesome, too. We also ordered pork ribs and they were outstanding. Beans were tasty, too. Matter of fact, hubby said beans here are better than Hard 8.

A friend of mine mentions how Opie's BBQ is seriously underrated. To tell you the truth, it is. Honestly, when people talk about BBQ in Texas, Opie's rarely get a mention. Maybe it's the location? If it was in Austin, people would know about it more, maybe? I was in the area because I had to volunteer for a nighttime trail race and I needed to eat something. Opie's is closer to Muleshoe Bend Recreation Area. First thing I see are signs mentioning the butter beans are for dining in. Note to self: try out their butter beans. Never had it but there's always a first. I enter and I have one of the servers show me the meats they have available. I ordered half a sausage link, 1/4 lb of brisket, and a quarter of a chicken. Then I grabbed me some potato salad and coleslow. Then I saw the hot items which included tater tot casserole, peach cobbler...etc. It all looked good but I think I had enough on my plate already. Then I went to the middle section where they have free bread, pickles, sauce, onions and the butter beans. I grabbed a cup of the butter beans. I must say it's pretty good. The BBQ was excellent.
Austin, TX 78751

PEJ's catered my wedding and they truly went above and beyond! Throughout the planning process, they were super patient with me and were very responsive. The day of the wedding, the team was prompt, kind, and brought THE MOST DELICIOUS food ever! The BBQ blew my expectations and all of our guests were super impressed. While we had a buffet style dinner, the team put asked my husband and I ahead of time what we would each like to eat, and made plates for us. The plate was at our table right at the start of dinner, so we had a minute to eat before we made our rounds to guests, which was SO appreciated!10/10 recommend hiring PEJ's for ANY event!!

Good cheap barbecue. If you get the Fivestars app and sign up for rewards, they'll offer you decent discounts just to get you to come back. I almost only come here when I have a $5 off coupon which gets me a big meal for about $6. I usually get the "Veggie Plate" with 4 sides plus their buttery Texas Toast. Most of their sides are good, other than the mac and cheese which tastes too processed. It's been a long time since I had their meat and it wasn't good enough or bad enough to stand out in my memory. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Much of the clientele seems to be older folks and young guys, although they totally feel like a place to feed a whole family on a budget.

"Honey, I'd walk through fire for you, just let me adore you."  Oh Poke Joes, Poke Joes.  I drove across town, I paid the ridiculous $1.50 up charge per 1/4lb of meat you have going on (which added up quickly I might add), and even when you didn't give me my full order we came back to retrieve the remaining items.  I need to tell you something important as a Texan, your sweet tea was abysmal. Perhaps it was sitting out too long but it wasn't good my friend. Maybe you're a great store, after all - your food is delicious, but you're just not for me.  I'm going to "stick to the rivers and lakes that I'm use to" and go to the Poke Joes up north.  Everything just rubbed me the wrong way and well, I ain't coming back.  So long I35 Poke Joes.  We will always have that one time we went through Covid together.

A coworker and I came here for a quick to go lunch for us and some folks back at the office. The woman who took our order was the sweetest. Not only were they super hospitable and nice, but our food came out super quick!! Clean drink station and delicious sweet tea, as well as a condiments bar. The guys in the kitchen even made friendly small talk with the various customers from behind the counter including myself. Food was delicious! I'll definitely be back.

First time in Austin and we wanted some BBQ. This was close to our hotel. Great place! First we were greeted by an outstanding crew! The whole staff was friendly and really made sure you had everything you needed and were satisfied. The food here was outstanding! For sure will come back next time we are in town!

So I was looking for bbq sandwiches for my daughters & I saw this restaurant from the sign on the building off 35...Went to the front parking lot called and ordered 3 large chopped brisket bbq sandwiches and took them home for my daughters Got home had asked for bbq sauce there was none the sandwiches were good not great the brisket was somewhat chipped  no option or offer of like anything else on the sandwich my daughter said she was really hungry only ate 1/2 the sandwich ..I would go back and they brought them out really fast i was just hoping for a little better in Austin!

I always make sure to eat pok-e-jo's on an empty stomach so I can really fill up on their delicious brisket, sausage, green bean casserole, and Mac n cheese! I come here often for my quick barbecue fix

I wish I could explain properly how disappointing my experience with ordering from this place truly was. I'm visiting this area to hang with my friend. We're at our hotel, and decided for last night we would rather spend more time hanging out and talking, as opposed to going out which we did all the other nights. We figure we're close enough to Austin to get decent barbecue, and we see this place which has a decent menu.We get chicken, brisket, and ribs. Some basic sides as well. Every single item that I had, every bite, was disappointing. I'm not exaggerating when I say Every Single Bite!
We've tried a few barbecue spots since we've been in Texas and so far this has been the best... But there are a few more I would like to try.
Austin, TX 78751

I ordered a quarter chicken, white meat, which included a breast and wing.  You can order it either white meat or dark meat, and the price is very reasonable at $3.99 before taxes.  They offer lots of different sides, but I only had the chicken.  The chicken was very plump and tasty, and the barbecue sauce is also really good.  They also include buttered toast with your meal, and you can request whole wheat bread toast.When I ordered, I was a little confused since it is a different system from the other Pok-e-Jo locations.  At this loction, you order at the register and then they call your number.  At the other locations, you grab a tray and pick out what you want.  Either way works fine.  The staff is very friendly. They also have a condiment bar with barbecue sauce (original and spicy) pickles, jalapenos, onions, lemons, crackers, salsa, salad dressing and a few more things.  They also have a soda, lemonade, and tea refill station where you can get your own refills.  TVs are tuned to sports, which was nice.I will definitely return to Pok-e-Jo's and highly recommend them.
Thanks for leaving us a review Chris! I'm really glad to hear you enjoyed it, and we hope we will see you back in again soon.Regards,John, manager

Funny.  I'm a vegetarian but the rest of my family is not.  We all love going to Pok-e-Jo's on 41st.  It's casual, super friendly, and the food is excellent. I get the veggie plate and there are many choices for me.  Everyone else in my family gets the sandwiches and they finish every bite. They have a wide variety of choices, from deep fried, crisp okra and other southern comfort foods, to their broccoli salad that is light and healthy.  The workers are always friendly and walk by your table to check on you and make sure you are happy.  We've been going to this place for years and they are consistently friendly and welcoming with delicious food choices.  Highly recommend.

I had Sunday lunch with a few family members at Pok-e-Jo's. All of our meals were very good. They have a great selection of side to go along with the BBQ. Between the 4 of us we ordered just about everything.The staff was friendly and the dining room was comfortable. Nice smoke and really tender meats. Loved the peach habenero sauce. The regular sauce was OK. The macaroni and cheese is on point! Definitely a place to go. We will be back.
Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review Dominic! I'm glad you enjoyed everything, and we hope we'll see you back in the store again some time soon.Regards,John, manager

The best customer service! Pok-e-Jo's has great food, a great environment, and great employees! I was just running errands with my big 110lb dog, when I got a craving for great bbq. I decided to stop by pok-e-jo's and eat outside with my pup. Although they had just finished a huge lunch rush, and had ran out of some of their best items they were still very accommodating. The employees kept an eye out on my dog while I order, brought my food to me since they knew I couldn't hear them call my name outside, and even brought my dog a big bowl of cold water. The food was amazing as always, my dog and I killed an entire plate turkey, sausage, and two generous sides of okra and peach cobbler. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a place with some of the best bbq and the best customer service!!

Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review Kat! I'm glad to hear that you (and your dog!) had such a positive experience with us, and we hope we'll see the two of you back in to see us again some time!Regards,John, manager

New to Austin so my husband and I are searching for our beloved Hutchison's bbq look a like. This isn't it. Dry brisket. My husband ordered broccoli salad which was more like broccoli vegetable medley with a Italian dressing. The okra was amazing cooked fresh. The peach cobbler isn't your grandmas peach cobbler. This place reminds me of dickies bbq. Fast food bbq
Hands down best BBQ for your money. Baked potatoe casserole best side ever. Lots of food for less than most.
Austin, TX 78751

My wife and I found this place in Yelp and couldn't be happier. Being foodies from Chicago we always get nervous about eating in other cities but this place wow'd us! The bbq chicken, brisket and ribs were so good. The banana pudding is AH-amazing! The manager was so attentive and friendly. Definitely coming back to Austin and this spot soon. Eat here, you won't regret it!

Not my best bbq experience in Austin. I ordered 3 meat plate ribs, brisket, and sausage and I didn't get ribs the lady put double sausage. I didn't say anything because maybe she misheard me but she should've asked for sure about the double sausage. The coleslaw had no flavor. Peach cobbler was more like a peach bread and very dry at that. The brisket was very good no too fatty and not dry. Sausage was over cooked I like to feel the skin crunch when I have sausage and there was no crunch at all.

Place was plain empty on a Wednesday night, I did not mind; I am staying at a nearby hotel for work, and have a ton to do.  Found this place and decided to try it and was happy I did. No such thing as a waiter/waitress .. you order at the counter and get your own drink.  but whatever, nice ambiance and could pull off full service if the decided to.  Wet pulled pork was good, bit spicy.  Brisket was moist and potato salad was good.  Grilled veggies are fresh and actually grilled, like just a minute ago, tastes like gas flame based on char, but not over powering.  Ill be back!
Probably the best brisket I've had to date in The Great State of Texas! I'd make love to it
Excellent service and food, we were brought extra toast from the front. Would come here again for a good, hearty meal. Green bean casserole needed a little bit of work but meat was great overall!

Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review Justin! We really appreciate it, and we're glad to hear that you enjoyed the experience. We hope to see you back in again some time soon!Regards,John, manager

First time trying this place out during my lunch break and I will definitely be going back! All the gentlemen that helped us were very quick and friendly and their food was great! Got the brisket spud and the brisket was so good and tender! Loved the self help bar with all the toppings for your plate available for you to just grab!
Ordered from their food truck and it was awesome! Smoked chicken plate with two sides: green beans and broccoli salad...very tasty and reasonably priced at $8.
Thanks for leaving us a review Jason! I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed it, and we look forward to getting you some of our food again some time!Regards,John, manager
Austin, TX 78751

Decent BBQ, definitely not the best, not even close. It was my first time here. The green bean casserole was actually pretty good considering I rarely eat that. This is a place you come if you want to eat quick and get out.

So we were planning on going to Ruby's BBQ in Austin after a visit to Sears at the Hancock Mall off IH35 but just like Sears is going out of business, (so sad), Ruby's has bit the dust.  But Lo', right across the parking lot of the run down Sears with leaking roof and no A/C, there is Pok-e-Jo's!  So we mosied our way over for some good ole Texas bbq and we was not disappointed.  I never had smoked Turkey at a Texas bbq joint but this was so tender and juicy!  And the brisket and sausage was yummy too.  Besides the plugged toilet in the men's room, I say A- Ok.  I'll be back!
We appreciate you giving us a shot James, and I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed it! We do hope to see you back in again some time soon.Regards,John, manager

Right after I landed to visit my friend; she said let's go here. WOW. I had the brisket with all the fixings. Melted in my mouth. The price was not bad. I told her we gotta come back again before I leave. Alas I didn't get the chance. So I am missing this place. Wish we had this in Hawaii.

The bbq should have been put in a container to later put on the sandwich.The sandwich ended up being soggy.The French fries were still warm but the cherry cobbler was in a small container that all I got was topping no cherries.But I love the bbq so I would order again.

My wife and I used Pok-E-Jo's to cater our wedding recently and could not have been happier with the level of service we received (the food was excellent too!). Jason was extremely helpful every step of the way. He set up a tasting, helped us put together the menu, accommodated some special requests, and guided us in the right direction in setting up the day-of. Honestly he almost acted as a wedding planner. The actual day of the wedding was very hands off - we didn't have to worry about a thing. The food was excellent and served right on time. The bartenders were super friendly and efficient. What we were looking for in our vendors was easy to work with, reasonably priced, and someone who would take most of the work off our hands. Jason and Pok-E-Jo's nailed all three. The name might turn you off, but give them a shot - doubt you'll regret it.
Thanks for the review Alex! We were so glad to be a part of your and your wife's special day, and wish you guys happiness (and more BBQ!) in your life together.Regards,John, manager

Today I went into Pokie Joes to pick up a 57.00 meal for my family.  I ordered 1pd. turkey,  1pd.  brisket and 1/2 pd. Chicken. Ordered potatoe salad (which they forgot). Mac cheese & beans.  The chicken  was so tuff I had trouble chewing it. Everything was dry. Perhaps it was because it was 3:45pm???? Really don't know.  I asked for a loaf of bread and the guy that packed my order gave me an open bag!!!!!What the H___!!!! Can't people get order Rught. Fought the traffic on 35 to Ben White blvd.and order isn't right.  I called the store in Hancock and takes with Sam who said he would Tae the pint of potatoe salad off my ticket. Bull s___!!!!Check your food guys this is not right.Victor
Excellent barbecue! The brisket was very tender and juicy. The sides were good as well. The restaurant is also very clean. The staff was helpful and friendly as well. Definitely worth stopping here.
Austin, TX 78751

This review is for the Pok-e-jo's at 4109 South Capital of Texas Highway, Austin, TX 78704.Good flavored and juicy meats with good portions, good sides with a wide variety, helpful and friendly staff, reasonable prices, fairly quiet, calm, peaceful, and clean location.
Glad to hear from you Michael, thanks for taking the time to leave a review! Hope to see you back in again soon.Regards,John, manager
A nice try for BBQ in Austin. The service is really good, they would know what you want before you asked them.
Definitely recommend visiting this place. If such good food and I love their cornbread, macaroni, sausage, and the sweet pickles! Great atmosphere and good food.

Come across to this BBQ place..been in Austin for few time finally have chance to try it.. Lot of choice, family menu, or u can order per pound.. 2choice, 3 choice and also 4 choice plate.. Luv it.. House special sausage!! Must try. People are nice. For sure will go again.. FOOD is awesome. If u like meat like BBQ. Got to try it!
Thanks for the review! So glad you stopped in to give us a shot, and come back and see us whenever you're in town.Regards,John, manager

Went here twice the turkey and brisket are the best I've ever had. Even beats my own cooking. Great bean casserole was good Mac and cheese was cheesy goodness. If you like turkey or brisket you aHave got to try this place.
Thanks for leaving us a review Billy, we really appreciate it! I'm glad to hear you enjoyed everything, and we hope to have you back in again some time soon.Thanks,John, manager

This was one of the first restaurants that I tried when I moved to Austin. UT had them catered. It was incredibly delicious barbecue! When you are looking for some affordable and quick smoked eats, I highly recommend coming to this place. They have a wide selection of sides and desserts. The service has always been friendly and great, too. It's a bargain place for local students; they give 10% when you show your student ID!

Didn't know much about Whitfield's the "first" time around, but I work in the area and was happy to hear that there was going to be a BBQ truck opening nearby.This place is good. It's a little pricy, but really not much more than any of the other big names in town, and still less than going to Franklin's or La BBQ and while they do sell out, I've never been caught in any crazy long lines or anything (though admittedly I usually visit Friday afternoon, and not on the weekend)I have had the brisket, Turkey, chicken, and smashed taters.  Everything is seriously delicious. The brisket has a great bark on it, with wonderful flavor, and a visible smoke ring. I have always only liked lean brisket. I still order the lean brisket here, but even then it still tends to come with at least a small layer of fat.  Anywhere else, that would be a problem, but here, that just melts in your mouth.  Personally I'd probably still have a problem with the "fatty side" because it would be a much larger piece of fat, but that said, it is cooked so well, that when getting just the small bit on a lean cut, it doesn't bother me at all, and that is really saying a lot.The smashed taters are one of my favorite things to order. These are red potatoes that I believe have been cooked in the bbq until they are "baked". Then, when ordered. They give them a nice little "smash" and fry them. They are good, but dipping them in that amazing bbq sauce really puts them over the top.  I highly highly highly recommend them, but don't forget to ask for an extra sauce or two for dipping.They also serve a variety of pickled items which I believe for the most part are ever changing. They make their pickles and pickled onions themselves which are served on the side of any bbq item.  Normally speaking when I got to pretty much any other bbq place, I tell them no pickles or onions, but not at Whitfields.  The pickles and pickled onions are awesome. Wish they served even more on the side (not that I feel that they don't put enough, they are just so good I want more)One of the other cool things they do, is just try out some new items here and there. You never know what they m if the have.  This past weekend it was homemade pimento cheese where they smoked the peppers themselves, and the "bread sticks" they served with it were so good, I could have eaten like two more bags of those without the cheese.Lastly, but in no way least, Kasey is just good people.  That guy is always so friendly, and when he isn't slammed in the truck cutting meat and making sure we are all fed, he is happy to shoot the shit.  I love talking football and fantasy football with him, but or course all my conversations with him have been great.  Definitely strikes me as the kind of dude you'd (or at least I) would want to hang out with and have a beer in "real life". Just one more of those "just good people" things. I'm sure they don't do this for every customer (because they would end up going out of business) but quite frequently when I come by, they have something "new" they are working on, and hand out a taste for free.  Now, I'm no on special here. Kasey doesn't know me from a hole in the wall other than the few times I've come by the truck, but even with just two guys working out of a food truck, Kasey understands how to make his customers feel special.I am not in the area a lot these days, so I don't get there as often as Whitfield's deserves to be frequented.  I really need to make more of an effort to head here though. Like I said, for my money this is right up there with the big boys if not even better, and far less of a hassle than even Terry Black's or Black's.If you're looking for damn good BBQ, you need to come and eat here

Updated review:The best of Austin BBQ.  Give these guys $10 and you won't have to eat for the rest of the day.  Pulled pork is tender and juicy.  The brisket is packed with flavor and has just the right texture.  Everything was fresh and hot. Great local south austin spot to grab some food with friends. These guys are on point! ********Tasty local BBQ.  Friendly folks.  People working in  the truck are super friendly. We had 2 brisket sandwiches, pickled strawberries, and a side of roasted vegetables.  All the food was great.  The brisket is a bit spicy (which I liked) and it had a really nice flavor. Believe it or not the pickled strawberries on top of the brisket sandwich are outstanding!!  I highly recommend ordering some    We will be back- thanks for a tasty lunch!

Tasty local BBQ.  Friendly folks.  People working in  the truck are super friendly. We had 2 brisket sandwiches, pickled strawberries, and a side of roasted vegetables.  All the food was great.  The brisket is a bit spicy (which I liked) and it had a really nice flavor. Believe it or not the pickled strawberries on top of the brisket sandwich are outstanding!!  I highly recommend ordering some.   We will be back- thanks for a tasty lunch!

We stopped here after trying to rider BBQ at another overly hyped South Austin Tex-Mex BBQ joint that had a 2 1/2 hour wait.  Whitfield's was friendly, fast and the food was amazing!  I'm so happy the other place was such a disappointment or we would have never discovered this gem off Brodie Lane. Their brisket was moist and delicious and the ribs were fall off the bone good.  I especially liked the pickled onions and strawberries which added a unique flavor to the meal. The smashed potatoes are a must order too!

Y'all.  Seriously.  Y'ALLLL.If you have never been to Whitfields BBQ on Brodie Lane... YOU ARE MISSING OUT ON YOUR BEST LIFE.I have lived in the area for over 20 years. I have always HEARD Whitfields was the bomb.com, but every time I ever tried to go, everything was sold out. THATS HOW GOOD THEY ARE!!So today... on my way back from Target, I looked over on my way home... AND LO AND BEHOLD,  there were people there and it LOOKED like BBQ!So I cut a right turn really quick and walked up to the window.DREW AND KYLE made my DAY!! They told me they still had BBQ left. The clouds parted. The angels sang, And a ray of light appeared behind the food truck.I'm typing this with sticky fingers and a fat stomach. Full of Texas BBQ goodness.  And guess what?I'm NOW living my best life.THANK YOU DREW AND KYLE for the deliciousness!!

My wife and i stopped by here earlier today akd it's Just Great BBQ...  the Brisket was perfectly season and moist as any it could possibly be.  The Beef Sausage was juicy and flavorful and the pulled pork  was one of the Best my wife and I have ever had.Stop by today and grab a Pound of anything, you'll love it.

Finally stopped here to try it and have 0 regrets. The tacos were loaded with meat, the kolache was the best I've ever had, I'll dream about the potato salad, the beans and fried taters were killer as well. We will be back!!!

Only found out about Whitfield's as I was passing by not too long ago. Supposedly they closed down and are now open again. After checking the reviews, I knew I had to make the trip.....a couple blocks away.I arrived around 1:30 PM on a Sunday and they only had about a pound of brisket, one rack of pork ribs, and quail left. So I took them all to go! I've had quail before, but not like this. Boneless, bacon wrapped, jalapeño stuffed little bites of goodness. Juicy with the right amount of smoke coming from the smoker and bacon. I would order the quail 10/10. The brisket was a bit fatty and I would definitely request some leaner pieces if it wasn't slim pickings. The pork ribs were some of the best I've had in town. A+++ all across the board coming from this little truck. I hope that the crew gets their order/payment process a bit more streamlined because with the way their BBQ tastes they are about to get a lot busier.

Whitfield's BBQ beef brisket is some of the best I've ever eaten - flavorable, juicy and tender! The potato salad is might fine too.  The  servings are every generous.  Anxious to try other items on the menu.

My boyzzz are back in business:-)Love them! Perfect prices, perfect food, consistently delicious !!! Try the random sides they will blow your mind (strawberries, pineapples, fried potato) I mean everything is delicious and these boys are freaking bad ass cooks. Inventive ;-)

One of the best BBQ joints in Austin.  The brisket is on point and THANK YOU to the dude who convinced me to pair it with the pickled strawberries.  Phenomenal choice.  As a cajun I'd be remiss not to mention that the boudin is overpriced (but good) so don't waste precious stomach space on it.  All in all, 5/5.  Nice guys, great food, and (to top it off) right down the road.  Check them out.

Super excited this trailer opened up right here! Great list of workers, including an old chef of Valentina's. I'd say the brisket tacos are right on par with them!I appreciate the creative menu - lots of pickled items including strawberries , smoked shrimp ceviche, tacos, sandwiches, and meat by the pound! The brisket tacos were juicy, tender, and had a great combination of flavors from the pickled onions and cotija cheese. I ordered a side of pickled radishes which went great in the tacos to cut the fat! My only complaint was that the meat and the tortillas could have been a little warmer. I'm sure this place will live up to the hype, it already was packing a line one week in. Yay, Austin!
I pre-ordered their Labor Day special, and I'm glad I did! The brisket and ribs were so good. I loved the loaf of "everything" bread. The beans were a bit sweet for my liking, but I enjoyed it all.

I want to start off positive. The peach cobbler is one of the best desserts I have ever had. It is really good. The BBQ sauce is good. The pickled pineapple is good. The pulled pork is ok. It's not anything to write home about. It's generic tastingThe brisket is bad. It's too smoky tasting and it over powers anything else you could taste.

I'm always searching the Austin area for good BBQ, and after hearing about Whitfields on 104.9 The Horn awhile back I was excited to see them open today. The BBQ is out of this world! Brisket and Ribs are done right, and the customer service displayed by Kasey was 2nd to none, he threw in a complimentary beer. This place is a hidden gem on the corner of Brodie, and 100% worth checking out!
I think this place has one of the best briskets in Texas!! The sides are great but the brisket makes my mouth water.... I can't wait to go back!

Whitfield's is a food truck with facilities. Strictly BBQ. They have a metal canopied area with a couple picnic tables where you can dine. They even have a porta-potty and a sanitization station.The people are fantastic and friendly. There was a slight delay on the day I went because a staff member had quit, but they picked up the pace and were ready to open only 30 minutes late. They were generous to offer me a free beverage for the inconvenience.A friend and I shared sweet potato fries, smoked veggies, smashed and fried potatoes, and fried pickles. I went with the trio of brisket, turkey, and boudin after having read the reviews about the ribs. All of the meats were exceptional, but I can really only recommend the sweet potato fries and smoked veggies.None of the individual BBQ prices were unreasonable, and I had meat to take home, but it was an expensive overindulgence, topping $35 for one. Also, since we chose to eat on premises, we battled wind and flies galore on their patio. That was a real downer, but Whitfield's doesn't make the weather or the flies.Solid four stars, but I recommend you get your order to go so you can enjoy it and choose your sides carefully.

This is some of the best BBQ I've had in a long time. The brisket was super moist and there was absolutely no need for bbq sauce. The pork ribs were sliding off the bone and the sides are super inventive. We had the beef fat fried potatoes--they are small potatoes that are smashed before frying with coarse salt on top. The pickled strawberries were unique and delicious, as well as the homemade pickles and pickled red onion.One of the owners is a former longhorn football player, so there's an awesome Austin vibe. The giant yeti cooler is stocked with lone star, big red, and topo chico. There's a covered area with picnic tables, a few Adirondack chairs-- total laid back outdoor atmosphere to eat your bbq. Can't wait to go back and try everything else on the menu!

Went there for lunch.  It was just me so I just ordered a quarter pound of brisket and ribs.  Brisket was decent, had a good flavor but was a little dry.  The fat was not rendered very well and probably should have been trimmed better before smoking.  The ribs had a good dinner but were way over done.  I took one bite and the bone completely fell out.  Fall off the bone is a stupid phrase and should be eliminated from your vocabulary, if it falls off it was over cooked. Sauce was just meh.The pickles were good and a nice touch though I prefer a little more crunch.  Overall it was a bit too expensive for what I got.  I'd prefer to hit up Valentina's, Leroy and Lewis or browns which are all close enough driving distance.Some non food things they should consider.  Ordering and pickup from same window is awkward (unless food is delivered almost immediately).  They had to pause people ordering in order to hand out food.Paper towels should be placed on tables. (They had packages of fork, knife and napkin) but I didn't need utensils and couldn't get a napkin otherwise.  Also BBQ is messy and might require a few napkins. Signage/marketing - the trailer is a plain white trailer and there is very little signage about the place.  They really should invest some money into the trailer and area to make sure people know who/what they are.  Throw some slices of bread or tortillas on the plate with the brisket/meat or at least offer it.  Many people like making sandwiches/tacos.I'll be back in a few months to see if they have their kinks worked out.

After several attempts I finally got there before they sold out of brisket! The family loved it. Great flavor and tender without falling into pieces. We tried the beef sausage also and it too was great! I'm bumping up my rating to 4* but they still have some work to do. I was hoping to try their potatoes but their fryer was broken. I have yet to give them a visit and get everything I wanted. Our family also agrees that we do not like their ribs. The most recent try confirmed that they have no flavor to us and this time were a little tougher than the previous time. I've heard others say they really like the ribs so give them a shot and judge for yourself. For us, they miss the mark and we probably won't order them again. (R.I.P. Artz Rib House)Big props for their buttermilk pie and their parfait! Who would think a BBQ trailer would have such excellent desserts??? We give the brisket, sausage, and desserts an A. Ribs a C-. I give their pulled pork an A+ (See previous review.)Here's hoping their dreams of a brick and mortar on that spot become a reality.

What can I say? I've had LA bbq, Valentina's, etc..This place, my god. It is so freaking good!! Fatty brisket for the win here. The brisket taco is just as good if not better than Valentina's. Thanks to the ex pit master from Valentina's. Also, try the fried potatoes. Just do it. Thank you to Kasey Studdard and the rest of the crew for some amazing bbq.

Got a sausage wrap and a copped beef at their grand opening Sun is so bright I had to expand when I get home. This first day is so hot I am going to try and come by tomorrow for a more in-depth review. Prices are not too bad, but I wanna get a load of ribs and sliced brisket.The chopped beef was good but next time I would get it just straight without pickles or any other topping except sauce. I think it stands on its own just fine. The sausage wrap, on a nice flour tortilla had some toppings that were almost German leaning. Very, very good. For now, it is an Elgin sausage, but they plan on having a bratwurst made to their recipe and that I eagerly await. The Q is good so far, but I must further test it out :-)  .  Their hours are a bit flexible as they settle into their business and any kinks worked out. One solid star is for the cleanliness, porta potty and wash stand. It is definitely worth a try.

Yum! Austin's south side actually suffered from a lack of delicious BBQ, until now: Enter Whitfield's, your new destination for tender, smoky meats. I live nearby and spotted the truck early this spring, but it wasn't until I saw the owner on KXAN that I really wanted to go (pictures do help!). The owner used to play for the Texans, and said in his KXAN segment that his chef "looks like a kicker, but he's more like a quarterback in that he calls the plays." Who doesn't love a team player? Kitchens have to run as fast and as smoothly as a football team to be successful. We got brisket tacos, shrimp tacos, and spare ribs. The ribs were peppery, tender, and smoky, and came with some perfect, house-made pickles and some sauce. Simple and delicious. The brisket tacos were loaded with tender, juicy meat. But they were only dressed with pickled onions and a little bit of avocado cream. A squeeze of lime or addition of crunchy pickles would have given some balance. The tacos were two for $10, which sounds expensive, but they  were not at all skimpy. I have the same minor complaint about the shrimp tacos. The shrimp was ceviche-style, and could have used some crunchy slaw or jicama to balance it out. Like all decent food trucks, they may run out of your favorite sides (they were all out of potatoes on early Sunday afternoon) or cut of meat, so time your visit accordingly to avoid fried potato FOMO.

We got there right as they opened at 11am on a Saturday and got brisket, sausage, and smoked vegetables.  The brisket was ok, but what really shone were the smoked vegetables and the cheese-jalapeno smoked sausage.  The sausage may be the best I've ever had, and the vegetables were smoky, tasty, and crisp.  Considering that this is just a walk-up food truck, I'd say it is overpriced, but I suspect that we'll be back.

Visit Thur 9/6/2018 I was really hoping this place was going to be good being 2 blocks from home. Lines the first month it was open were encouraging but I can see why they died down.  The Brisket was dry and tough which lacked any unique flavor coming in at $22 a pound. Spare ribs were good and cooked perfectly but were again just average. I ordered the smoked Italian sausage but when I arrived home I was given jalapeño cheese which was the best of the 3 meats i tried in this review. The real winner were the fat fried potatoes....Sooo good!!  Their menu calls out numerous veggie and fruit sides I'd like to try because it sets them apart for the traditional BBQ ones.  I'm never one to make one end all decision on a food truck/ restaurant and really want this experience to be a bad one off smoking day for them. Austin loves to support their small businesses and BBQ joints and I'll be sure to be back and give them another try and update my review. FINGERS CROSSED

My first time in Austin, first real truck type bbq. I ordered the pulled pork and was beyond my expectation. It's a totally random location and seems more of a personal spot. Potato salad was good if you like bleu cheese.
Just damn! Go early, they sell out quick. Enough said.

Decent brisket, nice folks, quite the wait too but at $22 per pound of brisket , $2/ bottle (small 500ml) of water this is NOT a good value. The meat was tender and flavorful but nothing extraordinary. You can get the same quality brisket all over the town and at better prices and less wait

When my wife and I decided to move down south, we thought we'd be missing out on some of the great spots that our old ZIP Code provided us. But boy were we wrong! Whitfield's is one the favorite new spots since moving down to 78748 and up there with the Austin barbecue greats!I ordered the brisket and the ribs and both were quite tasty. The brisket was perfectly moist, had great smoke flavor and the perfect bark.The ribs were great as well - perfectly soft with a nice bite yet not too sticky and sweet like many barbecue places around.To top it off, the pickles and pickled onions were a terrific contrast to the the rest of my meat.Great food, great people, and can't wait to get back for everything else on the menu.

This place is going to have a line a mile long once the word gets out. If you're into meat then you need to get over there ASAP. The owners are great to talk to and very friendly. They also have some very interesting and tasty sides. This will be a new bbq staple for me and my family.

Great location, great food, great people, what more can you ask for? Absolutely loved all the food and we tried everything on the menu! We went with a big group at the end of the day and cleaned them out. They were amazing hosts and the food was top notch. Loved all the pickled stuff (pineapple, strawberries, broccoli), great compliment to the meat.
Love their food, especially the brisket, and they are just so nice. We have been getting their food to go every Saturday for the last couple weeks because it's just so good.
Great brisket. They were most and flavorful. Love their pineapple as a side. It provide a great contrast. 16$ for 1/2lb brisket, pineapple and a bun

I showed up during the slowest part of their week. During the shoulder time between Thursday morning and the evening crowd Thursday night. I was very fortunate to be able to meet the owners. They seem very attentive to what they're doing but certainly don't make it too formal.I've been to all the central Texas barbecue places that you can name including the ones here in town and the meat matches all of them.  I was a little apprehensive with the pickled fruit particularly the pineapple as that's about the damndest thing that I've ever had. What a great tart cut through to the savoriness of the brisket. Everything was cooked so well, I didn't miss the stale Wonder Bread that was missing.I imagine that there will be some purists that roll their eyes at this but it really is good. The cauliflower is something I generally don't like but it just seemed to work.Personally I never do sausage at a barbecue place. It's like eating rolls at Thanksgiving and taking up valuable room from your stomach for the stuff you really like.  it was a little spicier than normal and it didn't taste like a lot of the Central Texas sausage that I get around these parts. It was really tasty and very moist.  The service was good and I was able to meet everybody that was involved in cooking my meal. What more can you ask for?  Every time I think that the Austin barbecue Market is saturated I find something else that's really really good. This place is really really good and I hope that they make it.

Really unique take on some barbecue classics. Pickled mustard seed in the pulled pork is an awesome twist. Brisket was really solid with a classic salt and pepper rub but smoked to perfection. Can't wait to go back and try some of the other sides and meets.

I ordered 1 1/2 pounds of brisket that had a nice smokey sweetness to it. The bbq sauce that came with it had an unusual aroma (couldn't quite tell what the ingredient was) that I thought I wouldn't like at first smell, but it actually tasted better than expected; however, a little more would have been appreciated as the small containers (one per 1/2 pound) is no where near enough. Next was the beans (two orders) which had a really nice acidic, vinegar flavor to it with some kind of tasty pickled relish that was balanced by a sweetness to it. Really enjoyed it. Ordered the smoked vegetables which was lacking any seasoning, and was overpowered by the smoke flavor. Didn't really care for. Also ordered the loaded potato salad. This was somewhat disappointing. Seems to have a little bit of cream cheese, but personally I would add sour cream (which is usually associated with a loaded baked potato) and lots more of it. Finally I got two orders of the peach cobbler. This was probably the most disappointing part of the meal. The "crust" or dough was way under cooked. So much so that I put 1 and 1/2 of the order in the oven at 350 degrees for almost 40 minutes!! Way under cooked. The dough had a consistency of day old porridge, lacked any flavoring, and the peaches were very firm. To sum up - brisket and beans, yes...definitely would reorder. Smoked vegs and loaded potato salad, eh, maybe, but probably not. Peach cobbler - definitely not.

My friend and I tried a little bit of everything -- the brisket, pulled pork, pork ribs, jalapeño cheddar sausage, beef fat potatoes and chow chow.HIGHS:The brisket was excellent. It was fall off the fork tender and the outside rub was delicious. It was the best bite of the day.The jalapeño cheddar sausage was second best. I would definitely get it again on my next visit. It and the brisket are must tries.PRETTY GOOD:The pulled pork was fairly good though I'm a NC boy and it's hard to stack up to what's back home. I did enjoy it, but if I got it again, I'd probably want it on a sandwich.The two sides I got -- beef fat potatoes and chow chow -- were also very tasty. The potatoes, while not as earth-shattering as we had hoped, were quite good. And the chow chow was an addition after they recommended it. I enjoyed how the sourness broke up the other very heavy bites.NOT SO GREAT:The pork ribs were a miss. The meat itself seemed fine and was moist and tender, but it seriously lacked flavor. They were a disappointment. Also, the barbecue sauce for the brisket wasn't good either. It tasted almost like store-bought KC Masterpiece.Whitfield's is a bit of a hike for me in East Austin, but if I had friends going, I'd definitely visit again. It's a solid addition to the Austin barbecue scene.
Love this bbq but super frustrated by driving 15 minutes only to find it closed when Yelp shows it's open like right now, a Thursday at 12:15.

As a newbie to the Austin area, I heard about this place on the radio. It is a trailer nestled in South Austin and a nice simple set-up. I tried the brisket tacos, tallow potatoes, and the jalapeño cheddar sausage. The brisket was extremely juicy and full of flavor. The sausage had a subtle spice and was tasty as well. The tallow potatoes were seriously phenomenal. Definitely put this place on your list of places to try!

The food here is AMAZING! The master chef has added such a unique twist to a Texas favorite, BBQ. The pit master knows what he's doing, the brisket was so tender and juicy it makes me wonder why I would ever wait in line for hours for BBQ when this is available at my fingertips. Lastly, Texas Longhorn favorite, Kasey Studdard, greets you with good conversation, a cold Lone Star, and great food suggestions, because that is one man who hasn't missed a meal . Check them out, you will enjoy every minute.
Best BBQ, best people. I will support this place forever. First off best brisket I've ever had. Everybody should come here. If you're not about all the meat and love the sides, they're perfect too.

Unbelievable BBQ! I love swinging by this awesome food truck and grabbing some brisket or a taco and a cold beer. The guys are great and the atmosphere is fun and comfortable. As an Austin native, it's nice to still have cool spots like this to enjoy damn good BBQ and people!

This spot opened up super close to our house and we have been dying to go there! Brisket and jalapeño cheddar sausage really great. Pickles and onions were one of the best parts. Everyone there was super nice and friendly. I'll definitely be back!
This is now in our top 3 bbq spots. Unfortunately the other two spots are in East Austin, so im very glad we found this place closer to us.
Simply the best Bar B Q in central Texas, yes I have had Franklins and Valentinos is on point, but Kasey brings more to the table and the food really shows it!
I love their jalapeño cheddar sausage and look forward to them reopening. Nice guys and good service.

Whitfield's just got a glowing review from Daniel Vaughn at Texas Monthly, so it might be worth heading there before the crowds.texasmonthly.com/bbq/whi…The review is warranted; everything I had was on point.  The moist brisket was tender, great bark, and a nice fat cap.  The ribs had a nice tang to them, and the bbq chicken was downright juicy.  The unique factor here is their pickled fruits and vegetables.  The pickled broccoli offered a nice piquant zestiness which pairs well with fatty smoked meats.  The pitmaster later told me his favorite is the spicy pineapple, so perhaps next time I'll try that.Very friendly folks here, too.

Amazing brisket - got the moist and they graciously threw in some burnt ends! Also let me try the pickled goods - strawberries, pineapples, and chow-chow...all worth eating again! Can't wait to go back and try more on the menu!

Whitfield's is Franklins without the wait.  In my opinion actually better than franklins.  They have moist and lean brisket you just can't find anywhere else, the ribs are amazing, the potatoes are to die for, and the way they prepare the veggies is unlike anything you have tried.  Be prepared! Gourmet Bar B Q does take time and can go quick.  Call ahead if need be,  these guys know their stuff and care about their customers!  Bottom line best bar b q in Texas. My fav is the picked strawberry and moist brisket together....... WOW

I had Whitfield's BBQ today for the first time ever and was very impressed.  The pulled pork sandwich was unique and fan-freakin-tastic.  I would put the ribs up there with Louie Muellers as some of the best I have ever had and the brisket is melt in your mouth amazing.  Come support a longhorn legend and eat some killer meat!!

This has become one of our family's favorite take-out place. Very easy to order online and pickup. I'm always glad when I curbside pick up my takeouts, the restaurant makes it easy for us by having a sign where you park, the phone number to call/text to let them know we are there. Chi'Lantro has these in front of their restaurant. I don't know how many times I order curbside pickup, drive to the restaurant, and have to scramble finding the phone number. Now food wise, I'm a fan of all of the dishes I tried here. My daughter likes their sweet potato glass noodle bowl, with tofu. I recently have been opting for their salads. And of course, the kimchi fries. Yum.

I order here on a weekly basis. So tasty, and relatively healthy. Fast and efficient pickup. The only reasons I'm not giving five stars is because their portions have been very inconsistent lately (at least with the noodle bowls, which is what I always order.)Sometimes my bowl is completely full, and heavy (good!) Other times it's only filled up to half, or 3/4, and feels noticeably lighter (sad!)Also I've noticed when I order extra of whatever protein, I'll just get the regular portion as usual. No noticeable difference between paying for extra versus not.

I had the rice bowl and the way Chi'Lantro sets it up is reminiscent of Chipotle, but eating this was a lot more light and guilt free. I wish the portion sizes were bigger though, I'm a female with lanky build and I could easily finish that entire meal and although I was satisfied I don't know if others would be. Their magic sauce which is a chipotle mayo sauce is supposedly their specialty and as someone who can't take spice that well was manageable and enjoyable! The kimchi fries? *chefs kiss* make sure to get an order when you come bc they are the most iconic thing here. Sadly, I heard from my friend that they got rid of their bulgogi burritos or something like that which bummed me out bc it would make this place stand out more.  There is a tent and tables set up on the outside of this location and was very sparsely populated so I felt very safe eating here

I am not a kimchi lover by any means but I had to try their famous original kimchi fries and oh my goodness, what a treat! I am OBSESSED with this. Definitely worth it to add chicken or some kind of meat to it, totally elevated the entire meal. So incredibly hard to stop eating. I also enjoyed their hot chicken sandwich which is a special they are running (this location only) until 4/4. Worth the try! Huge portion of fried chicken, very tasty.

Omg the kimchi fries!I promised to only eat half a portion but ended up inhaling the whole portion for my dinner. No regrets even the morning after.Crispy fries, lotsa meat and sauces. Deliciousness.I tried the noodle bowl a little bit but it tasted too healthy for me .

They have changed their menu and ingredients over the past few years. No longer resembles what it once was and prices have gone up unfortunately. Very inconsistent, sometimes the burrito will be well made, other times cold and mostly rice.

I come here every time I'm sick of chipotle and am craving some good 'ol Korean zest. The restaurant is on a build-your-own bowl/burrito style. Where they take Mexican-style chipotle and add Korean elements to it. Thus they have a lot of variety int their meat choices (think Bulgogi) and veggie options (think Kimchi). It is indeed very tasty and a nice twist on the traditional way of doing things.I think where they shine though is in their fries. They are sooo good! Loaded up with the many sauces and meats and that is one thing that I prefer over chips and guac!

The burger and fries combo for $7 is a steal. It is not available at every location. The burger comes with your choice of protein, which I feel is super cool since this is not an exclusive burger joint! In addition it is layered with onions, cheese, their famous magic sauce and even a fried egg. The fries are crispy and of sufficient quantity. A perfect meal which leaves the taste buds tingling and the stomach full!A special mention for the great service I've experienced here during every visit!

I was excited to try this place after watching it on an episode of Shark Tank. Glad to see it flourishing in Austin! It's home of the original kimchi fries and rightfully so. I've had many other kimchi fries but chilantro does it so much better. There is way more meat and kimchi than other places I've tried it. A flavor explosion in your mouth. The bowl was also tasty. Lots of options to choose from to customize your perfect bowl. It was a nice healthy meal with lots of greens that were much needed after all the other heavy meals we've been eating. The chicken was average. I would skip that. I would come back here just for the kimchi fries, so so good. The only thing I have to say was that the service was a bit iffy. The workers kept getting other tables orders mixed up, it happened 3 times for the duration of the time we dined in. They also gave our fries initially to a table that didn't even order it. The other table ate it so they had to make a new one for us. The plus side was that the staff is super friendly but those small mistakes could be avoided.

Would have gone 2.5 starts but this was all I could do.  Protein servings are weak af here - basically use a thimble to measure. Went with two proteins total to make up for it, chicken and tofu. Chicken is passable tofu was very over done, tough and gross. Now, the real reason I am writing this review is because of the farts you'll get from eating here. Holy god, there should be a move called Kong VS Godzilla VS Chi'Lantro farts, bc they are rank.  Even my dog had a hard time with them, refusing to hang out with me on the couch. I've read reviews of people that eat here multiple times a week and have to think to myself they either live alone or with someone who has lost their sense of smell.

Chi'Lantro is delicious.They have burritos and bowls.You can pick the ingredients you want-so you have control.The kimchi and fried egg are my favorite part.The way they do service is pretty smart.The food is quite good and will treat you right.Go do a favor for your appetite.

One of my all time favorite places to eat. When I first discovered Chi'lantro's, I came here everyday for a week. Was I a little obsessed? Probably. Food: I normally tell people that this is very similar to Chipotle except Korean. You have the options of going bowl and burrito, base of rice/salad/mixed, proteins, and the a large variety of other toppings and side dishes. I really don't think that you can go wrong with any selections here. I normally get a salad/noodle mix which isn't too heavy or too light, with either the spicy pork/beef. I literally get all the toppings and SPICY MAYO is a MUST!!! Their Kimchi Cheese Fries is also a MUST. But the serving is pretty filling so I would recommend either getting that as a whole meal or sharing it with someone else. Environment: This location is super aesthetic to be at and really inviting place to chill. Also, I appreciate the dietary breakdown chats that they provide for the customers. The employees are overall pretty great, there were some occasional communication problems in regards to payment and their rewards program. Interacting Fact: The owner was on Shark Tank!!!

I'm on the keto diet currently and the cashier, Caleb, who took our order was really nice and accommodating with my order! I got the burger and was able to sub the bun for lettuce and subbed my fries for more veggies. NoT all hero's wear capes

What a great place to eat! We happened upon this place after visiting the Savers thrift store next door. It was so cute and modern and the staff (especially Tiffany) was welcoming, kind and informative. She helped us order and I'm so glad she did because my Korean fried wings were delicious. They also had tacos, burritos, and kimchi fries which I'm disappointed I didn't get to try! Next time for sure. I may even be risky and top them with tofu!My sister ordered the burrito all the way and although she didn't love the spicy mayo sauce ON it, she loved the burrito and thought it tasted fresh and way better than Chipolte. They've got a small beer section and fountain drinks available. Next time I come in, I'm trying the fries and maybe one of their tacos.
I have ordered before and I really enjoy Chi'Lantro's food, but I think you have a new cook who's a little carried away with the cilantro. I didn't order a salad.

I would give it 5 stars easy IF the format of this location was the same as the others I have been to. I prefer the line style where you get to see and pick your ingredients for your bowl. They offer pre-selected bowls. They do not display all the offerings, you just have to know. They give you a list of proteins, sauces and add-ons that they charge for but none of the many free items are listed, whereas you can see them when it is line style. There is more of a wait as well. You get a number and sit down and wait. And wait. I suppose it depends on the time of day as to how long it is but we were there mid-afternoon with only a couple of patrons and it took longer than expected. The food is 5 stars. Fresh and delicious. No doubt about that. The basil lemonade is really good and not too sweet for me like most lemonades. I would go out of my way to hit up a Chi'Lantro that is line style instead of ordering off the incomplete menu again.

Chi'Lantro keeps it chill.Been craving Chi'Lantro for forever and finally came here Tuesday night. Ordered the kimchi fries with tofu - craving fully satisfied. It's the the healthiest item on the menu for sure, but definitely great nevertheless. Kimchi gives the dish a stand-out punch, but the other sauce toppings can kind of all blend together. Also had the sweet potato noodle bowl with tofu with the carrot ginger sauce. It was super tasty and would recommend if you're looking for something lighter. The menu has a lot of different "bases" for your meal, so I feel like everyone can find something to eat.The restaurant is smaller on the inside, but I haven't had an issue finding a seat before. Parking is easy with a giant shared lot, and service was friendly and our food arrive quickly.For a satisfying and filling meal for under $10, I can't complain!

This is a small establishment located in a shopping area off of Burnet.  The decor is very cute and the customer service is outstanding. Ordering is done at the counter and they brought the food to our table which was a nice touch.This visit we ordered:The original Kimchi Fries: These are as good as all the reviews read they are.  It is a very filling dish and should be considered an entree instead of a side dish. The french fries are perfectly cooked and loaded with toppings. The kimchi is absolutely scrumptious and they do not skimp on the cheese. We ordered the Ribeye beef with it for $1 more and it was worth it - the flavors in that beef just perfect. All of these toppings complimented well with each other and the fries.Korean Fried Chicken Wings with a side of their spicy ranch: Some of the best wings ever. That Gangnam sauce was out of this world delicious.
