The large chicken wings, cooked perfectly.  Surprisingly - as I am not a ranch dressing fan - their spicy ranch was the best ranch dressing I have ever had, not too spicy and very flavorful.Strawberry Limeade: Although the flavor was good, it was watered down a lot.Previously I have ordered via a delivery service:Noodle Bowl: Loved the noodles in the noodle bowl, so unexpected but soo very good. They do not skimp on their toppings for sure and I highly recommend this dish.Tacos: Served with two tacos and your choice of flour or corn tortillas or one of both.  These are some of the biggest tacos ever and best.Don't forget to bring your plastic as no locations accept cash.

We just love this place. Have visited the burnet road and south Lamar locations. Both were great. My 8 year old son really enjoys it as do my 11 yo daughter and 16 yo son.  The kimchi fries are a must. The bowls have also been good. All of the sauces are delicious.

I have been here twice. The first time I got the rice bowl with soy-glazed chicken and the second time I went I got an order of the kimchi fries with soy-glazed chicken. The food is served in large portions and the soy-glazed chicken in to die for! So flavorful! The fries are definitely meant to be eaten with utensils because of how packed on the toppings are. Can't wait to go again!

This location offers family meal packs which is much appreciated during these times! However, the burritos we received in our to go order were mostly rice and had very little chicken or guacamole (one of them didn't have guac at all even though we ordered it). Their queso was delicious and extremely satisfying, but I'm not sure it was good enough to salvage the meal.

Korean fusion food is one of my favorites to eat especially the kimchi cheese fries topped with beef. I had gone to Chi'Lantro whenever it was still a food truck and I was hoping the restaurant would live up to the same expectations. It definitely was not as good as I remembered. What was good about the food was that it was piping hot and made fresh. The beef that was on top of the fries was good and flavorful, but I wish there would have been more of it. The fries itself was kind of devoid of flavor and there was too much sriracha that overpowered any flavor that was supposed to be there. All I could taste was just the spice. The chicken wings were good. They came out hot and crispy. The chicken on the inside was fully cooked and juicy. The meat wasn't dry, but it was not dripping in chicken juices. The sauce was a good balance of sweet and spicy and overall the chickens wings were really good. Overall, I'd give the place around a 3.5/5 because of my disappoint in the fries, but since I did really enjoy the chicken wings, they deserve a 4.

Chi'Lantro is hands down one of my favorite restaurants&definitely a top recommendation I suggest to friends visiting Austin. There are several locations around town, but this is my favorite. It is conveniently located in central Austin and their menu offers more variety then several others. This particular location is always consistent, quick&great service, and offers plenty of parking in the lot. Interior is bright, airy, and modern with fun bright colors. My top suggestions are: Kimchi Fries, Bulgogi Burger, and Korean Beef tacos. The kimchi fries are Chi'Lantro's claim to fame and I can see why - they're seriously the best I've had anywhere. Flavors are prominent, but not overpowering. Each ingredient blends so well to create a harmonious bite that will keep you reaching for more until the basket is empty. The Bulgogi Burger comes in a fluffy bun with ooey gooey cheese, well-marinated beef, fresh tomato, lettuce and runny egg. You'll savor each bite. Lastly, the Korean Beef Tacos are generously stuffed. Beef is marinated well and balanced with fresh cilantro and zesty lime. All portions are big, filling, and will leave you oh so satisfied.

I LOVE THIS LOCATION! BY FAR, THE BEST SERVICE YOU COULD ASK FOR! The staff was so friendly to me, and it is a perfect lunch spot when sitting next door at Summer Moon!HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend. I got the glass noodle veggie bowl with tofu. So yummy.Thank you!!! I will be coming back :)

I've been here twice within the past month & it's my new favorite lunch spot! While I'm a big foodie, customer service has always been just as important to me as the food quality during my dining experience. This Chi'Lantro location has hands down the BEST customer service I've ever experienced in Austin! The entire staff (special shout out to Tiffany & Krystal) are incredibly kind & attentive  It is clear that they are passionate about what they do & they love their customers.The food is delicious, full of flavor, made with love, served with care, & reasonably priced. I love their kimchi fries, both of their lemonades (basil peach & strawberry), & spicy wings (they included extra napkins & several handwipes which was so thoughtful). On top of great food & service, their aesthetic is super cute, cozy, & laid back! After finishing my lunch, it was the perfect place to get some work done. I'm definitely a Chi'Lantro customer for life & look forward to trying out the rest of their menu!

Chi'Lantro is a must if you are in Austin! There are many locations throughout Austin, but this is my favorite location. First impression I got when I walked in to this restaurant is how clean everything was. Lights are bright, ceiling is high, and the place itself is quite spacious. Workers are all really friendly! My favorite here is the kimchi fries. Man, words cannot describe how much I love those fries. Beef bulgogi is juicy and tend and it goes really well with the cilantro and cheese. Fries are cooked well. The spicy mayo completes the dish perfectly!If you come here, kimchi fries is what you should go for. Seriously, you won't regret it.

Since I've been food blogging I've seen some friends in Austin post about Chi'Lantro. I've been craving to eat it after seeing their photos and I was finally able to taste the kimchi fries! Let me say, I've never had anything like them before. I ordered it with spicy pork and for only 6.99, it made me full. The service was great and all the ladies were very polite. So happy this location is near my new job site.

I tried the queso and chip for the first time at this location and it was hands down the best queso I've tried in Austin!!! Warning: it definitely has a kick to it but worth every chip dipping bite! The wings here were slightly smaller than when I usually order them at the other Burnet location but nonetheless still freaking amazing! My only small complaint was the crispness of the wings...there wasn't any! But I thought the amount of sauce on the wings was the perfect amount.
Wow! Just ordered sweet and spicy wings and they were awesome! Loved the flavor and all 10 were cooked perfect! Can't wait to come back and try more.

I have been wanting to try Chi'lantro for a long time now. Well ever since I saw them on Yelp and reading all the rave reviews. What sealed the deal was seeing them on Shark Tank. I was like well if the sharks like the food and my Yelper friends love it I NEED to try them out. We stopped in for a bite before heading over to the comedy club. Upon entering it had a hipster vibe. We ordered an order of kimchi fries with ribeye beef (for an extra $1) and 10 wings. We split the ten wings so we could try the Gangnam sauce and rooster sauce. The wings came with a spicy ranch for dipping and pickles.The food came out promptly and I believe that was because it was the day after Thanksgiving so no one was really out and about for dinner.  Anyway, the food looked amazing and then my husband and I both dug in I have had Korean wings before at a little place called Bonchon. There is not a bonchon in Austin but they have locations all around the country and even located outside the US. Anyway, this Korean style wing is nothing in comparison. Out of the flavoring I did like the Gangnam style better than the rooster sauce. Neither to me were close to being spicy. I felt the wings were just lacking. Moving on to the famous kimchi fries. Again I believe chilantro fell short. The fries were crispy but I have had kimchi fries before. I actually had them at a Yelp event that Whole Foods held. The kimchi fries there were amazing there but these fries at chilantro just were meh. What gives?I am wondering if this was a miss day or honestly chilantro is just all hype? One can only wonder and now I marked this off a place that I tried but won't be back.

Chi'Lantro's Kimchi Fries is the best I've ever had, and probably the only I've ever really liked! The bulgogi in the burger and fries was a satisfying portion, and was also so yum and flavorful. Kudos to the cashier too for being very friendly and checking up on us. I liked the overall atmosphere and experience and would definitely come back to try the Rice Bowl!
Easy to order online and pop in for a quick pickup right by the door. Always clean and friendly.When I die, please bury me with my kimchi fries. Thx.

To begin, the CEO Jae Kim was on Shark Tank for his famous Kimchi fries, so you MUST try them. He also spoke to my organization at UT and he's the nicest guy. He started as one food truck on 6th street and has really made a name for himself (and Kimchi fries). I am a HUGE sauce person - I literally cannot eat scrambled eggs because no sauce pairs well with it - and this place has lots of sauce options. I love how you can see the items and choose them as you go. Also, the vegetables are all included (no extra charge for them) which I love so that I get the most out of my meal. The service is super fast, and you can add a fried egg on top! It's also great as leftovers.

This is a great place to stop for lunch. You order at the counter and they will bring your food to you. The tables are set up community style so be friendly or get your order to go!I shared an order of the chips and elotes, as well as the fried chicken wings with gangnam sauce. I also tried the beef burrito. I really liked the wings- they were extra crispy and the sauce was a good blend of sweet and spicy. The corn dip is a mayo base which I am not a fan of- but my hubby loved it. The burrito was huge and very filling. The beef was flavorful and I loved the addition of the fried egg. Since you can build your own everything here, it's great spot for vegetarians and meat eaters alike.

Chi'lantro exceeded my expectations.  I know this place is all about fries but I am a lover of rice bowls so I started there.  The cashier recommended spicy chicken for my protein so I ordered the rice bowl with spicy chicken and chose the lime buttered white rice.This bowl was so full of delicious ingredients, including rice, beans, corn, carrots, red cabbage,  kimchi, lettuce, chopped onion, a perfectly fried egg with runny yolk, and a splash of tomatillo salsa.  I love green sauces so I could have used more of this, but given all of the flavors and veggies, this entire bowl was a win and quickly demolished.  I will have to return to try the kimchi fries though!

I've only been to Chi'Lantro once (at a different location), and today was my second time. I wasn't planning on eating here, but seeing as how most restaurants like to close at 9 (WHY), I decided to eat here. Anyways, it was even better than I remembered! I got the salad with spicy pork and it was TO DIE FOR. The employees were super nice too! Would definitely recommend this place (and it closes at 10 so that's a plus). The only drawback is how the toppings are a bit pricey and they don't allow substitutes.

Super friendly staff and the interior is very beautiful from first impressions. The menu is nicely laid out and choosing what to eat was no problem at all. I was pretty surprised and how much the spicy chicken tasted really close to something I would eat in Korea. I love the fusion of the restaurant and would certainly come back with friends, be careful of how much sauce you put in because it's already saucy and flavorful enough!

Used to love the truck but I'm not sure why that love is not transferring over to the brick and mortar spots.Got a to go order spicy pork rice bowl today. Spicy it was not. It has been a while since I've had to literally fix up my food so it would be edible, but today was that day. Completely devoid of flavor and taste I had to add fish sauce, soy and a bit of sriracha just to make it palatable. Really sad, not sure what has changed, but I won't be retrurning any time soon.
Amazing food. Can't believe we didn't stop by earlier. Straightforward menu but lots of options. Best of all- super friendly staff. Highly recommended.

I don't know, Its hard to say I love this place, but I can't say I hate it... When Chi'lantro was a food truck I had their burrito. It was very big and worth the price.This time I tried their rice bowl. The price in my opinion is a little too over priced. The portion size is perfect!The ingredients were all very fresh except the rice felt a little under cooked. The employees there are very sweet and kind In my opinion, the food was a little bland and i wanted some sriracha sauce to put in but they didn't seem to have any. Their kimchi fries are delicious! But even that is over priced. The toppings on the fries hardens when it cools down so try eating it as soon as it comes out! I don't know if I would come back.. maybe I just didn't order the right thing? I don't know .. I have mixed feelings about this place ~

The kimchi fries are so good! I love that they use a generous amount of kimchi on top of the fries and the proteins are pretty good too. I ordered half ribeye beef and half spicy pork to add in the fries and it worked so well. The beef and pork were not dry and the flavors didn't clash between the proteins and the kimchi.I also tried the Gangnam wings and that was passable to me. The wings are big and juicy and the sauce was tangy and spicy but I didnt like that it was more sour than spicy.

I have been here twice now and was tardy to the Chi'lantro party altogether (I had no clue this place was a food truck phenom before it was a brick and mortar).My first experience here was a-mazing! I had the Kimchi fries w/the bulgogi and it definitely lived up to the hype. The fries were a meal in and of themselves and the meat was so tender and flavorful as were the fries themselves (I had initially scoffed at the serving price, but you definitely get your money's worth). The menagerie of flavors and texture of the fries to the meat were very complementary.I was even given an introduction to the menu by the very friendly and engaging staff on my first visit as I was a little wary as to what to expect, but I was put at ease and felt like I had been initiated to Club Chi' (I'm was just waiting for my secret handshake and members only jacket).To say I was a bit smitten on my first visit would be an understatement. So when I came in for my second visit a few weeks later, I was expecting the same sort of Cloud 9 experience. Sadly, I think the spell was broken.On my second visit, I came w/friends instead of solo; we came on a weekend, so the place was packed vs on my first visit it was later on a weekday and I was basically the only person in the place, but I am of the philosophy that regardless of time of day or day of the week a place this good should be consistently good and on my second visit, things were nowhere as good as the first time.I got the exact same order as I had the first time and this time the meat had a weird sort of aftertaste to it that I could not quite put my finger on, but it was a bit off-putting. Also, the fries themselves this time were not fresh and perfectly crispy like they were the first time. They tasted a bit greasy and were a bit on the soggy/mushy side. And maybe it was those two things that put the flavors I had fallen in love w/the first time on the off-track as well, but everything just seemed to be out of whack. My friends had ordered some tacos and they told me that they didn't understand what I was raving about it.  Needless to say, I left feeling a bit betrayed.However, I do plan on giving my fries another try because they really were that good the first time and even though the second time was subpar, I am willing to give this place the benefit of the doubt because I know what they are capable of. So we will see if I just had beginner's luck here or if the Legend continues!

Edit:  It turns out the Thursday I came, it was during a huge Favor promotion. That explains why there were so many Favor people! So the typical wait time is probably not 40 minutes. Came Thursday night around 7pm Ordered rice bowl with soy glazed chicken Atmosphere? Digging the wood design and ambience. Waited 40 minutes for food to arrive (it was a really busy evening :o) Verdict on food? Very good chicken, seasoned well and moist. Nice balance of vegetables like corn, cabbage, lettuce, and of course kimchi. Fried egg was cooked well! Still had that runny yolk. ...Beans? Did not like having black beans with rice bowl, tasted kind of odd together. :(Other comments: - Menu design: Thin white font on wooden background is terribly hard to read. Apparently, they're working on a new menu design coming out this summer.- This place is cashless! Card only. Just so y'all know!- Apparently you can make a kimchi fries burrito. :o

Bring your credit card because no cash is accepted at this Korean BBQ. This brick n mortar started as an Austin trailer with lines waiting for the "Original KIMCHI FRIES" - you can add delicious-toppings of your choice like caramelized kimchi .... For healthy Korean BBQ, try a bowl by building from the ground up. 1. Start with a base of spinach, cabbage or rice2. Add protein like korean ribeye beef or spicy tofu3. Select toppings like cage-free eggs4. Sauces include carrot ginger!Chi' Lantro even has a Kid's Menu with Grilled cheese for the ankle-biters!

I love this chipotle style Korean fusion place. Their kimchi is really good! I always get the noodle bowl with the spicy chicken and it's always a winner! It's nice that they denote the most popular items so you feel comfortable ordering. Also pro tip, get their basil lemonade, it's soo good !

Omg finally a chilantro opened up in mueller!! After moving to mueller, I missed living on the other side where there were tons of good places to eat on Lamar. Environment: the location is definitely super nice since it's in mueller. The place itself is super clean and plenty of workers are there waiting to serve you. Food: what caught me off guard is that this place is not like the typical chilantro unless they changed their whole dynamic at all of the other places. I have been with them since they opened their food truck and the food quality is not the same as before. There is no burger option at this location and everything is serve chipotle style. The kimchi fries were crispy but I was given half of the account of fries I would usually be given and they put way more kimchi than chicken this time. I'm not sure if the workers are just new and are not used to the menu? Overall I think it's pretty decent for what they are. I would probably go back to their Lamar location (unless they changed that place too). I think I would give them a chance once they established the place. The fries were meh compared to all of the other times I tried it. Other than that this is the nicest location they have!

I had really high expectations for this popular Austin fusion restaurant. The brick and mortar location of the long time food truck is nicely designed and small, and the line is very telling of how popular the food is. However, I unfortunately didn't like the Mexican-Asian flavors that much.I ordered the rice bowl with the ribeye beef and brown rice. The bowl was pretty tasteless to me, so I felt the need to add a lot of Siracha. Even so, it wasn't a very satisfying dish in the taste department. I wasn't a fan of the black beans with Korean flavors. The salad, burger, or wings all looked like good options though, so maybe I just got the wrong thing. The Kim chi fries were pretty tasty though. I didn't have a bad experience, just didn't like my dish very much. It seems like many people disagree though, so I wouldn't discourage a visit!

Had this delivered via Uber Eats, and it was super delicious. I selected the noodle bowl with ribeye meat and salsa roja, and it was super flavorful. The portion size is perfect as well. The only downside is the carb in take, but it's totally worth it.

Hi there,Chi'Lantro addict here. I moved to Austin about 4 months ago and I think I've been here at least 15 times. My phone autocorrected Chi'Lantro to Chi'Labryinth and I actually agree. The place is a labyrinth of wonder. Every time I'm there I wonder what I'm going to order next. With so many different options to customize, the possibilities are endless. My go-to is the rice bowl with soy glazed chicken and of course, some kimchi fries. Trust me, random stranger on the internet, they live up to the hype. Check it out! I'll probably see you there.

So I couldn't stay away.  I went back for the Kimchi fries with spicy pork again last night.  I didn't even make it two days. What have you done to me? This is all I want to eat.  I thought there was nothing better than Thai food.  Ohhhhh no.  This is the best thing I have ever had!  Is there something better than this? Maybe? Do I want to find it? I don't know.  My son had a spicy pork burger with fries.  He finished eating it in record time.  So I am not alone in thinking this food is pretty amazing.
Cedar Park, TX 78613

When it was announced that the Switch was coming to the CP I jumped for joy as I'm a huge fan of their Lamar location. My enthusiasm was tempered as I had previously visited their location in the Drip and my experience was Meh.Well, I am pleased to report that if you are a fan of their original location you will not be disappointed.We have dined here twice during the Rona and they are practicing strict social distancing guidelines.Let's talk their BBQ. The two big smokers out back are producing Fabu BBQ that rivals their original venue. Their brisket is moist, not over spiced, and have has a beautiful smoke ring. Their St Louis ribs are AOK with a nice peppery crust. Like a spicy sausage then order their jalapeno link.I'm not a sides guy as I prefer to load up on protein, but.... their pinto beans with brisket is spicy and full of awesomeness. Their coleslaw has a nice spicy surprise as well. My Plus 1 was also raving about their Mac and cheese.Last but certainly not least service is top-notch and friendly with frequent check-ins while you are dining. There are plenty of TVs both inside and on their patio. They also have a decent craft beer selection on tap.Don't be discouraged if there is a long line. Everyone is six feet apart and the line moves fast. Order their two meat plate with two sides and a draft beer and you will roll out stuffed or have a nice snack when you get home.Come here and enjoy your meat coma, meat sweat, and don't forget to enjoy their scrumptious sides!

Same parking lot as Shipley's donut & Zero Degrees. So glad that they brought this here to our area! So good! Second time here, everything is yummy! Line is long but service is efficient and it flows real well. Free beer to those waiting in line! All the sides are delicious! I haven't tried their desserts yet but I will!Parking is free, of course. Lots of seating inside & also on their patio. Hurry & come early!

So far we have visited this location a handful of times since they opened and have not been disappointed at any time! This week happens to be their Tex-Mex week and I just enjoyed their Chicken Chile Relleno, best one I've ever had. My husband ordered the half chicken this time and that was delicious as well. Our favorite sides are their potato salad and beans, and I really want to try those new Brussels sprouts. If you plan to get a dessert w your bbq I recommend their tres leches cake or the peach cobbler. Both are fantastic! We've tried several different things on the menu, both regular menu items and their daily specials, and have enjoyed every item. The people who work here are also amazing! Always friendly, there's usually someone greeting you as you walk in or while you're waiting in line, they have solid recommendations if you're unsure what to try and sometimes they throw on a brisket burnt end for garnish!

Oh my, where do I start with Stiles?!  Oh I know, it was true love at first bite!Here's the scoop:-The food is delicious! We tried a little of everything and had zero complaints. I have some picky eaters in my family and even they enjoyed it all. Yay!-They have an AMAZING FRITO PIE on the menu. I mean who doesn't love a legit Frito Pie? Heaven!-Convenient location on 1431. It's easy to get in and out of their store, as well as the strip mall they are in. -The staff was fantastic! So very friendly and helpful with my gazillion questions.  Oh and they give samples too!-If you are eating there, they have plenty of tables with room to spare. I hate being crowded, so it's nice to have so much room.-If you are doing to-go food, everything is packaged up nice and tight so you won't have spills. I very much appreciate this since we are hermits and only leave the house to get food these days. Overall, this is an easy review because everything is great. Get your booty over here for some tasty grub.  I promise you will be happy!

I'm a HUGE fan of Stiles Switch.  I usually visit the Austin location about once a week.  When the Austin location was too crowded early Sunday evening, we decided to give the Cedar Park location a try.Here's the short version -- it's not quite the same, whether in terms of food or service.  Food.  I ordered the Frito Pie.  While the menu describes it being served with brisket chili, it usually comes with chopped beef.  Like some of the other reviews have noted, the servings at this location can be on the skimpy side.  I ended up with a huge pile of Fritos with a few pieces of shredded brisket.  And honestly, the shredded brisket wasn't the usual Stiles Switch excellence.  In fact, the Frito Pie drank up the BBQ sauce I had to ask for.  The fries also could've benefitted from being a little crispier and needed a lot more of the seasoning that makes their fries a real treat.  The best part of my meal was the chocolate pudding dessert, which was excellent.  My dining companion had similar observations about her dinner, noting that her ribs, fries, and brussels sprouts didn't taste quite the same as the original location. Her peach cobbler had a crust more like cake than a cobbler crust, which overwhelmed the few peaches at the bottom of the container. As we were leaving, we also noticed that you didn't smell the smoke and BBQ like you do at the original location.The service at this location is beyond friendly, just like the original location.  However, they have a hard time keeping up with the crowds, especially in the line.  The line regularly backed up and any sort of to-go order, especially a large order, brought the line to a virtual standstill.  Also, the drink area ran out of ice and we had to find two different members of their team before we managed to get ice for our drinks.I still love Stiles Switch, but I'm definitely staying with the original location.

OH MOMMA, THIS PLACE IS GOOD!* * *Stiles Switch is easily one of the ten best barbecues in Austin.Stiles Switch is the number ONE barbecue in Austin if you don't want to wait in line.I loath execrate despise and abhor waiting in line for lunch.I would wait in line at the famous places if that was the only way to get super-duper barbecue.But Stiles Switch is awesomeness on a stick AND it is instant gratification.Instant gratification is a good thing.* * *I ate at the Cedar Park Stiles Switch on Easter Day.On Easter, they have their own custom made home smoked ham.You want their own custom made home smoked ham.Their own custom made home smoked ham is one of the most insane pleasures the world has to offer.Note that the mustard sauce on your table goes awesomely well with their own custom made home smoked ham.Note also that they give you their own custom fruity barbecue sauce that is specially designed for their ham.The custom fruity barbecue sauce puts the mustard to shame.I'm an old guy - and back in the 50's and 60's they used to serve raisin sauce with ham.When I was a little kid, raisin sauce on ham was the greatest thing ever, the best way you could possibly eat meat.Stiles Switch's custom fruity barbecue sauce puts 1950's raisin sauce to shame.Put a load of their homemade corn casserole on your plate as well and life is as perfect as it gets.(If you want you can improve on perfection to superperfection by getting one of their nifty bourbon drinks. They have Jim Bean on tap. Anyone who has Jim Beam on tap is my friend for the next 1000 years.)* * *Now their normal barbecue is pretty amazing.But their Easter ham is a special seasonal experience.They only do that on Easter.Once a year is way too infrequent for the most awesome of the awesome of the awesomest.* * *What can you do about that?We need them to get confused so they think Easter comes more than once a year.Go to Amazon and buy yourself a full body Easter Bunny suit.Also buy a big straw basket and a load of egg dye.Make about three dozen colored eggs.Show up at Stiles Switch in Cedar Park and start hiding colored eggs in whatever nooks and crannies you can find.They see bunnies - They find colored eggs- They will think it is Easter.They will think it is ham time.And ham time also means fruity barbecue sauce time.The World will once again have Stiles Switch Custom Made Home Smoked Ham.True Happiness Will Return to Cedar Park.

Stiles Switch BBQ, if these pics don't make you drool, I don't know what to tell you. First time hitting this place up but it won't be the last. I haven't been to the original location and don't think I need to with this Cedar Park spot close to the house. I got the sausage, turkey, and brisket. I think the turkey was my favorite this time. Mac n cheese was great as was the banana pudding. Thanks guys for making some great BBQ!!

The brisket and ribs were great!  The sausage was fine. I'm not sure which sausage we got because our order was for 2 different ones and we just got 2 of the same thing (and I'm not sure which). The Brussels sprouts and corn casserole were great (not an afterthought like some places). Don't like the name of the Brussels sprouts scare you into thinking that they're spicy - they were not. My 5 year old enjoyed them!  The creamed spinach was unique and interesting. My husband and older son really liked it. It had a very pronounced tea flavor. The cons: We pulled out of the curbside spot 12 mins after arriving. Though there were clear instructions on both the order and text requesting the bag go in the trunk,  they still came to the window to ask who I was and what my order was. We are immunocompromised and I didn't like having to have contact since the information was already communicated. They texted to say they were out of prime rib so we didn't get to try that. The food gets a solid 4.5.If you like my reviews, please vote!  Thank you!

I was only in Texas for basically 1.75 days. I was going to get as much BBQ as I could because, when in Rome, right? We passed by Stiles Switch multiple times so when my buddy asked what I wanted to eat for dinner and I suggested Stiles Switch he was a little surprised. "Barbecue again?" Yes, why not?He had never been so he couldn't really vouch for it but it looked pretty popular with it being 'COVID packed.' The layout is pretty Texan, you go down the line pick what cuts/meats/sides you want with your tray. I ended up getting the 2 meat, 2 side plate, brisket and hot link with potato salad and I was convinced to try the pinto beans with brisket, guaranteed that if I didn't like it I could get another side.I'm not a beans guy so I eye the mac and cheese as a back up. Before I get to that, let me talk about the rest: the hot link, I think that often times it's 'spicy' is relative and for me, it was ok but not at the heat level I would have liked, it's not just for hot links but anything that's labeled 'spicy;' not melt your face off but maybe a light bead of sweat on the brow. I also got the moist brisket which was good. I'm a full convert to moist, fatty whatever you call it brisket.Now, the sides. I liked the potato salad but DAMN she was right about the beans and I REALLY don't like beans; I skip them entirely at Chipotle, that kind of dislike. Bottom line: get the beans, maybe skip the hot link and go for something else.
Cedar Park, TX 78613

Best BBQ sandwich I've had! I got Bufords T Diablo. Even the bun is great and BBQ sauce is just right. I also got the corn casserole which is delish if you like corn and cornbread. Will be back and so glad they came to CP.

I have to admit, I was skeptical when I walked in that this stiles switch would not be as good as the original. Boy, was I wrong! I got a 2 meat plate with ribs and brisket and two sides. Everything was just as good as I am used to. You have done the mothership well my friends! I will spread the word to make the bbq switch in Wilco (pun intended)! Man, I love good bbq!!!

I figured the lines have died down and I could get a quick lunch.  Was wondering what the hype was about, hope it was good. The line was short when I went in but by the time I was leaving the lines were long and growing.I ordered the two meat plate with pork ribs, sausage, tomato & cucumber salad, and potato salad. Oh, and pickles. It was quick to prepare my to go box. At the cashier, I paid my $20. plus (Not Cheap) Head  out to go home and eat.Everything was squeezed into one normal size takeout box.  It was heavy. Opening it up, I first sliced some sausage and tried it. It was good, slightly spiced but not hot, good chew and snap. The potato salad was where my fork picked next. Potatoes cooked through without being mushy, not overdone with mayo, had some flavor, again it was good. Onto the rib, can you say peppery.  It was a definite pepper taste but if you add the BBQ sauce, it killed some of the pepper. I finished it in record time because there was hardly any meat on it. Too bad as pork ribs are my favorite.  Finally taste was the tomato/cucumber salad, I asked for the feta cheese on top and it was barely there. The dressing was also barely there. It was bland so I added some  dressing and more feta and it was better.Well, I tried it and most likely won't go again. It is very pricey for what you get. My two meat plate came with 3 ribs and a 6 inch sausage, the salad were 1/4 cup. I could get the same portions for $12. at other places
Yeah so this is definitely the BEST BBQ in town... Great job folks! Bristle sprouts and this Cream Corn magic stuff is outstanding...

Food was great let me preface this the food was great.I got the two meat plate, brisket and jalapeño cheese sausage (amazing!)Got a half chicken for myself and it was perfectly moist!My only gripe is that I ordered a frito pie, and talked to 3 employees about it and even when I was paying I told the cashier what I had ordered. They never put it in my bag! Yes I should have checked it myself but I spoke to 3 people about it and they all said yes I'm going to go get it.I know ticky tacky gripe but I really wanted the frito pie and I paid for it (it was 13 bucks!)

We have been here a ton of times now since it has opened. It's very convenient for us. And It has persistently gotten better. Most of the time I opt for the BBQ sandwich. Sometimes i get the pre mixed when I want it super juicy or sometimes they will slice some brisket and put it on a bun for me. I normally opt for the fries because they are sooooo good! They are very seasoned fries so if you liked seasoned fries, these are for you. I also like their corn casserole dish. I think the sides all depends on the person. I personally like different sides than what they serve and that's ok. I wish they would change them up sometimes. However, i did learn when I was just in, that they have special food on some days and to check their social media to see when they post about it. For example they just had chicken enchiladas that sounded delicious. Also, their ribs are really really good. Honestly all the meat their is amazing and you can't go wrong. The staff has been really fun the last few months. Super friendly, funny and helpful! :) I think that was my only negative when we first started going, so I'm glad to see a friendly staff now! Def a favorite of ours that we will continue to support!

Slowest line I've seen. If you see the line at the little bike rack outside expect 20-25 minute wait outside and then another 15-20 minutes inside.  So you are talking 35-45 minutes or so. Line had about 16-18 groups of people - most are 1 or 2 people groups. And this is a social distance line. The cool thing was they did offer a free beer ( Coors or Miller light) once when I was in line- I politely decline. But that seemed more random that at an interval - took me 40+ minutes or so to get through the line and saw them offer the beer once. Cool gesture. Guy manning the door was nice. I got a to-go order and unfortunately you cannot order online or call in orders which is frustrating. I got a 3 meat plate with 2 sides. We got the brisket ( above average), sausage(average), and jalapeño sausage(really good). Our two sides were mac and cheese - it was mild cheese and better than average and a tomato/cucumber salad. That 3 meat plate was able to feed myself, my wife and my son. Yeah we could have ate more but we don't want to stuff ourselves. Side proportions were pretty small imo.  Inside looked awesome! Outside looked nice too, but it too hot right now to side outside and the sitting area is on the west side of the building. The bbq sauce is some of the best. I'll be back, but will skip if the line is long unless they start taking Phone in/ online orders.

Was excited to check out the new location up north as we've been patrons of the Lamar location for years now. Its a great place to bring folks, very cozy seating and inviting atmosphere. Waited for the post launch hype to die down to avoid the crazy lines and went on a Thursday afternoon, and thankfully we hit it at a lull. I particularly like Stiles for the sides, that always stood out. They do things a little different from most joints. The meats were great- Brisket was moist and fresh, ribs fell off the bone, pulled pork was a bit lacking in seasoning though. I think the bbq sauce was unusually watery during this visit which kind of dampened my enjoyment of that meat. Probably a fluke but worth noting. This is one of the few joints with fries, and they're amazing. Try out the hawg fries, the potato salad is buttery and fresh, the beans have brisket in them and they offer a lighter cucumber and tomato salad. All the sides are elevated compared to other joints. And if you're a Coke or Pepsi fan, worth noting this is a Pepsi joint (minor disappointment). Either way, awesome to have this joint in Cedar Park! Ever since losing Big Cat nearby we've been sorely needing a new spot.

LOVE their food!! Bf got the two meat plate with pulled pork, brisket, Mac and cheese and fries. Pulled pork was sooooo tender and flavorful! Brisket was delicious, very juicy and amazing taste. Fries were well seasoned. Mac and cheese was good but nothing special.  I got the  Frito pie, it was the best I've ever had! Met who I assume was the manager that night Jason, really friendly as were ask the staff. I'll definitely be back, often!
Cedar Park, TX 78613

I've heard a lot about Stiles Switch with most of those saying the place was amazing.  I finally went to check it out last week for lunch.  A few considerations resulted in my average score:  Quality of food, Atmosphere, Cost.Quality of food was good.  I had the two meat plate with brisket and sausage.  The brisket was good but nothing special.  IMO, you can get as good or better elsewhere.  There are some nice choices of sausage (I did the jalapeno and cheese).  The Cuban sandwich looked amazing.  The 'Cadillac' of the menu is the beef rib but I didn't try that this time.  The atmosphere was good.  Comfortable seating and an outdoor patio.  They seem to really want to capture a casual Austin feel.  Their take on it is a bit more formal, however.  There is a walk in line and you order at a glass case that feels a little too slick.  You pay at the end of that line and then serve yourself a drink and find your seat.  Depending on what you order, you either take the plate yourself at checkout or they bring it to your table.  The location was only ok for me.  It is is a little strip mall sharing walls and parking with other places like a donut shop.  It feels much more urban than you would expect for a BBQ joint. The cost is high.  BBQ has really come up in recent years.  These guys are riding that wave and charging a premium for their product.  Sandwiches are around $15.  My plate was $20.  The beef rib was listed at $27.  For lunch, that is just a high number.  Some don't mind paying that.  Some definitely will. Overall, I had a nice lunch.  I even took some home as leftovers.   Would I eat there again?  You bet.  Would I choose this place over other BBQ options?  Probably not.   My impression is that these guys want to be to BBQ what Hopdoddy's is to burgers.  Nothing wrong with that as it certainly appeals to many folks that like good food but also want to be seen doing the cool thing at the cool place.  For an average person, this is probably more of a special reason to go kind of place.

Hands down, no questions needed the best bbq in Central Texas and maybe the state. Everything is seasoned to perfection and given all the love it needs to just be absolutely amazing. And that does not even start to describe the workers the Stiles family have in place to make sure your visit is an A++++. Beef BBQ SandwichBeef Ribs

This is my new go to for BBQ simply because of the beef ribs. They were down amazingly and with a slight pull everything came off the bone nice and clean. The brisket was alright but the beef rib, my life is changed.

I've been several times now since my last review.  I go on Friday's for the Chicken Fried Steak $17.50 and I get my dad a chopped beef sandwich.  My only issue is that I never get an itemized receipt,  One time they were out of metal silverware, They only had plastic utensils and last Friday they didn't have regular drink cups and were using what looked like water cups with no lids.  Whoever orders or supplies this place needs to pay more attention to what they are doing.  Also I asked several times for the WiFI password but never did get it to work.  The Food is good but you might have to bring your own cup, lid and straw and real silverware.

This place is more expensive than most of this type of BBQ but I wanted to try it.  Most all of the tables are open despite the pandemic.  I only saw a few tables (less than 5) that were blocked off.  There was sanitizer and a box of masks at the door if you need one.  They have stickers on the floor asking you to social distance. You go through the line and place your order.  Silverware was wrapped in a bag.  There was no condiment counter but they may just be due to the pandemic.  I got a regular sausage sandwich and my father got a chopped beef sandwich.   We shared the corn casserole.  2 drinks in paper cups.  All of that was $30, The dine in order was served on a metal tray with paper towel type napkins on each table.  The food was good like most BBQ.  I thought about seeing if I could get a link of sausage to go but he told me I'd have to get at the end of the line.  Also I didn't see nor did they offer bread.
The food is delicious. All I'm gonna say it's that the cuts are so obscene that your tastebuds won't be able to contain themselves and will be watering before you take the first bite. Check them out!

Tried out this new location during COVID and was not disappointed. Worth all 5 stars to me. Got the sliced brisket sandwich The brisket is moist, has a great crust, and they gave me the burnt ends at the counter just to try it out to make sure if I would like it. The sides are amazing. Corn casserole was new to me but I love it. Only thing not for me is the sauce but it's just preference. Although I literally didn't need it what so ever so let that tell you good the meat is. 100% my new local bbq spot.

The BBQ is awesome at Stiles Switch. I think most will agree. BUT - have you heard about the corn casserole? It is legitimately out of this world good. Absolutely fantastic. Expect a line during lunch but the staff is super quick and efficient so it moves quickly. I'm so glad they opened a location in Cedar Park. Good eats!

Stiles Switch opening a location across the street from my neighborhood has been terrible...for my waistline. And my cholesterol. And for any sort of life event that needs to happen during lunchtime on Friday, because Friday lunch is now Stiles Switch chicken fried steak day. Every Friday. I can regale you with notes on everything on the Stiles menu, because I've had everything. A *lot* of everything. Instead I'll just say: The chicken fried steak is the best on earth. The Diablo sandwich burns the next day, if you catch my meaning, and yet is entirely worth it. Every meat, every side and every dessert here is either on par with or better than every other place you hear about in Austin. People may not travel here from other countries just to experience the BBQ at Stiles, but they damn well should. It's that good.
Cedar Park, TX 78613

Hope we all welcome Stiles Switch and their staff to Cedar Park.  I've eaten at their location on N. Lamar in Austin a few times and enjoyed it. Today (8/28/20) was my first opportunity to eat at their new location.  All of my previous attempts were dissuaded  by a line wrapped around the side of the building.  I got their at 11:15am. There were a few folks already in line and seated.  My wife ordered the brisket and jalapeño sausage plate. I went straight brisket with most burnt ends.  The brisket was cut thick.  Perfect amount of fat. The sausage had a good grind and nice snap.  Both had a deep flavor of smoke.   The Hawg Rub fries had excellent amount of spice and needed no sauce or ketchup.  The pinto beans with brisket was really good and reminds me of my late Meemaw's beans.  Corn casserole is good as is the cucumber/tomato salad.  Very fresh. Stiles is one of my top 5 BBQ places in the state of Texas.  This is what true Texas BBQ is supposed to be.Stiles is definitely on 'My Keepers List'.

We are so happy to have these guys near us. Sliced beef bbq sandwich is excellent. Location is not bad to watch a game and have some bbq and ice cold on tab beer! We tried there mild sausage and it was decent as well. Their two sauce options they gave us with sandwich are both great. Super customer service. GREAT pickles!! Can not wait to go again!

This place is hands-down in the top five barbecue joints in the state.Everything is great. Even the sides! Don't miss out on the macaroni and cheese!The brisket is the bomb, sausage is on point not to mention the turkey which is outstandingly moist.

I don't know why I haven't learned my lesson yet. I'm not sure what's happening here, but I tried Stiles for the first time within a few months of this post and loved it. Since then my experience keeps declining. I hesitated ordering the chop beef sandwich because last time I went in store the beef looked saturated with sauce and kinda been there all day. I ended up ordering the chop beef that day but asked for them to hand chop the brisket like the way they did when I feel in love the first time with it. Well, today I took a chance and ordered chop beef sandwich for delivery. Not only do I have minced beef in a cup of grease, it wasn't even on bun like it used to be. You know like what I ordered a sandwich. They had to deconstruct it because of the nasty grease pool the disintegrated shredded meat mess was in. I'm done with Stiles. I'm done paying for grease soaked meat and inconsistent quality of food. If I could get my $20 back I would!

A little disappointed. No sauce. Where's the sauce? Was looking for a good some chili gravy or enchilada gravy and its literally meat n tortilla. Flavor is still good but for me what I got today really isnt enchiladas with brisket, more like a brisket tamale plate. The beans had good flavor but were watery. Rice was delish! Overall, it is a very tasty dish. Would order again but not for take out seeing that I'm more particular about having enchiladas with gravy and not some form of a tamale bake. I would eat in and ask for more sauce.

Good food overall. But just so we are clear 2 slices of avg pieces of brisket soaked in grease per their scale .39 lbs was $10.53. I tend to stick with sandwiches, I feel like I'm not getting screwed. A plate with 3 or 2 meats with 2 sides is like $15 to $20 so its hard to take in 2 slices of brisket totaling $10. Something to think about when you order.

Very heavy use of black pepper in all their meats. While I didn't really mind, my wife couldn't eat any of her meal. This stuff is *heavily* spiced across the board. The bbq sauce is very tomato-forward, and "thin" (not a hearty thick sauce). Great coleslaw!Next time I'm cravinq Q I'll probably stick to Rudy's.

Location: 800 w whitestone/1431, Cedar ParkEstablishment: Good location with decent amount of parking. Very nice decor with a warm comforting feel. Staff was pretty friendly.Order: 2 meat plate- brisket, ribs, potato salad, pinto beansBrisket is claimed to be Prime, this is likely the case as the meat was outstanding quality. I wish more places offered quality meat for their price. Cooked perfectly with tons of moisture with a nice crust around it. Disappointing though as there was little seasoning flavor to it. Better than most briskets in the area just due to their cooking techniques and meat quality. If you enjoy fantastically cooked brisket with little seasoning this would be great for you. Ribs had more flavor than the brisket with a nice sweet, and peppery exterior. Cooked just as well as the brisket, and came off the bone nice and easy. Potato salad was pretty good, I believe it is mayonnaise based, and had a decent flavor profile. Would like to see a mustard based salad as well.Pinto beans were the best things I had on the plate. Seasoned with a good hand of pepper and other seasonings. Definitely had the most flavor on the plate. Highly recommend.Sauces: the house bbq sauce was okay. Seemed heavy on the tomato base with little attention to other bbq profiles. Not particularly sweet or savory. Would like to see more of a traditional bbq flavor out of it.I found myself using their mustard sauce on the table more than their bbq sauce. Decent seasoning to it with more of a basic bbq profile.Overall great atmosphere and better than most bbq places around. I would have liked to have more meat, on the ribs or an extra half of a slice of brisket to completely fill me up (I am a smaller person). For the price the quality was good but the portions were a tiny bit small. The seasonings could be improved but for most people would likely be fine. It is likely i'll be back and recommend on occasion.
Ambiance is niceStaffs are quick and helpfulFood is delishhhhMake sure you look at menu before coming in they do have a lot of options!!!!!
Cedar Park, TX 78613

If a BBQ place has beef ribs, I'm sold. We had an amazing meal of the rib, some brisket, and a couple sausages. The sides were all fantastic (slaw, beans, and the tomato salad), as were the pickles. I was very impressed and thankful to have a top-tier BBQ spot so close to home. I didn't love their sauce, but that's forgivable, as the meats don't need any at all. It was a bit like pasta sauce, too tomato-y. I didn't have an opportunity to try their cocktails or desserts, but I will definitely try next time. One of my favorite Austin BBQ joints, for sure!

I can't say enough good here. The north Austin suburbs finally have good BBQ! I got the 2 meat plate with brisket and sausage. Wife got a beef rib. Few frozen margaritas and we were set. Food was absolutely fabulous. Brisket was amazing, sausage rivaled any of the Texas greats. I'm beyond happy that we finally have good BBQ up here.

Secretly one of the best bbq places in Austin. I live next to Terry Blacks downtown but will usually drive north to Stiles because I prefer their brisket. Their sauce is amazing too. When I have visitors to Austin, I take them here.
Very good bbq. It is more expensive than most places but you get what you pay for. Definitely going back, but won't wait in their crazy lines.

Recently visited with family in town (they love to visit other BBQ joints when in TX), $200 to-go order for 6-8 people (TX Trinity, along with some desert) and received very disappointed responses.Communication was poor while ordering, 1 of the quart sides was not sent with us, and the meat (except for the brisket) was somewhat undercooked and lacked flavor (specifically the St. Louis ribs, which is surprising).Beans, corn casserole, and banana pudding were great, but when your reputation is for really good BBQ people shouldn't be highlighting the sides and deserts (especially being more expensive than most).Not sure if it was an off day, or if the place was still reeling from Snowpocalypse (week before) but put me off as well. Be a while before I return, I'll stick to the tried and true for now.

Ive eaten here a couple of times now just to test the consistency.  The bbq has been very good each time.  Nothing dry...all juicy, smokey meat.  Sides are ok; but its more about personal taste than execution.  I.e.  I dont really care for sliced jalapeños and apples in my cole slaw.  The line staff have always been very attentive and courteous with helping me pick out something different.  My only knock that has been consistent with each visit is the girl who works the register.  She always seems like she's in a bad mood.  This last stop I had to keep asking her for basic items (can I have my cup?  Can I take my card now?  Do you need me to do this?) because she was texting the entire time she was ringing me up.  Not a knock on the food; but the register girl's actions have been consistent enough each time to take away a star.The brisket and half chicken have both been very solid each time.

So normally I am a big fan of all things Stiles Switch and I am super happy that they are now in CP.And much of the negatives that I bring up could have been eliminated if I had just acknowledged that I didn't like my lunch and chatted with a manager early on.But that didn't happen so let me share my experience.  Almost no one was in line when I arrive at 11:30 and the employees were super nice and fun.  I ordered the daily special which was Brisket Enchiladas.  That just sounded great and the check out guy even said that was one of his favorite meals.So I sat down to enjoy a well made Iced Tea while they made the enchiladas and brought them to my table in about 5 mins.  The food looked great.  Expectations were high at this point and that is where I erred.  The meal wasn't very good but I had high expectations, I had eaten 2/3 of my meal before I finally admitted to myself something was off.  At that point I felt like I couldn't really ask for something else.  I really love enchiladas and brisket both - so I figured you can't go wrong.  Well the problem was the sauce.  It had this tang that I couldn't quite place but I will try to give me best impression.  It was like someone spilled beer and coffee on the carpet and then let it sit for a bit - then made a sauce mixing in a bit of BBQ or Salsa.  It just tasted odd - which was too bad since it covered up the flavor of the Brisket too.  The beans were very good.The enchiladas were not very warm - which I thought odd since I expected it to have come out of the broiler to melt the cheese.  I didn't get much of the cheese flavor either.  If you have ever taken some leftovers and then thrown in a few random ingredients at home and when you were done - you said "that doesn't really go together" - that was how these tasted.  Now this might just have been a bad day - I have never ordered the enchiladas before.  And I can't believe that they would continue to have a special if it wasn't popular.  Or maybe it is just my specific taste buds?  I just find it hard to understand why I have liked everything else I have eaten at Stiles Switch for more than 10 years but not today.Finally - I would recommend any of the standard BBQ meats or sides.  I have enjoyed them before and I will enjoy them in the future.

I was excited to see this restaurant open in the Cedar Park area. In fact, I went there on the very first day of opening and I'm adding to the five star reviews! It's great to have a high-quality Texas BBQ place in Cedar Park. The restaurant was much larger in size than I had anticipated. Kudos to the owners to open this in the middle of the pandemic! I went there towards the end of lunchtime and there was a small line outside and a line inside (with distance markers on the floor). Service was prompt and efficient. I ordered the two meat plate (brisket and cheddar jalapeño sausage) with coleslaw and tomato cucumber salad. I also ordered the Frito pie. My intent was to share all of this with a good friend. Everything was excellent as anticipated and we both enjoyed it. The Frito pie was a very good portion with plenty of chopped brisket. I'm anxious to go back and get a full portion for myself next time! I think it's the first Frito pie I've had in many many years! Both the brisket and the sausage had a great smoky flavor and was well seasoned. It made me appreciate the high-quality BBQ offered by Stiles Switch! Despite my best intentions I had never been to the original location in Austin. My only complaint was, and this may be partially on me, since I went on opening day at the end of lunch, the tomato-cucumber salad was not a full portion. I had hoped to share everything, but there really was very little to share. I look forward to my next visit and trying out more of their terrific menu!
Best ribs ever!  They have the best BBQ in the area. I would highly recommend their restaurant.
Austin, TX 78724

Eat there all the time and love it! Great food and great service. My favorite meals are breakfast tacos, Migas w/Cheese, brisket, and the 2 meat combo. Try the 1/2 Chicken plate. Don't usually order chicken at a BBQ place but did one day for lunch and it's my new favorite menu item. Really good stuff. Haven't been inside for a few months due to COVID but it's comfortable and clean, and I miss dining in. The folks that work at the FM969 location always make me feel welcome and happy to see me. Really like this place and the people that run the business. Go visit and support this fine local business now, you'll be glad you did.
no nonsense bbq, moist brisket and delicious sausage, the charro beans were bomb diggity. none of the hipster franklin bs here.

Pre paid days in advance to have a brisket brought in to be cooked and sliced for a Memorial birthday for my late grandpa. The brisket was agreed to be ready by early morning--upon arrival the brisket was not ready, Don's said it would not be ready until after 1pm even after they accepted payment and agreed to have it ready early morning. Instead of an apology Dons was rude/disrespectful, called my aunt a liar and never offered a refund instead they kept our brisket and gave my family literally old scraps of brisket to make up for the loss. The brisket was so bad I wouldn't have even fed it to my dogs. In a state that prides itself on the best BBQ I would highly recommend anyone use other businesses for catering when it comes to bbq. We ended up having to rush to Southside market after this horrible experience and it was so much better.

We were on our way from Austin to Fredricksburg. Just tourists from North Dallas area. This place caught our eye and the Yelp reviews looked good so we gave it a shot. There were four of us and our wives gave us "the look" because it aint fancy to say the least. Once you get past the "atmosphere" everything is great. The crew is friendly and helpful and the food is excellent. If you are hungry for some good Q, check this place out!

Cashiers are a hit or miss. They are not always nice. The food is good but I called because I was overcharged on a pick up order and was told the prices online don't reflect the 'real' prices and they don't know how to fix it

I was a bit disappointed with this place when I had been told that they had excellent BBQ. When i called to place the order, the person answering the phone was very short with me and kept cutting me off when I was trying to finish with my order. We had the BBQ and the brisket had so much fat on it that we could hardly eat it, they didn't send ANY BBQ sauce with our BBQ like it says.  I would personally not recommend their BBQ, BUT, they do have pretty good cheeseburgers! We heard that their burgers were good so decided to give them a try and they really were!! Would recommend them for a burger place but not BBQ. Also,  the 2nd time ordering on the phone,  was about the same as the 1st. They need better customer service FOR SURE!

This is a great place for food but gives no excuse on the costumer survive.. this female was so so so rude the one with her EarPods in. She's gave me the worst attitude and this is how she represents the company ?!!!!! Wow horrible customer service. I was a main host for 3 years I've done better !!!!

I'd give a 3.5 if I could.Some of the other reviews mention the sides, and that's where Donn's shines. The Mac n Cheese is a no frills classic that envelops your senses and perfectly compliments the Potato Salad. The meats however, the reason why I went, were off the mark. Really had to put some work into chewing the brisket, it was that dry. The ribs were a little better, but still required hefty amounts of chewing. At the end of the day, you get what you pay for, the breakfast tacos other people were having looked great at least.

Cleanliness 4Quality of Food 4Speed of Service 4Ambiance  4Likely to return 5Overall Score 4.2I have breakfast tacos TWICE this week from this location... WOW!  I am sold.  I just need to get in here for dinner.  Staff is super friendly and they are serving up some hot fresh food.  They are open early for breakfast!  Good local place for food!
Austin, TX 78724
Donn's has some really delicious bbq for a reasonable price. There are a variety of lunch specials.  Today, I had the chopped beef sandwich. It came with two sides and a drink for $7.79.

Don't go by the outside of this place or even the inside. This food is the best bbq we have EVER HAD.   We had the brisket sandwich and it's incredible!!! Going back later fo more to take to our daughters house. It's a must!!  They are not overly friendly but get overr that and you will love the food
Wonderful to-go lunch. Brisket plate was amazing and the fried okra was the best I've had in a while. Great bbq joint!!

I have been coming for years, today was the worst customer service I've ever received. Came to dine in for breakfast and stood in line for 8 minutes while the cashiers kept taking to-go orders at the window. Once they finally took my order, it was another 25 minutes of waiting and me having to go and ask where my order was before getting it. BUT, the food was good.

We placed an order via Grubhub for a different location by accident and when we showed up to this location for pickup, we were met with hostility from the employee. One of the employees tried to help but the other lady spoke over her and told us to go to the I-35 location. When we asked where that was she told us to figure it out and closed the window.

Came here for some breakfast tacos. They were pretty good. I got one with brisket and I also got one with bacon. The brisket was the better of the 2 for sure and I also put some BBQ sauce on it to jazz it up a bunch. The inside is like a dive but it's got plenty of room if you are eating with a group. The people working were not very friendly, but it was still the morning so maybe they weren't awake yet? I will come back and try there lunch menu.
This place is suck!Wanna to order food on phone and have nervous to tell me to call tmr?Know what fuck this place

Not disappointed.  We had the brisket, chicken, and sausage. The brisket was moist and a good flavor.  The sausage was dry but had a good flavor.  The green beans are basic but fresh.  The service was good and fast.

I've been going to this place for 20 years, it has the best barbeque in town. Today we went, during the lockdown, ordered a pound of sausage and halfpound of brisket to go, 28 bucks worth. I asked for a little extra sauce, they told me to buzz off, they'd already given me enough sauce, which was two little containers, enough for about half as much meat as I'd ordered. Ironic because every table inside comes with a bottle of extra sauce, you can have as much as you want. I would've given only one star, but they get two because I still like the place and love the barbecue. Maybe the problem was with the impolite girl cashier, I'd never seen her before.
Austin, TX 78724

First time going and I was not impressed. Cashier is not very friendly. Repeatedly returned to the counter because they forgot this or that only to be left standing there as if I were invisible. Needless to say I won't be returning.

Donn's BBQ was pretty good. Not the best BBQ in Austin if that is what you're looking for. The beef ribs seemed a little dry as well as the brisket. The onion rings are very good, as well as their homemade potato salad. In the other hand, they have really good prices, so if you're in the mood for BBQ and you are not wanting to spend lots of money, Donn's would be a good option.
Great brisket! So-so sides, macaroni is like Mac and cheese soup and the fried okra was underwhelming. I'll be going back but just for the meat. Like the sauce.
There barbeque is just OK a little pricey and don't ask for any extra condiments Cause you won't get him

People say it's good  I went in for coffee and 4 tacos the tacos were not hot then I asked " where's my coffee?? Oh they said it's gonna be 3-5 minutes 10 minutes later coffee was given to me I said but wait I like to drink my coffee with my food and the young lady just shut the window on me

I've been going to Don's for years but ever since this Covid-19 has come to town..lol..the tacos have gotten much smaller and greasy and sometimes they for get to correctly make my order so I leave paying for something I didnt get. Please fatten the tacos up and PLEASE get peoples order right. I still think you guys have great food but I think you guys are loosing your touch.
The quality of the food is not up to par; I had discolored meat served to me. Also, the meat did not have much flavor. They were friendly however, I will not be returning.

I am impressed!!! I just ordered Dons on the uber eats super quick, and the food was DELISH! I had brisket, Mac, fried okra, and mashed potatoes with gravy. This is deff food cooked with love! There was not a single thing wrong with any of it I am happy and full! I highly recommend this place!
It looks like a shack. I turned around several times but glad I didn't. The food was awesome!
Austin, TX 78724

I just wanted to thank Donn's for making my employee Christmas Party great! We ordered a lot of food and it was ready, hot, packaged well (except for the barbecue sauce, you gotta figure out a better way to secure that..lol) There was plenty of food and everyone enjoyed it. The staff was friendly and helped me carry the heavy bags to my car. We got everything we ordered, which almost never happens these days and there was tons of left overs that my family has been enjoying this weekend. Great Job Donn's!

Mom and pop type of barbecue place. Small building and from the outside doesn't look like anything special but the food was spot on! I got the chopped beef with fries. Sauce was very tasty! Not too spicy but full of flavor. Sweet tea is a must here! They also have a breakfast menu and deserts but was too full to try any! Check it out if you want some home style barbecue

We were on our way to College Station from the airport and were looking for something outside of the city.  Somehow we stumbled onto this place.  It was kind of in the middle of nowhere but I regret nothing.They have everything you could want from a bbq place and all for a reasonable price.  The food is made quickly for you right after you order (less than 5 minutes).  The quality of the food is great.  Everybody in my group ordered different things and everybody left satisfied.

Donn's is amazing, we love it SO much, The food and customer service have always been exceptional. We especially love the brisket paired with their honey bbq  sauce. We've tried multiple items on their menu and have never been disappointed; the brisket, sausage and charro beans are too hard to stay away from though. LOL!

It's ok. Not the best, not the worst. They have over cooked meats such as chicken goes. Sometimes they are nice, sometimes not so nice. They are average to say the least. But ok is you want some bbq I guess. Sigh*
The food comes out quick and the food is good. The brisket, sausage and the ribs are the go to, while the other items on the menu can vary.Overall it's a good BBQ stop and would recommend it.
good bbq and rly good service. love this place because they never let me down when I eat here one time they were so busy and let me sit and eat anyway bc i was alone

This place had a great chopped chicken burger that is a staple in barbecue restaurants. It was fresh and flavorful. Myself and my significant other both independently noticed the change of quality of the burger. Now it's 2/5 the quality of the past burger for the price of the last. It was as decent as a frozen meal. This place had the quality of a mom and pop restaurant and was renowned locally for it. Now, I'm sure less is invested in the actual ingredients and techniques for the sake of profit margins. I hope this restaurant makes a change for the better.
Austin, TX 78724

The Driest,  most unseasoned brisket I've ever had in my life! They Need to befriend some salt. It taste like they season it only with pepper. Real bbq doesn't need sauce, and sauce is the only way it was bearable to eat.

Best Turkey in town, atmosphere is amazing and the brisket is cooked perfectly! Back patio and stage are great for the hot Texas days. Plenty of space for little ones to run around while you have a beer and play a game of corn hole!

A bbq pit is defined by its brisket and this place has bad, dry, crumbly brisket. Apparently, the key time for the best version of this brisket is between 11:00 AM and 11:30 AM, as that's when they time it for finishing at the pit.  I didn't get the best version.I like their whipped potato salad a lot. I can't commend the place for bbq, and word on the street is that it's expensive bbq for this community in general.

Beef ribs were nice and plump. Fries were very hot but the Mac wasn't that great. I would come back for the ribs only. Nice bark on them and soft on the inside... no need for sauce but the sauce was a nice compliment.
There are not many restaurants around this area but I enjoy going to Donn's. The bbq is great and you get good sized portions. I recommend the brisket.

From the moment we pulled into the already crowded parking lot, to the last bite, Donn's blew past our expectations, and served up some of the best barbeque us Texans have had in a minute. My husband and I stopped in at Donn's on a whim while trying to kill some time, before heading to the airport. Arriving just as the breakfast crowd was trickling out, we were greeted with the delicious smell of slow cooked meat. The expansive menu board boasted a wide selection of plates, sandwiches, sides and more. We both had sliced brisket sandwiches, with a side of onion rings, and sweet tea. The brisket was so tender it was falling apart, and a very generous portion on our sandwiches. Served on the side, the barbeque sauce was warmed, tangy, and the perfect balance between thick and thin in consistency. Almost more food than we could eat, we moved on to the onion rings; which were crispy, and didn't turn into a greasy mush while they were ignored momentarily, as we shoveled brisket into our mouths. My only very slight complaint was that the sandwich was served on generic store bought sandwich bread...and there were no toothpicks. Overall we left with very full stomachs, and with just enough time to get to the airport. Next time we're in Austin we will be sure to stop by again.

Highlight:For $6 boxes, this place was definitely worth it! Entering the store, you know this place is college affordable with the boxes that they serve in. I ordered the Veggie Don (with tofu) and my sister ordered the chicken Don and we both heartily enjoyed the meal. Definitely worth the visit!

The bbq is ok, most of the time, but it honestly depends on the day. There are days where Donn's is great and others not so much. Once Donn's gets its consistency on track it will be a great place to go to any time or any day!
Eating dinner with boss, brisket and turkey. It was pretty good. It was worth the drive from the airport. Even can cook breakfast food.
Manor, TX 78653

Man the brisket and sausage plate was the bomb.  Friday special with two sides and a drink for less than $13!The sausage and brisket was so good I didn't even need or use the bar b q sauce.My sides, potato salad and coleslaw were also very good. Small dining room but most of their business seems to be drive through and take out so it was not crowded inside.I was very happy with my lunch experience here and will be back.
Such a great experience! Quick and easy drive through, friendly service and great food! TRY THE BRISKET! So well sliced.

Amazing food! The brisket was flavorful and moist, their half chicken was as well. I had plenty of left overs so even after being reheated the following day, everything tasted great. Can't wait to go back, I highly recommend this place.

We get some of the best bbq here.  This trip, we had the pork rib plate and 1/2 chicken plate.  Both were generously served and were certainly up to standard.  We typically eat inside but couldn't because of the current situation we are in.  We did use their picnic table outside the restaurant.  Highly recommend

We get some of the best bbq here.  This trip, we had the pork rib plate and 1/2 chicken plate.  Both were generously served and were certainly up to standard.  We typically eat inside but couldn't because of the current situation we are in.  We did use their picnic table outside the restaurant.  Highly recommend this place.

My in laws brought some over tonight. The brisket and sausage were really good.The mac n cheese was good too.The beans were fine,  I like a more ham hock flavor. The potato salad is good, kind of on the sweet side. My family said that the staff were all very nice. Good place to keep in mind!
Best BBQ i've ever had in my life. I will never go anywhere else for my BBQ. Not to mention the prices are unbeatable.

My boyfriend and I were on the way to Houston when we saw this little hole in the way bbq joint and decided to check it out.  We ordered the today's special which was sausage + brisket plate with your choice of two sides and a fountain drink! I chose the potato salad and kernel corn. I noticed as I got my plate how juicy the brisket and sausage looked and I was right! The brisket was very moist and their tangy bbq sauce was the cherry on top! The sausage was very flavorful. No complaints on the potato salad but the kernel corn tasted like something out of a can. The place itself needs to help, seems like this place needs a foundation lift. The floors were sloping down in the center of the room; this place would use some remodeling! But overall, the food is great and the price is right!

After visiting several places in central Texas in search of brisket an sausage, I ventured back to a place that has never let me down.  So, I ventured to manor to visit the little red building for a great meal.   For starters, do not ne intimidated by the building, the food and service are great and this visit was no different.  I ordered a pound of brisket, a sausage link, pinto beans and potato salad.  As always, the brisket was very moist and seasoned well even though it did not have much of a bark.  The sausage was pretty good - standard elgin sausage.  The pinto beans weren't dressed up, but they were cooked well.  The potato salad was pretty standard, but very creamy.    Finally, this is a no frills barbecue restaurant that serves great, reasonable, smoked barbecue without covering up the integrity of the food with extra spices and sauces.  It is worth trying if you are in Manor, Texas.
Manor, TX 78653

We've lived in Manor for a couple years now and have always wondered about this place. I finally decided to give it a try this evening and ordered a chopped beef sandwich and a brisket/sausage plate with potato salad and coleslaw. I actually ordered beans too, but never got them. First off, their portions are HUGE! Everything tasted okay, except the sauce. It was absolutely awful! It was like watered down ketchup with a bit of pepper and vinegar in it. The sausage was juicy and the brisket was slightly dry, but had a good smoky flavor. The potato salad reminded me of deviled eggs (in a good way) and the coleslaw was standard and vinegar based. The server at the window was super friendly and gave my dog a treat, which was appreciated!It definitely isn't the best bbq I've had, but their prices and portions make up for it. I'd have it again.

I ordered the brisket and sausage plate for dinner,  about 6pm. Brisket salty and dry. Sausage good, from Elgin. Potato salad good, tastes like HEBs mustard potato salad. Cole slaw was ok, not very saucy.  BBQ sauce had a tomato marinara taste. Overall was not impressed, was really hoping for better brisket and sides. Staff very friendly, with quick drive thru.

Not bad BBQ but it wasn't the best. The sides were good but super small. I expected more for the price. The small building has a lot of character. People leave messages all over the walls and ceiling. The place wasn't busy at 1 PM on a week day.
Great BBQ in our area. Had the chopped beef. It was purdy good. You can never go wrong with Tradition BBQ. Great flavor and fast, friendly service. I recommend this place to anyone.

I have been all over this country and tasted BBQ from many, many places. This little bitty place has what it takes! I do, however, wish they had a larger place for seating, but they do have a drive-thru. Easy to pass up though. If they'd put up some kind of advertisement to let the public know that they are there, they'd more than likely get more business...and prob so much that they'd have to open up a bigger building...yes, it's that damn good! Price is fair. For three (VERY LARGE) chopped beef sandwiches w/chips you'll pay around $17. Just be sure that you have a fork! I will (ALWAYS) be coming back to this place as long as they have an open sign.

The wait time at this place is ridiculous. They have a drive thru window which makes you think you will receive your order in a reasonable time. This is not the case for this place.
