I've been there twice and received the same nonchalant attitude from the staff and had to wait forever the second time. I will not be returning to this restaurant.
Prices are very reasonable. The meat is cut without a lot of fat and tastes amazing!!!

Drove by this place plenty of times without even noticing it until one day I realized it was a drive through BBQ joint. Decided to give it a try for the sake of convenience and I'm so glad I did. The brisket is delicious and the brisket sandwich is outstanding. The cakes and brownies are also amazing, but the sides are definity smaller than I expected. Every time I take a trip to or from Austin that takes me on this road, I make sure to stop by and get a sandwich.
Bleh. Just not good. Sauce is awful... Flat, boring uninspired. Chicken is good, kind of, if you ignore that SAUCE. Everything else, brisket, sausage etc... No no no.
Manor, TX 78653

I love this little bbq joint on hwy 290 east in Manor. The parking lot is dusty and full of potholes (don't use their drive through in a low sitting car!) and the building itself appears purposely shabby.. BUT THAT BBQ!!!! I haven't had anything that I didn't like. I love the bbq beef rib special (Wednesday lunch?) it's well seasoned, smoked just right and you get a lot for the money. Customer service is also always excellent. This is one of my go to spots in the area
Excellent chicken tastes very smoky and falls apart!! Brisket was equally tasty, yummy char and very little grizzle! Mustard potato salad was delicious!!

Got the sausage plate, it was nothing to write home about. And the BBQ sauce was just some fancy ketchup.  Two sides were green beans and coleslaw. I definitely loved the green beans.  I never find good green beans anywhere but here.  The coleslaw was your standard mayonnaise based stuff. Lunch specials are less than $10.

Great little BBQ place in Manor. Looks about like a Texas BBQ joint should look--small and scruffy. Portions are good and everything is cooked nicely. The brisket was very tender and the potato salad was awesome (mustard-type). If you take someone to a Texas BBQ place, go somewhere like Texas Traditional, not some crummy chain.

Excellent bbq at this restaurant I ordered a two meat plate: brisket and sausage with two sides Every bite was delicious!I ordered a 1/2 slab of baby backs as well Amazing on their own, even better with house made bbq sauce!!!I will definitely return againGreat valueGreat service/friendly staff
Awesome and friendly service the 2 girls are great.The barbecue has a great taste and the plates are well portions.

I really don't understand the bad reviews; maybe you guys went on an off day or are just extremely knit-picky and wanna complain about something. The chopped beef sandwiches are great! They're stuffed to the brim, enough so that I can pull like a handful off the sides because the serving is so generous and they literally only cost $4.49 for each one. I also tried the sliced beef sandwiches which are equally as good. For a side we got potato salad- which I don't even like typically but i LOVED here. My sandwich had so much meat that it alone filled me up- so I put the PS in the fridge and the next day it was still just as good! Finally we got pecan pie for dessert- I didn't try it but the person who did get it enjoyed it. Why 4 stars, you ask? Well the sides are kept in little crock pots and then the cold sides are just kept in this serving style tray (thing? Idk? Oops) anyway- I also happen to work in food industry and know that somehow this probably isn't the MOST sanitary process HOWEVER will it stop me from going back? Heck no it won't. Id way rather spend my money on cheap DELICIOUS BBQ then McDonald's or Sonic or Subway or the ever popular pizza in Manor.

This place is the best spot in town. Great brisket sandwich here, it was tender as it gets. I'd say you also must try the Mac n cheese as a side too. I'd try anything here. Owner was welcoming and cool to for us out of town folk. Staff was nice too. I've definitely gone more that once or twice this week, I'll be back too.

The food is great. Service counter.!it not a chain Restraunt . It's a family business . Gary owner runs as the BBQ master. It looks like a whole in a wall place . You can put your name on the wall and ring the bell if you love the food.
Manor, TX 78653

Really it deserves 4.5 stars. If it had nice outdoor seating and a beer garden I might give it 5 stars. When it comes to the barbecue it's legit Texas BBQ. If you are going to play golf at Shadowglen Golf Course before or after. My personal favorite is the brisket sandwich with a side of pinto beans.

I am so surprised at how well the reviews are. I really am. I have been here several times since moving to Manor and every time I am let down. Their chopped beef is the worst! There is always tons of grease just pooled all up in it. I don't know if they are trying to use that as the sauce, cuz there sure as heck isn't any bbq sauce in there. The brisket is super dry and doesn't have a good bark. The half or whole chicken is small and has a strange flavor. It's not bad, just strange. The skin is gross...no good seasoning. The sides belong in a school cafeteria. Sorry, but they do. The people are always real nice, so that's great. Unfortunately I don't think I'll be going back. I've given it several shots hoping that it was just an off day for the cook, but it's been consistently bad. I wish Manor had more options.

I am always up for trying new places and with 4 stars on Yelp, I thought it would be a good choice. Let me just say that if you don't take care of cleaning your restroom, what are the odds that you don't take care of sanitary conditions in the kitchen. Had I used the restroom BEFORE I ordered, I would not have eaten there.Pros - chopped beef sandwich was packed full and was piping hot            Fresh brewed tea            Restroom had soap, hot water and paper towelsCons - I had a big fatty piece of meat in my sandwich             Lots of annoying flies            Filthy restrooms!!!            When we first walked in, an employee was having an                 inappropriate conversation, using inappropriate language in the                 entrance of the restaurant with another employee. While we were                 the only customers at that time, the employee continued her story                as we stood waiting and she did not even apologize for her                 conduct before acknowledging us. Sorry to say, we will not be back. Elgin is not that far for better BBQ.

New to the area, so decided to try Texas Traditional BBQ for the 1st and most likely last time.  My family found the meat to be bland with little to no flavor.  The brisket was loaded with fat.  We purchased the food though the drive-through and I expected it would have came with BBQ Sauce and some bread as provided by most BBQ places, it had none.  So this already bland meat had no BBQ sauce to add to it.

Oh man, how I wanted to fall in love with a divey bbq joint.. BUT, the best thing here was the sausage and the guys attitude that was servin up food that day. Id come back just for his Texas friendliness, but not for much of the food. Sausage. PERFECT. IDK what brand they use, but it was excellent. Not fatty, or greasy, but not dry in the least. It had a perfect snap to the bite of the skin.. Damn, Im hungry. Brisket. Can you be tender AND dry @ the same time? It was very chippy, but tender, but dry. I hate brisket that isnt tender all the way through, bite after bite. I had a hard time chewing much at one time. My SIL didn't care for hers either. The sides were straight out of a can. Green beans with NO seasoning. No bacon chunks, or onion. Nothing! Open can, and serve. Majorly disappointing. No mac or mashed potatoes that morning, boo!! So we got pinto beans, again, out of the can, and serve- cole slaw and potato salad.. disappointing, from Sams or something. Nothing authentic in sides, which is a huge let down for me when it comes to BBQ. Sauces tho, you ask? All from WalMart and WATERED DOWN to a water like consistency, cold, and tragic. I don't mind a dirty-ish joint, a place that you wonder when it was last power washed, so that doesnt turn me off.. the food however, did.

Delicious BBQ.  Small little shack of a restaurant with A/C and delicious food.  We had a family style meal for 5-7With 4 adults and 2 small kids.  We had 4 sides instead of the regular 2 but plenty of leftovers.  Everything was delicious!! Lots of sauce options too.

Please don't eat here.  You see, I've discovered a very authentic Texas BBQ place that's not overrun with tourists or hipsters, but that seems popular with the locals.   There's not much of a line and they weren't out of anything.  And the prices are more than fair too.The brisket is very good, but the baby back ribs are among the best I've had anyplace.   Another positive to this place is the sauce.  They have three - a "regular" sauce, a Kansas City "sweet" sauce, and a "wet" sweet and tangy sauce.  The Kansas City sauce is probably the best, although the "wet" sauce will definitely grow on you.   Combine this with plentiful iced tea, saltine crackers on the table, good cheddar cheese, and friendly help and you've got a real Texas roadside BBQ stand.Again, please don't go here.  Please continue going to all of the "cool kid" BBQ places and I'll get my BBQ quickly here.
Awesome bbq!   We had the three meat plate with ribs, brisket and sausage.   All were great.   The wet sauce is out of this world.   If you are in the mood for bbq you must eat here.

Truly is Texas traditional barbecue, no need to spend hours on the toll road, no need to show up at 6am, no need to take pictures with some tourists trap gimmick, no need to shell out lots of cash. If you want good Texas barbecue at a reasonable price, without all the frills this is the place.
column21: University of Texas at Austin, Austin, TX

column20: Manor, TX 78653

I really love the food here. Astetically i think it can put a little money into the actual location.  It's all about the food here. The brisket is light, juicy and tasty. You have to get the mustard yuminess (potato salad) and it always comes with a side of sliced white bread. I have tried the ribs and they are very tender. All in all dont judge this place by the looks of it. Its hand down some of the better traditional bbq I've had down here. I only gave them 3 stars solely based on the visuals of this place. They have great service and great food.

My girlfriend made me late for the line at Franklin's Barbecue... So I took her here to break up with her.  The brisket was surprisingly excellent (5 stars). It's the best brisket I've ever had, but I'm not from Texas, so I expected this much.  A small consolation for missing Franklin's. The service was underwhelming (Just one girl worker, the others were super nice).  I'm not sure if the girl was in a bad mood or if she could sense my mood.  Needless to say, I left my ex in tex' and won't be coming back to this place.

Delicious BBQ place out in manor. I had the brisket and pork rib. Both had delicious bark to them and the meat was fall apart tender. The seasoning to the meat was amazing. I will definitely be back for more.
Great customer service. Bbq is delicious and their chocolate cake is amazing. Definitely a place to try if you're in Manor.

Popped in to grab some lunch at this lil joint. Not too visually pleasing, but don't let that deter you. It has a small dining room or you can drive thru. They offer daily lunch specials from 11AM-2PM. I ordered the sliced brisket sandwich with pinto beans and two pork ribs. My husband ordered the chopped beef sandwich and potatoes salad. Onions and pickles are available upon request. My brisket sandwich had a very generous portion of sliced, moist brisket. It was tender with decent flavor. I would have preferred a bit more of a smoked taste, but it was good. If you order the sides the small is super small. The beans were ok, not overly seasoned, but not bland either. I would have given this place at least 3.5 stars, but my husbands experience was not quite up to par. He did not like the chopped beef sandwich. It was not chopped fresh when ordered and he felt that it was pre-made and stored. The potato salad was chunky and not whipped. He agreed with me that the rib that I shared with him was tender and flavorful. Just FYI the bbq sauces available on the table were not impressive, but ok. The biggest thing for him was that the restaurant had a stale smell. I suffer from bad allergies, so I wouldn't know. If I were in Manor again, I would not hesitate to order another sliced brisket sandwich and the pork ribs.

BBQ shack is a good description it's got a drive through plus in-door sitting we had the pork ribs (tender but cooked) brisket sandwich (lots of moist brisket) and the chicken all were cooked well and had a great not over smoked flavor counter people were friendly I would like to try their pork steak next time
Had a chopped beef sandwhich and potato salad - delicious & affordable! Will definitely become a regular!
Got the baby back rib plate special for $9.75 on Wednesday, very good.  I found this place through Yelp and we'll absolutely be back!

Don't get fooled by an old run-down looking building, they serve the best barbeque in town! Their chicken is AMAZING - so moist, tender, smoky. The service is surprisingly quick, it wouldn't take 3 minutes to get your meal. Another thing I like is they have a drive-thru window, so you can grab something for lunch in the morning on the way to work. I wish they open a little longer especially during summer - they close at 8:00PM, but they are open for 7 days which is convenient.It's worth a try if you are in the area:). 4 solid stars.
Bee Cave, TX 78738

I am traveling through Texas trying as many BBQ joints as possible. The dining area is a nice size and very clean. The staff was very friendly, each customer is greeted individually and not a canned hello. Now let's get to the Q............. I had the 2 meat plate with coleslaw and potato salad. I chose brisket and pulled pork. The sides tasted homemade and were fresh and seasoned beautifully. The pulled pork was light on seasoning but had a good Smokey flavor. Now the brisket...... the bark they develop in the smoker is spot on. The meat was very tender and flavorful. Good balance of seasonings. Bravo pit master you have this dialed in.

The food was good but would have tasted better if the customer service hadn't been awful. We stopped in for a To-Go order 20 minutes before closing and were greeted with an immediate scowl and "Are you getting this to-go?" followed by a list of everything they didn't have. Typically this isn't a problem but facial expressions and tone of voice really make all the difference, ya know? After we ordered, another person walked in to order and the person who took our order made a negative audible comment something along the lines of "You have to be kidding me". There was absolutely no one else in the restaurant and there was still 15 minutes until closing time by the time we paid, got our food and left. Plenty of time. I could understand some frustration if we were there at or after closing time, but that was not the case. Such a disappointment.

The Schmidt Family has been bringing BBQ to Central Texas for 73+ Years, which tells you a little about their Heritage & BBQ Pedigree. I'm glad I didn't pass them by, because of the Yelp Rating....perhaps the fine town of Bee Cave doesn't quite appreciate what going down in their neighborhood!As soon as I stepped out of my truck, the wood smoked meat hit my nose, and like a dog in heat, I chased the scent of love through the doors to find this impressive BBQ venue ready to please any size crowd....EVERYTHING is BIGGER in Texas! I went with the 3 Meat Meal and let the staff pick their favorites. They chose Brisket, St. Louis Ribs & Sausage that were hand carved in front of me with excellent sized portions, which made me eyes happy and my mouth ready to devour along with their pick of Scallop Potatoes & Green Beans. With the Eye & Smell Test completed it was time to sink my teeth in for confirmation......YES! I was validated!! The Brisket melted in my mouth, the Ribs were meaty and smoked to perfection, Sausage was on point AND the Sides were so satisfying I'd come back for another round on their merit alone. While you don't need sauce for their tender and brilliantly balanced rubbed meat, I really enjoyed the table BBQ Sauce....it was complimentary to the meat & made my meal burst even brighter!Don't pass this joint by....stop in and sink your teeth into 73 Years of Family Tradition!

This is my hands down favorite bbq place. All the others fail to compare to the quality of the bbq and the sides. The beef ribs are my favorite meat of choice but I don't think you could wrong with anything here!! Yes, it's a bit pricey but you get what you pay for and it's worth every penny.

We order from Schmidt's BBQ often. It's across the street from our neighborhood, and is conveniently located next to the Galleria. The BBQ is consistent in the way in which it's cooked/prepared day to day week to week. Schmidt's offers classic BBQ sides and entrees you'd expect to find at a Texas BBQ establishment. Anticipate spending $15-$30/person (including children). If it's your first time visiting, I would recommend the loaded smoked potato w/ brisket. In addition they offer unique sausages that have a flavor profile you won't find at other BBQ establishments. Delicious. NOTE *to go orders*: I find the BBQ sauce to be second to none. However if you'd don't ask for extra you won't have enough for your entire meal in my opinion.

I understand being in a pandemic and business doing their best. But when the Manager or some one of importance ( the guy in the red adidas pullover) chooses  not to wear a mask at all   He berated an employee about cleaning and yet he is in an enclosed building and wears his mask dangling from his ear. We drove over here so my husband could have the turkey. It was as good as usual  , a tad cold; but flavorful. But we cannot patronize a place that chooses to allow a manager disregard the required mask.

We wanted to try a new place and support restaurants during the time of COVID. I would much rather drive to the other side of ATX to have BBQ than eat this. The brisket seemed reheated because it was dry The sausage was  super tough, the ribs had barely any meat on them, and the turkey was bright pink. Im really disheartened about this because I was hoping we would have a BBQ place near the house. Nope. Not worth it at all.

Not sure where the less than 4 star reviews.  I know Austin has a high bar for BBQ but this is really really good. This is the best sliced brisket sandwich I have ever had.  point blank......the best.With or without sauce its great.  The sauce is not your average thick sauce, its a little more like North Carolina without being all the way NC.The pic is WITH SAUCE so that should help you.  My wife who doesnt like BBQ sauce got some on the side and LOVED IT.  Said it wasnt really BBQ sauce.  I think it had a little tang like that of Heinz 57 but not as thick.I have had the other items and thought that were also really good but nothing comes close to the Brisket Sandwich and I should point out that I normally dont eat fatty BBQ but on this sandwich......its AMAZING !

Say it ain't so Joe! Now just barely hanging on to 3 stars. One solid star goes to Momma Lou. She has always been kind, remembering who The Lady and I were, and asking the other day how The Lady was doing since she was not with me. Now to the Q.The jalapeño sausage continues to decline in size and quality IMHO. This time it was dry with zero snap. It had to be cut with a knife. Saving grace... it was spicy. I had also ordered some brisket and a hot to take home for the evening. As I emptied the bag at home, only brisket. Being the Rocket Surgeon I am, I know to always check to go orders from anyplace, but I failed this time. Saving grace...I had not be charged for one so no star loss. Finally, the Lady liked her brisket from this visit. Star saved. I will return of course, and hope this was an off day.
Bee Cave, TX 78738
Best bbq around!! Fantastic brisket, ask for the burnt ends :) Also really really good potato salad.

Hooray!  They put the most expensive BBQ in the Austin area in Bee Cave. Try the savory $ 22.00 lb brisket.  It goes down hill from there. I'll bet the residents in Spanish Oaks across the highway go there.  They're the only ones who can afford it. If you're taking you're fam like wife and two kids, get ready to drop a hundred bucks.  Easy.   4 oz brisket (  quarter pound )1 small pork rib  ( little meat )Small side beansTea $17.00.   I'm willing to pay that if it's worth it. It's not.

I had an urge for good BBQ so  after shopping at Hill Country Galleria I stopped at Schmidts for Bbq. .. I noticed a large billboard on the wall with there menu so went to work to see what to order. So I decided to order the baby back ribs ., spate ribs and the brisket my weakness. Being a native Texan the barbaque was so good I ate all of the brisket on the way home boy all of the meat was juicy tender not greasy and so good. I love County line but they beat them by two bars.  This is my first time at Schmidts for Bbq and wow it is mouth watering. The only thing I would point out it is pricy but worth it. Parking is easy and the location is at the corner of 71 and Bee Caves they also have mac and cheese, beans, potatoe salads, cole slaw, green beans, cream corn and baked potatoes. Awesome place to kick up your boots and relax with family and friends. What a way to go!

First, know that I've been to Smitty's when it was Kreuz. I mean like back to 1980. It was a semi-annual office retreat. I've stood by the pit in the cold of winter and the heat of summer. I almost go back to the point where the knives were chained to the table. So I know Smitty's.This ain't Smitty's. It's city-slicker BBQ. It's not bad, but it's a far cry from the real deal.For one thing, it's a little too sterile. Yes, I've appreciated the clean and modern restrooms. But it has no BBQ joint ambiance to it. Just rows and rows of tables past the ordering point.The BBQ lacks a distinctive smoke ring; that should've been visible on the turkey, at least. The creamy potato salad had far too much mustard, although I was very happy there were no hard potatoes, a pet peeve of mine. The beans are way too peppery.And, honestly, there were no Schmidts to be seen. Nope. Not a one when I visited.Is it bad food? Definitely not. They have a good price for plated BBQ lunch, and you'll need to take some of it home, which is much better than going home hangry from BBQ.Kudos to Schmidt's for the fine crushed ice and large go cups. That's most welcome in the blazing Texas summer heat.A-OK by a smidge. Or is it a Smitty's?

3-Star BBQ with a 5-Star price tag. It's ok. The brisket is ok. The sausage is ok. Nothing out of the ordinary. The jalapeño sausage is too tough for my taste. The brisket is moist, however, lacks the smoky taste I have acquired in Texas BBQ. I could only find sweet bbq sauce; which isn't my taste either. Is this the only sauce they have? And do they have different cuts of brisket because I wasn't able to figure that out either?
Big beautiful location, friendly staff and great tasting BBQ Chicken. I had the bread pudding and it was delicious . Visiting for a meeting and I'm so glad I found this place.

Good quality bbq with fast service. You order at the counter and walk away with your food. We had pulled pot, brisket, Mac and cheese, and jalapeño Mac and cheese. All were very tasty. The beans were pinto and had great flavor. There is sauce on the table. You refill your own drinks. There is plenty of parking in the attached lot. The meat is freshly smoked. There is plenty ty of indoor seating. They have a private room for parties. The banana pudding was made with fresh banana and topped with whipped cream. It was delicious.

I finally stopped here after passing a million times.  I was craving a chopped bbq.  My sandwich was really delicious.  Good quality. Probably one of the best I have had.  Came by a second time & had their sausage sandwich.  Also quite good.  A bit on the pricey side for just a sandwich.  Had wanted to get their lunch special, but it is only offered Monday through Friday.

After at least seven visits to Schmidt's, I am finally getting around to reviewing the place. I thought I already had. If I could give it 3.5 stars I would. The first couple of times we ate there the BBQ (ribs, brisket, sausage and turkey) were just fair. The next three times, it was amazing. We were shocked at how great it had become. Then the last couple of times it has just been okay again? Don't know if there have been different pitmasters or what? The reason we keep going is that there is never a line and we know we will get pretty good BBQ on a bad day, and great BBQ on a good day. We just hope we are there on a good day when we visit.Fyi: We have eaten here a couple of more times since my last review and it has been a 3.5 star everytime.
Bee Cave, TX 78738
Food is always good. Lunch special went from 10 dollars to 13 dollars which is a large jump. I wont be ordering the special anymore but only the sandwich.

I'm a bbq snob and this hit on all levels. The meat was seasoned to perfection and they didn't try to do to much. Just a good pepper and salt rub kissed by post oak smoke. These guys do BBQ the true Texas way and if you in the area this is a must try.

Having recently moved to Bee Cave from California I am still exploring the area and having never been to Schmidt's BBQ before even though it is close to my house I would drive to Rudy's in Lakeway.  I had been to Rudy's many times when I visited Austin in the past, along with County LIne, Franklins and Salt Lick.I decided to try Schmidt's because of the location and on the first visit I just got the BBQ Brisket Sandwich.  It was excellent.  The brisket was so moist but not overly fatty like what I've had at Rudy's where you sometimes sacrifice lean for dry.   On my second visit I got the one meat plate, brisket along with potato salad and mac and cheese.  Just like my prior visit the brisket was moist and flavorful.  I got some of the "ends" and all I can say is wow.  Whatever the rub is they put on their brisket, it is crazy good.  In addition, I really like their BBQ sauce.  Not too sweet and not too spicy.  Rudy's BBQ sauce is so spicy I normally bring my own (Marks BBQ sauce which you can buy at H-E-B).   Lastly, they have great sides.  Schmidt's potato salad is the best I've gotten anywhere.  Their mac and cheese was good along with the banna pudding.Great BBQ and everytime I've been there, the folks behind the counter have been extremely friendly.
Had the Pork Chop and it was very Tasty and cooked just right!!!! Overall, really good meal and top it off with Bread Pudding 5 stars for it.

We stopped in today on our way West. We expected, since it was near Austin, to really like the BBQ. The smoked chicken was super bland. The brisket was sliced way too thick, the fat NOT fully rendered, the bark: so so. The turkey was good. The bill was almost $30 with no sides and one drink. I would rate the prices $$$
Really good food!  The pork ribs are very good, and my favorite is the scalloped potatos!

So glad we recently tried Schmidt Family BBQ! I've been to many well known BBQ spots in and around Austin over the years and Schmidt's is the best that I've had. The brisket, ribs and sausage are spot on. This is real Texas BBQ, we won't go anywhere else.

This is an example of a local family taking barbecue to the top shelf. Large restaurant which can seat about 100 people with televisions to watch the news or sports. Meats are sold by the  1/2 pound. They have plate and sandwich options as well. We tried the pulled pork and bbq brisket and they were very good. Try the cream corn; you will be surprised at how good it is. Good atmosphere and good for kids. Located in hill country galleria at Bee Cave. You won't regret it.

Dropped in for a lunch pickup.  I ordered a plate with pork ribs, two sides and a drink.  I filled the cup with sweet tea.  Ordering here is cafeteria style where you shout out what type of meat you want and then select your sides.  They do have beef ribs but they are just a little over a pound of meat, so either you can handle it or bring a friend to share it.  The meat is very tasty here but some believe the brisket is the determining factor of a great BBQ place.  I decided to get pork ribs which had a lot of meat on them which filled me up. It was excellent.  The sides were macaroni and cheese and potato salad which were both good.  I took my food home but was plenty of seating available.  Among the BBQ places in Austin I rank this place on the upper scale.
Bee Cave, TX 78738

Confession: I'm picky when it comes to Q. This is passable BBQ. Good thing they serve beer. Way overpriced for the assembly line quality. Brisket was a bit bland. Sausage was dry. Ribs were decent. Sides...not very memorable. Desert was good! If you just have to have BBQ in Bee Caves it meets the intent, but I'll likely drive by next time.

I can say that I read some reviews on this place and it does not seem like a place we would eat at but we decided to try and glad we did!!! Food was great had great flavor especially the turkey!! Brisket was equally as tasty!! I would have for sure given it a 5 star but was a bit expensive for a family style BBQ place,, probably should have looked at the specials first!! Try it you won't be disappointed
Stopped here for lunch with the husband on our way to family reunion. The food is great!!!

This food is fantastic. By far my favorite BBQ place. The meat and the sides are all top notch. Prime rib special was fantastic. The turkey is smokey AND juicy. All the standards are fantastic. Amazing food great people. So glad it's near where I live but would totally travel to in order to get some food.

More BBQ.... After struggling hard core with the meat sweats from our lunch BBQ feast... SURE, WHY NOT?!My fiancé and I walked into this joint feeling as we were about to hurl, but we left feeling much better! Perhaps you cure the FATTY MEAT STOMACH ACHE with more meat? Well, we did... However this time I didn't try the brisket, but I was told it was far better than lunch's brisket, because the charred crust was far more perfect! The slaw was also better because there didn't really look like there was much dressing on it. Less is more!I got the turkey because I had chicken at lunch. It was good but as we all know, turkey can be pretty dry... And alas some bites of this turkey needed to be chased with water. Our table also ordered a 1/2 chicken (for the 4 year old) and the entire time at dinner, I was eyeing her plate because... Well, I HAD TO try the chicken to compare it to lunch, right? LUCKY FOR ME, she could only eat the drumstick so I was "stuck" with the rest! WOO WOO! The chicken.... Definitely made up for this meal. If I didn't try it, I definitely would have rated this place with far less stars, but the chicken was moist and flavorful however, it once again wasn't as good as the BBQ joint I frequent a lot in LA. Shocking, I know!What did the rest of the table think? Well my fiancé was pleased but the other gentleman we were with (who dare I say it, is more picky than my fiancé) said that the BBQ was mediocre. So yeah... There's that. Come to this place prepared to order at a counter and eat off a piece of wax paper on a tray. Don't expect to eat BBQ with class. As for how my stomach feels now? Well, that feels OK but I know for a fact that our meals were INSANELY SALTY because I've been craving water, I could drink an entire reservoir! Ladies: prepared to feel BLOATED the next day... I only warn ladies because I swear men don't experience water retention.

Always a pleasure. I had stopped by after work one day and I've never been disappointed since going. A very Smokey, peppered BBQ that'll make your glands water just from walking in! Clean establishment, friendly staff, and some dang good BBQ! Everything I've had there was good so far and I can't wait to go back!
The food is very good.   I have taken a few customers here for lunch.  Bring plenty of cash, its expensive for what you get.

Overall the food is good.  But its not better bbq than rudys, county line or smokey mo's.   And the price ridiculously high.   Customer and I had half a pound each brisket, w/ two pork ribs each, two sides and drinks and the bill came out like $44.   I had to do a double take on the bill.

I will allow that Schmidt Family Barbecue is better than Bill Miller, and that the sides are better than Pok-e-jo's sides, but the bizarre spice on the brisket and ribs is horrifying and the meat is often overly dry. I have come back multiple times since opening, and the consistency with which they overspice the rub is maddening. Clearly, it's intentional, and not just an accident in the kitchen. I've been here a couple times since my last update (late 2015), and things haven't gotten any better.Don't waste your time or money, it's terrible what horrors they're wreaking on innocent pigs and cows that only wanted to be delicious.
Bee Cave, TX 78738
Pork chop! That's the bomb! Bone sucking good pork chops, you got a try one! Y'all come back now here.

Just left. 2lbs of brisket and a sausage with my son and his friend.Brisket was drier than a cats ass.Brisket was drier than a popcorn fart.How can a place like this ruin brisket.They are either cutting off too much fat when they prep it or over smoking it or both.Paid over $50 bucks for the pleasure of eating what to me was dried out shoe leather.GAAAHHHHHHHH

Well I finally went and was very pleased. Here is my order:Bottle of Fanta Orange: $2.50Small Beans: $1.99- very tasty. Much veg in there as well. Not sugary.Small slaw: $1.99- It's the sweet type of slaw which I love. Not too "wet" either.Small Mac n Cheese: $1.99- Needed a little salt but good basic MnC.1 original (hot) half sausage link : $4.50- Beyond tasty good. I was blown away by this link. It literally melts in your mouth..360lb lean brisket: $5.60: I have eaten brisket everywhere and I give it a 7.75 out of 10. It was moist and very tasty. The complainers about the peppered edge I don't get. The BBQ sauce is different with a sweet sour thing going on. Total order was $20.28...that's what it costs.Definitely will return when that craving rears its ugly head. All in all I was very impressed. With the BBQ pit inside the restaurant your clothes will definitely not be the same; that is part of the deal I guess. I thought the brisket was better than County Line, different from Rudys, not quite Opies, better than the lick and the place in Lakeway by far.Well Done. The staff needs to smile more and not take the paying customer for granted. I don't need a red carpet but if I owned a business and my staff was not smiling and courteous and gracious I would make sure this was changed.Welcome to the neighborhood!
Great BBQ.  You can't go wrong with Kreuz sausage.  The only issue is it's a bit on the pricey side.

The brisket tacos they serve in the morning are outstanding. They use tortillas that are a corn/flour mix that have the taste and flavor of corn but the strength and consistency of flour. Add to that some excellent brisket and a some egg and cheese. Most places you get a lot of egg with meat added; here you get the meat with the egg and cheese added in. It seems like a small thing, but the brisket is the star of this show and I like that the taco has plenty. Order one and you'll be full. Order two and you won't need to eat the rest of the day.

A decent choice for BBQ on the West Side of Austin.  While generic in decor (the inside is modern but looks a bit sterile, like a cafeteria), the BBQ is excellent.  I've eaten a fair amount of BBQ if you check out my other reviews; and this is definitely a spot that is worthy of the Lockhart location. The shoulder clod is decent but unexceptional (to my tongue a slightly leaner version of the beef rib or brisket), and the best item on the menu are baby-back ribs, which are not slathered in sauce - and have a nice bite of either chili powder or cumin at the very end. The brisket has a good smoky flavor, and the lean is just as good as the fatty, a rarity in my experience.This place gets 3 stars on the 'CTJ Scale', as noted below.5 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing on after finishing a meal here.4 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary.3 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus' Dad.2 out of 5 stars: Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn't have my last supper here.1 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn't have my penultimate supper here, either.
brisket just doesn't taste good: not smoked all the way. Ribs were not good. Too expensive.
Not a big fan of this place.  I got the brisket and pulled pork. Brisket was dry and had  no flavor.  The BBQ sauce was  horrendously terrible. What I paid was not worth it.

The spareribs were good, but do yourself a favor and pony up for the pound instead of the half pound. The coleslaw was crisp & tart as complemented the table BBQ sauce that I used on the ribs. I always enjoy a local brew with my food and they had a few selections. Place is peanut safe for our son Jake to eat. Tried some of brisket off my son's plate and enjoyed the bark on the meat.
Round Rock, TX 78664

Liberty is STILL my go to for BBQ. It's a nice little spot in downtown RR. Parking out front and plenty more in the parking garage. Pro:The turkey is fantastic Mouth watering brisket Spicy BBQ sauce YASSSSBueno drink menuHave you tried the queso?! Con:They're always closed on monday when I crave them mostThey went through a weird spell during the pandemic but we all did. If you got pandemic take out and were on the fence, try again. The owner is really committed to his craft and I can see that he works hard to right the wrongs.

A solid soft opening with excellent service but most important: the barbecue. Just for starters, I'm from west Texas, born and raised here my whole life. I grew up on the greatness of Coopers and home smoked BBQ. So trust me, Liberty knows what the heck they are doing. Moist, flavor packed, succulent turkey. Almost sweet, almost spicy pork ribs. Booming with flavor that's an extremely pleasant surprise. But the treat, the dessert, the brisket. My goodness. All four adults at the table were silent for a minute with ecstasy written on our faces. Bravo, Liberty. Bravo. I 90% certain the pickles are homemade. As a pickle lover I enjoyed them. Just the right amount of pickle spice and cool cucumber background to complement but not over power the meats. The BBQ sauce is delicious. I can't put my finger on the spice notes but I certainly enjoyed it. This was just the soft opening tonight. If it's any indication of their long term service then Liberty is bound to become a powerhouse in downtown Round Rock. Get some quick!

When I first tried these guys I wasn't all that impressed. One main reason was that they weren't doing smoked chicken. A BBQ joint without the cock. Unheard of. During COVID year 2020 I did pick up at Rudy's quite often. Anyone will tell you that Rudy's is hit or miss. I got a bit tired of the miss part of my Rudy's experience and decided to come back and give Liberty a try again. Maybe they have cock now.  I wondered.Went in one afternoon and got the ribs along with two sides. I'm not a big fan of any of their sides but will say the cucumber salad is nice and refreshing. I got the pork ribs and was really impressed with them. Nice, tender, meaty and delicious. Couldn't wait to come back. I think that was on a weekday afternoon. There was still no cock on the menu, but I did notice they have daily specials that are written on the blackboard at the end of the bar.On my next visit it was a Saturday. I had finished a good workout and was in need of some good protein to feed my starving muscles. I was craving the "Q". I went back to Liberty.  I walked in and grabbed a seat near the end of the bar and low and behold the daily special was cock!!!  Halleluiah!!  1/2 chicken plate with two sides. Fuck yeah!  I'm all in.  That was some damn good smoked chicken. Nice smoky flavor and the meat was not overdone like at most places. It was tender and juicy. I keep going back for the chicken and ribs on a regular basis. I have made many trips as either dine in or to go and they remain consistent with the quality of the meats. I will keep coming back here for sure.   Before you visit you may want to call ahead and see what the daily special is. One day I went in and the special was chicken fried steak which turned out to be pretty damn tasty. I'm not a big fan of CFS, but theirs was pretty good.

Update: Much improved! We ordered carry out, since we don't get feel comfortable eating in the restaurants yet. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich and fries I wasn't able to get last time as well as the deviled eggs. My partner got the Cobb salad, with brisket instead of turkey, and a jalapeño cheese sausage link.Order was accurate, even with our change requests, service was friendly and the order was ready when I showed up. The food was all really good. The jalapeño cheese sausage was super juicy this time and the seasoning they use on the fries is great. Good flavor on the pork and brisket, although  a little fattier than we prefer.Liberty has made a comeback. We will return more frequently now that we see what they are capable of!Original review: My boyfriend and I wanted to check out the new restaurant in town tonight. I ordered the deviled eggs to start and they were amazing! They have scallions and bacon jam on top. I ate all five of them - I may pay for that later but it would be worth it. I asked the server which she would recommend between the pulled pork and brisket sandwich. She replied that she would make it easy for me because they were out of the pulled pork. Brisket it is! I also got a quarter pound of pork ribs just to try it out.My boyfriend ordered the jalapeño sausage sandwich. At that point we were told they were sold out of fries as well. Being a new restaurant, they haven't quite gotten a feel for how much food to order from their suppliers. We were offered another side instead of the fries. I ordered the potato salad but my boyfriend didn't really like any of the options for the sides and decided to just get a half pound of meat with bread instead.Kind of mixed feelings about the food. The brisket was super dry and honestly tasted more like pot roast than brisket. The jalapeño sausage was okay but a little dry as well. The pork ribs were definitely the best option from the meat that we had ordered. Decent potato salad but I wish it had celery in it (the server told me it had celery but it didn't). Awesome pickles. When the server asked how the food was, we gave her this feedback and she said that the brisket is chopped first thing in

My boyfriend and I wanted to check out the new restaurant in town tonight. I ordered the deviled eggs to start and they were amazing! They have scallions and bacon jam on top. I ate all five of them - I may pay for that later but it would be worth it. I asked the server which she would recommend between the pulled pork and brisket sandwich. She replied that she would make it easy for me because they were out of the pulled pork. Brisket it is! I also got a quarter pound of pork ribs just to try it out.My boyfriend ordered the jalapeño sausage sandwich. At that point we were told they were sold out of fries as well. Being a new restaurant, they haven't quite gotten a feel for how much food to order from their suppliers. We were offered another side instead of the fries. I ordered the potato salad but my boyfriend didn't really like any of the options for the sides and decided to just get a half pound of meat with bread instead.Kind of mixed feelings about the food. The brisket was super dry and honestly tasted more like pot roast than brisket. The jalapeño sausage was okay but a little dry as well. The pork ribs were definitely the best option from the meat that we had ordered. Decent potato salad but I wish it had celery in it (the server told me it had celery but it didn't). Awesome pickles. When the server asked how the food was, we gave her this feedback and she said that the brisket is chopped first thing in the morning so that may be why it is dry. Yup, that seems like a logical explanation although it surprises me that this would be the process at a place owned by a seasoned bbq restaurant owner.We may give this place one more shot to see if they work out the kinks. With so many great food options in Round Rock, Liberty BBQ will really need to step up their game in order to compete.

Central Texas is known for BBQ.  And when you're doing BBQ in this part of Texas, you have to approach perfection.  And Liberty BBQ does approach perfection.  There's just a couple of hiccups, but nothing that can't be perfected.First, Liberty is open into the evening.  That means you have another option for BBQ into the evening.  And at least on our Friday night excursion, Liberty wasn't out of anything.  That alone is praiseworthy.  The BBQ is also praiseworthy.  My brisket was cooked to perfection without being overwhelming.  The ribs are the best in town.  I'm not sure what the seasoning is -- but there's a sweet, spicy, almost southwestern flavor that's bordering on addictive.  Likewise, my dining companion couldn't stop eating the jalapeno cheddar sausage.  Both of us liked the fries which were also crispy and well seasoned.  There was similar praise for the cucumber salad which also had a slight punch to it -- as did the pickles.Now, here's the room for improvement.  First and foremost, since Liberty BBQ is both a sit-down restaurant and bar, the service can be a bit haphazard if there's a large party drinking nearby.  We had to track our server down to close out our check and pay.  Second, I'm not a fan of the mac & cheese, which was way too thick and where the spice didn't help the flavor.  Also, unlike almost any BBQ purveyor I've visited, there's no bread.  Or at least we didn't receive any with either of our orders. Finally, the sauce is a bit different as it's almost got a pulp-like texture and doesn't add much to the BBQ.  It's not bad and the great news is that the BBQ doesn't really need sauce.  Having said that though, I'm usually a fan of a thinner, spicier sauce.All in all, Liberty BBQ is excellent.  The few hiccups I've noted should not dissuade you from trying them out -- especially if you want BBQ for dinner -- and even more so if you want table service and a full bar.

I had heard so much about this place that I really wanted to go here.  We had tried several times but always hit it when it wasn't open.  So I was excited to catch it Saturday, and if I had to put it all in one word, that word is:underwhelming.I mean, service was great and it's a great location, which was really enjoyable.  That, and the amazing (did I say amazing?) amazing BBQ sauce saved this from being a two star review.But did the chef forget his salt shaker on Saturday?  Does he taste his food?Everything needed salt (except the brisket.  It was fine.).  The deviled eggs (big plus for the jam on those.  And they looked great).  The coleslaw (I hunted all over for some jalapeno in it and never found it).  The potato salad.For what we dropped on the bill, this should have been top notch.  But it wasn't.  So sorry Liberty.

Long over due on this review...If your caught up in all the hype of these amazing looking trays of BBQ you see everywhere then this is a must stop....The gang at Liberty was not only very welcoming, they put on quite a show with there offerings...There "special" menu rotates...from Meatloaf, Chicken Fried Steak, Steak Night, etc....but Tuesday is for Tacos...and that was the goal in mind when we went...And as usual, we just cant try one thing when we hit a BBQ joint...So we went big and they delivered....not gonna dive into details, there is a lot on that tray!!...but everything on that tray was very, very good....Chicken Fried steak is next on the list to try....Great Job Liberty!!!....See the photo for the full description of what is on the tray.
Overall excellent BBQ. Wings were delicious., pulled pork was a bit greasy and a lot was 86'd by the time we got there so go early. Friendly service.
Round Rock, TX 78664

Taco Tuesday and Liberty BBQ is open! They are normally closed on Tuesdays but the Taco requests won out. Nicely smoked seasoned brisket , cheese and seasoning wrapped in a corn tortilla with dipping sauce made for an outstanding lunch today. I also ordered a couple Ribeye Carne Guisada for the fun of it. This is a must try and you don't have to wait for a Tuesday to try it. What a treat.

As far as BBQ goes in Round Rock, there's not much to get excited about. This easily means Liberty is the best BBQ in town.Brisket was good and moist, and the ribs were not over cooked - so still moist while releasing from the bone (though not falling off - which is good). Beans has plenty of flavor, fries are well seasoned and crisp, and the Mac and cheese was really tasty (kind of a queso mac - not particularly kid friendly). There's room for improvement however - potato salad was bland, turkey was flavorless, and bbq sauce had a weird salsa texture (also kind of overly sweet). Additionally, there was no bread item with the meat plate -- which for bbq is odd (white bread, roll, cornbread, give me something here!). Overall, like I said, there's not much competition in town for good BBQ so this stands out, with a few tweaks could be top notch.

Trash fries. That's it. Yum. Get the trash fries. A pile of perfectly cooked fries covered in all kinds of goodness including cheese, bacon, brisket and the option of queso, bbq sauce, and ranch. Enjoyed a delicious lunch at Liberty BBQ today in Downtown Round Rock. Great location and the restaurant has a fun vibe with the historic building and classic Texas bbq fare. We loved all the appetizer options and the unique sandwiches- we ordered the custom 41 option on the BOB (a tribute to the late President Bush) and it was delicious. It was hard to choose for a sweet ending but I wanted to try the banana pudding and I'm glad I did- really smooth, perfect mix of banana, pudding and vanilla wafers. Liberty BBQ offers a Sunday brunch too that I would like to try soon.Go get yourself some classic Texas bbq and enjoy downtown Round Rock.

We ordered takeout from here for our first time eating at Liberty Barbecue and it was kind of a mixed bag. We ordered 1-meat platters for my teenage kids and a 2-meat platter for me. Everyone had the brisket and I decided to try the boudin as well. Sides were mac n cheese as well as beans. Let's break it down:The Bad-Ordered our meal online and went to pick it up at the appointed time. Food was not ready. In fact it took 30 minutes after I got there for the food to be ready. In fact shortly after I got there I was told they were bagging my order. It didn't come out for a good while longer and later I was told that they had run out of brisket and were having to cut a new brisket. I feel that slicing brisket at a barbecue place is something that should be able to be done with your eyes closed and not take 30 minutes to happen, but putting that aside I figured I would get nice hot food. -The food was Luke warm at best. I ended up throwing mine in the microwave once I got home (not a long enough trip to cool off that much) just to get it warmed up. -I felt like the portions in the meat platter were all over the place. There wasn't much brisket to speak of but there was a lot of the boudin and the sides. The Good-Once it was warmed up the brisket was actually quite tasty, honestly if I had had more it could have pulled another star out for this review. -The mac n cheese was fantastic, and the quantity was great. (though I could have eaten more without hesitating)-My oldest said that the beans were good too. -On seeing me waiting for my order, the general manager did come up to me and apologize for the wait and offered to make it up to me on a future visit. It was nice that he was proactive about it. The Okay-I thought the boudin was alright. I ordered the two meat platter so that I could have brisket, the staple of a TX bbq joint, and try something new. I haven't had a lot of boudin in the past (this is only the second time) so take this opinion with a grain of salt, but I definitely thought the Cajun place down the road had better boudin (which I guess kind of makes sense). Final thoughtsMost of the food at Liberty BBQ was pretty good. If I had come here on another night and not had timing/temperature issues with the food or if there weren't some challenges with the portion sizes of the brisket then this place could easily have gotten another star, maybe more. I'll check it out another time and report back what I find.

Great ribs! But I really enjoyed the Mac & Cheese! I'm not into yellow cheese and was so happy with this dish. Another favorite is the cucumber salad. At first I was thinking why do they have this but after my first bite I knew why. It complimented the Ribs.

This is my new favorite BBQ place. The jalepeno coleslaw is the best. They also have a sweet sauce on the ribs which is a new change of pace.You can sit easily and comfortably at either the bar, the tables, or the booths. The atmosphere is friendly and rustic. I really can't wait to go back!

I have read so many good reviews of Liberty Barbecue on Facebook my GF and I decided to try it.Before I give my review, There are two nights of the week that are special here:Wednesday: Smoked ribeye steak nightThursday: Chicken Fried Steak night.I haven't tried either yet, but I am going to soon.There are so many really good BBQ places in Williamson County it is hard to rate Liberty in the top 5. BBQ is so subjective to each person's individual taste...Unlike most other BBQ places, this is a sit-down, order off a menu kind of place. I prefer the kind of BBQ places where I can talk to the meat cutter as they are slicing my brisket. Less fat, more fat, more bark...etc.I ordered a two meat plate. 3oz of two types of meat they offer. I had their smoked turkey and beef brisket. Both tasted good, but the smoked turkey was a bit drier than I prefer and had less smokey taste. The brisket was cut from the fat end of the slab. I tend to like a bit leaner brisket. Having said all that both were good and tasty.Their sides and condiments were first class. Homemade pickles and pickled onions were a hit on my plate as was the jalapeno slaw. The potato salad was a bit plain. The service here was excellent, and the atmosphere nice. They have a nice selection of beer and dessert.The next time we come back will be for the smoked grilled ribeyes on Wednesday night. I am already salivating at the prospects!

Love the rustic, country decor and atmosphere. A nice addition to downtown Round Rock. The barbecue was good overall but not super outstanding. The brisket and sausage were tasty. However, the turkey and potato salad did not have much flavor or seasoning. Fries were delicious with plenty of tasty seasoning. The Mac n cheese is possibly made with queso which is something to keep in mind if you're ordering for kids and are expecting a more traditional Mac n cheese.

This place was very cite and I actually liked it. But one thing the Mac n cheese is really NOT that good and potato salad is a thumbs now but the trash fries was a MUST! I'll get that every time. You'll need to request more bbq sauce but I give this place a 7/10
Round Rock, TX 78664

Food here is deeeeelish! The BBQ restaurant style is quite different than the normal BBQ restaurants in Austin. We were quite confused when we were escorted to a table and a waiter came up to us! All is well, the wait depends on your group and the time you get there. We were a party of 2 on a Friday night around 7 and were seated in about 10 minutes. They have you order appetizers first, then your meal while you eat your appetizers! I actually quite enjoyed this experience. The food was amazing and I quite liked the pickle fries!(I'm usually a pickle fries hater) we had leftovers and they were still delicious 2 days after! Great date spot in Downtown Round Rock

Great BBQ, terrible service. Best BBQ in RR but really poorly run, disorganized place. After sitting 10 mim finally flagged someone down for service. Drinks took another 10 minutes. And they were about 40% full. Won't come back except maybe to pick up.

Great food nestled in the quaint old town.  Loved that we were nestled away from everyone.  Appreciated the tall bar height tables.  Service was attentive and friendly.  The food was yummy.  Pickle fries a little salty, but otherwise everything was filling.  Trash fries were a crazy huge portion.  The lemonade was delicious as well

Liberty barbecue has never failed me! Everything is uniquely amazing. It's a bit pricey but it's well worth it. The trash fries are to die for and the brisket is top notch. Would recommend this place to anyone browsing downtown round rock.

We dined in for my birthday last night because I wanted a good Chicken Fried Steak for my bday "cheat" meal. Here's what we ordered:Queso with brisket added Trash fries3 adult beveragesSome moist brisket by the lb. chicken fried steak meal with mash and Mac & cheese2lb beef rib special with potato salad and MacHere's my take on the experience. It was pretty solid all around with a few exceptions. The queso came out room temp but we were starving and gobbled it up. The fries on the trash fries were amazingly crispy and I loved them. The big rib was huge and decadent. It was $32 and fed 2 people. The brisket had an herb (oregano maybe?) that surprised me. I don't like whatever the herb was but it was not overpowering so it was ok.  The meat in my chicken fried steak was excellent. Not chewy like some can be but the overall flavor was ok. Not bad but not amazing either. I was a bit disappointed because I hadn't eaten chicken fried steak for almost 2 years and had been waiting on my cheat meal. The potatoes and Mac were great and the garlic toast on the side was good.  No birthday dessert was offered but we were not hungry enough to order anything more. I would return to Liberty to try other menu items and am glad they're in our neighborhood.

We have been to Liberty BBQ probably 5 or 6 times and love the food.   We have brought several groups of friends to try it out and have been recommending the place.  The gentleman that is the bar manager is a good guy, and most of the staff are really nice.  However. there is a blonde haired woman employee behind the bar (I think maybe a manager) who has been so rude and condescending  to us on a few occasions - that we will not be back and we will no longer recommend this place to our friends.  We eat out a lot, we treat hospitality staff with respect and tip them well, and I wouldn't normally complain about an employee online - we would talk to a manager - but I think that might be her.   This most recent visit , we brought a friend to try out the food and the woman was so rude to us that we made this decision.   I have no idea if we did something to her the first time we encountered her, but I don't think that's the case.   Not sure if she singled us out or if she is like this with everyone.  I won't bore you with the details, but I'll say that she has no business being in the service industry.  I know it is corona , but she is probably worse than having a vacancy.If you happen to go and she isn't around, the brisket Reuben is out of this world , and their CFS is my favorite in the area (Thursday night special?).  Additionally, the deviled eggs are outstanding, as well as the loaded Fries.   The trash can punch is great, and finally the funnel cake fries with banana pudding (together) are incredible.  Unfortunately, we aren't spending our money there any longer on the off chance we have to encounter this person.  I'm not sure if she hates her job, but she needs to reconsider her career choices because she doesn't have the mindset for the hospitality / service industry.   I don't wish her Ill will, but if I owned the place I would want to know.

We decided to come to Liberty Barbecue since we love barbecue! We had server Crystal and her team and they where amazing. She gave us great recommendations on tasty meats and desert. Crystal laughed with us and made jokes which made us feel great. This establishment did great at "social distancing". Will be back for more beers and hooks. One ask - please please serve slow churned vanilla ice cream with your delicious deserts.

This is a bar that serves BBQ, but not a BBQ place that happens to have a bar.  BBQ was below average especially given the quality of Central Texas BBQ places.  I would only recommend if you were looking for a place is downtown Round Rock that has a great selection of quality Bourbon: Blanton's, Weller, Buffalo Trace, etc.  the food was just not that great.
Liberty serves delicious meals through out the wk and an awesome brunch on Sunday's !! #getyousome
Round Rock, TX 78664

My fiance and I went to Liberty for steak night. The steak tasted really good and was pretty big but a little overly fatty. We also got the deviled eggs, a 1/2 lb of pulled pork, and two beers ($4.50 during happy hour for craft is a good deal!). Eggs were tasty but the meat wasnt as near as good as our last visit. This seems to be the case overall as meat seems to be hit or miss depending when you go. I'd give it 5 stars if they fix the consistency.

Liberty BBQ is an offshoot of Brotherton Black Iron BBQ in Pflugerville which I have patronized since it opened. Marv is the creative force behind the menu at Liberty BBQ as he was at Brotherton Black Iron BBQ restaurant and he makes sure every order is perfect before it leaves the kitchen.  I arrived for lunch with my wife and we were seated at a window seat overlooking Main Street. The restaurant has a perfect vibe for Texas BBQ. Barb had the grilled cheese brisket sandwich which is her favorite at BBBBQ and I had the pulled pork sandwich served on a brioche bun with the absolute best fries in town!   A great addition to downtown Round Rock!
Fun Barbecue restaurant in downtown Round Rock.  Great service.  The decor is all Texas and cute.  The food is delicious!  I had a grilled cheese with barbecue in it that was incredible!

This was a second choice not because first choice an hour behind us had a line around the block. This Liberty BBQ was Fantastic! They don't serve burnt ends but tried to accommodate as best as they could. No smoked chicken but the turkey was fabulous. The two frozen margaritas to go hit the spot. Thank you Liberty Bbq!

Headed to Port Aransas, TX from Fayetteville, AR... went a bit out of our way because BBQ sounded real good! We were a touch disappointed when we got there on a Saturday afternoon (about 1pm) and the whole joint was closed for a private party. There was a sign saying they were still taking carry out orders... I gave them 4 stars because it was good BBQ... bet it would have been fun to have the whole experience... maybe next time ;)

They made this sandwich to commemorate George W and it tasted great. They have hospitality down to an art, we had a waitress, two beverage guys, and a utility waiting staff rotating around to make sure we were properly served. Tip: Get the Mac and cheese.

They made a sandwich to commemorate George W and it tasted great. They have hospitality down to an art, we had a waitress, two beverage guys, and a utility waiting staff rotating around to make sure we were properly served. Tip: get the Mac n cheese as your side.
Super attentive & friendly service. The food was delicious  I'm only saddened that it took us so long to try this place. We're definitely returning for their Sunday brunch, as it sounds amazing

Their "41" burger was a great way to put a new take on barbeque.  Mix of brisket and pulled pork with queso on top in a brioche bun.  Flavor was amazing and very filling.  I was unique for my first time trying that mix and was pleasantly surprised.  Bbq flavor was ok compared to over places so the 3 star but great service, great vibe, and wonderful place for lunch.
Round Rock, TX 78664

This is a go-to for my family. They have absolutely delicious food. And honestly, I am not a huge BBQ fan. But Liberty changed me. Now I want it 24/7. Also, if you go and DON'T get the Trash Fries, you did it wrong.

Let me preface this review with one thing - the 4 th star was because the staff was so nice and awesome, and they were open for sit down when a lot of places are just defaulting to carry out or horrible 3 rd party  delivery. The rest of this discussion is about 3 star bbq.First, I was looking for a BBQ JOINT that wasnt salt lick as I passed through RR. They excel in that dept. However i use BBQ slightly tongue in cheek because this place is really a bar that wasnt a 51% business, and didnt get forcibly closed by our Governor at the moment. While Im happy they were able to stay open, if youre looking for a true TX bbq experience (wait in line and see the pits, the slicer taking cut orders, etc) this is not where you want to go. This is a bar that serves a decent plate of food. It smells like a bar, feels like a bar and looks like a bar - and you know what mama always said about looking, walking and quacking like a duck...The food was decent - but its bar food. MAYBE Chilis level, because you dont have to drink here and you can sit in a booth. In fact its a lot like a chilis. You may give it 5 stars for that. Nothing wrong there, but thats not what I picture when a place has BBQ in its name. I imagine that pre covid, this was a popular, decent hang out that you could socialize in over drinks AND grab a decent dinner without waiting in a Austin BBQ line for hours. I would definitely come back again after this is over for just that kind of experience - but not when I wanted  a Tx BBQ experience.

Ok, where do I start? $17 for 3 pieces of cold, dry brisket, and 1 sausage? The sides were bigger portions than the entree. I really hate to leave a negative review for anyone during these times but come on. They forgot our drinks and blamed it on their system even though we paid for them and they were listed on our receipt. Lastly I would to say that I'm not a fan of mask wearing, however it is what it is and I have to wear one. The person preparing the food had no mask and the guy up front wasn't wearing his mask it on his face.

We were walking down Main Street and it looked fun from the outside so we grabbed brunch on a Sunday! From their decor and customer service was impeccable! I had the burnt ends and waffles, the waffles was the best I've ever eaten! Their brisket and Mac & cheese was so good! I highly recommend this barbecue restaurant, definitely 5 stars!!

Visited the restaurant Thursday evening so my daughter could get their chicken fried steak- it was fabulous.  My pulled pork sandwich was delicious and will order again.  The staff was so attentive and the owner was so sweet to my special needs daughter.  Came over and gave her a hat, visited with us and told us thanks for coming there. She loved it and I was so appreciative of the kindness of a stranger.  Will return.  Also the beer recommendation was spot on.

Ribs are good, but everything else is just a step above Rudy's. Maybe due to me ordering curbside, but the brisket was a little dry and the jalapeño-cheese-sausage didn't have any snap on the casing. The sauce may throw people off by its texture (it looks like salsa), but it is tasty and plays well it's the spices used on the meat. The Mac and Cheese is. . . interesting. It's the quest they use for chips and quest with elbow macaroni thrown in. It's actually really good queso, but I wouldn't order the Mac again.

Beef brisket blew me away. Just enough char satisfy. 2 sides drunken naked beans yummy and mac and cheese light and airy.Hubby got the happy hour special, pulled pork sandwich with cole slaw and a side of fries. I dont like fried, but these were fresh and crispy couldn't resist. What a great mealHubby loving his IPA nice and hoppy! Stash IPA with a sharp top

You had me at brisket! That is where my review of a BBQ joint always begins and Liberty Barbecue did not disappoint. It was extremely moist and had a nice bark. I got the two meat plate and my second meat was the jalapeño sausage, which was also excellent - plump and juicy. For my sides, I opted for the jalapeño coleslaw and Mac and cheese. The coleslaw was good, the Mac and cheese was great - thick and creamy. Good to know we have another solid BBQ option in the Round Rock area. Already looking forward to my next visit to try some of the other menu items.

We stopped in because the apple pie sausage just sounded amazing. I got a sandwich also for dinner and was blown away. The brisket was moist and tender just enough salt and pepper rub and perfectly smoked. The sauce on the side was a nice flavorful blend and fries were seasoned and crunchy.  If your in Round Rock, TX go and try it. You won't regret it.

I ordered via Grubhub. The order was prepared in a timely manner. I picked it up from the window. The employee had on a mask. They also had signs saying that customers are required to wear masks as well. I got the loaded baked potato (w/o cheese, but it comes with cheese). I chose brisket as my meat. It was good. Not my grandpas bbq but it tastes good so far.
Excellent brisket and jalapeño sausage is amazing! Sides are homemade and wonderful. Definitely worth a stop by if you haven't been before or in a while!

I had a massive coupon for UberEats and found Donn's on the platform because I was craving bbq sides including a loaded baked potato. So, I ordered two huge baked potatoes, a quart of mac and cheese and a quart of creamed corn. Probably not the healthiest meal (s) but I make my own healthy food and buy treats. It was delivered quickly, while it was still hot. The corn was actually almost too hot! I give it four stars because I had low expectations and it met them just fine.  It satisfied my baked potato craving and I'm a happy girl! The mac and cheese tastes like cafeteria mac and cheese, but sometimes I like it that way. The creamed corn was sweet and rich and soupy. The baked potatoes were huge, and hard to mess up, but could have used more toppings. This much food will last me for days, and was worth the deal from Uber, but I wouldn't have felt like I got my money's worth in quality if I paid for it. For the same amount of money, you could get slightly better food from bbq chains.I asked for no silverware and minimal packaging but they still wasted a bunch of paper and plastic by sending utensils, napkins, and wrapping the containers in plastic before placing them in bags.It's not too likely I'll be back for more, because there's better bbq in town, and I should just make my own baked potatoes, but if I find myself without potatoes in my kitchen I might come by for a baked potato again.
Bill Millers food taste and quality- Just swap in his cousin Donn's name in place of Bill's name on the sign. The staff also have less customer service skills w/a lack of politeness.

Ordered from doordash tonight, the 2 meat 2 sides. The brisket is fall apart tender. The chopped beef is tasty. Fried okra and borracho beans full of flavor. Comes with a generous side of bbq sauce that is spicy and good. I ordered extra bread, so this meal will last me tomorrow for lunch. So yummy, and filled my craving for bbq.

I stopped in here for dinner one evening after checking into my hotel by the Airport. I found this place on Yelp - and it sounded promising.I ordered a three meat combo - which comes with your choice of two sides. I selected Brisket, Beef Rib, and Jalapeño sausage, plus green beans and mashed potatoes with gravy, plus a bottle of water.The food came up in short order I sat down to eat - the BBQ was solid, but not mind blowingly outstanding - which is what I am expecting now when I visit Austin.The brisket was a bit on the dry side. The Beef Rib was tasty, but it was also a bit dry, you could tell it had been sitting for a while after cooking. The Jalapeño sausage and Green Beans were really good. In fact, the Green Beans were outstanding! I needed some extra gravy for the mashed potatoes, and they cheerfully doled out an extra side at no charge.The inside of the joint looks like a converted diner. Service was good.#DonnsBBQandCatering

Menudo is a poor people's food. $9.99 for a cup of soup which had pieces of tripe which are way too big. You could at least cut it smaller..and clean it better!! The tripe was inedible.Also...we had to order again because the Door Dasher delivered to the wrong house. If you would just write the house # on the bag, this wouldn't happen. And if it did, at least the folks who got the free food would at least know to whom it belonged & could take it to them. We even called when we reordered and asked you to put our house # on the bag. You did not. We will not order from you again for fear of another wrong delivery - knowing that you refuse to simply put the house # on the bag. Too bad, because your BBQ & breakfast tacos are good (hence 3 stars). This was our third & final order.

I ordered the 2 meat plate with beef ribs and brisket. Both were cooked perfectly. Moist and perfectly smoked. The potato salad was exactly how my grandma Lynn makes it and it was great. The peach cobbler and lemon meringue pie were also very on point. Thnks Donn's
You can make better brisket in your microwave. Every side, Mac and cheese, green beans, mashed potatoes was below avg. and a nice soggy falling apart pack of pickles to cleanse your palate.

Decided to try some other restaurants outside my usual delivery options, so Donn's BBQ was up.If the brisket I got wasn't lean, I dread how dry their lean is.  The sausage is good, but I would have preferred to be able to order by the link, not the pound.  The chicken was good, but chopped in a strange way; why chop a half of of a chicken into four pieces? what that all from the same chicken?Few Austin 'cue joints have notable sides, and Donn's isn't one of them.  The sauce had to be purchased by the pint, and did nothing for any of the meats.  The beans?  I've had better out of a can. The potato salad? Mashed with mayo and mustard and relish. The fried okra  was okay. The peach cobbler? A whole lot of floury-tasting topping that appeared just a few seconds short of burnt, and very little peach. A "small" had about five bites of peaches that had to be fished out of a whole lot of mashed topping. We'd also ordered a catfish plate; the catfish wasn't cooked through. it was still very translucent in the middle, a little pinkish, and the strips were narrow. The crust was thick.  That ended up getting tossed.  Rudy's is better. I used Rudy's as my Minimally Viable 'Cue (MVC), as it's not the best, but it's OK.  Donn's didn't meet that standard.

We've ordered their food via Uber Eats several times recently.  Their BBQ is the best!!  Servings are generous, the sides are great - and terrific desserts.  Do yourself a favor and order from Donn's!!
Came here 3 times, and everytime, the service has been bad.. The food is just not worth the type of service.

This place has the driest meat ever! Have been on two separate occasions. First time same thing, but figured I'd give it another chance and maybe it just wasn't that great on the particular day. First time I went also, one of the ladies were pretty rude. I went to the first window to pick up an order I placed over the phone, told me to pick up at the second window rudely then just closed the window in my face (was my first time going and just didn't know) and waited about 10 minutes at the second window just for someone to speak to me, in which the guy still was rude. Don't know how they have trash food and trash service, and they didn't even look busy, just sitting around, and continuously staring at me through the window like they didn't know what to do. While my food also sat right next to them. Should have never went back.
I got a chopped beef sandwich and it was ok. My husband got sliced beef and he said it was Great.

I ordered the chicken-fried steak, and was very disappointed to find one of those pre-formed, frozen, institutional "chicken fried steak" patties. That's just blasphemy in Texas. The cream gravy wasn't bad, but it was clearly from a powdered mix, not fresh-made (of course, since they're not making their own CFS, I wouldn't expect real gravy). And the mac & cheese wasn't a hit, either -- premade, slightly artificial-tasting cheese sauce, definitely not from scratch. Just a disappointing experience overall. If they take these kinds of shortcuts, I have to wonder how good their BBQ would possibly be.

We ordered via Grubhub and when we came here for pickup we were met with hostility from the employee again. I asked where I would pickup from Grubhub and she said "Second window" and slammed the window shut. I went to the second window and the woman was a little nicer. After being treated like an annoyance by 2 locations' employees in one night, I'll not be back to Donn's.

I ordered the 2 meat combo on uberEats. Overall it was good! It hit the spot since I was supposed to go out to eat bbq but had to stay in instead. I got the brisket and chopped chicken. The photo shows all I received. The meat portions were hearty, the mashed potatoes were a let down. They tasted watered down and the gravy from a packet. The borracho beans were probably pretty good since my toddler ate the whole side! I asked for an extra plate, and utensil set and those were delivered as well. Overall, I would order again if I was ever in the area.

If I could give it 0 stars I would. When we walked in we noticed the lack of people in the restaurant and overall atmosphere did not reflect a BBQ place.The menu was large but ultimately we just got bbq as that was what we were in the mood for. We ordered brisket, ribs, baked potato, sausage and chicken and it was all horrible and dry with no seasoning. The sides had no flavor and were watered down. We noticed that there was no smoke coming from an alleged BBQ place which made us almost walk away but, we were starving and decided to stay. The only pleasant experience we had with this place was the drinks. Do yourself a favor and take the other reviews with a grain of salt. I am convinced that the employees and staff wrote the only good reviews of this. This place does not represent real BBQ and is simply meat that had been boiled and not fresh at all. Stay away.
DELICIOUS. The bbQ is amazing and the cream corn is delicious. BUT THE REAL WINNER IS THE MENUDO!!! I never thought I would buy bad ass menudo from a dude name Donn!!! #DonMenudo

It was good but not great bbq. I've heard they used to be very good and a family member suggested we go there whilst visiting Austin.Simply put, they have a very good selection but everything, meat, we had was dry and not that flavorful.Sorry to say we won't be going back there again. Too many other better option for Texas bbq then here.
