While the restaurant was small the tastes were bold and my wife and I really had a great time. We will visit again and I wish we lived closer. Might have to see if we can make up a reason to be in the area again soon.

We think a delicious meal is a great excuse to visit again, Chris! I really appreciate you and your wife stopping by and enjoying some delicious barbecue and sides with us -- thanks so much for your kind words! We can't wait to see you back to try out some of our other menu options.Best,Al Shankle, Owner

I ate here once, summer 2020. Workers very pleasant. However, my first bite, and I got a mouthful of bitter chemicals, immediately got sick, ran for the trash can. I don't think the food was spoiled but there was some weird stuff in it. Obviously, I'll never go back, that's just my take on it.

This is my new go to spot after today. Ordered the family meal #1 with brisket, jalapeño sausage, beans, and green beans. Everything was fantastic. Brisket was moist with great flavor, sausage was very clean mixed with just the right amount of fat, I'm not a sides guy when ordering bbq but both the sides were excellent and I would definitely get them again. Don't forget the pecan pie!
Food is tender and juicy but they use way too much lighter fluid for me. Portions are small.

COVID review. Small operation but the smoke filled the air inside. I had the brisket plate and the red smoke ring was at 1/4 inch the way it's supposed to be. I received a decent portion and they even left me an extra side though I'm unsure if it was on purpose. Brisket was tender when there was enough fat but a bit dry when there wasn't. I suspect that the brisket was not evenly marbled. Also one misstep was not slicing against the grain.  I had long 2" strips that I had to shred myself and douse with sauce. The sauce was zesty with vinegar and worth asking for more but I didn't need it.

I really really wanted to like this place because of the reviews, but I can't. I really should rate this place lower than a 3, but I can't, because I feel really bad, since it's a local small business.I should have seen the warning signs in the beginning, but I gave them the benefit of the doubt.When I went, they were microwaving their meats.When I ordered a potato, they looked in a bin with a bag of raw potatoes. They said they didn't have any potatoes. Whew...I am glad, because I don't think they should serve a microwaved potato. We all should know a baked tater should take about an hour in the oven.The food overall wasn't too bad, but it's not high on the list of places I would rush back to.The sides were a disappointment. The cole slaw was chopped differently and also tasted differently. It grew on me after each bite, but it wasn't something I would get again.The Mac n cheese looked really dry. The potato salad wasn't bad.Ribs were ok, not terrible. Brisket was ok and really lacked the smoke ring. Pulled pork was dry. Bbq sauce wasn't bad. My son said "a little goes a long way". I would rate that the bbq sauce was the best part of the meal, followed by the ribs and potato salad tying, then brisket. The rest was meh.Serving size was pretty good. Got 3 slices of brisket and like a fist size scoop of pulled pork. 1lb of ribs was 4 ribs.I hope it was just a bad night and normally their food is fresher. Maybe their lunch crowd gets non-microwaved food. I hope at least.Maybe I will sneak away to try it during lunch instead of dinner.
Extremely friendly staff, very helpful. BBQ and sides were excellent- don't pass on the Mac and cheese, it's especially great.

We tried Hello Sweetie for the first time tonite. We got the family pack (#1). LOVED the brisket! So tender! Jalapeno Sausage was good. Mac n cheese was ok. I prefer it a little creamier, but the kids liked it well enough, so it's all good. Corn was good, but wish we'd gotten the coleslaw after reading a few other reviews. Tried both sauces (spicy and regular) enjoyed both, but didn't have a need to use much sauce.I'm sure we'll be back! Next time we'll probably call in our order ahead and come pick it up. There were a few orders before ours, so there was a little bit of a wait. Not super long, but the kids thought it was an eternity since we wouldn't let them play on our phones. Lol!
Georgetown, TX 78626

On a trip to Georgetown to get my drivers license after moving to Texas. Came across this place on the way home. This place is definitely a hidden jewel, but search it out. This guy knows his stuff. I ordered the Brisket sandwich combo. It was loaded with tender, juicy meat. The flavor was absolutely amazing. Tender, juicy and great flavor. My wife ordered the Brisket plate. Looked like a full pound of meat. We always judge a BBQ restaurant not just by the meat but also by its sides. We had green beans, Mac and cheese and potato salad. They were just as good as Grandma use to make. I can't wait to go back and try their ribs.  The location is kind of tricky to find, but it's clean, the staff is very friendly and the service is great. On some meals you get a fresh home made cookie with your meal.As folks dined and left I noticed each one had a positive comment to make about their meal. So all I can say is give it a try. Lots of BBQ joints in Georgetown. I like this one better than "Smoky Moes"!You be the judge.

It's an honor to hear Grandma would approve of our cooking, Michael -- thanks so much for this excellent, thoughtful review! We put a lot of heart into our barbecue and homemade sides, and it's terrific to hear that effort stands out to you. We'd love to welcome you back again whenever you're in the area!Best,Al Shankle, Owner

Da bomb. The smokiness and the flavors mixed with tender fall apart brisket wow. Lives the coke slaw. Loved the beans. Sausage was awesome. Two nice gentlemen working it. Keep supporting these guys. Want to try the potato salad and corn next time. Both military guys working the place. Plus out there working now in the craziness. Go there for amazing barbecue.

Really good brisket. Mac and cheese is decent. Sweet potatoes had a nice flavor, a bit watery though. Hubby says his pulled pork was great but the sausage wasn't good at all. Overall friendly environment. BBQ sauce was tasty, will return soon I have to try the turkey

Really good brisket. Mac and cheese is decent. Sweet potatoes had a nice flavor, a bit watery though. Hubby says his pulled pork was great but the sausage wasn't good at all. Overall friendly environment. BBQ sauce was tasty, will return soon I have to try the turkey leg.
I can't recommend this place.  The food was just so so.

Daryle, we wish we knew more about why you felt this way. We work hard to make quality food, but it sounds like we might not be quite what you're looking for. We appreciate the feedback and wish you the best moving forward.Sincerely,Al Shankle, Owner

Tried this spot on a whim, I'm born and raised in Texas and the brisket here had no smoke smell at all and had more fat than I'm used to but the meat itself was fairly dry. I tried the bbq sauce too and even that tasted mediocre in my opinion.

We have just ordered the family pack. Pound of brisket and half pound of sausage. Coleslaw and potato salad. And of course,  had to order 2 ribs on the side. Everything was great. On top of that, their bbq sauce is legit... Happy to find this place
Georgetown, TX 78626

It took Yelpers and a GPS to find this place, but my taste buds will easily lead me back.  Here's what Hello Sweetie is not:  It is not large enough to seat even a small crowd,  It is not fancy,  It is not for people who dislike smoky, flavorful food.  If you're still with me, listen to your Yelp buddies, turn on the GPS and GET THERE!Hello Sweetie is a tiny, humble place that serves up big flavors at a good price.  The brisket is a great mix of juicy, smoked meat with a wonderful bark that left such a wonderful flavor in my mouth it gave me goosebumps!  The jalapeno sausage is so good I set some aside to enjoy later with a cheese plate as a snack.  I'm a potato salad snob (or finicky with my potato salad depending upon on how you look at it).  This potato salad is in my top 3 all-time.  Great texture, properly seasoned with a zesty kick (dill?).  You can see the rendered meat in the dark, baked beans which some how straddle a line between Boston beans and Texas BBQ beans -- and it is GOOD!

This WAS my favorite place for BBQ and I'm from Taylor (home of some of the voted BEST BBQ) and would drive for this.  However the attitude of the owner the other afternoon will have me never going there again.  I've had bariatric surgery and have ALWAYS ordered the child's plate (almost $8) and I've never had an issue.  However he gave me complete attitude about it.  My oldest son, who ordered the biggest plate, was even taken back by the owner.  I easily spend $30 for 2 people here and close to $50 when my other son joins.  I even made sure to let everyone know how incredible it was whenever the subject of BBQ came up.  Never again!  To many other awesome places to go to in our great state.

We want our customers to feel welcome to order their favorite meals, Angela, and we're sorry if that's not the impression you got on your last visit. From our food to our service, we hope to have another chance to show you that we're the same BBQ place you have always known and loved.Sincerely,Al Shankle, Owner

My husband and I decided to try out somewhere new for BBQ today, 06/04/20. We EACH ordered a 2 meat plate. We get home and open the trays to find 2 little Single Ribs in mine and his had 1 Single Rib and 5 bite size squares of Brisket. I've never ordered a rib plate before and been given 1 Single Rib. Not to mention we were missing our Bread, Onions and BBQ Sauce.  So for 29.00 and some change (plus the tip my husband gave the lady) , we got 3 Single Ribs and 5 Bite Size pieces of Brisket. We won't be going back to Hello Sweetie BBQ in Georgetown, Tx!  I gave the 2 stars only because the BBQ actually tasted great. Sides were not great.

Ordered food to be picked up. Hadn't had BBQ in a while so was looking forward to it.Ordered the pulled pork. It was overly sauced. It may have been good had they used half that amount OR none at all & offered the sauce on the side. Had potato salad which wasn't that good either.Overall, I don't recommend and will definitely not be a returning customer.

We always want your order to be just how you like it, so I'm disappointed to hear our pulled pork and homemade potato salad weren't quite what you were hoping for. We like to think there's something for everyone to love on our menu -- I hope you'll reconsider giving us another try.Best,Al Shankle, Owner

First time we have tried Hello Sweetie and we will definitely be back for more.  We tried the ribs and brisket plates with the mac & cheese, red beans & rice, collard greens and fried cabbage.  The ribs were cooked perfectly, as the meat pulled easily off the bone but still had a nice chew.  The Brisket was super tender but still had texture.  The smoke flavor was just right right.  You could taste it but it didn't overpower the flavor the meat, and the sauce was a perfect complement to the smoke.  All the sides were great.  The cabbage and collard greens had great, balanced flavor. The mac & cheese had a nice subtle kick and the red beans and rice had a savory smoke flavor.  To top it off, the staff were very friendly and accommodating.  Due to Covid and the small size of the indoor dining, we had to eat on the patio but it was well worth it.

All of the food here is absolutely stellar!!! The brisket, ribs, and pulled pork are so very delicious, but it's the sides that are the real show stoppers! Their potato salad, coleslaw, and beans may appear a little different than what you're used to at first glance, and upon the first bite you may say, "Hmmm, that's not what I expected... but I think I like it." But with the second bite, you'll know you do and will be HOOKED!!! I could eat their sides until I hurt myself, lol!! My family had the same first impressions as I did, and it is hands down our favorite BBQ around. They make some good iced tea too (for those who are particular about it, like me.) AND I have to say that the people who work there are super nice, but for some reason, they always call me "sweetie". *Blush* LOLOLOL!!!! Seriously, you won't regret giving this wonderful little place a try. Enjoy!

Our sides are second to none, Lyn, and we're so glad to hear that you and your family loved them! Reading a review like this one really made our day, and we're grateful for the support. We're looking forward to giving you another stellar experience, sweetie!Until next time,Al Shankle, Owner

I was pleasantly surprised about this place. Overall it was actually good. I was so uncertain because of the location. It's across the street from Terry Blacks, and I was going there until I saw the ridiculous long line. While I didn't care for the side dishes, the meat was pretty good. My only critique is there slow service. They had food sitting for several minutes and the waitresses kept walking past it doing other things. They also were a bit unprofessional with some of the conversations they were having behind the counter. All in all, I'd recommend the food. I would need to have a second visit to confirm if they are consistent though.

Appreciate the team at Green Mesquite being so friendly and accommodating to a group that joined us from out of town! They're friendly, currently open indoors and outdoors, and taking social distancing seriously!Have always enjoyed the food, and our family was very pleased with both the BBQ and sides. The 2, 3, or 4 meat plates are under $15, and they each come with 2 sides, onions, and pickles. I typically get the brisket, sausage, and double fried okra (photo attached).Today- I learned that their cooking has been around since the 1950s, even though this building has been around since 1988. They've jumped around a few locations, but it's definitely an Austin original! Look forward to visiting again soon!

Very delicious BBQ. Ordered online for delivery. Very impressed. Ordered brisket, green beans, and mac and cheese. Everything was delicious . The price of the meal was reasonable.  If you are in the mood for BBQ, this place is worth checking out.

Family was coming to turn and the first BBQ place they selected had a long wait so they decided on Green Mesquite. We got a nice spot outside. I ordered the one meat plate...Turkey, fried okra, and salad. The Turkey was okay, the okra was yum and the salad was lackluster. It was just lettuce and two half slices of tomato. My brother and nephew's Mac and Cheese had a scorched taste to it and was completely inedible. He told the waitress that and to bring fries for my nephew instead and not to worry about him and she didn't. She could have made it right by bringing my brother another side. The pork ribs my family ordered were "okay" according to them. I tried two  and they were small with hardly any meat on them. The taste was fine. Just nothing impressive. My bf ordered the two meat plate with pork ribs and brisket. The brisket was very yummy!  The side were good as well. All the side servings seemed small. My brother had saved a good sized rib and some chicken to take home and when he got up to go the restroom, the waitress had taken his plate away. The brisket was good and so were most of the sides. Most of the meats were just mediocre.

Please do not eat here. It's an embarrassment of a restaurant. Nothing was good. Chicken fried steak, freezer burned and mostly breading. Fried fish, way over cooked and tasteless. Mac and cheese could not eat. Jambalaya if served in Louisiana, you would be in jail. Fries and okra old and tasteless. No, you could taste something, a ton of salt. I have no idea how they stay in business. If anyone thinks the food served here is good, please let me know. I'll avoid anywhere you eat in future.

Tried to go to Schlotzsky's on Lamarr only to find out that it was closed permanently. Friend recommended this place. Absolutely some of the best chicken I have ever had sides were good as well ice cold Shiner on tap.

I love this place!  Great food and charming atmosphere.My meal was a pretty standard 2 meat plate - brisket and sausage with coleslaw and macaroni on the side.  All wonderful.  Everyone inside was friendly and efficient, even the people that weren't helping me directly.  Brian walked me through the menu and was very welcoming.  The decor was excellent and I was excited to do some exploring while waiting for my order.  This was an excellent experience and I can't wait to go back.(Frequent traveler exploring his new home)

Green Mesquite is a diamond in the rough type of BBQ spot near Downtown Austin.  My crew of 10 was actually about to head tot he airport but wanted to grab some TX BBQ before leaving town.  Per Yelp, we steered our way to Terry Black's BBQ, but the line was out the door and we were short on time.  I quickly searched for another spot nearby, and Green Mesquite popped up.  Gave them a quick call and they politely verified they accommodate my party with no wait.The exterior leaves much to be desired, but we weren't there for fine dining...we wanted some kick ass BBQ.  And, they surely delivered in that department. We ordered a family BBQ for 4 with double chicken, sausage, potato salad, coleslaw, hushpuppies, and some pickles / onions.  Their BBQ sauce mixed with the spicy hot sauce was fantastic!  Others in the party ordered roasted wings and baked potatoes.  All of which was superb.The service was friendly and fast.  We sat in the huge outdoor patio area and the weather was perfect for it.  Again the place can use an uplift and some cleaning to make it really shine, but when it comes to BBQ, Green Mesquite stands proud.  Enjoy!

We came to Austin for the day and began looking for a BBQ place to eat. Researched prior arriving and had our sights set on Terry Blacks or Micklethwait. However, Micklethwait's was out because it only opens weekends. Our hotel staff recommended Green Mesquite BBQ, just past Blacks. We drove by Blacks to see it was too packed for our comfort, COVID safety that is. So we went a bit further to Green Mesquite. They had plenty of room for customers to space out inside and even more space out in the patio where we sat. Even better, they had a Wednesday special for 3 meat plate with 2 sides for $11.99. The staff was super friendly, and food was good. By far your buck goes further here than the other BBQ places that get all the attention and hype. So glad we were given the tip to try Green Mesquite. Would definitely go again.

Another on the list of DDD joints I've visited.  The place is unassuming and homey feeling.  The staff... amazing.... the food... faahgetaboutit!!!!   Wow... great Que for sure!!!I had 6 smoked wings, the four meat plate (Brisket (add a buck), pulled pork, pork ribs and smoked sausage with mac n chez and the Jambalaya.  Fantastic!!!   Oh yea, and how could I forget a couple of slices of white bread as sell. I wish I could remember my servers name because I'd give her a shout out by name.  Shame on me for being so absent minded.. She was knowledgeable, friendly, smiling and most helpful.   I had her surprise me with desert to go and was really happy with the Pecan Pie at the hotel. All said, I'd go back daily or weekly if I lived in Austin... despite the flippin traffic, well worth the run

Prices are good but the food wasn't great. The meat was a little dry and we didn't get as much of it as we expected. The mac n cheese looked and tasted like it came out of a bag two minutes before being served. The jambalaya was good. The patio is cute and spacious. The staff is very nice.

Oldie but a goodie. I've only been to the Barton Springs location. The brisket is my favorite and I recently tried the chili made with burnt ends and is basically the most ridiculously good Frito pie you have ever tasted. My friend swears the smoked wings are one of the best wings in Austin. Overall, great place for some comfort food and at a decent price.

As long as you don't eat bbq this place has great food. Portions are large, the kitchen is slow.Went with chicken fried steak, awesome breading and pretty tender. Tried mash potatoes and green beans both were passable.  The cheese burger and fries where on point as well.Pork ribs were as dry as the Sahara. The flesh literally absorb any moisture in my mouth as i ate them.  Absolutely zero seasoning on those things. Brisket was tough and stringy slightly better seasoned.Steer away from bbq and you'll be happy.

Anywhere else this would be an easy 4 stars, maybe even 5. BBQ competition in Austin is pretty tough so it gets 3 stars for me. I thought the brisket was lackluster but the sausage and wings were great. Atmosphere is totally casual. Outdoor picnic table seating is great for larger groups.

The best part about Green Mesquite was the sides, not the meat. The coleslaw was fresh and crisp, the potato salad was nice and chunky, and fries were great. The meat itself left a lot to be desired. It was fairly cold and was pretty flavorless, though the bbq sauce really brought it back to life. I doubt we'll be back, but it was an easy, quick stop in an otherwise busy area, so maybe we'll find ourselves here again sometime.

Portions are small and the food is mediocre at best. They rely on nostalgia and a great location.  Grew up eating there but won't be back. There are just so many better bbq joints in Austin these days
I came here to try the wings which I heard were delicious. The wings were good but during my meal I look down and see two roaches walking across the table. Gross

Classic authentic Texas BBQ diner that was featured on "DDD" aka Diners, Drive-ins and Dives. Sweaty Guy Fieri drooled over their BBQ meats, but as someone who doesn't eat meat, I can say they have some pretty good sides and desserts, as well. Not to mention live Austin music on the back patio under the huge pecan trees on weekends, which is when I usually go there. It's right by Zilker Park, so you can stop in while you're on a tour of Barton Springs or other nearby attractions.The fried okra and fresh whole green beans (no pork fat, thank you!) are some of my favorite green items, along with the thick-cut cole slaw. Mac and cheese is pretty bland, as are the fries. The pinto beans are cooked in a thick sauce that includes their tasty BBQ sauce. You can get a four-side veggie plate to try whatever appeals to you. Desserts are also typical for Texas, including pecan pie and seasonal cobbler. The meat eaters in our party loved the chicken, brisket, and ribs. Iced tea is a staple here (as in all of Texas), as are a roster of cold beers, including regional and national brews. The back patio is dog friendly (on leash and well-behaved only, like the sign specifies). The waitstaff is friendly and efficient. Restrooms are gender-neutral. Parking is scarce in their tiny lot or on your own along side streets, so plan to carpool or ride-share. "Horrifying vegetarians since 1988." Nah, we're used to it by now, living in TX.

Truly a neighborhood gem Awesome BBQ with an authentically Austin vibe. They have an incredibly friendly/hospitable staff and that starts with the great leadership from the owner Tom D. Tom - Thank you for being a wonderful neighbor and helping us replace our Jeep's blown tire, you saved the day!

My bf raved about the wings here, so I was willing to go with his opinion despite the fact that the reviews are kind of low. We ordered a mix of fries and onion rings and a 12 piece order of smoked wings. I am not a big fan of wings, however, I was really impressed and would definitely come back for more. Sadly, 1/2 of the fries were still kind of cold and lacked seasoning and I do not recommend them or the onion rings.
Love the chicken fried steak!   very am assuming diner  but it does have great food!  We thought that it my be one of those diners that are eeeh.  but it turned out that they have great  food!

We stopped after an SXSW movie at the ZACH.  I loved the whole diner decor of this restaurant and the food did not disappoint!  The signs inside  are really cute and the two bathrooms are labeled "Whatever - Just wash your hands."  The BBQ was different than what I am used to from Florida however we really enjoyed it.My husband ordered the four meat sampler, pulled pork, ham, chicken and brisket.  He chose sides of smokey pinto beans and okra.  I decided to get right down to business and ordered a large cobbler with ice cream.I am somewhat of a cobbler aficionado and this one did not hit it for me.  It seemed like a lot of flour and not much crust.  I told the server and they offered another choice so I went with the blueberry pie.  OH MY this pie is so good.  It was perfect and not too sweet, great texture.  Next time it will be double pie for me.So meanwhile I helped my husband eat his four meat platter.  I was not that hungry but the okra was so good.  I ate half his brisket and tried all the meats.  Overall this was a good choice and we took most of the ham home and I mixed it up into omelets the next day.  Great value since we got several meals out of it.Wonderful service even though they were super busy from SXSW and when I got the check I found I was not charged for either the cobbler or the pie.  Props to the management for taking care of their customers.

The BEST wings I've ever tried!!! The wings actually had meat on them and were very filling and hearty! Me and my boyfriend shared a 12 count of wings and were stuffed!The service was EXCELLENT!! Our server Brian was extremely helpful and checked on us regularly! Our waters were always full and he made sure that we had plenty of napkins. I love this place and it has become one of my favorite restaurants, I highly recommend coming here!
column21: Rob Roy On The Lake, Austin, TX

column20: Really frustrated and disappointed with my dinner tonight. I've traveled all over the state of Texas enjoying barbecue and I'm normally left with a very clean plate and yearning for more. Tonight I found my dinner barely edible and left a lot of it behind. The ribs were extremely dried out, the mac&cheese was average at best, and the Cajun rice lacked anything memorable. The brisket was just "ok". A couple of observations on the crew that left me questioning the sanitation. The server chowing down on a bowl of what appeared to be chilI standing behind the bar didn't exactly seem sanitary. I question the cook who came from the back and filled two soda cups with draft beer before disappearing back into the kitchen. Because there was an order that came in he then donned a pair of gloves to make the food, didn't see any handwashing in between.  Yuck!

So there is the trendy Franklin's BBQ and then there's the middle of the road Terry's Black BBQ where you take your parents or friends if they do not want to get up early and wait in line like Franklin's BBQ. Then there is Green Mesquite where the locals hang out. It's been around for awhile and Lord Almighty they stick to it no matter how good and bad it is. Well my friends and I ended up here on a Saturday night and it was crowded. When you step into this place, it's almost going back in time. Then we ordered out BBQ plates and the BBQ is decent. Not terrible but not the best. They had good potato salad and cole slaw. Parking is bit difficult but there is street parking.

Ordered the 2 meat plate with potato salad and green beans- it turned out to be a solid choice. The beans were seasoned and the potato salad was just ok. The meat choices were great. This has to be the tenderest brisket I've ever had. It was almost buttery. The sausage had a good flavor as well, but I started noticing that was tongue was tingling so it is a little spicy.

I spent a long weekend in Austin and ate at four bbq joints. While not terrible, Green Mesquite was my least favorite.Let's start with the good.  I loved the Barton Street venue.  It has the authentic look and feel of a rustic, 1940s-era bbq shack.  Tin roofed bungalow style.  In the back is an open air courtyard with music stage. Service was very friendly and attentive.The less good.  I wasn't wowed by the bbq.  I ordered the four meat, two sides plate.   A bargain at $15, I chose sliced brisket, chopped brisket, pork ribs, and hot link.  The hot link was the best of the four, properly cooked with the requisite pop of a natural casing.  Chopped beef was second best, sufficiently moist.  The pork ribs and sliced brisket were both bland and on the dry side.  As for sides, cole slaw tasted merely of chopped cabbage.  It needed a kick in  the form of a vinegar or creamy base.  Jambalaya wasn't bad.The biggest irritant for me, however, were the flies.  I sat in the open air back patio, so I can cut them some amount slack on this--but damn...I was shooing flies away between each bite, and it got on my nerves after a while.They have a liquor license and accept credit cards.In short, Green Mesquite wasn't terrible.  But in a town like Austin, the BBQ bar is set very high and is unforgiving.  Ok in a pinch, but not in the same universe as La BBQ or Sam's.

Poor, poor, poor... across the board.Two meat plate and all I got was 2 1/2 SMALL slices of meat and even less turkey. Portion size for the price is ridiculous... Waiter all over the place with NO help, like chicken with his head cut off. Slow service at all levels... Flavor was... eh, okay.Now I remember why I hadn't been here in over 5 years...

Green Mesquite is the most underrated BBQ spot in Austin. I bring my mom here every time she's in town as opposed to some of the well-hyped spots close by, mostly because I love the walk-in and sit style seating with the down home country ambiance. It reminds me of home and makes me nostalgic -- for what, I'm not sure, but that's the charm of this place. My go-to when I'm craving brisket, ribs and some mashed potatoes with green beans. The two meat plate is for when I'm really hungry, otherwise the brisket is just fine. The hush puppies always hit the spot! And the sweet tea is to die for. I also love the shirts the waitstaff wear. I hope Green Mesquite stays forever.

I love you guys.  Great food. However, just ordered 5 blueberry pies and ice cream delivered. I specifically asked for spoons. The pie came in the pie tin. No plates. No spoons. Its was awesome, but i really could have used plates and spoons.

Wings and chicken are great -- tender and tasty. BBQ chicken not overcooked as I often find, but comes away from the bone easily. Brisket (lack of flavor) and potato salad (too mushed up) not worth it.Good crunchy cole slaw.Nice, on-the-ball service.

HIDDEN GEM!! My boyfriend and I were going to terry blacks, but of course it was packed so we drove up the road and found this amazing place!! Their famous buffalo chicken wings are INCREDIBLE. Not kidding, best wing I've ever had. Their golden velvet corn was AMAZING. The baked potato, turkey, brisket and fried okra were all so so good. The service was also great and super fast. 100% telling everyone about this place.

We came here on Guy Fieri's recommendation. We tried a little bit of all the meats, but the smoked chicken really stood out for us! Loved having gumbo as a side option. Staff was friendly and atmosphere unassuming but homey. Great first meal for our trip to Austin!
So nice to find a place in Texas that serves yummy bbq!! It always smells sooo good outside!

One of my favorite places in Austin. Walking in here feels just like the day it opened (I imagine.) The staff is super friendly and make you quickly feel like family. To many this is a touristy spot but for locals eating the two meat combo is just a normal part of our week. Oh and it's no secret that the wings are amazing here. The last time I took someone here I didn't talk up the wings just simply said we are going to get wings. At the table he renounced all other wings and dedicated his life to Green Mesquite As his wing savior. Great food, atmosphere is authentic and the food is always good.

I've been here twice because of the good reviews and wanted to give it the benefit of the doubt. I was not impressed. The prices are great, however I think I will stick to paying a bit more for better BBQ. The country fried steak had extremely heavy breading. But... like I said, prices are great!

Wow.  Things have changed.  I came in with Mom on Sunday night after our last excellent experience. I'd call it bad service, but the better term is disinterested service. Our waiter made one appearance to get our drink orders, then returned to get the food order.  About twenty minutes went by before he returned to any of the three tables that had ordered about the same time.Finally, after about 20 minutes, he returns to tell us that Mom's order is "almost" ready, but that they ran out of tortillas to fix my BBQ tacos. This wouldn't have been a huge deal EXCEPT we didn't find out until that late into our order and when one order was almost ready.  Needless to say, it was time to cancel the order and cut losses.  No acknowledgement of our concerns, no apology, no visit or contact with management.It's as if this location knows that tourists and visitors will continue to get BBQ here because it's on a road full of restaurants and near all sorts of tourist attractions.  The food, when you eventually get it, can be pretty good.  The menu has a huge variety.  But this kind of service is simply unacceptable.Needless to say, this local won't be back -- and neither should you.

This place has been there for a long time.  It's not trendy.  It's not featured on every BBQ website.  There's no lines to get in.  They have regular hours. Running out of BBQ rarely happens.Green Mesquite is a trip back in time for Austin BBQ options.  All of the facts that I mentioned above are true. There's also waiter service.  Further, the menu has a variety of side orders and a huge variety of other foods, including burgers and chicken fried steak. Unlike a lot of the newer BBQ options in Austin, walking into Green Mesquite doesn't feel like you've walked directly into the pit itself.Food?  Damned good.  Mom and I each tried an order of baby back ribs since they have a weekend special for a half rack and two sides for $10.99.  The ribs were cooked to perfection with a slight glaze.  Not too messy and not too sweet either.  Also, they're cooked long enough so as not to leave an overly pork-y flavor in your mouth.  Both my fries and my mac and cheese were very good.  In fact, they were significantly better than they looked.  The sauce is one of my favorites.  The sauce is a perfect mix of sweet with a hint of vinegar.  It flows perfectly out of the squeeze bottle on the table. I would also be remiss if I didn't mention our appetizer of hush puppies, which were superior to most any seafood restaurant and came right out the fryer piping hot.As good as the food was, the service was even better. Our waiter was friendly, made great (and not forced) conversation with us about the food, kept the drinks refilled, and genuinely thanked us several times for our business.Long story short.  If you want BBQ, other options, and excellent service, you should give Green Mesquite a chance.  Or you can wait in line.

The chicken wings and ranch are to die for. The wing sauce is a mix of bbq and buffalo--it's the bomb! I think they make their ranch from scratch too. If you like chicken wings you have to give this spot a try.

The restaurant itself is kinda drab, says it was built in the 80's and looks like it hasn't changed one bit since then. But the food was great!!!I had the smoked turkey sandwich w fries and slaw (put some slaw on any kind of bbq sandwich, it's a North Carolina thing but sooo good).My husband had the smoked wing platter w pinto beans and green beans, he said the wings were so good that he didn't want them to end! The veggies taste fresh, not from a can.Friendly staff and fresh food

Love it. Nice outdoor seating, delicious barbecue and no wait. This is super underrated and just as good as other barbecues here in Austin. Customer service was super friendly and the portion was big enough to split. Super great place!

Really good food. ButNot worth the wait. Absolutely horrible service. Our server showed purposeful indifference to our wellbeing. We had to ask for the check after waiting 20 minutes, after our food was gone. And then she clearly took her time on purpose-was walking around and chatting with people. Also beware of the ice cream up-sell with desert. Mediocre pie, but one scoop of ice cream was $2.99! Total rip-off.  Don't waste your time here.
Fantastic service. Delicious rack of ribs. Pickles-- I had three servings due to the fact that they were quite amazing. Sides were mediocre. We'd go back the next time we are in Austin.

Saw an episode of diners drive-ins and dives. Smoked wings specialty so I had to try it. The food I had was amazing. Great BBQ amazing smoked mesquite flavor. Hands down best bbq I have tasted Austin and my 2nd favorite in Texas. Please stop and give your tastebuds a windfall or great tasting BBQ green mesquite style. The sauce is good but I didn't need it. The sausage is spicy so take that under consideration. I will be back to try some more sides. The Memorial Day weekend was busy so they didn't have whole menu. But that shows you how popular it is and that locals love this place. Visitors should try this food for sure. It is a Bucket list for Austin in my opinion.

Came here for a spontaneous dinner out as it is super close to our apartment. We both ordered plates: I got pulled pork with hushpuppies and mac & cheese, and my boyfriend got the brisket with fries and pinto beans. The service was prompt, but the food was underwhelming. We both liked our meats (though they were nothing to write home about), but did not like the sides as all. The mac & cheese was particularly bad in both texture and taste. This experience follows the general trend of these 'secondary locations' of popular Austin restaurants that have found a home in Southpark Meadows. None of them are as good as the original.

Pretty good BBQ. Consistently not bad across the board: brisket, ribs, sausage, and turkey are always consistent. Sides aren't bad. I've heard rumors that you can bring in your own brisket and rub and they'll smoke it for you for a small fee. Again, this BBQ is good, but with the plethora of great Q in CENTEX I can only give it 3 stars.

Just went here it's was such a great experience the wonderful man that greeted us had amazing side burns or Chops!Made us feel right at home.I loved the place before I ever tried the food. The staff was amazing!!Then the food happened... holly hush puppies of greatness!!The pulled pork, the ribs.. gee whiz the BBQ sauce.  Bought a bottle of sauce to go cause damn it I need more of that in my life!Set aside some time for this place and make some memories you're friends and family will be hella jelly.  Thank guys!
The food was delicious! Friendly staff and fast service Next time we visit the city we will go back definitely

The bbq was just so-so, but our server was incredible!  At the busy lunch hour on Friday he took time to explain the specials and wisecrack about us, the food and the restaurant. What a hoot! I just wish more waiters in town would take the time to engage with customers like this. We will be returning just because he made lunch so much fun. I didn't catch his name but our receipt says his name is Jason.

For my girlfriends birthday, we wanted REAL bbq in the heart of Austin.  We had seen great reviews for Green Mesquite and decided to give it a shot.  We ended up getting the BBQ for 4 so that we could try a lot of different things.  The brisket, bbq chicken and sausage were incredibly flavorful, however, I would have liked them to be warmer.  In terms of sides, the potato salad was AMAZING and the baked beans were yummy.  I also really enjoyed the heat and taste of the hushpuppies.  For me, it is also a requirement that I have slaw with my bbq and man did their slaw deliver!  It wasn't super mayonnaise like which I really enjoyed.Naturally, I also needed to add a sweet tea to my order, and it definitely hit the spot.  The service was great and we didn't have to wait, which I really appreciated after a long day.

Wow it has been awhile since I wrote a review for Keith's BBQ. Over the years....same great food. Love the moist brisket! My friend prefers the lean cut. But you can order whatever you want...just order it as you wish! I had a sliced sandwich. Sauce served on the side. Love that you can choose to sauce it up as needed.That sausage link....oh my. The snap, the flavor, the lovely kick....such goodness. Best sausage ever! And put it on a flour tortilla! Keep it simple and enjoy the goodness! Ya don't even need bbq sauce.....unless ya really want it. Sausage stands tall all on its own.But the best part....the cute bus and the workers! So nice and love to see their faces (even with a mask on) every time I go there!Keep up the great work y'all!!!

robin and keith rock! and paul is a cutie pie!  keep up the great work guys!  the food is fab! and the customer is the BEST!  keiths brisket is the best!! and that is one AWESOME truck!  who else puts their pit on the truck!
Seriously some of the best BBQ in Austin, TX. I genuinely have no idea how they make such amazing food in a school bus. Go out of your way for this BBQ, it really is that good.

The pulled pork and baby back ribs are fantastic.  Pricing and portions seemed fair too.  They could go with a better quality white bread in my opinion but that's a minor point.  House BBQ sauce was a perfect match for the rub and smoker that they are using.  Will be back whenever it's convenient (they brought the truck to my apartment this time)
Second time trying out Keith's BBQ and they have redeemed themselves. It was D-Lish! Not only good BBQ but hospitality as well.

Was looking forward to some good TX BBQ when I found out they they were going to be at my apartment complex tonight. Reviews looked good so I went and got a 2 meat plate with brisket and chicken. Worst BBQ I've ever had. Brisket dry and the BBQ sauce they serve with it has a weird taste to it. The chicken did not come as a whole piece but was in chunks. Very disappointing to say the least. I suspect this food has been heated up multiple times from whatever he wasn't able to sell earlier this week.

We booked Keith's BBQ for a Halloween corporate event and all of our employees gave rave reviews. Keith's communication was fantastic and the food was great. We couldn't have asked for a better experience. They even played Halloween music for us!What stood out most was the extremely friendly service from all of the employees working the truck. I definitely recommend Keith's BBQ for all events, especially corporate events. Thanks, Keith!

Love the idea of BBQ served out of a cute renovated vintage school bus!  I had the "two meat" combo in a flour tortilla.  The chopped beef was okay, although a little too fatty for my taste.  The sausage was the star of the show, it is very flavorful, moist and mildly spicy.  Bonus points for being able to choose between a sandwich or a tortilla wrap, although if you get the wrap the tortilla ends up pretty soggy.

Ordered the Brisket Sandwich (sliced) with the yelp check in offer. The guy recommended chopped brisket but I wanted to compare Keith's brisket with Franklin's. The briskets in my sandwich were consistently good--moist but not overly fatty. Better than the bad batch but not as amazing as the on-point Franklin briskets.I wish the buns were lightly toasted and crunchy on the inside, and I wish the sandwich came with a lot more onions and pickles. Maybe even some on the side. I grabbed some BBQ sauce and I'm glad I did, since the sandwich was a little dry (brisket is moist but shy of enough, especially for sandwich, and there wasn't enough veggies). Really good sauce too!

For the Pretentious Elite folks... Bugger Off..  First and foremost, barbecue is easily subjective, bordering on contentious in some circles.  Do not discount the other reviews for your ego stroking satisfaction. Now that being said...Keith's has earned a special place in my stomach, it is one of the best in town that I have had.

We hired Keith's BBQ as one of the food trucks for our conference. Service was friendly. The brisket sandwich was awesome. Fatty, not too much sauce and moist. Everything you want in a brisket sandwich. I tried Ironworks the day before and I wasn't too impressed but I decided to give Austin barbeque another try and it was delicious!Plus I love that they're on a school bus!

My gods, this was some good BBQ! I was in Austin for SXSW and told to try the also awesome Iron Works. But the first time I showed up to Iron Works there was an hour long wait out the door. I was way to hungry for that. Then I here a hippy calling from across the street "You want some BBQ, man!" I see this awesome school bus that smelled pretty killer. Deciding school bus BBQ now beats Iron Works BBQ in an hour, I gave it a try. And I wasn't even vaguely disappointed.I had the brisket and it was so tender and well flavored. The side of beans were just hot enough and had a ton of flavor of their own that only added to what the brisket was doing instead of subtracting from it. Great stuff! The hippy selling me the food was super friendly and everything looked clean and well maintained. I couldn't have asked for a better BBQ experience. When I did get to try Iron Works a couple days later, I was equally blown away by how good it was but...not MORE blown away. Keith's went toe-to-toe with Iron Works in my opinion. If you want good BBQ in Austin and you see this bus, you've gotta give it a try.

It's disgusting how good this place is.Think ravaged-your-hands-with-grease and licking-sauce-off-forever disgusting.I was about to drive off to another nearby spot in north Austin when I heard the music. In the three seconds it took me to source the music, I picked up the first hint of smoke, and all of a sudden I found myself hooked. Think Bugs-Bunny-floating-through-the-air-on-the-trail-of-carrot-soup hooked.The rest of it was really quite simple. I ordered from the off-menu option of Brisket by the pound. Got some wonderbread to go with it and stocked up on the sauce. Found a table, made a total mess of my hands, and put together marvelous slabs of Brisket Saucewiches. Visually, the sliced brisket lit up all the right colors, ranging from deep-charred brown to smoke-ring red to heart-attack fatty white. Each bite of my other helping of sandwiched chopped brisket blended all of its flavor profiles perfectly together--like a bottle of hand-prepped french perfume--with the charred topnotes and savory basenotes from the beef as well as the sweet and mildly tart heartnotes in the sauce all tempered ever so slightly by the two white wedges of carbs. I won't pretend to claim I know anything about BBQ, but heck I'd buy the truck if I could.Crushed it. 5 stars. One imaginary star on top for service. Might you guys kindly drive up to the DC area, pretty please?

Keith's stops by my job every other Friday and have done so for quite a while, and despite how good it smells, I've never tried it. Until today. I didn't get much, just a Rosie's Special which is a bean and cheese taco (I know, I know, it's a BBQ truck) with their chicken on a flour tortilla. It was one of the best tacos I've ever had. I paid $7 for it, which I cringed at initially, but it was easily the size of two tacos because it was overflowing with chicken. I picked a piece of chicken out as soon as I opened the foil and it was so juicy, tender and full of a smoky BBQ taste. Their beans have that BBQ flavor as well, throw in some melty cheese and a lightly toasted tortilla and it was heaven!! Well worth the money I paid. Truth be told I need to try some of their other meats, but I'm not even sure I can tear myself away from ordering this taco again! If a taco is this good, the rest has to be amazing. The bar is set!

First of all, you cant buy customer service. Keith and his crew are hands down the best guys in the service industry you'll find. They are out right friendly, reliable and just down to earth. Next the chicken, ribs and brisket are outstanding!!!! I could have had lunch but I cant resist this food truck qhen they are parked right in front of our office. The meat is sooo moist it melts in your mouth. If you have tried this truck is an Austin must!

Just got a sausage wrap from the food truck and it was great! It had just the right amount of heat, and it was very filling. I definitely recommend then and look forward to trying another item next time they're here. I love your logo, can I get a Keith's sticker?!
Life changing brisket..... absolutely life changing. I could write an opera about this brisket. The sauce is incredible. Chicken was bomb too.... but oh, the brisket.
I had the ribs, chicken and brisket!! Great smoked flavor!! Gotta have them all! Loved it!!

On the plus side, Keith's comes to my office parking lot.  I don't mess with sides, and pretty much just stick to the "Keith's Special" (sandwich or wrap of brisket and sausage).  So for me, it's under $10.  They drive down the highway with a burning fire on-board, so that's cool.  And occasionally the parking lot smells glorious.  The guy at the window is always friendly.The reviews are definitely a dichotomy.  I'm somewhere in the middle.  In my opinion, Keith's strength is convenience, but it's certainly not the mindblowing BBQ experience that would warrant anything approaching five stars.  The brisket today (chopped and sauced, instead of the usual "sliced" they had run out of) was room temp and slightly stringy, and the jalapeño sausage is clearly brought in.  I'll grade it on a scale where 1 is botulism, 3 is when-HEB-sometimes-has-a-trailer-selling-sandwiches-and-sausage-wraps, 4.5 is what I lovingly make on my Big Green Egg, and 5 are the places that make Texas Monthly's list every year.3.45 stars

Love love love this place! Great food, good service! The brisket and sausage two meat plate is what I always get and let me tell you... even if I'm full I still want more. So good!! Definitely recommend :))

We hired Keith's BBQ for a corporate event we did at South by Southwest last weekend and the food and experience was everything we could have ever wanted and more!!!We wanted to create the world's first in-flight food truck for members of the media and influencers by serving BBQ on our company challenger. I found Keith's BBQ through Yelp and worked with him in the months leading up to the event to make sure we would have everything we needed. Not only was this the BEST BBQ we have EVER tasted - they were so friendly, accommodated us (we needed vegetarian options - they delivered) and helped us have fun while working long days at SXSW. The members of the media RAVED about the BBQ as did everyone at Signature FBO airport.Keith and Robin went above and beyond for us and we are so happy with the result we had! HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend the pulled pork, chicken, ribs, homemade coleslaw ...basically everything!
Great meat, 10/10, would eat again. Good price too.Dudes were nice. This place is a triple threat.

HOLY MOLY BEST BRISKET EVER.  I'm serious!!  I eat BBQ for the brisket and Keith's is the best I've had in Austin.  So tender and moist, my mouth was welcoming it like MJ welcoming boys into Neverland Ranch!  Really enjoyed the sauce, too.  And I know BBQ is all about the meat, but a big fan of their cole slaw too.  Not as mayo-y as others but was bow chicka wow wow.So many !!'s I'm on a meat high leave me be!

Had Keith's yesterday from their truck at our office complex...one word...Fantastic!!I had the brisket and pulled pork sandwich on a potato roll with onions, pickles and jalapeños. The meat was juicy and delicious with good bark and just the right amount of fat. Their sauce has the perfect amount of sweetness to compliment the 'cue.I'll be keeping my eye out for them...my mouth is watering just writing about it!

This truck came to my work area a couple of times. Their $5 brisket sandwich deal makes it a pretty good choice. Nothing was dry, service was good, and they serve stuff out of a school bus.I've tried the pulled pork, sliced brisket, chopped brisket, and ribs. They're all solid.Just do it.

2 things.  1) The mixed-meat BBQ sandwich I got was awesome! (chopped brisket and pulled pork).  It was huge and the meat was so moist and flavorful... great value for the money.   2) The guys were so welcoming and upbeat -- something that is too often overlooked in the food business.   All around, a great food truck experience.

I had low expectations when they pulled up in the parking lot. Actually enjoyed the school bus where the pit was in the back in the generator in the front. However, the meet is serious.  The brisket was moist and they use the Franklin method of wrapping with butcher paper. I do prefer more salt on the bark but was impressed nonetheless.  The pulled pork was exceptional. It is on the sweet side (as opposed to the vinegar).  my business partner was impressed with the chicken. Today, we had a comparison since our office provided BBQ from Rudy's.  Keith's was much much better.  The beans were very good. To the person who criticized for not having potato salad, I can only say a "really?"  Judge what is on the plate.  Never in my life nor any of my other barbecue friends lives have we ever picked a barbecue restaurant because of potato salad.The prices are extremely reasonable and of course the convenience is outstanding. There certainly isn't the line like there is at Franklin's barbecue or at La BBQ. I certainly would say it's a top 10 barbecue restaurant in Austin.  I can't explain those with such negative reviews. I'm an amateur barbecue smoker and aficionado. I can only believe the people with the extremely bad reviews just happen to come on a bad day.  BBQ can be like that, fickle beast that it is.

Keith's BBQ catered our wedding and it could not have been more perfect. Our guests are still gushing about how amazing the BBQ was! My groom and I were dancing and socializing too much to eat at the reception. However, to our surprise Keith packed us two to-go boxes and put them in our get away car! We devoured everything as soon as we got to the hotel. It was so amazing to work with a vendor that is dedicated to creating a seamless and stress free experience. I never had to worry about a thing and Keith went above and beyond to ensure our guests were completely satisfied. If you are in need of a caterer for ANY event, I HIGHLY recommend Keith's BBQ! They are a true pleasure to work with and their food is incredible.

I recently heard about this place, but hadn't made the effort to go try yet. I live right by Zilker and next door to an office building that always has food trucks stop by for lunch. Just my luck that I came home about 11 am and Keith's was posted up next door. These people are slangin some serious bbq and some of the best prices around. When eating bbq by myself I almost always get a sliced brisket sandwich and tater salad. Not only is this sandwich in the top 3 I've had, but the price was a few dollars cheaper than the others. I'll definitely be watching them on social media and eating here again.

I went to their food truck twice and ordered sandwich twice. I tried brisket and pork and both were really tasty. Their coupon even make the deal better :)I recommend this place and you should try this bbq sandwich!

In order to get anything out of someone's review I think qualifying the statement with a little background is imperative. So below are just a few points on my BBQ histories and beliefs1. I fully believe that it is nearly impossible to separate the top tier of BBQ joints   around the state and completely impossible (and maybe irresponsible) to narrow it down a specific list. Mainly because....sometimes I am hungrier than other days...sometimes the chefs are on point and other times not...I typically don't eat BBQ from several places back to back and therefore don't feel confident remembering which place I thought was more completely awesome....etc. etc.2. My Typical Order for Reviewing: 2-meat plate - Brisket, Pork Ribs, Coleslaw and Potato Salad.3. To name a few I have eaten at: Franklin's, City Market (Luling), Kreutz's (Luling), Snow's (Lexington), J. Mueller's, Mickelwaith, Stiles Switch, Southside Meat Market (Elgin), Meyer's (Elgin), Big Bib (Brady), and many many more.4. My top tier (in no particular order): Franklin's, City Market, and Snow's.Now to Keith's...Keith's trailer comes by our office every other week and I have been able to try them twice now.  The first time I had the brisket and ribs w/coleslaw and the second time I had the pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw. I have to say that Keith's easily fits into my top 5. Everything I have had there so far is excellent from the meat to the sweet and creamy coleslaw. I was particularly impressed with the moistness and humongousness of the pulled pork sandwich, and I am in fact still sitting here dreaming about it now as I type this review.The service is top-notch and friendly and they provide the additional benefit of being able to text in your order to speed up the process. Please give these guys a try and you won't be disappointed (except for those who  have already tried it and were disappointed. I would have to assume these people have some mysterious taste pallette that is beyond my comprehension as a human.)
They stopped by my job and wow u could smell it inside my job ! I got a brisket sandwich but wow amazing !! And they stuff it until it's falling out but prices are a bit high but worth it

The cashier and Keith were both friendly and jovial. I used the Yelp $5 brisket sandwich coupon ($5.40 with tax) and it was honored without any problems. The sandwich tasted great (I said mmmm mmmm repeatedly) and it was an ample amount of meat for the price. I'm glad I got to try their brisket sandwich!

Barbecuing ain't easy.  Nor is finding good barbecue to eat.  Despite what the aggregate Yelp rating might say, Keith's BBQ is not good.  It's not even close to good.  The people are friendly and nice, and it's convenient when the drive their truck around and park outside your office at lunchtime.  But the meat is straight up terrible.  The brisket was tough, chewy, and roast-beefy.  The meat had a smoke ring, but since it was cooked so poorly, one has to assume they injected chemicals to fake it.  The sauce was mediocre.  The sides were beans and slaw - I just can't take a BBQ place seriously when they don't even offer potato salad.  I do have to admit the cole slaw was pretty tasty though.Based on the amateurish quality of the brisket, I have serious questions whether most of the 5-star reviews for Keith's are from genuine sources, or were perhaps part of a "marketing" campaign.  You will notice that most of the 5-star reviewers have one or two reviews to their credit.  Sketchy...And whoever said that Franklin had better watch out for Keith's (if in fact it was a real person) should have their Yelp account suspended for willful misconduct.  I have never heard a more ridiculous culinary statement in my life.  Franklin is a jedi master, and these guys are like backyard cooks.  At least it was cheap at 7 bucks.  If I ever I forget my lunch and reach the state of desperation where I might think about trying this place again, I think I'll stick to cole slaw, or maybe give the chicken a try.  They can't possibly screw up chicken, right?

Incredible! Had the Keith's Special with chicken and chopped brisket on a flour tortilla. Absolutely delicious!! Also, the employee that took my order was extremely friendly and funny!! Haha good stuff, will be coming back.

Keith's BBQ came out to set up shop next to my office building.Mediocre, or maybe less than. I was excited for barbecue I didn't have to drive anywhere to go get, especially after such glowing reviews, but what I got was disappointment. Everything was dry. The cut of brisket I received was incredibly lean, the ribs tasted okay but were not at all moist, the meat preferring to stick to the bone at all costs. The sauce is nothing special, just your standard sugary generic sauce. After eating half of it I gave the rest away to a coworker.

Hmmm. What to think about all the 5-star reviews for a BBQ truck in a town full of  awesome BBQ? Might be cynical, but the reviews are mostly from users with only a handful of reviews...I've had Keith's BBQ a couple times now, and I can say it's not bad, but nothing special. The pulled pork is good, the sausage is standard Elgin-type sausage you buy at the store, and the sides are chips, beans, and coleslaw. The sauce tastes like Rudy's.The brisket is another story. I'm not sure if it's not cooked long enough or low enough, but it was very fatty and chewy... not the cooked-till-the-fat-melts wet brisket I like.So, $7 for a grocery store hamburger bun with half a Elgin sausage and a small portion of fatty, undercooked brisket (Keith's Special) is a threat to Franklin's? Not so much. The service is good, if that helps.

Our nieces wedding was this weekend and Keith's BBQ catered. The food was fantastic...everyone commented on how really excellent it was! We had the coleslaw, potato salad, smoked chicken, shredded BBQ chicken and pork and chopped brisket. ALL of it was so flavorful and perfectly done - the meat all juicy and moist - the chopped brisket with bits of bark in there - drool! Since we're family - we were lucky to get to take some home and its like a little gem that I'm keeping hidden from everyone. My preeecioous (chopped BBQ brisket)!

Amazing food and really really great people. I love everything on the menu but y'all MUST try the chicken - the best I've had in Austin. The sampler plate is one of the best BBQ values in town and lets you try most everything on the menu.Also... I nominate them for best food truck website. PARALLAX STRIPES!!!

I love Keith's! They come to my office building a couple of times a month. I usually get sausage and brisket with cole slaw and potato salad. It's so much food but it's worth the food coma. It's really cheap for what you get, and the service is great. Everyone is always friendly! I'm a Memphis barbecue lover through and through, but Keith's has made me a much bigger fan of Texas barbecue.

Simply the best!Brisket is awesome and the ribs are second to none. The service matches the food as well! Highly recommend these guys if you want to cater a party. We've used them a couple of times and will again!

The hickory smoke pairs with the sauce like sushi takes to soy sauce. Baby Back Ribs dont pop often in Texas BBQ which makes Keith's a standout. And you would be remiss to miss out on the potato salad, slaw and beans . . . biggest standout though is that your dollar stretches pretty far here.
By far the best BBQ I have EVER had!!! Will drive to find Keith's =)

This truck came to my office building today. They had three guys on board: one taking orders and payment out the back window, one running the kitchen and slicing up the goods, and a third at the service window putting it all together. Slick machine and took about 3 minutes start to big ol' sandwich in hand. The bbq? I would have gladly waited longer for worse. (That's a compliment, by the way.) I got a sliced brisket sammich, ate half at my desk and took half of it home for a second go. Delicious.

Other than my husband's BBQ, this is my favorite! We love to go see John Gaar Band at the Saxon Pub on Sundays, and when we see this trailer we start salivating! I haven't tried anything I didn't like, even the sauce is delicious! The BBQ seriously doesn't need sauce, but like I always tell my husband, "I'm a sauce girl!" I will never stand in line at Franklin's for two hours when there are places like Keith's that are, in my opinion, way better! The only thing I would change is a little larger portion of sides, just a little more! Go find this trailer and see if you don't agree!

Well as I read all of the other 5 star reviews, I just shake my head yes yes yes.I agree with all of the statements.Just add me to the list of people that love the food and the service with a smile and positive attitude.It's always a pleasure.One suggestion would be to add to the menu's the cost per lb. of each food.But that's only because it's so good I just have to buy it in larger portions than just a BarBQ Plate.The chicken taste so good. Try it cold the next day. OMG! it just holds all that awesome flavor.They have a perfect recipe to grow huge. Don't change a thing.

Seriously one of the best BBQ chicken I've ever had!I got a Robin's Taco for lunch (chicken, beans, cheese... and some magical smokey goodness), and loved it so much that I went back and grabbed "to-go" dinner for myself and SO.Needless to say, the dinner (brisket and pulled pork plate) was devoured and got equally high praise from the SO.Also, a really good value.  The amount of food was quite generous for the price.Hoping they return to our office location (Barton Skyway) often!!  (hint hint hint)

Super fresh ingredients. Awesome taste. Good price. I had the sliced brisket sandwich when Keith's stopped by the WF office building at Las Cimas., it was a welcome treat.  The BBQ sauce has the right balance of tangy, sweet and spicy. I usually don't hold out high hopes for side dishes at BBQ trailers, but what a nice discovery... the beans and potato salad were fresh and tasty too. Highly recommended. I hope they keep swinging by here for lunch.

It's hard to rate TX BBQ anything less than 3 stars, and this is TX BBQ.  I would say it's solid, though it's not in the same tier as Terry Blacks and Rudy's, my favorite and second favorite respectively.  I had my meal off the truck.  I ordered the 2 meat plate, brisket, outside cut (aka meat candy) and sausage.  The brisket was ok, a little dry and slightly tough.  I had to use a knife to cut it!   HAHA  The bark was nothing special either, the rub could have used a bit more salt to bring out the flavor.  It was plenty peppery though.  It had a great smokey smell and taste.  The sausage was very good, dense and flavorful, and the casing wasn't too tough.  The sauce was sweet and tangy, reminiscent of KC BBQ, though not as runny, and no heavy vinegar taste.  It also came with a side, I went with potato salad.  The potatoes were cooked and cubed, but still pretty hard.  This tater salad held it's shape.  They used mustard (I prefer mayo) and the flavor was decent.      I would rate this place pretty far down the list of BBQ in central TX, behind Terry Blacks, Rudys, Louie Mueller, Opie's, Smitty's, etc.  HOWEVER, the biggest redeeming quality for Keith's is the price.  I paid $11 (tax included, plus 20% tip) for my 2 meat, 1 side plate, which was plenty of food for a work day, considering I try to eat light at work but could not pass up BBQ delivered right outside my office.  I can't get out of any other BBQ joint for less than $20, so $11 for a 2 meat, 1 side TX BBQ plate is phenomenal.  This is a "try it and keep your expectations in check" type place.  I'd go again.

I was rather disappointed since the reviews were so high.We ordered the 3 meat (ribs, sausage, brisket), brisket taco & brisket quesadilla.  The meats had decent flavor & taste, but the BBQ was not good.  That's pretty much a cardinal sin if you're a BBQ place.Maybe it was an off night or something, but we left extremely underwhelmed.
Austin, TX 78717

I've frequented this place several times now for in-door dining and takeout. It definitely hits the spot for a Chinese skewer spot. I've enjoyed eating their skewers, cold dishes, and hot dishes--all which are made to order and come out pretty fresh. I'd recommend people to go here for this cuisine for sure. It's yum!I've also had their Hawaiian bbq options and I will say that I found it to be just okay. there aren't very many places that sell Mac salad, katsu, and bbq chicken, etc in north Austin.

We like this place but wish the seasoning wasn't so monotone. They use the same seasoning for all the skewers and while it's good, you do get tired of eating the same flavor. A few times they forgot some of our takeout items so that was a little frustrating.

So very happy to find this Chinese style bnq spot during our trip to Austin! We were a fan back when they had their restaurant in the Bay Area (san mateo), they still have a sister restaurant in Cupertino, but we haven't been there for so long. We recognized the menu, but they had added Hawaiian bbq items to cater to the new demographic and more Chinese stir fry dishes. We only ordered the skewers, Chinese bbq bc that was what they r best for! As usual we opted for the lamb, beef ,chicken, chicken skin (so good!), tendon, tripes, sausages, Corns, eggplant (so good and sweet!), chives, A veggies, anf Chinese buns. They were all seasoned a bit salter than what I remember and a bit less spicy (probably they adjusted to the Americans taste a little bit), but they were all still so good. We had our (almost) 1 year old with us and asked for a couple skewers without the spice and they obliged. If you've never had Chinese style bbq, certainly, check this place out! The price is so cheap too, about 2 dollar per skewers and they are huge! Lots of meat on each skewer!

Really great flavor on everything we tried, fast friendly service, super fresh, and a ton of variety! They have something for everyone from chicken, lamb and beef to tendon, heart, and others. We tried one of just about everything. Loved the tofu, whole croker was tasty, shirk cooked well. All good. Will definitely be going back

Some days, I get huge cravings for meat. Today was one of those days, so I went to TLLT to satisfy that craving. I ordered 7 skewers of different meats, including lamb, pork, chicken, beef, and everything in between (plus potatoes on a skewer). The skewers were hit or miss. I thoroughly enjoyed the lamb skewer for example, but the beef skewer had a slightly strange aftertaste. The seasoning used on everything is the same, I believe it is a mix of cumin and cayenne. After eating three skewers, everything begins tasting the same. If you simply want to satisfy a meat craving, then TLLT is a great spot. Anything more, and you might leave unsatisfied.

I've finally had the opportunity to return to TLLT, but this time came with friends who could help guide me through the menu. The menu can be a bit daunting if you're not familiar with this type of cuisine, but it definitely paid off in the end.The meat was incredibly juicy and well seasoned, though keep in mind that everything is seasoned very similarly. The highlights for me were the grilled lamb and chicken skin. Definitely worth a try if you're feeling adventurous!
column21: North Buttercup Creek, Cedar Park, TX

column20: There aren't too many late night options on this side of town, so I was pleasantly surprised when I saw something that wasn't a fast food chain open past 10pm on a Sunday night. I became even more elated when I saw that it was a Hawaiian BBQ restaurant as this is something that's been missing from the greater Austin area. While there are a handful of poke joints popping up, the amount of places where you can get a loco moco or a Hawaiian bbq plate with a side of mac salad are pretty much nonexistent. Unfortunately, the search still continues. While TLLT advertises itself as both a Chinese and Hawaiian BBQ restaurant, its pretty apparent that the Hawaiian part isn't really their specialty. While they do provide a ton of food for a very reasonable price, the Hawaiian bbq just didn't taste authentic, and to be frank, was a bit disappointing.With that said, I did sample a few things off of the Chinese BBQ menu and was pleasantly surprised. This type of cuisine is new to me so I went with some of the less adventurous options (chicken wings and chicken on a skewer) and they were pretty tasty! I'll definitely be back to do a proper tasting of their Chinese bbq menu and update my review!

I've been searching for a place that would satisfy my drunken skewer needs and this place does it! I was always hoping Austin would have a place similar to Fatni up in Plano...but Cedar Park...close enough that I'm willing to make this trek!I order a bunch of stuff based on reviews and honestly not too sure what folks are talking about for the spices? It seems to be spiced with very typical Chinese bbq spices (so very heavy on the cumin). I don't speak Mandarin so it was pretty helpful that they had a book with all the pictures of the different skewers. While it would probably be very helpful if you did speak the language, it's not necessary and they seemed very friendly.

We are craving for skewer bbq so we headed to TLLT. We ordered 4 skewers each of Lamb, Beef, grilled shrimp, 2 skewers of Fish, chicken skin, pork intestine, chicken gizzards and wonton soup, and Dong-Bei Chaos Pork and veggie Stew. Skewers are on point on flavor, and wonton soup is tasty. Dongbei Stew is a heavy dish but I wish they would make it spicy version. Overall, TLLT fulfilled our cravings and our bellies.
Austin, TX 78717

They may serve spam musubi but don't come here thinking you're going to a Hawaiian bbq. Looks like the star is the skewers. The all I plate was small and underdone. I couldn't pry the meat off the bone no matter how much I tried. The garlic shrimp was not garlic shrimp at all. I was expecting giovanni's or something similar but it was simply overly salted stir fried shrimp. Rice portions were tiny as well. One star for some decent Mac salad. I maybe I haven't had Mac salad in a while.

3.5 starsFair warning, come with someone fluent in Mandarin. Some menu items don't have English translations and servers don't speak much English.I came specifically to try the grilled pig intestine. I was confused by the set up after walking if it was table service or counter service. It's table service.Ordered a few skewers and a whole grilled squid after a bit of a struggle reading the menu. I wasn't disappointed with the pig intestine, it was crispy and chewy, just how I like it! As I went on to eat the other skewers (beef tripe, chicken hearts, yam, squid) I wanted something to balance the heavy seasoning and grill taste. I wanted something sour or veggies! Like pickled jalepenos, daikons, or just plain pickles! Asked but server didn't really understand what I wanted and we didn't see anything on the menu similar.  Ugh! I couldn't finish all the food because it was so heavy tasting without anything to balance. Definitely bringing a jar of pickles next visit!

I was so happy when I opened Yelp! and saw TLLT listed under the new business list! I loved going to these back in Cali and I haven't found any other place in the area that's the same.Both times I went were not busy at all. The lady brought us water immediately and always made sure to refill when it got halfway empty. Hawaiian BBQ is offered but I have yet to try. A lot of diners were ordering from that menu. Ordered from the menu:Grilled squid - whole squid grilled on a plate. It was plump, fresh, and tasty.Sliced pork pig leg w/garlic sauce - The pig leg was good, but the sauce is just soy sauce with chopped garlic. Skewers: beef, chicken, lamb, croaker, chicken skin, beef tendon, chicken gizzard, tripe, string beans, and A-vegetable. Consistently cooked perfectly, the meat was tender and not dry or chewy. I wish they flavored it more with spice (which I'll request next time). Overall the restaurant is clean, service is great and the food is tasty. Note they are closed every Tuesdays.

Delicious food! Lots of choices and some even healthy. Def the best macaroni salad I ever had. Reminds me of my mom / grandma's. The bbq chicken and beef with rice and macaroni is lights out. Yum! The lighter side shrimp with greens and rice is delicious too. Their beef kabobs are tasty too. Highly recommend this place. I'd say it's a fusion of Chinese and Hawaiian combined with normal home cooking. Top notch.

It's a new Chinese BBQ restaurant just opened. Almost everything was served on grilled skewers. I highly recommend grilled lamb kebab and grilled little yellow fish. It's pretty authentic. Since it's just opened, they only serve 10 tables each time. You May have to wait for tables. Another thing is they don't have a receptionist. They only have 4 people working in the kitchen. So when you walked in, nobody will greet you.

Our first visit and first to arrive for an early lunch on a Sunday afternoon.  Most everything on the menu is not English, luckily for pictures it will definitely help you with menu selections with brief descriptions.  We received the food within 15 minutes so I'll give them 5 stars for that.  On the regular plates you get 2 scoops of dry rice, and a very small scoop of Mac salad.  The "Hawaiian" food is misleading.  The Mac salad "may" be considered an island side dish which was not bad, I'll give it a 4.  As for all other dishes, it's all Asian food.  For those who are local from the islands, Hawaiian food is not considered "Asian" food, so get your facts straight.  Hawaiian pizza with pineapple and Canadian bacon is not a Hawaiian, local  dish!!  Back to the food, the beef ribs had a sweet glazed marinade however more than half my ribs were ALL fat, who the heck wants to pay $15 for a plate of fat?!  I expressed and showed the lady who serves as well as is back of the kitchen, I only hope there is hand washing happening between points.  The musubi is an Asian local Hawai'i snack, but not even close to good.  The rice was so dry that it kept falling out of the seaweed wrap, it was not pressed tightly enough to pack it tight and no flavor except whichever meat you chose.  And don't let the pictures mislead you, it may appear that your getting a pile of meat, but under is a bed of shredded cabbage to absorb whatever existing fat  from the flat grill cooking.  It doesn't seem that they have an actual grill based on the appearance of the cooked meats, just my opinion, fact unknown.  Back to my complaint of fatty ribs, since the female staff acted as if she didn't understand me, I chose to give up.  When it was check time, she said manager gave 10% off, wow, a whoopin $1.50 from a bad $15 entree, lol.  We are high tippers, a minimum of 25-40% most times, but this time, they got their 10% back and NOT ever going back.
This place is the best! My family is from Hawaii and have been looking for a place that had good Loco Mocos and Musubi. Great prices and the staff is very friendly. We will be sure to come back!

No Mandarin, Cantonese, Hunanese, Min, Gan, or Wu needed.  We got there around 11:45am and only two table were full.  By the time we left, most of the front section was full and one of the back sections was full.  They still had additional seating in the back available though. The crowd was an eclectic mix of people (Caucasian, Hispanic, Black, and various folks of Asian descent). I think it was predominantly people looking for excellent food.  I spoke with multiple wait staff and they all spoke with understandable accented English. Much better than my one word of Chinese.  XieXie roughly pronounced in English as 'she she'.   The menu is in Mandarin but it has English translations for those who speak only a single language like myself.  Staff was super friendly and answered multiple questions that I had as different dishes pasted by headed to other tables.
