The acoustics of the restaurant are much best than most places were the collective voices turn into a loud sensory loading mummer.  Even with all the table full, we were able to carry on a normal conversation.  Pretty nice. We ordered the seaweed salad, pig leg, short ribs, and bacon wrapped mushrooms.  All the items were on the table in less than 15 minutes.  Presentation of each dish was very nice.  I can state the seaweed salad was the best I have ever had.  Perfect blend of flavors, mild spice, and textures. The pig leg (the menu is very direct in interpretation. I would call it the Pork Delight Plate or something else folksy) was well presented. It's a cool plate of thinly cross sliced pork leg. Very tender with lots of mild flavors.  Its a perfect appetizer or can be part of a main meal. I have never encountered mushrooms wrapped in bacon. They take small bunches of straw mushrooms, wrap with bacon, then broil. WARNING: they are extremely HOT when they come to the table. Let them cool off a bit and I suggest you cut them with knife and fork.  Delicate and delicious.  The short ribs were well marinated and broiled.  The dish comes with steamed rice. Nice caramelization.  Very good.   Full mean for two people plus some leftovers for $30.  We already have the next visit planned.  Seaweed salad, lamb kabobs, and chicken katsu. TLLT BBQ is definitely on 'My Keepers List'.
Awesome spot with great food. Each order is put on the grill as you order it so it is super fresh. So many varieties that you can definitely find something you like. The bbq short ribs were amazing!
Austin, TX 78717

Food is great but I was asking for help if I left my prescribed sun glasses and they were fast to say no. I lost my prescription glasses September 26, 2020 at around noon. For whoever might have seen it, please message me. I would really appreciate it.
Absolutely the most authentic Chinese bbq in Austin! Choices of bbq foods are broad with good quality. I love the cold dishes which are just taste like what I used to have in China.

I've been wanting to try this place for so long, left feeling full and very pleased. I'm happy to have this as an option for a night owl like myself. It was Sunday night, as soon as I walked in and saw that the patrons were Asians at an Asian joint was a good sign. The price was reasonable for the portion. We'll be back again, this place is a keeper.

We had a great experience at TLLT BBQ by Lakeline and 183.The food is very tasty, salty, chewy and crispy. We spent around $25 and tried several dishes. They are open late.There were a couple of odd things: The menu is in Mandarin and has some untranslated text. Also, they don't bring all of the food at once, instead they bring one skewer at a time.

New skewer place next to Hmart yaaaasss!Disclaimer: I only eat skewers, didn't try other dishes You can't miss this place with their neon lights. This place consists of friendly staff and yummy skewers.The seasoning for all the skewers are the same so don't expect flavor variety. However that seasoning is the flavor of my life. I can't get enough of it... could use a bit more salt tho. We had lamb, chicken wings, beef, bacon wrapped enoki mushrooms, potatoes, and a plate of short ribs. They were all great but it would be nice if they add more cumin. Spices and salt.

This is the first time I have had any sort of Hawaiian/Chinese bbq, so I don't have much to compare to. Here for lunch on a Monday (looks like closed Tuesday!), ordered beef bbq. Beef was tender and the mini portion was perfect for lunch. And delicious! After looking around at other diners' food, I wish I had tried the katsui or maybe the seafood combo, not because my food was bad (it was a straightforward dish, easily eaten by non-adventurous eaters), but because some of the other dishes just looked more fun to try. Came here by myself- will definitely bring the husband back.
We went here twice in less than two weeks because their food is so good. Our favorite here is the bbq flat ribs, lamb kabobs, locomoco, & seaweed salad. We will return and try out their other dishes.

There are many mixed reviews, but I love me some Asian BBQ. To my surprise, I wasn't disappointed. I had some Japanese BBQ skewers a week ago and was disappointed because the flavors were bland. These skewers were seasoned and portions were good. I would definitely go back!!

My husband and I used go to often.  But today I told her that the fried pork was not fresh and smelled of old oil.  She fought back and said that it was impossible, our meat was very fresh, and that this was our famous dish.  Sigh....very disappointed. We will never go again.
Austin, TX 78717

The pork feet are still frozen inside and they claimed that is how the bbq should taste like! That's ridiculous!Others taste totally different from the one in LA and I doubt whether this store got the authorization from TLLT. Also they only allow two credit cards to split the bill. Will never be there again.
Super good! Super authentic Northern Chinese grill!They have the food I love when I was in Home town. Id like to come often.

Portion size good.  Friendly owners.Almost everything else was bad though.  The wait was extremely long when almost no one was in the restaurant.  The food was pretty bland and all of my coworkers agreed their dishes were comparably bad.  If you do go, maybe get the garlic shrimp, that dish seemed to get the best round table review.

Amazing and authentic Chinese food, very close to Cedar Park! Having lived in China for 2 years, I truly missed eating good Northeastern Chinese food (东北菜). Lo and behold, TLLT has it all! Their BBQ skewers are mouth-watering and they have my all-time favorite Chinese food: 锅包肉 (double-cooked pork slices)!!! If you want to experience the flavor of this as you would eat it in Shanghai (which is known  for sweet food), then ask them to make this sweeter when ordering. You're welcome.
Ok perfect comfort food. I am in Love!!  You have to try it.They have a very good menu

We were excited to try the food here but unfortunately, it was a very bad first impression. I'm rating it 1 star because it took 37 minutes for our food to come out and it was a take out order!!!?! This is unacceptable!! From the time we placed the order at the counter, it literally took 37 minutes. My husband was furious when a family just came in to dine and there food was brought out before our order and he had been waiting a long time already! Their excuse was the grilled bass takes a long time to cook. That's baloney!! Grilled bass cooks very quickly so that's nonsense. At least apologize and take something off our bill for the inconvenience and inordinate amount of time sitting around waiting for our food when you didn't have operation together. You poorly prioritized how the orders came out. We ordered beef, chicken, lamb, shrimp and squid skewers. All skewers were overcooked and on the dry side. Squid was not on skewers but in loose pieces in the to go container. The grilled shrimp  was the tastiest but there was only one single shrimp on the skewer - for real! Seasoning was good but because the meat was too dry, it took away from the overall taste. Grilled bass was cooked well but had too many small bones we couldn't eat half of it! Grilled bass also needs some sauce or lemon wedges to accompany it because otherwise it didn't have much flavor. I pulled out pre-made seasoned Vietnamese fish sauce that I had in my fridge. Otherwise, why order a dry cold grilled bass fish with tons of tiny bones?? No, will not order the bass again. Also would not order the grilled eggplant again. It was entirely a sloppy slimy goopy soggy clump by the time it got home. Based on our first and only experience with take out at TLLT, I would steer you away from take out orders unless they better manage their operations.  This is the former Mama Fu's location but they've walled off the right side where the strip of booths were (not sure what that space is being used for now) so the interior dining space is smaller. There are a couple wait staff who take your order if you dine in. Also the individual skewers while reasonably priced come with nothing so I reheated some steamed rice and sauteed snow peas I had in my fridge to eat with our order. Beware of the long wait times for take out!!

Amazing amazing food. After living in Hawaii for a while, I craved an authentic chill place to eat that wasn't charging tourist prices(Hello places charging 12 bucks for little musubi), this place does it right. Great prices, HUUUUGE loco mocos and spam musubi done just like your favorite corner store on the island. Open late too, which rules. Can't wait to keep trying more stuff.
It's Chinese skewers, not hawaiian. delicious and cheap. lots of variety. great vegetarian selections too. love it. lamb and chives are my favorite.
Hawian BBQ? Sounds Great!  But the only thing BBQ about this place is the giant B's and Q out front.  It's weird Chinese food. So disappointed.
Austin, TX 78717

This is now one of my favorite places. This restaurant is made for anyone who's watching their weight. They have three hard-boiled eggs on a skewer, barbecued corn on a skewer, green beans on a skewer, and the best beef and chicken on a skewer. The taste was sublime. And it was not expensive. Definitely a "go to" place!
Soooooo soooo good.  Food was good.  Service was good.  Can't wait to come back again and try out their Kareoke place too!!!

WARNING: TLLT does not serve up traditional Texas BBQ. No brisket. No sausage.  No pork ribs except a hotdog on a stick. However, it's a specialty Chinese restaurant that grills everything over an open flame, and when I say "everything" I mean everything; meats, veggies, bread and rice. The menu is a giant picture book to let non-Asian patrons know what is served. TLLT grills just about every part of the animal's body, from the rooter to the tooter. If you want pigs feet. They got it. If you're hankering for lamb testicles. They got it. Seaweed pickled in ginger, they got that too - which is fabulous, BTW! I went basic with chicken wings, chicken kabob, and a plate of fried rice. The technique to their grilling is kabob style, and that's how it is served. I gotta tell ya, that chicken was amazing! Even the fried rice had that open flame taste. Downside is limited drink options and lack of explanation of what it is one wants to order.

When I eat here with my family the tables are set up close together so it is a cozy setting being able to eat with other families that may be dining there as well. I love to eat the lamb and the squid here. The vegetable soup is good if you can enjoy a spicier dish. Great service and prices are good. You can order a la carte or entree style. Family atmosphere we are regulars here may twice a month.

This is an interesting concept. Similar to tapas. Small portions for under $2 a pop. Very wide verity most are familiar and some items are adventurus.For the most part an excellent place to bring a date and eat lite and enguage in conversation.Quiet surrounding's.
Authentic north-eastern Chinese food. Very nice Chinese bbq, and very nice dishes like north-eastern stew, 锅包肉.
Takes to long to get food! Very slow especially if you're on lunch break! Don't have time to sit around for 30 minutes for food! Also, the food sucks! Undercooked chicken! Made me sick!
Authentic Chinese BBQ! it is definitely the best one in Austin. I live close by and have dinner there almost every week. Service is pretty good and staff are friendly.

Some of the worst food I have ever tired to eat!! The meat was mostly fat & the rice was cold. The employees barely spoke/understood English. The food court at the mall has better food!!!Couldn't eat it, left it on the table, a waste of money!
Austin, TX 78721

Um, don't go here if you're not a fan of the ghetto- it's on MLK and Springdale..DO go here if you want delicious BBQ for $5 for half a pound or half a chicken. It is certainly rough around the edges and Willie himself is too, but who cares, the meat is delicious. It's always awkward saying that...
The food was inedible, the brisket is extremely salty, the sauce is very tart and the beans are salty and dry. The worst lunch ever. Do not waste your time or money picking up food from this place.
What I like about this place is he is upfront and will tell you you get what he gives you and if you don't like it go somewhere else and I have yet to go somewhere else very good barbecue

I visited this location today and ordered a two meat plate with chicken and sausage. The two meat plate comes with beans, potato salad, pickles, onions, two slices of white bread and saltine crackers.  After my party of four and I arrived, we received our food within 6 minutes from order to table. The sausage was flavorful, however the chicken was a bit dry. The chicken was served cut up in pieces which was surprising as chicken when barbecued tends to be served whole, perhaps this is explains some of the dryness of the chicken. The owner was the individual who served my parties plates when they were ready.  Both the owner and the cashier were helpful and served up a whole bunch of southern charm.

Second time here with the 1/2 lb brisket. Really good! Had the peach cobbler the first time and it was great! Come with pickles, onions, white bread and crackers. Had an A&W to wash it down. Will make Willie's a regular!

Doesn't matter what you order everything is good the turkey legs were amazing I got one additional leg to go to. We had the brisket sausage turkey legs and ribs everything was just amazing thanks Mister Willie
Best bbq in Austin! And you dont have to wait 10 hrs for it! 2 meat plate is my goto! Brisket / Sausage. Beans and Potato Salad are top notch too!

This place use to have good sausage.  My recent visit the sausage tasted horrible and DID NOT taste like beef sausage at all, it taste like 2 day old sausage reheated, was VERY dry and brown colored.  I didn't waste my time and gas to return it, I just tossed it out.  After just one bite, a couple of minutes later I felt sick of the stomach, so it must have been old sausage. Next time I'll spend an extra couple of dollars and drive to Elgin for some true beef sausage.

I use to drive across town just to buy my usual  1/2 pound sausage.  This past Saturday I went there and ordered my usual  1/2 pound sausage.  Couldn't wait to taste it so I dug into it while driving.  It had so much grease..... I took a piece and ate it and notice it had a slightly spoil taste, Didnt think much about it so  I ate it anyway.  After eating it all, about less than an hour later, while on my way to shop, my stomach felt really bad so I turned around and went straight home.  Soon as I unlocked the door I could feel it coming out,  I ran quickly to the restroom and BARELY made it to the toit.  It was BAD.  I WILL NEVER GO THERE ANYMORE!  Once I get a hold of ANY bad foods, I will NEVER return to that same place ever again.
Austin, TX 78721

Willys is the real deal! A true part of East Austin culture and history. They've been there forever and are Full of the old-school East Austin vibe. This is not a hipster barbecue opened by  some investor group. Willie  himself is a hoot. He loves to talk and can tell you all kinds of stories. Their brisket is very good as is their chop beef sandwich.Downright cheap For what it is.

The service and speed were impressive off the bat. I got a sausage sandwich (delicious), and my nephew assured me that the brisket & ribs plate was great as well. They had a good amount of seasoning/sauce without drenching the meat.

I was going to try the BBQ trailer just a couple blocks down but, they were closed so, I saw this place and stopped in.  To be fair I wish I could give it 3.5 stars but, I can't justify a full 4.I felt that it was a little on the high end price wise for what you received.  All right time to break down my entire plate.I ordered the 2 meat plate with brisket and sausage for $11.50.  It also came with potato salad, baked beans, bread, saltines, pickles and onions.Brisket:  The smoke flavor and smoke rim on it was very impressive.  As I type this the smokey flavor is still lingering in my mouth!  However, the brisket was very fatty and I like fatty cuts but, this wasn't as good as others that I have had.  It seemed that each bite was different than the last.Sausage:  Once again the smoke flavor of the meat was very impressive.  I would come back here to order the sausage again.  It really was a great quality.The BBQ: It wasn't thick and was a bit on the runny side but, it sure packed a Texas sized spicy flavor to it.  I felt it complimented everything really well!  Yummy!Potato Salad:  This was my least favorite part of the meal.  First let me say that I prefer traditional potato salad to mustard potato salad.  This was mustard potato salad and it also had sweet relish in it (I think).  Overall, it was just not good but, then again I don't like sweet pickles or relish either.Baked Beans:  I am not a huge fan of the baked beans in general but, I have to say they were definitely homemade and they were good.  I ate a few bites just to try them!Fixins:  My meal came with 3.5 pickles and one sliver of onion.  Booo!  Come on I think we can throw a few more on!  They did give me 3 slices of bread but, personally I never use the bread.Beverage Fridge:  They have Sunkist and 7 Up in glass bottles!!!!  Wooohooo! Not too shabby!Service:  The service was fast and it is only counter service.  They do have tables inside but, I just ordered take out.  I believe this may have been the family that owns the place working there but, not sure.  They gave me ample napkins and silverware so, it's nice to see that they don't forget anything.Parking:  Sort of a nightmare since there is a convenience store attached to it.  I am pretty sure that I parked illegally however, I was in and out.  It was easy to get in and out of the parking lot here though; not too much traffic.Neighborhood:  Not that great and I did see a man pushing a lawn mower down the sidewalk.  Sort of the same principal of knowing you are in a bad neighborhood by how many abandoned shopping carts their are!  Come during the day!

Hole in the wall BBQ joint for sure! If you are afraid of the hood, then maybe this place isn't for you. The guys in the kitchen were all super friendly. There were 11 of us eating in their tiny dining area but they made sure to accommodate us and treated us well. Brisket and boudain were good. I don't remember the potato salad or whatever it was so it probably wasn't that great. I mean, you don't go to a BBQ place for their sides amiright???
I cannot say anything about the location as I did not visit the spot, however the BBQ sandwich my friend brought to me was absolutely superb. I know where to go if I want a good BBQ sandwich.

I have been coming to this place for about 9 years now and it's just as good as the first time I ate it almost a decade ago. I meant to take a picture of my food before I got into it but unfortunately I forgot. I always go with the sausage and brisket combo plate personally. Also for anybody wondering they are gluten free.
Good sliced beef sandwich fpr $4. But not at all the best though. Bread was the let down
Been holding it down for over 30 yrs. Besy mutton in town. Make sure you ask for dry sausage. Great smoky brisket. Been going there since i was a kid. Great community landmarks

This food is awesome.  Seriously rivals many other well known places in town.  Not fancy and no flash, just very, VERY good bar b que.  the sauce is a perfect combo of sweet and little spice.  Sausage, mutton, ribs and chicken were all perfectly cooked and delicious.  Can't wait to go back and try the brisket!  By the way the banana pudding was awesome too.
Austin, TX 78721

I've been here once, but one thing will bring me back.Is it the brisket? Not so much. I've had much better. The beans? Eh. The sauce? I'd rather not. The atmosphere and locale are a little off putting. That said, the service was pretty nice. I also did discover that Big Red is the best stuff to drink with barbecue because I drank it too fast and the burp that erupted tasted of awesome.The one thing that will bring me back to Willie's is the boudin. It was one of the most surprising discoveries I've ever had. The combination of rice, sausage, and cajun spices is perfect. This was the first time I've had boudin and I've seriously been missing out all of these years. I'll definitely come back to Willie's for this.

The brisket was fatty on the end and had a good char on it, which is exactly how I like it.  Boudin sausage was awesome. Beans were goid, potato salad was home made but too tart, not my style. The staff was extremely friendly. Well worth the time to stop.

When you first open the door the scent just knocks your nose. I ordered the brisket plate and it came with beans and potato salad. The brisket alone was flavorful and didn't need the BBQ sauce it was in, but I didn't hate, together it was all that more tasty and enjoyed the experience. The attendants were friendly and atmosphere comfortable.

A few years, two barbecue joints in town were busted for buying stolen meat. Sam's Bar-B-Cue was one of them and the other was Willie's Bar-B-Que. I recently had the boudin sausage from Willie's and wanted some more of it. Willie's shares space with a barbershop and a gas station so you could easily miss it as you drive by.You can only order the meat by the half pound so I went with a three-meat plate that is not listed on the menu. The plate came with moist brisket, pork ribs, and Elgin sausage with sides of potato salad and beans. I also added a link of boudin sausage. When I got my food, I looked down and saw a lot of the meats covered in barbecue sauce and seasoned salt. I thought that was a weird touch. The brisket was thinly sliced into small rectangular cuts. I did find an unscathed piece from the sauce and salt. The brisket tasted like smoky roast beef. There was not a whole lot of flavor so the seasoning salt and sauce did come in handy. The ribs were gray on the outside and pink on the inside. It was void of any flavor. Without the pink, I would have guessed the ribs were cooked in an oven the day before. The meat was tender and coming off the bone. The sausage had a nice spicy bite, but the casing was really chewy. It was beefy and a good amount of fat. The smoked boudin was definitely the highlight. The casing was snappy and could barely hold in the filling. The richness of the sausage played nice with the Cajun spices. I would have liked to see a little bit more meat in it because it was very heavy on the rice. There was nothing to note about the sides. Plain, bland, and probably store bought.I do not know if I could trust a restaurant that would buy stolen meat. The word quality comes to mind. If you are taking a chance on your main product, what else are you willing to do? Willie's smoked boudin was solid, but I would rather go to Smokey Denmark for that.
Favorite place to take kids before any type of UT game.  Only place in town to get mutton.  Yes, this whiteboy grew up.in the 23 and loves some mutton

Basically like the homey bbq like you get out of trucks downtown complete with styrofoam plates. Except it's not a truck and has a few tables. The place is dingy and the bars on the windows certainly are not inviting. Really the only thing the place has going for it is the food but that's enough.
just a simple place with great friendly service and great BBQ.

I'm not a BBQ aficionado but this place is awesome! The brisket moist and tender, the ribs flavorful and the chicken delicious too!I don't really eat sausage but my coworkers loved that as well.The beans and potato salad are a nice accompaniment but the star here is the meat.I'll be back and will tell all my friends! You should go!

I have been eating this bbq since a kid. It's decent due to the smoked flavor. Reasonably priced, decent portions, meat taste is great, service is okay. This place Comes the closest to home cooked bbq taste for me.
Austin, TX 78721

I have seen it for the last 4 or 5 months on my way to and from work.  After reading reviews on here i decided to give it a try the other day.  I got the 2 meat plate.  My pick was brisket(i love brisket, it is the symbol of BBQ, but maybe that because I am from Texas) and sausage.  The sides were rather on the small side and nothing special, edible.  The sausage, while very tender and good, was very greasy.  The brisket was really good.  But they don't give you a lot of sauce and your sausage sits in the same side of the brisket.  So it kind of soaks up that grease too.All in all it filled me up really good.  Meat portions were plenty. Filled me up so much that almost 6 hrs later i was still full and stomach ached a little.  I am dead set that is was the really greasy sausage.  I would say shy away from it, or thoroughly drain it and pat it down first.  I should have went for the ribs & brisket or just the brisket plate.  I will be making it back there since its pretty close.  I may just go for a 1/2 lb of brisket though.

Yay, I get the first review!I only discovered Willie's because it's right near my house; normally I'd drive right past it. It's in a little shopping center with a mini-grocery at one end and a barber shop in the middle. Then there's Willie's at the end, which has to serve about the best damn brisket I've ever had. I wasn't even a real brisket fan before I discovered Willie's. Now, whenever I come in, they know exactly what I want.Folks might be wary when first walking in -- it certainly doesn't look like much, and it's not the best place to dine in -- unless you don't mind a blaring television, plastic-covered tables, and a couple of wailing kids (of which there always seems to be at least a pair). But the barbecue is cheap and delicious, and you might well find yourself addicted, just like me.

Thier prices might have gone up a tiny bit but Iam wondering if the super nationally  publicized light blue/ green place on 11th behind the county federal credit union that I've never able to at least sample  to Thier overnight and camp out crowd has anything to compare when I've had the awesome consolation of having the brisket and mullet without much and wait at this place.

I have no idea how I ended up finding the great brisket this place serves but the location and looks verifies the phrase "looks can be deceiving!"     The fares that are served here good.  Had given up on lamb but after tasting a sample of theirs, it renewed my hope.     Biggest plus is that thier price is lower than most bar-b-cue places in town.
Fatty brisket, hideous potato salad, and banana pudding was something chemical out of a box. Yikes! I'll not darken their door again.
Closed down by the City/County Health Dept.  Bought stolen meat from undercover police officers.  kvue.com/news/Austin-res…
SHUTDOWN and the owners have been arrested for sending people to HEB to steal meat by shoving it down their pants! EWE! kxan.com/dpp/news/local/…

I happened upon Willie's while I was busy getting lost in Austin, and I am extremely glad I did. Willies is actually I bit more East Texas BBQ than I was expected, but the standout dish was BBQ Mutton, which I've never had outside the confines of the rodeo. I was perfectly prepared and not dry in the slightest. While you're never going to get anything but bare bones service and amenities, the quality of the meat more than makes up for it.

This is as gritty-real as BBQ can possibly be.  From the bars on the the windows out front, to the smoke stained wood paneling on the walls.  Pure smokey goodness, you just can't get from other so-called BBQ establishments ... no liquid smoke has ever been near the likes of this place.  This place has heart and soul in one bite of brisket, than many others have in their entire business.  Check out Willie's, they don't mess around.
Austin, TX 78753

Living less than 5 miles from here, they've become my new spot for a BBQ craving fix.  If you don't know about the difference oak wood makes in the cooking process, it's hotter, so there's a better bark and meatier texture vs what can seem like "steamed brisket" at some other places.They cook enough for that day and routinely sell out, so you know it's fresh.HUGE outdoor area, lots of indoor seating, and a solid selection of cold beers straight from the fridge or tap.If you're used to BBQ in Dallas, that style is here in Austin now and it's worth a taste!

If you've never had oak smoked bbq before you're in for a new taste treat.  A darker, sharper smoke at a different heat, it permeates the brisket that much more.  This is BBQ on par with Iron Works and Stiles Switch.  It's great to finally have good BBQ north that's not from a chain!

We really enjoyed it! Dog friendly!!! The staff was really friendly and the food was delicious. I got the brisket sandwich lean and while there was a mishap and the chopped brisket was SUPER fatty, they gladly switched it out for lean brisket with no dirty looks lol. The bartenders were really nice and helpful and the outdoor area is spread out and great for sunny weather. I can see why other people complained about the fatty meat- some people love it though so I'd just say Either order lean or expect the brisket to be on the super fatty side. I only took off a star bc the drink selection left something to be desired for me personally. Nothing top shelf available unless you're drinking beer lol I'm sorry but I am too old for Andre mimosas. I'd rather pay extra and have decent champagne.  We will definitely come back. Boyfriend and his mom got the crawfish and they loved it. Brisket nachos were also good (more like bar food for reference). Solid outdoor patio for bbq and beer!

Best Sunday we've had in a long time! Delicious BBQ nachos, cold beer on draft, fantastic service, and incredible blues music...Couldn't ask for more! It was very easy to social-distance, and the staff appeared to be doing a good job with masks, etc. Looking forward to next time!

We decided to venture on this rainy Sunday for some bbq after a friend mentioned Oakwood bbq, which is a new spot right by Braker and I-35 in North Austin.We tried the sampler which was great to get to try everything and also eliminated the normal challenge of figuring out what we wanted. We chose burnt end beans and mac n cheese to go with the sliced brisket, pork, turkey, sausage, and delicious cucumber. The turkey and the sauce were probably our favorites. I'd like to go back on a nicer day as they had super cool outside space with a live band and places to play cornhole and connect 4 as well as a decent amount of beer on tap.

I was stoked about this spot, but I should have read the reviews before going. The two stars are for my side dishes which were ok. I got brisket and ribs; both were overcooked and dry. The ribs were so bad that on one bite some of the bone came off with the meat. The brisket was dry and leathery, luckily the have decent bbq sauce that I used to smother the brisket for some moisture. I don't usually leave bbq on my plate but I did this time. Additionally employees were not wearing masks! I should have left when I saw that, but I guess I'm just too nice and was hoping that the food would be worthwhile.

CRAWFISH REVIEW: Vibes, yes. Live band, yes. Other than that, no. They offer their regular menu, along with their seasonal crawfish menu. We ordered 3-lbs of crawfish (corn/potatoes not included) for $12 each. Waiting for our order, it took almost an hour for a fresh batch to be finished. Luckily, we had beer and the sweet sounds of the Larry Harris Band to occupy us. When it came out, we were even more disappointed. The batch was a bit overcooked and flavorless. How can you tell it's overcooked? When you pinch the tail and it disintegrates in between your thumb and pointer finger, that's how you know. If it's flavorless, it means the batch hasn't been soaking long enough for the flavors to merry. Boiling crawfish is an art, and sadly, Oakwood is a novice.

Parking is OK. Walk in and order your food. We came to enjoy the crawfish. Pricing was average. Not sure why we couldn't order our food and drinks at the same register. Literally saw a woman take cold cans of beer from where we ordered to the back of the building. Which is where we then had to order the beer. Everything seemed a little rundown but maybe that was the intentional vibe. Food came out in less than 1015 minutes. Unfortunately our whole plate was cold. Potatoes were OK sausage taste it cheap and the crawfish weren't that big. After telling the host about our cold plate the manager proceeded to tell me food can stay cold without getting people sick for up to Exemouth of hours. I was not impressed or intrigued. Our same plate exact same plate came out with no adjustments other than more spice and warm. I hate asking people to take my food but I hate even more getting the exact same plate back for fear they might add "special sauce" Hubby and I chose to eat our food drink a beer and enjoy the music. We sat inside but if we ever go back we will sit outside if the weather is good because it has a cool backyard. Even dog friendly. Don't expect much and give this place a try I'm hoping my experience will be better next time and that your experience is definitely better than mine.
Great pork ribs. Fresh cole slaw. Beautiful backyard seating area. Gruff staff. Free live music Thursday nights n Sundays. Been here once. Will be back.
Austin, TX 78753
Omg.  Love this place.  Excellent customer service. Great food.  Love it.Traveling ..saw it on Yelp.  Why not give it a try.  Love the spot.

This place has a really really delicious bbq menu. I recommend the meat platter with ribs and the brisket (but don't get the really fatty one, the leaner one is probably better). Really curious to try their other meat selections.Had the Mac n cheese, potato salad, and cole slaw as a side - not a huge fan of their cole slaw recipe (a bit too sweet for me) but the Mac n cheese was pretty good. I recommend coming here with kids since there is a nice spacious backyard with games, a stage, and multiple tables. They usually have an outdoor show on some days so feel like it would be really fun to go then.
Sampler delivered some good expectations. Liked the pickled cucumbers n onions. Perfect turkey! Kinda drier than I prefer but bbq sauce right on the money.

First time trying food from here and it wont be my last.I ordered the following - Pit Burger: This is a nice burger, I really enjoyed it.  It is cooked perfectly and has a subtle smoke flavor and thick but not to thick.  The bread is soft and fresh. The house made pickles and pickled onions compliment the meat very well.French Fries: Nothing to write home about, your basic french fries.Burnt End Beans:  Not what I expected. Most burnt end beans I have had from BBQ places, they are smoky tasting but these are on the sweet side, not smoky flavored at all. They are OK, just not what I was expecting to get - but definitely not bad, just different.BBQ Sauce: I am generally not a fan of this stuff, but I would get this again from here for sure.  I did not use it on my delicious hamburger though but used it for my fries.All in all, I really enjoyed my lunch I ordered through Lunch Drop. I would like to go to the restaurant next and try some more of the menu items for sure.

I am new to Austin & wanted to try a local BBQ place rather than go to Rudy's or Coopers. But let me tell you, that was a BIG mistake... I ordered a mixed BBQ plate with two sides. The chicken, brisket, sausage, ribs & pork were all super dry & cold. It tasted as if the meat had been leftover or sitting out for hours, without being warmed up. The sides were subpar as well, do not get the potato salad. To say the least, I was very disappointed at this place & their "BBQ". Do not waste your time or money here... you will be dissatisfied.
Good experience all around.  The band was good, only a little too loud.  Outdoor seating under a canopy of leaves.  We had the pork nachos...delicious. Reasonable price.

I hate to give a 1 star review during a pandemic, but this place made me wish I went to bed hungry. It was a $60 meal that could've been 20... We ordered the family pack meal with moist brisket, sausages, mac, and creamed corn. We also ordered a side of fries, chocolate cake, banana pudding, and oreo cheesecake. I'm not sure of this, but honestly, they served frozen food that you can buy at the grocery store. It was odd that everything we tasted, felt like the stuff that we can find in the freezer aisle. It was the blandest of the bland, extremely small proportions, and very odd cuts. Brisket moist: more than 90% of the 'meat' was fat. We barely had anything to eat. At least it was moist and was the only thing that had salt and pepper.. Sausage: I'm trying to remember the brand name, but it literally tastes, looks, and feels like that long cheap sausage that you can buy at any grocery store. Ridiculous. Mac cheese: tasted like flour, pasta way over cooked, it was an odd burn flour looking color, tasted like nothing, and was gritty???Creamed corn: it wasnt creamy at all, it looked like corn tossed in flour and milk, color was of sand Fries: same exact thing!! I can go into the freezer aisle and find any fries and cook it myself. It tasted the same exact way. Usually fries have salt on them, this was cooked and thrown into the take away box.The desserts were the nail in the coffin. We cried when they were tasted. The banana pudding was milk like, the whipped cream was the common canned whipped cream that you can buy at the store. (It was a liquid when we got it) the oreo pie tasted like stale oreos, no cream cheese, and whipped cream. Chocolate cake felt like we were eating a dry block of chocolate and tons of raw sugar. The best part? All 3 of us were sick when we woke up. Beware of this restaurant people... take your money elsewhere.

This place is awesome.  A great area out back with a stage for live music.  Love the BBQ and the green beans cooked in bacon (or something ridiculous like that) are just amazing.  The staff is always great, too.

My husband has had lunch here before and swore up and down this place was the bees knees. He was not wrong!You order at the counter and they have a simple easy to follow menu. You can get a regular meat plate, they even have family meal options, along with sandwiches. My husband got the brisket meat plate with the Mac and Cheese, I got The Herd Sandwich combo with green beans, my Mom got the slider combo where you pick 3 sandwich choices and the burnt end beans, and my Dad got one of the sandwiches choices with the potato salad. Here's the general consensus: Mac and cheese and green beans were fire. The beans and potato salad were lacking. The meats were the best part! Very flavorful and delicious. I would definitely come back here 100%They have a giant outdoor area that's really beautiful. They have a stage for live music. The only real downfall is the parking situation.
Austin, TX 78753
Food was very very bland! Crawfish was basic with not much flavor at all. Even tea was gross. Patio area was cool but filthy. :(

I absolutely love this place. Ordered a handful of times through Postmates. I do have to say I'm pretty bummed with my order this time because I ordered 1/2 pound of brisket and basically got 1/2 pound of fat. The brisket is my favorite too! Please go easy on the fat next time. Thanks!

Have been to this spot several times over the last year because I work around the corner. For months now their soda fountain machine has been flat and their tea tastes old. Very disappointing considering it has been brought to their attention many times by myself and coworkers. It's nice to enjoy a fizzy soda every now and again especially with BBQ. Will not be coming here anymore because they unfortunately cannot respond to constructive criticism which would ultimately make their business better. Not sure how anyone can stand to drink from that flat soda machine for this long.

Felt like we were walking into somebody else's home uninvited. No one greeted us or gave us any direction on how/where to order. Terrible customer service. Stayed about 5 min without any word from the staff before deciding to take our business elsewhere. Unfortunate because we were super excited to try this place out!

Last week I was really craving a bbq baked potato and saw that they had called the "Mater Tater" on their menu. So I ordered that with the chopped brisket and the banana pudding through Post Mates. Unfortunately the potato was still hard and wasn't cooked through fully. Which was a huge disappointment.The brisket was okay, however I did enjoy the bbq sauce and the beans that were on the potato. The banana pudding was a bit runny but the flavor was tasty! Considering their high ratings I was disappointed in the preparation of the food I received.

After having some barbecue during the week, I opted to try yet another venue to experience one's interpretation of Texas barbecue, and this location beaconed me on Yelp. After getting misdirected, I then used the map that was p[roveided and arrived rather quickly. Touted as a beer and barbecue restaurant, I was curious to see it.      Upon entering, you are welcomed to a cozy dining area that emptied to a patio that had tables, playthings for the kids, and a stage for entertaining. I then ordered the standard two meat plate and waited for my meal. After I returned home, I opened the container and was p[pleasantly surprised with the aroma that arose from the styrofoam container and was pleasantly surprised with the quantity of the food.       The brisket was flavorful and had a nice char on the surface. The sausage was very flavorful and had a subtle hint of heat, but was lacking texture both in the sausage itself and on the casing. I would have liked a char or "something" on the casing. The beans were perfectly cooked by themselves and were loaded with brisket ends which turned them into a meal. The barbecue was complimentary and did not take away from the flavor of the meal. Finally, the coleslaw was balanced and shredded (or cut) perfectly it was just creamy enough.     Finally, I am glad Yelp steered me toward another barbecue restaurant which is located between home and work. I will try this restaurant again and will get the courage to eat in!!  Give it a try if you are in the area!!

I've only had it once and had it delivered, so I haven't been inside, but it was pretty dang tasty! They gave me a nice sized portion of brisket and lots of the crispy end pieces as well. I had the beans, which also had burnt brisket in it. Yum! I don't remember what other side, likely potato salad, but no recollection of it. I got the pie as well and wasn't really a great value for the piece I got, but it was good. It was the Oreo cheesecake. Definitely would try them out once it's safe to sit inside or have it delivered again. It's nice to be able to support local when you can.

Food is very good, prices are reasonable, great for kids, pets, and adults. Social distancing is super easy especially outside. The live oaks outside are amazing too. Darts, corn hole, connect four, and jenga is available. Outdoor space is great, like a backyard. If the weather is nice, even better!
The best BBQ in Austin. I ordered a sliced beef sandwich.  The meat was tender and moist with a perfect mix of seasoned bark (blackened outer edges). I will definitely be eating there again!
Austin, TX 78753

Long story short. Nice people.  At least one good side order.  And good pork dishes.  The rest?  Well, room for improvement.The gentleman at the counter was beyond nice and friendly.  The ribs were well above average and have a delightful glaze with a hint of sweetness.  The sausage was ok, but improved even more once it sat a bit.  The BBQ sauce is also excellent.  There's nothing special to note about the sauce, just a good accompaniment to the meat.  And both my dining companion and I really enjoyed the homemade kettle potato chips.Now, let's talk about the less pleasant aspects of the meal.  First, we ordered turkey.  Said turkey never made it to our plate.  Apparently, no one in the back of the restaurant told the people taking orders that they were out of turkey.  To their credit, we received a bit extra of the other meats we ordered. (As other Yelpers have noted, the BBQ is cut and prepared in a back kitchen.)  The brisket was a real let down from the typical high quality brisket you see at most BBQ purveyors in Austin.  The meat was poorly cut.  More importantly, the brisket didn't taste good -- whether it was the lack of bark, the lack of smoke or pepper, or maybe needing more time in the pit to let the fat properly render, this brisket wasn't ready for prime time.  And one other kitchen flub -- we never got the fries we ordered.  I mentioned this when the food was brought out and there was a promise to return with fries.  And again, before we finished our meal, I asked about the fries.  The kitchen staff claimed ignorance again.  The gentleman at the counter was gracious, removed the charge, and surmised that somehow the order for the fries was never transmitted to the kitchen.  Perhaps so, although the amount of people waiting for orders, especially to-go orders, indicated that there might be a bigger problem with the team in the kitchen.Between this and some other glitches, it's clear that the folks at Oakwood want to provide good BBQ and good service -- but they're not there yet.  Like so many BBQ places, good BBQ can only carry you so far -- the service and the rest of the experience has to be on point too.

We were in need of a nice Saturday dinner and decided on Oakwood. Ordering online was easy and fast. Food was hot and ready right when I walked in. Staff was very friendly. Got a family meal of brisket, sausage, cream corn, and mac & cheese. Great value for the price. The brisket was amazing! Delicious flavor, moist, and fork tender. The sausage was also very good. The cream corn was alright. Not much flavor but nothing terrible.Sadly the mac & cheese was vile. It had some veggie/uncooked flour flavor to it. No cheese flavor at all. Couldn't finish it.The meat was great but the sides dropped the ball.
This BBQ place make it seem like everyone can get into the BBQ business the food does not even taste like it was from a smoker but from a oven

We came by on a Sunday for the first crawfish boil of the season. We arrived at 1:16 and were told the wait for crawfish was 30-45. No big deal. 30-45 min is enough time to socialize and have a couple of drinks before everyone starts to get hungry. It's 2:45 and the food is still not here. You know being a yelper comes with making the tough decision to leave reviews that are neutral and unfortunately that is what it's coming down to today. I've never been here to eat any of the bbq but since it's crawfish season why not?If your looking to eat crawfish would definitely recommend going somewhere else. Having to wait over an hour and a half to get crawfish is not worth an executives time.
Decent bbq, good tunes, and a great atmosphere. They welcome dogs and the staff are very friendly. Good show guys. Keep up the excellent service. It was thoroughly enjoyed
Decent bbq, good tunes, and a great atmosphere. They welcome dogs and the staff are very friendly. Good show guys. Keep up the excellent service.

This is a bbq joint, review will be a short and sweet!Good and tasty brisket, ribs and sausage. I loved the spicy sausage and moist brisket. Also loved that they have pickled red onions. Sides didn't hit the mark for me, cannot beat Rudy's creamed corn. We were offered a free pulled pork nachos because someone ordered and cancelled. I was pleasantly surprised. I normally wouldn't order pulled pork, buy it was pretty good! I liked the homey feel of the dining area. I didn't check out the patio because it was dark (at night).

We sat inside because it just isn't the time of year to be outdoors for me. Next time for sure. Damn good ribs. The meat falls off the bone. Not real fatty and good bark. These were so good and I will go back for them and the other choices of meat. Brisket was just ok. It was room temp though and needed a bit more salt and pepper. Frito Pie! Wowzers. This is usually a special. This was great. It had mac n.. cheese on it which was kinda odd but interesting. The beans were great too. I would get this again with extra beans and meat. Green Beans! Yum. I will try the other sides next time!

I got a 3 meat plate and my friend got a 2 meat plate, but SOMEHOW ENDED UP WITH 4 slices of brisket compared to my ONE. And I got a tiny shitty little piece of chicken and some sausage.. how does a two meat plate have more meat than a three? Ridiculous. Had it delivered and paid $50 to be ripped off. Never again.
Austin, TX 78753

Worst potato salad I've had. Delivery service is poor. My last order was wrong. I ordered Mac n cheese and received creamer corn. The food was spilled and the delivery containers broken. Ordered a stuffed baked potato with brisket. It has very little meat and included jalapeños and onions which was also not part of the order. I gave this place a second go but I will not be returning.

I can't recommend this place as the service is lackluster and the food is well below average.  We showed up on a Sunday afternoon and found the place somewhat busy and seriously understaffed.  We ordered pork ribs, brisket, sausage, smoked turkey, creamed corn, Cole Slaw, mac and cheese and fried okra.  The brisket was very dry as if it had been sitting under a warming lamp all day.  The sausage was average, lacking smoked flavor.  The pork ribs were also dry and lacked smoked flavor.  Only the BBQ sauce made the dry and flavorless meat edible.  The sides were OK, with the creamed corn and fried okra being the best of the lot.  The Cole Slaw was likely purchased from a local grocery store and the mac and cheese was overcooked to the point of being mushy.  We ordered three kid's meals, which were nothing more than fried chicken tenders and french fries.  The one meal that was delivered (they forgot to make the other two) had overcooked tenders, to the point of being burned.  Our grandchild refused to eat the tenders, and I don't blame her.  We inquired about the other two orders, and the waitress said they would get them right out.  By the time the other two kid's meals were finally brought to the table, all the adults had finished their meals.To make matters worse, the cashier was also the waitress.  Long lines formed to order as she was required to deliver plates to diners and to run the cash register.  This was made worse as the orders frequently were mixed up, which required her to return the orders to the kitchen to be redone.  Consequently, just ordering your meal took a long time.The only bright spot was the attitude of the waitress.  To her defense, even though she was very overworked (being the only person taking orders, running the cash register and delivering meals), she maintained a very pleasant attitude.There are many good BBQ restaurants in Austin Texas and the local environs.  I suggest you steer clear of this place.
They were amazing! I had never been before and ill be returning soon! The best way to break my vegetarian diet
This food was good aweful. Sausage burnt and cooked to long. No fries at lunch. And gave me chopped beef instead of brisket.

Went back for another visit and had similar results. The beans were so hot they couldn't be eaten, I think they maybe put double the pepper because it was crazy! The brisket was delicious and better than I remember. Will have to make this a more common place to eat at.

I saw this as a new business here on yelp. Figured since it was somewhat close to the house it'd be a good bet for lunch. The decor is neat and the furniture is cool. They have about 8 spots out front to park at. The restaurant inside is pretty big with a few different rooms. Employees were personable.I ordered a one meat deal and chose brisket. It was greasy, but tasty. The meat was easily the best item from my meal. The sides leave something to be desired. The potato salad was as bland as could be; as some other reviews mentioned. The macaroni and cheese was very good, but again quite greasy. (Not trying to sound picky, just giving my honest opinion) I thought the beans were pretty tasty.I'll definitely be back, but will most likely skip the sides and just try meats.

Love this restaurant! Great patio seating, good for kids or groups. Food is always fast & delicious. I love the Herd sandwich & the Mac n' cheese. Staff is friendly. Great addition to the neighborhood.

Is it too dramatic to say, best BBQ in Austin? The food was delicious, great service and great environment. This is also a great place for the family to come eat with a yard area for kids, very family friendly!

I really enjoyed my lunch here. I had the three sliders. So delicious. Three different sliders - a flight of BBQ sliders! So awesome. Everything was tasty and the staff were very friendly. I'll be back.
NA

I haven't been out in awhile so tonight seemed like a good night to try something new and finally get out of take out ordering for the evening. I met up with my boyfriend for date night at around 5:15 and we were the only other group of people in the restaurant. The setup of the restaurant is really surprising as you order what you like at the counter and the server brings you whatever food you've ordered. So you pay right when you get in and the hostess kindly directs you to your table. All drinks and refreshments minus alcohol can be found on the far right of the restaurant for you to serve yourself, along with any to go boxes.We ended up ordering the braised beef jjim as well as the seafood pancheon which were both equally delicious in their own unique ways. The braised beef jjim was the right amount of sweet and salty and super tender. The vegetables perfectly accent the dish ( potatoes, shisitos, carrots, onions, and some hidden mushrooms). As for the seafood pancheon it's not your typical seafood pancake but the chef didn't skimp on the seafood!! The flakiness of the batter is an improvement from a normal Korean seafood pancake, in my opinion!! One last thing I forgot to mention was that the kimchi reminded me of my moms kimchi and the use of pears was a nice addition. Jjim is a bit pricey but I really like how they build the tip into the menu to pay their staff a better wage. The server who was running inside and outside did a fantastic job in making sure we were having an enjoyable time. I'll definitely be back to try some of the other dishes!

This place is walking distance from my house so I was eager to try this place in hopes I would be a return customer. All I can say the food speaks for itself and I will definitely be returning. I started with the fried shrimp mandoo then went with the beef short rib for entree choice. The portions were huge not to mention so freaking tasty & tender. Highly recommend you add cheese to top it off trust me you won't regret it. To top it off you get free soft served vanilla ice cream at the end of your meal and best of all it's free! Can't say enough good things about JJim and glad to see a new diverse bbq restaurant in the Austin area.

I absolutely love this place! I've been here twice and both times were great experiences with fantastic service and delicious food.Upon entering, you're greeted warmly and see a counter directly to the left and a wall of their merchandise and drinks to the right. After you order at the counter, the friendly staff take you to a seat - there's both plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. The place feels that much more spacious with its high ceilings and largely windowed walls. There was also a wall adorned with framed pictures of tigers, including a Tiger Woods picture which I found humorous. There is an area in the back where you can fill up on drinks if you ordered one, and grab utensils and things, although the service staff are also on point about bringing you what you need.I ordered the seafood pancake both times which is a testament to how much I enjoyed it. While unorthodox for a Korean pancake, I love the crunchy texture and the perfect ratio between veggies, seafood, and batter.I also ordered their jjim both times because duh, that's what they're known for! It was so exciting each time to see them bring out the beautiful cast iron pan of steaming meat and colorful veggies. I tried the beef short rib and oxtail and both were so flavorful and tender, with the oxtail being (arguably) slightly more tender. Their veggies are perfectly cooked and while not the star, do well to support the dish and serve as vessels of the heavenly juices that pool at the bottom of the pan. Side note, I highly recommend spooning some of those juices over your rice. Speaking of rice, let's not forget the sides - along with the jjim, they provide a nice-sized, covered bowl of rice that you can share. As someone who loves her rice, I can appreciate the plentiful portion and the ability to get more while staying warm under its cover. The jjim also comes with a choice of add-ons, and each time I opted for kimchi and pickles. They have my favorite kimchi because it has pieces of pear(?) mixed in which gives an additional texture and lovely sweetness that appeals to my sweet tooth while balancing with other flavors.I got the medium size jjim each time which I found to be perfect for 2, although they list it as good for 2-3 guests. If you're aiming to share between 3 people, you might want to order other dishes. If you don't finish your food, they say that the jjim are great as leftovers and have to-go containers at the ready.Small but admirable detail: they have a no tipping policy. Signs on their counter inform you of their belief that they should already compensate their staff well enough to not need tips.I have not been for them but they do have alcohol specials through happy hour and things like wine Wednesdays. Free parking is very easy to find in the nearby garages of the Lamar Union area. I definitely plan on coming back!

This place is now a family favorite. This was our first time trying Korean food and it was amazing. The owner was so generous and attentive. The food came out quickly and hot! The prices are reasonable considering their staff gets payed a wage. Love that about this place! Will definitely be coming back.

Delicious! I went with one other person and we over ordered but we wanted to try both items! Braised ox tail meat basically fell off the bone. You could do without the rice noodle bc they give you rice to eT with the dish but I like glass noodles. Baby octopus was yum yum yum! Has a little bit of Kimchi in it buy it's not spicy.I also got the koreN pear juice in a can and it was mehhhh. Won't get that again.At the end of your meal, you get a complimentary vanilla soft serve with little rice crakers on it.Apple soju was good too. I think we'll try a different flavor next time.I'll be back to try more!

The braised beef rib is O. M. G. amazing! I think it is one of the best Korean dishes I've had in my life. The beef is fall off the bone tender, and almost melts in your mouth. The sauce they use to braise it is the perfect mix of sweet and salty. We chose to top it with glass noodles, but there are also choices as well. The presentation is also beautiful, I think the picture can speak for itself! The other two dishes, the pork bulgogi and kimchi fried rice were also very delicious, but the braised beef rib was mwah (chef's kiss).At first, the menu seems really pricey, but it only looks that way since they don't accept tips. These three meals were enough for five people to feel satisfied, but did not break the wallet ($110 total). Plus free rice refills! Amazing food and great vibes, loved it.

A perfect spot for a small group outing! Great outside space and beautiful interior decor. Was thrilled when this spot opened off of South Lamar. It's counter service style -- you order at the front and then they'll bring your dishes to your table. Careful when you're ordering drinks -- prices aren't listed and there are some expensive bottles of sake! But, they do have 50% off sake night I believe on Wednesdays, which would definitely be worth it!For a table of four we ordered the Yellowtail Ceviche, Large Beef Short Rib Jjim (with kimchi and pickles), and the Seafood Pancake Jeon. This was plenty for four with some leftover! Everything was absolutely delicious. Do not come here and not order the Jjim -- it is a MUST! The ceviche was also fantastic, thinly sliced and super fresh. My mouth is watering thinking about it! The pancake was good, but super thick and honestly I would skip it in the future. More room for the Jjim! Delicious sauce, thick chunks of meat and veggies.Two reasons why this is a 4 star review rather than 5. 1) Unlike traditional Korean BBQ, you only get a choice of one side. That was pretty disappointing considering the price of the Jjim. The pickles and kimchi were OK, but I would have liked more variety of sides included2) Prices in general I felt were a bit high. Overall, great spot for an occasional visit and definitely come during the week when they have specials on drinks!

Been waiting for this place to open since last year. They specialize in their Jjim (braised beef short rib or spicy pork too) served with potato, carrorts, and mushrooms. You get the option of adding mozerella cheese . The meats on both beef and pork were fall off the bone. The noodles perfect al dente chewy texture meanwhile the cheese is not an overwhelming smother. Extremely flavorful as the sauce was perfect to pour over rice. You can tell that it took some time to make it that tender. There's not much of a benchmark in Austin for this dish so I think it'll be popular and catch on. Chosun Galbi is another option. They and all in California that I've experienced are more saucy versions. This is a lighter but doesn't mean it's bad, just a different presentation. Price is the same as Cali though. It does come with shareable rice, kim chi and pickles side dish. $55 for 2-3 and $75 for 3-4 however, important to note that they don't do any tipping. They justify that by rolling the prices in to make up for a livable wage.I'd recommend the 2-3 portion and then get a few more items like soup, appetizers, etc so folks in your group have an opportunity to try a little bit of everything. They specialize in Jjim but I am a fan of their other items too.

This place is delicious but also pretty expensive. I love that they're a no tipping facility because they pay their workers more to make up for it, and the Austin can never have enough good Asian places. Jjim brings a unique Korean concept to the city, and it's definitely somewhere you want to come with friends or family. One serving can serve 2-5 people. Their alcoholic drinks are also Asian-themed and delicious (I recommend their yogurt). The meat is so tender and well-marinated, all the veggies are yummy too. I even wish there were more veggies because when they're soaked in the sauce, even eating vegetables isn't so bad anymore. Jjim gives free vanilla ice cream with rice crisps, and it's such a nice palette cleanser at the end of your meal. I highly recommend this place! It's on the slightly more expensive side, but if you're looking for a great meal and good conversation with friends, go to Jjim for the night.

Amazing!! I went to Korea 2 years ago and had my first jjim dishes there, which were magnificent. So I've been wanting to eat here ever since I heard it was opening. I finally had the opportunity, but we ordered to go instead of dining there as we had a rather large family gathering. I knew the three jjim dishes were meant to feed 2-3 people so I thought the price was very reasonable, especially when you're sharing one of the jjims. The price was also very similar to how much it was when I was in Korea. We picked up our order and it took us around 25 minutes to get the food home and it was still delicious!I have to first mention the kimchi! It is WONDERFUL! There are pear slices in the kimchi so the mix of spicy and sweet was just perfect. I could not stop eating it.For the appetizer we ordered the Seafood Pancake. This is not your normal seafood pancake. It is more tempura battered and crispy to perfection! It was still very crispy when we got home and it was one of my faves of the meal.For the entrees we ordered the Beef Short Rib, Oxtail and Spicy Pork Jjims. All 3 were so tender and full of flavor. I think my favorite of the three was the oxtail. We had some leftover and I had it the next day. It was just as good as the first day! Our add-on was the Egg Jjim which I would recommend in a heartbeat. It's like an egg souffle and I had seconds and thirds. I usually cannot eat too much eggs but this was was not overwhelming for me. We also ordered the Spicy Pork Belly Bulgogi and the Japchae. You really can't go wrong with either of these items. The spicy bulgogi had the perfect amount of spiciness.Overall, the food is very authentic and some of the best Korean food I've had in Austin. Great to take your friends and family or even bring home to them.

Got takeout last night from Jjim and I was thoroughly impressed!Thoughts:GALBI JJIM - splendid, savory with the right touch of sweetness. The meat was so delectably tender. I wish the potatoes and carrots were a little softer and stewed a bit more and more flavorful, but the all the veggies were delicious as well! I also wish there was more sauce for the rice. Maybe that's a takeout thing. We added cheese which, even though it tasted good, I don't think it goes as well with the takeout order because it gets a bit cold and gummy. I DID love the addition of glass noodles. They were thicker than I expected but they soaked up the sauce so perfectly and maintained their chew. You must order this dish!KIMCHI PANCAKE - SO CRISP. So delicious! I was craving a pancake - next time I will for sure try the seafood one too! I was worried it would get soggy on the drive home but it was still super crispy when we ate. It had everything you want in a kimchi pancake - a tangy and savory flavor, crispy thin edges, a light and airy batter. Plus, it was huge, but I couldn't stop munching. The only thing I could say is more sauce please!FRIED SHRIMP MANDU - now I liked this dish but it was interesting. I'd probably only order if I were craving this specific type of dish. I was expecting the shrimp to be pasty and minced but it was  a whole piece of shrimp wrapped in a dumpling wrapper and deep fried which tasted good, it was just not what I was expecting.We ordered online and chose to pay in person. We parked in the garage (luckily we found parking on the first floor) and went inside to pick up. Honestly, this really should be eaten in a group. It was just me and my boyfriend. We had a bit of leftovers at the end but less so than I was expecting at the price! It's still totally worth it. I really can't wait for it to be safer to eat in person with friends because I will definitely be dining here! I can only imagine how good the galbijjim is in a ripping hot cast iron pan.

Here's a restaurant trying to do the right thing. They are paying their employees a living wage so the prices reflect that and no tipping. The food comes out quickly. Everything is tasty. I think their rice needs to be softer. And prices for the alcohol would be so helpful so you don't need to have an awkward convo "how much does this bottle cost? What about the one w the flower in the front? And this ?" with the cashier as a line queues up behind you...got the jjim without noodles or cheese. I would get it again with glass noodles. The meat is so tender my mouth is watering again just thinking about it

So... Jjim has been one of the most anticipated restaurant opening for me and it did not disappoint at all.   As a Korean American,  braised beef is one of my favorite dish, EVER.  Braised beef is generally served as the main dish at Korean weddings and special events so it's definitely a special dish to appreciate.  Once you try it, you'll see Korean BBQ in a whole new way.   Having been raised in Los Angeles, equivalent dish would easily cost 30-40% more so Jjim is providing their braised beef at more than reasonable price, especially when you can share with your party.  Seriously, to have a place in Austin that specializes this particular dish is a huge deal. The beef was soooo tender, you won't need to grab a knife at all. (funny, they actually provide you a butter knife)  The perfect balance between the salty and sweet of the beef will delight you along with the mushroom, onions and potatoes to balance things out.  Oh and the cheese add-on is a must IMO.  Jjim is a must try for all.  Staff is amazingly friendly and my food came out quickly.  I love how Jjim captured traditional korean tiger folk tale in their overall design.  Definitely a nice touch.  I'm sure you'll end up introducing all your friends to Jjim once you've tried it.  I only wish there was one closer to where I am near Cedar Park but the drive is definitely worth it!!

I heard there was a new Korean BBQ spot in town and KNEW I had to try them out ASAP! They distinguish themselves by offering delicious jjim.What is jjim? Jjim is a Korean dish that takes meat, marinates it in sauce, puts it to a boil, and then reducing the liquid - adding veggies to enhance the flavor.The one I got was the Beef Short Rib Jjim which also comes with potatoes, carrots, shishito peppers, mushrooms, shallots, and chives. This one is marinated in a sweet soy based sauce!I gotta say, this was probably the best beef short rib I've had. Very flavorful - has a nice rich taste that isn't overpowering. A good contrast of a chewy outter texture with a tender texture on the inside. Outstanding! Additionally, I added flat glass noodles for $4 extra and although they were good, I felt I could have done without since they already come with white rice!I enjoyed the atmosphere as it strives for a mix between modern and antique. They are a no tipping restaurant, so what you see is what you pay! All in all, I had a great experience here.If I had to give some constructive feedback, I'd say that I felt the dish was rather small. They say the medium dish is for 2-3 people, but I just don't see how it can be for more than 2 people - given that my friend and I were able to finish it with no problem.

Delicious!!!!! Will be back.Ate yellowtail ceviche, beef rib  Jim, mushroom japche (added bulgogi beef), and spicy chicken. Had frozen pear margarita and watermelon margarita too- amazing!! Tuesday happy hour has those drinks for $2!!!! Try the soju too (Korean sake).Order at counter and they bring food to you. Wait staff is lovely! Sat outside on dog friendly patio. Only negative- they don't take reservations.
Kinda fancy family restaurant but reasonable price Great food,nice view and super friendly staff

The lack of my usual Seoul vacation makes me craving all sort of Korean food. We went last night to have an early birthday celebration dinner for hubby. Ordered the beef short rib jjim, spicy octopus, chicken skewer and brisket kimchi fried rice for the four of us.Overall love them all and portion wise, they are ok. Plenty of steam rice to go around and you can ask for more if you need to. We definitely are full.. there's no more space left.The front counter seems to be chaotic. You cannot be seated until you order at this counter and pay. For some reason everyone made their reservation for the same time as we did and it was pretty crowded for a while (long lines and no social distancing)...and yeah..Covid is still a thing. Everybody is wearing a mask at least.Jjim is on the expensive side, though no tipping required. I just hope those extra money really go to their staff. Our server is friendly and she kept checking on us. Got all of us complimentary ice cream too.We will be back and try different items from the menu and maybe make a reservation for off peak time instead.Will be interesting to find out what is their mask policy after March 10th when there is no more mandate.

Newest thing to try in town, "Jjim Korean Braised BBQ"!! The setting is you order at the counter and pay first. Then proceed to your table which your server will show you. You can get Soft drinks and water from self serve. We ordered large size beef short ribs, and seafood son do-bu. Short ribs portion is generous and tender. Seafood Son Do-Fu includes shrimp, Octopus and clams. I think it's a little pricey for the soup. I wish they would provide some ban Chan or kimchi along with the meal, hence, one star was off. Overall, it's flavor is solid.

I loved everything about this place.  Casual atmosphere, great decor, order as you walk in, self serve drinks, and amazing food.  What more can you ask for.  Keep in mind most people hear Korean food and think bulgogi and kalbi, this is braised meats, not BBQ.  The meat is super tender and marinated well.  The menu is relatively simple which I see as a plus also as it is not overwhelming with options. Another highlight was the Kim chi and pickles. I've never seen Asian pear used in Kim chi and after trying that I could eat that alone.  I also loved the barley tea which is a Korean staple. If they also offered raisin tea I would probably be a 3-4 time a week regular.  This is a great addition to the Austin food scene.

There are definitely some growing pains to be worked out. Their model is semi-fast casual where you order at the counter, then your service ware and food is brought out to you later. So the front can be very chaotic at peak times and the staff stretched thin.Pros: Shrimp mandoos, shrimp was cooked just right and wasn't rubbery. All of the pancakes, finally it's done right. They have an heavenly light, and crisp texture but chock full of filling.Meh: Beef soon dubu, the broth felt thin and watery and I would've like to have more tofu. Also it was disappointing to see it come out warmish and not bubbling hot. The beef short rib jjim had the same problem. The cast iron is really just for looks. Flavor wise it was good and the beef was tender. However I felt for the price it could been more generous on the vegetables. All in all my experience was okay, it was nice to try but for me it doesn't quite scratch that itch for Korean food for me.

Best soon dubu in Austin. We've tried several places, and this is the best (by far in the central area). The broth seemed a little thin at first, but was perfectly flavored. Usually the seafood is just for the broth, but here it's a decent part of the meal. No side dishes, but big portions regardless. Next time, we may share one, and try some other dishes.

Wow, what a find!  Tucked back off of Lamar in a condo complex and right across Alamo Daft House movie theaterI was out for a bike ride and happened across Jjim and happened to be really hungry (good thing too).  I was rolling solo so only ordered 1 item....I was a little surprised at the pricing on the menu, it was pretty steep for each item.  But having just eaten the Spicy Seafood soup, it was well worth it!!  Firstly, it's SPICY....not burn your fade off, but enough heat to get your attention without taking away from the insanely good soup.  LOADED with big prawns, clams, baby octopus and scallops.  I think it was meant to serve 2-3 people.  I wiped it out. Couldn't stop.   That goes for the huge side of steam rice they gave me.  AND a complimentary Korean frozen custard for dessert.  I'll be back, with family and friends so we can order all the items on the menu!

Finally tried this place. It's the sister restaurant of Donkey Mo's, which was originally inside Hmart. We went there on Sunday at 12pm, because they don't take reservations so we wanted to secure a table. The place was really quiet at that time, and we were the first customers. The price was a bit high considering the dish was normal style dishes for common Koreans, but the serving size was fine. We ordered the spicy pork rib as the only dish, it came with rice and topping we chose (we add kimchi). The first bite was a bit spicy but the heat didn't grow. Compared with some other Korean restaurants, Jjim didn't make the dish too savory or too spicy, I really enjoyed the much more balanced flavor and I could taste the true flavor of the veggies and meats themselves. The pork rib meat was tender and full of flavor. Another reason that I really liked it is that it's not too sweet, I feel like some other Korean flavored jjim would have much higher level of sweetness. All the veggies inside the dish were packed with flavor too!

We stopped by for a family visit for dinner. You order at the entry, service was very quick (would work great for a lunch visit).We had the Portabella Japchae to start which was great.Decided on both the beef and pork rib Jjim (I guess that is not deciding...).Kids loved the beef Jjim. Tender beef and flavorful sauce. Generous portion including lots of vegi (purple carrots and shishitos were a nice touch).Pork ribs were also super good, nice and tender with good spice.Will be back!

The food was excellent (my fiancé is Korean, so he can attest to its authenticity), the service was great, the interior was clean and stylish, and the social distancing was spot-on. All of the staff wore masks, and we were seated outside far away from any other patrons. We ordered the classic beef jjim, the kimchi fried rice chadolpaegi, and the beef japchae. It was all to die for! The portion sizes were generous, but even so we ate almost all of it until we had to roll ourselves back to our car. (Thankfully, because of the nearby garage, there's ample parking.) So excited to come back to this place!

Best Soon Dubu near S. Austin so far! It's great to share and had decent size seafood in it. Flavors were on point. Absolutely going back whenever I crave it. Here's the downside: tipping is included in price so at first glance, it seems high. No side dishes. You pay first and then sit down, more like cafeteria style but they bring the food out to you. Which I prefer because you can just leave whenever you're done. It's a different kind of restaurant setting that's not bad but need getting used to.
The beef short rib Jjim was delicious. The seafood pancake was extra crispy and not the traditional soft, chewy pancake that I'm used to.

Wow. I saw the 5 star reviews and was skeptical (but hopeful)... I was not disappointed. I haven't found Korean food this good in many years. We ordered the Makguli, kimchi pancake, and pork ribs. Everything was more flavorful and delcious than I could have imagined. They even give you complimentary vanilla ice cream at the end (contains no dairy)! Their no-tip policy is also interesting and makes the menu more affordable than it appears at first glance. I can't wait to go back! I have nothing but incredible impressions.

Awesome experience. Food came super quick and tasted amazing.   Their style of deep fried kimchi pancake had this greatly satisfying crunch when biting into it.  The portions are definite not for the weak and took home the rest of a great snack.  Will be back to try their ox tail.
Really great food and ambience! Their Beef Braised Short Rib was our favorite. Service was top notch!

I admit having high expectations of this place, having eaten at Sun Nong Dan in LA many times as my point of reference. But pretty disappointed on several levels.First - the service model is odd.
