You order at the counter, which is fine. But why is my cashier also responsible for the drinks as well as seating me? It just causes a huge bottleneck at the cash register. She also didn't seem to worry if I had a reservation or not (didn't even ask until I mentioned it). Food - all of our food (kalbi jjim, kim chi pancake, even the rice) came out lukewarm/room temp). If you've ever eaten at Sun Nong Dan, the jjim comes out in a massive, bubbling hot cauldron. The food here came out in a cast iron skillet with a handle cover for the heat, but I could have grabbed the whole thing with both hands and had no problems. Kind of off putting. The flavor of the food was fine, but it would have been much better if it was actually hot. Other nitpicks:-$5 dollars for kim chi? I've never been to a Korean place that charges you for banchan. Come on. I'm already paying $55 for the jjim. -They have a sign saying they are a no-tip establishment so they can pay their employees a living wage, which I totally support. But even if they did allow tips, what would I be tipping for? It was counter service, and aside from them bringing out my food, no one ever came back to check to see if we needed anything once. They just said "if you need anything come back to the counter." The service model makes this place feel like a fast casual restaurant. But then you realize you're paying $100 for a meal for two people (between an entree, appetizer, and two drinks). It feels like if I paid $100 at a Chipotle. Sure it's good, but is it worth it?

Hey Eric,I'm sorry to disappoint and that your first experience at Jjim wasn't great.  We've addressed many of the items you've mentioned since your last visit and have made significant improvements.  This includes the temperature of the food, the work flow at the cashier, and more.  If willing, we hope that you visit us again, and that your experience will be much better.  Please feel free to reach out to me direct at jjimbbq@gmail.com.Best regards,Cindy

So I've been waiting for this place to open since I first found out about it 5 months ago.  I made a reservation as soon as I found out it was open and came here on a Friday night with a group of friends.  The set up was quite surprising as you order and pay as soon as you enter and there's no tipping!  So basically you pay for your food, sit down and that's it.  If you need water or extra napkins, you can get it yourself as it's mostly self service.  For the price of the menu, I was surprised that it's a self service restaurant but I think it's amazing!  Not a con, just a pleasant surprise that's all.  My friends and I split a large galbi jjim, seafood pancake and spicy seafood stew along with individual alcoholic slushy.  They let you sample the alcoholic drinks first which I thought was a nice gesture.  The Asian pear slushy was quite yummy.  The food didn't take long at all to come out.  The seafood pancake was not the traditional korean seafood pancake.  It was more of an assortment of seafood and green onion dipped in tempura batter and fried.  It wasn't traditional but it does taste pretty damn good so no complaints there, just another pleasant surprise.  The seafood stew was the same quality as you would expect in a sit down Korean restaurant.  Now, the galbi jjim was AMAZING!  I mean that's what we came for right?  The beef was flavored perfectly and the meat just melts in your mouth.  Absolutely delicious!  We were informed that they usually serve complimentary ice cream at the end of the dinner but since their ice cream machine was being funky, we didn't get ice cream.  That sucks but I guess we'll just have to some back next time.   I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good galbi jjim or just good food in general.  Also as a self service restaurant, the service is actually pretty damn good.

SOOOOO DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!! We had the short rib BBQ, kimchi and pickles (an absolute necessity and game changer), along w the seafood pancakes (trust me!), glass noodles and beet salad. I definitely would come here just for the the seafood pancakes for lunch. The bbq was so good. The service was incredible. Plenty of outdoor seating and great COVID precautions

My family was so excited to have this place open up. The food is amazingly fresh and made with love. We had the short rib jjim with noodles and the kimchi fried rice. This restaurant has a no tipping policy which I think is really great. The beer and sake selection was amazing as well. I can't wait to go back

My family had a really amazing experience at Jjim's! The food came quickly and it was so good that I didn't even get a chance to snap many photos. The service was also great - we were greeted warmly by one of the owners upon entering, and the cashier who attended to us was very patient as we ordered. We will definitely come back again :) Thank you Jjim!

I'm often disillusioned by a lot of trendy asian restaurants that I see pop up in Austin, but when I saw some pictures of the food from Jjim, I had to try it. The "no tip" business model will also mean the food will be a little pricer than what you would pay at most Korean restaurants, but we love to see restaurants who give their employees fair wages.The ordering experience wasn't the best. I disliked how I wasn't able to pay online, so I couldn't just grab my food and leave ASAP. I also wish the site had more pictures of the food since their gallery was pretty limited. (As of 3/6/2021 anyway) The restaurant had a cool vibe. The front end staff seemed to be pretty stressed out with the small crowd towards the front, so that wasn't super ideal, but I'm sure they're still in the process of working out the kinks.What I Ordered (To-Go): Medium Braised Ox Tail: great portion for two people. The marination was rich, sweet n savory. I usually hate onions but the caramelized onions were *chef's kiss*. And the mushrooms at the end after it's been soaking in the marination??? AMAZING. Try to eat the meat while it's warm. When it gets cold, it tastes a lil salty  (5 stars) Kimchi Pancake: more like kimchi fritters if anything, but they were definitely crunchy after the 35 min trek home. (5 stars)Asian Pear Colada: for some reason, I wasn't expecting coconut, but that's what "Colada" implies. First sip, it did kind of taste like korean golden pears with a hint of coconut but as it melted (def my fault. I was too focused on the main course) it tasted like sweet sake with a hint of coconut. (4 stars)TLDR: Food  (5 stars)Ambiance  (5 stars) Staff  (5 stars) Ordering Experience  (4 stars) I hope Jjim does well and will be here to stay!

We loved the atmosphere and food here. It was "lick your fingers" good. My husband and I had pork ribs and left wishing we had one in our current city. One the owner Min was very warming and welcoming. He explained their history. The drinks are amazing as well. Try the Mojito!! You won't regret a visit here. They've only been open for 3 months and just wow!!

We arrived at 8:30pm. There was a group taking forever in front of us so I walked in and asked the young lady at the second register station if she could assist us. She advised as soon as that group was seated then we would be taken care of. During this time another group came in and got in front of us. I asked them why and they stated they had been called and their table was ready.. so after waiting 45 minutes, we finally make it to the girl at the front desk/area. She asked if we were on the list already..? To which we replied " What list"? She then ran over and talked to someone else and came back to inform us they close at 10 and are no longer taking any additional parties.. What??? We have been waiting for 45 minutes.. how does someone get on this magic waiting list? They do not take "reservations"... I advised of this and asked why they didn't have someone working the line and trying to help, or have a sign advising of their process to which she had no answer.. This alone is grounds for me to never attempt to give this place another opportunity for my business.. If the front desk is this unorganized, I can only imagine the wait staff and kitchen are no better .. completely frustrating in any grounds, but this was a special birthday occasion for my 19yr old who selected this place..which made it even worse.. ugghhh...

Wow. This place is good. They don't do tipping but prices are high but you get a lot of food. I'll save you some money by saying get what the restaurant is named after--jjim. The beef short rib jjim is the most tender meat you'll ever have and the vegetables in the stew like contraption which pairs great with white rice is incredibly fresh. I don't leave speechless many times after a meal but this was one of the experiences. They truly put a lot of effort in the jjim. Now for the other things like baby squid and kimchi fried rice it just wasn't my thing. I've had better at other Korean restaurants but I'll be coming for the jjim over and over. That's the star of the show.
Kyle, TX 78640

Milts is great bbq. They've really done well making sure to have great food in a safe manner during covid. I'm someone who has tried to be super careful and I always feel safe picking up food. And I guess if you don't care if they're careful or not then it's still delicious. Enjoy it while you can still taste food though.

Moved to Kyle recently and tried this out. It is the best bbq in Kyle. Not as good as going to some of the out of town places, but if you are in Kyle and want bbq without driving 30 minutes or more, this is the best bet.

Died & gone to food heaven at Milt's Pit BBQ. I am avoiding busy downtown and was excited to try new bbq... bought a bit of everything (no pulled pork today, bummer). I was so impressed with the tenderness & flavor of the meat & all that I called after I ate at home to tell them THANK YOU FOR YOUR DELICIOUS FOOD! Easy online order & pickup.
The haystack is amazing!!!  The staff is always friendly.  We frequently order take-out during the school year and they always have our order correct and ready to go.

Everytime I visit my brother in Buda, we always take a trip Milt's in Kyle!Brisket melts like butter, they serve Lockhart sausage too!Awesome sides...must try bbq beans, german potato salad and surprisingly their Fries!!Place is always clean and the staff are super friendly!!

If my rating was just on the people, it would be 10 stars... they are all so good. Friendly faces. Very helpful. They always make you feel welcome. These folks just "do it right."Add in some great barbecue and you have a gem of a restaurant. The brisket can compete with anyone's (and I am a BBQ snob.) The fixins' are second to none.A great spot!

5 stars is nearly impossible to get from me on a BBQ place because I am so picky about my BBQ. Milt's is some of the best in the area. The brisket is better than most and their sausage is from Lockhart so you know it is good.  The sides are a bit average but it is so darn close that it is the best BBQ that doesn't require me to drive an hour.
BBQ is BBQ but Milt's is the bomb. I'm so happy we have this place in our town. The staff is always kind and the orders come out quick and well packaged to go. The brisket smoke ring is to die for!

The Lockhart sausage is a nice choice-tastes like what Kreuz and later Smitty's tasted like. At $4.99 it's as little as you can spend.The brisket at Milt's was priced at $17.00 for HALF a pound. FYI Franklin has now lowered it's temporarily astronomic prices to a more realistic $29.00 for a full pound. So Milt's is charging more than Franklin, and while the brisket is good, it is not even on the same planet as Franklin and a few other well-known places. And if you are interested, $34 a pound is about what a lobe of foie gras costs.Along with living in pandemic conditions, we are now seeing barbecue price gouging, as we do at the pump during "fuel crises." In fact, the availability and price of brisket has come down in recent weeks, but Milt's is one of several places that seems to be exploiting the actual shortage, even as it eases. I had a Lockhart sausage which was $4.99. OK, fair enough. Ordered a brisket sandwich for 11.99 which consisted of three very good but not great slices of brisket. But $17.00 for a HALF pound of brisket? At a good but not great place in Kyle? The sauce, which I always ask for on the side, tasted like commercial sauce with artificial smoke flavoring added. I totally understand that every food business is struggling through these times. But so is everyone else, and overcharging is not a way to make it through.
Kyle, TX 78640

I love the brisket potatoes here and the staff is super friendly. Really cool atmosphere and a very convenient location to the rest of downtown Kyle. The only thing preventing the review from being 5* is the overall price. It can be a little steep compared to the other bbq joints around here so I don't go too often. But when I do, it's always a good experience. Give em a try if you're in the area, definitely one of the better places to eat in this city!
Excellent barbecue and great staff. We've enjoyed every visit. Really like this spot a lot.
Awesome BBQ. Ordered the family style meal and some extra meat and it was all ready when we came to pick it up.
Love the BBQ. Brisket, sausage and sides are amazing. The place is small and outside dinning. I'm big on tea and the tea is perfect!!

Love Milts!Their ribs and dark meat chicken are the best. Also...the Okra. So good. So so good. 4 stars instead of 5 because their fryer went out of commission. You got me hooked on the okra and now I want MORE . Hope they get that fixed soon so I can order a big man binge with double okra. Yum!

Their ribs and sausage are mighty tasty, but what keeps me coming back is the sides! Whoever runs their fryer is a wizard, because the okra and cornbread fritters steal the show. Don't sleep on the creamed corn elote either, it's a winner!
Milt's is soooo good. Great brisket, german potato salad and the hush puppies or corn fritters, can't remember what they call them, are the best, hot and dipped in butter.
Great service and food smells great and plenty of seating and room. Waitstaff great attitude
Always good but raised their prices and seemed like smaller amounts even though brisket is suppose to be by the pound.
Kyle, TX 78640

$12.00 for this??! It's not even enough meat to cover the bun, and there's not even enough potato salad to fill the container. Absolutely pitiful. Not only that but there was a dead cockroach in the corner (meaning they obviously don't sweep regularly) and the gentleman in front of us waited over 25 minutes for one rib plate. I also saw orders leave with the wrong customers and the poor girl had to run out to peoples cars and get the food back. Pretty sure you can't take food back once it's left the establishment and you most definitely should not be doing that during a pandemic--talk about contamination!! I HIGHLY recommend you drive 15 minutes down the road to Hays Co. BBQ instead

What an amazing experience. The fatty brisket is to die for. I had the 3 meat plate with double brisket and ribs. The ribs super tender and tasty. This meat is like no other BBQ that I have ever had. The superfood coleslaw was amazing. One of the employees gave us a sample of beans and WOW OH WOW I wish I wound have gotten this as a side. My wife says that her smoked turkey was amazingly tender and good. Her German mashed potatoes were great and the banana pudding is good and homemade. Do yourself a favor make the stop when in KYLE TX

Milt's must bring in more of a lunch crowd.  I went for dinner and I was the only one dining in, a few people came in for pick up orders.  You order at the counter and they bring you your food.  I opted for a plate with lean sliced brisket and a side of green beans and Mac and cheese with a drink...under $11.  I sit down and a staff member comes over to tell me they're out of lean sliced brisket?  This is AFTER I order and pay...so rather than making a fuss I told her chopped brisket was fine.  Delivered on a metal tray I received 2 slices of white bread and 3 small styrofoam cups one with my meat, green beans and mac and cheese.  The brisket was greasy, and overly sauced.  The mac and cheese was plain and the green beans were VERY hot and had a bit of a kick.  It wasn't my favorite overall.

BEST BBQ IN KYLE clean establishment and friendly courteous  staff!!!! The food is always FRESH and it tastes amazing I suggest the corn bread you WILL NOT be disappointed I can promise you that much!!!! I recently  visited during the pandemic and I was happy to see that they are still open and have a great attitude about the whole situation
The baked potatoes are so good! And the girls working there through all the covid stuff and doing amazing!

If you want some good, no frills BBQ, then this is the place. The whole ambience, from the moment you push open the door, to you sat down and eat, set the stage of a family backyard BBQ get together. The staff have always been inviting, regardless of where you're from, color or creed. The food is cooked to Southern perfection that smells up the whole restaurant.  Your order comes pretty quickly.  I suggest the brisket and ribs. I am not use to the sauce coming on the side but this place has made it my standard. I especially love the decor; truly hope it doesn't change for a modern look in the future.If you are in Kyle, Texas, stop by this place! You will be talking about it from then on !!!
Place is great, small but big enough. Nice little outside patio area. Great Bbq, they have awesome French fries oddly enough. Friendly staff and a killer location right in the center of downtown..

Over all this BBQ is the best I have ever had in Texas! The staff are very helpful and kind.As of lately there has been a lot of backlash about them not opening there dining area. Being rude to there staff and feeling entitled is completely uncalled for.Again I dearly love the food and staff very much. If you are in Kyle TX. Anytime soon you have got to try there food.They do takeout and delivery.

We absolutely love Milts.   We visited for the first time over a year ago when we first bought our house.   But they never disappoint.  The staff is super friendly.  The food is great.   And you get it quick!!!    You guys are doing a phenomenal job!
Kyle, TX 78640

FYI, when someone asks if theres MSG in the sauage or on anything else and the counter staff doesn't know, that's red flag 1. When they go back and ask the kitchen staff and they don't know its red flag #2. When asked who makes the sauage and she comes out and says US Foods Red Flag #3.  I politely tell her that's a food distributor Not a manufacturer she looked at me like she had no ideas the difference between a manufacturer and a distributor.  #youbetterknowyouringredianceifyoureinthefoodindus­try
I really like the brisket and sausage. I'm glad they are taking care of the employees and customers by limiting seating and restrictions during this pandemic.

Love Milts! Their BBQ is to die for, the location is great in downtown Kyle and the staff has always been attentive and friendly. And my kids love it because you can write on the walls with a sharpie. At least I hope that is allowed. Another reason to support Milts is because of how much they care for their employees and customers by closely monitoring the COVID-19 trends in this city/county and closing their dining room in an abundance of caution.  They never stopped providing via to-go  and I sometimes order through a delivery app if I'm feeling too lazy to pick it up. Also -- you should follow their FB page - they are active and do a great job communicating specials and when they are sold out! (Yes because it's just that good). Give them a try if you haven't yet --support small local businesses!!

On a scale of 1-5 with 1 being worst and 5 best:My overall rating of Milts today:  3.3Brisket (sliced)Taste:  3Tenderness:  2Notes:   It was a bit dry today Turkey breastTaste:  4Tenderness:  4Pulled porkTaste:  3Tenderness:  4Notes:   Not much smoke flavor today and lacked some seasoning It was good overall, but I've had better BBQ here before.  Probably just an off day.  I'll definitely be back.  May have also had to do with it being later in the day (6pm).

We order Milt's for a game watching party of about 25 people.  We hadBrisketRibsSausage Potato saladColeslaw Macaroni and cheese Fried okraEveryone was so impressed by how good everything was.   The ribs and brisket are some of the best I've had. This is definitely a hidden BBQ gem.

I love coming here! I always get the brisket plate and the sauce is so good with it! I also get the fried sides, I lobe the fried okra and the fried cornbread! Also I like the beans and the spicy cream corn! Always friendly and helpful customer service as well. So good, I recommend them!

Great local bbq in Kyle! I enjoy the birds nest sandwich, the brisket and the ribs. The beans are very flavorful. I am working from home right now and have used their curb side a few times. The kids like the turkey and mac.
I thought I reviewed this place years ago. Best ribs in Texas. They run out of food, so get there early. Every time I'm anywhere near Kyle, I have to stop in at Milt's.

First rate Texas BBQ. Classic diner on the square. Friendly staff and excellent sides. I had lean brisket, chicken, fried okra and beans. The beans were the best I have had in quite some time. Brisket was old school and perfect. Chicken moist and delicious. The sauce was spot on. It is now in restaurant rotation. My favorite bbq on the south end.
Kyle, TX 78640

Had the birds nest Excellent.  I'm from Pennsylvania. Nothing like it there. Surprised by the kielbasa (sausage) thought only east coast eat that stuff. I to 10. Place is Eleven.Look out Kyle tx you're the go place. Service was great and fast too.
Great vibe, awesome food, friendly staff. Pricing according to market and publicized in advance. Outside seating is great.

Great Smokey bbq smell hit our nostrils as soon as we walked inside, and that was when we k ew we were in the right place.Great food! We got the Carolina wrap and the brisket and smoked chicken. The sides were baked beans, mac n cheese, and green beans. The green beans stayed hot forever but the food was amazing!Great customer service as well!

Meh. Nothing memorable or special about Milt's Pit BBQ, except maybe that it is one of the limited eateries to choose from in Kyle, TX. Quick takeout order. The hubby and I can usually split a multi-meat plate. Opted for the "Big Man Binge" bbq plate - sounded promising. Came with brisket, ribs, sausage, two sides of choice, and a medium drink for $15.99. Not a lot of bang for your buck...and, yes, I'm accustomed to dishing out the $$$ for good Q. Included: A few thin slices of on-the-dry side brisket. Certainly not "fatty" (a.k.a. moist) brisket. Lacked any depth of flavor and that crust that makes brisket so wonderful. A couple of small ribs, tender, fall off the bone; however, again, on the bland side. One link sausage, sliced, good sear, actually liked it, even though sausage isn't usually my fav. Other reviewers raved about Milt's beans, but failed to state green or bbq so decided to get each. Super duper small sides; beans were beans were beans. Huh? To go container/bag had one little sad piece of bread in it, no Texas obligatory sliced white onions, only one pathetic dill chip, and no sauce - which I usually forego (good Q doesn't need it and it's actually considered sacrilege [in Texas anyway], like putting A1 on a prime ribeye); however, this Q could've used a lil "help." Sadly, I doubt I'll be a repeat offender when/if in Kyle...unless maybe for a burger from the "Grill" as several others have suggested. "There's your sign!" If folks are sending you to a Q joint and recommending the burgers, well...enough said IMO. Merp. Just A-OK.[136 in 2015]

Brisket is fantastic. Moist, melt in your mouth goodness! They have Lockhart sausage which is only the best sausage in the world. I gave them 3 stars for this reason 1 star meats!1 star location1 star service  **didnt give 2 stars for these reasons**1 sides were not good, tried half of them. Beans are a staple of bbq restaurants, theirs sucked. They were soured with bbq sauce. If i want to taste bbq sauce with my beans I'll pour sauce in them. I want to taste BEANS. mac and cheese wasn't macaroni. It was MUSH and cheese. And dry. 1 you can't have Lockhart sausage and not have crackers and cheese to go with. All Lockhart bbq places do for that reason. They have to go together. *also, they don't have cornbread, that's a big one for me, all bbq restaurants should have cornbread*

WOW!!!! IMPRESSED FOR SURE!!! We had the 3 meat plate and shared it!  SPOT ON!  We drove from North Austin to get a pie at the Texas Pie Co and stopped in and had some lunch, we are kinda bbq snots, and we were very impressed!!!  It's up there with one of our favorite Ope's out in Spicewood.  This was definitely worth a return trip!  The sausage was spot on we had the jalapeño cheese was not greedy at all.  They let us sub the chicken for the spare rib and it was moist and cooked to perfection and then the brisket...... mmmmmmm was AMAZING!  Moist, moist, moist!  Great portion sizes as well.  The coleslaw was not overly mayo was perfect and the bbq beans were nice and sweat and had real meat in them!!!! If you don't like em sweat don't get them, we loved them!  The sauce was good as well!Then the service!  WOW! IMPRESSIVE!  I'm sure they were all high schoolers and the amount of professionalism that they displayed was spot on!  even made rounds to the table and asked if we needed anything.  Pleasant young ladies and the gentleman who brought our food to the table. It was clean ad the staff was cleaning up after people left and again pretty impressed for the age of the staff..... so judge metal but it often times fits the bill.  We were really impressed with the young ladies up front!!!!1 We were there yesterday!

My wife and I were driving through and were ready for lunch so we pulled off and came across Milt's. The wait to order was short and had our order brought out to our table in under 10 minutes. I had the chopped brisket sandwich with Mac and cheese while my wife had chicken, fried okra, and Cole slaw. I was disappointed with the brisket as it was way too mushy and seemed to be molded on my bun. The BBQ sauce help bring some flavor to it. My wife's chicken was tender and fell of the bone. I gave this visit three stars because I feel a chopped brisket sandwich is the foundation of a good BBQ joint. As a gage to rate BBQ joints I use Miller's Smokehouse in Belton, Texas which I feel is in the upper echelons of BBQ joints in Texas. I will give Milt's another chance because I might of caught them on an off day.

Gave Milt's another try recently and still disappointed with new owner or Mgr. The food is just not hot when it comes out - barely warm - not like it use to be. Thinking they must keep it under a lamp now?? Also still have the tasteless German potato salad - and they use to have the best tasting regular potato salad!? I think Fushak's BBQ in San Marcos is a much better value and their food comes out piping hot every time. Guess we'll just have to drive a little further.

Milt's was a miss for me today - which was disappointing  because we have loved this place! My 2 meat brisket and chicken plate came to the table barely warm and they have changed their potato salad from fantastic - to now a tasteless German potato salad!? The fried okra was good and my wife said she liked her brisket and sausage plate - but from the first bite of my brisket I could tell someone new was smoking the meat  (still good flavor but just different). So I asked a worker if they had a new owner and she said Yes. Bummer! Hope he can get the meat hot to the table like it use to be and goes back to the much better potato salad! I'll probably give them another try since my wife likes them so much - but if not good again - we'll be done. Too many other good places around to not get it right.

Where so many other shops can't show up properly, Chi'Lantro has filled in the gap.  I come here a lot.Pros:* Quality food, consistent, friendly people* Reasonable variety given that it's a food truckCons:* Location is a bit of a pain, you've got to stand around awkwardly in front of a post office.* Occasionally run out of things if you arrive after 1:00 pm.Recommendations:* Much prefer the burritos to other options* Not a big fan of the "magic" sauce* Ask for some hot sauce on the side

UPDATE: They are not by the post office currently.  Go to 9th Street between Congress and Brazos.---My go-to place in downtown.  Where so many other shops can't show up properly, Chi'Lantro has filled in the gap.Pros: * Quality food, consistent, friendly people* Reasonable variety given that it's a food truckCons:* Location is a bit of a pain -- kinda prefer it over the post office location but oh well* Occasionally run out of things if you arrive after 1:00 pm

1st time trying Chi'Lantroalways saw my co workers eating it so i decided to try it, for some reason it looked like it was like Chipotle but it's nothing like it. I got the rice bowl w/spicy chicken, chilantro, cheese, tortilla strips, black beans. i give it a 6/10. Not bad

Always fantastic when I come here. Luckily I started working downtown, and this location is close! Staff is always very friendly and the service is great. I love how friendly and attentive they are to first timers ( who I was with) as well as the regulars who are there to get lunch. I haven't gotten there before 1030 for breakfast yet, but I hope I can take the walk up the street soon. It's always time permitting of course :)Keep doin the good work!

This was pretty good. The fries are good as were the tacos! I would definitely eat here again...I ordered off DoorDash  so I can't comment on the service but receiving some tasty tacos in the comfort in my house were pretty yummy.

I was at food truck around 10:20am, and had to wait till 10:30am. Didn't know they were switching from their breakfast menu to their lunch menu.I ordered the rice bowl with spicy pork and added a fried egg. The food was great. Generous portion size. The lady seemed a little impatient with me when I was ordering though.Anyway, it was a short walk from the Texas State Capitol building, so it worked out well as a pit stop for me.

Out of towner here.This is a food truck that is stuck to the ground.  Apparently that is an Austin thing.  I was trying to figure out how to track down this food truck.  But apparently there is no need.  It's not going anywhere.They have pretty decent, fairly inexpensive rice bowls that you design Chipotle style.  All the ingredients are fresh and the soy vinegar dressing added good flavor for me.  A good lunch option in downtown Austin.
Healthy, delicious food at reasonable prices. Multiple convenient locations with consistent, above average customer service

We got the spicy pork bowl and the kimchi fries. I'll prob always come back for the kimchi fries, it's what got them famous! This is a fusion Korean and Mexican style restaurant. Very hip and aesthetic inside! Plenty of seating. Only have the Austin organic sodas. The kimchi fries were BOMB. I love the flavor of the bulgogi you can get on top and the special magic sauce PULLS IT TOGETHER. Y'all have to try it! The bowl often comes with less meat than rice, so the ratio is a bit off, but nonetheless still delicious!

Loaded fries are loaded fries. Drunk food and nothing much more...can't go wrong with it. There's no way fries can be crisp while holding up layers of sauce and condiments so can't really blame them for not trying to make fries really great themselves. But the mix of stir fried kimchi (honestly SO good) and the mayo and scallions is delicious!I also got the steak taco and chicken taco. Chicken was moist! And flavorful. The steak is alright. Interior is small but enough to seat a good dozen or so people. Glad this place made it from truck to building!

During SXSW, I grabbed a bit to eat in between sessions at the Chi'lantro food truck that set up shop in front of the Austin Convention Center (by the Trinity and 4th entrance). It was popular with a bunch of people queued up to order, but the line moved quickly.  I grabbed two orders for me and the hubby - Original Kimchi Fries with Tofu (for him) and Ribeye Beef Rice Bowl (for me). The food was delicious - pricy, but delicious.Original Kimchi Fries has caramelized kimchi, cheddar and Monterey jack cheese, onions, cilantro, sesame seeds, sriracha, and their "magic sauce". You have an option to add tofu, spicy chicken, soy-glazed chicken, spicy pork or ribeye beef (beef is a $1 extra). Rice bowls have rice, black beans, grilled corn, garden veggies, kimchi, fried egg, salsa, and a choice of protein (ones noted before). You have a choice of either white or brown rice. If you see the Chi'lantro truck in Austin, I recommend running over there and placing an order. Another cool thing about Chi'lantro is that it uses biodegradable paper containers and utensils. Eco-conscious and delicious, Chi'lantro is awesome!

Love this food truck! Super fresh and flavorful food.Hubby and I shared a rice bowl with beef ribeye and 2 corn tacos with spicy pork.The veggies were so refreshing and the meats were perfectly seasoned. Decent prices. Portions are actually more filling than they seem.

I work in the downtown area where there's limited parking and food options, hence, a couple of my co workers decided to walk a block and pay chilantro a visit.Chilantro is a food truck tucked in front of the post office (if I remember it right). It's hard to miss  around lunchtime as you'll see a bunch of people in suites and business casual in line for food. Unlike other food trucks, they do not accept cash so skip the ATM.I heard about Chilantro watching Shark Tank once where the owner got a deal from the sharks in order to expand. Anyhow, I honestly think that the reviews about this place was overhyped OR I just ordered the wrong thing (like the rice bowl). With that said, my co worker recommend the rice bowl so I tried it. I got the spicy chicken rice bowl with everything on it. Now, one thing about me is I love meat.... and to find out that my plate was 90% rice and 10% meat was upsetting. I love the fact that it was overloaded by my toppings/veggies but seriously dude.. where's the meat? 8 bucks for veggies and rice is pretty absurd. Although, customer service is great--the employees are extremely friend which I like.Overall, I am willing to give Chilantro another try. However, I'll never take a chance on their rice bowl ever again. Yikes!
A great asian fusion combo. Good sauce and veggie selection. Tofu option is available for vegetarians

Great place to grab something quick. Sort of Chipolte, but a food truck where you do not have an option to sit and eat. Good for quick lunch times grab and go. You would usually find a big line during lunch hours at this location. I like the spicy taste and the fusion concept is great. You have a lot of option to choose from and make a bowl of the choice with your ingredients ! I usually like the noodle bowl and sometimes I go for a rice bowl or a burrito. I love there Kimchi salad and miss there Kimchi Fries that I have had at one of their other locations.Go early during lunch hours to avoid a long wait !
Finally tried the kimchi fries! They were sooooo delish! I also dig the Korean fried chicken wings. The magic sauce is a must as well! Oh and the fountain drinks are amazing too!

This little restaurant has big bold flavors and creative ingredient combinations that could easily become a national franchise! The "Chipotle" style menu makes it easy to create your own bowl and allows for a variety of fresh, healthy options. I loved the food here and hope that they open a restaurant in the Fort Worth area soon!Great options for vegan or vegetarians!

After trying Chi'Lantro's food truck many moons ago at Nocturnal Fest, Fun Fun Fun Fest and this past SXSW I am finally writing a review. My most recent experience  with the food trailer was their catering menu during the Class of 2015 #RepublicSX. There were so many hungry festival goers yet the line moved super smooth, the Chi'Lantro crew definitely knows team work. The first night of the event I had the chicken sliders which is a catering menu item. The chicken was well seasoned topped with magic sauce. The hint of spice, toppings and soft bun were perfect. The second night I had their freaking amazing beef street taco. When I indulge I want it to be amazing and their streeet tacos were oh so worth it. The rib eye bulgogi was rich and flavorful. The cilantro, onions, Chi'Lantro salsa, sesame seeds, and lime wedge and fresh corn tortillas complimented the meat perfectly.They also serve tofu as a protein option and they have some gluten free menu items. Chi'Lantro is known for their gorgeous original kimchi fries and for a first time visit these are a must. The fries come with your choice of ribeye bulgogi, spicy pork, spicy chicken, soy glazed chicken or marinated tofu, then topped with caramelized kimchi, cheddar & Monterey jack cheese, onions, fresh cilantro, spicy magic sauce, sesame seeds and sriracha.Last night I finally tried their brick and mortar on South Lamar, review to follow!

Five stars all day everyday! Everything about this place rocks! The location, friendly staff, and amazing healthy food has me returning to this food truck a few times a week. In the mornings I prefer their Lamar taco and for lunch I always enjoy their spicy chicken noodle bowl! Give this place a try! You will not regret it!

The bulgogi burger is amazing! The people are friendly, the price reflects the quality of the food. We were beyond pleased with our order it was delicious.It's very interesting, not like something you get just anywhere. I can't wait to go back and try other menu items!

Knocked a star off because the kimichi fires were cold. Flavor and topping were great but cold fries no good. I had a rice bowl with ribeye (pork is better than ribeye) I added way too many toppings. Mushrooms and avocado were delicious I just over ordered. Bowl had a pretty good flavor but there was something, maybe a spice or herb that I wasn't crazy about. Didn't remove any stars for that because I understand it's probably just me. Good temperature was the only real issue. The bowl wasn't very warm either. My friend enjoyed the spicy pork burger. It looked great. Fountain drinks with a hipster twist. Whatever. Music was a little loud but atmosphere was clean and organized. All good.

I used "lunch drop" so I ordered my meal and it was delivered so that may be a factor.The price was a little high for quality & quantity you receive.  I ordered a rice bowl paid for double portion of meat $3 upcharge.  The bowl was small land really only a few pieces of meat.  The rest of the bowl didn't have much flavor.  I also ordered the chicken wings which were cooked well & crunchy and the sauce had good flavor.I would give 3.5 stars...not sure I would order again.

Whoa the food here is just heavenly. Every bite just melts in your mouth. I got their Bulgogi Tacos and Spicy Pork Tacos, and tried some of their tofu fried rice. I would definitely try them again if I end up visiting Austin again! Two tacos is probably enough but if you're feeling hungry, then do 3.

It is hard to pick among all the fantastic food trucks in Austin, but Chi'Lantro manages to craft a more than respectable reputation for themselves. I first read about their Original Kimchi Fries in the local newspaper which questioned whether or not their fries were overrated. Chi'Lantro built its empire on their amazing Original Kimchi Fries, Korean Fried Chicken Wings with gangnam sauce and other Korean-Mexican inspired dishes. So despite what the newspaper said, I had to try the Original Kimchi Fries that transformed a food truck into multiple brick-and-mortar stores. The Kimchi Fries were a masterpiece of flavor and texture. The kimchi was buried under the fries and sauce, but it provided an incredible burst of umami or savoriness to the fries. It's characteristic sour flavor left your mouth watering and craving for the next bite. The Korean chili powder wasn't too overwhelming to the point where there was too much heat either. It was just the right amount of chili powder for the flavor. The fries themselves were crispy and golden on the outside and soft and fluffy on the inside. Combined with the sharp cheeses (Monterey Jack + Cheddar), some magic sauce, a dash of sriracha (after all, how can you be trendy without it?) and topped with cilantro, the Kimchi Fries was a blast. My only gripe was that the tofu was fried to an absolute crisp. It was way too crunchy and way too much fried flour for the tofu. Even though Chi'Lantro is fast food, the depth of flavor belies the amount of time spent preparing it. It is on the slightly higher end of the price spectrum, but that is to be expected. I think it was completely worth it to pay the premium for the ingredients and the ingenuity. Chi'Lantro challenges the way you envision traditional Korean cuisine (Korean BBQ) and is infused with lively Mexican flavors. I will definitely be back the next time I visit Austin!

We absolutely love ATX and after canoeing on the lake we were looking for something fresh sense the night before we went out on the town and also we had a crap to tone of BBQ, room service and drinks lol.We ended going here and absolutely loved the vibes in this place from the get.We checked it out on yelp and seen that a they a specific type of fries that's similar to a food truck we have in HTX ( Yes, I am a Houstonian)The fries are from a place called Gogo Fries but many places have this type.We walk up take our orders and everything is swift and fast from preparation to transaction.Did I mention I love that I absolutely LOVE the fact that they're a Cashless food joint. Helps to speed up the transaction, save trees (no receipt paper) and they take Apple Pay.So we dive in and ... AMAZING! Everything was super fresh and delicious! The workers kept checking in with us and the environment was perfect to along with the fries.We will definitely come back again!!

I haven't been to Chi'Lantro's in a while for a reason, however since downtown Austin's food truck is right outside the post office doors, it lured me into giving it another try.  Sadly, I'm still not convinced for future returns.  The meat marinades are sweet, the tofu is extremely dry and it would be nice to have the option of "soft" vs. cooked/fried tofu.  How about bean sprouts or other vegetable options for rice bowl toppings?

I worked downtown this past year, across the street from Chi'Lantro, and cannot say enough good things about it! The line can get long during peak times, so if you work nearby, I would pop down around 11:30 or 11:45 to avoid the lunchtime crowd. Despite the lines, the service is great and everyones orders come through quickly. The staff is very friendly and I've never had a problem with an incorrect order! The location at the post office is just grab and go (no seating or parking) and caters to people who work downtown or at the Capitol.I normally order a salad bowl with beef, veggies, and the carrot ginger sauce. It's easy to make Chi'Lantro light and healthy, or more substantial with rice noodles! Note that this location (at the post office on Congress) does not have kimchi fries. if you work downtown, or are visiting the Capitol and want a quick lunch, I would highly recommend Chi'Lantro!

In Austin you are faced with a TON of food truck choices.  It is often the hardest decision of your day, trying to figure out which one to indulge in.  Especially at an event or festival where they are lined up nice and pretty beckoning you to their windows to give your order.At the New Year's Eve festival downtown, my husband and I decided to try a little bit of this and a little bit of that (apparently making hard decisions is not in the cards for 2017).  We got "appetizers" from a few food trucks so we could sample lots of things!  At Chi'Lantro....well we got the World Famous Kimchi Fries.....DUHHHHHYou have to get the Kimchi Fries at Chi'Lantro.  We got them with the ribeye beef.  Yum!  So flipping good.  Not into beef?  They had other options of Spicy Pork, Spicy Chicken, Soy-Glazed Chicken or Tofu.  All good choices! Except Tofu....sorry, just no.  But YES to Kimchi fries!  Million times yes.
Inventive, tasty, and super-fast! Great for vegans - delicious marinated tofu protein option! Larger space would be nice -it's always crowded.  Wish we had one closer to home

A great stop for lunch during the busy workday. Their sweet potato noodles are delicious. For meat selection on the bowl, I choose the ribeye and add a bunch of veggies and tortilla strips. I also get the sesame vinaigrette and magic sauce on top. The beef is really tender and flavorful. Staff is always friendly and they are usually pretty quick. Only downfall is they run out of a lot of options if you get there a bit later in the afternoon.

Austin is always there for me when they keep a promise to their "keep Austin weird" slogan.Chi'lantro Korean bbq is one of my favorite food trailers. You must try the original kimchi fries with ribeye bulgogi that are pictured. One of the most delicious, psychedelic things that you can obtain here in the bat city. It's so good that it's bad.

I love Chi'Lantro. One of the best food trucks around. The Kimchi fries are a must! They are incredibly flavorful - the combination of sriracha, cheese, and their special sauce is beyond delicious. It has a to die for flavor kick and isn't too spicy either. I washed down the fries with a cold bottled (mexican) coke. Hearty meal that hit the spot. My only complaint is that they need to smother the fries in the amazing sauce. Awesome: Kimchi FriesOk: Rice Bowl and Spicy Fries

First Korean food truck, was not disappointed.  The food was pretty good, we had the following:- Kimchi fries - Caramelized Kimchi, a mound of sizzling Korean BBQ, chopped grilled onions, cheddar and Monterey Jack cheese, cilantro, magic sauce, sriracha and sesame seeds. All set on top of a pile of crispy French fries - probably the best kimchi fries I ever ate, it was so perfect and delicious- Spicy fries - Crispy French fries, garlic salt, Korean peppers served with magic sauce - this was decent.. but next to the kimchi fries, you wouldn't even touch this- Tacos - Soft, double-layered corn tortillas filled with Bulgogi, soy vinaigrette Korean salad, cilantro, onion, Chi'Lantro salsa - their flavorings are so on point, everything was so good- Seoul Burrito - Flour tortilla, caramelized Bulgogi, soy vinaigrette Korean salad, fried egg, cheddar and Monterey Jack cheese, cilantro, onion, Chi'Lantro salsa, lime-buttered rice, sesame seeds - burrito was also delicious and on pointChiLantro was so good, can't wait to go back!

This is a Korean - Mexican Fusion Food Truck. All I can say is.... YUMMY! Everything was pleasing to my taste buds. ChiLanto did the catering for my friend's wedding. It was my first time sampling their food.  I absolutely Korean food and I gotta say, I'm impressed! Everyone at our dinner table was wowed by how delicious everything was! We sampled: Bulgogi Tacos, Spicy Pork Tacos, Spicy Chicken in the Baos, Jap Chae, Tofu, Sliders, and Kimchi Fries with an over easy egg on top. I can confidently give them 5 stars! When I'm back in Austin, I'll definitely look for this food truck again!

If you're looking for traditional Korean food, this place is not the place to go. If you're looking for hipster Americanized Korean food, then you came to the right place! They have added more items to their menu since expanding from a food trunk to a brick and motor. They added rice bowls! The only thing I get is their kimchi fries. Everything else I have had such as their burgers, fried chicken, and bowls were bland to me. The decorations and design of the restaurant is trendy! It would be a good place if you wanted to take some instagram photos of the food.
Food is usually good, but when delivered, they almost always get the order wrong. Ask for extra kimchi? You'll get none at all.  Specify kimchi sauce for your bowl? Too bad, you get Thousand Island!
We used the food truck to cater our Christmas Party. Awesome service and food! Loved the kimichi fries.

*Revisions*Decided to try Chi'Lantro again and ordered the same meal (noodle bowl with beef) my portion was twice as big and still delicious! The small portion must of been a one off situation.. maybe they where running low that day. According to the great Anthony Bourdain, " A Restaurants success is dependent on consistency." I see great things in Chi'Lantro future. Also, the manager of this location exudes so much passion it radiates!

This was my first time here. The manager was really nice and gave me information around catering which I thought was very proactive and observant of him ( I was wearing a name badge and he saw a business opportunity! That is great and very professional!) The food had awesome flavors, I loved the sweet potato noodle and beef with cilantro.... all my favorite things in one dish. The reason I gave 3 stars is because my serving was really small. I feel like they were running out of noodles, and gave me what they had left. I left still hungry and unsatisfied, and I don't have a large appetite. Has anyone else had this experience or was it circumstantial?
Honestly, the food was edible but not worth trying again. Didn't have a "wow" factor for me. However, the presentation was nice.

Great place to eat. I had the Kimchi fries with beef and the flavors were absolutely amazing. Fries topped with kimchi, beef (steak), cheese, spicy ranch, and kimchi sauce. They don't take cash, just as an FYI
Lovely kimchi fries.  Not too spicy or cheesy.  The food truck was very fast, which I appreciated.

Delicious and definitely a new take on the original Korean food of Kimchi with fries. The menu is quite simple and the food came out fast. Only place of improvement was to melt the cheese more, but it might of been the crazy lunch hour at SXSW where kitchen staff couldn't spend as much time on each dish. Very good experience overall.

3.5 starsMy coworker highly recommended this food truck and raved about the kimchi fries so we decided to come try it out. I ordered the quesdailla and split an order of kimchi fries. I thought the quesadilla was way too oily although the portions were quite large. The kimchi fries tasted pretty good and were definitely an unique creation. My friends were raving about the burger so I'm actually quite sad I didn't get to try it. I already had a burger the day before so I wanted to try something different, but don't make the same mistake as me and just get the burger. The meal was quite filling and pretty cheap, something that doesn't happen often enough when I eat at food trucks.

One of the best food trucks I've been to. Wow.We came right as they were closing and their propane had run out... *but* even with semi-warm deep fried tofu and fries, the kimchee fries were no-muh ma-shi-suh! A solid 92% from this Korean. ;)Only wish they put a little more kimchee on the fries. Then again, I can never have enough kimchee...BTW: kimchee fries = small to medium crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside fries + finely chopped cooked kimchee + shredded cheese + spicy aioli + Sriracha + magic.

:SXSW Food truck review: After waiting almost an hour in line for Chi'Lantro's  amazing kimchi fries I see the health inspectors roll up.. they then take about 20 mins inspecting the truck...  then proceed to shut it down! I'm not 100 % sure why but I heard the workers say something about not having running water. Watching one of your favorite food trucks get shut down is a scary thing!

The home of the famous kimchi fries! This place is awesome. I usually go with the Korean style wings or the kimchi fries with ribeye beef, but when I want to go a little lighter I choose the salad bowl. I eat here once a week or every other week. Customer service is always on point, the food is affordable, delicious and filling. I love this place and usually bring a friend or two. I'd recommend this to anyone that's a fan of French fries or Korean food.

After much hype over this place and longstanding accolades, I joined the queue of hungry festival goers at FFF to try some Chi'lantro. Their kimchi fries are certainly the most well-known item on the menu, and I probably should've ordered those, but at the server's suggestion I went with the fried tofu tacos. Anything taco + sriracha + kimchi is bound to be delicious. And delicious they were although not as astounding as I had built them up to be in my mind. Perhaps it was the fact that the truck was at a festival and they were constantly churning out tacos, but they weren't as fresh as I had hoped. The flavors were good overall, but the fried tofu was a bit dry. The tortillas were soft and fresh and the cabbage added an extra crunch but it could've benefited from more sriracha. I would probably go back to try kimchi fries but will satisfy my taco cravings elsewhere.

It's not as good as Kogi from LA, but Chi'Lantro has solid Korean/Mexican fusion, and I haven't found anything to top it in Austin. The kimchi fries are especially inspired.Besides those tasty fries, I've only ever had the burrito, which is good but not great. The magic sauce is a standout, but the rice a big snooze.
I have not eaten there but Shark Tank people  say it is the best they ever had.  I work in Austin, live in San Antonio.  Not sure if it is on my way but maybe one day I will stop in.
Cedar Park, TX 78613

Delivery Order - repeat customers Well let me just say this is hands down the best bbq we've had in Austin period. We've tried franklins, Terry's, Blacks and Stiles and they all miss the Mark compared to Alzer. Even more so, we've never even ordered in person, it's been delivered via Uber Eats all 13 times. In 2021 that says a lot about not just the quality of food, but the care they put into packaging orders, reading notes/instructions, and ensuring you actually receive value for the food you pay for. Is this place Black owned? Because by the taste of the potato salad and baked beans an old southern Black grandmother had to be in the kitchen putting her heart and soul into it! The sides here unlike most BBQ places are ALL amazing and tbh taste even better than homemade (didn't think that would be possible!) As far as meats, we tried the brisket (so moist and juicy), beef ribs and  my husband is obsessed with their sausage sandwich. You really can't go wrong with any choice. When I want lean brisket they deliver -- when I feel like a big fatty melt in your mouth piece they deliver on that too!Now here's the important part. When I order bbq I usually have to 1. Make my own sides AND 2.pull out my own bbq sauce from the pantry. I'm not at all into vinegar base sauces it really kills the mood for me. A nice smooth, thick sweet but tangy style sauce - Alzer BBQ has the best overall Kansas city style sauce I've had in Texas. If you made it this far you're doing it wrong. Stop reading the reviews and go place your order TRUST me. I couldn't imagine you regretting it even one little bit. Shout out to the owners for the level of service and consistency you've maintained - even through a global pandemic. We need more bbq places like this in ATX.

Thank you Denise for taking the time to write the review. Wow, you set such a high standard for us. I hope we never disappoint. If we ever do, please let us know. Our promise is to make it right.Thank you!

QUARANTINE/DOORDASH Order: First time ordering, got the Brisket Sandwich with Cole Slaw and the Rib Plate with Potato Salad and 1/3 lb Sausage and 1/3 lb Brisket added on. It was all so good. It cured our BBQ craving - only thing is now we want more!! The sandwich was so delicious. At first the ribs seemed like they didn't have much meat, but it was great! They don't skimp on the sides or sauces. Can't wait to get them again!
Great option for bbq. Generous portions, quality meats and you don't have to wait in line for hours. It's been a great place for to-go orders during the Covid 19 times.

Don't let the fact that this place is a food truck stop you from trying them. I previously made that mistake, and man am I kicking  myself now! Finally gave them a shot on Sunday and I so wish I had sooner! Best barbecue I've had in the area so far! We had the chopped brisket sandwhich combo and the beef sausage plate, both were absolutely Devine! I had the single sandwich and my husband had the double, the price on both is incredible for the size of the sandwich and the brisket was super tender and moist.. The beans are a nice combo of smoke and sweetness and the sausage was nice and smokey. A perfect meal for a Sunday picnic.  Definitely can't wait to try the rest of the menu. Don't waste your money on "upscale" BBQ places, this place has better food at exceptional prices.

1/19/20: Alzer's continues to be the best BBQ in Cedar Park.  They are not a brick and mortar.  They consist of 3 trailers in the parking lot of the Shell station.  They brisket has a perfect smoke flavor.  Their bbq sauce is a little sweet and an excellent compliment to the smoke barbecue they serve.  I often get the sausage sandwich.  Good flavor and nice consistency.  Sausage is not over ground like so many places make or buy.  If you have not given Alzer's a try because they are just trailers in a parking lot, you are missing out. The are definitely on my 'Keepers List'.4/26/20:  Alzer's is putting out excellent bbq with great customer service.  Everyone there is also super nice.  They do have new hours of operation Fri-Sat 11am-8pm and Sunday 11am-7pm...CLOSED Monday-Thursday.

1/19/20: Alzer's continues to be the best BBQ in Cedar Park.  They are not a brick and mortar.  They consist of 3 trailers in the parking lot of the Shell station.  They brisket has a perfect smoke flavor.  Their bbq sauce is a little sweet and an excellent compliment to the smoke barbecue they serve.  I often get the sausage sandwich.  Good flavor and nice consistency.  Sausage is not over ground like so many places make or buy.  If you have not given Alzer's a try because they are just trailers in a parking lot, you are missing out. The are definitely on my 'Keepers List'.

First off, BBQ turkey for the win! Lots of places around town only serve chicken pork and beef. So I was super happy to see Turkey on their menu. I called to ask questions about ingredients in their sides and again was delighted because all their sides are vegetarian. Score! I got there and ordered at the window and the quickly brought it out to me when it was done. Everything was well packaged and I was provided with everything I needed...even a mint for after the meal. EVERYTHING was delicious. My only disappointment was that it was Sunday and I didn't get larger portions...so I have to wait until the weekend to go back for more. :)
Great local bbq joint! Staff is friendly and the food is good and affordable. If you are in the mood for bbq, check them out!
Cedar Park, TX 78613
Honestly, it's the best BBQ I've ever had. I kinda thought that was true the first time. Now having had it a few times, I'm sold. I'd put it up against Franklins, Black's etc... it is unreal good.

Thank you Brad. We really appreciate such a great review. If we ever fall short of your expectations, please let us know. We promise to make it right. We love serving people like you. Our motivation will always be our happy customers.Thank you!
I do not say this lightly- some of the best BBQ I've ever had. I'd put it against any Austin area BBQ. Got the brisket and the turkey. I'll be back and back and back...

The reviews are very misleading. It's below average BBQ. The brisket slicing looks like a fourth grader with their first knife did it. Leagues away from even Rudy's. The brisket is under seasoned and lacks a good bark. I couldn't eat it and decided after trying with a few mangled pieces that it was better fit to shred up and put in breakfast tacos the next day. That's a sad fate for brisket that's priced similarly to the greats. Their sauce (which I don't really use anyway) is basically Heinz, or take your pick of any off the shelf sugary variety. Service wasn't very friendly from the woman at the counter. I really wanted to love a local business in a food trailer but sadly I won't be back.

The most incredible lamb chops I have ever had. I love lamb and have eaten much in my lifetime. Alzer's was perfection.  They were moist, tender with a light smoke, melt in your mouth goodness.  Have had their brisket and sausage which are excellent as well.  To find this level of food preparation out of a trailer is amazing.  Will definitely be a loyal customer!

This was a magical and very convenient find on our way out to Jonestown. We wanted to-go barbecue to take with us to the lake. As we were driving down 1431 I stumbled across Alzer's. I placed a to go order through the Yelp app - brisket, turkey, green beans and corn. Our order was projected to be ready 11:45. We arrived at 11:37 and our order was ready to go. Both sides were very tasty. The turkey was moist with a great smoke flavor. Brisket was also moist. They provided all the extras - onion, jalapeños, pickles, and bread. They do have a picnic set up for dining if you're looking to to stop. We didn't but it's available. Side note, they offer lamb shanks which I thought was a nice twist. I'll have to come back for those.
I absolutely love the fact that they serve beef ribs and other beef products. They were awesome and the staff and owner were super dope. Will be back

Got this via Grubhub delivery. The beef ribs weren't big on flavor, but they were good quality meat and tender. The corn was just odd. I don't know what they did to it, but it had an off-putting flavor. Beans were okay, sausage was okay. Overall, I'd say if you want to get something quick you'll be fine, but there's much better barbeque to be had in the suburbs north of Austin.

I have been reading the review for this BBQ truck for a while. Held off going because I kept thinking they are pricey for BBQ. The unique items finally won me over to try them.Upon seeing three Alzer trucks, it confused me. I assumed the one close to the street was for advertising and catering. I parked near the other two.  One was for ordering and receiving the food and the one in the back was smoking the meats.The people taking the orders were super friendly. I ordered a half of Cornish hen with green bean side. The freebies I got were pickles and I passed on the bread.They packaged the meal really well, no spillage. After unwrapping all the food, I dug in.The green beans were okay. No taste of bacon, onion, nor salt. Kind of bland. I pulled the leg off the hen. No crisp to the brown skin but its BBQ not roasted. I ate it anyway. The meat was moist but not juicy. You could taste the smoke. I forgot how small a Cornish hen is.  Not much meat. So the food was good but it didn't wow me. I will try it one more time for the lamb
Cedar Park, TX 78613

Don't let the food truck idea throw you. This was REALLY GOOD BRISKET! Plus, the service was awesome! Great local go to that's actually better than a local restaurant that specializes in barbecue. I'm not going to talk down anyone just because they weren't as good, so I won't mention the other place since they were fine, just not as good as this place! We're definitely coming back!

This place is out of a trailer and I have always said if its in a trailer or food truck its pretty good if its busy and its busy here most times.  Great flavor on the beans and potatoe salad.  Brisket sandwich had a good flavor to it.Small little place but it has outdoor seating for those staying.Come check out this place and if you blink you might miss it haha.

What a menu for a food truck.  They have lamb, lamb chops, quail and Cornish hen to go with the traditional brisket, turkey, ribs, chicken and sausage, as well as selling BBQ by the pound.I had a chopped brisket sandwich that tasted great and was very tender and moist.  Just the right amount of Smokey flavor with a side of sweet sauce.  My wife had a sliced turkey sandwich and said it was the same.  We each had a side of potato salad which was very good as well.  Of course it is outside dining or "to go" but they have a few covered picnic tables set up for your convenience.  Interesting also that they provide catering service.Open every day EXCEPT Monday.

I really can't say enough good things about this place. Tonight was our second time here -- we had ordered their brisket once before through a delivery app and really enjoyed it.  Tonight we opted for some by-the-pound options, and I was really pleased overall. We went a little overboard and wound up ordering a bit of everything (chicken, quail, lamb, jalapeño sausage, and the turkey) and it was all wonderful!  They hooked it up with the sauces and sides, and everything was just... man. If you want good BBQ, don't sit on these guys.  Their online ordering system is great, they're prompt, they're affordable, and the food truck area is nice and clean. I'd happily recommend anything on their menu. No matter what, you're in for a treat!

This brisket is the tastiest, moistest I have ever eaten out. Definitely going back. The sausage was excellent and really enjoyed the BBQ sauce, which I don't normally like. Sorry we waited so long to try!
Stopped by after fishing one day. Why having I been driving past this place for so long? Great big brisket sandwich and some bomb sides. Nice people with good food :)
Excellent food, reasonably priced (for BBQ)!  Love that it's so close and that the owner's and staff always aim to please.

The brisket was so tender you could cut it with a plastic fork.  We will be back.  My husband had the sausage plate but wants to try the quail next time.  Give this place a try.  They have out side tables or you can take it to go.

Amazing BBQ right here in Cedar Park! My wife and I decided we wanted some BBQ for our Easter Dinner, and Alzer's did not disappoint. We got a few pounds of moist brisket, and it was absolutely delicious. Perfect amount of fat, great smoky flavor, and the bark was delectable. I would even rank them at or above some of the well known BBQ places in Austin! Staff was extremely friendly, and I love the fact that they are a locally owned family business. I thought the pricing was right on, and actually even cheaper than most other BBQ places I've eaten at. We had corn, green beans, and potato salad as a side. The potato salad was the BEST I've had since I worked at Red Hot & Blue. My wife doesn't usually like potato salad, but she really enjoyed the one from Alzer's! Next time I'll need to get more than just the small size! Forget driving into Austin to find good BBQ, we have some right here in Cedar Park! Don't let the gas station and food trailers fool you; this place is legit! Looking forward to coming back again when we're craving some BBQ!
Cedar Park, TX 78613
It's the real deal, good Texas barbecue. Highly recommended. The only down side is they are not open every day.

Very good BBQ from an unexpected location!  Drawn by the cloud of positive Yelp reviews, I stopped by on a sunny, breezy day to try out this food truck's fare. Ordered a couple off the less-common items in Texas BBQ - the half Cornish Game Hen and the Beef Ribs, with a side of corn and beans.  Both were cooked to tender fork-ability, and the Game Hen had a nice smoke flavor all through the meat. The beef ribs were a surprise - unlike the Fred Flintstone style brontosaurus ribs, these are more like Asian short ribs.  Seasoning is a little puzzling, there's some sweet and herbal notes - maybe even sesame! - that I haven't come across in other Texas BBQ.  To my palate it seems a little more Middle Eastern or even Asian.The corn is unremarkable, but props for the beans.  Again, a surprise.  Rather than a typical BBQ bean, these are more sweet and sticky, like a serving of Boston Baked Beans.  I'd eat these alone or with a hot dog on a cold winter morning and love it!This place scores a 4 out of 5 on the 'CTJ Scale', as noted below.5 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing away after finishing a plate here.4 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary.3 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus' Dad.2 out of 5 stars: Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn't have my last supper here.1 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn't have my penultimate supper here, either.

INCREDIBLE!!! We usually pick up or eat here(precovid), but as a family with 5 young kids, we decided to order through DoorDash because it's not always convenient packing the 5 of them up to take out if 1 parent is at work... SO HAPPY WE DID! It was all neatly and tightly packaged so that nothing would fall over. I've had bad experiences with other places (EX:MFBurger) not packing well and sauce spilling all over bags and juices of meats dripping all over..just plain messes. So, Alzer's was an extreme relief with their over the top excellent packaging! Sorry, enough about the packaging.. onto the food! Absolutely perfect as always! They have halal chicken, brisket, and lamb so we opt for those for some clean good meats. We love all 3, but the chicken and brisket seem to go fastest. They all make amazing left overs too(brisket especially in our home and it even freezes well). Everything is always so moist and flavorful. Our last BBQ go to place (BigCats) closed down, so when we found Alzer's, it was a relief. When we actually tried it, were mind blown that anything could be better than BC! Way to go Alzer's.. never a disappointment!

It's hard to find places that serve halal barbeque. I have tried Franklin's and this place comes really close to it minus the long wait. I tried the brisket and the lamb chops. Both were really good. This is a food truck, but they have lots of outside seating available.
One of my favorite bbq spots in Leander. Always great food and friendly service. Don't let the gas station fool you.

Had the brisket, ribs, and turkey and they were ok, but all fell short of Rudy's. Brisket wasn't very moist and ribs were not very tender. Turkey was about on par. The side dishes weren't anything special either. All 5 of us thought Rudy's was better so unfortunately we won't come back here since it's equal distance to Rudy's.

Ok, this place is good... real good.  They have quail for goodness sakes!!Don't be deceived by the location, next to a gas station, as they have 3 trailers in the spacious parking lot.  They work out of one trailer and I believe the other two were smokers.  Some picnic tables to sit at and that's about it.The Q was delicious. I got the brisket and the quail. Yeah, quail and it did not let me down.  Not overly prices like most places that serve quail. It was smoked perfection. Even the little legs and wings were fantastic.The Brisket was pretty darn good too. They asked if I wanted wet, dry or medium and while I normally would say wet, I went to meet in the middle and chose medium.  The best of both worlds.  Things on the menu that I really wanted but couldn't get: Lamb chops!!  cornish hen.  This on top of the usual bbq menu items, turkey, brisket, sausage, etc.Overall, this place was well worth the visit and I'd love to go back and try those other items I missed out on.

I've eaten BBQ all over the country...Alz's has great tasting food. It's super affordable...a plate is around $9 about what you pay for a double hamburger combo at Whataburger....Plus they have great choices...lamb, chicken, brisket, ribs, turkey, and more....Go check em out....

Wow...this bbq is excellent.. I had the sausage and the brisket (lean cut). I've eaten cue all over the country and this is definitely among the best. I enjoyed the sauce it has a nice flavor. I had the bbq beans and potato salad - they were also very good. I've not eaten at franklin because of the wait but I'd rank this as some of the best in the Austin area. Also it is very affordable- I got two plates for less than $20 total. When I go the salt lick I am always at $40 for two. I took mine home - this is a food truck with outdoor seating.
Cedar Park, TX 78613

Cedar Park needed some good Bar-b-q and we now have some out of this food trailer in the gas station parking lot.  Excellent food quality.  Brisket, turkey, lamb, quail and sides were all really good.  Even on a hot Texas summer afternoon there were tables located in the shade with a nice breeze.  I do see a brick & mortar location in their future.

Damn ! The bbq here is awesome !!! Located in a gas station parking lot so do not be scared off. Nothing in the area bbq wise compares to Alzers. The brisket was incredible. Nice thick cut pieces with perfect smoke rings.  The sausage was amazing as well. We had some turkey too and it was good but a bit dry. We had potato salad and green beans and they were devoured by our family. Plenty of pickles and onions and bread to go with our order. Everything packaged spill proof. Can not wait to come back here next trip to Austin area.
What a gem this place is. Super good Quial and Brisket. We will be back! Fyi 17.99lb for Brisket

Excellent smoked sausage and moist turkey. Brisket was great, but we would have preferred a bit more smoke. Corn was buttery! Beans were a good bbq style. But sweet. We don't live close, but if we were in the neighborhood again, we would stop by and enjoy.
Amazing halal barbecue that's located right outside of Austin. Got the ribs, brisket, and chicken. All three items were extremely well cooked and tasted great!
This food truck has amazing barbecue! Love their potato salad and green beans too. So happy they are in Cedar Park/Leander area! Thanks!!

Great bbq with some unique offerings.  The smoked lamb racks are fantastic (a must try), I've not seen smoked lamb anywhere else certainly not in Austin, it is a must try.  The beef is also great, both brisket and ribs.  I really like that their beef ribs are the shorter ones compared to the dino sized ribs at most other bbq spots.  With the smaller ribs I can get ribs plus other meats and sides without going into a food coma.

Delicious food and friendly servers.  I had the brisket with a medium amount of fat along with a turkey wrap.  The cole slaw was really tasty as well.It was a cold night and nobody else was out there, but this could be a fun spot to take a date or a friend to hang out if it was a little warmer.

That was delicious ! My son and I had the chopped bbq sandwich. Loaded with meat and very tasty. Mr & Mrs Alzer are very friendly and gracious.  He brought out a nice sample of the beef ribs to try. And those were yummy! We took a plate of brisket to go. It was pretty moist and delicious.  Served with two sides and all the trimmings. Come by and try Alzer's Barbeque. They're a Cedar Park family as well.

I've been going to BERT's for over 20 years, usually once a week. From the old location on MLK to 24th St. to Far West. Gary, Jay, James, Lewis, and all the crew are good people who put out a good product. I've also used them for catering and that was fantastic as well. There is a place for craft barbecue in Austin, but for my money I'll take an old Austin original and ORIGINAL style Texas BBQ.

In the current environment, you need an escape into an earlier Austin and comfy food options.  If you live in Northwest Hills, your escape option is clearly Bert's BBQ, which I've been eating at on and off since my dad brought me lunch from there when I was at Doss Elementary.Today, I needed that comfort food.  And Bert's did what they do best.  Frito pie with chopped beef, which I customized with cheese and no beans.  It's not the current trend in BBQ, it doesn't come from a trailer, and it's not overly smoky.  But what it does, it does well.  It satisfies your hunger and it does so quickly and efficiently.  The team here is friendly and I hope they keep this up for 50 more years. (By the way, Bert's has been doing the same BBQ for 50 years as of 2020...)

While it has a "working class" "hole in the wall" "old time" "laid back" vibe, it's been around for 50 years and the folks there nice, all of which is totally cool, it can't make up for pretty mediocre meat and execution. I guess if you're in the area and are looking for a barbecue lunch, this would be an alright option.

For deer-heads-on-the-wall, local youth sports fanatics, and delicious barbecue, visit Bert's Bar-B-Q. This place screams old-school barbecue joint. Don't expect anything fancy, expect great brisket, ribs, and sausage served by friendly faces who have worked here for years. They slice everything to order. First time here? Order the two-meat combo with moist brisket and pork ribs. If you are looking for a go-to barbecue joint that is superior to any of the chain barbecue spots in town, give Berts a try.

I am so confused how people considers this to be good bbq. Went in for lunch. Got the turkey platter and Cole slaw as my 2 sides. I took two bites of turkey and dumped plate in trash. The turkey looked like a prison  thanksgiving dinner. The cole slaw was bland. The fridge it was kept in was very dirty and old. The potato salad was sitting out and left in the same bucket they probably purchased it in. The bbq sauce was the most watery bbq sauce I've ever seen. The guy poured the sauce over my turkey and it was like the sauce was trying to run in the opposite direction. I mean, the sauce spread over the turkey like Moses spreading the Red Sea. It turned into a stream of bbq water rather than stick to the damn turkey. One of the worst bbq places I've ever been to in my life let alone in Texas. Absolutely the worst. And this was $10.77 and didn't include a drink. It tasted worst than it looked. Would give 0 star if I could. How in the &$?@ is this place in business????
Great bbq like my daddy made. They still use real wood to smoke their food. Brisket is tender and full of season. Wait staff is friendly. The only place I get my barbecue.

I absolutely love going to Bert's Bar-B-Q. I usually go to the one in west campus (since I'm a student at UT), but when that one was closed for 4th of July weekend but this one was open, I made the trip, and I was not disappointed. Friendly service, good food, and good prices. The decor in the restaurant is homey and really showcases the history behind the establishment. I'll keep coming back.
Worst BBQ I've ever had. Couldn't eat the brisket it was so tough. I threw it away. They don't believe in BBQ sauce, so be sure you ask for it if you go there. They're not going to offer it!
Best smoke house in Austin, Tx. Still you real wood. Customer service is superb. All the meat is tasty & very tender. Every bite is packed with season. Most authentic bbq in Atx
