Sentimental memories of BBQ are not the same as BBQ.Bert's is an entire archive of happy memories of BBQ -and the Austin that once was - in the 1970's and 1980's.Never mind the fact that you are in a strip mall on Far West Boulevard.You might just as well be in Texas Memorial Stadium and Earl Campbell is still running the football and punishing tacklers.There are photos of UT and Austin in the good old days.There is a Wurlitzer jukebox with Marty Robbins, Tony Bennett and the Bee Gees "Staying Alive".There is a portrait of the founder when he was a young man.There is a photo commemorating the tenth anniversary of Bert's Bar-B-Q.There is a banner commemorating the fortieth anniversary of Bert's Bar-B-Q. It has over a hundred congratulatory signatures.Next to it is a commemorative declaration from the State of Texas, signed by Rick Perry - who then was governor.There is a burnt orange banner commemorating the forty-fifth anniversary of Bert's Bar-B-Q.There is a photo of the Clock Tower in Orange Lights and Number One on the side.There are no fewer than eighteen stuffed deer heads or antlers on the walls. The wall also has the original photos of the deer being displayed after being bagged, along with fishers showing off some really huge fish.Nearly everyone in the restaurant dates from the era of these pictures..Not counting the help, only one person in the store was younger than forty years old.*But time passes, and barbecue in Austin is a lot better today than it used to be forty years ago.The old classic places are being run by people who are not as good as their parents, grandparents or former employers. Mueller's, Southside BBQ and the former Lockhart establishments are shadows of their former selves.The new pitmaster-supremes are twenty-five to forty years old - are working in food trailers  on the East Side - and are blowing people away with what they can do to meat.*Bert's sadly has been left in the dust. There is not a lot of smoke or heft to the brisket. It is just lean meat.The sausage needed salt desperately but was over-peppered. The beans were tasteless, the potato salad supermarket quality.They do offer whole wheat bread as an option - and that is good for soaking up their sauce.The BBQ sauce still has the fire and tang.However, let's not go too far in sending Bert's Bar-B-Q to premature retirement.There were about fifteen people in there when I was eating - and they had clearly come to Bert;s because Bert's is where they wanted to be.Most were silver hairs who would never think of waiting three hours for a sausage link at Franklin's but want good BBQ close to their Mesa-area homes.*And Texas BBQ is still Texas BBQ.There is only one Texas in the USA, and the BBQ here is like BBQ no where else on Earth.Even just ok Texas BBQ is a privilege to have.If this place were in Wisconsin, I would be eating at Bert's a couple of times a week.(Wisconsin food can be really boring. Texas food rarely is.)So Bert's is still maintaining a great Lone Star tradition.And you look at the walls (or the customers) and you feel tied in to an earlier time when Austin was a magical place, but it was a different kind of magical place.Eating at Bert's is like visiting your great-aunt at the home.Sometimes she still has flashes of that old sassy fire, and she was certainly a Texas Tornado in her time.

Amidst all the trendy and high-dollar BBQ joints, Bert's quietly dishes good Q at a great price. You won't get a lot of style points with paper plates and styrofoam, but some delicious pork ribs and some unique specialties like the T man. If you want some no frills quality BBQ without waiting 2 hours, Bert's is your place.

I've only ever had the Frito pie and eclair dessert per a friend's recommendation. Both are delicious! I suggest getting cheese and extra Fritos and a few dashes of Cholula. Mmmmmm good. The eclair dessert was so tasty it has me researching recipes to make my own.I have heard those who order anything besides the frito pie are not happy so just stick with it. That is what everyone eats while here!
Every time has been wonderful customer service and food! I rarely give 5 stars but think they deserve a higher average rating! Close by and quick!
I love getting the turbo. It's my favorite. What else can you want. Brisket, sausage, beans, Fritos, cheese onion and pickles. It can be a bit messy, but it hits the spot every time.

Absolutely the best BBQ around!  I think they invented the bbq frito pie.  This is that place where every time you go it seems to be the best time ever.  The service is great and prices more than fair.  I would recommend trying it.

This past week my husband and I went to Bert's BBQ and had the absolutely worst lunch ever. He ordered the chicken plate and I opted for the sausage plate. A total waste of $19+. His chicken was so dry that he couldn't even chew it. My sausage was inedible. We threw our meals in the trash and left.

I like the texture of the turkey: more like ham. I don't know what's up with the sauce, either. It doesn't seem to adhere to anything. But, I come for the protein, which they sell, and for the nostalgia, which is free. I walked into the Bert's off MLK as an idiot 18-year-old UT freshman in 1996, and, feeling I had no place in that long line of football fans and regulars, asked "what's the T-Man?"After nearly 20 years, I saw this location in a strip mall, shocked. I couldn't believe it. I walked in, and there were the animal heads, the faded, hand-corrected menus.. and seemingly the same people behind the counter. I felt like I'd been asleep for 20 years, or had become unstuck in time. Where I had I been? What had I done with my life? I've never had anything hit me like walking back into Bert's did. I don't feel any different, but the time is gone, and I'm just as confused and unprepared.Now an idiot Austin citizen of 37, I was in line, disoriented, asking, "what's in the T-Man?"

Well thought I'd try bbq in a strip mall. And I got what I thought. Disappointment. Walked in and one customer in store. Walked up to counter and told the man was my first time. He told me " well there is the menu" so I rolled the dice on a sliced beef sandwich, PO, and sauce. What I got was greasy over fat mess, and the bare on meat, the cutter was weighing the meat and cut off till just right. The kicker was pay, ask for a tea, and the guy checking me out, takes my money, then reaches in the ice chest, were the ice scoop is to get my ice. My gosh! I didn't even drink it. Place was clean, but warm, ac wasn't on or not working. It is funny how two women come in while there the manger is all about helping them make choices and talking how great chopped beef is,even though it's the kind sitting in sauce all day,Sloppy Joe is what it is, at least change the pan out. Instead of leaving it all day and it's burning in got the pan. Also manger checked on guy at table, talked about baseball. Never said a word to me if I was ok. More worried bout the ladies and stacking stuff for a catering job in Westlake. Stacking it in the dining area. Poor, Poor, Poor.
This is one of my go to places for bbq. family owned, local, friendly staff. Great brisket, and chocolate eclair dessert.

I have been there twice. And both time they acted very rude. The first time I thought they were just having a bad day so, I just gave them the benefit of the doubt and today I went there for the second-and last- time. Well, the guys were extremely rude and treated me very disrespectfully. I am not sure if they are racist and/or just don't like Hispanic females customers. But I WILL NEVER go back there again.

I love brisket. And here, I find the brisket very bland. This place has been in business for a million years and isn't going anywhere no matter what the reviews are and no matter how rude or indifferent the staff are. (Yes, they are). Once in a while I give it another try (this would be about my fourth) and I am disappointed every time. It's edible Texas Bar-B-Q but better can be found within just a few minutes' drive. I like Rudy's just fine and it's just down the road so I will do that next time I get my brisket craving.

I was debating I should give 3 stars or 4 stars. It's a really small BBQ restaurant. The menu is pretty simple too. Totally 4 staffs there including one cashier. I ordered one combo sandwich and one beef sandwich. They served my food very quickly, quicker than a fast food place. Good for lunch. One problem is he forgot to put sauce on the meat. So I went back for the sauce. And he was embarrassed. Another older guy (maybe the owner) gave him a look. I didn't feel bad about it at all. I think not many people ordered sandwich here.I don't know if I was hungry, I finished both sandwiches on the way quickly. I thought I could gave one to my coworker. Both of them taste good. Maybe only Texans know how to make BBQ.I wanted to give 4 stars because I want to support a small store with nice people.

This small shop has some amazing food. The first time I came here, they were out of banana pudding so they gave me the eclair cake instead at no charge! I was not disappointed. I ended up going back 2 weeks later because I was still craving it.
Good brisket and sausage. OK beans. Get the T-Man, Turbo, or Frito Pie for a real taste of what this place has to offer.

You haven't had Austin BBQ if you've never been to Berts. The Frito Pie will change your life. Fritos, beans, chopped beef and sauce. Sounds simple but it will rock your world!  I add sausage to mine for an extra kick. LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!

Finally gave this place a shot, wouldn't go again. Tasteless brisket with no smoke ring. The sides were bland and uninspired. On top of that, the interior is boring and run down, and the prices are pretty high. This place needs. Serious refresh and rethinking or they'll be out of business in a couple of years.
I really like this place. The meat was good and the lady hooked me up with a bunch of sauce and bread. They were nice. I'd go back for sure.
If you want BBQ, Bert's gets 'er done!  Def try their T-man if your hungry.  The two brothers, prob the co-owners, have been doin this for a long time.  Nothin' fancy here, just good eatin'!
Bad bar-b-q. mediocre service. Overpriced for what you get.I tried giving them several chances.I'll now be going elsewhere when I want bar-b-q.Don't go here.

As others have mentioned, I also received that "outsider interrupting the campfire" feeling when I set foot in Bert's.  It was pretty dead when I arrived but traffic quickly picked up for lunch.I had the 3 meat sampler.Ribs - their best meat today.  Was tender and well cooked.  I didn't taste much flavor or smoke though.Brisket - was inconsistent.  Some pieces were moist, some cuts were dry.  Small smoke ring.  No real flavor or smokiness unfortunately.Turkey - When they pulled this out of the warming drawer I was worried as it appeared to look like a processed piece of turkey.  I'm pretty sure I am correct, the turkey was flavorful and moist but it seemed like it was a processed piece of meat similar to a ham.Beans - nothing to write home about.Sauce - sweet, ketchup based.I should have had a beef rib instead of the turkey.  Overall I marked them down for the blandness across all 3 meats and the turkey.

I struck out today to have a fabulous BBQ lunch at Bert's Bar-BQ with a fellow fan, Thomas.  The stars were aligned, the sun was shining, and I got the front and center parking space.  When we entered we picked up the menu to decide on which of the 3 specialties we wanted.  Thomas was quickly heckled by Gary, the owner, as he was confused why Thomas would pick up a menu after ordering the same thing for over 20 years.We explained that we were doing research for manuptexasbbq, to direct people the correct way to order.  Bert's is not a straight BBQ place, the joy lies in the "Specialty" items.  3 Specialty Items on the menu: Frito Pie (small or large), T-Man (small or large) and Turbo T-Man (Small frito pie+small T-Man).I have always ordered a small frito pie, Thomas has always ordered a large frito pie.  This day, I wanted sausage on top, so I thought I wanted a Turbo T-Man.  Gary quickly sized me up and said no, you want the small frito pie with sausage on top (i guess I didn't need the additional t-man to get the sausage)...Thank you BBQ Monger.We quickly ate our meal debating over UT football...Applewhite "Co-Offensive Coordinator"  we think he should take on a signature hat to offset the "Co".  My vote-the LBJ Cowboy Hat.Thank you Bert's for delivering the SAME amazing meal for over 20 years.  I may get older, but the BBQ taste the same.

I really don't like giving low scores, but this had to be one of the worst bits of BBQ I have had since moving to Texas. It was bland, bland bland. The sauce tasted like tomato sauce to me, and had no texture of spice to it. Even the Slaw was disappointing and I like all kinds of slaw.The inside was not the cleanest looking place, very worn down.I will give them another chance in a year or two, who knows maybe I will be in the mood for food with no flavor.closed on Sundays fyi
My husband & I were overwhelmed about the service we received. Everything about the food we got was very delicious! We can not wait to buy moor. It is a drive away, but well worth the drive!!!

I stopped at Bert's yesterday.I bought 3 beef ribs and a half pound of moist brisket!Fantastic food.I will  never go to Bill Miller on Burnet Rd. again.  Food not worth their high prices and they have a pi.. poor attitude!Will go to Bert's from now on!

Ahhh...Bert's...I remember going to the Bert's on MLK back in my high school and college days. Sadly, that location burned down in early 2007. I keep forgetting about this particular location, but I, fortunately, just happened to be in the neighborhood, spotted it, and decided I needed to visit even though I had reservations at Austin Land & Cattle Company in 90 minutes.Walking into the place, I was immediately struck by the familiar smell of wood and brisket. This is quite different from those burnt sugar odors emanating from mass chain restaurants that smell like they only serve the infamous McRib.While others opt for the typical BBQ fare, at Bert's, I've always ordered the Frito Pie, and I will always continue to order the Frito Pie. Once you've lived outside of Texas, you will realize how rare a treat it is to experience something so amazing and unique. Even in Dallas, I have yet to find this delectable dish.Yesterday was no different...getting it to-go, I drove back to my parents' house in a huge hurry, unwrapped it like a Christmas present, and proceeded to devour it with some white bread, noting the nuances between the sweetness and smokiness of the meat and the crunchiness and saltiness of the Fritos with the bread and beans helping to bridge the gap.Needless it say, is it the best BBQ I've ever had? Probably not. But, to me, it reminds me of happy times when all I had to worry about was homework the occasional test, and dodging curfew. Gourmet it isn't, but it is and will forever be comfort food.

Seriously, I hate this place. It actually was my first Texas BBQ experience. I ordered brisket, pork ribs, and sausage. Food was just meh... The sauce is too liquidy... I went to the Rudy's and Franklin and I think I had true Texas BBQ.... Oh, the price is too high for what you get... Stay away!

I was channeling my inner-Red State today, so I decided to stop by Bert's to see how they've been keeping the T-Mans in my absence.  The verdict?  Still as delicious as ever and still as good as the old location. (We miss ya ol' MLK location with your signed pictures of Rick Perry, faded UT football posters, and wooden picnic tables sporting signatures from all over.)One funny note:  I saw someone order the ribs today.  Hey newb, if you're not ordering a T-Man or Turbo at Bert's, you're not eating lunch!

Bert's BBQ is a restaurant not so dissimilar from many other Austin BBQ places:  They tend to do one dish or meat really well, while being average to mediocre on other things.    The one signature dish that Bert's does, and does extremely well, is the T-Man (a 1lb. frito pie-like concoction of BBQ sauce, beans, brisket, and sausage--fritos optional).  By themselves these ingredients are fairly average in taste by Austin BBQ standards, but combined they form a truly unique and delicious dish you won't find anywhere else.  The affordability, quick service, and unpretentious attitude will keep you coming back.

I went there today for a sandwich to go.The line moved quickly.They have bbq so good that you will be slapping the table.They accept credit cards.The parking lot was fine at the time I went,  which was around 12:30.I deducted a star/point because their dry erase board shows that the turkey sandwich was $4.50 but in actuality, it is currently $4.95.  I did not have the heart to tell the guys their prices on their white board did not match their flyers...and people can change their prices anytime, anyway, I just wish they would pay some attention to that, especially for the sake of the newcomers.Their brisket looked great!  The bbq sauce is just right for how they prepare their meats.I enjoyed my turkey sandwich.  I will return sometime.

First time coming here even though been in Austin 25yrs. Brisket was quite good. I had  moist cut.  Very flavorful but could have had a bit more wood smoke flavor.  There was a piece of lean but was dry.  Stick with moist and won't be disappointed.  Not fatty at all. Beef rib: great bargain compared to other places $10/lb vs $20+/lb.  Meat was tender and had more smokey wood flavor than brisket. I would say this is better than most of options around.
Tasted almost everything. And everything was so delicious. Beef ribs,brisket, turkey , chicken were Fabulous . Coleslaw even delicious ! Will be going there for barbeque from now on!!

Reminded me of a hole in the wall place back home. I had the t-man and a rib just to try. Rib was done really well. Served dry the way I like them. I would give them five stars on the ribs. The t-man is cubed brisket, sausage sliced, beans and sauce served out of a boat when I realized this I had to have it I have been mixing BBQ for years and finally a BBQ joint did the work for me. The cubed brisket was dry and a bit tough for my liking. One must consider the cubing process had some thing to do with it. The beans were perfect. Beans and ribs are how I judge a BBQ joint. This place will be a regular stop for me.

Far West is the less convenient, nicer sister of West Campus--essentially fraternity party central for UT students. Many students live up here, all the amenities are within equal proximity i.e. grocery stores, bus routes, and good grubbin'. Bert's has moved back into the West Campus corridor, and this one sort of has no appeal.On the idea of appeal, they are charging Franklin-esque prices, which is heresy. Brisket often runs no more than $10 a pound, yet I will say that there is a little correlation between pricing and quality. The brisket is great, but this review is about the ribs. They left much to be desired. Though the meaty character sits on the spectrum as fairly tender, the seasoning did not provide much in the way of true smoky character. The smoke ring was nonexistent.Bert's is humble, Bert's is true, and Bert's cranks out barbecued animals, but my heart was just not here.

When Rudy's closes it's eyes, it pictures itself being Bert's.Is it the best BBQ in the city? No. It is, however, something that warms my heart. They've sponsored umpteen million kids through little league over the years, and, in the category of Fast Food BBQ (yeah, I've invented that category) Bert's leads the way. This place is what small, independent businesses are all about.When you're there, try the Turbo con queso. Fritos, sausage, beans, brisket and sauce with shredded cheddar cheese on top. I ate one in 8 minutes once. Then I slept for days.

I'm always afraid when my work orders in lunch for us.  I'm know places can be hit-or-miss but honestly whoever is choosing the places we've been eating is missing.  They obviously don't know what Yelp is =P.To keep it short... I ordered a simple 2 meat combo plate.  It didn't exactly blow my socks off.  It had exactly TWO slender pieces if brisket and TWO slender pieces of Turkey.... uhhhh am I gettin ripped off here or what??  The portion aside the brisket was ok but turkey was pretty soft and tasty.Beans were pretty watery and bland.  Potato salad was average fare.  I just honestly don't know what brings people to eat at this place versus Rudy's.

Went to Bert's for the first time.  It was o.k.  We had the brisket, ribs, sausage, potato salad, and beans.  I liked the ribs but they were really small.  The brisket was good not great.  The sausage was so-so.  I thought the potato salad tasted like grocery store potato salad.  I did like the beans they were good.  It's a good place to go when you don't want to drive far to get some bar b que.

great comfortable casual "feel" insidevery good brisketok beanstub-o-lard potato salad (why on earth do all these bbq places serve tub-o-lard tater salad?)beef ribs looked very good EXCEPT there was almost no meat on them - so I paid $10 for bonescole slaw was good - at least not gooey like tater salad

i would give the cole slaw and the pork ribs a 3.5-4starthe friggin turkey was a LOAF!!!!! the potato salad was gooey slimmy bucket-0-pot-saladyuck bbq saucedid i forget to mention that the friggin turkey was a LOAF!!!!!

Bert's is pretty OK for in-town, fast-food BBQ. I can't say that I've ever participated in that whole Turbo con Queso thing, but I've had the brisket and it's not bad. The sauce isn't bad as well. It's a quick meal and it's not too expensive.Next time I go, I need to try their Frito Pie. But I just ate a burger so that's going to be a while...

Rude service. Mediocre food. Higher than others prices. STAY AWAY!We were nearly spat on for entering this BBQ joint near closing hours. We offered to leave and we were just picking our food up TO-GO. The manager and server begrudgingly let our party of 2 choose our meats and sides. They were rude and followed us closely out the door and immediately slammed it shut when we left. Don't Eat at Berts! Go to Poke Joes. Better food. Better prices and friendlier service.
Austin, TX 78748

I normally avoid reviewing a chain restaurant but this location of Texas Roadhouse is a special case. Last Veterans Day this location offered vouchers to veterans in lieu of a meal. This COVID inspired decision is probably the coolest of all Veterans Day offers since most are only good on one day. This voucher gave you until June to use. So, I decided to go and take advantage of my voucher.I arrived to see a surprise above the door. The owner of this location is none other than Willie Nelson. THE Willie Nelson. If there is one thing I know about about Willie it is that if his name is on a business that business is going to be good. He doesn't lend his name to subpar ventures.So, taking note of that I walked in and was seated.I ordered the shrimp appetizer, chicken fried steak main with a baked potato and a caesar salad. Everything that appeared on my table was good, hot, flavorful, well portioned, and memorable. The service, from front door to my exit, was excellent.I can't speak for other locations but I will DEFINITELY return to this one! Thank you to Texas Roadhouse for making this Veteran a happy customer.

Atmosphere 4Cleanliness 4Service 3Food Quality 4Price (5 low cost) 3COVID Precautions 5Likelihood to return 51-5 (5 Best!)OVERALL 4Date night for 1 LOL...  The wait for a table was an hour+ so I ate at the bar.  Fairly good service, a different service expectation since drinks are on demand!Food was good (not awesome as usual) it was not juicy and hot, and a bit dry.  I didn't see a manager on the floor, or in the bar area.Still a good time and good food.

If you like background info/"drama," start here. If not, jump to the *** below! :)BEFORE COVID-19, eating "out" typically meant take-out (for us, 0-2x/wk). Attempting to be somewhat budget-conscious, I kept a general tally of $ spent (family of 4 - 2 teenage boys), while I also gathered feedback of orders received ("doing my 'due'" as I call it to my family, regarding Yelp reviews).  SINCE COVID-19, eating "out" -frequency-wise- is about the same; however lately, I've been more closely analyzing $ spent, quality, value, etc.Average $ for a "good" dinner: $65 (family of 4, 2 teenage boys, appetizers added only if they don't impact the budget 'significantly,' and BTW I like my leftovers).VERDICT: Texas Roadhouse is a STAND-OUT in our list of places that we frequent (click on my activity to reference these).*** Review of 9/12/20 ***Orders: 1. Kid's sliders with loaded fries 2. Bacon cheeseburger with loaded fries 3. 11oz Sirloin with rice and loaded baked potato 4. Combo: 6oz sirloin and ribs with mushrooms and green beansOrders #1-3 and the always yummy rolls were on par, minus the doneness of the 11oz sirloin. Believe the chef mixed up his order with my 6oz sirloin (hubby wanted medium; I wanted medium-rare - they were "spot on," however the exact opposite- he got medium-rare; I got medium).Now #4 (my order): Besides the steak doneness mix-up, my order was missing the ribs! No ribs is not OK! I get this combo FOR their ribs and save some/all of the sirloin for tomorrow's steak and eggs breakfast. Definite reasons to go back (15-20 min drive 1-way), but yeah, grumpy about it.Cue Cameron, manager: Spoke with him about the missing ribs. Cameron was apologetic, desiring to satisfy a customer. He succeeded!So though my husband's and my steaks were switched regarding doneness and though I drove back to get my ribs, CAMERON is why I'm giving 5 stars. A manager can make or break a customer's desire to return. Yes, Cameron provided compensation, but he did so professionally and with genuine concern to not only satisfy us but he related he'll review the issue with his team/staff. So yes, this 5-star review is to highlight Cameron because people of his character/work ethic deserve recognition of their efforts and awesomeness.Yes, Texas Roadhouse remains in our top list of restaurant choices! (Cameron added the exclamation point) :)Pics added: my combo with the missing ribs, bacon cheeseburger, and rolls. Apologies: as soon as I realized my ribs were missing, I embarked on the mission to get them - no further pics taken!

This Tuesday night visit overall was good, not great. Overall rating: 3.5 stars, so rounded up to 4.  If you want to skip the details, scroll down to "SUMMARY" below.We hadn't been in awhile, so we were all delighted the birthday girl chose Texas Roadhouse.Our party of 6 was sat at a table vs a booth, and it was awesome - more room vs being squished in 3-across.Our server Olivia was pleasant as could be and gave great recommendations. The manager stopped by a couple of times to check that we were satisfied. Then there's Leelee: she did not seat us, but since our table bordered the main thoroughfare, she passed by frequently leading guests to their tables. I couldn't help but overhear her again and again informing each group of the specials, always with the same enthusiasm.Our night concluded with the birthday girl -however reluctantly- getting on the saddle! Family photo-op! Olivia was so kind to observe her wishes: saddle yes, the rest of the hoopla no.Our fare (with individual star ratings):-Hot & delicious rolls with their signature yummy butter. We got 2 baskets for the 4 of us who arrived first. Person arriving next got 1 roll. And unfortunately, the last person to arrive only got a 1/2 of a cold roll that was left. Olivia was very busy and was hard to find/catch. We didn't mind too much because it's so easy to eat too many rolls.  Rolls & butter always get 5 stars! 3 stars tonight because 2 in our party didn't get hot ones, as many as they would've liked, and there was no offer for more.- 2 Peach Fuzz's (Fuzzes? lol) - Meh. Tasted like peach juice. Alcohol in there? Scant. 1 star.- 2 Cape Cods - a little better? 2 stars.- 2 Black Russians - um, consult the manual: Kahlua & vodka (& nothing else). But, it's not uncommon that many places put seltzer in it (but that's not correct!). 3.5 stars.- Lemonade, sweet tea ("perfect" amount of sweetness=not overly sweet), Dr. Peppers. 5 stars.- Rattlesnake Bites - tasty fried balls of melty cheese and diced jalapenos served with creamy horseradish sauce.  3 out of 5 for "Would I order them again?"- Filet medallions with loaded steak fries and green beans. Cooked perfectly to order. Loaded fries = REAL shredded cheese (vs the liquidy alternatives) and a decent amount of bacon. 4 stars.- Steakhouse filet salad (my usual). Steak cooked perfectly to order. WAY to much dressing: Olivia asked if I wanted the Italian drizzle on the side. I ok'd it to be added since she said DRIZZLE. Well, my salad got a DELUGE. Darn, I really wanted to enjoy more of it, but couldn't.  2 stars.1 extra star for being cooked to order.- 11oz Sirloin, cooked to order, with rice and loaded fries. 3.5 - 4 stars.- Pulled pork dinner with mushrooms and fries - WOW! A HUGE amount of pork served with 2 slices of buttered & grilled bread. And WOW, the side of mushrooms was delish! 5 stars.- Smokehouse burger with loaded fries, cooked to order, and again YUM to mushrooms. 5 stars.- Kid's mini cheeseburgers with fries - 5 stars (because this kid always loves them, and tonight was no exception).SUMMARY:- GOLD STARS go to the cooks tonight - every burger and steak was cooked perfectly (& each in my family orders differently).- TOP-RATED ENTREES (from our orders): Burgers and pulled pork dinner.- TOP-RATED SIDES (from our orders): Mushrooms, loaded fries, green beans- RECOMMEND the table if you're a party of 6.- DISAPPOINTMENTS: Not enough/cold rolls for our late arrivals; no offer for moreCocktails were weakly poured.If you like greens drowning in dressing, order the salad as is. Otherwise, ask for dressing on the side.PLEASANT ENDING: For as many drinks and food ordered for 6 including the upcharges, our bill wasn't too painful ($140).

We watched them make homemade rolls while waiting for a table and then got to taste them! Excellent. I thought they were Better than Olive Garden breadsticks but my family thought that was debate able. How can you compare fresh to frozen bread? And the honey butter makes them perfect! So delicious, warm and melty. We also loved the jalapeño cheese popper things. Great start to the meal. But we would skip the blooming onion  app as it was really salty and just not our thing. The chicken fried steak was excellent excellent. Good sized portion. I even loved the mashed potatoes and Caesar salad. Both of those sides were made with quality ingredients and you could tell it wasn't just some filler food sitting lifeless next to the entree. We were also really pleased with our service and their efficiency for a packed house. The waitresses were friendly and actively engaging with us the whole time.

Yes, I love to get a steak at Capital Grill or Eddie V's on special occasions, but for everyday casual dining, Texas Roadhouse has my heart. First off in the height of covid, they had things down to a science. We ordered ahead and pulled up and they brought everything out to us. Now you can still order ahead and walk in to pick up or dine in. Be aware there. Is typically a wait on weekends or holidays like Father's Day, etc. why you ask? Because you can get a bomb steak dinner for a reasonable price! I am talking steak with your choice of two sides-I am a baked potato and house salad gal myself. They have blooming onions as well. Honestly, their menu has something for everyone, and I just think it is an awesome company.

Food was good. The host wrote down the wrong phone number creating an extra long wait. Our table was next to the bar, which meant that groups of people would crowd our table waiting for empty seats. All covid policies are just for appearances. At least 2 cooks weren't wearing masks and the manager seemed perfectly fine with it. This has been a favorite spot of mine for years, hope the next trip is better.
Great service our waitress Bri was amazing and went above and beyond and the GM Trey was phenomenal. Glad we stopped by after my girls dance competition. Will definitely come back.

OMG what a great restaurant great food prices are decent plenty to eat went for lunch felt like we ate like king (me) and Queen (my wife) had plenty of leftovers and made maybe a new friend our service his name is Matt actually grew up in our last residence in Palmdale CA
Austin, TX 78748

The one where I live in Corpus is horrible but I've been to this one 3x and it's been amazing every time.  My only complaint is that I saw a cook with no gloves, no beard net, no hair net and taking a French fry off a plate.  When I asked for a manager, she said "oh, he's off the clock, he's probably just helping, I'm kind of lenient with them".  I couldn't believe that response came from a manager. Whether you are on or off the clock, anyone in the kitchen should be wearing the proper protection and not eating, especially with the same hand you use to put a plate in the window and especially during a pandemic.

Fast food? Or half food? This place always forget something in your bag..onions, butter, sour cream or mushrooms. It's always something..Dine in is perfect..but if you want to go food you will never get everything..not more than once three to four times same thing. So next time I will have to dump everything out the bag before I leave I guess. Frustrating!

This is the Texas Roadhouse that we've come to for the past 14 years, close to home, great staff, and great food. Today I got the salmon, I know.... Why come to a steakhouse to eat fish? Don't judge me okay, it's freaking good!

I usually always enjoy dining here but as I'm seated to have dinner I notice a his restaurant is turning more into a twin peaks!! I don't enjoy seeing skin tight shorts all up some girls ass while I'm trying to eat..though this was a family dining establishment! This is not a strip club have some respect for the people dining we don't want to see this kind of mess

First time visit yesterday - came in for an early dinner. Upon arrival, we noticed the parking lot and front entrance was packed! Fortunately for us, we used the online waitlist feature to secure a table for 2 within 10-20mins. From the looks of it, it appeared we were in for a treat.I checked in with the host to confirm waitlist and was pleased to learn table would be ready soon. Literally waited 5mins and were escorted to our table.Our server, Jo, was very polite and attentive. I really enjoyed the bread rolls with cinnamon spread and the Jamaican Cowboy cocktail was delicious!I ordered the Dallas Filet and hubby got the 12oz Strip. Unfortunately the kitchen under-cooked and overcooked our steaks - food went back to the kitchen. I prefer my filet medium (not med rare) while hubby always opts for medium rare (his steak was in between med well-well done). Jo apologized for the cooks oversight and within 10mins, hubby received his ideal strip and my filet was prepared to my liking. Overall experience was pleasant thanks to Jo - really good food at a reasonable price. I look forward to the next visit.Since many businesses are gradually resuming operations, there might be limitations due to capacity. Just to be on the safe side, add your name to the list - I do recommend.

I've eaten dinner at this Texas Roadhouse location twice since I received gift cards. The ribs I ordered were delicious and fell right off the bone. They give you a very reasonable amount of food for the price you pay. I liked that they provide peanuts while you are waiting (if you ask for them). The restaurant itself could have been a little nicer on the inside and it felt unusual leaving peanut shells on the floor, although I didn't mind. Would recommend Texas Roadhouse for a tasty plate of ribs or steak!

We arrived as a family of 3. We were told it would be 30 minutes. We watched as other families of three went before though they arrived AFTER us. Our name was forgotten. We asked and it's another 10 minutes. We saw a lady and her son forgotten as well and ended having the manager seat her. Very disappointed in being tended to.

I hate to even write this review. I've been such a huge fan of TRH since they opened in Austin.  Food is always fresh and yummy and no matter what I try it's wonderful. Tonight was not an example of this:Cold hard carrotsGrocery store box macaroni and cheeseBurned riceTwo steaks both way over cooked and dry as a bone. Green beans and rolls are the only part of this huge meal that we actually enjoyed. I'm not a bad cook myself. Give me the $45 I spent on this meal and I bet I could do a Better job than your cooks did today. In an atmosphere where people are scared to go places or eat out, TRH should be making sure every single little detail is taken care of and as close to perfect as the price demands.  Covid kills bad restaurants too.

Great service the food was spot on baked potatoes were perfect. I had country fried steak Caesar salad and baked potato. Wife had chicken fried chicken salad and baked potato.ALL FREE to Veterans on Veterans Day, great business that shows their support to our First time we've been back since the quarantine and no in house dining, so the food was To Go. Everyone was friendly the food was perfect.I think everyone should support our hard hit restaurants during these trying times.
Austin, TX 78748
I'm usually not one for chain restaurants but this place is pretty dang good. Just their butter alone makes me happy when someone suggests eating here.

I definitely got a different vibe at this Texas Roadhouse versus the Texas Roadhouse back home in GA, idk I guess it's because this is Texas. Well anyway it was a good vibe. Even with Covid around they were booming. My server who was obviously busy, still was attentive and friendly. I opted in for fried pickles and it I must say it was probably some of the best fried pickles I've had. Crispy and seasoned just right and they give you more than enough dipping sauce. The food was great. My only issue was my ribs were slightly burnt, after having to wait as my server confused my sidekick of ribs for shrimp. That won't stop me from coming back though.

The rolls. Wow. If I could buy a giant roll and sleep in it I would. Right out the oven, nice and warm. Honey butter everywhere omg! I love these rolls. Seriously! If I could wear them as shoes, warm soles of my feet, shiny toe nails glistening with butter. Really if I could wear them as a necklace, I would take a bite every 3 seconds! Can we please get a recipe where all you need to do it add water!! Please!! It's not just the rolls either y'all! It's the happy hour drinks! The shells everywhere! It's the friendly service! It's the delicious meats cooked to your liking! LAWD LAWD LAWD. I'm my mouth is watering right now. And I just ate.

The wait at the South Park Meadows location wasn't bad on Sunday afternoon. After about 10 minutes we were seated with a basket of warm rolls to munch on. Our server, Payton, was great! Greeted us right after seating and was very attentive to our needs. We ordered the Herb Crusted Chicken and BBQ Chicken Breast. The sides were ample. I had the salad and loaded baked potato. The BBQ Chicken was overcooked. It seemed like they smothered it in in sauce to hide the fact. The server took it back and replaced it with another Herb Crusted Chicken which was a little salty but flavorful.In the end we left the place with full bellys and smiles.

In dining experience-I've worked at roadhouse many years ago, my sister also has.Rolls were made very nice! One of the best I've had in Houston/Austin area. I got the herb crusted chicken and it was cooked PERFECTLY! My fiancé got the 12oz ribeye medium rare and also cooked PERFECTLY! The slice of meat too was great! Service was fantastic, very nice staff! Definitely will be coming back to this location.

The steaks are consistently good.  I love enjoying the peanuts while  I wait a few minutes for my steak, and I look forward to the hot rolls and delicious better.I got a to-go order today, and they said they had no peanuts. Thats ok. But when I got home with the order, was disappointed there were NO rolls.  I can't get bread with my steak without having to make a special request for it? Ridiculous.  I got a sweet potato side, but had to scrape off the BURNT portions. The finger cleaning pad was buried under the meat and would have made our hands dirty if we attempted to use it. Just a tiny detail, but was was really disappointed not to have bread with my steak...this isn't fast food, it's supposed to be a good quality meal.Honestly, I would've been happy to pay an extra $10-20 to go to a place that will do it right.  Maybe I'm asking too much, but I like to have hot bread and no burnt portions if I'm paying more than $15 for a meal. Maybe that's asking too much ‍

First time at Texas Roadhouse south park meadows.  We added our party to the online wait list, it said 35min wait and to check in by 7:15.  We arrive on time and check in only to be told it'll be another 22min and we can wait outside or in our car. Already this is starting of bad and i'm not happy. If you have an online waitlist it should be more accurate than arrive and then still have to wait another 20 min. I do not recommend just showing up and waiting, try to book online if at all possible.  If you have to wait for a table, the waiting area is small and where you check in is small and usually very crowded.After waiting we are notified out table is ready and we are led to our table by a hostess that has with her a warm basket of rolls that we begin to snack on upon being seated. Besides the having to wait hiccup everything else went smooth that's why i still rated them 4 stars. The last few restaurants we have been to the service has been kind of bad like the servers were out of practice or something, but not at Texas Roadhouse their service is on point. We always get great service and the food is always good.  The road kill is my favorite i recommend to get it covered with the onion, mushrooms, jack cheese, and brown gravy.  I wish they had better sides to choose from .  I mean you can't go wrong with a loaded baked potato or steak fries, but i feel their other sides like the corn or mashed potatoes are average at best.

I live in San Marcos so I usually visit the Texas Roadhouse there, but on Sunday I visited this location and I have to say, I have NEVER experienced a great of a service as I did with Clarissa. She was so attentive, so friendly and made sure I was good the whole time I was there. My drink would barely reach half way before clarissa was refilling my drink without me having to ask. She was very interactive and made me feel at home and taken care of. I will definitely be returning to this location specifically to request her.

Restaurant is very clean, employees are friendly and teamwork to help customers are satisfied with foods. Managers and employees are using mask to protect keep away from COVID-19. Honey butter with roll bread so good! I love steak and baked potatoes!Michelle
Austin, TX 78748

Solid place we live by here and it is always good and good customer service! They handled Covid like a boss came up with a great system and kept providing great food! You can't go wrong with this place steaks, salads, seafood chicken burgers all good!!!!

For the 1st time out of the multiple(7, 8, 9?  ‍‍) times I've been here/ordered to go...they got the cook of my steak right!!!   Hallelujah!!!  Ordered Medium since they typically turn my steak into leather but this time...both my steak and my friend's steaks came out Medium!!!  On the other hand, I found out that the butter for the bread is missing.  I know I should have checked but seriously?  How hard is it to put 2 butter containers in the bag?  Whatevers.  At least the steaks were cooked properly.  Again...attention to details would have been nice.

Nicole is so incompetent.  She literally saw me waiting to pick up my to-go order after paying to another server since she was busy but then when my food came, she decided to skip me and get his order instead.  WTF?!!  My freaken order had ice cream dessert so getting home ASAP was necessary yet this incompetent cashier can't even do her job properly.  The only reason I come back is because I actually enjoy their steak.  Management, please train your cashiers/servers better.PS. Just got home and ice cream melted.

Went here on Friday afternoon...no wait which was a plus despite the restaurant being so packed.  Waiter took our orders and occasionally checked up on us.  We waited around 25min to get our food which was understandable since they're packed.  When the food arrived...they're overcooked.  I got the 8oz NY steak that was supposed to be medium well but was well done.  The waiter even asked me if I liked a little pink inside which I said yes...but what arrived had no pink at all.  My friend got the same thing but medium rare and it had only a slight pink...so hers was medium well.  It tasted good plus I was hungry so I didn't bother to complain since I'm not going to wait another 25min to get my food.  For my sides, the vegetables were delicious.  My loaded mash potatoes was good except the cheese looked like they're the shredded cheese from grocery store and hastily sprinkled on top and not melted at all.  Overall:Service was good for being packed.Food tastes good despite it being overcooked.  Attention to detail would be nice...like melted cheese on that loaded mash.Maybe it's just a one time thing so I'm down to check this place out again.  Hopefully, they don't overcook it again.

Tonight my husband and I were celebrating an anniversary. We both ordered drinks. My husband's drink arrived with a small fly in the bottom of the glass. They brought him another drink. He ordered a 10 oz filet but the waitress returned to advise him that they had no 10 oz filets and no one could cut one, but they could substitute an 8 oz filet and a 3 oz medallion. He also ordered the mushrooms. When his plate arrived the plate looked like it was covered with burned wood chips, but those were the mushrooms.  His steak was delicious but the mushrooms were inedible. We told the waitress but she advised us the mushrooms are always like that.  My food was without issue, but it probably will be quite a while before we return.

We stopped by after running some errands. Our fridge broke earlier so dinner was going to be at a restaurant, most definitely. I had never been to a texas roadhouse before and I was pleasantly surprised. It was hustling and bustling, but I was able to score bar seats pretty easily. It was Wednesday, thats the sirloin special night. You can't beat a pretty good sirloin and two sides for $10.99. Service was quick and very friendly. Amanda and Rhea took great care of us all night. Its a bit busy at the door but don't let that dissuade you from a good deal, a nice dinner, and great service.
Awesome food!!! Love the service. Ask for Tina G. She went above and beyond to make sure our dinner was a wonderful dining experience.

Best food and service in town! My mother and I had placed a to go order and was patiently waiting outside. Once our order was ready I was about to go in, but noticed three people standing less than 6 feet away from the door without a masks (other customers). I called and asked if they could bring it out to my car and they so kindly did! I was parked in the 15 min or less to go order parking. They didn't have to and they went above and beyond! We certainly have been paranoid with COVID and they made it much more comforting how much they care for their customers! I highly recommend them! I have been coming here since they opened and will continue to!

Texas Roadhouse is many things to my family. Comfort food, an origin story, Americana, a past career, and a great place to get safe food during the Covid-19 pandemic. The team is friendly and courteous. The website is well organized and the leadership is incredibly professional. The food is so consistent its uncanny. Package that with a well run staff and you have a dinner. Kiddos to this team for running their takeout and delivery with precision during these precarious times.
Austin, TX 78748
Great staff and food. Staff dealt with a couple of horrible customers who were just awful and they handled them with grace. Owner stepped in and did an amazing job.
Went in for dinner and had such a good experience. Service form Tina G was great and food was great!

This is Willie's place. It shows from start to finish. Everything I've hadhas been great. One of my faves is the Road Kill. The flavor is awesome as well as the sides. My all time fave is the Porterhouse T-Bone. The fresh vegetables are always properly prepared. The Staff is great and the energy is almost palpable. Very enjoyable!
Thank you for your kind words! We hope to see you again soon!

FIRE the Cook since the Cook needs lessons on how to grill a steak. I ordered Well Done and my steak was cooked RARE (Bleeding---Gross!). Literally bleeding that the steak was cooked 1 minute on each side. I ordered mash potatoes without sour cream. It arrives loaded with sour cream. Manager makes an excuse for the cook then states it's been happening this evening. That the Cook has been placing the wrong orders this evening. What! Fire the damn cook!!! Send back cooking school. Don't make freaking excuses! And you think he would have said, I'll buy your beer or give some discount. Nope still was charged full price. Sending a message to corporate headquarters as they lost my business. This veteran won't be back!
This staff & crew are always friendly & quick!! Great work!!  The carry out side of the business has been great.  They even gave extra rolls!!!!

I ordered my mash potatoes and baked potatoes loaded which cost extra to get home and not receive them loaded.. they didn't even put it on the side.. if you're going to charge extra at least check that's it's in the bag

I come here at least once a month and it's always a pleasure to visit. As in, order a medium rare and get a medium well and the person you're dining with orders a medium well and theirs comes out rarely.. So you trade. This Texas Roadhouse has never served me anything outside what I ordered and it is perfect every time. The food from the rolls w/cinnamon butter to the salads & rib eye steaks were delicious & cooked to perfection, whether you wanted it cooked for medium well to rare! The prices were great too. Definitely will be going back again!
Long time customer but the last three visits was a waste of money . Steaks were over cooked , fries were refried , place was dirty. Likely will not return.  Sad.
Austin, TX 78704

Admit it - we are spoiled. BBQ - especially BBQ in Central Texas - has been elevated to such great heights that grading BBQ has become unfairly skewed for long time establishments that have been consistently great at being good. Pok e Jo's is one such establishment. For decades now they have been delivering a consistent experience with some of the best sides in the game. The brisket is consistently good, the sausage is pretty great and the chicken is always on point - especially the dark meat. In this new COVID reality, I've made it a point to throw some of my humble business local restaurants whenever I can.  When I get take-out, I try my best to ensure it's from a local joint. With that in mind, I offloaded the stress of Thanksgiving dinner to Poke e Jo's this year. Money well spent. The turkey was great and I don't really care for Turkey. There's a reason I only eat turkey once or twice a year but I will definitely eat Pok e Jo's smoked turkey year round. It is that good. I am also pretty indifferent to stuffing but this stuffing was legitimately good. The gravy was also great. The usually great green bean & potato casseroles were consistent with how great they usually are.All in all - an awesome holiday meal with minimal effort on my part. The prep & clean up easily justify the price and I'm planning on doing this every Thanksgiving from now until I'm under the dirt.If you're looking for foodie-grade, world beating BBQ - this isn't that. We are incredibly lucky to live an great city with the best BBQ in the world and there are places that have that.I gotta say, though: I will forever miss the hamburgers, beef ribs, and black bean pico.If you want really good BBQ with a variety of good sides, options to feed large groups of people, and friendly staff? Pok E Jos consistently delivers.For consistency, longevity, tastiness -  4 stars.Extra star to help offset a ridiculous one star review.

Delicious BBQ at an affordable price. Line was quick and food temperature great. The brisket and turkey were moist and the sides we're tasty. The green bean casserole and Mac n cheese were my favorite. The banana pudding was decent to most. The cleanliness of the building and seating were ok. Thought the seating was quite narrow. Some of the child booster seats were broken.
Delicious BBQ at an affordable price. Line was quick and food temperature great. The brisket and turkey were moist and the sides we're tasty.

Just had lunch here today and it was great I had the 2 meat with moist brisket and pork ribs, Texas toast, potato casserole, pinto beans and tea. It was all very tender moist and hot. Ample room in the dining room to eat inside and it was clean orderly and the employees friendly and helpful.My wife had a chopped beef sandwich with potato casserole and said it was great.This is my favorite bbq place in southwest Austin area and they have never disappointed.Come by and enjoy a great Texas bbq meal and support a local restaurant.

We had the 2 meat dinners sides of potatoes coleslaw and fried okra. We had the banana pudding for dessert and the meals came with Texas toast.Since to go orders are the only option during the stay at home situation. I picked the order up and drove about 8 miles home.The sausage was a little more pepper than we are used too, not inedible but spicy. The brisket was tender and moist. Pudding was good but not the best I've ever had. On line ordering was easy and you call when you arrive to bring the food out. We are fans of poke e jos and will be back for sure.

Food is delicious and convenient, as always, priced nicely. Love the new brisket based chili for cold weather days when I don't have time to properly make my own! Best fried okra in town when prepared properly.

Great quick and tasty BBQ. It's a cafeteria type setting. You tell them what you want and make your plate before sitting. The meats and sides are always delicious. My only problem is that it's a little pricey for me.

If you're looking for consistently good barbecue without any hype or pretentiousness, well congrats, you found it. We always get the fatty brisket, turkey and sausage along with whatever sides make us happy that day. My kids love their mac n cheese while I'm partial to the potato salad, slaw & beans. This place is a S. Austin staple that's sure to put a smile one your face.

Had to have barbarque so I decided to stop at Poke Jo,s I ordered the two meat plate and loved the brisket marbled delicious. The chicken was good but dry. I really felt the chicken was left out too long under the ovens. So, my next visit will be if they can check my barbaque and see if its moist.located in a strip mall its decor is very pretty much wood floors very plain. Benches are available to sit. I rated the brisket and side salad 5 star and chicken a three star. Planning to try all the meats next time. Fountain drinks available and great staff friendly definitely will return again. Happy yelping!
Austin, TX 78704

If you are searching for barbecue? Keep searching! Trying to be a good citizen and support local delivery and our restaurants,  we ordered dinner tonight 5/6/2020, the 3 meat platter was so much less than adequate, barely enough meat for my partner, the sides were horrid and tasteless. I ordered the "big" sandwich,, what a rip off! About a half a link of the worst tasting sausage I've ever tried to eat,, the dog ended up with it. The potato salad, no flavor, no seasoning. I don't understand 42.00 for junk barbecue.  If these businesses want to stay in business,  i highly recommend they reassess what they are presenting to the people,  especially right now when we are all stretching our finances as far as we can, but, trying to be supportive at the same time. I am so done with being ripped off by their mediocrity.  Never again!!! Yuck

I got to say this location was hard to spot, good thing I saw the big Toy R' Us sign and kept following the road. Not the usual location I would go to but the food tasted the same as any other location. I was first introduced to Pok-e-Jo's and now I would almost always order the Combo Sandwich Meal with sausage and peach habanero sauce. Definitely recommend because their sausage is very delicious! Comes with one side and a drink, or get two sides and water. Get the Texas Toast with it and you'll be stuffed after. Service here is great and friendly, great stop for the day!
Thanks for the review Hong! We really appreciate you taking the time to share you thoughts. Come back and see us again some time soon!Regards,John, manager
It's not bad BBQ. Stopped in to get a meal to go for a group. Everything was okay, but not great. For the price there are definitely better Q joints around. This one is okay for a chain.

I've gone to a few Pok e Jo's in town and for whatever reason this location is always consistently the best of them.  The staff here is always super pleasant and happy to have you in (when it's a little slower you might get them to crack a joke or two).  Now, if you're one of those BBQ elitists - you might look down your nose, but hey let's be fair and recognize that you get some pretty good que here.  Breakdown of stuff I've had:Brisket - you can go moist or lean - but if you go lean prepare for it to be drier.  I like to get a little mix of both which they'll be happy to do for youChicken - I haven't had it but my office mate swears it's goodTurkey - smoke flavoring throughout, but not as moist as I would preferRibs - generally pretty good although I've gotten a few dry ones before.Sausage - always goodPot Pie - filled with some veggies and smoked turkey.  Really do like this - especially with the light flaky pie crust on top.Sauces:Regular - it's smoky and pretty basic not really sweet.Spicy - has a little tang to it but not really hotHabanero Peach - this one has a kick to it depending on how those habanero's are cooperating!Mac 'n Cheese - it's goodGreen Bean Casserole - like this one too - goopy goodnessJalapeño cornbread - yes pleaseFried Okra - so good - this is the way to improve vegetables - batter and fry themPotato Salad - it's good but not amazingcoleslaw - mayo based - pretty goodbroccoli salad - nice to see you being healthybanana pudding - just a little bit of 'mericacobbler - ditto the puddin'I'd say that you get some healthy portions here.  A two meat plate pretty much fills me up and a three meat puts me to sleep.  I like to get the sauce on the side so it's not all ladled over the meat and I can control how much I get.   If you're getting a drink - use a to go cup so you can take the rest with you.

Delish down home Texas BBQ! The dry rub on the ribs is just right, spicy but not over the top. The chicken is moist, tender and again, just enough spicy rub to make it mouth watering. Their BBQ sauces are wonderful and if you want fire, you can get all you want with the peach habanero. We will definitely be back!

Did a corporate event and wanted some BBQ for the meal. E-mailed the Pok-E-Jo's catering e-mail posted on their website catering@pokejos.com. Within 1 business day was provided a copy of their catering menu. We went with the 2 meat BBQ buffet. Was a great hit and tasted very good! There is a minimum of 15 people for delivery, and for less than 15 people you'll have to go to the store and pick up the food. We did pick up and was very impressed. They had all the food packed neatly, sealed, and in boxes. Had no spills or issues during transit, and they even loaded the food into the vehicle for us.  Plus our event started at 11:00am, so they worked with us to allow us to get the food before the store opened at 11:00am. Was even more pleased to see that provided ice, sweeter, and lemons for the tea. Also provided the cute red and white checker table cloth and spoon utensils. Was a quick set up and clean up. Which is saying something for BBQ ;). There was plenty of food and it tasted great! We will definitely consider Pok-E-Jo's in the future. Thank you!
Enjoyed every bit!! The food , the staff , the FOOD!! All the way from Katy TX to enjoy the meat falling off the bone and the okra fried to perfection. OMG EVEN THE TOAST !
Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review Keandra! We appreciate your business and hope to see you back in the store again some time soon.Regards, John, manager
Austin, TX 78704
All I can say is amazing! If you're ever in this part of town it's a must stop from the food to their workers! They will even give you samples if you haven't eaten there before.

I had 2 meat dish(turkey was excellent moist, smoky, fantastic texture)(sausage- jalapeño cheese was good flavor and moist as well), i wasn't a fan of the skin on potato salad(just a preference), and the coleslaw wasn't very tasty to me. I do rate their meat quality better than some of the famous BBQ places in Austin that I've tried.

We have tried most of the fancy and hole-in-the-wall bbq joints in and around Austin. Pok-e-jo's is our staple favorite and has been for about twenty-five years. We love the meats and sides. If you're getting brisket, we suggest sliced moist. Also, they are big supporters of the Longhorns. What's not to love?

Had the food catered for a business event. From a quality stand point, I would give it excellent rating. The brisket is so tender, where you have no need to exercise your knife's rights!  The sausage is as flavorful and tender.  To top that, I give the peach cobbler excellent rating as well. This is due to its "just right" sweetness level.  Four stars rating is due to not being at this place in person.  I definitely plan to make the BBQ Mecca visit, next time I am in town.  Give it a try!

Thanks for leaving us a review Mike, we're so happy to hear that you enjoyed everything on the catered event you attended! We love catering and are glad to hear you had such a great experience. Please do come by to see us at one of our stores some time when you're in town--we would love to have you!Regards,John, manager

I have been coming here for the last ten years and I have to say I am a fan. The staff is always fast & friendly and the food is great. Personally the jalapeno cornbread, turkey pot pie, moist brisket, spicy sausage and spicy BBQ sauce are some of my favorites.

We really appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback! I'm glad to hear that you have enjoyed your experience at our stores, and I just want to personally say thank you for your business over the last ten years. We look forward to welcoming you back in again some time soon.Regards,John, manager

It isn't Franklins or any of the other big names in Ausitn, but boy, is this place dependable. First, you never have to wade through long lines or crowds of people to get your meal and get seated. Second, they have absolutely massive drink cups (to-go and dine in), which fuel hydration and make you forget the hassle of leaving your seat in the middle of a delicious, messy bbq meal. Third, they have really reasonable prices. Fourth, I am a huge sucker for their disgustingly creamy mac and cheese and their killer green bean casserole for sides. Fifth, their meat is great. The brisket makes for an incredibly solid sandwich, and their turkey made for the best home-cooked meal replacement I have ever had on a Thanksgiving away from home. Last, I have a huge soft spot for Pok e Jos from my time at UT, where I ate it before every home game, so I can't help but have fond memories for it.
Hey Laura,Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review! We really appreciate your business through the years, we hope to see you again some time soon!Regards,John, manager
Austin, TX 78704
First time I tried Pok-e-Jo's and sorely disappointed. I ordered the "big'n" Spicy Texas Pulled Pork sandwich and I tasted more of the bun than the BBQ.

Okay so lets be honest.. other than Bill MIller's this is pretty much the worst case scenario for BBQ. Everything is either dry or tasteless or just not that great. I'll give them one point for the sausage as it tasted like a better beef sausage but it seemed to have been soaking in grease.. not sure what was going on there. The brisket and tenderloin were both dry ... so dry.. I wanted to stay away from the sugary sweet sauce but this meat was like cotton. Don't go here.. Don't Eat here.. Don't waste your time thinking about it.

WOW!  Pok-e-Jo's made our family's at-home birthday gathering an unprecedented success.  Pok-e-Jo's Catering Service was of immense help in bringing together the perfect array of succulent meats and side dishes --- that cheesy potato casserole was fantastic! --- and the honoree of the feast declared the huge meal the Best Birthday Present EVER.  This very well could be the start of a new family tradition . . . !

So disappointed! We love Pok E Jo's- been eating their tasty BBQ for years, but today, when we stepped up to the counter to order lunch, we were ignored... by all three employees... for over five minutes... It was crazy- nobody was even helping another customer- they just stood and stared.This has never happened before, but was quite bizarre- maybe we forgot to take our invisible suits off?

This place is great. It was our first time here. We ordered the Five Pack to go with brisket, pork loin, & sausage and the casseroles as sides, plus mac & cheese, and beans. With tip, it was close to $70. And we placed the order online in advance--ordered at 3 to be picked up at 5. When we arrived, I ran in to get it, and it hadn't been made. A tall guy behind the counter (kind of looked like the manager, but who knows) said it'll be a second, they accidentally gave me turkey instead of brisket but then I watched him put my entire order together right in front of me. Poor guy, I bet he hoped I wouldn't notice. I can understand how it would be easy to forget an order that was placed hours in advanced. Anyway. The funny part was when we got home. The 30+ lbs of food came in a large paper bag and my husband the genius thought it made sense to hold the bag by its two tiny string handles. Naturally, the bottom gave way and our food spilled out all over the driveway.  He started cussing up a storm, cursing Pok-e-Jo's, saying it was all their fault and that he should sue. I tried so hard not to laugh because he was really furious. But I mean, come on, it was totally his fault. So a warning to all: don't do what my husband did! Use common sense! What was salvageable was delicious. Thank goodness the bbq sauce and beans containers were wrapped in plastic wrap. In short, we'd come back the next time we crave bbq.

Had the 2 meat, ribs and brisket, green bean casserole, and corn bread.  The ribs were very small ribs, but tasty and mild for those of you who don't like Rudy's spicy rub.  The brisket was cooked perfect and also tasty and mild.  This place is perfect for 2 of my family members who can't take Rudy's rub.The sides were plentiful and served generously.  The cornbread is more of a cornbread casserole or cornbread pudding, however you want to think of it.  It's not anything you can hold in your hand.  They scoop it onto your plate.I will be back.

Food was great! Spicy bbq sauce was delicious.  Chicken was moist and juicy. Sliced brisket was right on!  You have to try the potato salad and macaroni; definitely a place to bring the family and get away from the city life.
Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review Manny! I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit, and we hope to see you back in the store again some time soon.Regards,John, manager

I don't think I have ever received such exceptional customer service. I called in a order for my co-workers (it was a very difficult order). When I got there there was a man Matt at a desk doing paperwork and a few people in the line ordering. I didn't know if there was a pick up line, as he saw me looking lost, he stopped what he was doing to help me. I asked him if there was a pick up line and he said that he would grab everything for me. It wasn't quite ready so he helped me get all the drinks from the fountain, he got me a drink holder, loaded them up made sure to get me condiments and extra sides. Matt and I believe her name was Sirye are truly great.
Austin, TX 78704

Pok-E-Jo's is definitely A-OK.  My favorite of the meats is the sausage, soft and juicy.  The turkey is pretty good, brisket is my least favorite, but not bad.The sides are great.  Corn, Mac and Cheese, Beans.  I have tried some of the others, casseroles and okra ...those are pretty good too.$31.99 for family pack: 2 lbs of meat and 3 big cups of sides.  They say it feeds 4 people, that is 4 hungry adults.  Great Value.And the sweet tea is excellent!

Me and my family went here tonight and it was amazing. The service couldn't have been any better and the food was delicious and mac and cheese to die for.  Typical pricing but worth every penny. We will definitely be returning.
Hi Lori,Thanks so much for the review! I will definitely pass on your comments to our staff, they will love reading it. We hope to welcome you and your family back in soon!Regards,John, manage

I was hangry and extremely disappointed when I wrote my initial review. While I didn't get my entire order the food I did get was really good. Lesson learned about online BBQ ordering stands though, just give them a call if it's late in the day to make sure they have some meat left. ***Do NOT order online. They run out of important stuff and you'll show up to get it with a surprise of half your order not being available. No brisket and no ribs at a BBQ place at 8pm is a problem.
Do NOT order online. They run out of important stuff and you'll show up to get it with a surprise of half your order not being available. No brisket and no ribs at a BBQ place at 8pm is a problem.

Solid food for a semi-fast-food BBQ chain restaurant! Good prices and basically no wait for pretty decent BBQ. Huge selection of sides and nice desserts. I had the mac-n-cheese (very good) and the baked potato casserole (decent, but nothing special) along with a 3 meat plate of pork ribs (excellent with a great sweet rub), brisket (pretty good), and turkey (decent, but nothing special).

I don't mind barbecue, I've just never felt the need to drive to Driftwood or Lockhart to eat it; and since the only thing I like to do at gas stations is buy gas, I'll concede I'm missing out on some really great barbecue from places I always hear about. With that said, I dutifully take visitors and prospective in-laws to either of the two County Lines in Austin, because it's the law. But for my own personal bbq fix every now and then, I come to this Pok-E-Jo's.I don't know the story about this company, but I miss the 5th Street location, I haven't been to the Parmer Lane place, but their Brodie Oaks location is larger and a tad more comfy for me than the Arboretum one. The bbq has been good for me at both Pokes. Apparently there are Round Rock and Hancock Center locations as well. Cool.If I'm low-carbing, it's brisket and onions--life is good.  If I'm being normal, Poke does an exquisite made-to-order fried okra I enjoy, and their broccoli salad is scintillating. Banana pudding and sweet tea. Ummmm.All things considered, I don't know--driving outside of Austin to eat bbq strikes me as driving to Waco or San Antonio to catch a plane.  If it's worth it to you, go for it.  I'll be at Poke's eating while you're in a car driving.

Love their BBQ. The darker sausage is good. I love the BBQ sauce. Free refills. Their French fries are so yummy! Greatly seasoned. Its right next to my job so convenient...but pricey af. I understand good meat is pricey.
Hi Victoria,Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review! We're glad you enjoyed everything. Come back and see us some time for some more BBQ, we would love to have you.Regards,John, manager
NA
Austin, TX 78757

This is one of the places that have kept me sane during COVID where I can't really go in anywhere and risk passing anything to immunocompromised family members.The quality of food has greatly improved.  It is surprisingly good, be it the brisket, fried chicken, mashed potatoes, or the pies.  The ice tea is always top notch as well.You can't beat this for the price, period.  This is one of my #1 spots I order delivery from due to the pandemic.
We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us, Douglas! We value your input and encourage you to let us know about your future experiences with Bill Miller.
column21: North Austin Civic Association, Austin, TX

column20: A couple of months ago I posted a negative post for this location and One of the mangers reached out to me rather quickly.. It appears my concerns have been heard. Now I would like to post a very positive experience with there drive thru and purchased meal. One of the best meals I had in a long time. Perfect customer service, Right taste, and portion for the money.. Thank you for a well deserved 5 star rating !
Victor, thank you for your review. We are happy to hear our team was able to make this right! We do appreciate your business and always welcome your comments.

This location is one of the worse places when it comes to plates. When by the drive  around 8:15 pm today and ordered a rancher plate. They put very little brisket, maybe enough for a small sandwich..  For over $15 dollar plate ? Is crazy.. If the reason is because they are about to close for the day? And don't have enough brisket? Don't sell the plate. This is not the first time either. Will never return...Appreciate you reaching out to me.  I'm not looking for a hand out.  By you addressing it with your staff? It's good enough to me. Again thank you
We hadn't been outside anymore than to walk the dogs for a month and decided to order Pick-Up at the Window. We'd be there in 15mins. We were like two kids driving there & back! We were escaping!
Thank you for your review, Ann! We appreciate your business and look forward to your next visit.

Asked someone where I was shopping where I could get a good taco nearby. They suggested this place. Drove there and went through drive thru, confirmed breakfast tacos are served all day. But then I was told they have no bacon and no eggs. Ummmm, how do have breakfast tacos with no eggs?? I pulled off and left. Do better.

Hi Valencia! Breakfast is served until 11:00 a.m. on weekdays and 12:00 p.m. on weekends. Please visit our website to learn more about our tacos served all day. We hope to see you again soon!  billmillerbbq.com/#food-…
Austin, TX 78757
Really good. Had brisket and sausage. Very tasty. Sweet tea the bomb. Mashed potatoes excellent with the onion in them. Loved the pinto beans and green beans!
Thank you for your review, Karen C.! We appreciate your business and look forward to your next visit.

Whoa!!! Where should we begin??? Let's talk Sweet Tea the way it's meant to be! Let's talk about juicy, plump smoked sausage that lights up your taste buds! OMG-osh!!! Did we mention the B word???? BRISKET, BRISKET, BRISKET!!! Yes. We said BRISKET! Oh man, we've had it in Florida, munched it in the Middle East (one of the guys, lol), even chowed-down on it in Houston! Tell you what, we ain't never (sorry) had  such mouth-watering,  succulent,  satisfying, TENDER, crazy-good BRISKET!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! NUF SAID, YA'LL! C-ya!
We’re happy to hear you had a positive experience, Carlise E.. We value your input and encourage you to let us know about your future experiences with Bill Miller Bar-B-Q.

I GIVE UP ON THIS PLACE. I can't count how many times my order has been incorrect. It must be extraordinarily challenging to get folks that care at 6am, but this is ridiculous. I have Celiac, and even though I shouldn't probably eat their homemade corn tortillas.... they don't bother my system and have been a great option for breakfast tacos. Over and over again I get flour, no bacon, barely anything in the taco, etc. They just DON'T CARE. Don't bother trying anymore. I'm not.

I grew up with Bill Miller BBQ as a San Antonio native but since moving to Austin 22 years ago the restaurant had receded from my view. A friend recently reintroduced Bill Miller's as a great place to get breakfast tacos. I'm hooked!There is one glaring problem however; the consistency of the food items vary wildly day to day. On some days the refried beans are the best you can ask for...and on other days I could swear they came out of a can. Chorizo and eggs...sometimes mixed/cooked together (the right way) other days, eggs and chorizo put together separately. There are too many other examples to list here.This place brings back pleasant childhood memories but I'm curious to know why food consistency is such a challenge here. I shouldn't have to feel the need to flip a coin to decide whether Bill Miller's will "get it right" today or not. Side note: The carne guisada has been awesome every time.
Went for breakfast and, you know, it was awesome.  Quick service great value - perfectly cooked bacon, awesome tortillas- quiet.  Lovely!!
Thank you for your review, Kristina! We appreciate your business.

This review is a long time coming.  While the food here is good the take out crew cannot get an order correct.  EVER - there is always a taco missing, or the bacon missing, etc.  I've called and of course been told that gee we will give you a free taco next time.  Well next time the free taco is there, but the rest of the order is screwed up.  I don't know if it's every Bill Miller - but the one on  Burnet road just sucks for service.
Austin, TX 78757

Back in Texas for the weekend and Jonesing for the real thing, brisket done Texas style.  Ordered a pound.  Got 3-4 ounces of meat and the rest was just plain old fat. Just disgraceful.  There is no pride at Bill Miller.  Drive on past is my advice.  Unless you really really like smoked fat.

Mark, thank you for taking the time to review our Burnet Rd location. We want to sincerely apologize for the quality of your experience. This is not the quality service that we pride ourselves on. Please send us a message with your contact information so we can make this right. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

Oh boy where do I begin. Three of us came over and got three different orders including different sides and desserts. Everything was just bad. Worse BBQ ever. It's so sad since there seems to be some legacy, but the food was just awful: the only exception was the hash brown and the service was decent. But you can tell people here don't seem to care about the taste. It's worth saying that we didn't get the tacos: but I don't think I'll bother coming up.
