We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback. We want you to have a great experience every time you dine with us. If you'd like to discuss your experience further, please send us a message with your contact information so we can better serve our customers. Thank you.

I like the food although the end result is inconsistent on quality. ie raw pancakes in the center. I suspect it's due to a high employee turnover. Also, glass cabinets and windows could use cleaning. I hope things change because food can be real good at times.

Bill Miller BBQs don't get no respect.In actuality they are not bad.Most things at Bill Miller are better with sauce - but with sauce they are okay.*****Bill Miller is a funny kind of a place.It is a barbecue with fried chicken and breakfast service and tacos.There is a little bit of something for everybody.Bill Miller is a chain and it feels like one.Not a lot of foodies eat there.*When I first moved to Texas from the Great White North -one of the first things I did to "fit in" was to learn about Texas BBQ and Tex-Mex food.So I learned that Lockhart was good and Bill Miller's was bad -so I taught my kid to be snooty about Bill Miller's.*That was a mistake that came from pretending to be more Texan than real Texans.At some point, I went back and decided to retry the house specialties.I had a sausage link and a fried chicken sandwich.The sausage was pretty decent.Commercial yes. Similar to what you could do at home with a sausage from HEB yes.But that still means good.The BBQ sauce was exceptional - so dipping sausage in BBQ sauce meant good times.Bill Millers - better with sauce.*The chicken in my fried chicken sandwich was less impressive.No grease - which was a plus.No taste - which was a minus.However, the condiments table has all sorts of goodies including pico de gallo for the tacos.Pico de gallo made the sandwich a winner.Once again - Bill Millers - better with sauce.*Is this the one place you should take an out of town visitor to get real Texas cuisine?Probably not.But a lot of people were happily chowing down when I was there -and I did not leave dis-satisfied.*On the Samuel C ranking of the Merits of Chain Restaurants:Bill Miller is better than P. Terry or KFCabout the same as Taco Cabanaand not quite as good as Jim's.(Thank you Brody H for the Taco Cabana comparison.)Middle of the road food at a decent price.
Service - 1 Star (see picture)Food - 2 Stars Sweet Tea - 5 StarsYup, pretty much sums things up.

The value for what you receive is good. I had a Combo that came with two Chopped beef sandwich's, fries and a large Tea. The fries were hot and fresh. The Tea was on the week side. The sandwiches are a whole another story. The meat had no flavor. This is common with restaurants who bake their meat instead of actually BBQing it. If I wasn't hungry I wouldn't have had a second bite. The meat was so mushy it could have passed for baby food. To make things worse it was smothered in a tasteless sauce. I think I'll stick to their Fried chicken and Chicken fried steak.

We come here for the fried chicken. It's not spicy but is done great. Crispy and fresh. It comes out hot and fresh. Great price too. It comes with fries but you can substitute and of there sides. I got potato salad. It was great. I also got a side salad and I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't just iceberg lettuce. It was a mixed green salad with cucumbers and tomatoes and the Ranch dressing was good. We'll be back for some more fried chicken. Don't forget the iced tea. They have some of the best. Yum!
column21: North Austin Civic Association, Austin, TX

column20: Austin, TX 78757

Stood at the cash register for 5 min and no one acknowledged me or took my order so I left. That being said, the tiny African American woman ALWAYS helps me and is nice. So is the woman with the heart tattoo on her neck!!

Smallest portions ever. I even mentioned it to the manager, but she was rude and acted like, I'm sorry that's all we can do. I will never come back here due to poor service. You are just a number here, they could care less if you ever come back. I like a real bar b q place where they remember your name and treat you like family. This is a corporate chain and is run like such. Will be taking my business elsewhere!

I am pretty tough when it comes to ratings because I feel like I'm paying for a service whether it be food, or a massage or a pack of gum. I want it to be excellent service I honestly expect no less. So when I say that this place has the most amazing salads ever you would probably say how can a barbecue place have the greatest salad of all time but it's true. I thought I would share this secret with all my friends and you can all thank me later. I must say I am not into salads much so that alone must tell you how amazing it is. I always get the fried chicken strips with my salad along with ranch, and lots of it. So the next time you're looking for the most satisfying salad ever come here. The barbecue itself is also great it's something about the salad though that prevents me from ever really trying much of anything else. Totally recommend this place with 2 thumbs up.

While the customer service was top notch, my BBQ pork sandwiches were not. As bbq sauce goes, it's a bit on the "lactic acid side" , never had such sour pig in my life thus far. Maybe use some hickory sauce from now on?
We're sorry for your experience with our Burnet Rd location. Please send us a message with your phone number and email address so we can discuss your visit. Thank you.

I've been eating a Bill Miller's for a long time. I have say that I prefer their breakfast over their BBQ. Saying that, I think they have one of the best assembly line breakfast tacos in town. Their homemade flour tortillas are great. Their ingredients are great. And their salsa is amazing!  They also have great sweet tea and have Big Red.  I will also add their customer service is great also. They replaced a messed up order without any complaints and the general manager even gave me a call to apologize.  Now the not so great part...their price. Their prices have increased significantly in the past few years.  I used to to get a 3 ingredient taco for $1.99. Now I pay close to $3.00 for my sausage, potato, and egg tacos. But they are worth it, if you can swing the price.

After 7 years, I decided to try Bill Miller again. I ordered two bean-n-cheese breakfast tacos and a brisket breakfast taco.  That's 3 tacos in total.I only received 2, however, after double checking the receipt; I was only charged the brisket taco and one BC taco.  Whatever, so the clerk can't count even while using my fingers as a display.The brisket was chewy like calamari at a Chinese buffet and didn't have much flavor.  The BC tacos were great because it would take an idiot to screw up beans and cheese in a tortilla.Their hot sauce (actually salsa) was good, but not as good as mine :-)If you're in a rush or super lazy and wanting the McDonald's of BBQ, then this is the place for you.**I went back to them today to get some breakfast tacos.  Lo and behold, they STILL DON'T KNOW HOW TO COUNT!!!I ordered THREE breakfast tacos at the drive-thru and even REPEATED the order.Guess what?!?  I only got two, yes that's TWO breakfast tacos.From here on out, I'm going to pay a little more for breakfast tacos at a place that knows HOW TO COUNT!!

After 7 years, I decided to try Bill Miller again. I ordered two bean-n-cheese breakfast tacos and a brisket breakfast taco.  That's 3 tacos in total.I only received 2, however, after double checking the receipt; I was only charged the brisket taco and one BC taco.  Whatever, so the clerk can't count even while using my fingers as a display.The brisket was chewy like calamari at a Chinese buffet and didn't have much flavor.  The BC tacos were great because it would take an idiot to screw up beans and cheese in a tortilla.Their hot sauce (actually salsa) was good, but not as good as mine :-)If you're in a rush or super lazy and wanting the McDonald's of BBQ, then this is the place for you.

Food is good. Biggest issue with this location is they constantly forget something in drive thru orders and to go. So I've had to check every little bag they pack to confirm my order is complete every time I go and every time they have forgotten something in my order. So my advice is, if you have a long drive home stop and check your order. If not expect to make a trip back for part of your order.
Austin, TX 78757

This place has really gone downhill.I typically use the drive thru once a week for breakfast tacos. My order is 2-3 Potato Egg and Cheese with 2 slices of bacon for my dog and 6 containers of hot sauce.4 weeks ago there was no hot sauce with my order3 weeks ago no bacon2 weeks ago a taco was missingToday there was no cheese on my tacos. If it were a one-off, I know that happens, everything can't be perfect every time. But 4 weeks in a row lets me know they don't value me as a customer or at the very least my hard earned money. So I'm going elsewhere.

Breakfast is out of this world. Specifically the carne guisada. BBQ is below average. You can certainly find something else in Austin to meet your needs and you certainly should. The service at Burnet location is well below average. Extremely slow and have a hunch that they can't spell customer service. Well below average service and food especially when you have so many choices. Maybe they will figure it out.

Fatty, pretty much inedible brisket. I just ordered the brisket plate (brisket, cole slaw, potato salad, beans) at the drive-thru. The small portions of the sides were fine, nothing special. The meat was a gloppy mess. My first bite was full of fat globs, which I spat out. I then attempted to cut around what looked especially fatty, but, seriously, nearly every bite was as fatty and gross as the first. (I finally gave up after 3 or 4 attempts). Never again.

I personally love Bill Miller's Bar-B-Q. Most of my Austin friends think there is better bar-b-q than Bill Miller's in Austin, which I can't say there isn't, but being from San Antonio, you always know what you are going to get with Bill Miller's which is GREAT steak fries and awesome bar-b-q. I personally love going to Bill Miller Bar-B-Q for breakfast tacos since they are one of the few restaurants that have County Sausage for breakfast. This is the regular bar-b-q sausage you would expect with dinner, but with eggs and cheese. This is better than breakfast sausage (link or patty).

Still horrible quality of food.  Most poorly managed and worst-trained staff.  Gave them four chances over a ten day period.  I ordered the salad delight with all white bar-b-que chicken every time.  Each time it came different.  Missing items, horribly small quantities of chicken.  Once the chicken was so overdone (dry and brittle) it wasn't even edible.Horrible horrible horrible.  Every manager/assistant manager should be fired and then retrain all of the staff (the girl at the window didn't even know the #6 was supposed to come with a drink (had to ask someone).

Bad BBQ, bad service, poorly managed.  A few other things on the menu are good, not great.  Listen, if you want good bar-b-que, take your foot off the brake and hammer down on the accelerator, because you're gonna want to drive past this place and go to any one of the other BBQ places in Austin.

Tonight I stopped in and got the 1/4 bbq chicken and salad for dinner. It was around 8:30 pm, they close at 9 pm. The salad was awful...dry and old. The chicken looked and tasted like it had been under the heat lamp all day. A few weeks ago I got a sausage plate and it was the same way. The only thing eatable was the hash browns. They seem to really be going down hill. Its kinda like Dickies bbq...awful.

Just picked up an order of fried chicken from the Bill Miller Barbecue on Burnet Rd. I don't know if they changed the temp. on their deep fryer or if the thermostat is broken, but the 3 pieces I got (2 breasts and a thigh) were overcooked and dry while the batter on the skin was a very pale color and very greasy. Not sure how they did that unless it was cooked on too low a temp. for too long a time - not hot enough to brown the skin and get it crispy, but cooked at that low temp so long that it dried out the meat. If it hadn't been such a long drive back I would have returned it. Guess I will have a sandwich for lunch.

Bill Miller BBQ puts on no airs. It's no Salt Lick or Franklin's, but it gives you exactly what you promise - cheap, simple BBQ. I went in and got a poor boy sausage sandwich with extra meat AND a side for a little over $5. I mean, how can you go wrong with that? The white bread had kind of soaked up the BBQ sauce on the sandwich, and the sausage was flavorful and plentiful . All in all, a satisfying, tasty, cheap lunch - and only a 5 minute drive from work!Also, if you're a sausage person (Let's get this out of the way: Thaaaaat's what she said!) you'll appreciate that the sausage is very "snappy" (has that great snap/crunch when you bite into it), even if it is a little oily. I'd stay away from the fries, however. They were a bit soggy and too salty. Otherwise, WILL VISIT again!!!
Austin, TX 78726

Thee best BBQ around!!  I know Texas has AMAZING BBQ and you wouldn't think it's being served from an establishment that's built into the gas station... BUT IT IS.  Their smoked meats are phenomenal and not overly seasoned and salted like some places, and the sides are limited but gooooood.   The creamed corn is heaven sent and should be the first side you get, TRUST ME on this one. PLUS thee best deal on breakfast tacos I've ever seen!  Yes they're open early for breakfast as well. These tacos start at $2.50, they're huge, AND they're DELICIOUS.  Egg and brisket is my favorite, followed closely by the egg bean and cheese... mmmmmmm

When we moved here this is one of the first places we tried and I'm glad we did. The flavor and the quality of the meat is better than I've had in a long time. Friendly staff and the line goes by quick. Their barbecue sauce is super great and you can never have too much. One time a take out order was wrong and they made it right and more! Will be going again and again until I cant eat no more!

Damn. It's been said that one has to compromise on one of three factors when getting fast food. Cheap and fast, usually not that good. Cheap and good, might not be fast. Fast and good, not always cheap. These guys hit all three levels on the bullseye. Walked in ordered the brisket and before I could pay the guy had my half pound of brisket and four slices of bread wrapped up and ready to go. I didn't expect much but on that first bite I knew that I had a winner. Don't get it twisted, it doesn't compare to brisket at Terry Blacks but it does the job for a quick fixing. It comes pretty close without having to wait long. That brisket was soft, juicy and full of flavor. I'm a fan and will be back regularly. Service here is above and beyond. Maybe the staff is getting high on their own supply because it seems like everyone at this location was in a really good mood.

My husband SWEARS this particular Rudy's location is superior to all other Rudy's, and all other brisket. We travel about 30 miles to get the moist brisket + burnt edges, even tho we have a much closer Rudy's closer to our house. Silly, but I pick my battles carefully. Banana pudding is good and cream corn is drool-worthy. Also, any restaurant with Big Red as a fountain drink option is a win in my book.

3.5"Rudy's is an institution!" my friend said as we pulled in for dinner here. I was a little incredulous, it's co-located with a Shell; it's not like people get extra excited for a Subway just because it's in gas station. What I didn't know was that it's by design and Rudy's got its start as a convenience store that sold BBQ on the side.So, this is obviously a COIVD era review so it's going to be a little different than business as usual. However, after coming from LA it was as close to normal as you could get. You placed our order at the register and the meat is plated behind you along with any sides. They ask you if you want any sauce/onions/bread and they give you some pretty generous servings of it. They're only serving bottles/cans at this point but why have a soda when you can get a bottled Lone Star?I got a 1/2 pound of the moist brisket, which I assumed is what they called fatty brisket and the new potatoes along with the aforementioned beer and some pickles and onions. I was expecting meh barbecue, thinking this place runs more on nostalgia than anything else but I was surprised to find the brisket was indeed moist but not overly greasy and I probably should have double downed on the meat because I found the potatoes to just be ok. I saw them simmering in what I thought was a healthy amount of butter but while they were prepared ok it tasted a little bland.

I love this place. Come in, grab a breakfast burrito off the hot rack, or sit and enjoy their brisket. The cole slaw is my favorite side with creamed corn. I never liked cream corn before. But for some reason, I loved it when I come here. Rudy's is the best little place to come to. And I'm so fortunate to have one close by

Ordered a handful of breakfast tacos and I couldn't finish it. Eggs were not fresh at all, small pieces of chopped up meat, and it looked like it was assembled by someone who had their eyes closed. I do not understand how someone could say this place is good. That's like calling the McRib true bbq.

I have been a HUGE fan of franklins for many years and while this review is not for franklins it's important to mention. Whenever I'd visit Austin, I would be unwilling to try any other BBQ. Rudy's is NOT franklins but their extra moist brisket was REALLY good. We also ordered a side of creamed corn - holy fucking smokes! Best damn creamed corn, ever. When you don't want to wait 4+ hrs in line or place an order that'll cost you; Rudy's is a good option to get your fix. I'll be back for sure!

This location has a winning combo for me. I freaking love their touchless car wash, so much I have the membership. I will say it's the only one worth the buck still left in town. Never has damaged my car. And today I just found out they have this new taco sauce/salsa that is VERY close to one of my fav Austin taco places. So this just shot up to the top of my weekend places to stop. Car wash then get a breakfast taco. Living in round rock it's a drive for me, wish the rr location had the same car wash setup.
Austin, TX 78726
Awesome service! Fast, helpful and customer focused! Great food, great prices and love the outdoor areas to eat!

Dear Rudy's under quarantine. I spent $102 dollars on dinner tonight to feed 8 kids and 3 adults. I did pay a delivery charge through GrubHub, which I know is a separate organization This is what I got. And all I got. 4 lbs of meat were left off the order (even though I paid for it) and GrubHub refused to make it right adequately. So here I am at 7:57 pm at night with not enough food for a house full of hungry kids. This is the kind of experience that will haunt me for a long time. The good news is you are "first in my mind" when it comes to failed dinner helps. I hope that is what you wanted from your marketing. Overpriced, under-delivered, late, traumatic experience. From, a formerly loyal customer.

Their bbq is about the same as any ordinary person would make. It gets pretty dry, but it gets the job done if you're craving brisket. Their sides are good and I love the drink options they have to choose from.I also love how big the inside and outside area are. They have a covered playscape for younger kids and a little covered outdoor area to sit as well. Overall this is the closest bbq place to me so I will continue to come.

Thank you for sharing your experience. Dry brisket is not something that we want to serve our guests! Would you please send your contact information to allysonyoung@wesellmeat.… so that the GM can reach out directly?

Delicious Brisket! No need for early rising or long lines, this is excellent Brisket, Ribs, Turkey and salads at a very accesible location and you can fill your truck's tank too at the same time! Always great service, happy and friendly employees!!! A pride of Texas! ...also try their breakfast tacos!!! Their relatively new brisket taco is from another world!!!
This place has such an amazing environment. The food is awesome and big portions. Staff is always very helpful and friendly.

I'll give you a higher rating once you get BAKED POTATOES like all other Rudy's. Yes, if you're like me and craving a BBQ stuffed baked potato...ALL LOCATIONS in Austin are BYOP. Not really, if you bring your own they'll probably be mad. But they don't have any, and won't until the end of the year according to management. The other food was good...but when you come in hangry and they don't have what you want, nothing is gonna taste right. Kudos to my friend who didn't mind me eating banana pudding as an appetizer to take edge off.

Let me start off by saying Rudy's is one of my favorite bbq spots. Brisket is always on point and I've never had a bad meal in the 20 years I have been going there ...just about on a weekly basis.The fam decided to get a Rudy's turkey for thanksgiving to makes things easy. Ordering, pickup, supplies - easy. All for a decent price. What we got was one tough bird. This thing was super dried out and pretty tough in most spots unless you got to the underside where is set in juice. Drums were just scorched bones with charred meat hanging on for dear life. We were all excited for a smoked turkey but we got a turkey meteorite. No, I'm not going to break up with you Rudy's. I will always love you.

I first experienced Rudy's in 1994 when they catered a chamber event and have been a raving fan since. Even through all their profit tweaking tactics, I've not said a word. But seriously, two things you've lost - 1. the joyous workers (I've kept quiet), but 2. Skimping in your sauce. What's next? Are you going to charge for your sauce? I have to ask for sauce, I'm given 1 little container, I ask for more and I'm asked 'how many?' Seriously. I look at the size, say two and find out later that's not enough for my 1/2 pound of meat. And bread. I had to ask for bread.
Austin, TX 78726

First time at Rudy's and loved it.  Had lunch with some great friends and Rudy's provided a great atmosphere and great BBQ.  Taking into account quality, price, wait time and friendliness of staff- Rudy's is hard to beat.The brisket was smoked to perfection, coleslaw and cream corn were very tasty sides, and the smoked Turkey was delicious.

Recently stopped by this Rudy's location to meet a business associate for lunch.  At all locations, Rudy's delivers a consistent, and better than most competitors, selection of barbecue and sides.  I enjoyed my usual favs:  baby back ribs, St. Louis style ribs, smoked turkey, and lean brisket.  All delicious!  Beans, coleslaw, and banana pudding rounded out the meal, and all sides were very good.  Rudy's has done an exemplary job of adapting to the COVID-19 hysteria!  The only negative aspect of the fare at Rudy's is that the rack of baby back ribs is often overcooked on the shorter end of the rack.  (It's one of the most expensive items on the menu).  You have to be mindful of that, and when they present you with the fare before putting it in your tray, make sure you inspect the ribs, instead of just saying "OK."  I frequently ask for a few of the ribs to be replaced, and it's never a problem.  I'm not sure most folks know that it's acceptable to do that.  The same holds true for anything ordered at Rudy's, if there is anything not to your liking, speak up, and the staff will be happy to fix whatever the issue is.  All that said, Rudy's continues to deliver quality BBQ at reasonable prices (for BBQ at least).  A great place to take out-of-towners who have not enjoyed a good Texas BBQ experience.

Delicious barbecue and sides served in a pleasant. clean atmosphere. I really enjoyed the cream corn and beef. Great restaurant to bring new to town guests due to the Rudy's new guest experience. Bathrooms are clean and well maintained. Seating outdoors with pets is popular. I would dine here again.

Consistent BBQ, service, and overall appearance We stopped into this Rudy's for breakfast tacos. We like Rudy's because the food is very consistent among locations. The breakfast tacos were fresh and very good. Overall cleanliness: excellentBathroom cleanliness: above average. One odd thing for this location- the bathrooms are much smaller than other Rudy's locations.

Did a call in order and as usual, it was perfect.  I only order moist outside cut when I would go inside so doing a call in order made me nervous.  But it was perfect.  They are consistent and friendly, I love Rudy's bbq.  Their cream corn is great as well.

First time here and really enjoyed it! I mentioned it was our first time and all employees greeted us and we were given samples to try before placing our order. Food was delicious (We got lean brisket, cole slaw, cream corn, and peach cobbler) and the inside eating area is well lit and has a high ceiling. So the eating experience was enjoyable and breathable.

This location is very poorly managed. Even though I went inside and brought my own sides to the counter before ordering my meats, they still managed to not put them in the bag before I left with my food. Furthermore, the manager felt like a fair compensation was to reimburse me only for the missing items, ignoring the fact that my entire meal was nothing but meat. This isn't the first time I've had issues at this location. They just don't get it.

Thank you for sharing your experience and we hate to hear that this isn't the first time we did not get your order right. Could you please contact allysonyoung@wesellmeat.… so that we can make this right?

Found this place through YELP as I was looking for a nearby lunch spot while in town for a work trip. The extra moist brisket TOTALLY hit the spot. Mouth watering and incredibly tender. I didn't need to get the potato salad as the brisket on top of a slice of white bread was perfect!! I had 4 slices of white bread and a total of 1/2 lb brisket. Gentleman at desk was super friendly and it was great I got to try 3 of their meats before making my decision. Place is pretty big, great for large parties with the long tables. Pricing was more than reasonable, though this is coming from someone who lives in NYC so any place outside NYC is going to have reasonable pricing for me, haha. Service was pretty quick considering the line.If I am back in the area again I will definitely be back! What a delicious lunch that was today.
Austin, TX 78726

We love Rudy's! We've tried at least 5 other BBQ joints around Austin and Rudy's is our favorite. Our son loves the ribs and potatoes, I love the brisket and coleslaw and my wife loves the moist brisket and potato salad!

Really enjoyed eating at Rudy's "Country Store". When we came n they asked if we had eaten there before. When we said no, the told us how things worked, and even gave us a little sample of the BBQ. Really liked how you could order different things, and build your dinner by the pound (or ounce). the food was great, and the place was reminiscent of the rural Texas side of the road BBQ places. Great food, great ambiance, and great service . . . what more could you ask for?
Delicious every time! We love the lean brisket and spicy chopped beef! Great location with great food!
Awesome BBQ!  If I lived here, this would definitely be one of my favorite places!
True Southern Hospitality. Great Customer Service. They are 2010 winners of the prestigious Malcom Baldridge Award. Food was unbelievable. Moist brisket and ribs to die for. Moving to TX

I could eat here everyday and not get tired for a long time. Parking is a challenge given how popular they are and how small the parking lot is.They were very friendly and let me taste some of their items before I picked. The brisket is to die for! Very moist and yummy and the burnt parts are the best.  The sausage and cream corn were really good too.

Consistently delicious barbecue. Never too long of a wait, with excellent quick service, and a casual atmosphere with plenty of seating. Their moist brisket is excellent, as well as their hot sausage, pulled pork, and turkey. Basically you can't go wrong with any of the meat here. They have great sides, especially their creamed corn. Order by size at the counter, and enjoy your meal. In addition, they will give you as much sliced bread as you want with your order. Their barbecue sauce is very good but if you like a little bit of spice in your bbq sauce ask behind the counter for their "sissy sauce" which packs a little more flavor. Also, don't forget about Rudy's when you're hungry for breakfast. They serve awesome grab and go breakfast tacos every morning!

I've visited or ordered from Rudy's a few more times and while their dining experience isn't always top-notch (think loud Texas-style cafeteria), the food's been reasonably on-point.My personal favs are the 'chop' sandwich and the pork ribs, though the brisket is quite good.  I'd recommend the moist brisket though the few times I've had it, there were some burnt ends included and the spice mix tends to be all salt, all the time.Though there are several BBQ places I like more, it's definitely worth a visit if you're in the Four Corners Region of Austin.This place scores a 3 out of 5 on the 'CTJ Scale', as noted below.5 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing away after finishing a plate here.4 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary.3 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus' Dad.2 out of 5 stars: Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn't have my last supper here.1 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn't have my penultimate supper here, either.

A decent choice for a BBQ dinner, especially on a family outing.  I've eaten a fair amount of BBQ if you check out my other reviews; Rudy's is very convenient to where I live and I've worked my way through a lot of their menu over time.Standouts include the chicken and the wonderfully tingly spiced chop.  I find all of their food uniformly good, only to be overshadowed by the ultimate artists working at my favorite joints. Special mention should be given to the staff, who actively engage you and direct the choices for those unfamiliar with how the system works.Said system allows for them to work a little like a Texas-themed cafeteria, which due to the number of people (especially families) can result in a very loud experience. This place gets 3 stars on the 'CTJ Scale', as noted below.5 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing on after finishing a meal here.4 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary.3 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus' Dad.2 out of 5 stars: Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn't have my last supper here.1 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn't have my penultimate supper here, either.
Austin, TX 78726

Rudy's is my go-to now for consistently good bbq that stays open even for dinner time. If you're a first-timer, tell them. You'll get a couple small samples. The creamed corn and the peach cobbler are so good as a little bonus. Is it weird that they're attached to gas stations? Well yeah. But this is Austin so in a way it's normal to have weird things like that here.

Rudys is like nothing else. Carve cam!!!!  Excellent food and for some reason my family go nuts over the pickles!! We get brisket and pulled pork and spicy sausage. Sauce good but not too spicy. Cream corm is like dessert. Homemade potato salad. The place is spotless!!! Very clean
Good food and service, my only complaint is they charge for jalapeños at a pretty good profit.
Has ruined us for bbq from anywhere else. We typically get a bunch to go and eat it all week long. Desserts are good too. You can't go wrong here.

Extra moist brisket (get some ends), perfect turkey and good ribs were our meats ... Cream corn is amazing and the Cole slaw and beans will not disappoint. The plus is an ambience that is simply Texas BBQ. Enjoy!!
This is amazing bbq. Although it is a local chain restaurant don't let that fool you. It is one of the staples I take people to they have the best brisket.
column21: The Woodlands At Anderson Village, Austin, TX

column20: Thank you for sharing your experience!
This is a simple and great place. Never disappointed.

First time in Austin and decided to try the most talked about BBQ place. The place was busy but no one seemed to be too annoyed. They had ample amounts of tables for customers: After reaching the front we were met with such kindness and a cheerful staff, even though it was busy. Upon realizing it was our first time they offered us samples and explained the menu. They were super nice and I must say I was impressed with their customer service! After ordering our food, they packaged our food in paper and provided the bread we needed for the meet. I ordered the cutters choice brisquit and sausage link. It was amazing and all so goooooood! I'm not much of a bbq fan but I definitely had seconds. The decor definitely made me feel like we were in a bbq restaurant. They also had condiments and their special bbq sauce on the side for customers to take at their leisure. I can definitely see why people love this restaurant and I would definitely come back with friends and guests next time I visit Austin.
NA
Austin, TX 78737

We tried The Switch for brunch on a Saturday. The bloody Mary served in a boot was delicious and perfectly seasoned( according to my friend)! The mild switch sausage was my favorite, super juicy and flavorful! The switch Benedict had a nice BBQ essence and was well proportioned.My only complaint was that the sign clearly asked costumers to adhere to social distancing and wear face masks and several patrons came in and disregarded all of that. It was just irritating because I was 36 weeks pregnant at the time and just wanted to feel somewhat safe and responsible while eating out.

We stumbled upon this place, while we were deliriously hungry and man did we find a gem of a place. We came in on a Wednesday and were seated on the patio, it was great weather that day. We were first served some complimentary hush puppies as we ordered our drinks and man were they good. Super fresh and had some jalapenos in them, really tasty. I then ordered the Brisket plate with the Sweet Corn Casserole and fries and i was absolutely blown away how good the food was. That gave me burnt ends and a fat slab of Brisket, ridiculously moist, super tender, and extra flavorful. The fat on it melted in my mouth! The corn casserole was friggin awesome and the fries were super fresh. We ended the meal with some banana pudding and that was really good, like outstanding.  We will definitely be back for Sunday brunch, that menu looked real good.

The Switch is a great BBQ restaurant and watering hole.  I've been here many times and have not had a bad meal.  Today we did curbside pick up due to COVID19 and the food was outstanding as always.  The online ordering and pickup was a breeze!  I personally love the brisket, Mac and cheese, and the Diablo sandwich.  I highly recommend this awesome establishment.

The Switch is an offshoot of Styles Switch, the longtime, iconic North Austin barbecue joint. Unlike its parent, it is in an swanky suburban retail park at Belterra Village, with very modern vibe. I think it fitting that you walk past the huge, well-equipped and enclosed pit area when you walk from the parking lot to the entrance. Holy Mary, do they have a lot of huge smokers.We've made several visits here since the opened a very few years ago. We've watched them through the vagaries of opening and getting their act together, and we cut them considerable slack for a while. And they I,proved over time.This visit was for Friday dinner prior to Memorial Day weekend. Expecting it to be slammed because of the hellacious traffic on 290, we were more than pleasantly surprised that the crowd was much less than oppressive. They have plenty of space, and while it lacks the funky soul of the old Styles Switch, it is a pleasant ambiance, spacious, clean, well lit. Hospitality was top notch, and Jackson, our server was very attentive and personable. One star for that.Brisket, to me, is the raison d'etre of a Central Texas BBQ joint. The Switch has learned over time to do it very well. Tender, juicy, and just, well, pretty. That was less satisfactory when they were learning early, but they've learned their lessons. Three stars for that. Sides on the other hand were disappointing. The complimentary hush puppies were fried in old grease, but the butter salvaged them and made for a nice start. The corn casserole tonight was tepid. Ordinarily, it is rich, creamy and savory and, at least, warm. I wish I'd sent it back to be nuked to an acceptable temperature. The cole slaw was 'meh'. The portions are large on the plated meat meals, so that somewhat offsets the deficit. And reasonable pricing saves the sides from being a star-deduction.Access is easy if you're traveling west on 290 to the wine country or wherever, so if you want really good brisket, the Switch is worth the stop.

Been here twice since they opened. We had been to the original shop out on North Lamar in the past and found it funky with credible food.The new Belterra Village addition is certainly welcome, and we had high hopes.First, when you walk up from the parking lot, you pass a MASSIVE smoking area with MASSIVE smokers in rows and a tangy wood smell. This is BBQ production done right. Inside, it is clean and modern and efficient. While I prefer the funky, re-purposed ambience of the old Switch, this is just fine on its own.As to the food, they've added  number of Cajun dishes that weren't on the menu at the other place.  Spouse had a kind of Cajun pot pie, which she didn't care for. But the Switch is, at heart, a BBQ joint, so I am not going to let that affect this review. First time, I had the brisket, the de facto measure of BBQ joints. Excellent. Better than my last visit to the Salt Lick.  Right below Franklins and La Barbecue on my scale of Austin briskets. Good smoke ring, slightly crisp rind, tender and moist throughout. Doesn't need sauce (but you should try their mustard sauce - sparingly). Second visit, with our son in from SF. He lived in Austin for several years and the original Switch was one of his favorites. It was the weekend, so we could get the beef short ribs, which we did. STUPID GOOD! Gigantic short  rib big enough for three with leftovers. Amazingly tender, amazing flavor. Retained the smoke tang.  We also had the pork ribs, which stand up well against the competition (but aren't as good as mine when I am  on my game).Sides can be delicious. But who gives a rats ass about sides  when rating a BBQ shop. Glad to have this new shop in reach of Dripping Springs. I was skeptical about Belterra Village as it seemed too suburbanistic, but they have certainly improved the food choices in the area with Switch, League, Torchies and the newer bigger Pieous.

I love The Switch. I was a big fan of Stiles Switch and was so glad to find The Switch when we moved to Dripping Springs. Their classic Texas bbq is on-point and their non-traditional dishes are also incredible! The smoked wings with Alabama white sauce were fantastic. My wife loves their gumbo and Cajun-inspired dishes. Also, their dining room has to be the most beautiful of any Texas bbq joint.

This was really not a great meal. Well, that's generous. It was barely a good meal. We ordered on-line which was super easy. Arrived within 12 minutes and called in to have it delivered curb-side. That was easy! The entire process was straight forward.We then pulled over to a parking lot to eat our tepid food. Ok, tepid was generous. It was room temperature. All of it. Like it was just laying on the counter somewhere to be handed over. Like they believed it would be cold before we got home, so why bother warming it up. That was hugely disappointing.I had the Brisket & Shrimp Po'boy. When the shrimp was more enjoyable than the brisket, you wonder why the main sign outside says BBQ. The brisket was just a cold / room temp of meat with the taste of roast beef. The cold fried shrimp was only mildly more flavorful. Well, the cheese tasted good and the sub was crusty! I opted for the side of sweet corn cassorole. It would have been awesome last night or whenever else this thing was cooked. As it was, it was a cold snowball of scooped casserole that tasted reasonably good. I would love to see this warmer. Perhaps I should have warmed it on my hood.My lunch partner had the Smoked Turkey BLT. I almost went with it! Well, if it's smoked, I didn't taste it. Dehydrated in a gas cooker I could believe. In a pit, not a chance. Again, it may have been an entirely different meal if it was warmed, nuked, heated, or cooked before handed over.Come at a better time or when the chefs are rolling thru. 1:00 on a week day gets you whatever was left from lunch.
Best chop beef sandwich I've ever had. The perfect bun, so much meat and their bbq sauce is different but amazing.

Ok, y'all. Texas Monthly was right! This BBQ is worth the drive. Fall apart brisket, pickled onions, vinegar based sauce. Sweet corn casserole is a great choice for a side here. Brisket enchiladas are fantastic. The homemade chili on top could be ordered all by itself in a bowl. Got get ya some!
Austin, TX 78737

Burnt Desserts and they don't care.. Ordered cobbler to go on  a Friday to enjoy on the rainy Saturday. Opened it up...completely burned. I call Ed a day later to let them know- policy is same day. I'd normally let this go but the cobbler is $7- i clearly do t mind paying the price but it better be with it- it isn't.

All the staff I encountered were very nice, including the guys in the smokehouse, when I went in the wrong door. Enchiladas at a BBQ place? YES!!!! Brisket enchiladas (2 of my favorite things) were so good, I couldn't shovel it in my mouth fast enough. Some might think it was a little pricey, but we're talking smoked brisket here, not ground beef. It was a generous portion and some of the best enchiladas I've EVER had. They even gave me a free cup of queso to put on top, but it didn't need it (IMO). The restaurant was very clean & I like the decor. They have many big TV's (if you're into that) and they were playing some good jams. It was 2:PM on a Friday and there was no wait to order and the food arrived quickly. Well worth the 45 drive from my house!
Cute BBQ place. The fried chicken was very good. We also really liked the brisket. But I was not a fan of the macaroni and cheese or the BBQ sauce. Overall this was good and I would go back.

This place rocks. The food is consistently good for brunch and dinner (never been for lunch). The bbq is fantastic, and the sides are delicious too. Despite a much larger and more well known bbq restaurant being 10 minutes away, we usually come to the switch because we find the food that much better. The bbq wings are out of this world too. It's definitely my guilty pleasure - but well worth it.

I came to try a smattering of tastes right after their grand opening. I tried the boudain, which I was pleasantly surprised to find on the menu. It was a bit salty sausage, but it was full of great shrimp flavor. Cheese grits were amazing!! This is such a good complement to the BBQ. I wish more places had this as a choice. Course and chunky cheese bits were all throughout and it was rich, but not over the top.Thick, not salty brisket. It was chewy and moist just like from Stiles Switch!

Had a quick dinner here on the way to Johnson City.  We were are to take our dog in the enclosed  patio which was great!  Service was good.  I had a green salad with brisket and it was okay.  My husband's bbq sandwich was a little dry.  The stand out was the wonderful warm hush puppies!!

Had dinner here on Saturday night and enjoyed the food.  The complimentary warn hushpuppies with a spicy sauce were wonderful!  I had the Smoked Chicken Piquant which was served on top of their yummy sweet corn casserole. So good!  Others had the chopped beef sandwich, and the meat plates.  Everyone enjoyed their meal. Serving sizes were large and our waitress was really nice.

This is a 16 dollar shrimp po boy. Save you money and drive  east, it'll be way cheaper and better tasting. To be honest, the 4 shrimp I got had NO seasoning at all. It tasted like cornmeal/ flour. No salt or cayenne/Cajun/anything. Even the Mayo was bland. They also do not have green beans here. Which is really sad for a BBQ place. Who doesn't have green beans with bacon in it?Also the Mac and cheese was really bad, the noodles were hard and undercooked and it smelled like some one shoved it in the fire pit. Also under salted and a strange bitter taste. I've been here about 5 times and have always been really underwhelmed. If you come here, just stick with the meat. Don't get the actual entrees

Even before Covid their hours and days that they were open seemed unpredictable and didn't make much sense. It's only gotten worse in the pandemic which is somewhat understandable (although it seems like they're missing a lot of opportunity to make money where they can right now). The food is great but way overpriced. I've tried ordering takeout via a delivery app a couple of times recently and ended up canceling because an hour later they STILL hadn't even started the order. It would be a great place if they could get their act together by providing a better service experience, lower prices for fairly standard bbq dishes (the gumbo is the only stand out in terms of doing anything different from the other great bbq spots) and actually be open during peak days/hours.
Austin, TX 78737

The food is okay although over priced. My fried chicken was borderline burnt. The bbq sauce is almost straight vinegar. Keep in mind this is during COVID times. The young man slicing meat had his mask barely covering mouth and not covering nose. One of the wait staff had her long hair hanging over the trays of food she was carrying. They are not using disposable or one use menus. They do not have the tables they are using properly spaced. They are also seating people in the high traffic center of the room. Sorry to say we won't be returning.

We had an amazing lunch here after one of our other favorite restaurants in dripping springs closed. Super friendly people and beautiful interior. The food was incredible and we ordered a lot for two people. We had: smoked turkey blt, switch po boy, and corn soufflé. Sooooooo good. Please come out and support this terrific business. They also do online and curbside service.
We have been going for date nights, and love sitting at the bar. I love the salads and the gumbo with potato salad inside on a cold night is yummy.

Our latest trip to the Switch Dripping was curbside pickup.  The brisket, beans, potato salad, and chips and queso were all outstanding!  We have been eating here for years.  It's always amazing food and they have many non-traditional BBQ dishes as well because they really are trained chefs. The Sunday brunch features many breakfast dishes with a BBQ twist.  I highly recommend the Switch Dripping!

I'm sorry to give only 3 stars, because the people were great and the food had a good taste, but it was overpowered by pepper, spice and onion.  The ribs were much too peppery/spicy.  The turkey was also spicy, but very juicy tender and good.  The mild sausage was very good and one of the few non spicy items. The cucumber and tomato salad, was full of red onion. The feta tamed the salad, but the cucumbers tasted more like pickles. The bbq sauce was not spicy and had a tomato soup thing going on.  The pulled pork was quite boring, needed bbq sauce for sure.  They were out of brisket, so that could be a game changer on the stars count, plus I should try some more sides.

A sudden case of the munchies on our road trip brought us to The Switch for a quick lunch. A quick Yelp check validated that this locale is a cousin to the Stiles Switch on Lamar. My first impression, this joint is too clean and bright to serve good BBQ, and it looks like a chain restaurant. Well, bless my heart I admit I was rootin tootin wrong.Is this a carbon copy of, my favorite joint, on Lamar? No, it has its own identity and a full bar! Speaking of the bar as you are in Dripping Springs, of course, there is a slew of local brews on tap. Our server started us off with a Comped hush puppies order with a pretty lively dipping sauce. We ordered brisket, short ribs, and beans. Their brisket was smoked to perfection, tender, needed no BBQ sauce. I loved that their ribs were finished with a peppery rub that gave them a nice crust. The beans were AOK as well.A strong four and a half stars. Hopefully, the good folks in The Drip will embrace The Switch.

I had already eaten here three times from opening day to this visit and noticed some fine tuning.  Parking may be a problem if many show up, but so far has been good. Every BBQ place has a different way to ordering process where here as you walk inside you are greeted.  This person asked how many in party and assigns you a table by giving you a number.  You then walk down and grab a menu and checkout some swag to buy.  You then walk up to the cashier who takes the table number from you and then order your food. We ordered brisket and pork ribs along with potato salad and beans. We were given our number back and where before pay here but got changed where you pay later. So we find our table and server comes by to fetch our drinks.  At this point you can order alcoholic drinks from the bar. We also were given a sample of boudin balls. It tasted very good.  Besides bbq they also have a Cajun menu and serve brunch on Sunday.Our food arrived in a tray and can ask for a plate.  Their other restaurant, Stiles Switch, is among the Texas Monthly top 50 bbq places so I first expected great things here, and they do not disappoint.  It is truly amazing bbq. The brisket was cut thick with great flavor. No sauce was needed.  The pork ribs has excellent flavor and melted in my mouth.  The beans and potato salad was great too.  It was served with white bread. I have a feeling this place will make it on Texas Monthly's list for next year.

I really really wanted to like this place. The atmosphere is 4 stars, it's super cute and newish so it's clean and nice. But this much fat on a brisket is not "Normal" which is what the waitress said. When I questioned the meal - and my husbands meal she brushed it off. We literally paid for lard.

I've been going to stiles switch for years and the switch is not stiles switch that's for sure. The service is very lackluster more like I'm taking time out of their day to help me. Food was alright but nothing like what I've come to associate with stiles switch.We went for brunch and they were out of several things because they ran out of biscuits I asked if they could possibly sub a biscuit for maybe Texas toast for the Benedict since we drove pretty far just for that and was abruptly told no. No I'll check with the kitchen nothing just a flat no with 0 effort.What I did order was fairly bland and overall a waste of a 30min drive. Not sure why this location is so night and day from stiles switch but it shows for sure.
Austin, TX 78737

With no shortage of BBQ joints between my neighborhood and North Lamar I've never ventured into Stiles and Switch. I was however excited to hear of the expansion of a sister restaurant near my house that served their signature BBQ plus some Cajun specialties.I ventured early in the afternoon the day after they opened. A hostess type person greeted me and asked where I would like to dine. I chose the bar versus the actual dining area. Not sure how the line option works; as I left the line was quite long though. Togo perhaps?I wished I could have tried some of the Cajun cuisine but the main dishes are only served after 4pm. This doesn't make a primarily lunch guy too happy. What I did order was delicious. The jalapeno cheddar sausage wore a crisp casing and was a bargain at around $3. Molasses BBQ sauce could be close to the best BBQ sauce I've had.The Frito pie wowed in the flavor department but came up a bit short on the portion. For $12.50, I wished they could have layered some chili in between the chips. As I finished all the chili, plenty of naked chips remained in the boat. Maybe I'll be in the mood to come back for dinner one day. I've got to see what $21 catfish tastes like!
Brisket was excellent. The corn casserole is so good, you won't need dessert!The Cobb salad was really good, the smoked turkey was very good. Need to explore the menu some more but so far so good!

This location of the venerable hipster favourite needs to figure itself out.  The table service doesn't seem to work well, and the expanded menu wasn't terribly necessary.  The Diablo sandwich's melt-in-your-mouth brisket was otherworldly good, as was the peppered sausage, but the gross ballpark nacho jalapenos completely ruined all that was good about the meats served on a fresh buttered bun.  It can't be that hard to roast fresh peppers to serve on a $14 sandwich.  Fries are well seasoned and the right level of crispy.  The full bar slings very overpriced drinks for the size, the little kiddie-cup highballs they servecocktails in are comical at best.

Food:  4 starsService:  2 stars (friendliness was 4 stars)Atmosphere: 4 starsThe food was good to very good.  The service not so much.  I would go back again, but probably order ahead and carry out the food.  We arrived around 3:30 on a Sunday afternoon with 7 in our party.  We were seated almost immediately, which was a pleasant surprise, but unfortunately it went downhill from there (on the service side).  We waited for 10 minutes and no server had visited the table.  I got up and approached who I believed to be the manager and asked him if we had a server.  He apologized and grabbed someone and told us we could have a queso on the house.  We had intended on ordering it anyway so that was nice.  The waitress took our order and then brought the appetizers:  stuffed jalapeño poppers and the queso.  Both were very good.  To back up on the ordering a bit, we experienced another service glitch:  the website (which we had visited before arriving) stated that brunch was served until 4pm on Saturday and Sunday.  It was 3:30 and 3 people in our party wanted the brunch items.  When they attempted to order them the waitress said brunch had ended at 3.  I told her about the website and she asked me if I could show her, so I did (on my phone).  She apologized and said that was inaccurate.  So we regrouped and ordered other items.  Then the wait was on.  And on.  And on.  We waited a full 35 minutes for our food, which is unusual in a BBQ joint where there's little cooking to order involved, mostly just the serving. To make matters worse, we observed 3-4 other tables of similar size being served before we finally were (and we had arrived before each of them).  As I said off the top, the food was good, hence the 3 star rating overall.  The brisket was moist and tender, a perfect amount of smoke and not overpowering.  The smoked turkey was among the best I've had.  Loved the peppery outer crust which perfectly housed the tender, juicy meat inside.  The sides were good to very good as well:   Cole slaw, mashed potatoes, pickles and onions.  We just had to try the desert:   The peach cobbler (made with Fredericksburg peaches) was delicious.  The "smoked banana sundae" sounded very good and we ordered one of them too, but it was disappointing.  The bananas had not been smoked at all - just peeled and sliced like what you'd get at any ice cream store.  So, our first time visit was a mixture of enjoyment (food and atmosphere) and disappointment (service issues, lack of attention, etc).  I think next time (and there will probably be a next time) we'll order ahead and carry it out.

Went for brunch and was disappointed how the brunch menu did have many choices using their BBQ. Ordered the brisket, smothered cabbage and cheesy grits ( available all the time). The brisket was decent and the smothered cabbage was something I would order again. This was pretty much opening weekend-ish so there are some service and menu items they should 86.Beef rib was fried and tough, and the briskets were dry and extremely dense.

After being an Austinite for over a decade, I only have one BBQ rule: If they don't have a presence or sister store in Lockhart, don't go. I broke this rule for Switch, and I'm a better man for it. Switch is a permutation of Stiles Switch, with roughly 90% of the menu devoted to Texas style BBQ and the remaining 10% comprising cajun or creole influenced dishes. Now if I'm honest, the only reason we ended up here was because Pious was closed for Summer break. They do that? Apparently.The decor is roomy and modern, without being too try-hard. They have electric jellyfish on tap, which is a great start, though I suppose it's become ubiquitous after winning heaps of awards. The only downside of the entire meal was the "hye" fashioned. While it looks incredible on paper (garrison brothers bourbon, a mezcal infused cherry, bitters, etc), in practice it was an absolute sugar bomb. We went for brunch, I had the Texas toast sandwhich with damn near everything on it (brisket, bacon, egg, tomato) while the wife had the brisket hash. The common theme? Excellent brisket that absolutely made both dishes. Great crust, a deep smoke ring, incredible flavor. (Side note: why is it so difficult to find truly great brisket in Austin???). Switch made a great call on the Texas toast, going for slightly sweet instead of garlicly, which I thought was a solid play for a brunch item. I have to award a bonus star to any place that calls their family platter "The Trough." Sorry, that's a rule. The tab came out to just under $50, though without the hye fashioned, we would've been well under $40, and we both left completely stuffed, which is a real value.
We have been sampling  the Austin area BBQ and for us this is our favorite moist brisket!  Everyone has a different take on BBQ but we return often to the switch!

This was our first time here. They were entertaining a large group on the outdoor covered patio area (little league), so we sat inside at a lovely booth. The service was fast and the food was excellent. Our server couldn't quite figure out how to wear his mask though, and the menus were the regular ones, not disposable. My biggest challenge here was not saying anywhere on the menu that the potato salad is made with sour cream. I'm lactose intolerant and that very nearly derailed my entire evening. I even asked about dairy in the smothered cabbage and the server missed that opportunity to point out the dairy in my other side. The brisket was tender and juicy, and the turkey was very moist and tender. The bbq sauce is sweet and spicy with a nice spice blend. The cucumber-tomato salad had a nice vinaigrette marinade too. To be honest, though, the smothered cabbage was a bit sweet for my taste. I would get the salad again but pass on the cabbage dish. My husband had the poboy, remarked on the wonderful blend of flavors and the tender shrimp. The 4 stars vs 5 was because of the perception that they were a bit lax with Covid hygiene measures, the dairy miscues, and the fact that our waters never arrived until we asked for to go cups. Once we can gather again in larger groups, I'd love to check out the big room inside!

Ordered curbside yesterday. The food was cold (I ordered early and specified a pick up time), and the order was wrong. I'd ordered sausage and ribs and got sausage and brisket...which gave me the chance to experience some of the worst brisket I've ever had. Dry as a bone and flavorless. I've been to Stiles Switch several times, and the food was excellent, so I was expecting at least mediocrity from The Switch.
Austin, TX 78737

As a life long Texan who has eaten at many BBQ places all over, this has to be the lamest excuse i've ever seen for a "2 meat plate". There's so little meat here. Everything bigger in Texas? Apparently not here. Aside from small portions, flavors were good. Corn was a bit too sweet for my tastes. Half the sugar would still have tasted great.

I just picked up a to go order that I waited 50 mins over the time it was due to be picked up, while I waited every one was nice offered me a drink etc. Well got my food got out to truck ( we were pulling trailer so I had to walk a ways to park) got back on road. No silverware or napakins....ordered corn casserole and coleslaw as sides not sure what they expected us to eat with.  We were excited to finally get to stop but probably not again.

I like to give places a second try when the first time wasn't all that great. Nope, still bad.  I think most of the trouble is with the people: servers and cooks.  I was placing an order for takeout.  Ordered the Chicken Fried Steak with gravy on the side (long ride home and didn't want my steak crest soggy). Nope it was all over. (We won't discuss the difference between traditional gravy versus the onion/bell pepper crap that they used. I didn't know this at the time.)  When I called to let them know someone wasn't paying attention to my request, I got attitude.  I took the hit, but after I couldn't get over the meatloaf taste with onions/bell peppers instead of a steak, I realized  I should have taken her offer of a refund. Meal so totally not worth it.

Got a mixed 2 meat plate with Mac n cheese and sweet corn casserole. The meat was really moist and enjoyed the pickles on the bread. The corn casserole hit the spot but the Mac n cheese wasn't good. My son gave me one of his ribs. These are excellent with a little spice baked into them. They brought out some really dark hush puppies that went well with the dipping sauce.

Solid choice for bbq at a place that feels more like a restaurant than just a bbq stand. The brisket was delicious - not quite at the level of La Barbecue, but I also didn't have to wait in line at all. Seems like a great choice for folks driving through Dripping Springs.

Been hearing great things about this place and finally made it over here for the chicken fried steak. Pan fried is the best n my opinion. This is a deep fried. Gravy was one of the best tho and for a deep fry it was good. For appetizer we had the boudin and hush puppies were complimentary. Both outstanding. Lastly, we suggest sitting at the bar. The bartender was a wealth of knowledge and took very good care of us. We will b back for sure. If u live near Dripping Springs it's a must stop.

Lucky enough to be the first in line for their Grand Opening on 06.22.18. They've made some great additions to their regular menu with Cajun items like their dirty rice, Mamou smoked seafood sausage/boudin, and PO-Boys. They also added a dinner and brunch menu with stuff like gumbo, pork ribeyes, and blackened catfish. Super envious of that pit room filled with all those Moberg Smokers  Everything was awesome!

Came here last weekend. First things first, service here is impeccable. It's not your typical BBQ joint where you order at the window. They've got plenty of booths and tables to go around. I ordered the pork ribs, brisket with a side of grits and corn casserole. The pork ribs were outstanding. Fatty, juicy, and had a really nice bit of spice in the rub. The brisket was delicious. Had a great smoke (if you like smokey brisket, get it) and was super tender. The grits could have been spicier in my opinion. That corn casserole though.... amazing. You've gotta get it. Now. I did not enjoy their take on boudin. I'm got family in Louisiana and I'm a Houston transplant. Gotta say, it just wasn't doing it for me. The crawfish addition was nice though. Could have been a lot spicier. Also, pickles are made in-house. They're delicious!!Overall, I would definitely come back. Especially in the warmer months! They've got a nice patio outside.

Had a a Party of 20 and the Style Switch didnt disappoint! Brisket, Sausage, & Ribs were on point! Drinks were flowing, the staff was friendly and courteous! A great 2-1/2 hours of laughter was had by all. Will come here again and again!
Austin, TX 78704

Good for breakfast tacos with sabrosita salsa roja.  Good for lunch with salad and papa combo or fried yardbird, if you desire comfort food.  Speaking of, their poppyseed po boys are Dddd-lish.   Good for supper with chopped beef sandwich sweet tea, and pie.  Good condiment bar.  Oh and if you like fish during la cuaresma they have the seafood.  I'm glad they do the staffed driver through now too, like chik fil a, it really expedites things.   Keep your cup once COVID19 is squashed and they give us like one quarter refills! Best of all is the service, as others have noted.

Thank you for sharing your recent experience at our Ben White location. Due to COVID-19 we are adjusting our procedures to ensure the health and safety of our customers and employees. We value your input and encourage you to let us know about your future experiences.

Their fried chicken is good, but the brisket not so much. I read a bad review but thought I try it myself. The brisket was dry and tasteless (thankfully I could dip it in their bbq sauce-which was okay). I've never had brisket that just didn't have a taste, like they didn't season it whatsoever. Sides were descent.

Thank you for the feedback, Erika. We want you to have a great experience every time you choose us. If you wish to discuss your visit further, please send us a message. We do appreciate your business and always welcome your comments.

Horrible in and out , set up is shit.. you pay on a machine for your food that everyone touches but die to covid 19?!? WHAA?!? lol then once they bring you the food boom you gotta get back up and beg for the drink you ordered yourself lol priceless..And the BBQ meeehhh portions so damn small you have to order two meals..

So annoyed as my lunch sits in the trash instead of in my stomach. This place is near by work. I go because it's convenient, not because it's great. Today I roll up and order a two sandwich combo BY NAME, NOT NUMBER.I get back and pull out my order to see several pieces of gnarley fried chicken instead of the sandwiches I ordered. I call, get put on hold, to then get put on hold again. A woman finally comes to the phone. When I tell her my order number she tells me, "that's what you ordered." So let me get this straight, I tell you I want a sandwich and I get something else and you're right? Why do you think I'm calling you if I got what I ordered? A dash of common sense here would be so refreshing, instead I have nasty fried chicken in the garbage, no lunch and this frustration ringing in my ear. I get that mistakes happen, we all make them. When you make a bigger mistake in failing to correct a simple issue the message is clear to me. I won't be back.

Bob, we apologize for the service you have received at our Ben White location. We want you to have a great experience every time you choose us. If you wish to discuss this further, please send us a message so our team can reach out. Thank you.

At first I was impressed with their breakfast tacos. The past 2 months they hired new staff that do not speak, nor read English that they are making the breakfast tacos horrible or wrong order. My order is messed up every time. I ask to please spread the potatoes and crisp bacon as I hate raw bacon. And I ask if they did that with a response "Si". They continue to lie about. In addition, smaller portions then what it use to be. I'm done with Bill Miller's BBQ until they train the staff the read the tickets correctly and go back to what they original tacos were. Like I said, great at first, then downhill after the new non-English individuals. Please train them as it's not hard to do.

3 Stars for the quality of food (breakfast tacos) and the ability to follow a simple request is a challenge for the staff. I mainly go there for their Breakfast Tacos. The previous staff that were there had your order correct, and spread the portions to balance out with the tortilla. And you received your money's worth. Now the new staff cut the food portions in half, lump food in center of the tortilla. So half of the tortilla is empty that you squeeze the middle lump out. Now you have a small thin breakfast taco. They forget to add cheese or crispy bacon or confuse "spread food on the tortilla" to mean "put tacos in two different bags". Check your order as 80% of the time it's wrong. Overall, the staff are friendly, welcoming, and helpful. That's a major plus. Just horrible at reading ticket orders.
Austin, TX 78704

Ordered BBque and will never order again.  I ordered the family meal and was so disappoint for the $50+ I had spent.  I didn't like the tomato induced green beans or the under cooked peach cobbler.   The chicken was dry.  Just wasn't wowed for that price. I knew I should have ordered Poke Jo's spot instead. UGH!!  Lesson learned.

We're sorry for your recent experience, Jane.We want you to have experience every time you choose us. If youw wish to discuss your visit further, please send us a message with your contact information so our team can make this right. We do appreciate your business and always welcome your comments.

Good BBQ Brisket here! They actually smile here! :) ;) :) :-DLOL!!!!!!I like smiles! Ordered their #1 combo here and it was good. They have fried chicken here as well. They have a lot to offer. I'm sure you find something good!They have a drive through as well. It was a good experience. Stop by and see for yourself!

This was a pleasant experience for a fast food type BBQ restaurant. They have a good amount of food options available on their menu for a very good price. I ended up ordering turkey, hash browns, cream corn, Spanish rice, lemonade, and apple pie for a little over $12. They have freshly baked slices of pie for $1.69 (you can't beat that!).The staff was very friendly and helpful in navigating the menu options. The manager even checked on me a few times to see how everything was. The customer service was definitely on point at this restaurant.They have 2 type of bread available on a side bar in the dining room. My only complaint was that the bread was cold instead of being warm. As such, the butter didn't melt onto the bread. Other than that, it overall was a positive dining experience!

Worst of the BBQ chains. Drive thru is the only thing good about Bill's. May have given them 3 stars in the 80s. Turkey is the best thing on the menu. In today's super competitive BBQ market, Bill just doesn't deliver.

I think we all agree that breakfast tacos should NOT have egg shells in them. I found egg shells in two of my tacos and it grossed me out so I wasn't able to really enjoy the food. I'm very disappointed because I love a good potato and egg taco but this ain't it chief.

We're sorry for the quality of your meal, Kayla. Please send us a message your phone number and email address for a call back from the Area Manager so we can make this right. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

Every time I come to Austin for the TMCEC conference I make it a point to stop by this place! I think it's absolutely delicious. I love the brisket, hash, beans and slaw. Comfort food! Yesss. The servers are very nice and patient with me! Sometimes I ask too many questions. Lol.
Don't eat here got bad food poisoning from this place.  Also saw bugs in the bathroom.
Austin, TX 78704

This is definitely the epitome of fast food in the bbq world in every sense of the word. I can see why this chain has fond memories in many people who grew up eating it with their family as there's a lot for everyone and at very cheap affordable prices.That said, the food is ok for what it is. And despite being a bbq joint, I still think the fried chicken is the best thing on the menu. The chicken is very juicy, though not as crisp as I would like. On the 3 piece dark, I think the drumstick was the best of the bunch as it was the crispest and juiciest. The thigh is meaty but bit too much moisture in the crust that makes it a bit soggy. The wing has some breast meat attached to it but also a weird section of the bird that did not seem to taste very good. I thought it was a large chunk of breading - it definitely was not.The fries are actually really good too and the bread although bland is a good palate cleanser to soak up grease.Also, they got a to go line and the in house line. We mistakenly went to the to go line and could have sped up the whole process by going to the other line but at least now I know.

Generally they are real good at making some amazing breakfast tacos, but the fast few times I've been there, I've been receiving more tortilla then eggs and they are real picky about asking for extra salsa.

Barbecue breakfast tacos.  Only thing that could make me skip kolache in Austin.Our friends had been here many times and recommended it, so we all stopped in for a quick breakfast.  I didn't get to try any other BBQ items here.  Had a brisket one- very good.  And a carne guisada, which, though the name reminds me of carne asada, was actually more tender and soaked in gravy.  Topped off with sweet tea, it was an unusual but tasty breakfast.Good service, decent prices, plain atmosphere except for the sign.  I'd go back.

Service is good and the pie is good, but don't expect good BBQ here. I came from out of town and didn't do much research when looking for bbq just something close to the hotel.... I regret it immediately.
Adam, we're sorry for the quality of food you have received at our Ben White Blvd location. Please send us a message with your phone number, and email address so we can discuss your visit. Thank you.

My job has catered Bill Millers for Holidays for years. The holiday food they get from them is awful. I think the catering we have gotten from  there at work is what initially help skew and influence my opinion of them. I'm hesitant to improve my review thinking bout how bad that food is. What I've decided to do is just let that go and review only my experiences at this location. Now that I have lived in Central Texas for a few years I can see Bill Miller for what it is, a great local fast food chain with an awesome home cooked spin. Its not about anything the convenience factor here.So I gave them one star initially and I cant say that most of things I said are completely wrong. The BBQ is the worst you can get probably in the whole town. The thing is the Bill Miller markets itself a BBQ joint in a town that actually has the best BBQ in the world.If I think about Bill Miller in comparison to just about any BBQ in town it falls flat. If ignore their attempts to be a BBQ restaurant and treat them like a cheap fast food restaurant, which I would argue is what they are they shine!The BBQ poor isn't bad at all for the price and will make you much happier than anything you could get McDonald's, Jack in the box or Wendy's. The special that comes with two BBQ sandwiches and a side for 5 bucks is one of the best lunch deals in town. Sure the chipped beef might give you heart burn and  be a bit runny. Its still better than the other options at its price point. I get the chicken fried steak meal occasionally with rings in at just under 8 bucks and I daresay is not only not bad but actually very good. I always seem to have a wait a bit longer for the steak but it still falls into the fast food time frame and I know they don't cook it till I order it. That's right they actually cook me a fresh chicken Fried steak.. A quick trip through a drive through and I get pretty darn good Chicken Fried Steak! I started out writing this review with the intent of upgrading my one star review to a three star. By the end of writing this I decided they deserve 4 stars. I could go on about how good the Tea is, about how the green beans seem to have improved since my last visit and about how the mashed potatoes are chunky but I don't think I need to. What I do think everyone should do is give Bill Miller a chance.. and if it doesn't work out the first time give them another chance. Bill Miller isn't pretty on the outside but it has it where it counts.

Bill Miller is the worst BBQ you can get in town short of buying from an HEB deli. I cant say anything good about this place other than its cheap. This is one case where you get what you pay for. I'm not sure why people eat here. The meat is always dry and flavorless, the sauce is bad, the side items are better than the food, and they taste like they aren't fresh. You can get better breakfast Tacos from any Taco trailer off the side of the road. Don't go here!
I've eaten here a lot but my last visit was disappointing and so far I haven't gone back and don't plan to
David, thank you for leaving us a review and we appreciate your business. If there is any feedback you can give to make this a five star rating, please contact us at billmillerbbq.com/contac….
Austin, TX 78704

Always embarrassed when out of town friends tell me they went to this place. BBQ is like sex, it's always good...but some is better than other. Bill Miller's is the worst actual BBQ in town. Transplant parasites. Only eat here when in a rush and don't want fast food. If I'm looking for BBQ, this place wouldn't even enter the thought process.

Matt, we're sorry for your experience with our location. Please contact us at billmillerbbq.com/contac… and fill out our compliments, concerns, or complaints form. Our team will be reaching out within 24 hours to discuss your visit.

Best customer service. Every time we have been here, everyone is super nice. I went through a minute before they closed, totally expecting to be turned away. That didn't happen. They were super nice and happily took my order. The food is really good. The tea is the best in town.
best fried chicken and sweet tea in town; fast and friendly service always. great for breakfast as well.
Thank you for your review, Lester! We appreciate your business and look forward to your next visit.

for brekefest tacos (carne guisado) and their fried chicken, you can't go wrong.  We show up at 5am and the service is under a 5 minutes for your order everytime.  They r generous with drink refills etc.  With the single beef laden taco, I'm good for the day and I'm now working as an apprentice plumber.  Solid delicious food for the long hard day.
Thank you for your review! We appreciate your business.
We pulled into the drive through and the girl with the pos system came up and asked what we wanted before we were even able to look at a menu, it was just a strange ordering experience.
Shelby, we're sorry for the service you have receive. Please send us a message with your phone number and email address so we can discuss your visit. Thank you.
Austin, TX 78704

I like this equally as much as tacodeli but Valentina's reigns supreme, still. I liked this taco and I think I could have bumped it up another star if the potatoes didn't taste like they came half cooked and freezer burnt. A co-worker got the biscuit with gravy, it looked and smelled amazing. I'll have to try that and when I do I'll get you an update.
