I didn't know. I just didn't know. Breakfast tacos are where Bill Miller BBQ SHINESSSSS. I got two, because I was cocky and hangry and anything less was "insufficient". I am woman enough to admit that I was wrong. Tortilla game is strong, eggs are fluffy like a baby bunny, and the bacon. Ah the bacon. You ever eat something and it's glorious and then you find out that what you were eating was garbage because you eat the real thing? The bacon made me find religion. Don't miss out on the sausage, though. Every bite had eggs and filling in it and I was making some questionable noises. I ate both tacos and was miserably happy. Absolutely I am coming back and I am not going to share so get your own.

I went inside the restaurant to order food to-go. I asked for rye bread instead of the basic white roll. A younger Hispanic male put the bread directly in the bag instead of having common sense to use foil or a plastic bag!! He looked at me like I was crazy for scoffing his thoughtless behavior! I think that's disgusting and unsanitary.  Presentation is everything!

Where the heck are they getting their buns? It definitely not the same supplier they use in SA.This locations takes forever and day, when BM is generally known for their speedy drive thru. The chop sandwiches are half filled and the buns are easily a week old, leaving a pound of crumbs in your lap after eating. And, their tea tastes like its at least 2 days old.Definitely not up to typical BM quality standards. Wait for Buda and stop there.

If I could give a zero I would, but I would rather give a negative rating.  This place is open until 9pm yet we are locked out at 8.31pm.  Every employee could care less and just looking the other way, as if we are not standing outside the door in the freezing rain.  Good to know customer service doesn't exist with this place and no hours signs are posted or displayed.  However using google it says they are open until 9pm... stay classy Bill Miller's as you have provided yet another reason to never go here ever again.

This review is based on their "catering service" I use for my Thanksgiving turkey and (new this year) my Easter ham.  It works great, I call up (actually if I forget they call me to remind me to order) and pre-order my turkey or ham. Then it's ready for me to pick up the day before the holiday.  They even walk it out to my car for me.  You can also order additional family style sides, including pies.Turkey: Choose Tom or Hen.  It comes fully cooked (you just reheat in the oven), with gravy and stuffing on the side.  Delicious every year I've had it, 7 years and running. Ham: Choose a half or a whole.  It comes fully cooked (I re-heated it in the oven 1.5 hours).  It comes glazed and spiral cut.  It was very tasty and I loved the glazed end parts.I've been to the restaurant for lunch a few times.  Their brisket is okay, the sausage is better, and I love their darker bread.  3 stars for their BBQ.

INSIDE SCOOP!I've worked there!-- you can skip to the CONCLUSION.THE FOOD:Many of the complaints that I see on here are about the wait for fresh food (like fries) I love the fries from this place but only when they are fresh. Because they aren't like gross processed McDonalds fries that last forever, Our fries can go soft after sitting under the heating lamp for a while. We don't cook them in bulk because then they'd all be mushy! the wait really isn't all that bad either, it only takes 4 minutes to cook from the time they are put in the fryer.really, fresh food from this place is the best.time to cook fresh food:Fried Chicken: 15-20minsStrips: 8-10 minsFrench Fries: 4-6 minsChicken Fried Steak (always cooked fresh to order) 6-8 MinutesRibs (highly suggested fresh) 8-10 minsFried Chicken Sandwich 5-6 minsBrisket:This is delicious! as long as you aren't the type to be grossed out by a little fat. and really not for the person trying to watch their figure. This one you would probably want to be cut fresh too. The way we serve this is by the #. (a 1/4# one serving) You can ask for a couple of different options:Marbled (moist and tender, more likely to have fat)Lean (less fat but can still be there, also not as greasy)Extra Lean(where they really try and get as much fat off as possible. But the meat can still be tender! don't get this confused with marbled!)No Ends (this cuts off the harder black pieces at the ends of each slice.--- the smokier parts)--lean choices are more likely to be dry..... you can also ask for a combination of lean and marbled- for the lean choices you can also ask for the meat to be sliced thin!)And just as a note as to why fresh food is the best thing to ask for here: It's not because its Bill Miller's, It's because its Bill Miller's in Austin. We don't get nearly as busy here as the stores in San Antonio, so we try to wait to cook our fresh food until peak hours. don't get too frustrated though if you come near closing time and have to wait 15 minutes for a family order of chicken, You're probably the 4th car in a row to order it. people like to do that at night.....THE SERVICE:we are super nice!! :D The manager's are so cool and will gladly sit down with you and have a nice chat! they'll even offer you free dessert if you had to wait too long! The employees themselves can be a bit fussy at times but I think that's just how some of them are. But usually they're only fussy with each other and more than willing to help out a customer in anyway possible to make their meal even more enjoyable. The trick is to smile back. CONCLUSIONOur prices are much cheaper than other BBQ places you will find, especially in Austin, The environment is very casual, but with way better than average customer service of fast food chains. you order and get your food from the front, but we bus your tables-- fusion of fast food and family sit down restaurant. Fresh food is usually the best asking for fries. only takes 5mins.It's not The best restaurant, but It gives a bang for your buck, and you're eyes will definitely be bigger than your stomach here.Personal favorites:-- #1 Poorboy with side order and a drink (Sweet Tea is to Die for!)The Quick Menu:Meats: Brisket, Ham, Turkey, Sausage, Ribs, Chop (a brisket and bbq sauce mix that plays the part of sloppy joe)Sides: Pinto Beans, Green beans, Hash browns, Coleslaw, potato salad, spanish rice, mashed potatoes, french fries.all super delish.
Stopped here after leaving the airport. Really good! Don't be fooled by the exterior.

I just got the brisket plate. The brisket was full of tendons. It was chewy, wet and sitting in water in the tray. By far the worst brisket I have ever eaten and I've had frozen walmart brisket before.Update: my dog appreciated the $10 meal I just gave him. I couldn't eat it.

It is the BEST spot for Asian BBQ in Austin. They have an insane happy hour where you can walk out spending less than 20$ with tip. I'd highly recommend this spot and definitely download the rewards app.In terms of service, this restaurant is understaffed at times but you can't blame them as they opened up right when COVID-19 began. The manager is super nice and always comes to check in on my table. This place is worth the wait, especially on the weekends just make sure to use OpenTable. For food, I have been here at least 25 times since they opened so I guess you can say I'm a regular. As a regular, I'd recommend ordering the angus beef ribs, toro beef, pork belly, and the prime kalbi short rib.
Hi Matthew!We’re so happy you enjoyed your dining experience with us! We look forward to seeing you again very soon!

Since we don't have many self grilled Korean/Japanese BBQ places in Austin, I'm glad Gyu-Kaku opened a location here. For the price of the preset combo sets, I would say this gives you a good value for what you pay for. For myself, the 2 people value set is more than enough food and includes a selection of marinated meats, appetizers, and dessert (s'mores at the end of the meal). You can also order a la carte and they have a large selection of drinks & a good selection of desserts that includes Lady M famous crepe cakes. They are also COVID safe here with partitions between each tables, servers wearing masks, and temperature checks prior to being seated. Free 2 hour parking garage adjacent to the restaurant strip.
Hi Hong!We're so happy you enjoyed your dining experience with us! We look forward to seeing you again soon! :)

I love good Japanese food and finding a Japanese restaurant in Austin with outdoor seating is difficult. When I received an Uber eats gift card for my birthday, I decided to choose a restaurant to which I had never been and Gyu- Kaku seemed perfect.I ordered a huge amount of food for myself, my husband, and our visiting son. We had chicken karaage, a chicken Karaage bowl, garlic chicken noodles, two types of wings, the Gyu-Kaku salad, and some dumplings, as well as a bowl of Ramen (which I could not eat at the time and save for a lunch later that week).The food was delivered in a timely fashion and was absolutely wonderful. Each person got a little bit of everything except Ramen. My son especially loved the wings and we almost had a fist fight over who got the last ones :-). The chicken karaage was also wonderful - finding this dish can be difficult and I was surprised at how good it was. Oddly enough, the salad was one of my favorite things because the ginger soy dressing was perfect! The potstickers/dumplings were very good too, but everything was excellent so it is easy to forget which thing was my favorite. I saved the Ramen for another day because we had too much food, and it was incredibly good a couple of days later. Since December, I have ordered twice more from this restaurant, and both times it has been so good that I wanted to order again almost immediately. When the pandemic is done, I look forward to visiting the restaurant itself!

I do love BBQ. Especially self grilled style which seems to be a growing trend within Austin. Got fresh meat cravings? Here ya go!Atmosphere: As with most self grilled style places, very homely and close up. A great place to share with friends and smell the freashly cooked meats.Food: Having been here 3 times I would say you can't go wrong with any of the premium cuts. These are marinated meats that really leave a satisfying flavor when they're done being cooked. Really can't go too wrong, just choose some meats that you enjoy and go from there.Service: Service has always been great for me and my party every time we've dined. Very attentive, patient if you have any questions if needed, and helpful.Overall: Again if you have any fresh meat cravings and are around this area this is the place. Can't really beat self grilled style, and that mix of Japanese homeliness adds a great mix for a fun night out.

We had a party of 4 and did the Yakinuku (basically, bbq for 4 ppl). We were in the restaurant for 3.5 hours and our waiter ghosted us for the last 30 min. We were missing food, drinks, and utensils - so much so that we needed to serve ourselves. This was by far the worst service I've ever experienced.After being seated and getting a round of drinks, the waiter started bringing our appetizers. Salads, noodles, etc were quickly rolled out - except none of us had plates. We flagged down a different server, who then played telephone to our server, who finally brought plates and chopsticks to us. 3 of us had napkins. The other made do as we were pretty hungry. Our waiter then told us a volcano tuna was coming, and that he would be right back. Almost thirty minutes later, he came back with 4 plates of meat. We never got the volcano tuna.After a quick explanation on cook times, our waiter zoomed off. We flagged another waiter, who then played telephone with our waiter, who then took our bar order for the second round of drinks. The beer is bountiful. About an hour later, our waiter came back with the second half of dinner - the remaining 4 meat dishes. He then zoomed off and we noticed the larger table behind us, despite having been seated at the same time as us, had already started eating their s'mores dessert. Another hour later, after our dinner is long complete, our waiter comes back with the promise of s'mores. I guess the s'mores are pre-skewered, since he came back with marshmallows pretty quickly. We order a final round of drinks with him, as well as asking for a few glasses water. This time, the beers never come and the waters also never come. My friend gets a graham cracker caught in her throat and crunches ice to help. Our waiter is gone.We then ask for the check. We sit at the table, waiting over 30 minutes for someone to cash us out. We ask the bar if they can close us out, but they don't have a POS system. So we continue to wait... and wait... and wait. Finally, a different waiter notices us and brings the electronic machine to close our table out. An end. The food is not bad. To say the service was slow is an understatement.

Hi Fiona!We're so sorry that you experienced this when you came to dine with us. We understand how frustrating and disappointing that must have been. I've let our upper management team know about this and we're going to make sure we improve on this. We sincerely apologize for our dining experience and we appreciate you leaving this comment so that we can improve. Thank you for your patience.

I don't care if this is a chain restaurant, this is THE spot for Asian BBQ in Austin. I've tried almost all the Korean BBQs in town, and nothing compares to the quantity, quality, and price you get at Gyu-Kaku. My love for Gyu-Kaku was originally discovered in Houston, so when I saw that they had a location coming to Austin, I was ecstatic. I highly recommend ordering a preset course menu for your group, as this comes with appetizers, a multitude of protein and dessert. For a party of five, we ordered the Shogun menu (serves 6).  Don't be surprised by the double orders, as THIS IS INTENTIONAL! Apps: Miso Soup, Salad, Edamame, Bibimbap and Gyoza Dumplings. BBQ: Prime Kalbi Short Ribs, Skirt Steak,  Filet Mignon, Sirloin beef, Shabu Beef, Pork Belly, and Garlic Shrimp.Cocktails are a bit more on the sweeter side, only recommend if you like sugary cocktails.

I wish I could give this place a better rating.  I've tried Gyu-Kaku in SoCal and enjoyed it so was super excited when I found out they came to Austin.  Decided to book it for Mother's Day.  We ordered the 4 person combination and service and speed of which the dishes came out was great.  However, the meat quality was nothing close to what we had in California.  It was chewy and they all came in small and uneven pieces. We had an incident in which only half of the meats were served to us.  We were left still hungry by the end of the meal so I tried to order more meat.  That's when the server let us know that she had accidentally given half of the dishes to the table next to us instead and proceeded to bring out all the food when had already stuffed ourselves with bowls of rice.  In addition to that, the order of which the dishes came out was all wrong.  They served us all the meat first, then appetizers, and then edamame at the very end.  Throughout the entire meal, there was a leak from the ceiling to the booth which made my experience quite uncomfortable.  The bathroom was also a mess.  We all left disappointed especially since this was celebration of a special occasion. It looks like they still have a lot of new restaurant issues to fix and perhaps need to put some processes in place.

Kudos to owners and staff for making me and my family feel extremely safe during the pandemic. Reservation was hard to get online so I highly recommend reserving at least a week or two beforehand as they are seating at limited capacity.  We have visited Gyu-Kaku in Taiwan, San Jose, and Houston before so we kind of know that food isn't cheap but food quality should be impressive.Temperatures are taken at the door with sanitizer available, and we were seated far from other customers. The meat lovers combo was huge and delicious. Makes my mouth water just thinking about it. My daughter is a pretty good eater and we couldn't finish all the food (did order a plate of kalbi and beef tongue...probably shouldn't as we just couldn't eat that much). Try to visit during HH to take advantage of those discounted beverages and cuts of meat.We had high expectations and Gyu-Kaku did not disappoint!

Super delicious and just what I needed in this cold weather. Ordered the garlic miso ramen which came with thinly sliced pork, eggs, and a variety of veggies. It was well packaged, smelled great, arrived warm, and healed the soul. When it gets cold like this, I'm going to have to make this a regular thing!

I have been here twice and ordered a la carte. Most things were okay tasting, prices were very fair, and the menu was extensive. My favorites were the garlic noodles and takoyaki. The rice bowls were underwhelming and looked nothing like the menu picture. It seemed like they smashed all the ingredients together in a bowl and pressed the rice down (see pictures). I think we would've enjoyed the sous-vide short rib but it came out frozen on the inside. We were excited to try it since it was a special for Lunar New Year but it took so long to make the first time, we decided not to wait for them to finish cooking it. Also would not recommend the karaage chicken - they were tiny pieces and slightly burnt.

I would like to actually give this a 3.5 star rating. This is a very fun experience and the meat quality was great, don't believe the other reviews. I'm only giving 4 stars because we had some strange experiences with our waitress. We ordered a preset 4-person meal. They had brought out 1/3 of the meal and then she told us she wasn't allowed to serve us the preset meal we selected. It left us thinking something had spoiled and we were going to her food poisoning. After 10 mins, she informs us that they were out of 1 meat and they would just swap it out. Weird, seems like a simple fix. We were also very excited for the dessert (s'mores) and then she tells us they were out. This is the main dessert option that is included with all of the preset meal options. You would think they had plenty stocked up. We will go back for hh to give it another try.

Wonderful service. Delicious food! We went on a Friday night with a reservation. They were packed but practicing safe social distancing. The menu is a little intimidating at first but our waitress was super helpful in determining the amount of food and what we should order. We started with spicy cucumber salad, spicy cabbage salad and some Gyu beef sushi. All the flavors were bright and delicious. Then came the meet. We ordered the Kalbi and two other marbled beauties. We told our waitress we loved sauce and she brought out every sauce they have in the restaurant. All of the meat melted in your mouth. We had to go back for two more rounds. Ordered black and gold sake. $30 for a 750 mil bottle. Great pricing and easy to drink. Overall will be back many many times!

Gyu-Kaku is the same Japanese chain located in L.A. and the Bay Area owned by Koreans. This location is serving a limited menu without all the Korean entrees. However they did serve Korean banchan oi muchim as an appetizer. They were able to serve our party of 6. I was impressed that each booth was segregated by a tall piece of plexiglass. Because of the plexiglass, this location is able to seat more than 50% capacity without requiring 6 feet distance in the direction of the plexiglass. They still need to abide by the 6 feet minimum across the walkway from other booths. There were no 6 person combos on the menu so we ordered the Yakiniku 4 person combo plus the Good Chef 2 person combo.  We felt like we had ordered too much food and would probably order just a 4 person combo next time.  Our server was nice enough to throw in two extra S'mores for us. Even though you'll be taking your mask off while eating, a mask is required to walk through the restaurant or to the bathroom. Unlike Bartlett's, a face shield is insufficient.

If you've never had Japanese Barbecue, it's slightly more delicate. I prefer it over Korean. Overall, the quality of meat is much better; cuts are smaller where it takes seconds to cook. It's not marinated with a thick sauce. With that, there's a series of cuts that have less marinade to let you taste the meat quality. Most are medium to high marbling of meat. Another section, Umakara, is where the meat is sitting in a savory, "Uma (umami)" and slightly spicy "Karai". Be aware of the difference and sample from both seriesIf you're really that brain lazy (or simply never had the experience) they have preset combinations. In fact, their happy hour is 2-5pm and 9-close where the two persons combo is $55  (Weekend only) This is a great deal. If you order outside the preset, you're looking at about $75 if you're conforming to their suggestion for 2 vegetables and 3 meats plus a couple bowls of rice and dessert. The perk of ordering yourself is you get exactly what you want. Be high end or as cheap as you want. Here's what we hadShrimp & Mushroom Ahijo ($8)Spanish inspired garlic butter pesto appetizer with succulent shrimp and thirsty mushroomsGyu Tan Tongue ($11) A good portion of thinly sliced tongue that goes best with the salted scallion oil ($1.50) and a squeeze of lemon to reduce the gaminess Prime Kalbi ($13) was probably my favorite meat. When cooked correctly, your teeth cuts thru it like butter and the marbling makes it so juicy and flavorfulHarami Skirt Steak ($10) Is a bit chewier but it gives you extra time to taste the juices a bit betterUmakara Ribeye ($7) I recommend because it has the marinade, is a good cut of meat and let's you benchmark quality since everyone has had ribeye beforeSpicy Cabbage Salad ($5) is what you should order if you insist on having that Korean flavor component. Crunchy and refreshingGarlic Mushrooms sweat in garlic. Nuff saidTaiyaki ($5) you get to crisp up on the grill and pair it with extra cold green tea or vanilla icecream

Service will always be a hit or miss at Gyu-Kaku chains. I'm confident of this theory because I've been to four locations across Texas now. Honestly, I don't even mind that much because I love Japanese BBQ so much. The first time we came, we had to wait around 30 minutes even with a reservation because they "overbooked", but our server was so awesome that the whole meal went by smoothly. The second time, the restaurant was less busy, but our server was incredibly slow and we had to ask other staff for help. Favorites: sukiyaki bimbimbap, pretty much all their cocktails but lychee and mango are the best, Angus beef rib, galbi, and all of their fattier/leaner meatsSkips: gyu sushi, garlic noodles

This spot is amazing for first dates, group meet ups, or date nights! I came here with my boyfriend and it was SO MUCH FUN! All of the meats were delicious by themselves. We ordered 4 meats, white rice, noddles, spicy cabbage, zucchini, and broccoli and it was enough to fill us up. The drinks were delicious although a little pricey in my opinion. Our waiter was cool and helped explain the process and was consistent.
Y'all please ignore the negative reviews. We had an amazing time!! Great food, great service, free 2 hours validated parking, lady M crepe cake, and super covid friendly!!

Was super excited to see a location of Gyu Kaku open in our neck of the woods. Had previously gone to the Houston location which was great. They specialize in Yakiniku, which is a 'cook it yourself' concept very similar to Korean BBQ. The location just opened recently so there were some hiccups as they get a hang of service. Went with a group of 3 and we reserved ahead of time in compliance of COVID precautions in place. They did a good job there- spaced out seating, hand sanitizer stations and temp checks. Waiters wore gloves and masks. The menu has a few ways of ordering- combo meals preset for 2-4 people or a la carte with a ton of options. We ended up getting a combo meal for 2 with a few extra bowls of rice and we left incredibly full. This includes salad, miso soup, beef sushi (cooked) and a bunch of cuts of meat for grilling. Their cocktails are amazing btw, so good i'd classify them as dangerous. We got the mango and lychee ones and got absolutely hammered on them. Super tasty and summery. Now while the servers were great- we had some issues /hiccups. Mainly after appetizers they were very slow to bring out meat- the main course. It was long enough that they apologized. Shortly after we were told one of our meat options was 'out'...the filet, which was one of the cuts we were looking forward to. The server made the mistake of stating that some chuck they bought out was an 'upgraded cut' to make up for it which if you know meat, that's a strange claim. Chuck is a cheaper cut. Was willing to overlook that as the servers seemed new and were probably training. We grilled all the cuts and they were great, next time we'll probably just order a la carte to have better control of what we get. They have a ton of options and variety so its a place worth revisiting. The garlic rice was fantastic as an add on. Overall was a fun experience despite the hiccups. Location is nice, food is good and be sure to get the s'mores. Look forward to visiting again once they fully get into the swing of things.

Perfect place for a date night or would be super fun with a small group! They took temperatures at the door, everything was spaced out and all servers wearing masks. I believe they are doing indoor dining as well as take-out. I felt very safe! You do need to make reservations in advance, and if looking for a weekend, I'd book at least a week or so out. For a week-night, but a few days in advance was fine.My boyfriend and I shared the Chef's Favorite, which was plenty for two (I thought we would have leftovers...but we managed to eat it all!). My favorite was the skirt steak, filet and shrimp. It was really fun cooking everything at our table, though as first timers it was a little overwhelming to hear all the different time requirements and then be left to our own devices. But, we managed and it was great!I would definitely do Ala carte next time because there were some things that I would have swapped out (like the broccoli and the pork belly). The other thing I thought was delicious was the salad -- really yummy dressing! Definitely will be back!

Brought my boyfriend here for his 21st bday and I was so disappointed. To start off the first hostess couldn't find out reservation so we waited and she took our temp and asked to wait a few minutes. Then a second hostess greeted us and asked about our reservation and then took our temp a second time. She asked us to wait an additional 10 minutes and then took us to a dirty table and then had us follow her around cluelessly until she realized there were no clean tables available. Took us back to the host stand to wait. Plus no one acknowledged the fact that our reservation was for a special occasion. Then she takes us to a large table where we watched every other table be greeted and served while we waited to be approach for our drinks. After waiting for the waiter I approached the host stand again and the second hostess apologized and she took our drink orders (we never got the drinks). Our waiter eventually showed up and apologized for the the inconvenience and took our orders. He was actually pretty nice and made the experience bearable. Overall the food was great but the service was poor and can definitely use some training. I'm not sure if the second hostess with blonde hair was either young or just really unprofessional or just poorly trained.

Hi Raegan!We're so sorry that you had this experience when you dined with us, especially when celebrating a birthday. We understand how frustrating and disappointing that must have been. I've let our upper management team know about this and we're going to make sure we improve on this. We appreciate you choosing to dine with us and we thank you for leaving this comment so that we can improve.Thank you for your patience.

Went here for a saturday dinner and loved it! The meat lovers menu is very delicious and super filling - come here with an empty stomach! Preferred some of the finer meats like the steaks over the bacon/ pork - those were really fatty and not the highest highest quality so a bit tough to chew.Overall, staff is great and experience is fun, so if you've never done Asian bbq this is the place to go!
This was so yummy. Japanese BBQ comes with a bunch of sides. There was garlic noodles, salad, miso soup, two sushi rolls, and an assortment of meat to be grilled.
Did 3 times take out. It was very good. Love Prime Kalbi, Toro beef and Harami skirt.

I ate at Gyu-Kaku in Dallas before, but it's a 3 hour drive from Austin if I wanted to eat here. Finallyyyy in Austin, goodbye to the long drive to Gyu-Kaku!First time at Gyu-Kaku, you must choose the BBQ course to have different choices if YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT TO GET. I went with my husband and my friends, which was their first time. We decided to order the Yakiniku course. I would say for 6 people if everyone doesn't have that big of an appetite. Never ending food for 4 people!! We had to roll out the door as soon as we ended with the s'mores!Definitely will come back with all of these deliciousness!

Hey this place is tasty! They just opened not too long ago. Trying to give them the benefit of the doubt. But this is what happens with chains. You lose quality. I'm from San Antonio. We drove to Austin to try the new location. I've been to the Dallas location several times. First time I tried gyu kaku it was literally the best meal I ever had. The Austin location is not up to par. The meat is over seasoned or marinated too long. It wasn't even remotely close to what I remember. Some of the plates were delicious but others not so much.Host was super nice. Our sever was extremely rude. Not gonna fault her. We're all human and we all have bad days. But maybe look into how you treat your staff?All-in-all it was okay. Wouldn't go back again. I'd rather drive to Dallas.

I haven't really visited many places during/post COVID. Gyu-Kaku provides a fun, clean, and safe environment to enjoy at-your table grilling.The restaurant offers a variety of meats that are Japanese/Korean inspired. The meat is cooked at your table with a unique grill built into the table. The style of grill sets gyukaku apart allowing the meats to cook at a very high temperature to establish that charred taste.The service is on point. Met some amazing servers. Chris and Gabriel will take good care of you. They make sure that your experience is one to enjoy.My fav meat is perhaps the prime kalbi. For first timers, I recommend choosing one of the set menus because it allows you to try a variety of appetizers and entrees.They have extra sauces. I wasn't a fan of the cheese dip which just tasted like cheese wiz. My fav sauce is the scallion mixed in with the fresh wasabi. These are the sauces that they charge extra for. Your meal comes with three free complimentary sauces: ponzu (vinegary), spicy, sweet soy.You'll have a good time here. Highly recommend.
Happy hour is where it's at. Meats are cheap and so are the drinks. Get the toro beef and those garlic mushrooms they're the best of the best on the menu.

BBQ was ok, but service was unprofessional and slow. It was not the busy time, but we had to keep reminding them to get food for us. The experience was disappointed, especially we were here to celebrate the Mother's Day. There was an error on the check as well. Btw don't order ramen, very salty and egg was cold. Gyu Sushi fell apart.

Hi Monica!We're so sorry that you experienced this when you came to dine with us. We understand how frustrating and disappointing that must have been. I've let our upper management team know about this and we're going to make sure we improve on this. We appreciate you choosing to dine with us and we hope to see you again soon.Thank you for your patience.

I finally got my foodie friends together and came to this infamous Japanese bbq place.  For the reservation, they will only sit you once all party has arrived so make sure no ones running late or you'll end up paying for parking cause you go over the 2 hour validation limit.  Since none of us has been here before, we opted for the 4 people set menu so we can try everything and not have to make decisions.  Last time I ate Japanese bbq was when I was in Japan so this is a pretty nice treat.  The set menu came with a ton of appetizers and about 20 different types of meat.  All the beef were fresh and tender.  We all agree that we can do without the chicken  breast cause it was the least appetizing out of all the meat.  Overall, I think this is a great place to enjoy a practically guilt free meal( there's no rice!) with friends.

My husband & I went for dinner and absolutely loved it! We did one of the pre-fixe dinner bundles (The Meat Lovers) and supplemented with 2 other appetizers we really wanted to try. I have to say the food quality and portions were incredible - we left stuffed! Penelope our server was the best, great service. We love a cook-your-own BBQ place like this, but were super impressed with the ventilation system - after sitting for almost 2 hours, we left not smelling like smoke and meats like you typically do at other places like this. We definitely be back!

We made a reservation for 2 and we were late for 2mins, and they refused to let us in. It was such a bad experience and they didn't call us to ask when will we be there. Really bad experience and the server didn't apologized for anything and blame us for that. Plus it was very crowded inside and not practicing social distancing.

The food, service, COVID procedures, and atmosphere were all great. It's similar to a KBBQ style, in which you cook your own meats on a grill at your table, so expect the meats/veggies to come to you raw. You can do an a la carte or a prefixed menu. We chose to do a la carte.Food/drink: Pork gyoza were delish! Full of flavor and nice and crispy. The meat (ordered the prime Kobe short rib, Harami skirt steak, UMAKARA ribeye, pork belly, and spicy pork) was delicious, tender and well seasoned. The veggies (we ordered the assortment) were fine, just a basic assortment of baby tomatoes, zucchini slices, mushrooms, and shishto peppers, no seasoning. The drinks were very good (ordered the lychee mojito and geisha), strong but delicious at the same time. Service: Abiding to COVID procedures, the staff were all masked and wore gloves when we were welcomed. They took our temperature and set us at a table that was well distanced from other parties. They were friendly and attentive, offering cooking times for meats and keeping an eye out for if the grill flames got high. Cons: The portions were small for the price. I feel like I could have gone to a classic KBBQ for the same price and left with a fuller tummy. Also, aside from the Japanese greeting/goodbye, I couldn't tell what made this a "Japanese" BBQ, as opposed to a "Korean" BBQ. They had similar cuts of meat, and Korean dishes like bibimbap, kimchi, and chigae. Overall, would return if there was company visiting or for a celebratory meal, but would probably go somewhere else for a more filling Asian inspired meal. Glad to have something like this in the East Austin area though!

Terrible food..  the meat is BAD..  it's is hard...  I had $55 dollar lunch that was disappointing.  I will avoid stepping in that place again..  the miso soup wasn't good.. the edamame was over cooked..  AVOID!!

My absolute favorite place to eat. I was super excited when they opened up a location here in Austin. Grate place to spend time with family and friends and also enjoy delicious food. Staff was excellent and service was very good.

Had a reservation & they have a 15 minute late policy got there before that but was told we still wouldn't be seated because " not on a night like this" said the hostess as multiple booths stood empty behind her with not a single other person in sight waiting to be seated... the most ironic part of it all was the hostess was preparing our table until another hostess walked up to her & told her that it was  n o w  at the 15 minute mark *after we'd already walked in, spoken to the hostess, gave our name, stepped off to the side to the wait and began chatting w each other for a minute AND she began preparing the table* BUT they "could not seat us anymore on a night like this".... it was our first time here and will not be going back.
Good food, fun restaurant, but lackluster service. The waitress forgot to bring three of our dishes to the table.
Finally more Japanese BBQ in Austin. Delicious and comfortable atmosphere. Definitely recommend but book a reservation because theyre busy. Cant just walk in normally.

Don't go here, and DEFINITELY don't make a reservation after 8:30 because you will experience the worst service of your life and you'll be pressured out before you can enjoy your food. They RUINED my wife's Mother's Day and we paid DOUBLE for it. If you do choose to eat here, (seriously, don't) you may or may not get all of your food in the right order IF at all. Don't expect to be drinking anything until your basically done eating. And definitely don't ask to speak to a manager because the manager is the one allowing it to be this to happen. I know I won't ever eat here again.
Love the food, but won't order delivery or take-out again because of all the petroleum-based plastic containers. Wow, Gyu-Kaku. Times are changing. Change with them.

As I make reservations two days prior to come in at 7 pm on 9-20-20. This point I come into the restaurant get deny service because I only have cash lost  my debit card and denied me service. Apparently a low income cash isn't good enough for these "owners". Thanks for putting that information on your website before making the 30 min trip to try out this new restaurant. You guys suck!!!

First time at a Japanese BBQ restaurant. Food was good. Beware towards the end the burner gets too hot so recommend cook times should be a lot less, our last few meats burned with the recommended time. Other than that food was great. Although pricey for what you get IMO. Our server did well and was polite. We did arrive 15 mins early to our reservation and they would not seat us because we were waiting on one person. They also were out of stock the 3 drinks I asked for. Kirin, Sapporo and the Sho chiku bia saki.

I'll never go back.  Manager treatment of customers is very poor.  Saw him throw out a peddie cab guy trying to get a meal before starting work.  Manger should be fired   The peddie cab guy did nothing to be disrespected and discriminated against like this manger did that day
Big variety on the menu no frozen meats all fresh when served to you. Very good helpful staff and tables are setup so no smoke ever gets in your face overall great place 10/10 would recommend
Hi Danny!We’re so happy you enjoyed your dining experience with us! We look forward to seeing you again very soon!

Came here with a co-worker. You have to make a reservation so get on that. I've been to the Gyu-Kaku in NYC and this one is pretty similar. My co-worker who's been to the one in Hawaii said the menu in Hawaii is slightly different than the one in Austin so, beware. Service was pretty top notch. Our server helped us with anything and everything, she was sweet. Their menu online says it's limited but they still have A LOT of options. Recommend the Harami skirt steak and the beef tongue if you're into that. I thought beef tongue was pretty good and it was my first time trying it when I came here. Happy hour specials also available. This place is also good for groups.
Austin, TX 78736

Great food! Good drinks. Live music.Restrooms are clean.Most of all - there is a huge play area for kids. Witha chalk board on fence, three playscapes and picnic tables all under a canopy of trees.Parents can go there, chill with friends, eat tacos and drink with your kids in sight!

Apparently, the barbecue is not Stubbs anymore. However, the bbq we had was pretty good.  We love this location because of the park-like atmosphere and giant playgrounds for younger and older kids. Our granddaughter loves it! It's convenient to the zoo, so a great choice for a quick meal after a zoo outing.

I heard some great things about this joint! So today the hubs and I took the El Camino out for a ride and wanted to try a new spot for some bbq! We ordered quite a few things since we wanted a variety to try. The brisket was bland! Like where was the flavor!!??! Also got some spinach side which was okay, but it was kinda cold, and the potato salad was alright. Also got some brisket nacho potato thing which was just fine. We even spilt a banana pudding which was down right the worst I've ever had! It was vanilla pudding with three slices of brown bananas on top with four wafers covering them. Now while everything was edible, sometimes it's times like this where it just shouldn't be served or consumed. I'll never eat there again. Oh and I swear people should have their kids on a leash there. Who let's their kids run wild, it's annoying to those who are just trying to relax. Absolutely awful!

What an amazing place for me to revisit [My first visit was EIGHT years before, 06JUL2011, when I was pedaling my Beloved Doublevision across Texas, and was returning home to El Paso in the blistering mid-Summer/mid-day heat of 101F/39C/87% humidity. My turnaround point had been a week prior, at my most favorite #1 son's apartment in West Houston, and having spent the 4th of July holiday with my most favorite #1 daughter in Austin] Anyway, 8 years before, US290 was undergoing renovation with numerous adjacent side businesses sprouting up; "Senor Buddy's" had just opened. I was extremely pleased to be one of the first customers and the the owner, Jorge Garcia, allowed to sit in the shade, cooling off and resting. Fast forward 100 months, I stopped beside one of the fuel pumps, barely recognizing what had previously been an active construction site. This now-well developed area represented the vast Westward growth of the capital of the second largest state in the USA. Pleased with payment at the pump but Dismayed at the name change, I refilled and continued motoring East.

Very disappointing,  I get barbecue across the state.  Went a little bit out of my way to go to Stubb's and got sliced beef sandwich as you can tell from the picture it was more of half beef and  half fat.  It was also  was barely warm.
Excellent BBQ and the outside seating is legit as long as they have a heater on when it's cold. Plenty of seating and delicious food.

On a trip to Austin, TX for the marriage of a relative we decided to go to Stubbs.  It was a hot day.All seating is at picnic benches outdoors.  The order window is small.  To get into the Stubbs one must enter through the Graceland Grocery mart which, shows no evidence of exposed out back.  Luckily, we were with someone who was vaguely familiar with this location.  I suppose I really had expected a proper indoor restaurant.I found the ribs and other BBQ items I nibbled to be tasteless.  The sauces were all different shades of hot and not a single BBQ with a sweet note.The fried okra were done well.  But, tasteless.  I don't think anyone was happy with their meals.  Much of the food was left and with this group that is a truly unusual event.I had the Beef Brisket.  It was good.  But, not great.  I ordered the macaroni and cheese side.  While it was saucy it lacked any distinct cheesy-ness.I cannot be specific about the meals of my Partners-In-Dine as it has been quite some time and those details have left me.You can do better.

We went there for the first time yesterday and thought it was super cool vibe... I got brisket (asked for lean) and chicken very flavorful (gave me leg and thigh) with mac n cheese and fries....no sauce. Meat was super juicy and tender! Lost a star for flavor, fries and mac and cheese tasted a Little bland...they had a band, nice bar, playscape for kids plenty of shade....all picnic tables.....should have brought my dog as another patron brought theirs. There was even a small kids birthday party going on on the lawn. some of those people brought in their own lawn chairs....would go again!
This review is solely based on the epic chicken wing I got.It was pretty damn metal. It's was a stroke of luck, a sign. The omen. I will be back.
Austin, TX 78736

I've gotten breakfast tacos there a handful of times in the past. I have to say my more recent stop there will probably be my last. The bacon they use is always too thick, fatty, and limp - totally wrong for a taco. The cheese and eggs should be the chewy part, bacon should be thin and crispy. The bottom line is when there are so many other options nearby for better breakfast tacos, there's no need to choose this one. Oh and be careful, if you grab a taco from the "brisket" section you might unwrap it to find it was an out-of-place migas (blech).

I was torn between a 4 and a 5 star. If they would maintain the kids playscapes better, I'd give it a full 5. The place is perfect for kids. 3 playscapes. Brisket was good, a bit fatty, but that makes it so tender.  Also had stuffed peppers and the spicy chicken appetizers,both worth it.  All the food is pretty good!  There's a full bar and live music on the weekends.  We actually went for both lunch and dinner on the same day! Kudos.
Fine, nothing to write home about. I don't think it's associated with Stubb's anymore.
Delicious food great place to stop huge playground for the kids to enjoy. Will definitely stop again

Stopped here on our way back from Fredericksburg with our 9 month. She loved that there were so many kids around and we loved that she could eat/yell/play all she wanted while we had dinner. Wish they had a place like this near us in CA

Stopped here on our way back from Fredericksburg with our 9 month. She loved that there were so many kids around and we loved that she could eat/yell/play all she wanted while we had dinner. Wish they had a place like this near us in CA

If magic and meat ever had a baby, this is it. All the meat dishes are best in class. You literally can't go wrong. The sides, yeah, more of the same.Add to this live music al fresco, a huge kids playground that is far enough from the stage to let the little tykes do Lord of the Flies while you enjoy some sweet jams and relish the best way to consume protein in peace.Yes, Stubb's is worth the drive out to this location.Just skip the rainy days, since almost all the seating is uncovered.  Hmm, on second thought, maybe just do take out when it rains.Ooh, did I mention they do gluten free that is OK for my celiac wife.  Oh yeah.

This place is great. Main reason that I go here is for the coffee. Besides being a grocery store, playground for the kids, and live music, they do provided coffee. I usually get a latte, which for the price about 2 and some change, comes with two shots of espresso. Which is great! Worth the stop if you are on 290 going into the hill country and need a stop for coffee break.

It's hard to believe people like the BBQ here.  The sauce has a funky taste, the brisket, ribs and turkey  was unbelievably dry; the Serrano spinach was so spicy, it wasn't edible.  The nachos were gas station quality.   The sweet tea and fries were good.  It's a great property, with a killer playscape for the kids, which is what the 2nd star is for.  Seriously can't believe the BBQ was so bad.  And my standards are not really high.   Totally sucks because we won't ever be back.
Austin, TX 78736

Awesome grocery with the famous Stubbs name on it. Great variety of coffees, breakfast tacos, snacks and local beers! Very nice and upscale place with lots of choices to eat and drink. In addition, get gas and enjoy some live music. What a cool Austinish venue just on the outskirts. One of my favorite headed West stops to prep for a trip. Great addition for the good coffees too!

I was out this way and it was getting to be beer:30 pm so I just gave it a try.Not sure about the other reviews but I was quite happy during my visit. So giddy I completely forgot photos.The outdoor space is huge. A lot of covered patio and shade with cooling fans. Numerous crafts on tap and full bar from the friendly bartender.  $3.50 draft during happy hour. Very dog friendly as well.The BBQ is ordered from a separate window and did not disappoint. Brisket, chicken, turkey all good. The beans and spinach sides were highly regarded and the cole slaw was quite good. Free whole jalapeños to boot always rock in my book.I like it and will return, a lot better than expected based on previous reviews.

I suppose this is a great place to bring your kids so they can run around unattended while you eat mediocre BBQ. Every few minutes a kid was emerging from the playscape crying, looking for their parents. Food quality was low on the scale for Texas BBQ. Ordered brisket nachos and was shocked at the blandness of the meat, and cheese and chips were what you would get at a baseball game, straight out of the can and bag. Feel like this place has good potential, but they need to elevate their food game, and maintain their grounds better.

Barbecue - excellent 2 meat plate to go.Brisket was moist and flavorful, perfect tension. Ring was a little weak.Ribs were fall off the done tender, meaty, and large. 3 of them with about 4 decent slices of brisket.Sides were good, mashed could use more gravy. Will be back.

Food is absolutely nothing to write home about.  Guys...come on,  this is ATX...if your gonna do bbq then you have to do better.  Chicken was dry and I have no idea why people buy your sauce.  Some changes will need to be made before i return for food.

Food is absolutely nothing to write home about.  Guys...come on, this is ATX...if your gonna do bbq then you have to do better.  Chicken was dry and I have no idea why people buy your sauce.  Some changes will need to be made before i return for food.

I wish I didn't just pay $40 for cold mediocre BBQ. This place is for families who need a place to take there kids so they can run around while mom and dad have a beer. For some people it's probably perfect, just not for me.

I'm conflicted. I like the BBQ. But the rest of the food kinda sucks. I love the location and hope they are a success, but they need to get out of the old, old, old school way of cooking or they will lose their shirts. We had several appetizers and none were worth saving. The queso, salsa and chips was a sad showing for Austin. The queso was bland and lifeless. The salsa was just sad, anything taken at random off a grocery shelf would be better. The fried green tomatoes were cut way too thick, had a heavy, thick, cloddish breading and was served with a really blah ranch dressing.  The potato skins were mediocre, absolutely nothing to make them stand out. The chicken wings with the spicy sauce were far over-cooked and the sauce tasted strange and was really incredibly hot...and I love hot food. On the positive side, the smoked turkey is darn good as is most of the BBQ items. The fries are really good as well. The grounds are a real draw, with a huge tree-covered outdoor play area with super kids' play-scapes. This they really aced. Now if they could only give up the old cooking ways and inject new life into their food, they would have to turn people away. Until they wake up and join the current world wide interest in new and better food quality, I suggest you stick with BBQ and fries.

If I were rating the place, it would be five stars.  Lots of great, covered seating, and Friday night, there was a good band playing.  It was very enjoyable, and surprisingly comfortable for a late-July afternoon.  The barbecue is average.  There is a pretty good selection of beer, too.
Austin, TX 78736
Not sure it is Stubbs anymore, but the food was amazing. The kids really enjoyed running around play grounds. We were guests to a birthday party and our kids keep asking to go back.

It's pretty good BBQ, and the location is nice too. It's comparable to Rudy's BBQ, but I thought the outdoor seating was better. I'll definitely return. Also, it's not crowded, and they're open until 9PM.

I don't come here for the food, though I do eat it and find it to be decent. I can't really get excited about BBQ from any place. As every parent knows the kid-friendly places aren't really known for their amazing cuisine, and that's just something you get used to.However as a place to relax with kids and have a beer this is my absolute favorite. Tons of shade and room to run around, big interesting playscapes, and they host great kid shows on Tuesday nights. If this place shuts down I'll be so heartbroken so parents, get out there!

Very mediocre. On a scale from 1-10, I would say 5. Chicken was chewy and brisket was very mediocre for Austin. Sauce is entirely too sweet. Potato salad was really good. I guess you could by a bucket of potato salad I wouldn't bring out of town guests here, for sure. $50+ easy for 3 people. There's much better in Austin. Try the thrillest top 8 bbq list for Austin. Can't go wrong at any of them.Stubbs, step your game up!

The atmosphere here is great. They have cool events and bands all the time. Sadly the BBQ is only okay. First, BBQ joints can be separated into two camps - those with beef ribs and those without. Stubbs falls into the "without" category. We can venture into BBQ theory about pork vs beef ribs, but to keep things short(ish) let's just say beef ribs are a must for me. Fried okra is also a plus, and Stubbs doesn't have that either. The brisket is decent and the sauce is acceptable. Going toe to toe with some other really good BBQ places in Austin is hard, and with the name recognition of Stubbs I was hoping for much more. So food, meh. Atmosphere, excellent!

Worth a try, brisket taco was decent but not that hardy on the beef. They have a wide selection of tacos on corn and flour tortillas. Two dollar sausage and egg. Green and red sauce. Premade grab and go quick easy and in and out kinda place. But They do have an area where you can order as well, I'm just talking about the breakfast tacos.
I enjoyed everything I ate and drank while there but be prepared wait because this place is understaffed and the wait is very long.

Great BBQ and service. You must try the Thursday lunch special. Sometimes I just need to feel like I'm getting a bargain. Thursday is my weekly "get something for almost nothing" lunch. It's really great food and a beautiful family friendly playground. I usually bring my dogs along too. It's like BBQ in the park.

So much potential, but I've been disappointed more often than not.They seem to be constantly over staffed but are still incompetent--particularly the baristas. They struggle to understand basic orders let alone any additional requests (i.e. personal cup, almond milk) work slowly even when nobody else is in line, and struggle to fill the cup to the top.The tacos and self serve coffee station are not always well stocked or even clean.They just seem to be struggling to get it together. Inconsistent quality and service at best.
Austin, TX 78736

Excellent BBQ from a relaxed and friendly location. Excellent Pork ribs and their Brisket is perfect! The sides are great too. We especially like the spicy creamed spinach. Top it off with their banana pudding!

Very disappointed in the service we got here at Graceland. Bartender was inattentive..waited to order drinks while she took care of something other than bartending. Wanted to watch the Texas game..server told us to ask the guy handling the food orders, that guy told us to ask the bartender, bartender said she didn't know what channel it was on.. we found out the channel, told her only for her to say that the tv doesn't change channels..Food seems to be decreasing in quality..BBQ lacking seasoning ..We love the concept of this neighborhood place and really want it to do well.
Beer selection is great especially for someone who likes dark beer.Brisket was really tender.  Will definitely come back.

Been here a few times and sad to report their BBQ is some of the worst in Austin. I suggest enjoying the ambience and sticking to beer and cocktails. Vibe is casual and good place for a group to gather. The outdoor area is a fun place to hang out and toddler/kid friendly so I'll be back but their BBQ game is seriously lacking.

So; The live music sometimes annoys me because I can hear it INSIDE my home. It's inconsistent... sometimes a whisper, and on Kid's nights  and Sunday brunch, it can be an assault. Bummer. They could treat the neighbors better by putting up a simple wall behind the stage. Mostly, the music is a cut above what most outdoor venues offer in this area.( I'm a guy who does guitar work for folks like Eric Johnson/David Grissom/ Redd Volkaert /etc) ..KInd of a "critic". Service: VERY friendly and courteous.Wait: It's often15 minutes in line and 15 minutes to get your order. That's too long.If I call in an order, they tell me it'll be ready in 5 minutes ... BUT; when I get there to pick up my order, I sometimes STILL have to wait 15 minutes in line to pick up my order. That wastes my time.They NEED a way to do pick-up orders MUCH more efficiently.Bar: Good selection, fast service, and makes the (often) long-ish wait for your food ( if you're not picking up) more palatable. Friendly staff at the bar. Food:  Love the sandwiches of all kinds. To- go sandwiches are great too.  Fajita nachos are great. (!!) ( I suggest you don't get them to go though ... they come in a "kit" where you have to put them together yourself ... NOT as good as what they serve in-house, at the table, in my opinion and that of my friends) Ribs: Tried them 3X to try to be be fair. Pretty bad.If you want to get good ribs; go to Black's , or take a trip to Lockhart, or go to a little roadside shack called "Benny's"... east of the flyover on 71 ( Cedar creek) or go to Kerlin's on east 12th. I'd say :"Franklin's" ....... but I don't need to deal with the wait. There's always Rudy's ion 360, and Ruby's, on Guadalupe.... Or Salt Lick ( good meat ... hate their sides) . Point is; There are better ribs out there. The deal with the ribs @ Stubb's is that they have a LOAD of black pepper and other spices which over-ride and obscure the flavor of the meat. Those ribs appeal to the crowd who think; "It MUST be good.... see how hot and peppery it tastes" I'm sorry, but when you've had good ribs, you know what  good ribs are. Access;Good.  BUT; If you have kids, park close to Stubb's. Why? The speed limit is 45 mph on Circle drive, and crossing Circle to get to Stubb's is NOT safe.There have been several near-miss instances where an excited child darted out from between parked cars to cross Circle drive to get to Stubb's. Even IF the speed limit was 30 mph, it'd still be dangerous. Watch your kids (!) crossing that road.Ambience:The ONLY thing about the place that is self-defeating is the volume of the music. I've seen parents SCREAMING at their kids, ( on Kid's night) trying to be heard over the volume of the music, and the kids not being able to hear parents. Frustrating for both. HOWEVER; this is not consistent: ... Sometimes, the music level is just fine, and parents and kids alike can communicate, relax, and have fun.  Other than that, the ambience is Wonderful.  play-scapes, etc.  .... GREAT place for kids and parents to go have fun.Price/ reward.  Overall; if you consider travel times, parking hassles at inner -city places, etc.... this is a very good neighborhood place to go "kick back"... just needs a few refinements to be top notch.
There is better BBQ out there, but the place has lots of room, it is kid-friendly, the staff is courteous, and the food is tasty.
Yummy tacos, whenever we go on road trips we stop here. Staff is friendly, place is clean, and beverage assortment is well curated.
Fun place to take the kids. Decent beer selection and bbq. Nice place to have the kids bday parties.
The portions are small for the money. I prefer rudys instead. I think the food is a little better and you get more for your money
Austin, TX 78748

Um, go here. I'm not a BBQ expert by any stretch but I know good food (and good brisket). The most pleasant surprise were the sides - that slaw and the creamed spinach was amazing! A great place to eat and social distance and let the kids run around as well.
Thanks so much for the review Jessica! Glad to hear you enjoyed the food and hangout. We sincerely appreciate the support and your business. Hope to have you back again soon. Take care!
First time trying Wunder Pig. We ordered a little bit of everything and it was exceptional!

The good: great location at Lustre Pearl South with ample covered seating and drink options. I liked the brisket - it was tender and had a nice smoke flavor/ring. Pulled pork seems to be their strong suit (my friend ordered but I didThe Lack-"lustre" : the jalapeño cheese sausage wasn't very flavorful, and I don't recommend the potato salad for that same reason and it was served at a lukewarm, tepid temperature , like it had been left out on the counter too long. For a price that's competitive with Valentino's down the street, I was hoping for more.

Hi Eric, Glad you enjoyed the brisket and pork! We appreciate the feedback. Not sure what happened, but I apologize for the not so cold potato salad and will make sure we are double on top of the pick up holding times. Thanks for stopping by and we hope you try us again soon.

They would have been better off saying they ran out of beans than serving me canned beans.  Didn't make good on their promise to make it right either.  Banned me on IG because I posted this to their page.****Update**** The owner called me personally and apologized,refunded my meal and offered to take care of us next visit.  I can work with that.  Giving em another try soon!

Holy Moly. I went to a local brewery and they offered food through Wunder Pig Barbecue food truck. Boy, was I disappointed.The menu isn't extensive. They offer Meats, Sides, Classic Sandwiches, and drinks. I wanted brisket but surprise surprise...no brisket. So I ordered a pulled pork sandwich. Twelve minutes later I received a Styrofoam box with my sandwich, a side of mustard, barbecue sauce, creamed jalapeno spinach, and jalapenos.The pulled pork was just "ok". There really wasn't any flavor to the meat but it was moist which was on a grocery store bought bun. Hmmmm. The bun wasn't prepared at all. It wasn't warm, or toasted, or with any spread at all. The jalapenos that I ordered, were about a tablespoon of jalapenos from the pickled jalapeno jar that I saw on a counter inside the truck. They weren't prepared at all either. Just a scoop of jalapenos. The creamed jalapeno spinach was a half a cup of cream cheese and spinach. It was just "ok" to. The thing is that the side said it was to have jalapenos in it. I didn't see or taste any jalapeno in any of it.What a waste of a meal. I could have had better. Don't stop here if you have an option. Or better yet, have a drink at the brewery and then Uber somewhere else, anywhere else. I give them 2 stars because it wasn't gross and scary, but less than "OK". I hope they don't think they are going to do any "breaking in" into the Austin BBQ scene. Based on this performance I think they have a long road ahead of them.

Hi Gabriel, thanks for your very thorough and detailed review on the brewery (which you also unpleasantly commented on) and our spot. Some pretty harsh stuff for sure. Nonetheless, I was happy to hear you could get out of your office job to come into the brewery. Must be brutal on the bones to sit at a desk all day.  And since you took the time to break down your out of town experience on us and the brewery and went even as far as saying we shouldn't think of "breaking in" to the Austin scene, I felt in only appropriate for the sake of my hard working team to respond on this one. I think it's only fair to let you know we've actually been open for almost 6 years now - in Austin.  We're adding two more trucks to the fleet currently and have built a pretty strong following with repeat customers at the brewery. And yes we've had write-ups in case you're wondering. In either case, I wanted to clarify a few things.  To start, I wanted to let you in on a little secret (shhhhh) Ready...Okay hear it is...not sure how they do things in Houston, but running out of brisket is actually a REAL THING if it's a popular item on the menu.  (crazy I know, right?!) Also, we are a traditional/classic style barbecue spot.  We don't use fancy style buns because, well... this is barbecue? And even though we pride ourselves on meats primarily, the buns we do use are Martin's Dutch Potato rolls - which in case you didn't know are what a good amount of the bbq spots in the "Austin BBQ scene" actually use  (i.e. Valentina's, La Barbecue, Franklin, etc).  I know this because we have the same sales rep that delivers to us. Since it sounds like you have an extensive background in the BBQ field (apparently), you'd probably also know that traditional old time BBQ spots sometimes only serve barbecue up on plain white bread for the sandwich since the focus is on the meat and quite frankly, some people prefer it that way. And that's fair if you felt the pork was little lacking in flavor. We'll take note of that and appreciate the feedback no less. We do offer a more extensive menu on the weekend since that is when the brewery has the most traffic with a variety of specials.  Moreover, regarding the packaging - as you can see from all of our Yelp photos we use kraft boats served on a tray board in traditional fashion, but we gave you to-go styrofoam box because it was actually raining (ridiculous I know, who would do that? Ughh). Unless I'm guessing you would've preferred your food extra moist, possibly?  Yes our jalapenos are jarred which is pretty common for barbecue, we do make homemade smoked-garlic pickles and do pickled onions if that's frilly enough for ya. As far as the jalapeno creamed spinach that you said had no jalapenos in it, not sure if you realize this, but we finely chop it and cook it on the smoker with the cream cheese, special seasonings and spinach. Spinach color you ask? Yup you guessed it - GREEN just like jalapenos.  (poof -total mind blower) I always find it interesting when someone who isn't a part of the industry somehow considers themselves a self-proclaimed food critic "picky foodie/home chef" (that's cute). Almost as if one day it's like. "Hey I woke up today, watched enough food network and presto! I officially certified myself in all things cuisine!"  Lastly, the next time you want to share someone's food and want to do it some justice, please take a photo that doesn't look like you're in a desolate cave.  And not trying to tell you how to be a photographer or anything, cause I'm sure you got a "picky-photo guy" certification badge lying around somewhere I'll bet. Take care....Anyone reading feel free to check out more of our daily photos at instagram.com/wunderpigb…

Awesome place to get some good Texas style BBQ! On top of that, they are steps away from the Oscar blues brewery!Grab a beer and then when you are hungry run on over and get some great food.You can't go wrong here with anything on the menu, the chicken is moist and has great seasoning with an awesome Carolina white sauce.The brisket was awesome, seasoned more than most but had a delicious flavor and fall apart in your mouth with a great crust.The pulled pork is where it is at, and I don't buy pulled pork normally because you had one you had them all. YOU have to give it a shot, it is so flavorful, I can't describe how good the flavors are on this.The sausage is great too, not one of those you bite into and squirt grease on your shirt when you take a bite. The potato salad is mustard base and reminds me of home and the baked beans and coleslaw are also just like your parent's will make them.
Austin, TX 78748

Okay.... so this was just okay. We most likely won't go back, the spinach side option was so salty we didn't eat it. The potato salad had either too much salt, vinegar, or garlic. And just simply wasn't good, the brisket was decent and it is the only reason I'm giving it 3 stars, but like I said we most likely won't be back for this truck.  We were very disappointed since the guy taking our order said the spinach side was the most popular and it was actually the worst thing we ordered. So if you like super fatty brisket, salty spinach, and vinegar-garlic potato salad come to this food truck! But keep in mind when you order 1/2 a lb of brisket 0.25 lbs is fat! And we spent $30 for just two people.

Wunder Pig, how I love you, let me count the ways. I really pride myself on being one of those people that stans slept on joints. Wunder Pig is definitely a sleeper in the Austin BBQ scene and that's a shame. If I go to Austin during the week, I usually look at their calendar to see if I can catch them on a lunch rush. Imagine my surprise (and delight) when I went to Oskar Blues this weekend and the glorious smell of smoke hit my nose while driving up and there was WP in all it's glory. The line they had was intimidating, but when they're hand slicing meats and have three dudes in that tiny trailer, you have to give them props (and patience!). Word on the street is they are Oskar Blues permanent food truck, win-win!The sandwiches are the stars here, for the amount of meat and food you get, it's a steal and a half. I am never left wanting more. My all-time favorite is the Pig Vicious (pulled pork and sausage? yes please!). The Wunder Wich is their brisket based one. Although, they had specialty sandwiches this weekend that were bad ass, my best friend got the brisket frito pie and I had the chicken with green chile mac and cheese. Both were excellent and I hope they guest star again soon. Their sauces compliment their sandwiches perfectly, their mustard sauce is to die for and now they're apparently making it with a stout from Oskar Blues, super cool.Alright, I know why you're still reading. But what about the BRISKET! Listen, I never fault any BBQ day for having an "off" day, which is why I only review BBQ joints after I've been enough times to really get a feel for the pitmaster's skills. The bark on the brisket from Wunder Pig is probably one of my all time favorites, it's delicious and flavorful, you know the pitmaster knows his smoker and how to get the best flavor from it. You know, I never used to be a huge pulled pork fan, but I'll be damned if Wunder Pig didn't make me a believer. It's a little sweet and plays so well with the sides.I know everyone says BBQ isn't about the sides, it should be about the meat. But would you go to a burger joint and be okay with subpar fries? Nah, probably not. This is where Wunder Pig smashes it out of the park completely. Their potato salad has a certain je ne sais quoi (Jenna said what?!) that I can't put my finger on, but it's damn delicious. The jalapeno creamed spinach has the right amount of kick and flavor to be different and make everyone's least favorite vegetable, sexy. The main meat man and owner, Mems is really gracious and very approachable. I've seen him walking around and talking to customers to make sure they're happy, which is a big plus in my book. tl;dr: sleeper BBQ trailer specializing in ridiculously unique, delicious, and filling sandwiches, stellar sides, and sauces. Come hungry and with patience, it'll be worth it in the end. *heavy breathing* Meat sweats for days!

The portions are really small, you can go for a taste.Sausages and Prime Angus Brisket do not serve with anything in bread style.The taste of the meats are ok but nothing special.The only good thing is that it is next to the brewery, thanks to this food truck we have learned that it is a brewery and we will start going there.

Hi Berker,Thanks for your feedback. And definitely happy you all found the brewery! Although we were a little confused that you mentioned our portions are small - as we offer everything in tradition to most other BBQ spots (i.e. by the 1/2 lb or 1 lb in weight). Everything is measured on a digital scale at the window so accuracy is consistent to what our customers order. In addition, we actually do offer a variety of sandwich/bread options (including specialty sandwiches) for all the meats we prepare for our patrons - which are listed on both the menu inside and at the service window. Sliced bread is always available (free of charge) to all customers ordering meats a la carte. We hope you come and see us again when coming back to the brewery. And please let us know if there there’s any confusion or questions you might possibly have about the menu. Thanks! Mems Davila, Wünder Pig BBQ Co

My friend came here on Friday when hanging out at the Far Out Lounge and told me how great the sandwiches were and we immediately decided that we should go back on Sunday so I could try. When I went there Aaron was so great but what was even better then the service (which was excellent) was the food! Would highly recommended it to anyone looking for some good ole Texas bbq truck with a twist!
Hey Decker,Thanks so much for coming back to see us. We appreciate the love and support. Glad to hear you enjoyed the ‘que. Come back and see us again real soon! Thanks, Mems Davila, WP BBQ

i ordered a half pound of pork and the same of brisket to go. I wish there was a way to get some sauce to go. Sadly, the brisket i received was powder dry. The flavor was good, but so dry i could barely eat it The pulled pork was delicious

This is amazing! I tried it when they had a food truck next to my office. Quick food and delicious BBQ! You get so much for under $10! I recommend the burger- it'll get you full for sure, especially with sides. If you see their food truck you've definitely got to try it out. You won't regret it!!

These guys are great- the food here is amazing and are true artists - most places focus on their bbq and their sides are just blah - not these guys! Every dish is thoughtfully constructed with creative flavor combinations that are delicious. On top of that, they gave us a free sausage link on the way out just because! You have to try them :)
Austin, TX 78748

The best way to find out where Wunder Pig is located is to check their website for the current week. They tend to park in busy business parks and luckily they were close to my work that week. So what's so special about it? It's pulled pork sandwiches, nothing fancy, but it's all about the slow smoked swine that makes the sandwich. It is also a huge sandwich, too so you won't be disappointed with the portion. The pork was juicy and tender, but was served sans sauce - or as I like to say uncarolina - but sauce is offered in BBQ or their mustard based one. The buns are warm and buttery, so be prepared to be licking your fingers clean.

Loved Wunder Pig BBQ this past weekend.  They were set up at Oskar Blues Brewery and did not disappoint.  I ordered the brisket and potato salad.  Both were flavored very well!  The meat was tender with just enough fat.  I will not hesitate to order from them again the next time I see them around.  Both of the guys working were friendly and didn't miss a beat.  Good sides, good sauce as well.

Discovered Wunder Pig during a recent visit to Adelbert's brewery.  Their website mentions their daily location schedule.Austin has so much good BBQ. Most BBQ places have their 1-2 strong points that stand out in my memory.  For me the pulled pork, creamed spinach, and coleslaw were remarkably memorable.  The highlights for me were actually the sides.  The sides were really that good.  I could have just eaten a plate of the creamed spinach and coleslaw alone.  The pulled pork was my stand out meat here.  It had a lovely hint of tangy sweetness to it.  The other meat was good, the pork was just better.The food truck isn't much to look at, and I loved the hand written menu on brown paper. Large portions for affordable prices.

Especially enjoyed the sides. Big fan of the jalapeño cream spinach. Didn't expect to like it as much as I did but the employees gave me a sample and I was hooked. Also very into the potato salad. Yuuummmm

Ok!  This is one of the best BBQ Joints I have ever eaten at.  Aaron is the man!  He is very kind and accommodating.  The brisket is to die for as well as the pulled pork and chicken.  There is nothing on the menu that will disappoint you.  My favorite side is the jalapeño cream of spinach.

Definitely a solid BBQ spot in my book. I just moved from El Paso, TX, found this foodtruck on Yelp and I can say this place does not disappoint. I was looking for a meaty sandwich and went with the Pig Vicious with a side of potato salad and inhaled every bite. The pulled pork was tasty and tender as can be, the sausage was smokey and delicious and the slaw pulled the sandwich together nicely. The potato salad went very well with the sandwich on such a hot day too. It's always nice to try new BBQ spots and the various styles and flavors, very glad I came across this place. I will definitely be back for more BBQ sandwich fixes, and it's not far from my new spot. Win-Win.
They had a very tasty special (forgot the name) that was a Chopped Brisket sandwich with Sausage and Jalapeno Creamed Spinach. Highly recommend trying.

Got a sliced brisket sandwich from their food truck parked at Oscar Blues. I thought $10 was too much for a brisket sandwich but it was huge. Easily could be shared with somebody. Took half home for later.

This barbecue was AWESOME!! I'm picky with my barbecue and this was NOT a disappointment. Aaron helped me and was very helpful, friendly, and made great RECOMMENDATIONS. I ended up with more food on my tray than I wanted and thought I shouldn't have ordered so much... I ate it ALL. SO glad I let Aaron convince me to try all they had to offer. I later thanked Aaron for being so patient and taking the time to recommend everything I inhaled. Definitely going back! Two very enthusiastic thumbs up
Austin, TX 78748
Great barbecue! And the red barbecue sauce RoCks!!!!! Go get some scrumptious you won't be sorry!

I had a pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw and sliced sausage added to it. Amazing!! It was full of flavor and not chewy or tough. Very good. Coleslaw was not overly mayonnaise'd either which was great. Service was friendly and quick.
Start with the good,  potato salad is awesome.  However this is a Bbq joint.  I ordered 1/2lb brisket.  2/3 of that was non-rendered fat.  I will not be returning.

Hi Jake, We're sorry to hear about your recent experience at the food trailer.  First off, glad you enjoyed the potato as all sides are house made.  Regarding the 1/2lb brisket, I'm not sure if you ordered some of the moist cut which does have more marbling that some customers do prefer, but definitely in no way should ever have gristle of any kind. Our team is trained on trimming the brisket accordingly, so if that was the case our sincerest apologies and management will keep a close eye on this. These aren't reviews we typically receive,  so we wanted to make sure to reach out and hope you consider visiting us again. (Sending you a DM for a food voucher code on us)  - The Wünder Pig Team

Wunder pig is amazing, it was posted up out side in the food truck and I was originally going to go get a salad but the sweet BBQ smell got the best of me. The two guys in there were so sweet!
