I got a pulled pork sandwich,Potato salad and a water-$11!!!! So it has a pretty nice pricing point and not over the top like some food trucks are. The sand which was so so so so DAMN good. Highly recommend.
Good brisket and friendly customer service! The sides are good too! We got the creamed spinach and potato salad and it didn't disappoint. Perfect pairing with an Oskar blues ale.
Awesome pork sandwich!!! I came back for a second. They used to come to my work but now they're here permanently! So good, friendly, and consistency.

Decent food but not worth the wait or the price.  Waited 30-45 minutes for one sandwich and one side.  I usually don't post reviews but this place was a stand-out in terms of poor service, terrible wait times, and food that wasn't worth it.  Seemed like the customers were an inconvenience.  Very odd experience.
Great food. What a monster sandwich pulled pork and sausage with coleslaw. Tastes amazing. Staff is very nice and friendly. The sandwich is a meal in itself. Bun was great.
Austin, TX 78748
This is my favorite BBQ food truck. The meat is perfectly cooked, tasty and the brisket is moist, but not fatty. They have some new sides which are equally tasty.
BBQ so GOOD it makes ya wanna slap yo mamma!!!!!!!!!!!!! Definitely recommend it, The BBQ was amazing! The sides are delicious and the staff was extremely friendly! Check out this hidden gem!
column21: Far West Side, San Antonio, TX

column20: Best pig vicious sandwich! Seriously I've never had a sandwich that was so good and paired it with pickles mmmmmm you got to try it. I plan to go back!  I just finished my food and I want more
Brisket is great, but in Central Texas you can't just serve up great brisket.  Their BBQ sauce is amazing!!  Total package is some of the best around!

Wunder Pig was such a nice surprise! I can't lie. I haven't been impressed with the barbecue in Austin so I wasn't expecting too much but my pulled pork sandwich was so great. I was skeptical because it didn't have sauce on it but the meat was so flavorful, smokey, and tender. The potato salad was pretty good too. They had a few free condiments and extras (onions and pickles). Prices are also very reasonable. I'll definitely be back to try more!
Awesome food great service 10/10 would recommend to everyone I know. The meat is phenomenal and the staff is extremely friendly I love it

Highly recommend Wunder Pig.  We've used Wunder Pig for several catering events, and have had their truck out for lunch service at our company. Our most recent experience was for a company BBQ.  The food is always amazing, the staff is always well prepared and personable, and we always have an appropriate amount of food (if not a little extra).  Mems is a pleasure to work with and we will definitely be using them for future events and catering needs.
I got the two meat plate. The brisket had enough salt to survive a transatlantic sailing trip. The pork was bland and wet. The best part was the bag of chips.

We loved Wunder Pig's food and service so much that we had them cater our wedding! They served to 140 guests, and all of them raved about the barbecue. Mems does a great job of working with you to get the right meat and sides selections to fit your budget. He also helped coordinate the logistics of whether to serve out of the truck or to serve buffet-style, and his foresight helped us serve everyone more quickly.The brisket was a nice balance of fatty and lean, the sausage was just spicy enough to give a little kick, and the jalapeno creamed spinach and potato salad were excellent sides. The ribs are definitely worth the extra money as well!In terms of the catering service, it was top-notch. Mems made sure his staff had everything coordinated flawlessly. They served 140 people in short order, and everyone left full, happy, and talking about how great the food was. After we booked with Mems and determined the menu, we literally just showed up and ate on the day of our wedding. The entire experience was great, and we'd highly recommend him for event catering!
NA
Austin, TX 78745

I have been here a few times. The bbq is actually pretty legit. I love the drive through, especially in these times. However, they are slow as hell. I usually only have 1 car in front of me, but it is like there are 10. Otherwise, the food is worth it and reasonably priced. I love the smoked turkey..and I typically do not even like turkey!Some of the menu items: 2 or 3 meat plates where you can choose from turkey, brisket, sausage, or pulled pork. Baked potatoes that you can top with your choice of meat, mac and cheese, cole slaw, peach cobbler, and banana pudding -soooo good. The prices are also pretty reasonable.

To go BBQ from HEB. I must say I was kind of weary. Well I was impressed, the Q isn't going to win any BBQ contests but it's definitely worth the money. I got the 3 meat combo with ribs, sliced brisket and a whole chicken breast with the wing still attached. It also comes with two sides , I opted for the brisket beans and potato salad, a lot of food for the price. Like I said, not the best but good BBQ at a good price plus it's a drive thru. I'll definitely be back for another 3 meat combo!!

I came in here and got the beef brisket sandwich and some potato salad. The barbecue sauce was fantastic the portions are absolutely perfect and size not too much not too little. The food had a little bit of heat to it which was beautiful just enough to want you to have a little more. The staff is very friendly they have a happy hour special in the afternoon if you want a sample beers and the price was just right. They have a drive-through so you don't even have to get out of your car. Easy freeway access and the food comes out fairly quickly. In my opinion there's no reason to not stop by.

I'm giving True Texas BBQ two stars for their $2.00 draft beer happy hour on Tuesdays (which is unheard of in Austin) and because when we sat out on the patio  facing away from the parking lot you almost forget that you're inside of a grocery store... these are pretty much the only good things about this restaurant. The bad parts are the food! I ordered the 1 meat plate with natural brisket, macaroni & cheese, and coleslaw ($11.79) and I kid you not that nothing on my plate was warm. You'd think at a minimum that the brisket would be warm but the entire tray of food was cold like it had been sitting out for a few hours. The brisket was very dry for it being a fatty slice (you have the option of choosing the cut e.g., fatty or lean) and the coleslaw was just okay. The rising star was the mac & cheese that was quite cheesy, but because it was cold... you feel me lol. The rest of the table got the chopped natural brisket sandwich and two other 1 meat plates. Two of four meals were served completely cold (old?). They were also out of the potato salad and brisket beans. Honestly the only reason we came was for the $2.00 draft beers, so I'm happy about that, but I wouldn't give the food a second thought. The convenience of having a restaurant inside of my favorite HEB is nice but for the quality of food, I think it's overpriced. The indoor atmosphere is decent but because it's COVID times, I try to only sit outdoors or on a patio when dining out.

A friend posted a picture of a brisket he was smoking for Labor Day, and since my invitation got lost in the mail, I decided I'd need to secure my own tasty meat. Since I live less than a mile from this joint and they have a drive-thru, I thought I'd give 'er a go. For a holiday, I wasn't sure what to expect as far as a line. I arrived at 11:40 AM and from the time I got there, to the time I drove off, it took 19 minutes total. Not terrible, especially for all you Whataburger freaks who wait an hour for a burger, but I digress.I opted for the moist brisket, and a side of macaroni, cole slaw, and creamed corn. The bark on the brisket was a little tough. The flavor was good, but not the best I've ever had. The macaroni was good. The cole slaw was a little bland, but I love how thinly it's shredded. The creamed corn was very smoky/black peppery. I wasn't offered or given any bread, pickles or onions. I was given a choice of BBQ sauce: sweet, spicy or tangy. I got tangy and it was not good lol. But, good meat shouldn't need sauce in my humblest of opinions. Whether or not you'll like this place probably depends on where you usually go. If Bill Miller is your goto, this is probably a step up. If you usually endure a muggy August day in line at a smoky trailer for an hour for the perfect piece of meat, this will probably leave you missing your regular spot. Overall, pretty decent for a grocery store's drive-they BBQ, but won't be my first pick.
I had to wait 90 minutes. It was worth the wait. Was it good. YES! Was it tasty. YES! To be continue...

I was going to try this when it first opened, but the line was far too long. I came back today at 10 to 11 in the morning and they were not quite open so I drove around the parking lot. By the time I got back in the drive they line, there were three cars ahead of me! So it took a little longer but I was anxious to try the barbecue as it smelled so good. I ordered 2 pounds of lean brisket, 1 pound of pulled pork, a half chicken, the brisket beans and coleslaw, and 2 cherry cobblers. I also requested some of each of the three sauces (peppery, sweet, and vinegar) and they provided 3 containers of each type! Between the wait in line and wait for my food I was there about 30 minutes. It was a 10 minute drive home and the food was all as hot (or cold in the case of the coleslaw, onion, pickles and bread) as it was supposed to be.The lean brisket was amazing! Not much fat and very delicious. The pulled pork was great though I personally would prefer to add the sauce myself, but that's why it's less expensive. The 1/2 chicken was moist and tasty. The brisket beans were great but a little watery. The coleslaw (creamy) was perfect for me. We were all too full to eat the cobbler so I'll have to comment on it later!

Definitely the best chain BBQ restaurant in Texas.  Granted, when the comparisons are with Bill Miller and Dickey's, that's damning with faint praise.The food itself is pretty legit.  I tried the brisket and ribs.  The fatty brisket is above average, although it might've benefitted from some more smoke.  The St. Louis ribs are on point with a glaze that's both sweet and spicy.  My dining companion enjoyed both her turkey and sausage as well as her creamed corn.  We both tried the spicy sauce, which wasn't spicy, but had a good flavor for a BBQ sauce that's significantly thicker than most Central Texas BBQ joints.  As for dessert, we tried the peach cobbler.  If you like a cake style cobbler, it's pretty good.  It would be even better if they had ice cream as an option.Surprisingly, for a H-E-B operation, True Texas BBQ fell down on the little touches that can make good great.   First, the cornbread.  I'm a huge cornbread fan and love the sweet contrast with BBQ, especially ribs.  I only wish I'd known that the cornbread was jalapeno cornbread.  Also, it's pretty apparent that the plastic containers for the meat are pre-prepared.  The lady taking orders asked if we wanted pickles, bread, or onions.  I said bread only.  My dining companion said pickles only.   We both got pickles and onions -- and in almost the exact same amount, leading me to think the plastic trays were premade.  (Also, on that note, the plastic trays for the BBQ are barely big enough to hold the meat, much less cut it.)All in all, it's a great chain option -- and some of the similarities with any chain show up in the failure to execute on the little things.

Went to this place again, and this time it was even BETTER than last! So tasty, the brisket is to die for!! The inside is very clean and nice rustic looking. The employees were also very helpful and very kind. Overall this is a great place to eat and if you like great brisket definitely try this place out!!
Austin, TX 78745

I'm shocked at the bad reviews. I've tried brisket form all over the state and I have yet to have anywhere have as consistently flavorful and juicy brisket.  I lived in Lockhart and while good, wildly inconsistent. Southside Market in Bastrop is the other place that may be as reliable as this corner of an HEB. I don't care about sides or sauce. The brisket has been great all 5 times I've been.

Other then the wait and the fact that they were out of sausage links and corn, it was pretty good. The line is a bit much to wait in, but I would definitely be back again if I see the line is not long. It moves too slow to sit in again.
One of my favorites places to get brisket in Buda !! Brisket is nice and tender and have great flavor !! Sides are Okae but I usually come for the brisket !!! Natural cut is my absolutely favorite !!

3 stars and here's why :1) the very VERY slow drive thru time..... I don't quite understand why it moves so damn slow. The first time I spent maybe 20 min or a little more and this is not an exaggeration, in line. The 2nd time was a bit more Normal at 10 min. 2) both times I've ordered the peach cobbler and TBH it is very good! Get some ice cream and enjoy the two together! You won't regret it.3) loaded baked potato with chopped brisket. Overall it was really good and I would order it again, except ask them to be a little bit more generous with the toppings

Had a pretty long wait which is okay with me if the food is good. All I have to say is I feel like a sucker.This tastes like cafeteria style BBQ. If you are big into BBQ do not waste your time here. Brisket is difficult to chew and not tender, sausage is tough, etc. Go to an actual BBQ spot like Terry Blacks, Valentina's or Micklewaiths. This is fast food quality so spend your money on some good BBQ not this place.

I can stay silent no more.Dogshit. I gave this place three or four tries with a variety of products, but I will suffer no more from this "chain." Baked potatoes: undercooked.Pulled pork: unmemorable flavor.Cobblers: apple cobbler is okay, if you like the bready kind of cobbler.Tri-tip sandwich, their new beast: an inedible abomination. "Here, how about eight or ten loops of onion sandwiched between huge slabs of meat and gooped with avocado and also uncut dried tomatoes. Oh, and the bread disintegrates mid-bite."  Thank you, Randy Evans and Kristin Irvin.Frito Pie: this is the alpha and the omega of offenses. A dump of chips into a shitty paper box with a gloop of meat dumped on top. Imagine Randy and Kristin at the pitch: "We want people to feel like assholes after they eat the five wet chips on top and then just scoop around with a plastic fork for Fritos."Loaded cornbread: If you like dry cakes of corn loaded with cheese and whatnot, here you go. If you want to enjoy your food, don't get this.

I can't comment on the drive-through experience, but if you order food at the indoor counter, be prepared to wait... and wait... and wait. I was there today intending to order a simple brisket sandwich for takeout. But I quickly noticed that out of the eight customers inside the restaurant, only two had their food. Everybody else was standing around anxiously staring down the corridor where the food is brought out. And this was at 3:00pm, so the kitchen should not have been very busy. When I asked the counter representative if there was a problem in the kitchen, she replied "No, but if you're in a hurry you should probably go somewhere else." I agreed. Waiting 20 minutes for somebody to place three slices of brisket on a bun is not a worthwhile time investment. After all, that's what happened during my three previous experiences here.

Order # 80644 - Austin locationwhile the food was good, it failed in every other way sadly.the app didnt tel me it would be 5 hours before my food would be ready (2 2 meat meals, 1 3 meat meal, 1 half slab of ribs). until after my credit card was chargednever got the text letting me know it was ready, luckily i just went to see if it waswhen i walked out, i decided to check the order and i am grateful i did. there were multiple items not in the bag, went back in and the lady let me know that "she messed up and forgot to let me know so she could sub food in its place".so 5 hours wait, during that time my food order got jacked up and i was initially sent on my way with 1/3 of my order missing.i wouldnt go out of my way or wait in a long line for it, its good but not great, and truly lacked in customer service.

I've tried almost everything on the menu. I imagine some people are aggravated that there always seems to be a line (because the H‑E‑B is brand new), but give the app a try. I order on the app and set the time for the next day and just walk right up, grab my food, ask for vinegar bbq sauce (it's the best) and go on my merry way. I love BBQ and, yes I love Lockhart, but south Austin has been desperately needing a good place. True Texas completely beats out Green Mesquite and Bill Miller's. Sorry, but it had to be said. Go give it a try.
Austin, TX 78745
The wait here is not worth it, I ordered a sandwich with macaroni on the side and I waited 40 mins for my order. The wait is stupid and there wasn't a lot of people in there

Recently had True Texas BBQ and I was very impressed. BBQ items are amazing! I mostly prefer the brisket and turkey, but I've tried the chicken as well and it is very good! I would have to agree with Texas Monthly on this being one of the best BBQ chains I've ever been to. Highly recommend! (Pro tip use their True Texas BBQ app to avoid the wait!)

Very disappointed in my first trip. First off we drove a bit to get here. I don't live in town so I placed a order for pick up at 6pm. We pulled up to pick up the order and they gave us the wrong order. I had to park and enter H‑E‑B. I told them it was the wrong order. She went back and grabbed my bags (it was a large order). We left drove 22 miles home only to realize items we ordered and charged for were not it the bag. I called to speak to someone to refund what I was missing. I was told I have to drive up there to get a refund. Absolutely ridiculous! Because true Texas bbq made a mistake I have to drive 44mile round trip for a refund! Unacceptable! Also bbq is overrated!

Lack of condiments with large orders. 2 slices of bread for 2lbs of meat and 1oz of BBQ sauce, small container of onions makes for a bland bbq meal for a family. The only good thing was the brisket was smoked well. Turkey was ok.

For the hour wait in drive-thru, I could've driven back and forth to Stiles Switch for curbside pick up. The wait time at H-E-B would've been worth it if it was really good, but it was merely adequate. The meats were on the dry side and the brisket beans were watery. My biggest issue: everything was cold (and it was only a five-minute drive back to my place). I might try again when the hype dies down, but I wouldn't sit in a 20-car line again.
The food is delicious, but the wait is not worth it. The restaurant needs a carry out option.

What can I say. Drive through is convenient and it's no Salt lick or Franklin but it's a drive through and it's good and beats Rudy's easily. Price isn't bad, too. Yeah customer service isn't the best but it's amazing food, can't complain. I'll definitely be back. Be prepared with line taking 30-45 minutes. You have to get the ribs! Easily the best part!!

So I had to go from here multiple times now beginning on opening day.  Opening day was the only time they had all items available.  Today they had no sliced onions, in allocation that is less than 75 feet from HEB produce.I honestly don't know what yo take away from their lack of onions.Are HEB onions not up to quality?Are HEB BBQ unable to shop at HEB?Can HEB not plan meal prep while selling the concept to shoppers?Look I gave them a pass for no banana pudding but sliced onions not available says they got issues.PS I would have left feedback on their BBQ  app but it doesn't allow it.

Seriously disorganized. Ordered online app. Said it will text me when order is ready. Arrived at my order time and waited 25 min. No text saying it was ready. Asked girl at pickup station and she has had my order out and ready the whole time getting cold. They did not have anymore sausage so i had to sub it. Placed my order in the morning. Guess nothing is guaranteed until you get there. Mac and cheese may be the worst i have ever tried. Brisket was good. They did not put bbq sauce in my order. I ordered the spicy. Parking was a pain too. Not going back. Sub par bbq
Austin, TX 78745
The brisket sandwich was delicious! And I loved the spicy BBQ sauce it was fantastic. You got to try it, yum.

I tried this place for the first time and was impressed and happy with the food. The portions were surprisingly large and neither my friend nor I were able to finish everything on our plates. I had the two meat plate with turkey and brisket with mac and cheese and brisket beans for my sides. Everything was great although the brisket was slightly under seasoned for my taste, but it was still delicious. The brisket beans a few fantastic and the mac and cheese was also really good. My friend had the banana pudding and raved about it. Good food and a good experience. I will be back.

Stopped by to grab groceries and bbq. Ended up waiting 30 minutes to order, which I was fine with especially since this HEB is new and I'd rather have social distancing. Unfortunately the group in front of me, 6 boys, ordered nine plates of food. This order alone took over 20 minutes on top of the 30 we had already been waiting. It took another 30 minutes for my one plate of food to come out and it was extremely dry. Only come here if you're okay with waiting over and hour for sub or bbq.
This bbq is soooo good! The ribs and turkey are my favorite. I was so surprised by how good the turkey was. It is well worth the wait in line.
waited for about 30 minutes in line to order for take out... but I didn't really mind the wait. The food was really good, but they forgot our BBQ sauce:(
Horrible wait time. Waited for an hour in drive thru just to order food. Got the food and food was cold and tasted like it was reheated.

Not very efficient, but given the Covid situation I get it. Nothing special. It was ok food, but it does not stand apart from any other bbq place in Austin. Please be sure your orders are *accurate*. I ordered a 3 meat plate and when I got home, there was NO brisket in my order. Extremely extremely frustrating considering the wait was 90 minutes!

It's hyped up and It's HEB, so masses will come. To me It's average BBQ and meh sides, nothing to write home about, good for fast food BBQ.  I would say it's on par to saltlick, just without the fun atmosphere. If you're looking for Great bbq like Valentinas, Franklin's, La barbecue and other great craft bbq places in Austin, then this aint it. Plus why not support local small businesses.  And with a name like True Texas bbq you would think they would at least use a traditional offset smoker, not a propane assisted one, lol.

I ate here for the first time today and after meaning to check it out since it opened. I have to say I am VERY impressed. Now I am usually very picky about my barbeque, how it tastes, the texture it has and just how it looks and smells.  After eating here all I can say is that, this is some of the ABSOLUTE best barbeque that I have ever had. 10/10 Would eat here again and 10/10 would recommend to friends. My cashier Darla was very warm and welcoming on my first visit.
Austin, TX 78727

We hadn't been to this place since the convid pandemic hit.  It's still very good. I had the sliced brisket sandwich and was delicious.  You get approximately 1/2 lb of brisket and some delicious sauce on the side.  My partner got the sausage wrap.  The piece of sausage looked like it was about 1/2 lb too.  He was able to cut it in half and make two wraps out of it.  The sausage looked too.
A family favorite! Great food and great staff!Tried Curbside tonite for the 1st time and it lived up to Smokey Mo's high standards. Will be stopping by more often! Thanks!

Last Saturday my husband and I decided to go pick it up and it was so quick and so delicious. The service was just as amazing as the food. It only took my husband 10 minutes to go in and out. Faster then any drive thru.

After MONTHS of wanting to stop by, we finally headed over for lunch on a chilly, rainy day. The chopped brisket on potato was the perfect bad weather snack. Fresh, packed with my beloved carbs, offered tons of tasty flavors, and was the size of my head. We bought a little extra brisket to use when we reheated it and it made for another very tasty and filling meal. The side of Mac and cheese was tasty and homemade.The employees were AWESOME and worked with us to make sure we got the best possible meal combo for lunch!The only disappointment was the peach cobbler. I LOVE my desserts but unfortunately this just didn't do it for me. The peaches were floating around in a thick, gel-ly sauce and some graham cracker crumbles were sprinkled on top, then it was put into their mini fridge. It just didn't taste or feel like a cobbler to me.

Had a crappy experience at smokey mos. #1 dropped a menu holder that was not secured down and it hit my toe and cut my toe. #2 inexperienced wait staff. Red necks with attitude. Didn't even know if they had another location. #3 really low class place. #4 felt a lot of tension walking in like everyone hated their job.#5 no one responded to me when I reached out about the incedent that occured through call or email. #6 was so excited about getting barbeque but my experience and vision of them has completely dimenished.  #7 complete lack of concern for a pregnant woman who just wanted barbeque. And just don't care about their customers. -Plain and simple these people including smokey mo. ..do not give a fuck for their customers. Absolutely appalled. Will never return. And my first job was In a barbeque restaurant. Dis entirely.

Worst bbq in Texas- coming from a true Texan.  The brisket is super fatty and the turkey is dry. All of the sides are gross and the bbq sauce is more like spicy ketchup.  And the customer service is terrible on top of the super high prices and gross food.  With so many other options to choose from, I will never go here again!

Went in to get tacos this morning.  Awesome tacos.  So nice to have something a little different with a bbq smoke flavor.  I don't know how many times I've come in here but it's lots and these folks are always friendly and accommodating.   Always saying "how can we help you?", etc.  Clean restaurant and inviting atmosphere.    Thanks for the great bbq, and tacos, over the years.  I look forward to many more.
Food is great, management and staff are also very nice and hospitable. Always have a nice experience here.

More like Smokey NO.  Brisket sandwich was bland.  No smoke flavor on the meat , it was at least tender though.  Needed to add flavor so poured the cup of BBQ sauce on my sandwich.  Big mistake.  The sauce is slightly sweet. Sorry but real Texas BBQ doesn't need sauce and if it does, it sure isn't sweet at all.  The green beans came out of a can, no salt and pepper added.  Very bland as well.  Last visit to Smokey  NOs!
Austin, TX 78727

Visited this place on a sudden hunger bout which turned out to be a great surprise! Tried out their chicken tacos and loved them. Also the staff is extremely friendly and are always ready to help you customize your order! Will definitely be revisiting this place for their breakfast tacos and sandwiches.

We shopped & shopped & shopped for a good BBQ place to cater our wedding for a decent price.I randomly said to the now wife "I wonder if Smokey Mo's caters", low and behold they do and the KNOCKED IT OUT OF THE PARK!!! Everyone gave us compliments on how great the food was and the price was a terrific value.If your looking to catering an event id give these guys a call for sure

I took the COVID-19 disclaimer into account and added 1 star. Smokey Mo's isn't going to win any BBQ awards. I'm okay with that. Sometimes you get the BBQ bug and you just want some pretty good, fast brisket. What I'm not okay with is employees who act like they are doing you a favor by taking your order. If you are so miserable that you can't someone's order without being an obnoxious jerk go work somewhere else. During these times, I'm very selective of when and where I choose to eat. Smokey Mo's will no longer be one of those places.

Placed an online order but accidentally selected the wrong location, called immediately to cancel but was told hard luck no way to cancel. Absolutely awful customer service! No way to contact the third party ordering service and they weren't willing to do anything to help. I get it was my mistake but their attitude was awful! ** edited to add: we ordered the family platter, 3 meat combo, totaling 1.5 lbs. we only got 2 nests that barely weighed 1.0lb.Never again!
column21: Avery Ranch Far West, Austin, TX

column20: Stopped in for lunch and was pleasantly surprised how good the food is!  Got their Thursday special which was a loaded baked potato (I opted for turkey instead of. Red), was also served with butter, sour cream and fresh chives. Came with a small drink for $9.50. They were very generous by serving a large baked potato and plenty of chopped meat. Friendly service, was served promptly, and tasted delicious!

Just wanted to drop line about Eric and the folks at Smokey Mo's...staying open and fighting though this pandemic (safely) has made me returning customer. I dont eat out much but I keep coming back for more. I love BBQ and have found the spot. Thanks for being here every day!!! And I dont mind taking out for the time being. Again thanks Eric and employees. Just look how they pile on the meats!! Yum Yum!!  Stay safe, mailman.

If you want delicious brisket, sausage, fried okra and tea -- this is the place. There never is a long wait, either. The staff is really friendly and fast. The desserts always look great, but I am usually too full to try. Maybe next time I'll add some banana pudding.

Order the family meal with a few extra side totally was around $75 and not worth it at all! Half my sides showed up none of the desserts and the meat was dry and very small portion for a "family meal" will not be going back.

This location has great customer service and the line always moves quickly.  The to go orders are always accurate.  The food never disappoints and are generously portioned.  The price is not overpriced for what you typically pay for quality bbq.  We have not tried other locations.
Austin, TX 78727

Smokey Mo's BBQ is pretty tasty and I always receive good customer service at this location. I really enjoy their brisket, sausage and they're turkey is decent too. I also suggest the meat wrap and the bbq baked potato. The green beans and potato salad are my favorite side and the bbq sauce is flavorful.

I've known Eric the owner here for a few years now back when I was managing Apartments Now right next door. I used to always go in for a turkey wrap which was always great. It was really hard to beat sub $3.00 for something actually not bad for you at lunch. Well I moved over to 183 and Burnet for work, but a friend of mine started working at Apartment's Now. She asked me today to join her for a burger and fries at Smokey Mo's. Of course I'm down! Eric always serves quality food, but honestly the burger surprised me. Damn it was delicious! The bun was not soggy, and the meat was cooked perfectly....and the fries...oh damn the fries! The fries were fantastic! They had just the right amount of crunch, and they actually bring them out sprinkled with pepper! It seriously had no grease!
Super friendly, extra personable and great food. Thank you Eric for gettin' my order, Matt for the sweet smile and OMG SAM!!! for the origami balloon! love love love stopping by this place.

Nothing special at. Brisket had like blood vessels looking things on it that were bleeding which is not very attractive when when your trying to enjoy your lunch. The ribs are like pre-made ones you would get at Walmart and throw in oven aka not tasty or flavorful. Mac n cheese is not the worst I every had but far form the best.

The Mo's Salad is the best, I order the turkey one! The tea is awesome as well, and dont get me started on the "red vinegar" sauce, Idk what it is but I use it ;) They have the BEST customer service around!

Disclaimer~ I'm not an Austin local, so I havent been here multiple times. Was just in the area and needed some lunch~Food: Middle of the road BBQ sausage sandwich. It took a lot of sprucing before I could really enjoy it. (lots of sauce, hot sauce, and pickles). The potato salad was nothing special AT ALL. Atmosphere: I think this is what draws the crowd in. It very much seems like a neighborhood type vibe. The two guys working the count/kitchen/register/floor were really happy to be doing all 4! My family and i were greeted like we were family of the owner. While sitting there eating the mediocre sandwich it seemed as though everyone knew these guys as they entered. This atmosphere is the best part of this place. Price: CheapBuilding: Small, strip center style. Overall, If im back in the area and need lunch, I'll swing by.

I usually an very satisfied with the food and customer service  here. But last night, not so much. I ordered a sliced  brisket  sandwich  among other items.  When I got home my sandwich was not with the rest of my order.  Went back and I thought it was taken care of.  But again whe I got home it was the wrong item.  Not happy.

Well. I've officially been to this restaurant three times now. Sadly,  I do not much care for either their potato salad or coleslaw. This majorly upsets me because I LOVE cold potato with my bbq. Slaw, my default back up,  and neither I like. But, their baked potatoes are TO DIE FOR. Top it with chopped beef, and that's the best damn potato you've ever had. I was totally impressed with how tender and moist the baked potato was, plus the butter, bacon, sour cream & chives.....MANI had a bbq plate at another of their locations,  and so far I'm happy with their chopped beef. They could use a softer, local bun, but it's solid. I will try other sides and meats.
Austin, TX 78727

Very friendly staff that will always make you feel welcome once you walk in.  I have come here several times and each time I always get into a conversation with anyone that is working there which is a nice change from places that just take your order and push you out the door.  The food is good and I am a big fan of their banana pudding; tastes just like how grandma used to make!  The brisket can be hit and miss, some days more moist, but it could also just be going earlier in the day as compared to later.  The combo plate is a reasonable price because you do get a nice size portion of food.

Let me tell you somethin'! [Fire Marshall Bill voice]If you wanna drive all the way out to Lockhart or Taylor or Lexington or Llano for some of that "Best of Texas Monthly" beef, don't let me stop you. If you have time to wait for 2 hours in line to taste some of that famous Franklin meat, by all means, go 'head on. But if you are in the McNeil/Parmer area on a busy day and have a hankerin' for some succulent smoked yardbird or jalapeño sausage, you can't go wrong with Smokey Mo's.Notice I didn't say anything about brisket. I never order it at Smokey Mo's because that's not what they do best. Follow my lead, and you'll be happy that you stopped in.+Two meat combo plate with chicken and sausage (Monday's special)+Chopped baker with smoked chicken* (Tuesday's special)+Mo's Country Salad with chicken (Wednesday's special)+Anything else with chicken, turkey, or sausage.The end.*Note, you will pay a little extra for chicken on the chopped baker.Smokey Mo's is a locally-owned, family-run chain started in Cedar Park in 2000. They now have 11 restaurants in Texas, most in the Austin area, but also a couple in San Antonio and Conroe.P.S. I hear that the breakfast tacos are downright delicious (3 items for $1.60), but I've not had the pleasure myself. My old co-workers in the Riata area used to swear by the desserts, including the chocolate cake and cobblers.

As a franchised establishment they offer great bbq. This is a fast serving Bbq location that will give some of the smaller companies a run for their money. The sides are excellent and the homemade sauces are great.
Friendly service and very good food.  This location has become a favorite since I've been in Austin.  Everything is good and they have the best fried okra!
More than what you expect from the outside and from the inside I guess too but yes a very great option for quick good bar b q to go.

So this is one of my go tos but I found out about something new today that's technically is a 'secret menu' item loaded fries basically it's a loaded baked potato with fries instead of a potato and it is awesome definitely a worthy 5 star rating
I go to the is place all the time. The food is good but what keeps me coming back is the service. These folks always make an effort to be friendly. Also, breakfast tacos are fantastic.

The food is always awesome and the employees are so nice! My boyfriend and I live right around the corner so we eat here pretty often and only once have they forgotten cheese (on a frito pie to go with everything on the side so it didn't get soggy). Compared to many other places that are CONSTANTLY messing up our orders, that's saying a lot, especially for how frequently we eat here! Keep up the good work guys!! My favorite is the turkey sandwich loaded with pickles and BBQ sauce and the frito pie is also good! Banana bread putting of course is amazing, and so are their homemade brownies! Delicious!!! My absolutely favorite is their breakfast tacos! I don't think you could order anything bad from here!
Love the que, just not crazy 'bout all the sides.
Austin, TX 78727

Wasn't a big fan. The turkey was just ok, it was dry. My boyfriend got the chicken and it was far better than the turkey.The lack of sides was disappointing since I love mac n cheese with bbq. I got green beans and butter potatoes. The green beans were too soft and lacked any taste. The potatoes were slightly tough and lacked seasoning besides being smothered in butter. It wasn't bad with a little salt. Overall it was disappointing since my boyfriend and I both love bbq.We prefer going to Poke-E-Jos.
This place never disappointments me, it's some of my fav bbq. The service is always great too! So polite and helpful. I think the quality and price is good.

The breakfast tacos are fantastic! Generously packed and super tasty. We live in a breakfast desert and the tacos from here are a welcomed addition to the hood.I haven't heard great things about the que. I had a brisket sandwich that was OK. I'll need to take time to delve deeper into the menu. I hope it's good. It would be nice to have good que right here in Avery.

We ordered our food in the location and to-go. There's a reason why BBQ shouldn't be made quickly; and this place is the prime example. Corn on the cob- Extremely soggy and under seasoned. It's as if they boiled the corn and left it in the water for hours until someone ordered it. There was not even any salt added to the water. Green beans- Extremely bland. No seasoning added to this either. Certainly canned beans (which I usually don't mind...Hell, I'll eat them straight out of the can for lunch sometimes) but it tasted as if they left them soaking in salt-less water just like the corn. Baked potato- Not terrible. Good amount of flavor, not too mushy. However, seems a handful of shredded cheese was tossed on top of it while it was cold not allowing any cheese to melt making a very weird texture. Frito pie- Some of us liked the chili for the brisket, others not so much due to the burnt top. The Fritos were completely soggy as if it was prepared hours in advance. I mean, how hard is it to put Fritos in a container and put some chili on top of them when ordered? 1/2 chicken- Decent. Pretty moist and a decent amount of seasoning and the BBQ sauce that comes with it is pretty good. A little on the pepper/spicy side... it went well with the chicken. Sausage- Enjoyable for a quick BBQ joint. Not too spicy and moist. Brisket- Pretty mild on the seasoning side could use a little more. Cooked well, decently moist. Creamed corn- Fantastic. Perfect. Exactly what you want cream corn to be.Fried Okra- Nothing special. Seems as if it just came off the Sysco truck.. Texture was what it was supposed to be but we wouldn't go back for it. Tea- Delicious. I would go in just for a glass of iced tea. Not too sweet, but not lacking.

I stopped in here for lunch yesterday. I think it would surprise no one that my apartment locating office is literally right next door, and yet I'd never bothered to stop in until now. Mostly because my barbecue loyalties lie elsewhere, but a brisket sandwich was a craving I just couldn't deny. It's a small space, but very hill country "Texas" in its feel, especially for being located in an unremarkable strip center. The bottles of sauce arranged by the counter disoriented me for a moment, as it reminded me a lot of Rudy's. I had to remember it was Smokey Mo's.I ordered a combo plate for $7.95, which includes your choice of two meats and two sides. I chose brisket and turkey, along with potato salad and fried okra. With a large iced tea, lunch came to around $10. There were two employees, one friendly and the other one a little more abrupt. I'm being polite when I say "'abrupt", as when I received my plate, there was no okra. With no explanation, I inquired as to its whereabouts and he sort of snapped: "It's cooking." Like I'm automatically supposed to know that. Like I said: abrupt.I also had to ask for bread to make my sandwich; they had told me earlier it was included, but they made me ask them again, and it was sort of thrust at me. Well, OK then... The brisket was lean, and was above average tender. As I munched on the sandwich, I saw a sign that instructed customers to specify whether they wanted moist or lean brisket. I had just said "brisket", but no one followed up with "moist or lean?" So, I'm assuming I got lean because it was...well, lean. The turkey was nice as well, and I would have liked to make a sandwich out of it, but the guys working there looked like they were eating lunch and I didn't want to bother them for another two slices of bread. The okra was OK (at least it was fresh and hot), but my favorite was hands down the cool, creamy mustard potato salad. I should have had a double serving of that.I noticed a fridge full of pudding and cake desserts, but skipped it for now. Hey--for what it is, it's not bad. It's affordable, accessible barbecue right in my part of town (and next to my office). Even today I have to admit I'm still a little put off by that one guy, though. Maybe he was hungry, because as I left he was chowing down on what looked like a salad topped with brisket. Even still, I really don't like being made to feel like I'm some sort of "inconvenience" to a business. Especially when I'm a paying customer. Solid barbecue. Service may need improvement. In any event, Smokey Mo's will more than likely see this smoking 'mo again.
Food is decent, customer service from management is better than most.

I go past Smokey Mo's BBQ on my way to HEB so tonight it was time to see what this place was like.  I didn't read any reviews, just walked in to this small, what looks like privately owned BBQ place.   At the back of the store, which happens to be the shortcut to HEB they have a smoker, so I knew that the BBQ was going to be at least made on site.I ordered a turkey plate with fried okra and corn on the cob, it came with their own BBQ sauce.   The turkey had no fat and had a hickory smoked taste :), the fried okra was standard, but the corn on the cob was a little too brown-ish yellow for me to attempt to eat.  The BBQ sauce was oh-so-good, had a little kick to it and was full of flavor.  I'll definitely be picking some of their sauce up again.To compare, Rudy's turkey this definitely had more flavor, just their sides were lacking.   I would probably go back and try something different on the menu.   But its not the best BBQ i have had from a similar local restaurant.

I come here so often (twice a week or so), I don't know how I could not give it 5 stars. The customer service is exceptional, and the barbecue is even better than that. Usually, I can't pick between a brisket sandwich and a turkey sandwich, so I buy both and have one later. That having been said, I can't really speak to their sides (which is what most of the negative reviews seem to be about), because I usually just get a bag of chips.
Always has great meats so flavorful and juicy.  Love the creamed corn and the okra started off the brisket was my favorite but now has to be the pork loin. Good job John keep up the good work.
Austin, TX 78759

Wonderful spot for a Korean food fix. Ate on their nice outdoor patio during lunch on a Friday. Service was perfect, food was very delicious, and we are already planning to come back with friends for the all you can eat Korean BBQ.

SO lovely! Please support this wonderful restaurant! I drove by this morning and made note to try it on my lunch hour. I had a DELICIOUS bulgogi bento box ... and the atmosphere is so nice. They even have a big deck outside that looks like a great venue for dinner. The food is very good, and the service is wonderful. When I was there the place was empty so it felt very safe - but of course I'm sure they do takeout, too. Cheers!
Excellent experience. All of us were pleased with our meals.  The pickup experience was safe and extremely quick.  Can't wait to try their full menu.

Omg amazing. Stop what you're doing and come here now!!!! I had the JeYook BokEum and it was so delicious. Soft and flavorful and such a large serving I am stuffed. I wish I took a picture but I devoured it.

I can't believe I've never come here before! Food is really legit, and I'm quite impressed with the quality as well. I will say that the only thing I noticed that bothered me a bit was that when we walked in, there were many tables that weren't cleared and the hostess had to direct us to a corner of the restaurant that had a clean table. My friend and I ordered LA galbi and soondubu. I loved my galbi, and the caramelized onions at the bottom were delicious. $17 is definitely a bit steep for the amount of food I got, but their marinade, rice, and side dishes were good. I love the mashed potatoes the most and their kimchi the least. I tried my friend's soondubu, but it was just okay. It tasted more like a kimchi stew than seafood tofu. Overall, it's a pretty decent Korean place. Service isn't great, but I can tell their food is legit.

Ok, I hate to be a downer but Jan Chi has either gone downhill or appeals to a different crowd. (They have lunch specials that looked like a good deal). I came here for dinner with a friend on a recommendation and we were both pretty underwhelmed. Pros:- Location. It's a convenient spot for a pretty residential neighborhood.- privacy? Intimacy? It wasn't crowded at all and there is also a pretty lit patio in the back.Cons:Food is mediocre. It wasn't bad, but I'd go almost anywhere else... It reminded me of home cooking.. my own home cooking where I'm just throwing things together that sound palatable and the sum is about equal to its parts. The cheesy spicy chicken was exactly that. The seafood pajeon was alright.

On this day before Veteran's Day, the Colonel Hubby and I headed out after work for some hot pot! Our go to lately has been Basil Thai. We rolled up, and, much to our chagrin, they're closed on Tuesdays. Big bummer! We tossed around some possibilities! Pho? Ramen? Thai? Naturally, I took to the Yelp-verse to peruse the possibilities! Short story long, I ran across Jan Chi Korean Cuisine & BBQ! First, my husband lives for Korean, as I'm sure that I've mentioned ad nauseam in reviews past. Second, it was right down the street in the old Hai Kai location on Spicewood Springs.The reviews were good, so I pulled the proverbial trigger. Can I just say that we were utterly charmed? The redo of the place was just right. Dare I say high end-ish casual? Yes. I dare! Lol! The music was perfect. The menu was gorgeously simple and authentically Korean. The beer list was solid. The wine list was impressive! Trapiche? Yes, please! I was pretty sure, right away, that this was going to be a heavy rotation repeat, and it made my heart smile! Team: Local Restaurants Making It Right Now! I wave the flag! The husband ordered his usual Korean fave, Dolsot Beef Bimbimbap, and I, still thinking Hot Pot/Pho/Ramen, went with the Seoul Bulgogi, since its description was thinly sliced marinated beef in special broth. Chris's bimbimbap was as good as his OG bimbimbap at Fort Hood! He had doubts about my choice of restaurant, at first, with his heart being set on hot pot and all, but, after trying it, he started pointing out other things on the menu that he planned to try next time, so he was obv sold! The little side plates of deliciousness were absolutely gorg! And my Seoul Bulgogi, y'all? Holy snaps! Truly good! The broth is sublime! If your belly needs a warm cuddle on a cold night, THIS is the place, and THIS is the dish! So, to recap, a beautiful establishment, a great vibe with a comfortably Austin-feel, an authentic menu, and a lovely beer/wine selection. Nothing not to like! Keep this place open y'all! Pretty please! Give them business!

Mediocre food. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad, just not great. It's not very traditional Korean food. I wish the portion can be bigger. Not a bad option if u are in the area, but I won't make a trip to try this place. We ordered bulgogi and seafood tofu stew. I expected the bulgogi is a slicked meat instead of ground beef. I expected more seafood favor.
This place is so cute! They have really good service and the food is good. I recommend galbi, seafood pancakes and the japchae. They also have a cute indoor or outdoor area for seating.
Austin, TX 78759

I'm not sure if I was just starving after chilling at the pool for several hours but I wolfed down this grilled chicken with cheese ravenously. It was really good and felt healthy as it was all white meat. I was hoping for dark meat but it's good to be healthy.Tried some of their pork belly, I prefer mine juicier. Theirs was sliced thinly and might have been cooked too long since it felt dry. My friend who ordered it liked it though she was starving and had drunk quite a bit.Their side dishes were wonderful. Kimchi had a sweet flavor. Enjoyed the fish cake. Lovely. Not unlimited portions but I was full anyways after everything.Their bibimbap looked good too, will come back to try.

I rarely leave bad reviews but in this case I was really surprised by our experience here given the strong reviews in the past and am hoping this can get ownership's attention to focus on some of the fundamentals:To start positively, we were a walk-in for lunch and were greeted promptly and were able to get seated outdoors. We were one of two parties in the entire restaurant for lunch. The waitress had a vibe of also being the owner and she was very kind and took our orders almost immediately but for some reason it took more than half an hour for our food to actually come out despite the restaurant being nearly empty.Service aside, the food was also unfortunately extremely bland. We got the Bulgogi bento boxes and the beef tasted barely marinated and the other sides were also relatively low on flavor. We also ordered a side of Korean Pancake and we ended up not finishing it due to the lack of flavor.The outdoor seating is a very nice area but unfortunately also not particularly well-covered which meant leaves were constantly blowing onto our food (every 2 - 3 minutes).Based on all the other reviews, I'm really thinking we came at an off-day (new chef?) but it'll likely be a while before we give it another shot.

Yum!!! Yum!!! Yum!!!Grilled Spicy Pork was probably the best I have ever have. So juicy and flavorful with the just the right amount of spice. I think about it often. Haha.Crispy Mandu was perfect. They were fresh and not overcooked (which I have experienced at other places too many times).KimChi Jeon/Kimichi Pancake - This was a perfect balance between crispy and soft/chewy. My only criticism was that there was quite a bit of oil still left when transferred from the pan to the plate.Pork Belly was a bit dry but still tasty. I would have liked an option to have had it spicy (where it is cooked/grilled with the spicy seasoning/sauce). But it was still delicious.Definitely going again!

I'm always on the search for good, authentic Korean Food. After already trying so many, we decided to give Jan Chi a try. We ordered the Fried Chicken Wings, Bulgogi, and Seafood Tofu Soup. The Seafood Tofu Soup was great, however, everything else was subpar. The Fried Chicken Wings are HUGE. You can choose either 4 or 12 wings (drastic, yes). I recommend if you are interested in these panko crusted chicken wings, go for 4. The Bulgogi was nothing extraordinary.
Really good food! I ordered through yelp and the service was fast. Once i arrived my food was waiting on a table. Portions were huge, I will be coming back

Brand new Korean restaurant in the Spicewood Springs area. They haven't officially opened yet so it was sparsely populated and some dishes weren't available.The gist is they are Korean cuisine & BBQ restaurant, with a few updated dishes. They have a stylish, upbeat ambience and instrumental jazz music playing in the background. I tried the Spicy Pork BBQ box, which comes with fried dumpling, japchae, salad, and rice.  The pork was nicely cooked, very flavorful, and not particularly spicy.I also had Seafood Tofu Soup, which was flavorful with lots of little seafood tidbits, and again not terribly spicy, also lacking the raw egg that you typically are served with soondubu dishes. It was nicely presented with a selection of thoughtful sides.I'll definitely be returning to try the spicy chicken and cheese, and also tacos!
Friendly service and clean restaurant. I had the doenjang jjigae soup and it was really good! I will definitely stop by again.

Delicious food and friendly service! I had the kimchi jjigae and fried chicken wings. Portions were generous and I had left over wings for dinner, double win!I can't wait to come back...next on my list to try is the bulgogi.The restaurant has an awesome deck with lots of seating surrounded by greenery. Thank you, Jan Chi Korean Cuisine.

Please do not order the chicken teriyaki! The teriyaki sauce was runny and too sweet but the Chicken itself!- tough, dry pieces of chicken breast in a sweet, out of the box like sauce. Kid couldn't chew his way through even a few bites.The spicy pork too was on the sweeter side. The banchan was a huge letdown ! Some boiled egg slices, cucumbers,mashed potatoes, kimchi.With atleast a few really good Korean restaurants around, they need to step up and put in more work!
Austin, TX 78759
Delicious! New hole in the wall. Please give this restaurant a try! Had it a couple months back and can only hope I'll go back soon! The meats are high quality and I had a good meal.

This is a wonderful restaurant. It's brand new and beautifully decorated  it has a nice patio on the back which we are looking forward to using this summer. Now about the food. My SO ate here first and had the pork belly, and he said it was delicious. It came with rice, cold mashed potato salad and veggies. Today we went for lunch and both had bento boxes. I had the chicken teriyaki and my SO had bulgogi. It was delicious. And a wonderful value. It came with miso soup also as well as glass noodles with veggies. I highly recommend this restaurant. The service is also very attentive.

What a great institution. The food is quite delicious, very fresh and light tasting. Super authentic as well. My wife's seafood jiggae was flavored just perfectly. We've been to many Korean restaurants in Austin, Dallas, Houston and this is a great addition to the Austin scene. Bonchon are unique and taste homemade, the cucumbers are fantastic. They have a great, lit up outdoor patio if you want to enjoy the green belt views or if you have your dog. The staff really made this place, 10 out of 10. They are beyond attentive. They saw that we were cold, sitting outside, so they brought us out hot water and hot tea, on the house. They offered to bring our dog water. Extremely friendly all around, the hospitality is as good as I've seen anywhere in Austin. Do yourself a favor and check this place out. Won't disappoint.

A solid addition to the few Korean restaurants in the greater Austin area.  All the dishes we ordered were very good.  We had the Galbi, Chicken Wings, and some Korean pancakes that of course came with your traditional sides (kimchee, potatoes, bean sprouts, etc), which were all good.  It's obvious that they're still working some things out, as they just recently opened.  The menu has a lot of favorite Korean dishes in the States.  Some dishes I plan on trying next are their Pork Belly and Tofu Soup.  It would be nice to see some of the not so common dishes show up on the menu in the near future.  All in all, everything about Jan Chi looks promising.  Hopefully, the locals are encouraged to give them a try.  Most will definitely not be disappointed.

A solid addition to the few Korean restaurants in the greater Austin area.  All the dishes we ordered were very good.  We had the Galbi, Chicken Wings, and some Korean pancakes that of course came with your traditional sides (kimchee, potatoes, bean sprouts, etc), which were all good.  It's obvious that they're still working some things out, as they just recently opened.  The menu has a lot of favorite Korean dishes in the States.  Some dishes I plan on trying next are their Pork Belly and Tofu Soup.  It would be nice to see some of the not so common dishes show up on the menu in the near future.  All in all, everything about Jan Chi looks promising.  Hopefully, the locals are encouraged to give them a try.  Most will definitely not be disappointed.

We came here on a Saturday around 1:30pm and there was plenty of seating! Service here is awesome! Everyone's super friendly and very efficient. We ordered the plain fried chicken wings as an appetizer and OMG, one of the best fried chicken we had. The batter is more of a tempura batter. Light, crunch, with a lot of meat still. Came out super hot so clearly could tell it was fresh.I ordered the kimchi soup and my boyfriend ordered the seafood tofu soup. Both were delicious. Came out hot, not to salty, and the broths were amazing. The banchan isn't a lot, but all very good! I would highly recommend if you're in the area and looking for some authentic Korean food :) can't wait to come back already.

Great Korean Place, many... really MANY years ago I used to babysit for a Korean Family, they were both Doctors and with no time to cook, they had a Korean Woman deliver food for them and I was lucky enough to get introduced to this incredible cuisine. Jan Chi is a family business, their food is authentic, fresh and delicious.The  restaurant is very clean and has a very nice patio area. I was walking my dog when I stopped to place a to-go order but they actually invited us to come in, we sat and the patio and they brought water for me and the dog.They are truly kind, honest people serving great food.I hope this review inspires you to stop by for some authentic Korean Food.Support Small Businesses!

My new favorite Korean restaurant.  We came here for lunch based on Yelp reviews and it was fantastic.  My galbi bento box  was perfect.  I loved how tender and flavorful the short ribs were. They are the best I've had in Austin.  The kimchi pancake was great too.  My husband had the fried chicken wing bento box and his only complaint was they were too hot when they came out (personally, I wouldn't complain about freshness).

This spot was great!  Really enjoyed all the baps and bips it had to offer as well as the pancake thingee.  I think I drank about 7 glasses of ice tea there because the tea was incredible.  Can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.
Austin, TX 78759

BEST KOREAN RESTAURANT IN TEXAS. 1. Interior design is aesthetically beautiful.Natural feeling-like, comfortable distance between tables, booth is wooden table and bench, such a beauty!2. Huge inside. This place inside is large, so good for groups as well! 3. Such a fine restaurant to bring somebody you love.I believe that you will give them a good impression. This place is such a wonderful  place to eat such a good food within a good atmosphere.4. Artistically designed dishes and plates!Sparkling clean, sparkling neat. They deliver your meals in a beautiful settings of plates and dishes.5. DELICIOUOSO. Super duper delicious!!! Not strong flavor, but divined and distinctively pure for your body and soul. All side dishes and main dishes, they do not fight to each other but creates a harmony. Wonderful taste. 6. Good pricing! Not very cheap, not very expensive. 7. Their bento box is lunch special, it ends at 2:30 pm. Take this in your mind! All of bento menus are super Goooooooooood-! Definitely.Definitely I WILL RETURN WITH MY ACCOMPANIES!!!Though, I live quite far away, still, I will preferably come here often!!!!* For Spicy cheese chicken menu, Spicy level: mild. Fantastic! Don't be afraid! ** they have this taste of fancy Korean traditional restaurant taste. You can't eat this kind of taste quality anywhere else than here with a good pricing like this!!

Mediocre Korean food.  Service was slow. Inside was so thick with smoke.  I had the bulgogi and it was so plain and the meat was so cheap.  My gf had the bulgogi dolsot and it was about the same.  Would not recommend this to someone that has had real Korean food.

It was quiet and the waitress was a sweet older woman. The Kimchi Jjigae was good enough to eat on a hot summer day. That's a stew. I did not anticipate the heaping plate of wings when I ordered the appetizer. Heads up on that one; it's substantial. I will be returning.

I haven't written a review in years, but had to rave about this place. I'm half Korean and originally from NYC, so have been privileged with the quality and authenticity of the Korean food that was available to me from early on. It's also made me a huge snob when it comes to critiquing Korean eateries. I've spent years in Austin looking for a spot that captures the flavors and presentation of the true, old-school Korean food that I grew up loving. But for the most part, every place I've tried has come up a little short. Until this place. Some places overextend themselves by offering too many options, none of which truly shine. Some places go for fusion (looking at you, Chilantro) and don't taste like the real thing at all. Some places try to repackage traditional Korean fare into sleek new concept restaurants, but lose that down-home quality in the process. But not Jan Chi. The menu is short and sweet. All the classic dishes are there. You'll find doenjang-jjigae, kimchi jjigae, bulgogi, and bibimbap. I ordered the kimchi jeon (a big Korean pancake with kimchi cooked in), and it was delicious. Unlike any kimchi jeon I've had before. The flavor is smooth, not too spicy, just the right amount of kick from the kimchi. Plus it doesn't fall apart when you cut into it. I ordered dolsot bibimbap as my main dish. This is bibimbap served in a steaming stone pot (the Korean equivalent of a sizzling fajita coming to your table), and it's a classic. This one did not disappoint. It came out sizzling hot so that the rice on the bottom keeps cooking, which leaves this delicious caramelized rice when you reach the end of the meal. All the ingredients were pristine and tasty, including the meat and the egg served sunny-side up. And the gochujang (chili paste), instead of coming in the usual plastic bottle, was provided in a little serving dish that proved just the right portion. A+ for presentation. It was the best bibimbap I've had in Austin. My mom's order of bulgogi looked great and earned her approval. All in all I was in heaven throughout this meal. The only drawbacks I can see are minor IMO. I didn't see an option to grill meat at the table, which I don't care for but a lot of people like. Maybe they had some grill tables I didn't see. Their banchan (small dish) options are limited, though they opened recently and explained that they're still experimenting with banchan options. But my oh my, I hope you all discover how great this place is so that it stays open for years to come. The location is a little off the beaten path, but the space is so chill. The service is above and beyond. They even made a banchan dish on request by my mom. Shout out to Samuel, who was one of the nicest and most helpful wait staff I've experienced recently. Shout out to the chef. Y'all made us feel welcome and important without trying too hard. That's a recipe you can't argue with.

I'd been eagerly awaiting the opening of Jan Chi, and finally had the chance to go for the first time last night, and I was not disappointed!  My go to order at any new Korean place I want to try is dolsot bibimbap - when done right, it's out of this world.  Jan Chi did it right - served in a heavy stone bowl, super-heated and sizzling.  It's always hard to wait for the rice to crisp up, so I really appreciated the miso soup and other sides to nibble on while I waited for the rice to get browned and fragrant.  The meal was delicious.  We also got chicken wings - so crunchy and flavorful - a great appetizer to share if you have a group.  The interior of the restaurant was spacious, clean and relaxing, and service was super cheerful and attentive.  When I asked for them to turn down the music a little, they were happy to do so.   Parking lot is large and easy to get in and out of.  Jan Chi is a VERY welcome addition to the Mesa/Steck area, an area which has a dearth of good, reasonably priced restaurants.  Yay for Jan Chi.

I had high hopes for this new korean restaurant but wasnt entirely impressed. i think they have a good variety of korean options but the flavor and authenticity was not there. I ordered the kimchijigae and the kimchi pancake and was not impressed. the soup was not well seasoned and the pancake barely had any kimchi?! the upside is the staff was very nice and the place was very clean. this is a newer restaurant so i hope they can modify their current menu im sure they will get more traction!

Due to location, would really appreciate a kid's  menu. We asked and they steered us towards chicken teriyaki which was 13.95 and our son didn't eat it. They may be steering towards a no kid vibe which is totally understandable too but just a suggestion. Otherwise the food tasted like it was made with quality ingredients and service was good!

My family and I decided to try out this new place. We ended up being disappointed due to the food quality, lack of flavor, and lack of service. We ordered kimchi jigae, pork belly, and a beef soup. Kimchi jigae had no flavors, beef soup was not bad, and pork belly was edible. The sides are not traditional Korean dishes, more of American dishes (tomatoes, egg, mash potatoes, and kimchi) The restaurant looks spacious, and unique. However, food quality was just not to appealing.

My family and I had a wonderful dinner here. The kids enjoyed the chicken teriyaki and fun interesting sides. For myself it was the dolsot bibimbap, so so delicious. It's my go to whenever I eat at a Korean restaurant. It's the perfect combo of rice, veggies, meat (bulgogi), with a fresh egg in a hot stone bowl. The side dishes were great  like the hot sauce which is great for adding heat to the main dish, the kimchi was delicious, my Korean great-grandmother Halmoni would have approved of this place and the kimchi very good.
Austin, TX 78759

I don't leave a yelp review often, but this time, I am. The restaurant greatly impressed me, so it moved my heart to leave my positive experience of Janchi and hope to share it with everybody how grateful this place is.Start with the neatness, this restaurant is new and the owner cares his restaurant, so it is very well maintained. Interiors overall is inspiring and wonderfully succeeded of making audience enjoy of staying.Food tasted high quality. Very well made. No other chemically stashed (nothing taste like MSG added onto dishes). Can feel the chef really cared into the overall balance in entire meal. Each side dish can give supportive taste boundaries with main. No dishes that overcomes others. As a person who also cooks, this is very hard and can relate how this restaurant chef is clever also skillful. This thoughtful design of a meal is hard to be seen in restaurant unless chef truly cares his/her customer.I greatly respect the chef of Jan Chi.Thanks.I give my full love and my passion for you.I highly recommend here for whom wants heartful meal of love and a beauty of what is a real Korean "Han-jung-sik" (Korean high-end quality traditional meal ; usually menus that are designed for a royal/king).

Restaurants don't need to give out straws by default! They're bad for the environment! People can bring their own reusable straws if they are really concerned about their lips touching a cup that came from the same kitchen as the plates and utensils.This food was tasty! Kimchi pancake (jeon) had a good texture thing going on, crunchy and chewy! Bibimbob seemed simpler (fewer ingredients) and more soul food / home cooking style than I've had in more formal-seeming Korean contexts in the past (tomato and hard boiled egg pan chan). Chicken wings verrrrry tasty. Can't wait to go again and try kimchi jigae, soon tofu, and dolsot bibimbob!! Yum!!!!!!

This place has a great atmosphere! Nice people, large booths, and great prices! I got the fried chicken and it was the best thing ever! They were juicy and hot and sooo amazing! 10/10 definitely coming here again!

Wow, finally some good staple korean dishes in Austin, none of that fusion nonsense (this is the real deal!) The marinades on the meat dishes are superb and come out on sizzling hot cast iron pans to keep your food crispy and searingly hot. The soondubu jiggae is also stellar. However, the hidden gem is definitely the seasoned "yang-yum" chicken wings, fried to absolute perfection! A must order item for sure

Wow..what can I say? The food is fantastic and the service outstanding! And the price is great to boot! The bulgogi bento box is my personal favorite but I must confess I haven't strayed far enough throughout the menu to know for sure yet!

The food was okay. The portion was a bit small for the price and the recipe feels a bit different from other traditional Korean restaurants. They also don't carry any Korean beers which is a bit disappointing.
Delicious, first time here. Very nice, peaceful, coffee vibe environment. The food isn't disappointing. I would definitely come back!

We were looking for a Korean place that's open now and this was the only one we found. Great food. The service was great. They kept refilling our side dishes. I just wish there were more vegetable options. But overall I would definitely come back

Missed our trip to Korea and Japan but we were really happy with the cuisine we got to try at this restaurant!  Super friendly owner/server/cooks and the space is spotlessly clean.  Refreshingly different, delicious menu (yummy bulgogi).  We bring friends and they become fans too.  For sure, we'll be back!Nancy R

Good, old fashioned, Quality BBQ. Excellent sausage!Walk in, order, sit down and eat your plate. Good bbq with quick and friendly service! It's a little pricy but considering city of austin property taxes I totally understand.

This is an original southeast Austin biz with good old fashioned BBQ. The breakfast tacos with brisket($4.95): 1 with egg and the 1 with refried beans are delicious Don't forget to ask for the homemade salsa or BBQ sauce. The brisket was moist and flavorful with good bark first thing in the morning--real Texas breakfast taco. My favorite was the brisket and beans because their beans are yummy. During Coronavirus mask is required for everyone's protection and the place is homey, clean and full of nice folks. I'll be back some more tacos soon!!Sorry no photos since I ate them so fast!!

Vic's just ain't what it used to be.Vic's used to be reasonably good BBQ for the price, and a value compared to some of the big boys like Terry Black's.  Not any more.  Vic's prices have gone up, their brisket is at least the same price as Terry Black's maybe more these days, but it isn't nearly as good as Terry Black's or Black's or any of the other "names".  If you like your brisket lean:1) be prepared that they do charge $1 more for lean (not unheard of)2) be prepared for them not to actually give you a lean cut.     When you ask for lean at Vic's, they don't just go cut from the lean side, even if you ask them to.  They will not cut into a new brisket until the completely serve the one they have already cut into.  So, if you ask for lean, and you aren't at the first cuts, what you get is a piece of fatty brisket that they cut the layer of fat off, and with it the bark.  So now, not only is there no bark, but it is still a fatty cut, and the texture is not the same.       Moral of the story, this lean brisket eater will not be ordering brisket at Vic's again.Also the price of their sides has gone up, while the portions of their sides have gone down.  I like their potato salad, but the side portion is laughably small especially for $2.99All that said, I do like their BBQ chicken, and it is one of the only BBQ joints in town where you can get BBQ chicken, so on occasion I will make a trip there for that, but aside from that, considering all I have written, I will go to one of the many other BBQ joints in town and spend my money there, because Vic's has taken themselves out of the competition.

Somedays the brisket is excellent and somedays its just alright. It's tough to rate bbq joints unless something clearly stands out above the rest or just isn't good. The portions to price ratios are fair but consistency is 50/50. I like Vic's BBQ but its hard to love 'em!Order a meat plate or a combo plate. You'll get to try more and better for your buck.Sausage is good, not greasy.BBQ Sandwiches, i don't recommend bc there about the size of something you'd make at home, doesn't resemble something served in a restaurant. There is usually always a line, not a long one but they're usually always busy. Maybe it's the location, maybe it's the quality, maybe it's their local reputation...idk!

We stopped by (another item on our list) about 30 minutes to closing and the place was basically empty. We got 2-meat, sausage and brisket, which came with two sides (we got beans and potato salad), that also comes with two slices of plain bread. The sausage was better than the brisket, which was a bit dry and not super flavorful; they have awards on the ceiling so maybe we just don't know what good bbq is, but we know what we like and this wasn't as good as other places we have been to. We also wanted to try the ribs, so we got 4 - quite expensive! It came out to about $14, which seems excessive. They were good, but nothing special, not great. Even though it's pretty close drive for us we'll probably go somewhere else (like Valentina's) for a bbq fix.

Busy AF. Long line, so I guess people eat lunch later on Saturdays. Parking is scarce. Very friendly staff! Helpful. Warm atmosphere. Food tastes great. Beef brisket is yummy. Excellent sauce. Cole slaw was all right. I ate the brisket with the sauce, onions, and pickles they provided. Excellent!I will be back!
Not much to look at, but you gotta try this! Amazing BBQ...Sides are awesome and it's reasonable.Like it better than the big chains for sure

The best brisket breakfast taco stop. You can not beat this shit at all. I love em. It's the best thing in the world. There good all around. The sweet Tea is to die for. The sandwiches are bomb. The pork chops they have are good. To me you can not beat this place. Please go!!!

Vic's was always that place I drove by, whenever I had business in a somewhat industrial neighborhood, where I wouldn't normally want to stop and eat... But I always told myself I would try Vic's, and now I'm glad I did!The inner debate was between this place or Cafe Creme, after an epic hike at McKinney Falls State Park. I felt that hearty BBQ was more fitting to the outing than fru-fru crepes. I got a combo plate of brisket and chicken, which came with sides, of which I chose potatoe salad and green beans, and then topped the whole thing off with a Mexican coke. It was great food, and no wait! I'm so happy I found great BBQ near where I live. Why wait in line or drive a long distance when you can support the independent next door?

Amazing !!! This was one of those places that I always pass by and I just eventually tried it. I had the Brisket Plate and my boyfriend had the Two Meat plate with brisket and sausage and it was delicious. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. It's just a very cozy place. Definitely will be coming back ! :)

Not horrible def not the best bbq I've had in Austin. The most important part was that the meat was tasty & cooked nicely. The bbq sauce was not good. It didn't have much flavor & was thin & watery. The sides were also not good & seemed to be from a can. I wanted to give this place a chance but I will stick to my known favorites.

I've been coming here for years. A lot of these reviews mentioned overpriced but... it's bbq not McDonald's!! We live in Texas and when you want good bbq you know to expect to pay a decent amount of money for a meal! I've NEVER been let down, it's better than any chain bbq restaurant. The chicken is probably my favorite thing to get here, very flavorful and comes right off the bone!!

My dinner schedule was set in a different time zone and by the time I realized that I was hungry, it was getting close to 8pm.  The hotel concierge recommended Vic's Bar-B- Que since it was near.  I got there five minutes prior to closing.  The staff was ok with me ordering as long as I didn't mind them cleaning up.I got the two meat combo; brisket and ribs.  It comes with two sides; potato salad and beans.  I liked the brisket better than the ribs.  It was flavorful.  The ribs were good but not as tender as I liked.  There was bbq sauce that I could have added, but I didn't.  I feel that good bbq shouldn't need additional seasoning.The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Prices are reasonable compared to others.  Overall this place is worth a visit if you are looking for decent bbq.  I would return.

I stopped in here with my husband for dinner one evening.  It is definitely A-Ok BBQ.  Not the best, but it is good solid BBQ.I am a brisket and sausage girl myself, but my husband raves about their pork steaks here so I decided to get the 3 meat plate so I could have a little of each.  I knew it would likely be too much food, but I could always take the leftovers home.  This is just what I did.
