The sausage was ok, the brisket was good and flavorful, but the pork steaks were great!  I don't recall ever really seeing pork steaks as an option at most BBQ places around here, so I thought it was unusual.  It is so easy to over cook port too, but these were done right.  The smoke ring went almost all the way through the pork steak.  The sides I had with my meat plate were the potato salad and beans, which were both just ok.If you are looking for some decent BBQ down south this is an option.  I would stop in here again.

Great ribs brisket and Chicken sauce was a vinegary Carolina which was out of sight I just dipped all my bread in the side sauce and was content.. it's right off the freeway so it's really easy to get to
Close to work so we went. Another overpriced BBQ restaurant. Sweet tea to sweet noo smokiness to the Q, friendly people though.

The sauce is edible and has a decent taste which is great bc it will take a lot to cover up the bland flavor and dryness of the sub par brisket.I usually don't write reviews about the staff bc even if the staff is rude but the food is delicious, I'll go back , however, not only was the food droll and regular but with that lasting bad taste followed by heartburn, the staff was on that , "I dislike this as much as you will" attitude and there wasn't a half a smile to share between all 4 people. Upon entering, we were greeted quickly by rude lady remarking to us that our feet were dirty and immediately asked us if we were "gonna do something about that mud on your shoes?!"Then, the meat cutter just stared at us until we figured out how the process works. For two hot sides and a 1/4 lb of brisket, sweet tea and two bread slices, I paid 15$ , while my partner ordered a sandwich and tipped a dollar, but the lady refused to give him ice for the water. Unfriendly service for sub par, over priced bbq.
Hole in the wall kind of place. The chopped beef is very good and inexpensive.  There is better brisket in Austin.  More of a "I'm in the neighborhood" convenience type of BBQ.

I tried BBQ brisket for the first time at the Los Angeles county fair a LOOOOOOONG time ago, from some super random BBQ stand and it instantly became my favorite smoke-flavored meat. Since then I've searched for that flavor and texture and nothing has even come close: enter Vic's.Vic's was recommended to us by Joe A. from the Red Roof inn, shout out to him... cool dude with real, honest opinions about Austin's BBQ. I knew I was in for something special from the moment I walked in: a smoky aroma filled the air. I turned to my fiancé with eyes wide open ready to feast. We wanted to try as much as possible so we got two "two-meat" plates, two sides and a big Texas-sized drink: at about $12 a plate ($14 w/ribs) this was a deal.The taste? Unbelievable. I can't even describe the feelings and emotions I felt while eating, EVERYTHING was delicious, even the slaw and potatoes salad both of which I NEVER touch. The corn, slaw, baked beans, and potato salad were off the chain.The star of the show, the "MEATS" were AMAZING. I walked in with expectations molded from foggy memory, Vic's slapped that memory and told it to go home. The brisket, the chicken, the ribs and the sausage were  THE BEST. I feel like Vic's collected all of my favorite smoked foods from my past and put them in one restaurant, I love it and hate that there's no Vic's in Los Angeles. Thank you Vic's, you made me and my fiancé very happy people today.
column21: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

column20: Idk how this place has such high prices for such lame bbq ... theirr briskeT was dry and looked old potato salad is  good tho ... probably get better somewhere else ..

Was in the area and stopped in here one day for lunch and was very impressed! I of course had to try it all - brisket, sausage and chicken. They were all delicious I have to say, but I liked the brisket the most. Got some potato salad and corn, and tried the hush puppies too which were very tasty. Would absolutely recommend !
Thank you for saving they day with your delicious BBQ and excellent service.  Love the hometown feel of this hidden gym

Don't sleep on this place, there's a reason they have been churning out quality smoked meats in the same location for so long. Skip the lines in town and treat yourself to brisket and ribs Vic's way. The sides and desserts are divine but the real star of this show is the meat. You can also get brisket for breakfast in taco form. BRISKET. BREAKFAST. TACOS. Their sweet tea is freshly brewed, too if you're into that kind of thing. There is a tv and it seems like they show whatever sportsball event is happening that day, and everyone was kind and helpful.
Get the brisket, sausage or pork loin..., Not so much and the entire meal is pretty pricey for what you get.

I had the pleasure of visiting Vic' s while on a recent business trip to Austin. I liked it much that I ate there three days in a row. One day I had lunch and dinner there.This place is pretty legit and authentic. It looks a bit rough on the outside, but don't let that deter you. The folks working there were very friendly.I ate the pork ribs, beef brisket sandwich (twice) and the big beef ribs. The beef ribs were my favorite and I think they only have that once a week - Thursdays I think.The sides were good - baked beans, corn, potato salad and the pickles. I loved the pickles. Meals come with a couple slices of plain, sliced white bread and you're ready to go.Please pay them a visit and you won't be disappointed.

The lady that works the register is terrible. The meat cutter just stares at you until you speak. Probably the worst customer service I've ever had. The food is way over priced for the quality. To many other options around to settle for this place.

Nice neighborhood bbq spot.My friend has been coming jere for 5 years and swears they are a goto place.I went in to see a homie lil bbq spot with decent priced items.I had the half chicken plate with. Potatoe salad and coleslaw. And my friend hand a brisket sandwich and a sausage wrap.My potatoe salad was the star today. Mmm!My coleslaw was four day old slaw. Kinda soggy. My half chicken had great flavor. But was on the dry side. Probably just hold it in the warmer too long.I tried a piece of brisket from my friend and it was tasteful and juicy.Even though my experience today was not the best. I. Will say i will come back and give it another try.

Went to Vic's for lunch today with some co-workers. The building feels like it hasn't changed a thing since it opened a few decades back. It had that Texas BBQ charm and character which got me excited to eat. Cafeteria line style. Pop up and put in your meat order and they then ask you to choose between cole slaw and potato salad. I chose the two meat ribs and brisket with slaw. Afterwards you get one additional side, I chose beans. Don't forget to grab BBQ sauce at this point because it's not on the table like I'm used to. Lil Vic was there and he could not have been nicer. Incredibly thankful and courteous to his guests. Every answer I have him was greeted with a "thank you" or "of course sir." He was a pleasure to meet. As for the meat, overall it was a little dry while still having hunks of un-rendered fat. After cutting off the flavorless fat I wasn't left with much meat to eat. The sauce helped rte flavor and moisture levels of the meat a little bit not enough. The sides were simple but tasty. They were also portioned a lot larger than I was expecting. Overall the atmosphere is a bit dated and rustic but that's what you want in a BBQ place. The people were so nice and happy to see you. The sides were a plenty and tasty. The meat, the centerpiece of a BBQ place, fell short. Sad to see.
The brisket is moist and marbled.  sauce is different than other places, less thick more runny.  Sausage needs flavor, salt maybe.  The banana pudding is good.

Stopped in recently for a quick lunch   Would give 1 1/2 stars if Yelp allowed half stars.  BBQ is just average at best, nothing remarkable.  Got the meats by the pound as the sides didn't look so good, looked like they'd been sitting there for a while, so we passed on the sides.  Sauce is portioned out and all you get is one small container, barely enough for your meal.  What kind of que place portions out the sauce?A bit overpriced as well, running in the $16-18/lb range for average to below average meats.Worst part of the experience here is the service, lady behind the counter is unfriendly, rude, and appears not to care.  No smiles, no friendly hellos, no how can we help you, just a robotic automaton.   And lord help you if you attempt to refill your water cup with ice from the ice machine out on the dining room floor, that rude woman stopped me dead in my tracks as I attempted to re-ice my water cup.  Thought I had committed armed robbery the way she yelled, the whole restaurant just stopped and turned around to look at the ice thief.  What kind of place is this?  Definitely won't be back.

Credit card fraud - ordered from Vic's at a street fair. Paid with a credit card. Instead of handing me back the iPad to sign, the employee signed my name and did not print a receipt. Until the transaction posts to my account, I have no idea whether the employee charged me the correct amount, added a tip, etc. I will be reporting this to my credit card company, and would warn anybody else to be aware when paying with a card here to make sure that you finalize your own transaction.
Duke sandwich - all the way! Great value! This sandwich comes with brisket and sausage on a hamburger bun with bbq sauce, onions and pickles. Mmmmm.

When I can't get to Lockhart for bbq Viccs is one of my go-tos. They've got exceptional beef ribs! Only served on Thursdays and Fridays I believe. The pork ribs are yummie too! The brisket tacos are amazing. So simple but delicious. I am not a fan of the potato salad but the corn is definitely buttery goodness! Warning: The sausage is a greasy mess! Ewww! I've been going to Viccs for years and I must say their service has gotten much better thank goodness.

Stopped in this morning for 2 breakfast tacos and $5.25. Personally I'm old school and still believe that breakfast tacos should be $1-$1.50 max per taco so 5.25 seemed a little steep for 2 tacos. I got a brisket taco and a potato egg and cheese and I'll admit they were tasty but for $5.25 the should have been better.

A coworker suggested Vic's for lunch last week, and it was good enough for us to make a second trip there within just a week. It's kind of funny that the main street sign for the restaurant actually advertises that the place has breakfast tacos, not barbecue. The building itself looks pretty old to say the least. Anyways, the place was completely packed during our first visit at around noon. You can tell right away it's a restaurant that gets all of its business from regulars and word of mouth. Memorabilia from local high schools and community groups line the walls, and the interior is just as rustic as the outside. The menu is short and simple, and all of the plates average about $10-$11. I've tried the brisket and sausage plates so far, which come with the choice of coleslaw or potato salad, the choice of green beans, corn, or beans as your second side, and the usual free pairings like white bread, pickles, etc. If there's a line, it should go by pretty quickly. If you've ever been to Rudy's or a similar establishment, you'll know what to expect.Austin has more than enough barbecue joints, many of which are excellent. I would say the brisket and sausage are both just pretty good; that's probably the only compliment I can give the meats here. However, Vic's has a few other things going for it: the history and sense of community you'll immediately notice, an extremely friendly team, and probably the fastest barbecue experience you'll have around here. I've always loved hole in the walls. When you see a full house inside a pretty rundown spot, you immediately know there must be a reason why that's the case. Well, hopefully I'll get the chance to try some of their breakfast tacos one of these days. Otherwise, I'm sure I will be back for more barbecue during lunch as the weeks go by.

Definite under appreciated Austin spot.  Been going here for years, since 2000 or even earlier, and have consistently been good and delicious.  Have yet to get any meat that is not flavorful or moist.  Staff always friendly and welcoming.  Potato salad is consistently delicioys as well.

I did take out from here for lunch. It was a little disappointing. I got it without sauce. Brisket was drier than I like. Sausage was okay. But expensive for just a pound of meat. But that seems to be the norm around Austin.

The BBQ was not good and I'm not hard to please.  There were older folks in there watching TV and I believe they were the owners b/c they got up to help the staff for a minute.  They were rude and unappreciative for my business.  I bought lunch for a crew of people so it was a large ticket and the owner acted like he was doing me a favor by taking my money.
Pretty good BBQ ! Friendly staff. I just need a little more of a kick to the BBQ, otherwise it was pretty dang good.

Sorry folks.  We tried the pork ribs, brisket and sausage and our overall opinion is that Bill Miller's is even better than this.Four hours later, I am still belching and tasting the ribs that seemed like they were baked or roasted in an oven instead of a pit.  The brisket seemed to be prepared the same as the ribs.I wouldn't go back, nor would I recommend to someone else.

One thing I know about barbecue, you never know what you're going to get. What I have found with Vic's is a decent amount of consistency with the food being good. I do believe some of the meat is baked for a certain amount of time as stated in other reviews because the smoke flavor is very faint. I think they have the best bbq sauce in town. The service is just okay and they charge extra for lots of "little things" like refills, etc. but all in all, I like this place.
Good, fast, friendly. No frills or fancy you will enjoy this hole in the wall BBQ joint. I had a chopped brisket and sausage sandwich but I plan to return for some ribs. They looked really good.

Vic's has been CONSISTENTLY fantastic since I have moved to Austin in 2001.WHY?It's damn good bar-b-que that 1) doesn't break the bank, 2) YOU WON'T HAVE TO WAIT IN EXTREMELY LONG LINES TO HAVE SOME BBQ (ahhhem, Franklins), 3) has plenty of parking, and lastly but most importantly this place WILL NOT RUN OUT OF BBQ no matter how long you have been waiting to taste some local meat(s).A modest $8.99 for a 2-meat plate (ask for fat if you want fat on your brisket! They will be more than happy to leave some on for you) with 2 slices of bread and delicious homemade potato salad (or pinto beans that have a kick to it) - your choice.The sweet tea is excellent, as my boyfriend claims, and didn't need extra sugar at all. Refills are free on tea and water of course. There is even a pot of coffee brewing all day for free (no cost).I will go back to try the burgers one day and maybe the tacos too. I noticed they have breakfast plates as well that I have yet to try on the cheap.LONG LIVE VIC's BBQ! God knows I love my BBQ waaaaaay too much to have to stand and wait HOURS for it on the "east side". Ain't nobody got time for that. I do, however, have time and extra money to have some of that sweet and delicious bread pudding that sits on the ice as you check out.
Good old fashioned Texas BBQ. Great place. Great staff. Sweeeeeeet tea is definitely sweeeeeeet. Parking is not the best, but way better than downtown.

I have only tried the brisket once on a taco and it was very good. For breakfast tacos they're a hidden gem, fast, consistently delicious and cheap. I give a call on the way to work and run in. Friendly folks too

Beef ribs that are as good as Salt Lick 3 for 10 dollars on Fridays... Hell yeah I want some... Hell yeah I'll ride my scooter there in a flash flood to get them! Cant say enough about how yummy the food is over here its award caliber BBQ.. just in the middle of nowhere!

Vic's has a horrible location, limited parking and somehow manages to make some of the best BBQ in town. I didn't care of the sauce here but the meat is divine. I've gone here many times and all  the meet tastes like it has been magically infused with smoke flavor. The flavor profile of the meat here is amazing, short of driving out to Lockhart this is some of the best BBQ I've had in town. I cant help but think they have to stay up all night making this BBQ. It would be a 5 star BBQ joint except sometimes they have problems with the moistness of their brisket. Its hit or miss as far as the brisket here goes, you always get good smoke flavor but the moistness is inconsistent. I'd say if you live or work anywhere near Vic's and haven't been your missing out. I'd also say it wouldnt be a bad thing if you want BBQ to skip out on places like Rudy's and come here.They also do Breakfast at Vic's but I havent tried it.

Nothing fancy here and that's the way I like it for a quick lunch. Helpful staff. Ordered a brisket sandwich and since the sausage wrap was 2.99 I figured to add that too. Sweet tea to complete the meal. Sausage tasted good and brisket did too.However, here's the strange thing. Both the sandwich and 'wrap' were served on white bread. (See pictures)All in all a good quick lunch and really reasonable prices. I would probably return for a quick lunch again. (In fact I will before heading to the airport)Easy to get to and ready to park.

Vic's bbq is officially off my a  list. The sausage was drenched in grease; this is due to baking it in the oven. The brisket was also oven cooked. The potato salad was good and the green beans was the best part of my meal. I can't see places get away with calling themselves  a "bbq " place when they do not actually bbq the meat. Something told me to avoid this place today; i should have listened to that voice.

I always judge a bbq spot by its sausage. They have some good sausage; better than most. The brisket is nice as well.  Never been for lunch but ever time i picked up some que the place was not to busy.
Austin, TX 78758

So freaking good. The ordering is chipotle style but with about 20 more options. The build your own bowl has been my go to - the ribeye, kimchi, noodles, magic sauce , it's all so damn good!!! The bowl comes out to usually around $11 (ribeye is $1 extra) , which is incredibly well priced for the amount of food you get.I can't Speak to the atmosphere inside we always pick up and leave, but the food is 10/10!

I did a quick curbside pickup here recently, since it's right by the domain! Chilantro has expanded all around Austin, so everyone's got easy access to some great Korean inspired eats. It was super easy to order online, as they use a common and informative platform. The menu with item description and options for swaps/add-ons are all easy to manage on their site.I craved some street fries, and since Chilantro is the OG of Korean street fries I knew they were the spot to go to. I got the original with spicy pork and swapped the sriracha for ranch. They accommodated to my covid concerns and contactlessly put my order in my car trunk. After a ride home, my fries were still intact and the magic sauce still poppin like a nostalgicly remembered. Some crunchy fries and some slightly soggy from the kimchi and pork juice, which is perfect for me!

Love Chi'lantro. We're addicted to their wings, first of all. They are super good, and if you ask them to leave them in a little longer to get extra crispy, freakin' amazing. Second from there it's a straight tie between the noodle bowl with ribeye beef or kimchi fries, also with the ribeye beef. Seriously, super super good. Also, I just gotta say that, with covid and everything, I really appreciate their whole to-go setup. It's ridiculously convenient. These folks are doing it right. Also, shoutout to the folks at the domain location. They're really great. Love this place. Try those wings!!!

Chi'Lantro is a great Korean-Mexican fusion restaurant with multiple locations in Austin (and the owner made a deal on Shark Tank). Think Chipotle with the process of choosing the items, protein, etc. but with better flavors. The magic sauce, a spicy mayo, goes really well with the spicy pork. They are known for their kimchi fries which you need to try if you haven't had them. Such a great lunch, thanks Chi'Lantro!!

I am a regular here but i think my opinion still has some weight. Chi Lantro is my favorite place in Austin. The meat is great, the service is always 10/10, and most importantly the food is out of this world! I highly recommend you to try Korean bbq and especially Chi Lantro. I get the original kimchi fries with spicy pork, no kimchi and extra magic sauce.

I had a great first experience at Chi'Lantro! I have been wanting to try this place since moving to Texas and it is definitely worth the hype. I was pleasantly surprised at how soft and tender the chicken was. I went with the noodles and got most of the toppings. The magic sauce is truly magical. I also tried the sesame vinaigrette on the side, this is a little more potent with a strong vinegar taste. The kim chi added a perfect tasty crunch to the bowl. I will have to return for their well-known kim chi fries.

A Korean spin, but not like anything I've ever had. One side has seasoned ribeye over French fries top with queso and a touch of cilantro. One side has a glazed chicken and one corner kimchee.It's really good!!  Looks a bit odd, but I really like it and frankly I didn't know what to order.The staff was really helpful!They have other items I'd like to try!

The Korean chipotle. That's how I would describe it to a friend. As someone who does not eat Korean food super often, it's a great way to get a variety of flavors in one bowl. Their kimchi is great and so are the sauces. The price point is great too for a fast casual place. I ordered through DoorDash and picked up, and it was fast, packaged well, and order was accurate.

This is for the food truck catering order. So the way it works is you order ahead and they just drive the truck to a set spot and you pick it up. The food was nearly cold by the time I got it. It is neat they are doing these things for neighborhoods, and I get it can be tough to cook on the spot, but this just wasn't the same Chi`Lantro I know. It had the taste and was ok once microwaved, but in the future I will probably just DoorDash my food.
Austin, TX 78758

I don't know why there are so many great review but my recent 2 orders from here have been bad. Tonight I've my dinner there - Korean BBQ beef plus an egg, and they're extreme burnt and I can't eat them. Ended up throwing the whole thing away.

This is one of my absolute favorite places to go in Austin. I haven't been in a while and I'm finishing this review retroactively, but in case this is still true, go to this brick-and-mortar location over the food truck if you can because the marinated tofu they serve here is TO DIE FOR. I've made a lot of people try it and they can attest to this. Best tofu I've ever had. I'll be trying to recreate the recipe for the rest of my life, so honestly if you guys could just shoot me a list of all your secrets now that would be great. Also, would recommend just getting rice or noodles as your base over the fries. I know that's the thing they're known for, but just my personal preference. Can't wait to visit again.

There's something for everyone!Chilantro started off as a food truck in Austin before it expanded to restaurants. The food here is mainly Korean food - but you have the liberty to make it as you like. I'm a vegetarian and love her ng their kimchi bowl or the bowl with fries as the base.Food - I'm a fan of their bowl with fries as base. The fry the fries fresh right in front of you so could ask them to crisp them a bit more. Load up the fries, veggies and yummy Magic sauce along with some spicy sauce and you're good to go. They have great teas too - I've tried their varieties and it's refreshing compliment to the food.Service - They are quick and friendly. If you keep going to same location, chances are they'll even  recognize you.  The restaurant is clean and not that noisy. Right off of burner and near the Domain, try this spot when you are in the mood for healthy but still spicy lovely food. Recommended!!

A fun Korean-fusion spot located right next to the coffee shop Summer Moon. We stopped in for some kimchi fries to share for an afternoon snack -- I remember seeing the Shark Tank episode so was curious to try it out for myself!The food was really yummy -- if it hadn't been the afternoon, I definitely would've tried some of the build-your-own options but the fries were super tasty. There were lots of different flavors from the tofu, fries, sauce and more and it wasn't too spicy either (since sometimes kimchi can be). It's easy to dig in with a fork!There is plenty of seating in a super modern, and clean space -- would love to go back for a bowl.

I love chilantro!! i've been to a few of the locations and have had a great experience at the ones i went.  Food is delicious and can stop by every week if i let myself! I usually get the rice bowl with the marinated tofu and i can't get enough of it!! The queso and chips is another one of my favorites from there.

Ordered the Signature Tofu Salad (spinach) with a side of black beans. The salad was exactly as described, with lots of flavorful tofu. The beans were perfectly cooked and delicious, with a lovely garnish. Not a speck of styrofoam, and the salad didn't even need the carrot ginger dressing. Had there been a little more spinach in my salad, 5 happy stars for sure.

Came here because of all the amazing reviews I've been reading on Yelp. Sadly, I didn't get the same experience as everyone else.I had the rib eye tacos, Korean fries, wings, and a customized bowl with spicy chicken.The rib eye was SUPER salty. It was extremely overpowering that my eye was twitching when I bite into the taco. All I ate was the corn and grilled Kim chi that was on the taco because I came hungry expecting to eat something amazingThe fries were cooked perfectly but the topping was alright. It had rib eye on top of it so I didn't enjoy it.The rice bowl mediocre. When I think Korean food, I think of rice in a super hot bowl and the rice here was cold rice so the experience was too relatable to a chipotle bowl but cost more.The wings was the better part of the meal. You can find better Korean fried chicken else where but of all that we ordered, this is at least edible.Gave it a two star because it was wasn't a horrible experience, just not a place I would go back to but at least I can say I experience it.

Let me start by saying that I have now been to this location five times in the last two weeks, and I'd probably go more if I didnt have that voice in my head reminding me that I have groceries at home that need to be eaten. This place is delicious! A fun and unique take on a quick, healthy meal at a great price.I have lived a few miles away from this location for almost two years and am so sad that I am only recently discovering the magic. To be honest, I came once when I first moved here and felt overwhelmed. The place was packed and the concept was new to me. I felt rushed by the impatient folks in line behind me, and wasn't able to ask as many questions as I would have liked, nor did I ask to sample anything. Therefore, even though my food was good, I didn't go back.Almost 17 months later I tried again, and boy, am I glad I did!!! When I finally came back in, there was no line. I asked loads of questions and the staff was helpful and friendly. I built a delicious, nutritious, and filling meal with a special blend of flavors unlike anything else. The best part is that my meal was less than $5!My current favorite is a bowl with half rice, half salad, the Korean beef, grilled kimchi, all the veggies, and a fried egg on top. I cap it with the carrot ginger sauce that I could straight drink. That stuff is finger licking good. Give this place a try (or two) and you'll be hooked like me!

Have been eating Chi'Lantro for 7 or 8 years now, it used to be the absolute king of my quick go-to list. Previously I've rated it 5/5 on other platforms. I hate to be negative because I have so much love for the place, but the food isn't what it used to be. Not sure what changed, but in the last 2-3 years the consistency has declined greatly. Haven't had a 5/5 meal here in a while unfortunately. My go to has always been a ribeye burrito and queso, and while the quesos pretty much the same it seems like I regularly am noticing a poor showing/serving from one or more of the ingredients inside my burrito. The weak ingredients that prompted this review were the tough/chewy rice and sparse beef. The rice didn't taste good and the toughness made the burrito a chewing match. Felt the beef was way lacking quantity wise, I've had this so many times I had certain expectations but I'll freely admit that complaint is more subjective and less of an issue than the rice. My thinking is that I just got a batch that had been sitting a while, but I ordered at 8:30PM rather than right before close. Hopefully tonight was a Covid related issue somehow and not a snowballing of previous concerns I had Will absolutely continue to give them chances and hope to change this review, but my confidence is shaken
Austin, TX 78758

Think asian fusion but Chipotle style and you get the concept of Chi'Lantro. Build your own bowl, pick your protein, toppings, sauce - freedom to customize.You can't, of course, forget their famous Kimchi Fries where you also get to pick your choice of protein. I got the spicy pork and the pork was superb, flavor is spot on for the marinade! My only feedback is I would prefer the fries to be more crunchy rather than mushy and limp. Overall, great place to get a healthy meal since you can pretty much build to your diet. Interior is fairly spacious but it was hot inside when we dined in - Texas is already scorching, we need that AC any time we can get.

I love this place and always have! I work nearby and everything on their menu is good from their kimchi fries to their wings to their noodle and rice bowls. I like that this location has their bowls chipotle-style instead of like other locations that have pre-set bowls. The staff is always really friendly and efficient. Their queso is DELICIOUS. My favorite!! You may think, well this isn't a queso place or a wing place or a fries place, and it's true they may not have a lot of options in THOSE areas, but EVERYTHING they do, they do DELICIOUSLY. And they have tons of (healthy) toppings if you go for the bowls.

(THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE CURBSIDE SERVICE ONLY). Called ahead of time, was told there is a 30 minutes wait on the food. Waited 30 minutes and called them when I got there, was told they will bring it out in a minute. Waited another 15 minute or so, no one came out so I had to go in. Found out the food has been sitting on the table for pick up...not sure what happened there

I love the food and literally could eat here every day, but ... beware if you ordeR Online. This is twice I have received the wrong food . It's like they don't read the instructions !!!! Seriously. We paid extRa for queso and did not get any on the fries. No sauce on the rice bowl. $18 plus for a meal we didn't order. :(  VERY DISAPPOINTED!

This is my number one come to place when I am in the area. And since my doctor is over here, my after appointment treat. My favorite item off the menu is the Kimchee fries! Minus Onions and sriracha. With they're delicious tofu, this meal is heaven for me. I grab a coffee from next door and my meal is complete!

This place has totally changed!!!Last week wanted to eat kimchi, as it was long day, my husband wanted to go to this location as it's close by but I didn't want to, so he told we l just go inside n if we see same people/Person behind the counter, we l go to other burnet location. but to my surprise almost all were new faces so we thought of giving a try and made a right decision.People now are all good, they listen to you, greet you and food was amazing, I don't know the name but there is one big fella who was pleasant, smiling, welcoming and felt like he was loving to do his job.We were so satisfied with food and service we went again yesterday night.Keep up the good work guys!!!

Go to some other location, if I could, I would have given negative star!!!We usually go to 5222 Burnet Road Ste 525, but decided to try in this location, this place totally sucks, whoever manager or person charge of this place do fix it. Both food and service totally sucks, I ordered kimchi fries and my husband rice bowl, the lady who took our order was all over the place and trying to do 2people work( it was totally unnecessary as there were 3other people, other than a guy in front of the counter), there were hardly 5-6 people in the restaurant.she was like pissed at work or something, she put rice beans chicken kimchi in a bowl n left it, then she did same thing with mine and left it, waiting for the fries for other takeout order, my husband got irritated so he was like, 'our food is getting cold, can you finish ours', she replied 'I m doing sir( actually she was waiting or the fries), along with ours she started two other fries, got all four to salad section and finished all four together, ours was so cold and cheese was like taking and eating out of the packet, and the the sauce was like splashed and all over the box(guess she dint like my husband asked her to finish our order), I took a food from her and said thankyou and she made a irritating face, I really dint get itand she dint asked us to go or here, so she assumed herself and gave Togo, but we were there for dine in.So never going back to this location.
Amazing noodle bowl- can fill up with any toppings you'd like. Just be careful with the sauces- magic sauce is more of a burger sauce than for noodles.

It's been a hot minute since I have been to Chi'Lantro so this has changed a bit from the last time I have been here. It is more of chipotle style restaurant now where you go order your bowl/burrito/etc and customize to your choice. When I came a few years ago it was an actual menu (weird)I got a bowl with the spicy chicken and all the sides etc. I got some spicy ranch and their magic sauce (or whatever they call it). Delicious, flavorful, the second batch of kim chi was better than the first so a fan there.Overall really good, kinda tripped me out that the menu changed but I also get why it made the process really quick and easy. The food was good that is the most important piece.Next time I will go get my classic Kim Chi Fries.
Austin, TX 78758

We ordered togo and I was so surprised by how good this was! The tofu is perfectly cooked, and the secret sauce is delicious. My only complaint is that I wish there was more of it in the burrito. I thought maybe the mix of all of these ingredients wouldn't work well but I was wrong, it's amazing! I can't wait to take visitors when they come to town!

Great fusion of Korean and Mexican food. They have many option from super carnivore's to vegetarian. It's fast and delicious. If you're looking for something different and deliciously unexpected give Chi'Lantro a try!Pro tip: ask for a fried egg on top of what you order!

I am obsessed with Chi'lantro and it's entire menu. Often I go for their bowls and pack it with most of their toppings and that.. is a hefty delicious meal. Everything tastes super fresh and clean. The marinated tofu is to die for and definitely my go to. After being introduced to it I get it probably once a week. Fresh, innovative and delicious!

Omg! The burrito here is AMAZING! I was able to stuff it with all the fixings. I had the beef, caramelized kimchi, two types of corn, the awesome magic sauce and some other veggies. It was so stuffed that the poor kid broke the tortilla and had to make me another one. Awesome job Chi'lantro. I will definitely be back.
We had lunch here today. We spent $6.50 for a tiny queso and it was not very good. Overpriced and m'eh food. Would not recommend.

KIMCHI FRIES ARE A MUST. I wanted to savor the deliciousness and hefty portion of the fries, so I got a kid-sized noodle bowl to go with it. Couldn't eat just fries for a meal! Even though I ordered a kid portion, they still topped it with a good amount of carrots, cabbage, and lettuce. The fresh veggies helped to balance out the heat of the fries.

I was in town and I saw that this was near me and went to try it out! It's chipotle styled, you choose your base, protein, and add-ins. The process is very smooth, and I like that you can customize your own bow. I've never seen that for Korean fusion food before. The price was fair and the service was fast.I got bulgogi and spicy chicken (50/50) and I have to say, both were well seasoned and not dry at all! The bowl was really big so I didn't finish it, but it's a good portion for the size. Probably will stop by next time I'm in Austin!

I'm obsessed with chi'lantro. They make it so easy to order whether through their app or DoorDash or Uber. I'm slightly embarrassed to say I have ordered from them at least once a week since the pandemic started. I also recommend everyone I can to them. I think I'll order chi'lantro for lunch today! Just writing this reviewing made my mouth water.

I'm a vegetarian so I always get the rice bowl with black beans and avocado. The chips are good but they ruin the guacamole with too many onions. We usually arrive around 11:30 and never have to wait.
Austin, TX 78758

Hands down the best Chipotle themed restaurant! Their sweet potato noodles are amazing and the only noodles I want to have going forward! Their steak and spicy chicken are extremely flavorful and I added their carrot ginger sauce and my bowl was bursting with flavor! If you're near the Domain, eat here and not in the crowded shopping area.

I love the customizable this place is! My go to items are the noodle or rice bowl with spicy chicken or soy glazed chicken. The employees are super nice and let you sample anything before you put it into your bowl. The Magic sauce and the noodles are the items that keep me coming back! Also all these pictures are from different times I've gone over the year haha.
The kimchi fries are xlnt!! I also enjoyed their salads. Delicious food and great service!

Yaaayy! We finally made it to Chi'Lantro! After 2 years of bookmarking it on Yelp. We finally made it. Luckily my father in law works in Austin so we made the drive from Killeen to pick him up after work. My mother in law wanted to check out Burnet Road in Austin.. guess what's on Burnet Road? CHI'LANTRO!What is Chi'Lantro you ask? It's like a korean/asian fusion Chipotle! You can make your own bowl, choose your starch/protein, veggies/etc. or you can make your own basket of loaded fries! My family were being all healthy so they got different types of rice bowls. One bowl consisted of brown rice, soy glazed chicken, Kimchee and lettuce. One bowl had beef & soy glazed chicken, brown rice and avocado. Last bowl had soy glazed chicken, white rice, lettuce and beans. I had to be the only person that got their #1 seller Chi'Lantro loaded Kimchee fries with soy glazed chicken and all the toppings! (Kimchee, onion, cilantro, sriracha, cheese and more) not gonna lie- my fries were preeeeetty spicy!Everything was good. Including their fountain drinks. My favorite has to be the cream soda! My husband tried their hibiscus drink as well as their pineapple soda. They were all pretty good. Downfall of our experience was that my Father in law chose beef as his protein, and he said it was super oily and waaay too overcooked. Tasted like it's been sitting around. The meat was extremely crumbly. We felt bad so we gave him some of our soy glazed chicken. The chicken was really good! Super flavorful and juicy. Not dry at all. If you guys ever make it your way to Austin, you have to try this place. My suggestion is, get the sriracha on the side. TRUST ME. It was a lot to handle lol

Chi'Lantro is like a Korean Chipotle fast-casual restaurant done well! They have rice and noodle bowl options. Their noodles are clear, vermicelli noodles used in Korean dishes like japchae. Their chicken and meats are cooked well (not overdone and seasoned right). I really liked their kimchi fries! I'd recommend those, you'll be a happy camper.

Noodle bowl with spicy chicken and beef. First time today. Here in Austin for work. Enjoyed it. Was able to try an Asian style chipotle!! If go during lunch, go a little early. Small restaurant but very good!

Super delicious tacos and burritos with an Asian twist. Really love this place. Big portions, decent prize, very friendly and fast service. Nice modern look inside too. Tasty lemonades as well. Highly recommended.

Chi'Lantro is like the Korean/Mexican fusion version of Chipotle! The concept is basically the same - Fast, easy and customizable!You come in and choose your:1) Base (Rice bowl, noodle bowl, salad, tacos, burrito or french fries)2) Protein (Ribeye beef, spicy chicken, soy glazed chicken, marinated tofu, or spicy pork)3) Veggies (Lettuce mix, homemade Kimchi, spinach, red cabbage, cilantro, carrots, cucumbers, onions)4) Toppings (Avocado, guacamole, queso, cage free fried egg, cheese, tortilla strips, sesame seeds)5) Sauce (Salsa roja, magic sauce, Kimchi sauce, Sriracha, spicy ranch, carrot ginger, or sesame vinaigrette)So fun and delicious! And best of all, it's next to Summer Moon Coffee!

Used Uber Eats to try this restaurant. Got the burrito but upgraded my meat to the rib eye. Wow!  Better than I expected. The portion size is huge for the cost. Very thing so very fresh and tasty!  Glad I found this gem!
Austin, TX 78736

This breakfast spot hit the spot. COVID requirements in placed and being followed. The food is authentic and taste great. The service was fast and friendly and enjoyable.  I also enjoyed the banana bread but the coffee is extremely average.

This review applies solely to the sliced, moist brisket taco. Served only after 10 am, it may be the best $4 you'll spend this or any other week. Generously packed into a flour tortilla, this brisket doesn't need much, but be sure to ask for pico de gallo and red sauce to round out the flavor profile.You'd better just go ahead and order two, because if some is good, more is better.

First time visit and we had high hopes for this place. Service was prompt and prices are reasonable but the taste not so good. My husband enjoyed his 2 meat combo while my sisters were not impressed with their plates.I ordered the lean brisket with a side of homemade potato salad. The brisket was shockingly bland and the potato salad was a bit tangy/sour for my liking. I am guessing this spot is probably best for breakfast. I don't plan on eating here again.
Everything was fresh tasting, lots of flavor, and hearty portions with a great variety. :) would ABSOLUTELY have to return
I love their brisket stuffed baked potato so much. Every time I go I want to try something else but I don't.

Whenever I walk into a barbecue restaurant, i take a huge deep breath to soak in the barbecue smell.  There was only a slight smell when we walked into here. But we decided to eat here anyways. We ordered the family special they included 2 pounds of meat and four sides. The sides were fried okra, cream corn, green beans, and mac & cheese. The okra tasted good not great,  the other three sides were average at best, there was no special flavor.  For the meats we ordered brisket, turkey, and jalapeño cheese sausage. The sausage had adequate flavor but definitely needed more jalapeño. Turkey was not smoked, definitely from the oven. It could've used more space and flavor. The brisket was tender but lacked smoke flavor. It was overall bland.  Barbecue sauce was pretty good at least to compensate for the lack of flavor in the meat. Not sure that I will be going back.
Ate here for the first time with a friend recently. I'm a big BBQ fan and i really enjoyed this place. I'll be back.

I liked the roasted chicken a lot. We tried brisket, ribs, turkey and sausage as well. The chicken was the best, hands down. Super moist, great flavor, perfectly cooked. Everything else was on par with Austin BBQ. Minus a star for having nasty, ketchupy BBQ sauce.

One star because the food is okay, but the service is beyond awful. The woman taking orders was so incredibly rude and she was coughing and sniffling the whole time. I was somewhat worried about this, but she had a mask on while taking the order. Then she closed the window and took the mask off. She was right by all of the food with no mask and had just been coughing. I live with at-risk family members and was horrified by this. Absolutely disgusting and I will not be coming back.
Austin, TX 78736

Was contemplating a 4 or 5 until I got to the main course. Beef rib.  It was huge! Looked good. But was pure FAT!  Ugh.  8 dollar slab of FAT!  Ok. Bad news over.  Cheap thing on the menu; chopped beef; worth every penny and then some!  If you're getting ribs or want pork; get the pork ribs. They are so flavorful and meaty.  Pulled pork was a little less so, but just add BBQ sauce. Enjoyed coleslaw today. other sides are good.  I used to get the breakfast tacos here, and recommend that too!

We happened to be on this side of town and stopped in. I ordered the brisket omelette with cheese and jalapeño. On top I added Pico de Gallo, sour cream, and hot sauce. On the side I had smoked ham. It was tasty too. I love when I can get breakfast or tacos at a bbq joint. I would get this again. Hubby had 3 meat plate. Brisket, Ham, & Turkey. His sides were potato salad & green beans. He liked the brisket but neither of us liked the turkey. Way too smoky. We compare all bbq to Cooper's and this wasn't bad but definitely not Cooper's. I thought the spicy green beans were really yummy!If we are back in the area we would stop in again. Food came out very quickly and the bathroom was clean. For sure worth a try!

We go get take out three or four times a month. We enjoy the food. So tonight my husband went to get dinner of brisket and potato salad. When he got home we noticed what we thought was potato salad was a bowl of tarter sauce. So he drove back to let them know what happened. They laughed and made it out as no big deal. My husband said for his troubles would the give him a second potato salad. They really didn't want to do it. They said ok and gave him the very small one and seemed to be put out. Not good customer service. Ps. There potato salad is very good.  I believe you make the customer happy within reason Well we tried it again. My baked potato was brown on the inside and dried out I asked for moist brisket and it was very dry. I really think I will go somewhere else next time.

We go get take out three or four times a month. We enjoy the food. So tonight my husband went to get dinner of brisket and potato salad. When he got home we noticed what we thought was potato salad was a bowl of tarter sauce. So he drove back to let them know what happened. They laughed and made it out as no big deal. My husband said for his troubles would the give him a second potato salad. They really didn't want to do it. They said ok and gave him the very small one and seemed to be put out. Not good customer service. Ps. There potato salad is very good.  I believe you make the customer happy within reason.

I love the breakfast all day menu. They have traditional breakfast foods and a wonderful assortment of Mexican breakfast foods and tacos including barbacoa, carne guisada, and tons more. In addition to the wonderful BBQ menu, they have hamburgers which are gigantic and delicious. Service is always friendly. I have gone here for years, and it gets better each year to where now I visit weekly.

I love the BBQ, this is a favorite of my extended family. We've purchased from them for years. I was deeply concerned when I picked up an order this past weekend for my brother who has cancer when the order taker and order deliverer were not wearing masks. I saw another worker depart from a back door and assume she had finished her shift. I praise her for wearing a mask. Come on business owners keep us safe and we will help to keep your business going! I'm choosing who I do business with based on how I see you keeping people safe!

If you find yourself in Austin stop into this place. Me and my wife stopped in for breakfast. She got a Austin Burrito and I got the Cowboy Burrito.  Both are amazing and huge!!!My wife likes huge burritos..... Both options give you the choice of meats, bacon chorizo, sausage, ham, brisket, fajitas, barbacoa or chicken. I got the Brisket and it is crazy good. And let me repeat myself these burritos are huge.At first I thought this place was pricey. I am here you tell you you get what you pay for. Don't miss out on the homemade sauce and salsa. Give it a try, I gave it 5 stars. We will be coming back for dinner.

Excellent BBQ!!  Meat very tender, infused with delicious sauce/sauce.  The extras were perfect!  Delivered on time, and hot via UberEats.  Good prices, delivered hot.  Perfect for when you have a serious BBQ craving

Love this spot! Their breakfast tacos are delicious, I always go for the sausage, egg and cheese but the bacon is good too! I am also a huge baked potato fan and they make a great one with brisket on top!
Austin, TX 78736

Love coming here for their bbq. They have amazing food and a great price! The tacos in the morning are sooooo good!! That's mostly what I get. Brisket taco, bean and cheese or a bacon and egg. For lunch it's usually a brisket sammy! There's so many bbq places around but Donn's beats the quality vs price points every time. Fresh and the people are nice too!
The people answering the phone are RUDE and Unprofessional.  They are complete imbeciles there, my orders have never once been fully correct.  The food is good, but the service is awful.

Big fan of this little hole in the wall. Service is good, food arrives quickly and it's delicious. We've only eaten here at breakfast- love all the breakfast tacos. Brisket and egg or brisket potato are my favorites. We need to go back for lunch sometime because the menu looks tasty. This is not a place for a romantic date... no ambiance. You up for the food and service.

Right tasty BBQ, served quick and with a smile.  The brisket (fatty, not lean) and turkey are standouts.  The slaw is tasty and fresh.  The fries are wonderful.  I'd skip the bbq beans and go borracho.

We used to eat there all the time. Went back today to get barbacoa and charro beans. Ot has been nearly a year now and I remember why. The place has gone way downhill since the new ownership. More commercial. Super fatty (Brain material)barbacoa. I mean ground tiny too so its hard to pick through. 2 lbs I won't eat. Charro beans are bland bland bland.  Boiled pinto beans is all they are. I wasn't happy with the barbq last time either. Either dry or full of fat to trim. Bland too. Like the care is gone. Good things never last forever.  I don't think we'll ever return. Too many better places nearby.

This was a really nice surprise!  Great place, my only complaint was that it was kind of messy in the restaurant. Perhaps we came in after a rush, but the floors were really bad. And to make matters worse, it looked as if someone tried to clean the floor by using a strong-smelling cleanser - (such as Pine-Sol) and the smell permeated the place. You can't taste your food when that happens. But- all that aside, once i got to the car, the realization of how great the food is really hit us. If you get the chance, go to Donns!

Donn's isn't just "another BBQ place!" They have a greatly expanded menu with breakfast available all day. Breakfast plates include all the favorites ranging from migas in all their varieties, to egg and bacon/sausage platters, biscuits and peppered gravy, pancakes and waffles, to breakfast sandwiches. Of course they do the regular BBQ meats, but also offer hamburgers, chicken fried steak, a catfish plate, and fajitas with that awesome aroma that makes you wish you had ordered that when a sizzling plate passes by! Condiments and drink refills are on a counter across the dining room from the order/dessert counter, and tables are nicely arranged for comfortable, roomy, seating. The prices seem a bit high, the atmosphere is very plain, the service is only okay, but the food is always hot, fresh, and delicious.
This place will address the need, or hankerin' for good ol' Texas BBQ. I can vouch for the brisket, baked beans and creamed corn, with a slice-o white bread with onions and pickles on the side.
Very good food and friendly atmosphere. I love their ribs and sides. Small quaint restaurant but really delicious BBQ.
Austin, TX 78736

Love this place! OMG, buttery tasting barbacoa is fantastic! Also tried the brisket omelette, sooo good. If you're hungry come here, I've  had their breakfast and lunch on several occasions and they never disappoint. Angus beef burgers and crispy fries to die for!Claudia , the cashier is always friendly and courteous. Give this place a try at least twice. I think you won't be disappointed.

I love this place. Good bbq, Great sauce and for me you can have the best bbq in the world, i.e. Franklins, but an important part of getting bbq are the side dishes, convenience, and value. This place hits it all.  I've had the chicken, brisket, sausage, and ribs. All good ! Yum

The bbq is always good. Breakfast tacos are great. I always get beef ribs and brisket, potato salad and beans. I come here every time. Mmm-good. I have come here for some 20 years. The brisket has not changed a bit tender and sweet. Our dogs kennel is close by so I get to drive Donn's and get breakfast tacos. If I don't my dog and my daughter protest and complain. Close by and good bbq

So we are visiting Texas and high on our agenda is good BBQ. Unfortunately, we decided to look for it on New Year's Eve around 6 PM and we had no idea that it was a thing for barbecue restaurants to "run out of meat". Soooo weird. This was the fourth BBQ restaurant that we stopped at and the only one that wasn't close because of the holiday or a lack of meat. We were willing to eat almost anything at this point, but as it turns out... The food was AMAZING. We arrived at 630 and they were closing at 7, yet they were patient, friendly and answered all our random touristy questions. (Including... Do people really walk around wearing guns in Austin? How crazy is that??) My fiancé had the turkey, brisket, beef ribs, baked beans and Mac and cheese. I had the pork ribs, beef ribs, green beans, and French fries. We devoured ALL of it. In record time. It was DELICIOUS and the brisket was so tender I only got one bite before my fiancé snatched his plate back. Great service, good food and a great welcome to the coun- er state of Texas!
DON'T USE "EXPLORE THE MENU"!! New management! Changed website and HIGHER PRICES! Still not a bad deal, and good food, but don't be surprised when you get there!Use the link to the website instead.

Solid 4 stars for a mid week family dinner. Casual atmosphere, kids meals, BBQ and Beer for the adults and easy parking... what more could you ask for.  Love the onion rings.  Potato salad was not my favorite.  Service was great and staff were friendly.

Been going to Donn's for many years and I have to say that we will probably never go back. There have been menu changes that dont allow the same meat on a combo. We ordered 2 ribs but were charged for a 1/4 lb before it was ever weighed. I understand that this could be an advantage if 2 ribs weighed more than 1/4 lb. there was nothing good about this. The ribs tasted old and had a yellowish color. I got my money back for the ribs...but the cashier looked at them as if i shouldnt get my money back bc myself and my guy tasted one. Potato salad was dead.Im so disappointed bc there isnt any place to get bbq in our area besides rudy's. Ive been in foodservice for a very long time and i can say without a doubt that Donn's has gone down hill by trying to save on food cost.

Great breakfast tacos!  I usually walk the 3 minutes across the street while my daughter is in a nearby swim class.  I usually get the brisket and barbacoa breakfast tacos, and they have a salsa bar to dress the tacos. Never been here for lunch or dinner, but I can say it's a great place for breakfast.
I'd give this BBQ joint a three star that being said I'm not a huge meat fan and I usually look forward to the sides. But my sides were nothing special to write home about.
Austin, TX 78736

A colleague and I recently has lunch here for the first time.  My expectations were low from previous experiences at Franklin, Blacks, and LA BBQ to name a few of the best.  However, after having the fatty brisket and jalapeño sausage...Four stars!  Exceeded expectations and will definitely be back.  Side note: they have okra!Update: we've come here for their breakfast tacos a few times.  They've been really good until I found a piece of plastic in my taco.

A colleague and I recently has lunch here for the first time.  My expectations were low from previous experiences at Franklin, Blacks, and LA BBQ to name a few of the best.  However, after having the fatty brisket and jalapeño sausage...Four stars!  Exceeded expectations and will definitely be back.  Side note: they have okra!
I absolutely love this place! Donn's isn't just known for their tasty BBQ but they also have a delicious breakfast menu.

Pretty descent barbeque. The prices are a bit high for the portions given and the atmosphere  is dull. If you're looking for a quick Texas BBQ (take out) at the Y in Oak Hill then give it a try. The Brisket and Pork ribs are good. The sides are nothing to write home about.

I've been coming here most of my life and it's definitely one of my favorite BBQ spots in Austin.  The brisket and sausage are so good and they make my all time favorite potato salad.  The potato salad is so delicious and has tasted the same since I started coming here decades ago.  Nothing ever compares to Donn's potato salad.  We came today and had a great experience as always.

I'm so disappointed with one of my favorite BBQ places , over the years I've always bragged to people Donn's is the best value for good BBQ but I haven't been in a year or so .... boy did they let me down today , Sausage and Brisket was so freaking dry and old tasting I can't believe y'all served me this crap , if we had ordered dine in instead of take-out I would've demanded my money back with a nasty attitude !! Fortunately my neighbors dogs didn't complain and enjoyed all 3 plates . Way to ruin it for me and my family

Oh yes I did. So, I'm not a huge meat-eater, but when delicious food is presented to me, well, let's just say I'm a "freegan". Brisket is something I discovered after moving to Texas (a long time ago y'all, and not from California, so don't get mad). Brisket in general is about the most delicious reason to be an omnivore and Donn's does not disappoint!They give you a few options, so you can get the crispy? brisket (the one with more fat) or the other kind. Both are delicious. So that's good, but the best thing are their sides! They have an amazing "squash" side with zuchinni and yellow squash and tomato yumminess, and their beans are great! They also have the requisite cooked to death collards, which are tasty. The convenience (for me) and price of Donn's for what you get is unparalleled! Two thumbs up in Oak Hill!
Love this place.  Catfish is great. Staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is nice and not Loud place so you can always hear your friends.
Love the breakfast tacos. One of the few places I can actually get my kids to eat. One of the best original BBQ spots in Austin.
Austin, TX 78748

From a pre-COVID visit: Great Food! I ordered the brisket and pork ribs; so awesome. Service was great as well, didn't have to ask or wait forever to get a water refill! Will always come here when I'm in town.

Got this on UberEats and was pleasantly surprised given the ratings. I think the problem is that they put BBQ in the name. I believe I had the brisket at the other location once before and was not impressed and we had the sausage here and it was nothing special. The chicken and Mac and cheese are both solidly 4 out of 5. The peach cobbler is also good but I don't think I've ever met a cobbler I didn't likeThe real stars of the show are the hush puppies and even more so the wings. The smoked Buffalo wings are a must order

I walked in and ordered to go food. When I walked up I literally walked up to the bar and the lady looked at me and waited for me to say something. She didn't greet me or anything. She then proceeded to take my order and was very rude. Like I was a burden. I left a 25% tip because I always do. As I waited at the bar for my food to be prepared her and another coworker were just complaining the whole time. The larger man that was there then picked up my receipt and looked at the tip and walked over to the lady and said to her that he was surprised he left a tip. She agreed and said that never happens. Very unfriendly and unprofessional. The lady there even had her kid at work with her sitting at the bar. Very unprofessional environment. You guys should talk to your staff and if you're the manager I'm writing about then you should re-evaluate your profession. I usually don't write reviews. This is actually my very first one. I'm a kitchen manager for a restaurant and would never treat my guests that way. They are your priority. You should be lucky you even have a job during a pandemic. Way to be a role model for your child there watching you work. The food was good.

Well, thought I would try a new spot. Drove to the Barton Springs location... but if you know anything about parking downtown... there's no parking. So drove out here (South Austin). Finding the place is tricky park near the theater. Ordered catfish platter and jambalaya and Mac n cheese. Not sure what to think... fish was good n hot but the meal coating lacked some seasoning. The Mac n cheese was well, ok but did not like the jambalaya... rice was a little under, seasoning was ok. Best part of the meal believe it was for me, the tea. Would I visit again, maybe...but a bbq place that has fish, I should have got the bbq.
The service isn't the best.  Training would be beneficial for staff and clientele alike.

I'd pass on this place if you are looking for good food, ambiance, or friendliness. We came in about an hour and a half before they closed...there were people there. As a matter of fact it was kinda busy...we are not sure why. They were already starting their shut down tasks. I think it was way too early to be cleaning up a fountain drink area...to which they proceeded to serve our drinks from a 2 liter bottle of soda...so needless to say it was flat. The food was less than stellar, right down to the prefab burger, it matched the service. This seems like the type of place that Gordon Ramsey would rescue.

Bold statement alert. Pound foe pound and pint doe pint, you cannot beat the S. Austin green mesquite. In totality: sides, brisket, turkey, chicken, and CPI try deserts there is almost no better all around choice in austin. Yes there are spots with more name recognition. Yes there are famous legacy locations but from a sheer food quality standpoint, you would be hard pressed to do better than the Green Mesquite!! They also have amazing prices and family style catering.

So....we used to LOVE coming here. We would come once a week, sometimes more often pre-COVID and even when they reopened after because they had a good variety on the menu, good service, and a decent selection of beer.But the last three times we have been there we've been really disappointed, including tonight. It's a management issue.1. They don't staff properly anymore. Most nights there is only one person working the floor. I suspect there also is short staffing in the kitchen too because we hear them cursing a lot. This makes for incredibly slow service. Tonight we sat for more than 10 minutes and decided to leave when a big party came in at that point. The cook was outside walking around. Not good.2. Because they are short staffed, the staff who is there is under a lot of pressure. They get frustrated (and they should, their management is putting them in a terrible position). They also make more mistakes because they are so in the weeds, and when you try to get something fixed, it takes a long time. As in, everyone else is done with their food and you just got yours.3. They seem to be trying to cut costs more by reducing menu items. Particularly their beer selection. It used to be great. Now they don't even have staples like Mich Ultra. It's really a shame because we feel for the staff, but each time we are there it's just a little worse. Would love to see them come back, but not sure they will.

Friendly staff. And that's about all they have going for them. The food was not at all up to Texas BBQ standards. The Turkey sandwich had two think slices of turkey. Less than an ounce of meat, for sure. Adding French fries is $2 and you get about 13 small fries. The portion sizes are dismal for the $. The chopped beef has little to no flavor. No smoke taste at all. It tastes like it was cooked in an oven. Very disappointed in the food quality. In a town with great BBQ, a BBQ business can't afford to make such poor quality food and pass it off as BBQ.
Austin, TX 78748

Wow, can u really call this BBQ in today's climate of awesome BBQ places. The only thing it has going for it, is that you can walk in and get something to eat without a line. Just about any great BBQ joint is sold out within hours and has a line wrapped around the building.No need to ever go back.

Ordered 3 rib plate and got 2 ok ribs and one very small inedible one. when I order a three meat plate I expect more than two ribs this is ridiculous. They were also really dry and tasteless. Try to call the restaurant several times and they never picked up, I will never recommend this restaurant. I asked to ask for no onions and they gave me onions. If they pick up the phone I would be able to fix this but they never picked up.

The Green Mesquite is going way downhill. This location has never been as good as the Barton Springs store. We ordered the three meat special. There were four other customers in the restaurant at 2 pm on Wed.The brisket was very fatty and greasy. The sausage tasted like it just came out of a package. The ribs were old and dry. The pulled pork was extremely dry. All of the food arrived lukewarm. The jambalaya side dish was better than everything else. I realize that restaurants might not know how to prepare food in these times but they should try to make an effort to give better food and service with the lack of business.Never again Green Mesquite...I have given you too many chances for repreival!

This is not a great BBQ place, food wise. I honestly didn't pick this place but we had a gathering here. The service was good but the food was nasty. I much rather go to the dollar menu at any fast food joint. Maybe it's because I ready bad reviews here that made me not want to come but after experiencing the food. I totally agree with bad reviews.
Ordered to go, Got the bbq sandwich and it was good.  Got fries as the side, $2 extra and got about 8 fries... pissed me off enough to never order again.
It says "Best Wings In Austin" .... and guess what, they're right! I'd say best I've ever had, hands down. They're huge, and the sauce is unlike any wing sauce you've ever had.

Catfish platter. Breading on catfish was mealy and not very flavorful. YUCK!!!!  Pork ribs. 75% fat. Got a whooping three bites off of two ribs. Pecan pie. Pitiful. See pic. $50 for a $5 meal. Disgusted. Off our list. Used to be a favorite.

Upon walking in there was no one in sight to greet. I walked to bar and someone causally walked over, told them it was my first time and he said "ok". Proceeded to order and then when I said I wanted to dine in the employee made it seem like a big deal that I ordered at bar instead of finding a seat, there was no one to seat me! During entire interaction while ordering the employee wouldn't take his eyes off TV screen and not once made eye contact with me. Haven't even got my food yet but no matter what it's like I can tell I won't be back, would rather grab H‑E‑B BBQ.

Decided to finally Door Dash this place to my home and as I'm eating my chopped beef sandwich, I found a long (couple inches) black and gray hair in it. I was so mortified because I have blonde hair and that definitely wasn't my hair. Potato salad was so bland and Cajun rice tasted like something out of box. So disappointed and will not be eating here again.
Austin, TX 78748

Only giving 2 stars because the first time I was there, exceptional service and food was good. Got a to-go order tonight, paid 12.49 (+1.00 for brisket) and this was all the meat I got...... barely any. Also, forgot the bread for both plates. Not impressed

We absolutely love this place. We love all three locations but this is probably our favorite location out of all of them.My husband ordered the Philly cheese steak double meat which he absolutely loved. The focus was all about the meat which was excellent quality and double means extra extra. The bread was fresh the cheese was melty and yummy and he thoroughly enjoyed it.My absolute favorite... from this particular location especially,  is going to be the smoked Wings which I get the sauce on the side. This is the best place I have found in all of Austin for some really good chicken wings. They smoke them and then I think they might fry them afterwards to give it that nice crisp to it but they don't put breading on it which I love because I do not like breading on my chicken wings. They also seem to be bigger and plumper at this location as well. The buffalo wing sauce is really really good and does not taste like bottle sauce at all like a lot of places do and the blue cheese is fresh and really good.We also enjoyed a couple drinks. I got the Chardonnay wine and my husband got the draft Fireman's 4 which was served cold and promptly.The service was outstanding. Our waitress, Balinda, was very nice and sweet as well as prompt and attentive without being hovering.We really enjoyed our visit here. Thank you for the awesome food and terrific customer service.
Not quite as good as the Barton Springs location but still consistently passable BBQ. I've heard a rumor that you can bring in your own brisket and rub and they'll smoke it for you for a small fee.

Great place to eat or take out.  When I come to town for meeting I always stop buy to eat here.  The staff is always nice and helpful.  I love the chicken wings, they are the best.  I usually just get these with a side or two and its plenty to fill you up.

We ordered this to go and got pulled pork sandwiches. When the order was delivered they had the meat on the buns so the buns were soggy and ruined, the pulled pork was huge chunks and 1 tiny side of bbq. It was terrible will not order here again

I ordered a 1 meat plate with 2 sides through Doordash. I put gluten free all over my order. When I opened it it smelled really good but bread was in top of the whole order. Rendering it inedible as it was contaminated with gluten. I was very very disappointed. Doordash was able to refund me but gluten free is important and I don't feel comfortable going back.

So we ordered food to be delivered for dinner, and since I've never heard of the place, I was looking forward to trying it. I am a plain eater, nothing overly fancy for me and I'm happy with that. But what happened to our order was so unreal that I won't order from this place again no matter how hungry I am. Not realizing they didn't have an entire chicken that I ordered, they "made this up to my family" by throwing in a slice of fudge pie. The potato salad that came with the full chicken that we didn't get? The potato salad was no larger than a pint. I kid you not. Now how am I supposed to feed my family on a pint of potato salad? Lastly, I ordered a plain Jane baked potato. Plain Jane baked potatos don't have pork. I am  of ethnicities that require proper eating, and when I am given food made in ways I didn't order or have things that are a blatant disregard of the requested order, I know that I never need to go back. I would give this place a zero if at all possible.
Saw this restaurant on Diners, drive ins and dives. The sandwiches were perfect, the french fries were cooked exactly how I wanted and the service was great!!

The only good thing I've had here are the wings. The brisket is downright awful, and pretty sure it's steamed and not even smoked. The sausage is decent at least, and the sides are decent too. But that's it. Good wings, everything else is average to below average.
Austin, TX 78748

If you are looking for blow you away bbq, stay away. This is not the place to get your filling of great brisket that is if you are a brisket fan. Meat is dry and lacking in flavor. Not a bad place I would assume if you are looking for a quick bite to eat but this does not have the making of flavorful and mouth watering Texas BBQ.

Welp, when in Texas, the BBQ standards are insanely high. And for that reason, Green Mesquite, ya just can't quite cut it. Anywhere else, this may be passable for a 3 or 3.5 star, but the food really didn't wow me at all. (Service was excellent, I will say)The green beans tasted and looked straight from a can, with some onions thrown in. The mac and cheese was runny and bland and the pulled pork sandwich was ok, but certainly didn't taste homemade in the slightest. Good value for the money in regards to portion, but again, taste and quality was lacking.The service was really nice (I was dining alone and the waiter was very attentive, answered my menu questions and used my name when thanking me after the bill was paid) and I do appreciate that a lot. The restaurant had a large porch with tables, and a smaller inside area with a soda fountain and fresh-brewed tea. People seemed to be regulars and there is a to-go spot.

I am very sad. I brought my family here because I have had good food here before... Not this time. Once we found hair in most of our food ( BBQ 4 ) we freaked out. We just left. My little sister was crying & we had to leave.

The food was mediocre. Not horrible not great.  I had sausage, brisket and pork ribs. It was all pretty bland and unimpressive. Same goes for the slaw.  Potatoe salad was the best but again not great.. The peach cobbler was straight gross.  Way way to much soggy topping or bread or whatever on top of a few canned peaches. That part was quite disappointing.

Being new to the Austin area, I always view going to a new eatery as a happy adventure. It was an adventure alright! We arrived around 5 pm and it seemed about a quarter to a third full. There appeared to be only 1 overworked waiter, so we were determined to be patient and generous. Well now ... it was almost 30 minutes before we were even greeted, when our order finally arrived it was missing the appetizer and the side dish, which never showed up. The Family Platter (almost $50) did not have the chicken and we've had way better turkey from H-E-B's deli. The brisket was fair, but a tad dry.  Plus instead of the pleasant smoky smells prevalent in most BBQ places, this place had a rank chemical smell. As one member of our party said: Take a good look around. You'll just have to remember it. We won't be back. I feel really bad leaving such a review. But this place is really sad so far as food and service go.

I love green mesquite. It's not the best BBQ in Texas but they have great deals and friendly customer service. I enjoy the BBQ although twice the brisket and pork ribs has been dry and bland. All the other times cooked to perfection!I come here almost every Tuesday cause they have $16.99 all you can eat BBQ and sides. This special is Mondays and Tuesdays from 4-8 at the south park location only. I live northwest but come here for that deal. Its just so good! I mix and match meats and sides for at least 2 hours! My favorite are the smoked wings, pork ribs, mac n cheese, velvet corn, and fried okra.They also have various daily specials so check them out.
This place was great. Smoked wings are amazing. A must try for anyone in the Austin area.

WARNING! Hands down the absolute most basic and bland bbq in Austin. The ribs tasted boiled and trust me it's as bad as it sounds. Not a happy camper and what makes it even worse I was craving bbq and I was on a budget the opposite of a win win!

First of all Myca is a badass! I go here because I know that if I sit at the bar and she is working then I will have the best time! Second, the wings are freakin amazing, BEST in Austin by far! And they have Fireman's on tap! Take all of that and add a side of Mac and you really can't go wrong!
Austin, TX 78748
Went here because a few people recommended it in their blogs. I learned these people must not live in Austin. The atmosphere was boring and the food was served cold.

Got the 3 meat plate with 2 sides. Meh. Brisket was dry. Small portionRibs were very dry and tasteless. 3 small ones. Wings were actually good. Sauce was sweet and tangy. Potato salad tasted store bought. Mac and cheese was thick and had a weird smokey flavor. You get what you pay for. Go into town to get some real BBQ.

I dont know whats up with past reviews so low.  I have likely eaten at over 100 Texans BBQ spots. Maybe one has to know what to order so Ill go ahead and tell you cuz what I had Im telling you ends out my 2018 bbq tour its fantastic! I had a 3 meat plate of pork ribs (perfect) turkey (same) and pulled pork. I could live on what they fed me and die a happy cowboy. Green beans fresh as heck and cajun rice spicy and great too. 5 stars all the way. Im glad I live less than 3 miles away.

My go to is the chopped beef sandwich.  The staff is always friendly, helpful and attentive. Love how laid back the environment is and the friendliness of the staff.  Parking is never an issue, only thing is there is an echo, so, if there is a crying kid, it is crazy amplified.

Green Mesquite is one of my favorite bbq restaurants. I live in San Antonio and make the drive to Austin every couple of months just for Green Mesquite. I have tried all the bbq the brisket is very good so are the ribs. The frito pie is one of the best, is made with their brisket and the serving size is huge. My favorite thing and what I drive to Austin for is the wings. They are smoked then fried so you get a great smoke flavor and a crispy skin then they are tossed in their delicious wing sauce. The sauce has a little bit of heat but not too much and it's a little sweet. I always buy some sauce to take home.

First time at this place. Overall quality is just ok! Had the slicesd beef plate with okra and corn. Texas as being the BBQ heaven, this place does not really meet the high expectations. Flavor is bland and a little on the boring side! Place is cluttered with no vibe to it!  Typical Texas friendly staff. From a value stand point, it is ok if you get the daily special. Would I make a special trip to this place, most definitely NOT!  Especially now seeing the small draft beer bill @ $4.62 for happy hour. Sure isn't happy!
