For years I've recommended your establishment for a 'quick fix' - to circumvent the drive to Lockhart. Have called in orders of dozens of wings on Sundays for games always requesting they not be dropped in the fryer, knowing and having to acknowledge that they still need to be cooked further - which I as well as those I'd sent your way would do either in the oven or on the grill to finish them off. Sadly when coming in this evening on short notice after a busy SXSW week I was not only told what I'd been doing for years was not possible; your 'kitchen manager' proceeded to demean me at the bar instructing me that what I was requesting was never an option and that I was lying. After a back and forth with him I had to have the server readjust the tab as I did not, and never want, wings dropped in the fryer - making certain to not hold that against her of course and tipped her generously. Regardless this 'kitchen manager's attitude, also acknowledged by the server; her stating that "he's always shitty...," is unacceptable and out right horrible.I don't know if this guy who claims to be an employee of "25 years" is your best source of weed but the fact remains him and his attitude is not good for business moving forward.Being an on and off frequenter of your establishment for nearly thirty years, and more recently this south location for the past five + years since relocating down this way, the server didn't hesitate to give me his name when I asked - I'll not post it here as that seems wrong however I'lll address it with him personally - though I doubt he's man enough to own up to his short comings let alone apologize.His sanctimonious attitude alone is enough for me to never recommend your establishment moving forward. Furthermore I vow to mention people not go to Green Mesquite at every gig or engagement I am involved with moving forward until this "25 year" cook/kitchen manager is no longer part of your company. However from my conversation with him it seems as though he's your weed connection therefore I doubt anything will change but I will stick to my morals and preach against your company as the drive to Lochkhart isn't as bad as it use to be given the toll road.psThanks for the half decent ribs.

The only good thing we had here were the smokey wings. The mac and cheese was runny, the brisket was dry, the Philly cheese tacos had sliced unmelted cheese on it (least you can do is melt that plastic cheese into the meat), cornbread was dry, pulled pork was overcooked.I'll never go back even if the wings were good.

Well, I think I'd be full of lies if I gave them another star... I have them a year to get it together and darn them... I'm going to just say bless their hearts, but dang that yard bird was dry.  Also got ribs and they were dry and greasy all at the same time, wth?!  So I got beans that had a bit too much fat in them, yuck and also some potato salad, which was kickass.  Hubby was displeased with his dry and sauce-dependent brisket and turkey.  They are really nice here, just wasn't that fab...
Buda, TX 78610

We found Willie's from Eastside Broilers. The perfect spring weekend includes slurping crawfish, throwing back drinks, and enjoying sunshine. Coming inside Willie's bar looks a bit sketch, as it's behind an ominous brown door, no signage. However, basic beers are also served outside in the yard for a quick grab. Patio seating is a PLENTY! Warning: Buda is located outside the Austin perimeters, so expect the crowd to be a bit more conservative like the rest of Texas.

Great place, y'all!! If you're looking for a down to earth authentic spot that serves amazing crawfish boil, this is your place. Plus they have awesome live music with local bands and everyone's rocking even during COVID! We can't get enough of their crawfish boil though - it's so addicting! The service is always friendly and definitely take care of you. Our new favorite spot for a fun casual night out!
I've been for crawfish on a Saturday afternoon and a separate time to listen to live music after dinner. Fun spot with cornhole, picnic tables, indoor and outdoor bar, and friendly people

Have been wanting to go here for a while.  Stopped in for lunch.  If you ever read my reviews you know I do not usually enter a bad review.  I simply choose not to go back and do not review the place.  However this place got me feeling that their practices are misleading and others should know.We ordered  two cheese burgers, a app.  2 beers and ome margarita.  Bill was $61.88 before a tip?????  This seems excessive based upon menu prices forlunch so when we looked at our bill, we saw we were charged $7.50 for Fritos???I told the waitress we did not order $7.50 worth of Fritos, we did not  have any Fritos. She told us it was a COVID law that food has to be a percent of the alcohol bill so they charged random chips to customers without their knowledge to meet this alleged law.  No one told us this was going to be on our bill,  food we did not order, and did not receive?When questioned she could not tell me the percent and why our food did not go against this percent.  Told us we could wait until the manager came in an hour from now.  I just got my bill and was ready to leave, why would I want to wait an hour???Service was poor as we never received any water, silverware, or napkins until we asked after our food was delivered.I am very disappointed in what appeared to be a nice outdoors bar and grill we were looking forward to frequenting as we live here.I definitely will not be back and Can NOT recommend!

Been going to Willies for years prior to COVID.  Always have had great times! 1st time back and our bill was twice regular.  Nothing changed in our orders.  Had over $50 added to our order for "Chips".  We never got any chips!  Spoke to owner and he said that was so they could open as a "restaurant" and not a bar!  The Governor has already opened up the regulations in regards to this!  There is no need to over charge your customers to try to get thru the COVID loop hole!You are a BBQ joint LOL! If you need the bar and alcohol business to stay afloat then you may want to reevaluate your food!  Even before COVID nobody ever wanted to eat your food!

Fun fun fun place for the entire family, pooches welcome as well! Several bars , inside and out, crawfish  and other menu items.  Live music, outdoor games...ping pong & corn hole for the adults and a huge play area foe kids!  sit, relax around a fire pit and enjoy a cold brew and southern jams!!

I love Willie's, I get exactly what I'm looking for. It's got the perfect vibe for an outside bar. The bartender, Kirby made my experience all the more worth the drive. He was attentive, well informed, and was well versed in the menu and it's prices. He explained the whole "chips" deal Willie's has to do to stay open and I appreciated him taking time out of his busy shift to explain it to me. Will be coming back for this wonderful staff!
Couldn't be a better place for a group gathering. We had a going away party for my brother in law and it was perfect. Great crawfish, beer selection, barbecue, you name it! Awesome place!

We moved to Buda a few weeks before the wuhan lockdown & looked forward to trying this place once it reopened. Then I saw the disgusting portable toilets in the yard where people are drinking and eating. Will not go there now & cannot believe this is allowed by the health department.
Buda, TX 78610

Today is my birthday and we decided to check this place out because I had been told by a few people that the burgers were fantastic. I figured I would give it a shot. We decided to call our order in and get it picked up. The only good thing about the burgers were the buns were homemade. The burgers were bland. If I am going to pay over $12 for a 1/2 pound burger, I expect the quality to be a tad bit better and would like to see some grill marks, instead of being cooked on a flat top. The burger was seasoned with just salt and pepper. In some instances, that is all your need. Burgers come with chips. If you want fries or tater tots, that an up charge. If I wanted to be nickel and dime to death, I would have opted for a better burger joint. We did order fried pickles, which were ok. This place does have a nice outdoor area where you can gather with friends and have a beer. If you are considering a burger, skip it. There are plenty of burger places with better burgers that will not cost you an arm and a leg.

Went on a Tuesday afternoon for a happy hour beer with a friend. After quickly getting greeted with a "Be with you soon" from the waitress, we waited 15 minutes to get service. Wait staff - including the waitress who said she'd be with us soon - hung out to smoke and talk with themselves.Waitress finally made her way over to us only to notify us that the draft lines were broken and that only cans were available. Ordered two Ziegenbocks (because the selection was next to none) and an order of fries. Drank the beer, hung out for an hour, never got the fries or a return visit from any wait staff.Left highly disappointed and remembering why I don't do happy hours at places in Buda.
Got rid of their bbq and no more pickles eggs. Hamburgers and appetizers only. Prices went up as well

Cool environment, crappy service and expensive not so good drinks. Disappointed. Was excited to try it we ordered. Drink inside then got our table outside. The server outside made eye contact several times but never once came and checked on us. We were going to order food but decided to finish our one drink and leave.  Sucks cuz it's a cool place

We've given this place a couple tries.  I've had to drop my rating lower.  It is a great venue and location, but staff are rude, slow, and un-attentive.  Eye rolling at your patrons is not recommended. And, you should definitely eat elsewhere. Food is very overpriced and sub par at best.

Fun place, BUT just had their ribs.  They tasted pretty good, but at $10 for 3 small ribs I will not be ordering them again.  The bbq that my friend's ordered were tasty and had a decent quantity.  Bar is decent.  Would like a better selection and maybe some on tap by now.

Well the only good thing I can say is that the music is good. Dont come here if you're hungry. I am waiting still for an appetizer. Got a crappy drink. I am still waiting on the server to say bring me the check and just donate it to someone else. I am paying to leave this place.
A few weeks ago my adult grand children and I decided to go to enjoy some crawfish and drinks, we had an excellent time and the food was delicious.

Not much to look at, but you can tell it's a fun joint to hang out at night. We came here after Buda's trail of lights for Christmas, and it was a bit chilly, but there were  a few outdoor heaters to warm you. We ordered the brisket plate with Cole slaw and tots, and I got the pulled pork plate with the jalapeno Mac n Cheese and waffle fries with queso (but they were out of the queso (at only 7:00!?!))My husband's meat was delicious!! Mine was chewy and tasted like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for 5 hours. The sides were fine. If we go again, it will be for the chicken Sh*! Bingo and the brisket!
Buda, TX 78610
What a fun place! I love the outdoor atmosphere, live music and fun things they have going on during the weekends! The staff is always super friendly too. Good times.

I really wanted to like this place. Staff is great but the food is not. The mashed potatoes has an extreme amount of pepper and garlic. The potato salad was just awful. Meat was just ok. We ordered for 8 and no one was impressed.

While some people may find this place enjoyable, my experience was less than. The bar smelled likea bathroom and the food was mediocre. My entire family got sick after eating there. It seems like a cool place to grab a beer and sit outside but I don't recommend eating there.

Meh. I finally made it down here for a crawfish boil. I wanted to like this place SO bad.... but, $18 for two vodka sodas?!? I mean, what?!?!?! They asked if we wanted doubles and I said no. Then she tells me it is $18. As other people have stated, I'm pretty sure I was over-charged.If this place was actually affordable, it would be pretty cool. Large outdoor space, live oak tree, free crawfish (during boils) with a drink purchase. Not very much shade though and when we went it was HOT!!! If I ever make it back here again, I will make sure to see that itemized receipt. You have been warned.
Good food and I like the outdoorsey environment . Been here a few times and will be back sometime

Heard that WC Clark was playing for free so decided to give it a shot. We went on a Wednesday and were pleasantly surprised that Educators got a free entree with a drink purchase!We both got the 2 meat BBQ Plate with Brisket and Sausage, and we got four different sides, potato salad, beans, Mac & cheese and waffle fries.The brisket is fatty, but I like it that way, so I loved it. The sausage is nicely spicy. The potato salad is German style (mustard), and was unremarkable as were the beans. The Mac and cheese was great but it was lukewarm. Waffle fries were fine....They had outdoor fires, people playing cornhole, combined with a cold beer, and WC Clark singing the blues, made for a good time.Prices are average.One con is that it's right on the main road in Buda, with cars going by, it wasn't as relaxing as it could be, but what cha gonna do.Will be back...

What a GREAT place, who knew it was smack in the middle of Buda Texas.What I love about this place is the divey feel. There is an outdoor seating area with fire pits and  a cool atmosphere. It  has a FULLY stocked bar and very friendly waitstaff. Ask for Lexi, she's from Abilene Texas and knows all the best jokes about that flat land. Lexi made sure to tell us all about the dinner specials and special events that take place at Willie's joint all year long.And as an added bonus there is chicken shit bingo for those who have a wild streak. This joint is a fun place for kids too.Let me tell you about the food, better BBQ than I've had inna long time and they serve generous portions to boot. Great pulled pork, sliced brisket and a big hunk of meat that defies an appetite. Burgers with bacon in the meat.Come on by and ask for Lexi, she's a real sweetheart and her affection for this place is infectious.

Been driving past here and finally stopped by with some out of town friends. Your hole in the wall local bar that has a nice size courtyard with stage for live bands...plenty of seating that includes picnic tables to bonfire seating. You have all your yard games such as bags and washers and giant Jenga.Came on a Monday afternoon when they opened and Melissa was great to us recommending drinks. Not a whole lot of options for local crafts or IPAs but they have your main liquors. They have events going on each evening so this is a great place to stop in for drinks if it's isn't busy like on bike night.

My oh my!! Where to begin. It's a beautiful day and this was the best possible place we could pick to come have lunch on our way back from Austin. It's a complete dive but it's a great dive. The outdoor area has water mists blazing to keep you cool and plenty of shade as well. They have beer and mimosa specials on Sundays. The bbq is good. Not bad on the price. The employees are great and will get you anything you need. My mind was blown when I asked about crawfish and they took me to this spot in the back bar area and showed me where it was and told me to get all I wanted... I was standing there like an idiot, thinking ok, this is the time where you tell me how much it is. But he just walked away and said enjoy! So I got free crawfish. And it was the best I've ever had because I have been dying for crawfish all season and just have never had the chance to go and get any. Then all of a sudden I'm blessed with the free stuff. Lol. No butter, but hey. Who's complaining...? We will be back for the live music and evening experience. It's bound to be a blast!
Buda, TX 78610

The service was TOP KNOTCH! Felt like we were family! The bartenders were really personable, fun, and attentive. I mean.... there weren't that many of us there on a cold Sunday night but whatever! Good service is good service. Broad selection of beer and we had pork ribs and sausage. They have complimentary stuffed olives which is random but delicious! We found out that they do crawfish in Saturday's so guess who will be back this Saturday? We will!

It's a cool venue. I like the setup with the outdoor fire pits and games. Fun venue to get together and hang out with friends and family. The trouble is the ordering system is absolutely horrid. To order a drink or food, you have to go inside to the bar (there are outdoor bars but I have yet to be there a time those were open). The bar is packed when people at the bar and the rest of us trying to order. They just make it so difficult to give them money. I wanted to just bring a beer from my car as it would have been a ton faster. The staff is on it though as we saw them crack down on a person trying to sneak in a cooler. Instead of having the police staff, they really could overall the food and drink servicing options.
Willies is a fun little spot. Drinks are good and cheap and they do fun crawfish boils and live music. I'm from a small town so I definitely enjoy the feel of this little place tucked away in Buda.

This was my first time to ever hit this place up. I am a huge fan of chill, outdoor, everyone knows your name kinda bars so this was right up my alley. If you are looking for a classy joint, don't go here. The outside area is very large with lots of seating. They had lots of mist fans to keep the area cool. I would however request that the fans turn. They were stationary, so you either say at a table and got soaked or sat at a table and got no fan at all. The outdoor table tops were also pretty dirty and looked like they had never been wiped down. The bartenders were all great! They new several of the locals by name and treated us no different. They were very quick and friendly. There was plenty of parking and seating. If you are looking for a place to chill, this is the place!

Such a fun local bar! If you have been to moontower in South Austin, this is VERY comparable in the fact that it has the same atmosphere but much smaller. The food is delicious and the drinks are good. I love relaxing under the huge trees and playing some fun games with friends. I highly recommend this place!

I don't know why there are so many poor reviews- this place was great! We went for lunch and had the pork tacos and pulled pork plate, jalapeño macaroni and cheese & potato salad- all were to die for! The guy working there was super friendly and the porch area was huge with lots of lawn games. We went when it was super hot and found shade under some misters. This would be a great place to have a big group of friends or to take your dogs. We will definitely come back! :)

Of all the places we could have eaten at in Buda, TX this has to be one of the best in the Austin, TX area. A retro style ranch house with all the color it needs inside or out. The bar/dining room is small so you're sort of forced to eat/drink/party outside amongst not fancy picnic table umbrellas but huge trees providing shade. The BBQ is awesome whether it is Texas Brisket (chopped or sliced), chicken, pulled pork, Texas ranch style baked beans, jalapeño mac & cheese, waffle cut seasoned fries, desert (not that we had room for it), and whatever you wanted or needed to drink. You'd be hard pressed to find better food, service, or colorful staff!The two ladies pictured together work there and described the set up they're standing beside as "Chicken S*!t Bingo where you bet (winning $ goes to the charity of your choice), the chicken is turned loose inside, and whatever square it "eliminates on wins!

Awesome place to bring friends and family when visiting for the weekend. Their crawfish are spicy in the best way and go perfect with their reasonably priced drinks. Crawfish are free when you purchase a drink on Sundays. The line is fun to drink and wait in. A must visit place!

If you've ever been to a HandleBar or Kung Fu on a Sunday then you may have tasted this fine bbq for free! I first discovered the amazingness that is now known as Willie's Joint at HandleBar one Sunday Funday. Greg would pile up a combo of his delicious mac 'n cheese and chopped brisket topped off with his intoxicating bbq sauce. It's a salivating combination. I'm so excited that now there is a brick and mortar restaurant to experience this every day. The back yard is gigantic and will be great once the summer heat dies down. They have lawn games and lots of chairs and tables to relax and enjoy a nice night out. The inside is a lot smaller but we live in Texas after all so the outdoors is where it's at. I do agree with other reviews that they probably should get rid of the piano and oversized tables and chairs to fit more moderate seating. To place your order, you go inside and head straight to the bar where one of the bartenders will take your food order and drink order if you're feeling up to one of their unique cocktails. The food menu is limited but what they make is done well. My favorites are the mac n' cheese, green beans and the chopped beef - with the light bbq sauce. The prices may be a little high for Buda but the quality is definitely there. I will definitely be back and look forward to seeing how this place grows.
Buda, TX 78610

This place is a cool little hang out with some great live music.  Never tried the food.  We only go for concerts and drinks.  I would recommend paying cash.  I have been over charged the last 2 times we went.  If you do put your card down for a tab ask for an itemized receipt. That clears things up real quick. I will see if it happens again the next time we go.  Until then,  just remember this.  Always keep one eye open whilst doing business with strangers.

Came to go to Shugabees food truck but they were Mia today. Went with Wiilie's instead.  When you come inside you grab a menu and order at the bar. Food came out pretty quick. I ordered the pulled pork nachos.  Chips cheese and they gave me brisket instead. It was still really good. Put onions, jalapeños, and BBQ sauce on them. They come out in a bag on a tray so I ripped open the bag to get to the good stuff. Hubby had pulled pork and brisket. So I put some of his pork on it too.  Definitely enough to split unless you're a mountain man. Sad to leave half of the pile behind but they just aren't good warmed over. They had a good amount of nacho cheese on them too. Not like some places that are stingy with the cheese. My nephew had the moist brisket and really liked it with the pineapple coleslaw. Which I tried too and it was really good!  We tried the potato salad and it was just ok. Next time I'll try the jalapeño Mac and cheese.  Neat little place. It was a little warm so we ate inside, but they have a really nice outside bier garden.

Relaxed, fun, live music and cold beer! Who needs more than this?! This joint is where it's at. Outdoor seating with some inside also. At night they started up the firepits to keep the chill off. There were giant games to play like connect four, bucketpong and jenga, but they also had the classics like cornhole and horseshoes. My friends and I stopped in to enjoy the cold beers and listen to some live music and Willie's did not disappoint. Think of chillin in your best friends backyard, then add a bunch of strangers (that aren't friends yet), and a dash of awesome! That is Willie's Joint. Can't wait to visit again :)
I love this place!  Great specials, super cool vibe and fun outdoor spaces. The best are the bartenders. They are so fun and engaging and their drinks are on point.

Very cool, off the path Texas joint. We stumbled across Willie's just driving around town. On weekdays they are just open in the evenings but it looks like they are open for lunch on the weekends. We did not sample the food selections, which smelled delicious, but we did have some local brews. There is a bar inside as well as outside. The inside area is very small but the outdoor section is very spacious. There is a variety of seating ranging from picnic tables to beach chairs around fire pits. There are outdoor games set up such as jumbo jenga and bean bag toss. Live music  at night and daily specials.

Only thing consistent is the hit or miss customer service. Either it's a couple well maintained men that love mixing drinks, or bitter old women that have zero personality and have no interest in having a good time behind the bar. Coming from a local that will not be back.
Food was outstanding.  Husband steak cooked to perfection.  Cierra was very friendly and attentive.  Will definitely come back.

Overall, this is a good spot. Some things could be better. I was told the bacon wasn't ready when I ordered a grilled cheese with bacon and it was close to noon..so I just got it without bacon..kinda strange to tell your customer bacon isn't ready so basically don't get it and it was already close to 12 pm. grilled cheese was good though. Chopped brisket sandwich was also good, not super greasy like someone had reviewed before. Some of the drink prices are a lil steep..$8.75 bloody marys during brunch time on Sat seems way too high..i know on Sundays they are only $4, so 8.75 seems too high. $1 or 1.50 pulled pork tacos on Tuesdays are tasty and a great price, but I wouldn't pay the regular price for what I believe is only 1 taco any other time because I don't think they are big enough to charge 3.50 each. The pork sliders we have tried and I feel they kinda skimp on the meat so we stopped ordering those. We felt when we got the BBQ plate that it really wasn't enough food for the price. I think they should have burgers all the time instead of only during certain hours/days.  $1 frito pies on Monday is cool, just know that its served in the bag, so don't except something super big or anything, esp when its regular priced. bartenders have always been pretty friendly overall and the outside seating area is pretty cool especially on a nice day. We will keep coming back but certain things could be better!

Came here on a Tuesday to try their pulled pork tacos and they were very good! The tortillas were also good. Added some jalapenos and onions and it was perfect. The Ziegens were nice and cold and were a good price. This was our 1st time trying the food and we were both impressed with the pulled pork tacos. bartenders were friendly and helpful. They assisted me right away when I got to the bar which is always nice.
Austin, TX 78745

Newcomer ro Austin and decided to check out more BBQ while in lockdown.Found Chief's on UberEats and found a favorite already. Wow! Great brisket with huge side orders of potato salad and green beans. Plus Texas Toast!And my order showed up less than 35 minutes after I ordered so it was still nice and warm. Absolutely perfect late Monday Night dinner w leftovers for tomorrow because rhey were so generous with their portions. Great food - great value.Definitely going to be trying out other items soon!

I had a very delicious lunch today, one of the best barbecue meals I've  eaten in these difficult times.  The chicken was moist and nicely smoked.  Loved the vinegar  cold slaw.  Would recommend  to anyone who need a que fix and the guy told me the time of delivery and the food came at this precise time to the minutes.

The flavor of the food is good. Be careful when ordering ribs, 3 baby back ribs were $20. They were 80% fat. We were very disappointed. Would not purchase again. You can get a whole rack of ribs for that price at a restaurant. The Cole slaw, onion rings and brisket were good. This place is not cheap.
Outstanding chopped brisket sandwich. The beer-battered steak fries are a really good side. The service is very friendly and very quick.

Brisket:  It was so tough, I couldn't bite through.  I ended up pulling it from my mouth with this tough string of meat still attached to the piece in my sandwich. We had plastic utensils which required a lot of sawing to get through it. Not much flavor going on. The potato salad and slaw were good.  Sausage had decent flavor,  but was on the dry side. If you want brisket,  this likely isn't your spot.
The ribs are super meaty and the "Homer" is awesome. I've been eating there for years.

I can't enough good things about this place. Ordered from here for the Superbowl/my birthday dinner. Got pretty much my usual. But I had to run out quickly and hoped to make it back before the delivery arrived. Since I was literally going to the end of my street I didn't think I would be gone and hour...but I was. But the driver called me and I told him he could just leave it at my door. It's things like that, that keeps me coming back to this place. The service and customer service is amazing. On Superbowl Sunday while they were obviously very busy he took the time to make sure I got my food. I was impressed. Had to call the restaurant back and let them know. I also told them to add a $5 tip because I wasn't here to do it. Make sure to support this business. We need to keep this type of service in our community.

Ordered from Herr again (too tired to cook but needed beef in my life). Got the 3 meat plate (DOUBLE RIBS and sausage). Same sides as last time as well as the bacon cheese burger. It was all very much the same. So at least they are consistent. However, an order of ribs gets u 2 ribs. I thought a double order would get you 4, but when the food came there was only 3. Apparently, I don't know how to multiply. Truthfully, math was never my strong suit soooo...

Put in an order for delivery on memorial day. It was kind of a big order for 2 people. A 2 meat plate (sausage and ribs) coleslaw, beer battered fries and green beans as the sides. Also, a bacon cheeseburger, stuffed jalapeños and a slice of pudding cake. They said it would take 45 minutes to an hour. But it had to be around 30 minutes. The delivery guy said they weren't busy so they got the food out quickly. But when we opened the container we kinda figured out why the food arrived so fast. The food wasn't particularly warm and considering I don't even live 15 minutes away we thought it was weird the food was that cold. The sausage was cut into large chunks and the ends were crusted over indicating it had may have been sitting exposed to the air a bit. The sides were decent. Green beans had pieces of bacon so that's always a plus. The best thing were the ribs. They were tender and smokey. No sauce needed which was good because the barbeque sauce provided was too tomato-y for our taste. The burger wasn't bad. The top bum looked a bit crusty. Not in the 'oh they toasted this perfectly!' kinda way but the 'dude you didn't close the bread bag last night' kinda way. The lettuce, tomato and pickles were sparse and a little limp. But, I guess their logic is you ordered a burger. If you were that worried get a salad. We just bulked it up with condiments and veggies from the kitchen so no biggie.  The poppers were decent. They had cheddar cheese inside. A thicker coating but it still had some nice heat.   The pudding cake was great though! It was more of a pudding than cake. It had what I believe to be a grahmcracker crust then I believe it was a layer of cheesecake! But that's not it. On top of that there was a layer of chocolate pudding followed by a thick layer of whipped cream! It was lovely and decadent. All in all it was OK. We just popped everything in the microwave and it was alright. I've seen some reviews that say its just as good or better than salt lick. I wouldn't go that far. But I also wouldn't go to the other end and say its bill miller. Its solidly OK. Could you fire up your grill and make something as good or better? Definitely. But,   if you woke up at 3 in the afternoon on memorial day and you missed all the festivities then yeah, this will suffice...don't judge us.
Austin, TX 78745

I should have taken a cue from the very unfriendly guy at the counter and walked out without ordering. Everyone has a bad day, after all.  I ignored his rudeness and ordered ham, brisket and chicken to go.  The chicken skin was weird, like rubber.  It didn't seem to be done.  Yuck.  The brisket was bland and  tough. The ham was so salty it was hard to eat so I chopped it up and threw it into green beans that I made in my Instant Pot (the only win of the day). There went $27.  Never. Again.
Horrible tasting food . Potato salad had too much mustard . Meat was all dry . The ribs and sausage wasn't even edible .. would never eat here again .
Chief's has decent BBQ, but lacks consistency. I've tried all of their meats and sides over the years. It's just very hit or miss.

This place is the bomb!!!!  I admit I was really hungry but I asked the people in the other businesses around it and received great info so my choice made, I went in to check it out myself. Oh man....I took pictures of the food and people were coming in left and right.  Mainly for the brisket but the sausage was ordered and I had the ribs.  Delish!!!  Use that bbq sauce!!!  It gives the ribs a whole new address in your mouth. The green beans are made with sautéed onions and bacon.  Seasoned well and so good you ask for the rice (they don't service rice) but you act like your at home.  Pudding cake is new to me but. It anymore!!!!  Oh you have to have a slice of that!!!  I ordered food to go and I was still eating!!!  Tomorrow is gonna be a Good day!!!!  Try it!! Soon !!!

I love trying BBQ places. I gave Chief's BBQ a try. Overall, I wasn't impressed and can only recommend if you are craving sausage. I ordered a three meat plate with brisket, pork ribs, and smoked turkey. I added a bite of sausage so I could give it all a try. For sides, I had fried okra, pinto beans, and potato salad. The ribs were thinly cut and were served barely warm. The brisket and turkey had little flavor. There was no rub on the brisket and I found it lacking any character. The bright shining star is the sausage. It is from Elgin and tastes like heaven. Sadly, I have a feeling this has more to do with Elgin's fame than Chief's BBQ knowledge. I enjoyed the pinto beans--they were stellar. The potato salad and fried okra were mediocre at best. The ambiance is great. This is a nice little restaraunt and I felt comfortable. It was clean; but, the service was lacking. I felt I had interrupted the work day and the hand motions of the clerk taking a phone order made be believe they wanted the call to end quickly. In addition, the curse words yelled in the back and the TV tuned to snakes eating birds was quite off-putting. To sum up, the sausage and pinto beans are the only reasons to come to Chief's BBQ. They was so good and I highly recommend. However, the rest was just "meh." I would characterize eating at Chief's as a mediocre experience.
Great place to grab a sandwich. Went on a Sunday sat outside. Fries are also beer batted!

Dear Chief's,You may want to change your name to "Shaman's" because it's nothing short of a miracle that, cold and several hours old, your fried okra tastes better than most places in Austin fresh out of the fryer okra.And you're $18.99 combo pack is the best cure for a few adults and a child who may be somewhere between starving and peckish and just need SOMETHING to get through to the next decision point in the day (too late for lunch? too early for dinner? I didn't eat breakfast. I didn't eat lunch. I'm so hungry I can't read this menu, please feed me.) One pound of meat, two huge sides, bread, pickles, onions, and sauce.  What?!  Damn near voodoo.Lastly, the speed of 'I'm so hungry, I can't read' to 'wow, that's a lot of okra!' is almost incomprehensibly short.  Or, shall we say, "Shamanicly short."Sincerely,Melissa A.

Im from los angeles area and stayed in south austin on a business trip and heard texas is best for brbq....knowing i dont have transportation to go to any place nearby i had to use uber eats for delivery of my food...i ordered the 2 meat place and got to say the pork ribs were so good especially the sausage....everything was good...I give it a hell yea...Great to know this one was close to my hotel..I will return one day again to get some good brbq.

My homies wanted some BBQ without the extended wait so we ended up here.  Chief's is pretty hole-in-the-wall, maybe borderline grimy, but everyone determined that it would suffice.  As you can imagine, not very vegan or vegetarian friendly.  I suppose vegetarians could snack on the corn on the cob (it was reportedly not very good) and potato salad.  I ordered a side of fries and it was a tremendous crazy generous mound of fries - they were all right, pretty greasy, pretty much what you would expect.  Everyone's orders came out fairly quickly, and the ribs seemed the favored fare as it was consumed rather quickly.  I think we all appreciated the "not waiting" for competent BBQ in Austin.  It's definitely not going to blow your mind or come anywhere close to Salt Lick, but the staff is hella friendly and it's perfect for when you're faced with time constraints.  Another pro of this place is the gas station next door, should you desire a six pack (there's a limited selection) with your BBQ feast.  A fairly big downside of this place is the lack of public restroom.  I had to shuffle on over to the gas station and purchase a mystery fruit flavored water (I mean, I probably didn't HAVE TO, but felt it was the right thing to do, but srsly, wtf with dearth of regular unflavored waters?) in order to utilize the toilet.
Austin, TX 78745

Ordered brisket and requested lean, the leaner the better. I drove home to find very fatty meat and a large fat cap on top of the sliced. This happened a few months ago, just catching up on reviews.  The first time we ordered here, the food was incredible. The second time was less than ok, but we felt it was just an anomaly. This time was completely disgusting.The owner better make changes before it's too late.  I highly suggest checking your food before leaving.

$15 got me aggressively mediocre BBQ with three sides. I should have just gone to Bill Miller's.I like supporting local businesses, and this one is local. The one great thing it has going for it (aside from being near my house) is that the staff are so incredibly friendly. Unfortunately, the food doesn't match up. The brisket was borderline flavorless -- a theme that will come up again and again. The sauce that came with the brisket was watery and weak. I'm not sure where they found it, but it was bad enough that I threw it away and just grabbed some store-bought bottle stuff out of the fridge.I got some sausage to try it out... it wasn't bad. The menu calls it Elgin sausage, which may explain why it was the best of the group.I got some potato salad, onion rings and "brew fries" as my sides. The fries and onion rings were, again, flavorless. That's tough to do with an onion rings, but somehow they managed. They were thick onion rings with a uniform thick batter... but maybe it was just a plain flour breading... I don't know. The fries were non-descript.The potato salad was the best of the bunch, and even then was just "good." It's a mustard-based variety, which I personally like, and it hit the spots. Still, it had hints of generica mixed in.I know this isn't trying to be one of the top BBQ places in the country. It's just a strip-mall restaurant, so I have to cut them a break. But given its proximity to Bill Miller (which is pretty lackluster), they need to up their game. In Central Texas, the worst thing you can be in the BBQ business is forgettable. Sadly, Chief's is.

It is better to have less thunder in the mouth and more lightning in the hand. - ApacheYou have to go there to appreciate the above Native American Proverb and the FANTASTIC BBQ. I had my hair cut next door about lunch time and wandered over there for a bite to eat. I asked for a sliced beef sandwich and here comes something a caveman or LEE would appreciate. GENEROUS slices of smoked brisket that not only you can smell but taste. The bun was gynormous and the sandwich was loaded with pickles, onions and their BBQ sauce........mandatory siesta time after lunch.Don't let all of the wooden Indian heads and Indian motorcycle stuff fool you, the money is in the FOOD. BTY,  this little BBQ restaurant delivers too!
It was the worst. We had the brisket it was all congealed and discolored, didn't even look like brisket. I wouldn't even eat it but my husband was brave and then got sick.
Savory potato salad! So good! Delicious smoked meat delivered straight to your door. What else do you need ?  I hope I don't die of a heart attack within 2 years lol!

Place was nice and comfy"nice Vib", but the meat was dry and not seasoned enough!! And for a barbecue place you would think they would have good barbecue sauce, but they didn't, couldn't choke that stuff down if I wanted too. Not for me,too much cumin

Proof that Way South Austin is ripe for good BBQ. This is the best place you can find south of William Cannon. You can eat it, but you won't feel good about it.First, the place just felt dirty. And they had some documentary playing on the TV that was dropping f-bombs ever few seconds for my kids to enjoy. I immediately lost confidence that this was going to turn out well.Then, the food. Brisket was rubbery and dry. The potato salad was super mustardy, the onion rings were like resistance bands, and the sauce tasted like the base was made from armpit sweat. The one bright spot was the sausage. It wasn't too bad, but they buy it from somewhere else, so I can't give them too much credit.Make the drive towards downtown (or Lockhart even) and avoid this place if it's good BBQ you seek.

Overall disappointing after being told to come here and after reading Yelp reviews. The good: Sliced brisket was great!The average: bbq sauce , green beansThe bad/disappointing: Fries and onion rings had zero seasoning, zero flavor. The turkey breast is one of those cheap processed hunks of meat not an actual whole turkey breast. I didn't even eat it, it was gross. There are better bbq places that's for sure.

Hidden little gem of a restaurant in South Austin. Been here several times and they have never disappointed. Their food is great and they serve well sized portions. Their Tuesday Stuffed Potato special is to die for!
Austin, TX 78745
Always quality. The service is great. I try to stop in whenever I'm rollin' down S. !st. Keep up the good work.

The BBQ is only 3 stars worthy, but the brew fries are completely amazing. Chief's earned the 4th star by telling a person who asked if the beans were gluten free: "I onno, this is a barbecue joint, the food's not good for you."People who are complaining about the service are expecting too much service from a gas station BBQ joint. I love that Chief's will just throw you out if they don't like you and watches Lord of the Rings at inappropriate volumes repeatedly on their huge TV. It's like going to eat at your aggressive cousin's house. Don't ever change, Chiefs!

Awesome that they deliver. BBQ is acceptable. Small dining area and the sun will be in your eyes if facing the window because their window coverings aren't very effective at keeping sunlight out. 2 Star rating because they don't even have a sink to wash off BBQ-hands. I can live with walking to the convenience store to use the restroom; but, what kind of BBQ joint doesn't have at least a sink. The employee advised me to use hand sanitizer when I asked to use a sink to wash my hands... not cool.

This place is great!  It's kind've a small place so folks are sitting there in a small space eating or watching television, which is cool.  It might give some a slightly awkward feeling since it can be very quiet in there once you walk in.   That aside, they're quick, they got the order correct, and they were nice folks behind the counter.   The BBQ (we got brisket and sausage as usual) and the sides were awesome!  And we will be back again!  They do deliver, just not to my neck of the woods so, I just call in my orders and go and pick them up.For the sides, we got the usual on a party pack but we also grab some Joe Bob's beans:  A big bowl of beans, with chopped brisket, sausage, cheese, BBQ sauce, onionand jalapeño.  Yum!  Comes with pickles, onions and bread.  You know the drill!   Enjoy some good BBQ!

NOT WELL-KNOWN, BUT WORTH KNOWING ABOUT!Well, I need to fire up the ol' camera for Chief's. There are a few pictures there, a couple that are even good, none of my particular "fave" (which I can only WRITE about at the moment). Yes, we DEFINITELY need more pictures. I'll work on that, soon.There aren't a lot of BBQ places in the first place, in the '45 Zip Code. There WAS a Bill Miller just down the street from me, @ W. Wm. Cannon & Manchaca, but they closed up shop. Probably my fault, cuz I never ate there much, even though they were the closest. Locally-owned, but still too "Corporate" for me. I like the little "Mom & Pop" places; they not only APPRECIATE my business more, they usually NEED it more. And if they have GREAT FOOD like Chief's does, they DESERVE my business, and YOURS too.I've had the "Big Three" at Chief's, what I refer to as the "B.R.S." for short. That's "Brisket, Ribs, and Sausage". Chief's "B.R.S." are what you should EXPECT from a good BBQ joint in this part of Texas, that being that they are fantastically flavorful, and tender. Chief's IS a Chief, when it comes to BBQ.But one of my favorites isn't exactly Chief's BBQ. It's called "THE BARNEY", and it's a meal on a bun. This mountain of meat consists of TWO CHICKEN-FRIED STEAKS, topped with grilled onions & Jalapenos. Hey, you've gone this far, why not go "all the way" and add some bacon for an extra 99 cents? There's a place in Vegas called "The Heart Attack Grill", and they MEAN it. At least two of their regulars have DIED as a direct result of their food. They probably have something similar to "The Barney" on their menu. But sometimes, if it's REALLY GOOD, ya just gotta "fall off the food wagon", ya know? A "Barney a day" WON'T keep the doctor away, but an occasional one will sure cure your Chicken-Fried Steak fix! To butcher on old saying: "So good, and so NOT good for you." But WICKED TASTY!! Then, you may need a good, loooong NAP.I can testify that all the sides are wonderful too (can I get a Witness?). CHEIF'S DELIVERS, if you live inside their delivery area. I don't know the boundaries of that area, I only know they'll deliver to ME; I live just N. of Wm. Cannon, just W.of Manchaca. Or you can pick up. They also have an inside dining room, and I think a coupla tables outside, but don't hold me to that. I usually order for pickup or delivery.The staff have always been friendly & accommodating to me. Prices are very reasonable. Depending on what you order, the sandwich / entrée itself will be under $10, or just a little over. So using the soon-to-be-famous "Yelp-dollar-meter", it would be a High "$", or a Low "$$" per person. I don't go out much for BBQ. Why? Because I have my OWN smoker, and after years of trial (and LOTS of error), I've perfected my 'Cue. So I only order or go out for BBQ when I don't have any laying around. It's not like whippin' out a burger; a good, tender brisket takes a MINIMUM of 16 hours of slow-smokin'. I typically smoke mine for a full 24 hours. So when ya get hungry around HERE, ya either have some ready, or ya just go to Chief's. I usually just BBQ for myself or a few close friends or Family, on my lil' New Braunfels brand smoker that will hold no more than two briskets at a time. But I've catered a COMPLETE BBQ dinner, sides & all, for OVER FIFTY PEOPLE, on a 20-foot commercial-size trailer / smoker, BY MYSELF. Point is, I KNOW MY BBQ, and have been told by some (not all) that my BBQ is the best they've ever had. The rest of 'em had no complaints. Guess they didn't wanna get slapped (hehe). I'm NOT tryin' to brag here, just to illustrate that I KNOW MY BBQ.And if I like Chief's BBQ, I'm confident that YOU will too. If you live in this part of town ("Far South Austin") and have been "Milling around Bill's", so to speak, give Chief's a shot. You'll enjoy 'em, and you'll be back.FIVE STARS for me!larrythediner.

Jeff catered our wedding, and he and his staff did a kick ass job. There were super easy to work with; did everything they were supposed to. And, we got lots of compliments on the taste and serving sizes.What we had: poppers, deviled eggs, veggie tray, bbq, sides  Highest rated: green beans. do it!

I received a flyer for Cheifs, so I decided to give it a try. The guy who took my order was nice and that is the reason they got a star for my to go order. I got a two meat combination plate: sliced brisket, smoked chicken, potatoe salad, green beans and beer battered fries. Brisket was dry and had little flavor. Chicken had a great smoked skin on it, but had almost no smoked flavor even on the skin(I don't know how this is possible, but they did it.) Potatoe salad was a weird texture like it had gotten water or condensation in it. Green beans were ok. Beer battered fries had no seasoning at all. Their "Bbq sauce" is just a watery mess, but at least it had some seasoning. Maybe they used all their seasoning in their so called sauce?

First time we ordered from this place. It took over 2 hours for the delivery. Food was some of the worst we have ever had. Side order of onion rings came with three small cold bad onion rings. We ended up throwing the food away.

The first issue I had walking in this place was the guys standing around vaping (e-cig) inside THE KITCHEN. If that wasn't bad enough I ordered brisket and asked for burnt ends. Not only did I not get burnt ends I got no ends. Just dry brisket. I told the guy I ordered burnt ends and he tells me "I'm sorry I did the best I could." That's baffling considering the best one can possibly do is cut off the burnt ends and give them to me. There's no technicalities involved. He simply did not want to redo my order. Moving forward then brisket was extremely dry and I will not return. Business was much better 2 years ago when I came.
Austin, TX 78745

My new favorite bbq joint in South Austin.  Not Franklins, but it is a really solid option.  Kind of a hole in the wall but the guys working were friendly.   The brisket and ribs were really good; the green beans and onion rings we kick ass.  The sauce was good with a little spice to it.  I had the barney sandwich.  Two chicken fried steaks with grilled onions and jalapeños; just amazing.  Totally going again next time I'm craving bbq and don't want to drive.  They also will deliver and do a bunch of take out orders.

Great for lunch, they'll deliver if you're close by.  I almost always get the sliced brisket sandwich and for lunch it's pretty fantastic.  I recently stopped by and got one during the dinner hour and it was like chewing a shoe. The sides are average and the other meats are O.K. Definitely a lunch spot, doubtful I'll be back for dinner anytime soon.

Couldn't get my cc number correct after i cant tell you how many times i gave it to the guy. Then I had to order at least $17 worth of food. Ok no biggy. Then it was a 45-1 hour delivery time. It was delivered right on the hour...I'm freaking starving. So I didn't leave a tip does that make me a bad person ... NO but then the delivery guy asked me , No tip?, and i said no...His reply was that sux! WHAT!!! ARE YOU SERIOUS? Well then I open my food up and the BBQ sauce is missing! WTF its a BBQ sandwich how do you forget the sauce and on top of that the BBQ was extremely DRY and cold! Cheese sticks cold! Poor service and food. I learned my lesson.

After running into a large line at Rudy's, I decided to try this place out. I generally prefer smoked meats off my own pit, but as most know, it's a time consuming process. I ordered to go, but I believe they also deliver as well. I'm a self proclaimed bbq nerd, so I will try to keep this from turning into a novel..Good:-Brisket was moist and had some decent bark-Beans had a good flavor and weren't over seasoned-Service was friendly enough and had me out in under 5 min-Turkey was moist and had a good (but not overwhelming) smoke flavor-Prices were reasonableNot so good:-Sauce had tons of spices but the flavors didn't mesh well. Simple is better in my book.-Potato salad lacked flavor and texture I will give them another shot, and try a few other offerings. Certainly would love to see more local businesses in this area and will continue to support south austin entrepreneurs.

I visited this place to see if there was any good BBQ in my South Austin area.  It's kind of rinky dink but a lot of BBQ places are.  The man behind the counter was very friendly and we talked with him about the business and the food.  They have fair prices and their food is good, but not great.My sister and I had the Homer sandwich, fried okra, onion rings, coleslaw, brisket and turkey.  The brisket was a bit dry and surprisingly so was the chopped brisket on the sandwich.  The Homer sandwich was huge, I enjoyed the sausage on it and it wasn't too fatty.  The turkey and okra were really good.  The onion rings were just okay and the coleslaw was okay as well.  That brings me to their BBQ sauce.  It's cumin based and I found that odd for a BBQ sauce, I didn't like it very much.After speaking with the guy behind the counter the "Chief" is an Irish red-headed transplant.  Maybe that accounts for some of the lack luster parts of the food??  That being said I would return here for a pick up or delivery and use the Salt Lick sauce instead of their BBQ sauce.
We'll had the brisket again and it is still the bomb.  Try the fries too and the rings.
You have to try the frys.  Has some of the best brisket around.  Price is good.
When I first tried this place it was great! Then I had an over charge on my card. The next time i had it, the food wasn't cooked all the way. I won't be spending money here anymore

My favorite BBQ joint in Austin hands down-their Ribs are the best in the state-funky roadkill sauce so good it'll bring a tear to your eye.Small space -like 5 tables inside and 2 outside.Awesomely located next to a Tattoo spot,a head shop,and a gas station.What more do you need.Tucked away in deep South Austin-I've been going there for about 7 years-support these guys.
NA
Hutto, TX 78634

I grew up with the original Southside Market in Elgin and when I was passing through Hutto I had to try their newest location! The decor and atmosphere is so open and airy, felt very safe during COVID! The food was, as always, SO DARN DELICIOUS!My order:- Southside Plate - Original sausage, brisket, mac & cheese, and corn on the cob. Seriously my mouth is watering while I write this review because I love this place so much! Their bold and original BBQ sauce is always a perfect pair with their meats and the guilty side of bread.If you love Texas BBQ, stop on it!

I've been anxiously waiting for this place to open since I heard the news. I love the OG Southside Market in Elgin.We pulled up to the drive thru around 4:30pm and there was no line. It definitely got packed while we were waiting for our food. We found out they were out of a lot of meat. What?! At 4:30pm. So we ordered chopped brisket, cheddar jalapeño sausages and pork steak. The chopped brisket sandwiches were so good. We ordered chopped brisket since they didn't have USDA prime brisket. Delicious. The pork steak was amazing. My mom approved and she's a hard critic.Loved everything, but was sad we didn't get to order and that much since they were out.

Went for lunch today 10/21/2020.I always like to beat the crowds and eat around 11:30. The line was short and service quick. I really appreciated the microphone that are used so that we could communicate with masks on. That is a great idea and worked perfectly. I ordered the Brisket Sandwich and Potato Salad. The picture does not look like a lot of food but it was plenty for me. The sandwich was very tasted and had just enough sauce without being messy. The Potato Salad was very good and obviously fresh. I added my Tony's seasoning that I bring everywhere I go eat out but Salt and Pepper would have been all it needed. This is a brand new location and will certainly be a hit in Hutto. I can't wait to bring my wife back for another visit.

Good service. Waiting in line depends on the time of day. We visited last time on Sunday afternoon (yesterday). We beat a rush of people in, which was nice to do. We got through the line quickly and the food was hot and ready to go. I had chicken and sausage with two sides- beans and coleslaw. I prefer the bold bbq sauce on the side as the original has always had a cinnamon-y aftertaste. The bold is peppery but not hot. I also love their hot sauce and it's perfect to dip the chicken/ turkey in. My husband has his favorite- brisket and sausage with Mac and cheese and potato salad. The Mac was amazing- and had plenty of the baked crispy topping on it. I think he ended up with brisket that missed getting fb it's flavor rubdown though, because though it was definitely smoked and moist, there was no seasoning to it. That's not the norm (we are Southside fans) and it was still delicious dipped in sauce. The restaurant is clean and tables were wiped. One Employee was working all the tables and keeping them cleaned. Enjoyable experience.

Good brisket is so hard to find. My husband said "Half fat, half brisket. But the part you can eat is good." I'll second that. We got a pound of their moist option. Unfortunately, it was a little fatty for our liking. The bits we did eat didn't taste BAD, but it was a let down. We also got potato salad, and peach cobbler. Both were fresh and yummy. The lady at the drive thru was very nice, and the service was fast. Sadly, I'm going to have to say we'll probably either drive for better brisket, or make our own at home before we will go back for more of this.
We recently moved here to Hutto and since we love BBQ we decided to stop by.. OMG! This place is beyond amazing! Not only that but the staff is so nice here .

BEST...loaded baked potato I've ever eaten. The portion size was very generous which is great, definitely will be a regular for that reason alone. I also ordered a few slices of brisket to try it out, and man oh man, I was not disappointed. I'm a huge fan of traditional smoked brisket with the simple salt and pepper added for flavor. It was tender with the right amount of fat attached, and it melted in my mouth.
It was really good. I look forward  to eating here more often. Staff was friendly and they came to check on us several times to see if we needed anything. The ice cream was a plus for dessert.
Not surprised SouthSide BBQ in Hutto Averages 3 stars. Service  is horrendous ! They all seem so confused even management. My experience on Mother's Day has me thinking i need to find bbq elsewhere
Hutto, TX 78634
Jonathan the manager was very attentive and kind.. I traveled from Miami and this is a great place for brisket and pork ribs...

We went through the drive thru and ordered cobbler and pudding. 6.50 for both these teenee tiny servings. I asked for ice cream at the window since she had mentioned it was an option. I asked how much, she stared .50 cents extra, so I asked her to add it.  A few moments later she came back and told me that because I ordered it after my initial order, it was going to be 2.00 dollars instead.  Frustrated, I told her no. Nevermind.   She handed us this big bag and so we came home.  Low and behold, the servings are in these tiny cups.  What a rip off.  I hate to think what their food costs and serving sizes are.  Probably not going back any time soon.   Avoid unless you're not hungry and are rich.

Happy about having a location here. I've been going to the one in Elgin. My most favorite item here is the sausage. It's always juicy and has a lot of flavor. This is one sausage that I can eat that doesn't have me in a fetal position after I eat it. Without a gallbladder I can't process beef or fatty food like I used to.The brisket is very moist and that says a lot.  I've never had any issues with service and my order is always on point.

Excellent BBQ! Wanted to try this on opening day but got here the next day. You can call ahead and order online then you don't need to wait in line. Sausage is the king here... Original hot links and sausage slammer!

Finally some good barbeque again north of Wells Branch. When I go to a BBQ restaurant, I want food that tastes good without having to drown it in sauce. Otherwise, I might as well just have baked something in the oven and put sauce on it. Southside did not disappoint last night.Everything was seasoned well, nothing was dry, and extremely well portioned. I wish I had photos, but we were hungry. We split a stuff BBQ potato and a three meat plateBBQ/baked potato was huge with quite a bit of chopped brisket on it. They kindly put the sour cream on the side so it didn't get cool off the potato. It also tasted like an actual BBQ potato! I've been to too many restaurants in Austin were their "BBQ" potato probably looked at the pit for a few minutes for inspiration or something and they called it a "BBQ potato."The three meat plate had their "pork steak", mixed brisket and a chicken breast. Huge portions for the price and my sides were coleslaw and a side salad. The sides were pretty great for a BBQ restaurant, greens and tomatoes were fresh. If you expect great coleslaw, then you might be disappointed - but why are you going to a BBQ restaurant for vegetables? The pork steak was fantastic and was easily my favorite thing on the mixed plate. The chicken was great too, not dry like so many BBQ chicken places (excluding Inka Chicken and Pollo Rico, both have excellent chicken). Brisket was well seasoned and tender - solid brisket.As others have said, the moist brisket had a layer of fat, but I'm beginning to suspect that some demographic in this area prefers that. It didn't bother me too much, but then again I didn't get a huge amount of it. The chopped brisket on the baked potato we ordered didn't have any fatty parts on it, but wasn't dry either.Also, their blackberry cobbler was pretty great. A lot of actual blackberries, which was a welcome surprise, and since I had leftover white bread, I used that as a replacement for the crust. Heresy probably, but it tasted great so I don't mind. Overall, I highly recommend Southside for BBQ that actually tastes good. We placed the order online and picked up curbside which circumvented a lot of the crowd. Note that they only have pickup in the front of the store, so don't look around back for a curbside spot.
Great food and excellent service, interior looks nice and seems very clean and sanitary.

Ok soooooo....... it's a no for me. I know they are new so the pits probably aren't burnt and old and built up yet. I'll be back in about 5 years. Hopefully then the pits will be all nasty and good haha. This was the most flavorless bbq I've EVER had. Granted, the meats were moist. That was good. But absolutely 1000% no flavor. Sausage tasted boiled and ribs tasted baked. No smokey flavor. No pit flavor. Crazy thing is I can actually smell the bbq from the road. Smells great in there too. But the flavors don't come through. Oh.. potato salad was good. I'll keep going to Rudy's, Smokey Moe's. Luling, Lockhart and good trucks.

While the food is good, the service is NOT. We have given this place multiple chances and have been disappointed each and every time. The first 3 orders were each missing SEVERAL items. When we called to try to get a refund for those items, we were told a manager would call us back. Every single time. Which never happened. Getting a manager on the phone seems to be impossible. They are new. We expected some mistakes. Tonight, I placed a pick up order at 4pm, for a 6pm pickup. We still have not received our order and its now 30 minutes past the pickup time. While I understand places get busy on the weekend, this order was placed at 4pm. I feel its ridiculous to have to wait this long for our order when it was placed 2 hours ahead of a scheduled pickup time. Too many issues for us. We will take our business to someone that can fulfill an order correctly and at a more reasonable time. My husband finally went inside after waiting for 40 minutes in the pickup spot, to be told they havent even started our order yet! I had high hopes and was really excited to have something other than the Salt Lick around here. But this place has been a disappointment from our very first order.

I visited this location in Hutto, Tx on Mar 16, 2021 I ordered 5 pork spare ribs and the total cost was $32.64 the ribs had a lot of pure fat and they were disgusting no taste or seasoning.  I will never go to any of the Southside Markets again and will recommend to anyone.
Hutto, TX 78634

Man oh man.  I hung out with some friends and decided to pick this up for dinner.  Our order was pretty big for just 3 folks.  They had preordered for pickup.  My buddy was inside for THIRTY MINUTES waiting to get the order.  He saw so many people come in, order food, get their food and eat while waiting.  Turns out they had given away the sliced brisket that he had ordered.  It took them 30 minutes to figure this out?  They apologized saying "we were slammed and more busy than we expected."  Who does this?  How do you sell food that's already spoken for and then make the customer wait 30 minutes?  No offer of refund.  No offer of discount.  Just a whoopsie daisy and subbed chopped brisket.  Don't get me wrong, the chopped was damn good but if you want SLICED MOIST BRISKET, chopped just don't cut it.  Either way, this whole situation was bungled beyond belief.  My buddy was pretty upset and well, probably won't go back.  Which sucks because it's right down the road.  You'd think a place that's been around for so dang long would have better systems in place.
Their brisket sandwich is amazing and very reasonably priced! Will be getting my bbq fix here from now on

We have been to the Southside Market several times in Austin and had great food and service.  We tried the Southside in Hutto twice and I can't speak about the food because we never got any.  Went there on Friday to order 2 brisket baked potatoes and 1/2 lb. of lamb. After waiting in line for 25 minutes were told they just ran out both by 6:00 PM.  We decided to try again on Saturday and called in a pickup order at 5:35.  The person on the phone was nice enough to check that they had both in available and confirmed that the order would be ready for pickup in 15-20 minutes.  We arrived at the market window at 6:00 and gave them our name.  They looked and said that the order wasn't ready and that it would be another 15-20 minutes.  I asked why another 15-20 minutes and was told that the person taking the order should have never said it's only 15 minutes.  While they were explaining how that never should happen the person standing next to them taking an order stated that their order would be ready in 15-20 minutes.  We waited 20 minutes and watched the entire line of people go through regular line get their orders.  I watched 2 other groups complain to the manager about their order not being ready while we waited.At 30 minutes after arriving I asked where out 2 potatoes and 1/2 pound of lamb was as we could have gone through the line and got our order in the time we waited.  Another person asked me to confirm my name and then told me told they don't have my order and suggested that I called another location.I would recommend visiting the Mopac location, but the Hutto site if you want Southside Market.

Not bad BBQ, but it's not good BBQ either, falls below average in my book.  Better than Dickey's, not as good as Rudy's as far as chain places go, which Southside is quickly becoming.  You can do better and should probably pass.
Outstanding service & amazing food!Special thanks to employees Chris, Laura, & Marty for going above and beyond. They took care of a special order for us. We're very happy! Thank you!!

What a disappointment. I've been waiting for this location to open and could wait to get some good bbq. First time I went I got a bag full of fat instead of brisket. The second time (today) I got several dry hunks of tasteless turkey. They were out of chicken and pork steak and it was only 1:20pm. My wife's chopped brisket tasted "funny" enough to make her not want to eat it.I hoped the Elgin store didn't go this route.
Constantly (3 times) after work between 5:45-6:15 out of food and sides. Twice out of brisket and once out of ribs. I gave the benefit of the doubt the first month but not anymore.

So today was the 2nd attempt of eating at the southside location in Hutto. And the 2nd time we left with nothing because they were sold out. The first time was maybe a month and a half ago. We just chalked that up to it being new and not sure what to make. But tonight at 6:20 we visited again, after standing in line for 15 minutes with nobody taking orders and just walking around looking completely lost a manager came out and said that they were out of everything but sausage. They were out of almost all their sides and all their desserts. At this point there will not be a third try, this just reminds me why I prefer Meyers in Elgin so much better over the southside. It's quite possible that this could be the best tasting barbecue in the world but I will never know because of how poorly ran the management is and I will not waste anymore time going there to try to spend my money with you.

Well, the parking lot is ridiculous at the location in Hutto. If you are someone who goes inside to eat, and there is a line in the drive-through, you will never ever get to leave. I don't know who designed this monstrosity, but they need to be put in jail. Second we were in the drive-through for 45 minutes. When we finally got there we were astounded at how expensive it was to get just a little bit to go for two people. We drove all the way  home to eat our dinner only to discover that we had paid $17 for a pound of chopped brisket but hand received than 1/3 of a pound. When I called them they really couldn't have cared less. I sent them a picture of it on my food scale. They wanted my number so the manager could call me back. All I wanted was my stinking dinner. I had to come up with a solution because the assistant manager had no clue what to do (ended up going back up there to the curbside pickup). After all that the chopped beef was extremely dry & tasteless, the macaroni and cheese had beans in it and the pinto beans had macaroni it them. This would never have worked for people who don't like their food mixed. So for a mediocre meal at best, for two people we spent $40,  had to make two trips, wait 45 minutes in the drive through, 10 minutes in the curbside and the food was not good at all. I'll stick with the local guys. Or Rudy's or my own pit. PS The gal at the window was super friendly and polite. She said thank you for your business. Do you realize how long it's been since someone thanked a customer??  Ages!  That's why this review for two stars instead of one.
Hutto, TX 78634

This review pertains only to the online pick up orders located inside.  I went today to pick up an online order I'd placed.  First I would like to point out that there definitely needs to be 2 entrances to this restaurant - one for dine in and another for pick up orders. The reason is due to the online pickup area being placed in such a poor location; it is right in front of the entrance as soon as you walk in.  When the line builds up here, customers who are entering to dine have to squeeze past customers standing in line to pick up their orders or vice versa. Secondly, the staff does not ask people standing in line if they are there to pick up an order or are they there to place one.  Why does this matter?  Well if you ordered and paid online, the typical customer would like the convenience of just walking in, providing their name, grabbing their food and departing.  Instead, you wait 15 to 20 minutes for the customer in front of you to complete their order, the whole time staring at your own order sitting on the counter.  My complaint today is  for a separate issue.  As I patiently waited in line for 15 minutes to pick up my order, I noticed a small pack of precooked pork ribs marked at a price of $4.98.  I grabbed the pack and when I finally got my turn at the counter, the staff member rang up my ribs but then said, "Wait, this price is not right."  He then commenced to weighing the package, then changed the price to $13.98 and asked me if I still wanted them.  I told him I wanted them at the price they were originally marked at and the customer behind me chimed in to agree with me, stating the obvious, "That is bs and you cannot change the price. You have to honor the price the item originally had!"  The staff member gave some lame excuse about meat being placed out with wrong prices and he was "just doing what he was told".  Got it.  But no apology for the mix up, no customer service AT ALL, just "do you want it or not".  Or not.  And I won't be back either.  Not because of the $7 difference, but for the lack of customer service and best business practices.

I'm wondering why this restaurant still ask theyre teenage employees to drive in winter hazard conditions. People don't need bbq that bad. You're endangering our kids. This shows bad character on management.

We drove out to Hutto eager to have some bbq. Big disappointment!  The brisket & beans were good. The skin on the sausage was almost impenetrable!!  The potato salad was awful. Sorry to say it was a waisted drive

The place is very clean and staff was amazing. I wish I can say the same about the food. I order the 3 meat platter. (Lamb ribs, Brisket, Sausage).. Way too fatty and greasy. I understand some people love Animal fat. Well, I'm not one of them.  I just felt it lack flavor compared to other TEXAS BBQ joints.

Disclaimer: This review started out with 4 stars due to the food being decent my 1st visit,  ended up with 1If you order online then call for curbside pickup YOU'LL NEVER GET YOUR FOOD. They don't answer the phone. Went early in the day, picked up order from drive thru since I couldn't reach anyone after 15 minutes waiting. Chopped beef was good, took me back to childhood at the Elgin location, mac n cheese was delicious too. The lean brisket was tender and flavorful. The sausage was beyond DISGUSTING! Soooo greasy that the filing separated from the casing, more grease than meat! Now today...the 2nd time I went, opted out of cooking dinner and ordered online AT 3PM FOR A 6PM PICKUP waited about 15 minutes with no one answering the phone then finally saw someone come outside that worked there. He went to check for my order, said they didn't have it even though I showed him the paid receipt with date and time stamp. He was very apologetic and kind, wasn't his fault...had to get my kid outta the car & go inside to have the manager look at my receipt...chick behind the counter was fussing saying that people shouldn't be making online orders, like it was our fault that they had a system issue (there were numerous folks having order issues waiting) bout an hr later, finally received my order only to find it mostly missing...20 more minutes go by, I'm watching the drive thru line slowly move and I'm seeing people get their curbside orders, even though I've been waiting well over an hour at this point...dude comes outside a with no food apologizing and offering a refund that he still had to go back inside to request...I understand being busy and having glitches in the system BUT if you want to be a new business in an up and coming area, HAVE YOUR ISH TOGETHER!! Time wasted after working all day, no dinner and still gotta go cook after all...Gave this Southside Hutto location two tries, won't give it a third.

Have always loved Southside's food, and it is just as good at the new locations. However, service at the Hutto location has so far been disappointing. Last visit I called in a to-go order, was told it would be 30 minutes, and it turned out to be almost an hour. In addition, there were no pickles or onions, no sauce, and whipped cream for only one of the 2 orders of banana pudding. When I went inside to pay, there seemed to be lots of staff doing nothing, and one person (who was taking care of me) working very hard. Her name was Tracey, and she had only been there 4 days. Get it together, Hutto!

First time been to a Southside Market.  Great location in Hutto. Ordered inside to go. Efficient and friendly. Extra moist brisket uses deep chewy rub that do not care for. You see a slicer, but not liking the tiny end piece of brisket thick slices he cut.  They don't show you what it looks like or see the scale its weighed on.  Sides of slaw and mac tasty. Southside barbecue sauce very thin, tomato juice consistency and flavor.  Fountain sodas only.  Great to try it out, but sticking with Rudy's!

Waited a few days to visit to let the traffic die down, totally worth it! Ordered the south side plate combo with Mac and cheese and beans. Super yummy and a nice amount of sides. Highly recommend. My only complaint is that they put onion/pickles in the same to go box with meat and it all got mixed together a bit. But that's just a personal problem haha from me not liking pickles. Can't wait to go again!

Terrible quality food, specifically asked for LEAN Brisket so the guy slices the meat at an angle to make it look like there was less fat. LEAN Means no fat. The turkey is the driest turkey I have ever had. It was so dry we could only eat a small amount. The sausage is good but too greasy. The sausage slammer was good. Piece of advice if you want good barbecue then don't eat here. It's really sad we were looking forward to them coming to Hutto. The worst $41 I have ever spent in my life. So disappointed.
Austin, TX 78753

Here we go again- another takeout review!! Although I can't speak to the sit down experience at First Chinese, the atmosphere was warm and welcoming the entire time we were there- although we got there very close to closing time (15 mins), they waved us in anyway and took our order. The staff were so friendly, the place was clean and had Chinese and English newspapers in the waiting area, and the food was AMAZING. Incredibly authentic Chinese- I haven't had duck like theirs anywhere except Beijing! We got the duck, snow pea leaves (very crisp and nicely salty) and the crispy noodle with pork sauce. Everything tasted great, and we will be back. Thank you First Chinese BBQ!
column21: Far West Side, San Antonio, TX

column20: Ok, I have had Chinese BBQ in Los Angeles, New York, Las Vegas, San Francisco, Southern China and Hong Kong and points in between. Their BBQ pork or Cha Siu is wonderful. Their beef chow fun is on point. The roast duck is crispy and delicious. Nice team of employees, efficient and get you in and out quickly. Good menu of Chinese food and priced fairly. Not cheap. Not expensive. Austin does not have a ton of Chinese BBQ, but that's ok as we have this restaurant. It's also convenient to MT Supermarket, a pho shop, a bahn mi spot and other Asian food. When I went recently, it take out only. Not sure if indoor dining is back.

I come here so often that almost everyone in my life knows it's going to be my first answer to "what's for dinner?" The fun part is, no one really knows what my order's going to be!
