Honestly, so much of this menu is delicious. My absolute faves are the salt and pepper shrimp, the salt and pepper pork chops, eggplant with pork, BBQ pork, flat noodle with beef, seafood crispy noodle, and chicken sweet corn soup. They've been GREAT during COVID and double bag things that might leak, poke small holes in boxes with crispy food so it stays crispy in transit, and NEVER miss a beat with requests. Great flavor, reasonable prices, expansive menu, and always hot and fresh. 5/5 stars, my absolute favorite. One note of caution: For some reason they have the SPICIEST chili oil in the business. Eat at your own risk!

I love Chinese bbq and this has got to be some of the best I've tried. We ordered the trio of tongue ear and tripe and I highly recommend this plate. It may seem like a strange choice but trust me you'll definitely enjoy the depth of flavor and textures. The tongue was definitely my favorite. The walnut shrimp is such a guilty pleasure, I love the creamy sauce and the thin crispy batter on the shrimp. The walnuts was caramelized and added a nice sweetness. Broccoli to make you feel better about yourself, but just a bit bland. The marinated bbq pork and chicken was such a highlight! The chicken was a great surprise, so extremely tender and the skin was fatty and delicious. They were out of duck this time so we decided on the chicken and had no regrets. The pork was so flavorful. It almost had a hint caramel or maple syrupy sweetness, a bit more charred bbq texture and so good. You need to try this place asap, I will be back to get the duck next!

Be careful fat guy in register just looks to to take advance at any moment . He will charge you more if you're not paying attention. Food was cold and average. Probably the most dishonest joint in that area . Trash
Found bugs inside my soup lid. Ordered 2 whole ducks, water spinach, and roasted pork. Didn't realize i asked for bugs and sour soup  absolutely disgusted.

First Chinese BBQ has been a frequent go-to for me but I hadn't been there in awhile so when I was craving roast duck yesterday I decided it was time to pay them a long overdue visit. I arrived shortly after they opened at 11am so you'd think I'd be getting the freshest of the fresh in regards to their meat selection. Well when I got home I was quite disappointed to find that the 4 pcs of duck I was given were primarily bones and the few pieces of roast pork I got were either tough, unedible or just pure fat (barely any meat). So sad after such great past experiences...In addition, the gentleman behind the counter stated that they are currently not offering any lunch specials (as of 10/27/20).

For lunch yesterday I wanted noodles so I purchased To-Go from First Chinese BBQ. I've been here a couple times before and I have never been disappointed. The thing I love most about this spot is their Chinese BBQ meat selection which is set up at the front of the restaurant. I decided to order the Beef Flat Rice Noodles and a Quarter of Roast Duck. The portion size is excellent for the price paid. There was so much food that my daughter and I shared and still had leftovers for dinner. The noodles were a little on the oily side but was still delicious nonetheless. The Roast Duck was wonderful as always. It's soft, tender and juicy meat with crispy and flavorful skin. In the past I've had their fried rice, sesame chicken, wonton noodle soup and they've all been great.
Good food. Bad register. Charged me a full duck instead of half wanted to see if he noticed didn't even give me my receipt smh oh well it is what it is.
Austin, TX 78753

Roasted pork has no flavor. The skin was not crispy, in fact it was chewy, tough, and flavorless. We saw the quality of the meat that they gave us and requested another piece but was turned down. I wasn't expecting great customer service, but I'm not surprised at how rude they came off.

The char siu here was excellent. It has the perfect flavor. The house crispy noodles was also really delicious. Our last dish we ordered was the walnut shrimp, which tasted good as well. I am not as a big a fan of walnut shrimp, so not giving it more praise. Covid restrictions still in place as of 1/28/21 with no dine in service. First time was a success, and I plan to be back for more.

Huge portion of delicious food at very affordable price. Do try their roast duck wonton noodle and house crispy noodle.In my opinion, best roast duck in town, super flavored, crispy outside and juicy inside.They take really good precautions during covid, feel safe to order.

First Chinese Barbecue, is my kind of place. Do you like some delicious BBQ from a Chinese kitchen. You came to the right place. Delicious. Good. Tasty. Great service. Are some of the words that describe the First Chinese Barbecue.Living for most of my life in NYC, I had the opportunity to walk a block or two and taste some delicious Asian food. Name a country or region in Asia and I had my go-to place.Austin, I have found to be a tough sell for outstanding Chinese food. They have plenty of take out locations with Americanize Chinese Food. While tasty. I need the real deal. The First Chinese Barbecue has that Flushing Chinatown feel.As soon as you walk in, a wall full of roast duck hanging. Guest what I want to eat. My order was the roast duck and pork combo. To start it was delicious. The pork was well seasoned with that crispy skin that snaps. Awesome. Some may find duck a tad fatty. I was in heaven. Not healthy, but anything good in life is not healthy...lol. Lots of flavors. A gaming taste that worked. The skin was tasty. Very tasty combo.The staff was about to have their meal when I sat down. Take a look at their meal (picture below). It looked good. Real good. I was going to join them. My kind of meal. Rice. Veggie. Soup. All good.First Chinese Barbecue is located in The Chinatown Center. Lots of stores with a supermarket with Asian influence. Going to have fun working my way through all of them.Thanks, First Chinese Barbecue for my Flushing Chinatown restaurant. Delicious experience. Cheers...

Best Chinese Food in Austin, Texas. Their Sauteéd Chinese Broccoli  is absolutely delectable and the Orange Chicken is stellar. Their fried dumplings are wonderful too, but you can't order them on their Chowbus delivery service Menu.   Honestly, that's the only drawback I can give this place. The service and quality of the food is always fresh and delicious.

Really do love the food- always come in to get our Chinese fix when we are traveling through, which is often.  Lots of locals coming out today. We love the braised Pork and roasted duck with the fresh pickled cabbage, the crispy noodle dish and the duck pho are always consistently delicious. The rating is really for service.  It was so so today. What stood out was the bus service..noisy clanging of dishes and utensils being thrown into the bussing receptacle was just extremely too loud, it would startle a sleeping baby. Just felt it wasn't necessary to clean up around your patrons in this manner.

This place is a little treasure of China! The bbq roast pork is mmmmmmmhmmmmmmmmhhmm muy delicioso! Must try. You should come on a Saturday when it's made at its best and fresh. The pig skin is super crispy and the seasoning is on point with full of seasoning. Employees are really nice and kind. When you walk in to the restaurant you will see a hot display table where you can pick your roast bbq, Chinese bbq, Peking duck, and other foods to go if you choose. You can even watch the chef cut your meats. The roast pork is served with steam rice on the side. Another dish for all those vegetarian or tofu lovers is the touch-fried salted soft tofu dish is a must try it. It's pretty tasty! The dish is simple but really tasty. It has jalapeños so if you don't want your mouth burning simply just eat the tofu lol The Peking duck here is decent. The dish is served with buns and green onions and a hoisin sauce. Usually the duck skin is crispy but for some reason the duck we had there wasn't and the duck had a lot of fat. Not the best duck I've had but okay if you had a craving. Prices for food, flavor, quality, and service is overall great. I would come back to try their other dishes!
The best take out in Austin. Fast, authentic and friendly. I highly recommend the the duck soup with dumplings.

During COVID (at least till August 2020) this restaurant only offer call-in/in person food pickup and take out, but still very convenient - just call to order and pay there later when you pick up. Food is as good as always and kudos to the packaging - stir fried food has extra layer of aluminum foil in the box which prevent leakage and soaking boxes. Note the online menu in their website is not complete - menu photos in yelp is better. Make sure you take a paper copy there for your next call.
Austin, TX 78753

I have been a regular for last 12 years but It took coron'a'pocalyse to get to this review. Here is our favoritesSpicy fish fillet... it's close to Schezwan style.Beef stew hot potBeef flat noodle/ soft noodleAll the leafy stir fries are amazing... our favorite snow pea leaf... if u have only one chance to be here and don't want to go too adventurous the above list is your go to list.      They have some of the best servers and very hospitable owner.
Tasty and fresh. The huge lazy susan on the table made it easy to pass the shared items.  Nice place to order a variety of dishes to share and sample the large menu. Yum!

I've been craving Chinese food, and this place satisfied my craving! We came here for Saturday dinner with a group of 10 people, and there was no wait!Pros- Wait staff is super friendly and fast. Our waiter suggested various dishes we would like- The dishes came out really fast and tasted really fresh!- My favorite dishes were the pork bbq and the fried peppered tofu! They were so flavorful! I probably could've ordered 5 plates each of those dishes- The dishes come with white rice, and since we were sitting at a round table there was a lazy susan that made it easy to pass the food around- Prices of the dishes were reasonable, and the food portions were perfect for sharingCons- Our seating was a bit cramped. I was sitting on the inside against the wall, so whenever I had to use the restroom others had to get up to let me out- There was a flickering light that needs to be replaced- I wish the menu included some pictures of the food items! Thank you to previous Yelpers for posting pictures! It definitely helped to make our ordering process easier.

Our waiter and waitress were nice and polite which was a surprise only because we became used to the rude service at Ho Ho. We'll be frequenting FCQ much more and forget Ho Ho. I was craving the shrimp wonton soup here so we drove all the way here for that. Best shrimp wonton soup in town!! My daughter loves the crispy skin on their roast pork and we liked that the pork was a lean cut.  The sauteed snow pea leaves were cooked with a balanced flavor. Our food came out quickly too. There's a "Specials" board in addition to items in their regular menu. The bill comes out written with hand written Cantonese characters. Next time, we'll sample other dishes on their extensive menu!

Love this place!!! Very good prices for a large amount of food. This is my favorite Chinese bbq restaurant. I want to try everything on the menu. The Duck and BBQ pork with rice was so good. I prefer roasted pork over BBQ pork. But they're both delicious. The seafood crispy noodles are amazing. The Salted fish Salted Fish & Chicken Fried Rice was great. The Chinese broccoli and mushroom was so tasty. The gravy was rich and delicious. Five stars!!!!

We were looking for a Chinese restaurant while traveling in the area.  Stumbled upon this Chinatown Strip and chose This restaurant based on reviews.  It definitely didn't disappoint.  Everything was so flavorful and the BBQ pork was amazing!Would definitely return!

This is the best Chinese food in Austin hands down. I live in downtown Austin and make the drive to this place quite often. The bbq pork soft noodles are my favorite. Other notables include the sweet and sour pork, general tso chicken, salt and pepper pork, young chow friend rice, and the scallion beef.
Every time I drive across town; I would make a trip here to have my favorite Chinese roast duck and BBQ pork.

This deserves a 6th star. The service is responsive, friendly, and helpful. Our baby touched hot water and began to cry, the server offered lotion and desert to him. The fried rice cooked with high heat on the wok is what I was looking for. All the dishes are made very well and the chef in the back deserves recognition as well as the servers. What a great small community where everyone is at their best. Will come back once we are out of quarantine.
Austin, TX 78753

I've eaten at the restaurant once but have ordered takeout a couple of times. I've had their bbq duck and their pork blood/chives dish. Their bbq duck was just decent but I wouldn't say that it's the best I've ever had. I've been spoiled with all of the options in the So Cal area. Their pork blood and chives dish is on point, though. There's a consistency that I look for in the pork blood cubes. For me, it's the softer kinda like soft tofu. They are super consistent with this dish which keeps me happy. My order has always been right and their prices are very reasonable. I would definitely come back!

Roast Chicken, Roast Duck, Roast Pig...are you looking for those meats that they only serve in very traditional type Chinese restaurants? Look no further.I've been coming here for months and I remember the very first reason I did was because it's so hard to find a place that serves roast pork belly or whole roast duck in Austin, I'm talking like the type that hangs delectably with of course the head still intact. This place for sure is my go to for any traditional type meals for noodles, veggies, and of course meats. The great thing of course about any of the roast meat options you can just order to go right at the front as they have usually a stock ready to go and fresh.As far as food my go to here is anything lo mein (noodles) and beef. Fairly traditional type meals at good prices too. I've usually caught this place not during prime hours so I can't speak on how service is then, but the times I have gone service was good and friendly, helpful too if you're unfamiliar with items on the menu.Next item I hope to get is a Whole roast Pig. Fully body and all.

Went here open minded for the first time. Ordered the pork bbq with crispy noodles, egg rolls, hot and sour soup, and the steamed buns. I was very disappointed with my food. The noodles tasted like a funnel cake, pork bbq had no flavor. The hot and sour soup was alright but nothing special. Never going here again. Egg roles tasted weird, very mushy.
I vouch for the chicken fried rice. It's plentiful, fresh and not greasy. The egg rolls were $1 each and were greasy, but tasty. Service was fast and nice and pricing was very reasonable.
I've converted to a primarily vegetarian diet, with my splurge being Peking duck from first Chinese. Maybe it's because I've never ate it elsewhere, or maybe I hit gold at the first place I tried it.
Just moved to Austin, and somehow I landed right next to Chinatown! Woooo! Anyways, I've Eaten here 4 days in a row. Everyone of them has been delicious.

Why yes, Virginia, there are seven zillion strip mall places we can choose from. But here's why First Chinese still rules: 1. They've got the best cheap & good weekday lunch specials in town. One day I'll actually get close to the $10 credit card minimum. 2. Anglos can fill their table with broccoli dishes, and Chinese families can do stuff I've never seen before. And First Chinese doesn't judge you publicly, they just keep bringing it out. Day after day. If you need to play "A Christmas Story" in Austin, here you go. Oppan Cantonese Style. No wall plaques for hip & cool here, and don't confuse quiet efficiency with curtness. If we're going for trendster fusion, I've got a separate list for that. For me, First Chinese is about that single cup of hot & sour soup, that's served frigging steamy hot. I call it, "Pearl of the Quarter."I'd also say hold off on the BBQ duck & pork until you're with a group - you'll get a ton of it, it'll be better, and that's how it's supposed to be done. Perfectly okay to disagree. And I'm pretty sure this is a Dallas family that started with one restaurant thirty years ago, and now have thirty different restaurants in a dozen cities or so. I'm first to applaud the American Dream. But First, I'm going to do a little hot & sour. And then maybe some eggplant.

Another childhood Chinese restaurant. Only this one sells duck that my family and I actually eat. The food here is always solid. I enjoy their roast duck and their seafood fried noodles as my lunch. Their fried noodles have a satisfying crunch to it, and the roast duck is a great deal for the amount of duck you get.  During formal dinner meals with family, I'm always the errand girl of the household to drive over and buy a whole roasted duck. Parking is not a problem. First Chinese Barbeque is located at Chinatown North at Lamar, so the whole parking lot is huge. While the designated parking for First Chinese Barbeque is commonly taken by other cars, you can still walk from a further parking spot without the risk of being towed. Late lunch is the best time to visit. Lunchtime itself is also acceptable because First Chinese Barbeque never is packed. Mostly Chinese people here. I see the occasional non-Asian person that eats lunch, but they're usually on the elderly side. First Chinese Barbeque has been at Austin for years.

The last time I came here they told me the prices had gone up but they hadn't changed the menus yet.  The very rude young Chinese waitress didn't say a word to us and then brought us our check long before we were done.  And the establishment itself could use a DEEP cleaning. The duck is okay, everything else is drowned in oil.  I do NOT recommend this place.
Austin, TX 78753

FOOD//I had the duck shared with friends and really enjoyed it. The buns they provide were so great and soft, but it was definitely not made fresh. Water was off meaning tasted like the sink water ):ATMOSPHERE//Entering the restaurant, you see lovely duckies waiting to be eaten - so, it was #shook. The restaurant had an odd odor and humid-like air. SERVICE//Maybe it is just asian place, but put that smile on your faces.SURROUNDINGS//It's part of chinese plaza.

This is one of the best places in Austin for Chinese food. The large strip mall is full of other Asian businesses with plenty of parking. The bbq pork and roast duck is better than I've had in some large city Chinatowns. Every entree we've tried hasn't disappointed. They have a huge menu and a lot of it is authentic Chinese food.

Two words: real deal! Today was the first time to try this place - I came here for char siu pork but was doubly excited to see they had beef tendon too!! We were on our way out of town after getting dim sum and getting Asian groceries but I saw this place and wanted to check out their char siu, which unfortunately I haven't had in a while. This brings back fond memories as a kid going to chinatown on the weekends with my family.I just tried the char siu pork and beef tendon and they are so juicy and flavorful and so tender. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town. Happy New Year!

Wait staff was very short. Not like in stature or anything.. Their attitudes were just really lacking in personal skills.. no tableside manners or checking in on us for items we might need. Water refills, napkins, nothing..Food took forever too, like they forgot to ring it in and when they did bring our meals out they would bring them only one at a time at varying increments; leaving everyone else without something. On top of that the food was cold upon arrival and they fled immediately upon dropping off the plates all while making little to no effort to check on the meal.Lastly, we timed the duration of the last person to get their food from the second to last person to receive their food. It took 14 minutes. For shrimp and veggies Collectively, we waited an hour to so get cold food. With all the other options in the strip, I'll go to a different one next time.

Delicious. As long as you know what fits your pallette, you will find that the taste fits the portions and the price affordable for it. Go for the Spicy Fried SquidSpicy Crispy Tofu6 buns priced at .50 cents per bun Roast PorkYou cant go wrong with that.

I've been coming to this restaurant for years and years! With every visit, I'm left with a happy heart and a hefty bag of leftovers. Who doesn't love leftovers?? HELLOW.First off, there's no fluff when it comes to the staff. They're quite prompt when it comes to seating you, getting your drink, and taking your order. The menu is extensive, but it's okay, everything I've ordered here I've ended up liking, so don't be afraid! This is your chance to be adventurous. One thing you must order though is their BBQ Pork! Their style of BBQ is a bit on the sweet style, but it goes so swell with their steamy white rice. My go to order is the BBQ Pork, Chinese Style Broccoli with the white/garlic sauce, and the Combination Soft Noodle.This establishment is perfect for a causal date, family or friendly outing, or even a quick spot for take-out! It's honestly great for any time and with anyone so hurry and get the BBQ. If not, I will for sure!
If you want the most bang for your buck, go here!!! Such generous portions and the food is actually good! This is my go-to for Chinese food in Austin.

The wait was ridiculous. My friends and I were hoping to eat dim sum at a restaurant nearby but was told it would be a 45 minute wait so we came here to First Chinese instead. Big mistake. While we got seated right away, we waited OVER 45 minutes for our food. Clearly, we should've waited the 45 minutes for dim sum. A 45+ minute wait for food is absurd.While this was my first time at the Austin location, I have frequented the Richardson (a Dallas suburb) location multiple times. You can usually always count on First Chinese to whip up some solid Chinese cuisine. But the long wait for food after ordering was just a major turnoff. We ordered the beef flat noodle, crispy seafood noodle, salty fried squid and the roast pork & BBQ pork plate. The beef flat noodle wasn't as flavorful as I remembered. The beef itself was super tender and the noodles were all consistently soft. The crispy seafood noodle was solid and hefty. Good flavors and huge portion. The salty fried squid was also very delicious. I loved all the spicy jalapeño peppers that it came with. Consistent fry, good chewy texture to the squid, and overall great taste. What I don't understand is they have all this roast pork and BBQ pork out in the front in the BBQ area yet it was the last of our items to arrive. I figured the roast pork and BBQ pork plate would be easiest to prepare seeing as they always have those items ready to go - they just need to chop it up and put it on a plate. The roast pork was off the day we went. The crispy, crunchy skin is supposed to be the best part but it was on the chewy side. The pork meat itself lacked flavor and had a tougher texture. We usually get a mixture of dark meat and white meat but all our roast pork slices were white meat. The BBQ pork was so not the business either. Good flavor which is to be expected from First Chinese but the pork tasted overcooked. It wasn't as tender as it should have been.

Good stuff.  Some of the best Chinese food I have had in years.  The duck may be a little expensive but that's because they put in the work to make it easier to consume.  On another note, I figured I'd try the orange chicken.  Delicious.  This kind of establishment is mainly good when you arrive with a group of friends, at least four altogether preferably.  That way, everyone can try a little bit of everything because the portions are huge.  Parking is easy to find, even on busy weekends.  There is a huge lot off of Lamar right in front of this restaurant inside the Chinatown area.  Service was pretty sufficient and flexible.  I asked for a to go container for the rice and they had no problem providing one.I would definitely return to try more off the menu.  Hopefully bring along some other friends as well.
Round Rock, TX 78681

Probably our family's favorite BBQ place in the Austin area. Their brisket is always super tender and moist with excellent flavor. The turkey is very good, but not moist enough to be considered great. Sausage is good too. Their sides are fantastic and the portions are generous. Since COVID we've really appreciated the family pack to go.

We have eaten at Pok-E-Jo's for years.  It is our favorite BBQ. Tonight I put an order online and Favor was to pick up and deliver it.  The driver said he delivered it but never even picked it up!  The wonderful manager at Pok-E-Jo's delivered it herself!  Way to go!  What a great restaurant who goes above and beyond for their customers!

Really good barbecue, great customer service, I will definitely come back soon.The food: I went with the pork ribs, as well as the sausage, some sort of casserole and banana putting. I really enjoyed the ribs. They were full of flavor and very tasty. The sausage was good as well. The sides were just as good too. I think my overall favorite though was the banana pudding. They had a pudding was very very good.Customer service, amazing customer service. The people here are very friendly and very nice. They make sure food comes out fast as it's pretty much ready to be served. We had quite a bit of a party we didn't have to wait at all. Everyone was very nice and they checked on her table several times.This is a local favorite, as they got very packed during lunchtime. I will definitely come back here again when I'm in the area. Great job guys and girls

I ordered on the phone based on the rave reviews.  When I arrived, there were three employees at the register.  One girl and man were talking and did not acknowledge me.  Finally, the third girl asked why I was there.  Also, though it was 430 pm on a Sunday there was not one person eating in the restaurant.  I waited about 15 minutes for my order.   No need to order by phone. Sadly, when I got to my son's home, I found very grizzly, fatty brisket that had very little edible meat.  The chicken was OK as was the mac n cheese.  The fruit salad was grapes. The bread was a loaf of bread from HEB, still in the store plastic. The original BBQ sauce was good. Don't go here -- marginal food, poor service and very pricy for what you get.

We have eaten some great bbq across the USA. This was good  bbq. Tender brisket, juicy chicken and fall off the bone ribs. Plenty of side choices and  the employees were super nice. Tucked in a corner of a shopping center with outside seating too.

I have only been living in Round Rock 7 months and have never dined at this Poke-E-Jo's.I last lived near their location at Parmer and Lamplight Village in Austin. I ate their often.Two years ago I discovered they served brisket chili between January and March. That year and last year I ate their brisket chili often as it was very tasty and different than regular chili.I have always ordered it as "Frito Pie" with the chili laid on top of a bed of Frito corn chips and shredded cheese and onions on top of the chili.It might have been the time of day I was at the Round Rock location (about 7:00 PM on a Friday evening) but this year's first serving of the Frito  Pie wasn't as good as I remembered from their Parmer Ln store.The chili itself was not served as warm as it should have been, and the overall taste of the chili was that it had been sitting on the steam table for too long. It was a bit dry and lacked the flavor I was expecting. The presentation wasn't as nice either. As you can see from the photo I have posted, it was served in a bowl. At Parmer Lane last year and the year before, the served it on a large square dining plate. I was able to easily add some pico de gallo and extra onions. All fall I was waiting for January when Poke-E-Jo's had Frito Pie on the menu. It is now February 2 and I am concerned I am going to be disappointed the rest of the season. Maybe I will just drive the extra distance to the Parmer Ln store.

Omg! This place was amazing! We walked in, and the guy behind the counter asked if it was our first time here. We said yes, since we hail from the west coast, and he responded, "where have you been?!"; seriously, where have we been?!?! Ordering is cafeteria style, so super easy to read the menu and decide what you want because you can see the food! We ordered the 3 meats combo, which comes with Texas style bread, and two sides (or you can get one side and a drink instead).For the meats, we ranked the chicken as #1 (get dark meat), then the ribs, and the brisket. Though all of them were amazing! For sides, we got the corn bread casserole and Mac & Cheese. The Mac & Cheese has got to be the cheesiest Mac & Cheese ever! We also got the lone star beer, because what is BBQ without beer? ;) The condiments bar is also on point! All the pickles and pickled jalapeño compliment the meats wonderfully! P.S. when you walk in, it's highly recommend by the knot as a caterer for weddings! I would definitely cater from here if I was local!

I am spending time to write a review because I don't want other customers have the same experience as mine. We ordered for pickup on Sat 8/22/20 and there's a mistake on one of the order that found out when we are already back home. We ordered rib but they put something else instead. Unfortunately, what I really wanted to try was their ribs on that day. My husband was very angry because he spent time ordering it and wanted me to have ribs. Plus he put generous tip to help out during COVID. I called and was told with very unfriendly tone (made me feel like they were talking with someone who was fishing for a free meal), agreed that they would give me a refund only that order that costed $17. And I should see the refund on Monday morning. Today Wednesday 8/26, I still see no refund. $17 is not that big money for us but they sure have lost one customer forever. We are not happy with the taste of their food anyway so I will be happy to: 1. Drive father for other BBQ even though this place is very close to our house. 2. Warn other new people in town NOT to go to this place unless you want to waste your money.

The problem with BBQ places is that they are inconsistent in food quality.  I came to this location because I ate here once before and it was good.  Today the pork was almost all fat.  I could only eat about half what I paid for.The staff is very friendly and the cowboy atmosphere is nice.   But I came to eat the barbecue that I paid for and that didn't happen tonight.  It was a fail.
Round Rock, TX 78681

Best brisket I've had in quite a while (which is saying a lot in Texas), and the broccoli salad was a tasty surprise. The pinto beans, sadly, were way too salty, and the baked potato salad was pretty much just mashed potatoes with cheese. But I'll be back for more brisket!

Called Pokejo's in RR to place an order to be picked up. NO. They don't take call in orders anymore. You have to come in and order. I tried ordering online but couldn't get it to work. Just how is that safer? You would think less person to person exposure would be a good thing.

Thanks for leaving your feedback Missy, I apologize for the frustration we caused. Your experience was a one day thing just due to our super high order volume for the day before Thanksgiving. We had around 300 preorders today along with a large amount of people looking to get food to take home, and as such we decided that we could only accommodate one of the two between online ordering and call ins. We picked online orders, but got so busy that we had to close these off part way through the day as well. This is all a long way of saying that it was truly a one off, and we will be back to taking orders online, over the phone, and in person again on Friday. We take the safety of our staff and guests very seriously, and even staged all of our pick up orders outside today. We really appreciate your feedback, and hope you'll give us another shot some time so we can show you our commitment to safety and service. Regards,John, manager

LOVE me some Pok-E-Jo's!! When it's fresh, it's best! I ordered several side quarts for a birthday party for my Mom (jalapeno corn bread casserole and potato salad) they were packaged perfectly and waiting for me at pick up. The Manager offered to help me carry everything out to my car which was genuinely appreciated.The sides were absolutely delicious and were a big hit.Very well ran establishment with excellent management!

Wow!  How did this happen?!?  We drive hours for good BBQ. Maybe it's because it's in a strip mall but this place is 10 minutes from our house and we've never been here. I thought we had but nope, never!We ordered the three meet plate and an extra 1/4 lb of beef sausage. Brisket, pulled pork, turkey and beef sausage. The brisket was a little dry but everything else was tasty!  Our favorite was the pulled pork. It wasn't drenched in sauce, just really tender and juicy. Our sides were the hash brown casserole and sautéed veggies. We actually preferred the sautéd veggies. They were a little spicy. We had sauce on the side. Me habanero and my hubby the Original. The habanero was really spicy and good. I liked you could get pico de gallo on the condiments bar. Jalapeños, onions, sliced and spear pickles. Definitely will be back.

I've had much better bbq in Austin and Houston. Surprised at the high ratings.KIDS CHOPPED BEEF SANDWICH + Fries $5- the sandwich was decent, not much flavor but the BBQ sauce helped. At least it wasn't fatty meat. I wasn't too hungry so it was a good size. The fries were salty. How do you mess up fries.SAUSAGE- kinda mushy. I like mine firmer BRISKET- not much flavor, but it was tender and not fattyMAC N CHEESE- the only thing I liked. Thick and cheesy. FRIED OKRA- eh

28 minutes on hold. Tried to call with another phone in case they forgot. Just kept ringing. Tried to order online. Only available for tomorrow. Drive there: they were dead as hell. The manager cut my meat without gloves on. Told the manager to get his shit together. I would be surprised if this place lasts another 5 years open.

First time eating at this location, but I'm the Duke of Pok-E-Jo's. Everyone enjoyed their meals and left stuffed. The staff was very nice, the place was clean, and they have folks who come by to check on you, pick up your trays, and get your to go boxes. They have ALL of the free onions, pickles, and jalapeños you want. Unlike the greedy owner of Rudy's in Round Rock who charges for jalapeños which is an unforgivable sin in Texas.

6 employees behind the counter,  15 customers in line....  One person serving a customer who is taking a very long time, asking questiions etc. Not a single other employee is noticing or caring about the line building up, they are all standing at their stations doing nothing. I can't remember the last time I saw a place so inefficient.
Round Rock, TX 78681
Very good bbq - reasonably priced and great atmosphere!  The staff was very friendly!  Definitely recommend for a quick bite!

I like the food here but trying to order anything out is a nightmare. They cannot get an order right. If they run out of something they just throw mac n cheese with every order without even thinking if its wanted or not and its not communicated to have the items removed or the order redone.  I won't be ordering or eating here again. I'll just go to the Parmer one.

This review is long over due. I am writing this review for an order that was delivered a few months back. I ordered the family pack and two Super Spuds. The family pack was enough to feed three adults and two children and have left overs. I ordered the family pack with 1  1/2 lbs. sliced chicken, 3 pint sides,  1/2 pint PoK-e-Jo's BBQ sauce, and breadThe chicken for the family combo was tender and full of flavor. The Super Spuds came with 1/4 lb of meat each. The Super Spuds can actually serve as one meal for an adult person as it is a real "meat and potatoes" dish. The food was delivered quickly and did not disappoint. I will order this from Pok-E-Jo's via Yelp again.

I returned to Pok-E-Jo's Round Rock with a group of folks for an appreciation dinner for a friend and was very pleased with Pok-E-Jo's for accommodating our party on a Friday night.  I called 10 days in advance to reserve some tables in the front room, and they promptly confirmed our reservation via email.  When we arrived, they rearranged the tables so our group could also sit together.  We ordered our meals in the serving line and the food was promptly ready for us.  The food was good as usual, as we had no complaints, consistent with them recently being named one of five finalist for best barbecue in the Austin area as voted on by readers of the Austin Chronicle. You can also pre-order your meal so that you are guaranteed to get exactly what you want without the risk of them running out of a certain meat.  We decided to roll the dice and order when we arrived, and they unfortunately were out of chicken and turkey, which was our own fault for not pre-ordering (we were just not sure what we wanted or how much we wanted).  They had plenty of sides that we wanted, and they gave us all the bread we wanted including buns without charging us extra, which was much appreciated.  We brought our own cake, and they gladly provided us some small plates without a plating charge or giving us grief.  They have definitely improved upon their customer service since I provided a review last year.Note - to reserve the front room all to yourself, you have to put up $250 up front and then pay anything above that.  However, if you want to reserve some tables at the risk of not having the front room to yourself, then there is no booking charge.  In summary, I would definitely return with a large group and appreciate the hospitality shown to us and definitely recommend Pok-E-Jo's in Round Rock for large parties.
Thanks for taking the time to leave us this review Chris! We really appreciate you bringing in your group, and we look forward to seeing you back in again some time soon.Regards,John, manager

I visited their store on Parmer Lane last week, so I thought I would try the Round Rock store as well.  I ordered the same meal as last week - a quarter chicken, white meat, which included a breast and wing.  You can order it either white meat or dark meat, and the price is very reasonable at $3.99 before taxes.  They offer lots of different sides, but I went with just the chicken since that was filling when I had it last week.  The chicken tasted good, and the barbecue sauce is also really good.  The meal came with two slices of Texas toast, which was good.  I asked for a bun instead, but they said they would have to charge extra (note, the Parmer Lane location gladly let me substitute a bun for the Texas toast at no charge).They have a condiment bar with barbecue sauce (original and spicy), pickles, jalapenos, onions, lemons, crackers, salsa, salad dressing and a few more things.  They also have a soda and tea refill station where you can get your own refills.  This location seems to do a lot of catering business, as I saw several of their catering trucks in the parking lot.I found the staff at the Parmer location to be much friendlier and more accommodating.  I prefer the the Parmer location over the Round Rock restaurant.

Finally home to eat my GrubHub order and I couldn't be more disappointed. I ordered a 3 meat plate which consisted of brisket, brisket, and pork ribs. I have ordered this before from a different location however, and my $25 meal wasn't this skimpy. I moved so I thought I'd try a closer location. I just can't believe this. Looks like they cut my brisket in half and put it on someone else's order. One star for the peppy guy on the phone when I explained I was on the way from the wrong bbq joint.

When in Texas, wanted to try some bbq. The rating was 4 stars on YELP, however it was a little disappointing with the meat. We did the 5 pack family meal with 4 sides and some fried okras. The meat was briskets were bland, the pork ribs was dry and the chicken was decent. The sides good. Not too impressed with this place.

Came in on a random Wednesday night. I opted for the lean brisket which was very well seasoned but more dry which was to be expected by a leaner meat. So I'd go for the moist brisket. The macaroni was a bit cold and tasted surprisingly not that cheesy. Noodles were cooked well however. The green beans were tasty and with a bit of salt, was great! My favorite part was the habanero bbq sauce. I would buy an entire bottle of that! Tangy and spicy. They also have a convenient condiment bar with salsas, onions, and jalapeños. I hear the pork ribs are delicious, so I may try those next
Round Rock, TX 78681
Fantastic as always!!   We love the bbq and they have some of the best side dishes to choose from.    3 sauce choices too

Had the smoked Turkey breast plate with 2 sides, broccoli salad and pinto beans.  Tried the habanero sauce, delicious, and the broccoli salad is my favorite side. I appreciate that they have healthy sides besides water downed green beans. My husband had a brisket plate with green bean casserole and jalapeno corn casserole. With 1 drink + water ticket came to $31. Expected at a BBQ place. This is one of my husband's favorite places for BBQ. Been going here over 30 years. Oh, and today's service was top notched too. Very friendly. Thank y'all.

Went in for lunch the other day. My meat was dry and cold. Asked to speak with a manager, was informed he was busy.  The food was terrible and service was as well. I definitely would not recommend this place to anyone. I do not appreciate the manager not taking the time to talk with me.

My husband and I went here on a Saturday night and the service was amazing! They were happy to let you sample anything, including their multiple sauces (love the habeñero!), and explained everything. The food was amazing, I had the chicken and he had the brisket, I asked for white meat and my piece had a ton of it. All of the sides were great, the potato salad had great consistency of actual potatoes and not just sauce.

The five stars is for the sausage here. They have some of the best in Austin!  As for the rest of the barbecue, it's good too but I generally just get the sausage here and then supplement the other barbecue from somewhere I prefer.

One of the most important ingredients in a great restaurant is customer service. These guys are AWESOME! The bbq is delicious, but it's the people that really made my day. Being disabled can be frustrating especially in restaurants. The staff here got our drinks for us and carried our food to a table. Happy and smiling the whole time. Come for the fantastic pulled pork, or jalapeño sausage, but you'll keep coming back for being treated like a queen (king)!

Two chop beef sandwich combos each with  a side of the Mac and cheese. Wasn't a lot of flavor in the meat but the Mac and cheese was super rich and great. The interior is a bit run down and most of the cups had chips or cracks in the top so had to use a Togo. My wife's sandwich bottom bun was super hard. All in all just not near as great as I remember so going to be skipping this one from now on.
The food is great and the staff are so friendly! I got the ribs and they were very tender and the sides have a lot of flavor.

My company used these guys for a catered event recently and I must say that we were blown away with the quality and flavor of the food. We had both the brisket as well as the smoked chicken and both were out of this world. We had three sides to include the mashed potatoes, macaroni and cheese, and green bean casserole and we couldn't believe the flavor considering the large quantities that were required for our event. We had two separate servings and all items were fresh and hot each time. Our employees were so pleased with the quality and flavor of the food that we fully intend to utilize them again in November for another catered event. If you have a need for catering, or just want some fantastic barbecue for the family, I can highly recommend Pok-E-Jo's!
Round Rock, TX 78681

Regret ordering via grub hub. Two missing sides and a thimble (small container) of sauce for a family order, plus chicken.  No pickles or jalapeños as well. I get meat and broccoli salad for $47.  I've never had a problem dining in, but will never order online again.

Apparently Pok-E-Jo's is competing in the Battle of the Briskets. Unfortunately, the brisket we were served as not of championship quality. The spicy sausage was very good but the ribs were ok. The potato salad was good and the fruit bowl was very good. If Pok-E-Jo's was someplace else it might be a three or four star BBQ establishment; however, in the greater Austin TX area, it is on two stars.

This Pok-E-Jo's may be my personal "Happy Place." I eat here at least once a week, sometimes more. The staff is always super friendly, and everything is clean and well-run. Whenever my family can't decide on a dining spot, we just come here, and everyone is happy. What makes Pokie's so special is not the meat, which is good, but the side dishes, which are amazing. There is a wide variety of sides available beyond the standard beans, coleslaw, and potato salad offered at many BBQ joints. My personal favorites are the potato salad, green bean casserole, and fried okra. In my opinion, your best meat bets are the ribs and sausage, particularly the hatch chile sausage when available. If you aren't in the mood for BBQ, they also make a damn good turkey pot pie...Do yourself a favor and eat here often.

I don't know if this place is under new management or something, but the quality has went WAY down!! I came here for the first time back in May and the food and sides were great!! The 3 times that I have came after that have just gotten worse and worse. Tonight I ordered a two meat plate with ribs and brisket. The ribs hardly had any meat on them.  They literally gave me smoked bones!! My daughter ordered the same thing and her ribs were the same way!! Then they forgot one of my sides (fried okra). I'm really disappointed. Don't think we will be back

Wow, I didn't know it was possible to mess up barbecue this badly. Everything was completely flavorless. Sides looked like they'd been sitting there for days and the whole place looked dirty and disorganized. Very disappointing.

Nice bbq place where you can see all the food before you order it. They also let you do takeout as well. Meat was moist and sides were good. Takes a bit to get your fries but no big hassle. Drinks are pretty large and refillable. I'd go back.

I was in Austin a few weeks ago from California. I was visiting my sick mother who was in the hospital in Round Rock. I got hungry and looked for some good Texas barbecue. I found Pok-E-Jo's . And decided give it a try. It's in a older shopping center off the highway. I was greeted by a young man who took my order. I chose the pulled pork sandwich. He piled on the meat so much I decided to take one to go.  A young girl asked me what kind of sauce I wanted of three they had I chose the hot and regular. And ordered fries also. She wrapped my to go sandwich and put it into a warmer . I then sat down and enjoyed my food. My fries came out freshly cooked . I choose to give this place 5 stars because of the service and food. The place looks old inside, but it didn't matter to me if the foods and service is good.Keep It Up!

I have always had very pleasant experiences not only at this location but at all of the locations around Austin. I work down the road and frequent this location multiple times a month and have yet to be disappointed in the quality of the food, the cleanliness of the restaurant, and the friendliness of the staff. I wouldn't say they have ever gone above and beyond, but I'm here for their good BBQ and they have always met my expectations. I usually order the BigN chopped beef sandwich with Mac and cheese and plain lays chips. Today I switched it up and am so glad I did! I decided on the two meat plate with the turkey and chopped pork, the Mac and cheese, and the mashed potatoes. Everything was heavenly! My husband even enjoyed his meal and he always has SOMETHING to complain about. I would highly recommend this place and frequently do. Don't listen to the other negative reviews, this location is great and I can almost guarantee you'll have a good lunch.

I was craving some sweet BBQ the other day for lunch and decided to give them a try. Man am I glad I did! I have been to their other locations a few times but this one is pretty close to work and will now become a go to place for lunch! I did not grow up in Texas and don't like beef as much as apparently everyone else's here does, I was raised on pulled pork sandwiches. I find it hard to find one in these parts but when I walked in I saw a huge thing of it calling my name. The employees were very friendly, the restaurant was extremely clean and my sandwich was delicious. I had taken it to-go and it was just as good 20 minutes later than it would have been in the restaurant. I highly recommend the pulled pork sandwich, you won't be disappointed!
NA
Austin, TX 78717

Very good BBQ from the Avery Ranch location. We noticed a TV commercial this morning and decided to try this popular Avery Ranch BBQ place. Ordering online was a breeze. Parked in their curbside area and a delightful young lady brought our order out as soon as we called. Great brisket, turkey, ribs and baked potatoes. The meats were moist, perhaps a little on the salty side but not overpowering. This BBQ can hold its own with any of the BBQ competitors in Austin.
Brian, we are so happy you gave Smokey Mo's a try! Thank you for the nice review-- it's going to make the Team's day.

Love Smokey Mo's and this is our favorite location! Food is always hot and well prepared, the restaurant is clean, and the staff is friendly.Curbside pickup is a safe and convenient bonus that we plan to use more often.

This was the first time in over a month that I'd had BBQ. Not totally because of this crazy "stay-at-home" stuff. I just REALLY needed some BBQ Pork Ribs.They were AMAZING!! They were fall off the bone soft, not tough at all! I wish I had gotten 10 pounds of them!!I hope this is the way they always make them now, as they have been hit or miss in the past.Everyone at Avery Ranch location today, 4/21...THANK YOU!!I'll be back!!
Thank you for the love, Girl T.! Hope to see you in again soon!

We were the neighborhood and spotted this place for a quick lunch.  I had the sliced brisket sandwich (lean) combo.  They packed a lot of brisket into the sandwich.  It had a wonderful smoke ring on it and the spices used really made it delicious.  The sauce has a slight heat. The staff were all friendly and they were all practicing safety protocol.

I ordered the sliced brisket plate via Uber Eats.   The brisket was, at least, 2 + days old and COLD!.    I called and spoke to a female representative  who told me I needed to call Uber Eats and she took no responsibility for the poor quality.   I will not be ordering from Smokey Mo's again.  0 stars

I would like to say that in the past  I have always been a fan of Smokey Moes bbq .  I always order brisket moist and fatty because I have a compromised salivary function, however the last two times I have been there I have gotten the worst cut of meat you can imagine. Mind you this is two different locations so it must be standard procedure now. They take half of the weight you order and put moist on top of old dry crusty meat for the other half. Very disappointing.

Has breakfast while in the area. Good hot food and decent prices. Very friendly and clean. Plenty of places to sit. Variety on the menu. Easy to find and close to other stores. Huge bottles of sauce on each table. Plenty of condiments and to go containers to serve yourself.
Austin, TX 78717

The only regret I have is we didn't get a picture of our meals! This is DELICIOUS bbq! I had the Chopped Baker, a fully loaded baked potato with chopped brisket on top! The brisket was tender and juicy, the potato cooked just right. It was tasty and so filling! My husband had the pulled pork sandwich and said it was fresh and yummy! Their bbq sauce had an awesome smokey flavor. The customer service was friendly- the GM came out and welcomed us. I will definitely return to Smokey Mo's and highly recommend!
Angela, thank you so much for the 5 Star review! We are so glad you enjoyed everything, and hope to see you in again soon!
column21: Avery Ranch Far West, Austin, TX

column20: I waited 28 minutes for them to prep this!  Not sure how they "smoked" the brisket.  Couldn't eat it-tough and no crust.  I love bbq, but won't grace this establishment again.  Too many other options.

I just stopped at this location because it's on my way home but I regret it now. I asked for the brisket plate that comes with two sides, pinto beans and potato salad for me. I don't have any complains about the sides, but the amount of brisket served it's ridiculously small. This is $13 bucks plate! And all I got are bits and pieces of brisket, plus it was cold - most probably left overs. I'm really disappointed and upset, I even left some tip in cash for this crap. The service is friendly as in any Smokey Mo's but the to-go servings at this location leave too much to be desired. I should've have checked my plate and was going to when the girl that was handing the food made small talk and forgot about it -lesson learned.  I won't be coming back to this location, maybe Cedar's Park values their customers more. Smh...
Good sides and sausage but the brisket is more like a poorly cooked steak. It's chewy and over cooked.

My husband and I came here a month ago when we were initially looking for an apartment. Having been at the apartment now for a month, we decided to try this place out again. I ordered to-go for him and I and it was great! My first visit I tried the brisket which was good but I'm more of a pulled pork fan so I tried the chopped sandwich and it was delicious! We both got a side of creamed corn since my husband loved it his first visit. It's almost like corn gravy, mmmm. The fries are good too which my husband had as his second side. Our first visit I had the buttered potatoes though I do not care for them at all. I wish they had macaroni and cheese on the menu but the creamed corn satisfies that warm, guilty pleasure craving.Edit: Wow, I am extremely happy that they now have Mac and cheese on their menu! It's really good! We tried the half chicken as well which is fall off the bone good! Nice job Smokey's!

Sandra, it's great you found us while looking for your current apartment and came back to give us another try -- welcome to the neighborhood! We're glad you have some personal favorites like the chopped and now, you'll have to come back for our mac n' cheese. Let us know if you have any questions about the menu.Thanks so much,Smokey Mo's Management

My husband and I came here a month ago when we were initially looking for an apartment. Having been at the apartment now for a month, we decided to try this place out again. I ordered to-go for him and I and it was great! My first visit I tried the brisket which was good but I'm more of a pulled pork fan so I tried the chopped sandwich and it was delicious! We both got a side of creamed corn since my husband loved it his first visit. It's almost like corn gravy, mmmm. The fries are good too which my husband had as his second side. Our first visit I had the buttered potatoes though I do not care for them at all. I'm not sure why anyone would order them. I wish they had macaroni and cheese on the menu but the creamed corn satisfies that warm, guilty pleasure craving.

One of our go-to neighborhood spots. Reasonable, fast and friendly service. There are daily specials and a variety of menu options. My faves are the lean brisket and or the half chicken plate. I love the potato salad, fried okra, cream corn and mac&cheese! The sweet tea is one of my faves. I always forget my reusable cup, I wish they sold regular cups at a lower cost. Because I have about 50 reusables now! 4 stars instead of 5 because a short black hair was in my fried okra this last visit. It could've been a dog hair or mans short hair. This was a first but gross. I took it up to the counter, the young man was a little dismissive and just before I had a few words in, the manager intervened and offered a fresh serving. He brought it out to me. All is well and yes, I'll be back.
Austin, TX 78717

Guys....you've let me down yet again!  Why would you serve your customers fatty.....and I mean fatty brisket?  This is the second time in a month!  Yes....it was crappy fatty brisket.  Nearly 70% of my brisket was inedible!  Which is worse...you cut it and put it on my plate.  I bet you would not have eaten it!  The "carver" stood right there in my face and smiled away while serving me up something that only my dogs would have enjoyed.  Wow....shocking.Is beef so sacred?  You advertise it and sell it...why not deliver quality food to your guests?  Your food has become so complacent .... so lazy.  Even your sides.  Come on can't you get at the very least become more creative with your sides?  Or perhaps maybe you should look at your sides again after all these years and make some better improvements with the existing ones.  Green beans out of a can?  That's creative sides!Now, if management even reads this, they will reach out to me....apologize and offer for me to come back.  The answer would be no.   Thank you but h**l no!   You have had two chances to make it right...and a third time, well the odds are against me still.  You should have made it right before placing the jiggly greasy fatty brisket on my plate.   I guess being the only little side saddle barbecue establishment in the immediate area makes you feel more secure.  Guess again...that will be your demise if you continue to serve food like that!  Next time, I'll drive the extra 10 minutes or so and go to Rudy's.

My friend and I came here for dinner and had some food. I ordered the brisket dinner with slaw and my friend ordered the pulled pork. My brisket was okay, a little dry but good. I would have liked to put sauce on my brisket, however it tasted like ketchup. I did appreciate the jalapenos and onions on the side though.

I got a 3 meat plate and was super unimpressed. I work nearby but I live in central Austin so perhaps I'm spoiled for choice but I don't plan on returning here. My 3 meats were pork tenderloin, brisket, and sausage.The tenderloin was way overcooked. I regularly cook tenderloins both in a smoker and in the oven and I know how juicy and tasty they can be but this was dry and uninteresting.The brisket wasn't fall-apart tender. Combined with the lack of smoke ring, I imagine it was cooked too hot and too fast.The sausage was the highlight of the plate but when is the last time you had bad sausage?It's a big place with friendly staff but I wish they'd put a little more time into perfecting their craft.

Logan, we appreciate you taking the time to share, but it's important to say we've been perfecting our craft for almost 20 years. Please know that we take feedback of this nature very seriously and will continually apply it to our craft. Hopefully, since a few months have passed, you'll consider another visit -- we'd love to make you a three meat plate that leaves you impressed.Thanks for your consideration,Smokey Mo's Management

Not sure if it just location or if Smokey Mo's this is the standard across all restaurants. The breakfast is not what it used to be. Cold, runny eggs creates soggy tortillas. I threw away 3 tacos rather then returning to the store.

Met the owner before and these guys have always been great. Great food and great service. Food quality is always prime. Great place for family to go and eat as well. Friendly atmosphere and pricing is right at standard BBQ prices. Love this place!

I order from this place often so I'm sad to write this. We always order fresh chip brisket sandwiches and we got our order and it was the chop brisket out of the pre- made stuff. When we called back to tell them it wasn't done as we asked, they made me feel like it was my fault. No apology, no I'll make it again. I asked to talk to a manager they said I could call back another day. No let me take your name and number.I'm writing this because I hope the owner sees this and realizes this isn't the way you do business.

Lindsay, we are quite disappointed your delivery of chopped brisket sandwiches were not up to par. It does sound like there was some sort of miscommunication at the time of your phone call, and hopefully, we can get to the bottom of it soon. We hope to get another chance at making you a great chopped brisket sandwich.Just a side note, we do not use premade ingredients or premade chopped brisket. Our meats are smoked and prepped each day with fresh ingredients. Hopefully, we'll get this resolved soon.Thanks for your time,Smokey Mo's Management

Great casual place to get your barbecue on. We ordered the combination plate, and the taco salad. The meat had a nice smoked flavor and was cooked perfectly. The sides were delicious and fresh. Dinner for two for round $20 bucks, great value, very reasonably priced, satisfying, and delicious.
Austin, TX 78717

I am a huge BBQ fan and have been eating it for as long as I remember. I just moved here from Houston and was not sure where to go so I thought I would try here because it was close to my house. I order brisket and ribs. The portion size for the price was not comparable to what I was used to paying. The brisket tasted dry and had no moistness to it. The ribs weren't bad but the price made it hard to appreciate them. I went...learned my lesson won't be going back.

Great breakfast tacos, made just right.  I've got their take out BBQ lots ,  too, and it's  smoked to perfection.  They also have a huge baked potato, and you can get it with chopped beef and it makes 2 meals.   They offer catering too.  Brisket by the pound , or sausage , Turkey, pork loin, or ribs.
Lisa, thanks! It means a lot to know you've always enjoyed our breakfast tacos and perfectly smoked BBQ. We can't wait to welcome you back for more. Until then! Smokey Mo's Management

What I had:- Brisket Sandwich - for $6.75, I was expecting a little more than just blaaaand brisket on picnic hamburger buns. Thankfully it wasn't painfully dry, but the meat wasn't moist either. It might be okay to eat this here where you can pick up some jalapeños or pickles at the condiment station, but they don't offer any to go cups for takeout customers.I doubt I'll be back again. I'd rather just try somewhere else than try something else on this menu.
Quality of the BBQ has improved and the vanilla pudding was fresh the last time we got some. Keep up the quality and we will keep returning.

Would like to see the BBQ quality a little better and the prices a little lower.  Vanilla pudding must have been a day old, because the quality was not worth the cost.  As they improve the quality of the food, more folks will surely come.

I know Smokey Mo's isn't your TacoDeli or Torchy's 'over the top' style tacos, but that's why I really like them! My sons and I come here on Saturdays for breakfast tacos and sweet tea. The pickle bar is also a plus for us! Great service every time. It's also great seeing the GM getting his hands dirty with the rest of the crew. We'll keep coming back!

Probably done with this location and headed to cypress creek location or big catz. There has been turnover in staff in the past few months (after someone was down from corporate for a few weeks). I've come here for lunch 1-2 times a week since this location opened, but the new staff isn't the same, quality seems down, and have actually returned orders now a couple times - chewy turkey and "lean" brisket that was all fat..been going less often to this location and experience isn't improving, there are other Mo's and other bbq spots..

I love mixing it up from Rudy's, Saltlick, and Freedmans.  I just wish there were more higher-rated options in north Austin.  The best I could find to get my BBQ kick was Smokey Mo's, off Parmer, north of 45/620.When you walk in, it ALMOST feels, and smells, like you're in Black's or Smitty's down in Lockhart.  Mostly wood décor and construction, and iced tea station.  However the place begins to fall short with a subway feel counter and carving station.The options for food seemed fair in price for what you allegedly get:  Plate combos, multiple sides, multiple meats, etc.  I chose a combo of brisket and sausage, with sides of potato salad and cole slaw.  The brisket: good flavor however it became very crumbly and was difficult to stick a fork into without brisket breaking into bits.  The sausage: not bad, definitely had better...tasted like kielbasa from HEB.  The potato salad: very standard, nothing wild.  The cole slaw: definitely skip this, just crumbles of milky cabbage (I understand that that's generally what slaw is, but it just wasn't right for some reason).  The portions of the meats were very small and disappointing, especially when compared next to the sides (the potato salad and slaw actually came in large portions IMO).  Now the tea was excellent.  I get sweetened, and whatever they are doing, keep doing it, this is where they save the meal.
Austin, TX 78717

Not bad BBQ,I loved the smoked sausage and Potato Salad , but the Brisket is drier than i'd like, There are some who prefer brisket that way and that is fine, the staff will try and help make your meal as enjoyable as possible.  Keep up the good work guys.

We usually order the family pack which is a good value.  For the brisket, our order includes both lean and moist.  Lean brisket is sometimes too dry, and moist is too fatty at times.  The turkey and pork ribs were surprisingly good, but we'll skip the pork loin...too dry and flavorless.  As for the sides, potato salad and baked beans were good.  The beans were cooked with brisket, so it was extra flavorful.

I was looking to expand our family bbq horizons beyond our usual go-tos, so we tried out Smokey Mo's for lunch today.  I'm disappointed to say i don't think we'll be back. Main problem: small portions for the price. My whole family walked out hungry, and for the same amount we spend at Pok-e-jos, and there we all leaves full and happy. I was really craving a good pit smoked chared brisket. The Smokey mos brisket was ok if lackluster. Didn't hit the bbq spot. The turkey was ok, again, not great. The sausage sandwich was a letdown. Meh sausage on a plain hamburger bun. The sides: canned green beans and waterlogged corn on the cob. The one bright spot that I will praise was the bbq chicken.  That was delicious!  It was smoky and crusty and juicy.  I wish I'd ordered more of that! The location is convenient.  The store front is nice. The folks behind the counter were nice... but i was looking for good bbq worth coming back for, and unfortunately I didn't find it.

Mary, it's very disheartening to read that the BBQ spot was missed on this visit. We'll be touching base with our team to get to the bottom of things in regards to your BBQ. Please know that everyone here works really hard at making authentic food and if something isn't to your liking the team will fix it right away. Hopefully, you'll consider another visit in the not too distant future so we can show you what we're really all about.Thanks for your time,Smokey Mo's Management
Good place. Mostly same as others. Nothing stood out. Should service bean without pork.

Murad, we appreciate you stopping by and giving our BBQ a try. It's great you have a suggestion for our menu -- it will be taken into consideration. We hope at some point that you'll give us another chance to show you what we're all about. Thanks for your time and feedback.Till next time,Smokey Mo's Management

Recently moved to the area, and this is probably one of my favorite places to grab a to go order, or occasionally dine in. The smoked chicken is amazing, great side choices. I recently stopped in to try the breakfast tacos and was definitely impressed! The staff is always super friendly as well. I've consistently had great experiences at this location!

Stephanie, first and foremost we want to share our warm welcome to town! It's great that you found us and have already stopped in a few times. We'll be sure to share this one with the team and hopefully, see you again soon.Thanks for sharing,Smokey Mo's Management
The brisket was so fatty I could not even eat it. (See picture). Will not be coming back. Very disappointed they even served that
